WKI_Summary: EG e-Invoice - Add Bank Account Details to AR e-Invoice Submission XML
details: A25 31-Jan-25 12:56 GMT+03:00:     This WI is created based on the eRequest from customer which is set as feature request - HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=53047a4f-c3ed-4644-93ca-daa0d0e9890c&VersionNumber=25.1.31.76&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bWuUlA8i3irnqYiQ1XXORkOhE8H09mO4n" CS01833300 - MTSLOGALY - Payment details in e invoice    As understand, customer is asking to add their bank account details into the invoice.    Based on our investigation, bank account details can be included in the e-Invoice XML for both Invoices and Credit Notes by using  the Payment structure in the DocumentSubmissions API method    Invoice Data Structure : https://sdk.preprod.invoicing.eta.gov.eg/documents/invoice-v1-0/    Credit Note Data Structure : https://sdk.preprod.invoicing.eta.gov.eg/documents/credit-note-v1-0/    Payment structure : https://sdk.preprod.invoicing.eta.gov.eg/documents/invoice-v1-0/#payment    In the payment structure, bankName, bankAddress, bankAccountNo, bankAccountIBAN, swiftCode, terms details can be send. All of them are optional.    Based on the documentation, it seems that the Payment structure is not an array. So, seems we can only send one bank account detail.    Element Type  Description Value example  bankName  String  Optional: Name of the bank of document issuer. Alpha Bank  bankAddress  String  Optional: Address of the bank of document issuer. Captured as single line of text, not a structure.    bankAccountNo String  Optional: Local bank account number in the bank 12-1982939  bankAccountIBAN String  Optional: International bank account number used primarily for international documents.    swiftCode  String  Optional: International Swift code of the bank.    terms   String  Optional: Description of the payment terms describing when and how payments needs to be made, for example.    Our XUT does not contain any information for the bank account details, however since the mapping of the EG e-Invoice is done on the CW side, I belileve we should not face any problem.    DOF;     Figure out how and where to obtain the bank account details.    Add Payment structure to the submission XML. The order in which Payment structure should place in the whole data structure may be important. Therefore it should be added to the structure in the appropriate place.    Options for obtaining bank account;    1- One way to obtain the bank account can be a similar approach that is used by China. https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=b850544e-f05f-471d-8904-8fcb589f491f    This way, we can obtain the bank account based on the transaction header branch’s proxy. Since, Payment structure allows to send only bank account, we can get the Default bank account where the country is EG and currency is EGP.    2- We can consider the options described in the following UPN for Germany. The same hierarchy can be used to get the bank account.    https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=771e9b6d-6405-4f9f-a3f2-aa5250a510e3
feature_description: Invoice - Add Bank Account Details to AR e-Invoice Submission XML

WKI_Summary: Total Allocation Statistics Section UI Enhancements
details: Done Statement  The Total Allocation Section of showing the quantitative measures/statistics of the Allocation Routes under a Carrier Contract to be enhanced to support:  Contract using only TEU as the Unit of all Allocation Routes.  Contract using only CN as the Unit of all Allocation Routes.  Contract using a mix of TEU or CN as the Unit of individual Allocation Routes.    SRH 28-May-25 17:59 GMT+12:00:   Comments by Rohlig per the question of apart from TEU, will 'CN - Containers' would be used as a unit for a Carrier Contract and would a single Contract would have mixed Units of TEU or CN under different Allocation.  Majority would be using TEU as the Unit but they may also have Contracts using 'CN' as the Unit that Rohlig needs to further clarify before getting back to us.    ELP 25-Jun-25 18:51:  Latest wireframes for Total Allocation panel in CCA: https://www.figma.com/design/ML8B5lyFugTSv6hddg8k42/C-A-Drafts?node-id=7528-529777&t=cCkvQDenJCKsJ7ZH-1        Tien Long Lam (TLM) 22-Jul-25 10:12 GMT+10:00:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/Shared/_wiki/wikis/Forwarding%20Work%20Item%20Wiki/18968/WI00904060-Total-Allocation-Statistics-Section-UI-Enhancements

WKI_Summary: Colombia - New IVA Withholding RETEIVA General Rate
details: Country COLOMBIA  Sub Project HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAG0SYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=8a359331-1de8-4cf3-9d8c-b4b307f53461&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bP2SRixGxJ8TkxP97S0n9r8Y%2baGu7dGb1" Project PRJ00037091  Head Project HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAUSSYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=5da8f849-6392-428a-bf02-6fa35d2a52be&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2ba6icvzlBehIlslRQuYs2zRHPSY5jcmNz" Project PRJ00029620  Topic Importance Comments  In Colombia Country there is a IVA Withholding Tax that our Users have requested to add in CargoWise.  Add a new RETEIVA Tax ID for Colombia Country that supports IVA and IVA Withholding Genral rate calculation.  Moreover, add a new rate reference to source the rate for the withholding.  Standard Colombia IVA Rate is 19% and reduced IVA rate is 5%.  The IVA Withholding general rate is 15%.  IVA Withholding calculation base is the IVA amount.  This is an invoice based Withholding calculation (included inside the invoice by the issuer).  Therefore, Users need to be able to easily distinguish Withholding amount when posting an AR transaction and also be able to extract this information from AR transaction XUT when needed.  Scope:   HLD (High Level Design) Done Statements:  When the Specification is completed, the following statements will be true:  Two new RETEIVA Tax IDs are available for Colombia Country.  CargoWise supports IVA Withholding Genral rate calculation for Colombia Login companies.  Withholding amount is easily distinguish in the invoice form  Withholding amount appears in XUT.  Other notes:  Find below some Incidents where CargoWise Customers request to add Withholding Taxesin CargoWise:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=c0ea518b-2167-4d9e-82cc-df15a1ee016b&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b8As96ajqQ%2bJDlmyn7EBf8XHwkOGU6Iar" CS00675940 - KEYLOGBOG1 - COLOMBIA - Withholding Tax  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=be0287f5-2f83-44d5-ae85-d6124ccb9b1d&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bSEVpuVgDtUIsDXc1mLTXYhtNv3SEg8QT" CS00239355 - GEOWILBOG - GW COLOMBIA - Compliance requirements document- URGENT  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=3bd41e3d-682f-4cfb-b598-60c5fcfb4c72&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bHEXQ6rpK5CYm6iEhbaZEWTa5%2fasnzlI7" CS01153365 - TRATECYMQ - Colombia Withholding tax
feature_description: New IVA Withholding RETEIVA General Rate

WKI_Summary: Turn off Audit Events for Declaration tables
details: JPG 24-Mar-25 15:42 GMT+11:00: The purpose of this WI is to turn off Audit Event logging (by default) for the main Declaration tables. See the following links for an overview of what we want to achieve:    https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/ArchiveManager/EUUiOSoELGRNsSGhAzlT16kBowtezPrVVdNV3H4dxM3N9g?e=FWtKxN    Guide: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/13383/Turning-off-Audit-Events  Sample PR: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/291327    REQ001: Remove the IsAutoLogged override from the following classes (that is, turn off auto logging):    BaseJobDeclaration  BaseJobComInvoiceHeader  CusEntryPayInfo    LY 09-Apr-25 10:30 GMT+01:00: Remove relevant business objects from AuditEventTest baseline https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FArchiveManager%2FArchiveManager%2FArchiveManager.Test%2FAuditEventTest.cs&version=GBmaster&line=107&lineEnd=108&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=1&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    REQ002: Add the following tables to AutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValue (https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FWorkflow%2FWorkflow.Business%2FAuditStmALog%2FAutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValues.cs&version=GBmaster&_a=contents)    BaseJobDeclaration  BaseJobComInvoiceHeader    This enable 2 things:  When the registry is on for a particular table, then StmALog events will be created as if IsAutoLogged were turned on.  When the registry if off, then NonPersistedStmALog events will be create. These will allow workflow to work on EDT/ADD events, but it will not actually persist the events in StmALog (which is the real goal here).    (Do not add CusEntryPayInfo, because we do not support workflow against that table.)    --    The three tables should already be in the Audit DB and visible on the Declaration form:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=1e0c4ffb-8314-4b9f-85b2-333c8c27b748&VersionNumber=25.3.24.25&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bjQqGxygot%2bGXvkNui0RvVK9hMBdK6j9P" WI00886436 - Enable Audit Data tab for all JobDeclaration Forms      TT7 03-Jul-25 09:57 GMT+10:00: IsAutoLogged has been updated. We just need to override its value to AutoLoggingState => AutologState.AutoLoggedToQueueOnly and Workflow will work as expected, no need to add the tables to AutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValue
product_candidate: Turn off Audit Events for Declaration tables

WKI_Summary: [CCA] Consol ETD should NOT check Allocation Route Period if Booking/MBL exist
details: Done Statement  Once the Carrier Booking Number or Master Bill of Lading Number existed on the Consol, Consol's ETD should NOT be validated against the Start Date / Expiry Date of Allocation Route(s) utilised.    Both Rohlig and DHL have raised the same/similar request/scenario:    HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAUSSYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=d8368320-9922-44c9-b0b5-41061f310f3a&VersionNumber=25.3.7.316&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bs%2fgyGgpaGNctZwxgDD5VWpfpqwkLkeY%2f" Project PRJ00049515 - HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=d8368320-9922-44c9-b0b5-41061f310f3a&StorageDocPK=ae9c573e-9199-4c22-860d-b5424b1e3ec9&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bvlLbzF7uTHwyt8ysWDBTh6wA1F39k0KT" SRH 07-Mar-25 23:56:  File WTG DHL Workshop Summary - 24 to 26 Feb 2025[2] (WI Ref).docx (Memorandum of Understanding)    Context:  This work item is a Rohlig priority.    TLM 01-Apr-25 13:57 GMT+11:00:   HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/Shared/_wiki/wikis/Forwarding%20Work%20Item%20Wiki/15017/WI00829485-CCA-Consol-ETD-should-NOT-check-Allocation-Route-Period-if-Booking-or-MBL-Existed" WI00829485 - [CCA] Consol ETD should NOT check Allocation Route Period if Booking or MBL Existed - Overview    No expiry date validation errors occur on a Consol once it is attached to an Allocation Route.    TLM 12-Dec-24 10:17 GMT+11:00:   https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/Shared/_wiki/wikis/Forwarding%20Work%20Item%20Wiki/15017/WI00829485-CCA-Remove-the-expiry-date-validation-on-a-consol-if-it's-attached-to-a-route    # Done Statement  No expiry date validation errors occur on a Consol once it is attached to an Allocation Route.  # Context  Despite agreeing on a fixed allocation per period e.g. 10 TEU / week. Reality does not work that way necessarily. Vessels get delayed.   # Description  Validation of ETD should happen only when initially attempting to link a Consolidation to a specific Allocation Route ID, where the ETD should be validated against the Start & Expiry date.     Once the link has been established, there should not be any further checks. Even in the cases   - the ETD gets **beyond the Expiry date** of the Allocation Route    - the ETD gets **before the Start Date** of the Allocation Route
product_candidate: [CCA] Consol ETD should NOT check Allocation Route Period if Booking/MBL exist

WKI_Summary: IT (NCTD5 TP OFF) Registration date for amendment without declaration
details: DONE STATEMENT  When user must amend a declaration done in another system he sets a declaration without MRN as amendment.  In this operation user is required to enter the MRN of the original declaration to amend.  We must request the user also the registration date of the original declaration, so that we can determine if the declaration must be managed as TP ON or TP OFF.  We must verify that after having entered MRN and registration date the declaration is automatically set as TP ON if needed.    Refer to HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=69fa951a-8931-48aa-a557-9b28502c767d&VersionNumber=25.2.19.11&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b%2bsVzI%2fe25Mz22k3AzEYUw%2bXNz9OX63Ap" WI00862760 - IT (NCTD5 TP OFF) Amendments for TP ON    CRI 05-Mar-25 17:42 GMT+01:00: SPE https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/DevelopmentCustomsTeam/Shared%20Documents/IT/Work%20Items/NCTD5/WI00871784%20-%20IT%20(NCTD5%20TP%20OFF)%20Registration%20date%20for%20amendment%20without%20declaration/WI00871784%20-%20IT%20(NCTD5%20TP%20OFF)%20Registration%20date%20for%20amendment%20without%20declarati.docx?d=wfe676e4fb30f461b9027c4f2032b8628&csf=1&web=1&e=vRbU1V

WKI_Summary: MEXICO - New TAX ID to calculate 8% VAT (IVA) AND "2/3" IVA withholding (5.33%)
details: Country MÉXICO  Sub Project HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAG0SYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=f4633ef2-cb93-44a4-906b-cb9e51a305d5&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bpUlhJPovuu6xcRwpGBIfyHkgxx4cQoU5" Project PRJ00029637  Head Project HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAUSSYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=5da8f849-6392-428a-bf02-6fa35d2a52be&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2ba6icvzlBehIlslRQuYs2zRHPSY5jcmNz" Project PRJ00029620  Topic Importance Comments   New MX TAX ID (8% VAT and 5.33% of VAT Withholding     Scope:   HLD (High Level Design) Done Statements:  - We need to introduce a new VAT Withholding Tax ID for Mexico (MX).  - Mexico have a VAT Withholding rate for certain classes of transactions (i.e. Suppliers who are natural persons providing personal services 'Leases/Rentals' to a legal entity (our clients), located in a border area) that is two-thirds (5.33% of the 'Reduced' 8% VAT rate (Currently 8% for companies in border region).    Current Functionality:   *Standard VAT Rate in Mexico is 16%  *We currently support a Tax ID = IVAREF to calculate Standard VAT 16% and 10.66667% ('Extra Tax Rate') of VAT withholding (5.33% effective rate)  *Reduce 'Fronteriza' rate in Mexico is 8%  *We currently support a Tax ID = IVAREDRET to calculate Reduce VAT 8% and 4% ('Extra Tax Rate') of VAT withholding and Tax ID = IVAREDREB to calculate Reduce VAT 8% and 3% ('Extra Tax Rate')       Other notes:  Reference incident requesting new TAX ID and legal basis:   http://www.diputados.gob.mx/LeyesBiblio/regley/Reg_LIVA_250914.pdf  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=8a6bb0a2-d659-464f-803b-59f42491e76f&VersionNumber=25.4.2.29&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bo8n5mxjcKtXKWHXmw6ERxevdtAx28%2b3L" CS01917113 - NOAMARADT - Missing Border tax with 60% retention
feature_description: New TAX ID to calculate 8% VAT (IVA) AND "2/3" IVA withholding (5.33%)

WKI_Summary: PP: Stock on Hand Report By Location and Stock Movement Report
details: AQO 30-Apr-25 09:29 GMT+10:00:   for functional review  1. the "Stock Movement Report" has been updated to make "Product" & "Product Description" columns customisable. please test these columns can be added to the TXT/csv version of the report, and the header is in the right place in the PDF/Excel version of the report  2. the "Stock on Hand Report" (By Location Sheet only) has been updated to make "Product", "Product Category", "Client" and "Product Description" columns customisable. please test the report with customized columns    MMC 05-Mar-25 11:36 GMT+11:00:   Update the System defined Template for Stock Movement Report to and make "Product" & "Product Description" columns customisable. BRS: Dev to confirm this doesn't affect the "header" (we don't think it does based on other reports)  Update the System defined Template for Stock on Hand Report (By Location Sheet only) and make "Product" & "Product Category" columns customisable. BRS: I assume we want Client + Product Desc too?    You will need to use the "CustomisedColumn" macro    TG1 20-Feb-25 11:37 GMT+11:00:     This Work Item includes 2 Reports    Stock Movement Report - Customisable Product and Description columns Stock Movement Report (CS01823823)    Current Functionality: The column Product and Description in "Whs Stock Movements" report template do not have the column headings, (due to being non-deletable) which is causing the Product and Description columns to not exist in the csv/TXT version of the report     Desired Functionality:  Make the Product and Description columns customisable and appear on the CSV version of the Stock Movement Report     Stock on Hand Report (By Location Only) - This fix only applies to Stock on Hand report by location. Expose the product + category to be able to customised     Current Functionality: Stock on Hand Report - issues with Part Attribute 1 and Product Category formatting. When client run report , the product description split into another row. (please refer incident  CS01783186 and CS01851489)    Desired Functionality: To display correctly by exposing the product + category to be able to be customised     Additional information:    27/09/24: The report template has a few issues that needs to be addressed although it seems the clients haven't had an issue with it.  1. The product category will cut off the description if it has a value, Product needs to advise how it needs to be presented in the report, maybe put it in a single value together with the product description.  2. The product category value and it's caption is tied up to the "Part Attribut 1" column. So if you remove or move the Part Attribtute column then it will also move the product category value and it's caption.    24/10/24: SF to add screenshots of the reports (see Screenshots tab)  7/11/24: SF to discuss client who wants change reverted - Stock on Hand by Location wrapping descriptions  13/11/24: Client can customize the reports to display it they way they want  SF to document before/after behaviour - Back to Product Investigation  22/11/24: SF will discuss with Luigi next Monday, as the issue is not caused by product description.  21/1/25: SF new issue from Yusen (CS01851489) - need to revisit with Luigi when returns from leave  19/2/25: This fix only applies to Stock on Hand report by location report. Expose the proudct + category to be able to customised   Products should check current incidents if clients only have issue about Stock on Hand report by location or have similar issue with Stock on Hand report by Product as well.   20/2/25: TG1 has searched current incidents relates to Stock on Hand Report, so far both incidents are about Stock on Hand report by location only.
product_candidate: Stock on Hand Report By Location and Stock Movement Report

WKI_Summary: CCSUK (temporary storage) pre- vs post-arrivals
details: CKG 03-Apr-25 10:36 GMT+01:00:     Tech Design:    1, The field we need to add the validation to is bound to CM_FlightNo, therefore we need to add our logic to the CheckCM_FlightNo method in C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\GB\Core\Ccsuk\AirCargoInventory\BusinessObjects\CusMAWB\CusMAWBValidation.cs  So if the profile is agent (We can use Parent.IsProfileAndAgent), then do not show the MandatoryValidation.    2.  I don't think we need to do anything here as the message error will still be shown.    3.  We need to change the error message shown, so will have to replace the Mandatory Validation, with something like    if (Parent..CMFlightNo.IsEmpty)  {      Parent.CM_FlightNoInfo.AddMessageError("A flight number is mandatory for an ETSF record.  Supply a flight number or create an agent pre-arrival record using your agent, not ETSF, profile.");  }    4.  Change the logic in the SendToCommunity message in C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\GB\Core\Ccsuk\AirCargoInventory\Messaging\CcsukInventoryMessageManager.cs    To something like this...    internal bool SendToCommunity()  {   var reasonsWeCantSend = new StringCollection();   var warningsAboutSending = new StringCollection();     var awb = (CusMAWB)bizO;     if (awb != null && awb.IsProfileAShed && awb.CM_FlightNo.IsEmpty && (how.MessageSubType == CcsukTransmissionMessageFunction.CUSCAR.FRC.Subcode || how.MessageSubType == CcsukTransmissionMessageFunction.CUSCAR.FRI.Subcode))   {    reasonsWeCantSend.Add("It is not permitted to send this message using your ETSF profile when the bill lacks a flight number.  This sending will be aborted. \r\nSupply a flight number and re-try the sending, or if you do not have the flight number you may consider using your agent profile to create a pre-arrival record. \r\nIn doing the latter, it should be remembered that agent pre-arrival records are expunged (archived) if not arrived within 4 days.");   }     SendMessage(sendMessagesToCustoms,    reasonsWeCantSend,    warningsAboutSending,    new MessageBuilderDelegate[] { GetMessageBuilder }, how.MessageType + how.MessageSubType, CancellationTokenSource.Token);   return reasonsWeCantSend.Count == 0 && warningsAboutSending.Count == 0;  }      DJC 27-Mar-25 15:10 GMT+00:00:  Please see very long winded discussion in the attached.   We must change our CCSUK module's validation.   But as the incident shows, users ignore validation, so we need a hard block on sending too (without using red validation).     HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=eba86973-e70f-48a5-944a-2a9c9ac96424&StorageDocPK=4df8e662-6a13-4188-9489-54d7df8b5bf3&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bVnDEHc81nW%2brmggFUE1BHTCQpMcb8ZU9" DJC 27-Mar-25 15:12:  File d12516787908418caeacd7afa5dd73ef.bmp (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.      1. When the profile is an agent profile (2), do not show this blue validation on the flight number (1) when the flight number is missing.      2. Continue to show this blue validation when the profile is an ETSF (shed) profile and the flight number is missing.     3. Change the wording of this existing blue validation. It shoudl say "A flight number is mandatory for an ETSF record.  Supply a flight number or create an agent pre-arrival record using your agent, not ETSF, profile. "    4. If the user ignores this blue validation, and tries to send an FRI (create) or FRC (amend) message, block that messaging action.  You can achieve that by CcsukInventoryMessageManager.changing SendToCommunity() to add a piece of feedback to the reasonsWeCantSend collection.   Do so only if the AWB is a shed, the flight number is empty, and the message sub type is FRI/FRC; the result is something like this: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=eba86973-e70f-48a5-944a-2a9c9ac96424&StorageDocPK=0c73710e-63a4-4d19-9139-de637444dfaf&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bK%2fedTwPh0VtvqBzJY2M5adC60hqdpV49" DJC 27-Mar-25 15:29:  File 15d599e374d14c8596c4610a9f84941d.bmp (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.  Wording is "It is not permitted to send this message using your ETSF profile when the bill lacksa flight number.  This sending will be aborted.   Supply a flight number and re-try the sending, or if you do not have the flight number you may consider using your agent profile to create a pre-arrival record.   In doing the latter, it should be remembered that agent pre-arrival records are expunged (archived) if not arrived within 4 days."    Tips:    LicenceAndPimaHelper.IsFullShed(CusAwb)   how.MessageSubType == CcsukTransmissionMessageFunction.CUSCAR.FRC.Subcode  or CcsukTransmissionMessageFunction.CUSCAR.FRI.Subcode   CM_FlightNo      Desired effect:  Intermediate effects   Agents don't see blue validation when the flight number is missing   Sheds do see such blue validation   Sheds (if they ignore the blue validation) cannot send FRI/FRC messages without a flight number   Sheds can send all other messages without a flight number  Further effects:   Sheds dont' accidentlayy create a post-arrival record on CCSUK even though CW1 thinks it's a pre-arrival  Ultiumate effect:   CW1 and CCSUK both agree that a record is or is not a pre-arrival, and so we agree on whether to purge that data after 4 days.
feature_description: vs post-arrivals

WKI_Summary: MAWB Form - Shipper and Consignee Account No. fields (ACAS item 7 support)
details: AFE 14-Jan-25 16:16 GMT+08:00:    # Done statements    As per HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=083492d5-0454-4731-8376-5c058ea8b323&StorageDocPK=9c3b65df-541c-44b7-ae97-7191f4da11a2&Hash=%2bPSNmlCaUMwf3IZdadm%2f28qaVt2HwvqnT&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" AFE 14-Jan-25 16:36:  File WI00853749_HLD.docx (High Level Design), Shipper and Consignee Account No. fields on MAWB should be populated automatically from:  1. Sending Agent and Receiving Agent organisation code for non-direct consols  2. attached shipment Consignor and Consignee organisation code for direct consols    # Proposed changes    - For Shipper Account, remove `Consol.IsCoLoad` in the if statement. `base.ShipperAccount` has taken care of the different cases for direct and non-direct air consols.  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FExportAWB%2FExportAWBHeader%2FConsolExportAWBHeader.cs&version=GBmaster&line=1820&lineEnd=1823&lineStartColumn=3&lineEndColumn=4&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    - For Consignee Account, apply the same change as Shipper Account  ```ExportAWBHeader.cs  protected virtual ZString ConsigneeAccount  {   get   {    var consignee = ConsigneeDocumentaryAddress?.Organisation;    return consignee != null ? consignee.OH_Code : ZString.Empty;   }  }  ```    ```ConsolExportAWBHeader  protected override ZString ConsigneeAccount  {   get { return Consol != null ? base.ConsigneeAccount : ZString.Empty; }  }  ```    Done: Shipper and Consignee Account No. fields automatically populate on MAWB form    This is a small change to better support ACAS item 7 (Customer Account Number) by automatically populatating the Account No. fields for Shipper/Consignee on the AWB form. This behaviour already works as expected for shipments and HAWB but it does not work for MAWB. For ACAS reporting of Customer Account Number, this means users do not have to manually enter the Account No. on the AWB form.    This change applies to shipments destined or transiting USA and US territories
feature_description: Shipper and Consignee Account No. fields (ACAS item 7 support)

YMK 04-Apr-25 10:21 GMT+11:00:   The following changes are required:    1. Rename ClientsWhitelistedForAuxiliaryEvents setting in ContainerEventDeliveryProcessorSettings into "ClientsBlacklistedForAuxiliaryEvents"  Do the same for ClientsWhitelistedForAuxiliaryEventsSet    2. Change logic in ContainerEventDeliveryProcessor to opposite - deliverAuxiliaryEvent should be 'false' if the ClientsBlacklistedForAuxiliaryEventsSet contains ClientId    3. WKI_Summary: CPW: ComplianceWise enabled by default and support only
details: Background  https://wisetechglobal-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/p/karim_micheal/EURYE0Cc7-tHgrjxlANE8YgBrwVsvVc-MHh-Tdk7FbntUw?e=VP4P9x    Problem Summary  RW wants WTG to control the enablement of CPW on customer systems. We need to ensure only WTG can enable and disable ComplianceWise.     Alternative enablement solutions  There are currently two work items to ensure WTG controls the enablement of CPW that contain two different default enablement options:  Option 1 (this work item): ComplianceWise is enabled by default and visisble to support only  Option 2: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=25df4f9e-5160-4f6b-9930-2109293ca242&VersionNumber=24.10.17.96&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bfHsLr8pDW9rzQFvofVxKNeYufoJQVHC4" WI00818073 - CPW: ComplianceWise disabled by default and support only (currently the preferred option for RW)   Option 3: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=7d00f749-5906-4258-9b59-92ab74f65ea4&VersionNumber=24.11.13.50&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bJorkS8CYLGl32TfpesdysfPMxIeE1lhz" WI00809870 - CPW: ComplianceWise enabled by default on Forwarding modules (Was implemented for a while then rolled back)  Once confirmed which option we will go with, one of these work items will be cancelled and the preferred option will be checked in.     Product Changes  ComplianceWise (Master UPN) - https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=499d436e-b256-45e7-8f73-35fd2396c30a - Update   HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=35dd7974-da2b-466b-a551-ef973d323396&VersionNumber=24.10.17.96&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b%2bdU80P5EBLN3KEK4R%2bcKsKGnjmdVtMR3" WI00778739 - ComplianceWise customer facing update note   Updates here: https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/DevelopmentROPETeam/ETDRAru70KNGnlA-_gefPIkBtlSqkqsZdwdIdibl8oOoPA?e=gulbPt (Page 79)  How do I enable ComplianceWise and how do I get support if I experience problems? - https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=63ee12df-da3e-4d7a-acb9-38c45aedda1c - Remove  How-to Transition to ComplianceWise from Denied Party Screening for jobs - https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=a4602976-ce39-434f-9a8d-befe2cff16f9 - Update   HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=da16cb0a-d91f-4aa1-8a1b-5d6c836232f7&VersionNumber=24.10.17.96&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bDLd2GSXl6Upyemt9dGDyqb62O%2f5rq%2f4x" WI00790507 - CPW: Customer facing How to transition guide and FAQs   Updates here: https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/DevelopmentROPETeam/EQ6Lr-NCYv9GmegPIhuRALYBtS69_l_VZ00-OXovuf8H7Q?e=cIddBJ  How do I transition from Denied Party Screening to ComplianceWise? details: MNY 13-Jun-25 11:24 GMT+08:00:   Based on test result in previous WI, we have to make the adjustment on registrys, messages and hints  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=1a6980fe-33f4-47c2-ae64-665288aa3172&StorageDocPK=a9ab7b86-26dd-4f89-be9a-ed02668ee859&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bb%2fJV4DU%2blC2%2f4t9eH%2by0R4PW5YQHOsgq" MNY 13-Jun-25 11:25:  File WI00901510 - Implement Period Reopen Approval Logic & remove raise request if feature enable - Final UAT.xlsm (Unit Acceptance Testing)    Here are the remaining task for this WI.  o Test 1 - We should remove the new registry “Enable self-administration to reopen close periods” once all changes mentioned below are completed. And adjust the logic to show the security override form instead of the re-open key request form to be controlled by existing “Enable Users Authorized to Reopen Closed Periods” registry.     o Test 3 - We should change existing “Enable Users Authorized to Reopen Closed Periods” registry to be a non-CWSupport registry should that all users can opt to enable this feature if they wanted.    o Test 3 - We should update the registry hint of “Enable Users Authorized to Reopen Closed Periods” to as follows:  You can now opt to self-administer the re-opening of close period(s) by appointing and authorising your designated staff to re-open closed period instead of having to raise eRequest to CargoWise Support to request for Reopen Period Key.   This gives you full control of your period management and facilitate efficient reopening of closed period in a control environment.  When this registry is set to ‘Yes’, you will appoint and authorised staff to re-open closed period with their granted reopen period security right via the “Users Authorized to Reopen Closed Periods” registry.   Note: Please logout and log back in after you have set this registry to ‘Yes’.    o Test 4 - We should update the registry hint of ''User Authorized to Reopen Closed Periods' to as follows:  Only the users nominated in this list will be allowed to re-open accounting periods.   After enabling this registry, Period Reopen Levels must be defined and appropriate staff security levels assigned.       o Test 7 - The current error message is incomplete.  According to the system logic, only users that meet the following conditions can reopen a closed period.  I. The user must be one of the authorized users specified in the “Users Authorized to Reopen Closed Periods” registry  II. He/she must have the relevant security right granted to him/her under “Manage > General Ledger > Period Management > Reopen Period” taking into consideration the “Period Reopen Levels” registry configuration.  The current error message only described the part of the reasons.   Please adjust the error message as follows:  You do not have the appropriate security rights to run this function.  To reopen the period, you must fulfil the following conditions:  1. You must be one of the authorized users as specified in the ‘Users Authorized to Reopen Close Periods’ system registry.  2. You must have the relevant security right granted under “Manage > General Ledger > Period Management > Reopen Period” with reference to the required Period Reopen Level  Please reach out to your system administrator to grant you the required access. WKI_Summary: EG e-Invoice - Add Bank Account Details to AR e-Invoice Submission XML
details: A25 31-Jan-25 12:56 GMT+03:00:     This WI is created based on the eRequest from customer which is set as feature request - HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=53047a4f-c3ed-4644-93ca-daa0d0e9890c&VersionNumber=25.1.31.76&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bWuUlA8i3irnqYiQ1XXORkOhE8H09mO4n" CS01833300 - MTSLOGALY - Payment details in e invoice    As understand, customer is asking to add their bank account details into the invoice.    Based on our investigation, bank account details can be included in the e-Invoice XML for both Invoices and Credit Notes by using  the Payment structure in the DocumentSubmissions API method    Invoice Data Structure : https://sdk.preprod.invoicing.eta.gov.eg/documents/invoice-v1-0/    Credit Note Data Structure : https://sdk.preprod.invoicing.eta.gov.eg/documents/credit-note-v1-0/    Payment structure : https://sdk.preprod.invoicing.eta.gov.eg/documents/invoice-v1-0/#payment    In the payment structure, bankName, bankAddress, bankAccountNo, bankAccountIBAN, swiftCode, terms details can be send. All of them are optional.    Based on the documentation, it seems that the Payment structure is not an array. So, seems we can only send one bank account detail.    Element Type  Description Value example  bankName  String  Optional: Name of the bank of document issuer. Alpha Bank  bankAddress  String  Optional: Address of the bank of document issuer. Captured as single line of text, not a structure.    bankAccountNo String  Optional: Local bank account number in the bank 12-1982939  bankAccountIBAN String  Optional: International bank account number used primarily for international documents.    swiftCode  String  Optional: International Swift code of the bank.    terms   String  Optional: Description of the payment terms describing when and how payments needs to be made, for example.    Our XUT does not contain any information for the bank account details, however since the mapping of the EG e-Invoice is done on the CW side, I belileve we should not face any problem.    DOF;     Figure out how and where to obtain the bank account details.    Add Payment structure to the submission XML. The order in which Payment structure should place in the whole data structure may be important. Therefore it should be added to the structure in the appropriate place.    Options for obtaining bank account;    1- One way to obtain the bank account can be a similar approach that is used by China. https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=b850544e-f05f-471d-8904-8fcb589f491f    This way, we can obtain the bank account based on the transaction header branch’s proxy. Since, Payment structure allows to send only bank account, we can get the Default bank account where the country is EG and currency is EGP.    2- We can consider the options described in the following UPN for Germany. The same hierarchy can be used to get the bank account.    https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=771e9b6d-6405-4f9f-a3f2-aa5250a510e3
feature_description: Invoice - Add Bank Account Details to AR e-Invoice Submission XML

WKI_Summary: [LIC] Release group security for Feature Control Module
details: Goal:  Feature Control Module records can be secured such that edit access for records having some release group is only permitted for users being a member of that same group.      Requirements:  Create group security node "Allow feature edit for any release group", default no  Add security checkpoint in FCM. If user security has this node set to NO, then they can only edit records where their staff profile is an active member of the release group on the feature code. If the security node set to YES, then user can edit any feature record  Add validation that RELEASE GROUP field on feature code must not be null. Record creation should be alowed for a user with edit access to FCM, whether or not they are member of the release group being first set (you may have another suggestion on this Sam)            -------------  SCW 17-Mar-25 11:19 GMT+11:00:   Staff security checkpoint doesn't have ability for default grant/denied. The status is inheritted from parent, so if the module access is granted, the new security will be granted as well.  Consider using data transformation to add a denied record for the new security code, if Feature Control module access is granted    TECH DESIGN:  RVE 19-Mar-25 15:07 GMT+11:00:   Add Security Checkpoint to EDISecurityCheckpoints.cs with display name "Allow feature edit for any release group" and parent node Feature Control    Override ShowEditForm() in FeatureControlController.cs, it should have the same logic as the base ZController.ShowEditForm() function but with added logic as follows:  var featureControl = sourceEntity as FeatureControlHeader  if (featureControl.ReleaseGroup.Staff.Contains(Env.CurrentUser.PK)) then call ShowViewForm(sourceEntity), otherwise proceed with the base ShowEditForm() logic.    Change FeatureControlHeader FCM_GG_ReleaseGroup to be Non null, this may require a transformation to change any nulls to non-null, this might need to be made into another WI.  Another transformation (or the same transformation) can be used to add a GU_SecurityItemIsAllowed = 0 record for the new security checkpoint if Feature Control Module access is granted
product_candidate: [LIC] Release group security for Feature Control Module

WKI_Summary: S&S GB - change in mapping to better support multiple commodities
details: KH1 18-Jun-25 14:26 GMT+01:00: See Daniel's specification on eDocs for details, particularly the worked example.    The required changes apply to S&S wrappers found in CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\GB\Manifest\ICS\Messaging\Wrappers\SafetyAndSecurity\Common    The GoodsItem elements are created in DeclarationWrapperSS:105-108, one for each Bill  Change this to return a GoodsItemWrapper for each unique(commodity code + normalised description, see below) found in the packs of each Bill (create a routine that will look at all bills, and return a GoodsItem wrapper for each commodity code found in the packs). The number of items returned should be at least one per Bill. If there are no packs in a bill, create a GoodsItemWrapper with empty list of packs [This would be similar to the existing behaviour even if it doesn't necessarily make sense; Packages would return an empty list, Commodity would return new CommodityWrapper(ZString.Empty), GoodsDescription would return the bill's GoodsDescription]    Using the combination of commodity code and normalised description to make a "key" for each pack will make satisfying the requirement simple (with distinct for each GoodsItemWrapper, then using that key to match to get the specific packs that belong to that GoodsItemWrapper) . Normalised description = trim and convert to upper case. A possible solution is to add a property to the (S&S) AsycudaPack class to return the key, although note that this would require casting the base-AsycudaPack up to the (known class it must be) S&S AsycudaPack in order to access this; there may be benefit from a little refactoring to avoid having all these base-class references everywhere, but it goes all the way back to where DeclarationWrapperSS is instantiated.    The GoodsItemWrapper constructor will need to accept a list of packs (IEnumerable<AsycudaPack> maybe), as well as the Bill it currently takes. Store the list of packs in a readonly field, probably should be converted to a list or array as this will be referenced in several places.  Change GoodsItemWrapper.Packages to return a PackageWrapper for each pack given to the constructor only, instead of all packs of the bill.  In fact, every use of bills.Packs in GoodsItemWrapper should just be changed to use the list of packs given to the constructor instead.  GoodsItemWrapper.GoodsDescription: use first non-empty description from the packs, or if all blank (or there are no packs, see above), default back to bill.ABL_GoodsDescription ? At the moment, the pack-level description isn't used at all. What if we have the same commodity on two packs in one bill, with different descriptions? See HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=685a2487-340b-4198-aab4-9133870f87fe&StorageDocPK=af2673d3-7cfa-4b30-8d5c-eed8719ef11c&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bfx8b8YN6nh78GOKq%2bcZC6m5fCLpq0EiI" KH1 18-Jun-25 14:32:  File Descriptions.jpg (Client Correspondence / Screenshots)  DJC 19-Jun-25 10:01 GMT+01:00:  Please treat {commodity code plus normalised package description} as the discriminator when grouping packages into goods items.  So in Katie's question, two package rows with same comm code and different descriptions will be treated as (will result in) two distinct goods items. See eDocs. When we come to write the goods item description, if blank, it's OK to fall upwards to the bill's own description.     Suggested outcome:  GoodsItem 12345678 "DESC FOR 12345678"    - pack of 1 AH  GoodsItem 12345678 "BILL GOODS DESC"    - pack of 3 BX  GoodsItem 87654321 "DESC FOR 87654321"    - pack of 2 BA    Current result would be (wrong):  GoodsItem 12345678 "BILL GOODS DESC"    - pack of 1 AH    - pack of 2 BA    - pack of 3 BX    DJC 03-Feb-25 09:22 GMT+00:00:  Current data capture requires one bill ber commodity, and there's little front-end assistance to explain this to users.   Change to allow more natural and intuitive data capture, then use the messaging layer to turn that into the required structure.
feature_description: change in mapping to better support multiple commodities

WKI_Summary: Improve Label Printing Speeds for Forwarding
details: BPD 07-Oct-24 15:34 GMT+11:00:     Detailed Build Design :  Investigation : The main goal of this work item is to improve label  printing speeds for Shipment Label documents by printing all labels in one document,  for Freight Label and Freight Label with Unique ID .  The pause customer complained about is caused because printer prints multiple documents one by one, "This is the document for forwarding shipment, and there are multiple print label documents are generated when you print this document, then printer will print them one by one, just like pause, there is no pause, just print multiple documents one by one." HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=de5d16f1-9e53-4ae5-a796-38f683ae017d&VersionNumber=24.10.7.3&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b9UHHiNsylalXEq1UPgPluVUIr2ib%2ffVq" CS01537895 - INTSCMLAX - Pause when printing labels   and from this work item , we want to provide a single document with all labels in multiple pages to address this.  Please find HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=10c5d0ed-eed4-40b1-a47e-551d88b0d3a8&StorageDocPK=590d7cda-b8b1-413c-9e23-c03ff07077fd&Hash=%2bNQgFINJI%2bWf1EN9tSvpOmLXvEtmgmYVJ&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" BPD 07-Oct-24 15:22:  File WI00795931_DetailDesignNotes.docx (Internal Correspondence) , I have added snapshots of how the label prints can be previewed and the difference between number of documents.    Suggested changes:  a)  Create new datacontext options for printing Shipment freight labels in a single document:, for documents: Freight Label (GenericFreightJobByPackages1Doc) and Freight Label with Unique ID (GenericFreightJobBySelectedPackages1Doc)     In /Enterprise/Product/Core/Resources/Resources/Constants   please introduce two new contexts : public enum DataContext{..}    GenericFreightJobByPackages1Doc    GenericFreightJobBySelectedPackages1Doc    b) Make the changes in document wrappers to check if the user has selected any of the above two options and if they have, print the shipment label in one document.    In \Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Forwarding\Forwarding.Business\Shipment\ForwardingShipmentDocumentSupporter.cs    protected override DocumentWrapper[] GetDocumentWrappersInternal(Core.Constants.DataContext dataContext, IStmMenuItem commandBeingRun)  {    //we will have to add conditions to match datacontext against GenericFreightJobByPackages1Doc and GenericFreightJobBySelectedPackages1Doc  }     currently     when DataContext is GenericFreightJobByPackages, GetGenericWrapperForPacks(dataContext) is used     when DataContext is GenericFreightJobBySelectedPackages, GetGenericWrapperForPacksInRange() is used   which create multiple documents for multiple labels,     to return one document with multiple pages , in the above conditions we can check and pass an extra parameter to the wrappers to denote if we want to print as a single document      if DataContext is GenericFreightJobByPackages  or  GenericFreightJobByPackages1Doc   {      GetGenericWrapperForPacks(dataContext, returnSingleDocument ) (returnSingleDocument would be true if datacontext is GenericFreightJobByPackages1Doc)   }     if DataContext is GenericFreightJobBySelectedPackages or GenericFreightJobBySelectedPackages1Doc   {    GetGenericWrapperForPacksInRange(returnSingleDocument) (returnSingleDocument would be true if datacontext is GenericFreightJobBySelectedPackages1Doc)   }     and modify GetGenericWrapperForPacks , GetGenericWrapperForPacksInRange to create 1 document if returnSingleDocument is true.    for example please refer to PR : https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/260299    https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FWarehouse%2FTransitWarehouse%2FTransitWarehouse.Business%2FDispatchConsignment%2FWhsItemDispatchConsignmentDocumentSupporter.cs&version=GBmaster&line=58&lineEnd=58&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=103&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FPacking%2FPacking.Business%2FCommon%2FTransportPackageLabelHelper.cs&version=GBmaster&line=73&lineEnd=76&lineStartColumn=2&lineEndColumn=6&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents      CJP 03-Sep-24 10:28 GMT+10:00:   https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=1bbcb2fb-7dd7-471b-bddf-46e0b32bf1a8    TWH has improved their label printing speeds and the client needs the same to be done to those in Forwarding. Specifically the Shipment > Freight Label with Unique ID    ---    The DataContext controls what DocWrappers to produce, and the labels that are slow produce a DocWrapper (file) per page/label. Instead if we provide a single DocWrapper and   populate the Packages collection with the packages we want, it sends a single file to the printer with many pages, so it no longer pauses between printing.    Refer to this PR from TWH  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/260299?_a=files
product_candidate: Improve Label Printing Speeds for Forwarding

WKI_Summary: Colombia - New IVA Withholding RETEIVA General Rate
details: Country COLOMBIA  Sub Project HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAG0SYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=8a359331-1de8-4cf3-9d8c-b4b307f53461&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bP2SRixGxJ8TkxP97S0n9r8Y%2baGu7dGb1" Project PRJ00037091  Head Project HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAUSSYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=5da8f849-6392-428a-bf02-6fa35d2a52be&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2ba6icvzlBehIlslRQuYs2zRHPSY5jcmNz" Project PRJ00029620  Topic Importance Comments  In Colombia Country there is a IVA Withholding Tax that our Users have requested to add in CargoWise.  Add a new RETEIVA Tax ID for Colombia Country that supports IVA and IVA Withholding Genral rate calculation.  Moreover, add a new rate reference to source the rate for the withholding.  Standard Colombia IVA Rate is 19% and reduced IVA rate is 5%.  The IVA Withholding general rate is 15%.  IVA Withholding calculation base is the IVA amount.  This is an invoice based Withholding calculation (included inside the invoice by the issuer).  Therefore, Users need to be able to easily distinguish Withholding amount when posting an AR transaction and also be able to extract this information from AR transaction XUT when needed.  Scope:   HLD (High Level Design) Done Statements:  When the Specification is completed, the following statements will be true:  Two new RETEIVA Tax IDs are available for Colombia Country.  CargoWise supports IVA Withholding Genral rate calculation for Colombia Login companies.  Withholding amount is easily distinguish in the invoice form  Withholding amount appears in XUT.  Other notes:  Find below some Incidents where CargoWise Customers request to add Withholding Taxesin CargoWise:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=c0ea518b-2167-4d9e-82cc-df15a1ee016b&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b8As96ajqQ%2bJDlmyn7EBf8XHwkOGU6Iar" CS00675940 - KEYLOGBOG1 - COLOMBIA - Withholding Tax  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=be0287f5-2f83-44d5-ae85-d6124ccb9b1d&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bSEVpuVgDtUIsDXc1mLTXYhtNv3SEg8QT" CS00239355 - GEOWILBOG - GW COLOMBIA - Compliance requirements document- URGENT  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=3bd41e3d-682f-4cfb-b598-60c5fcfb4c72&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bHEXQ6rpK5CYm6iEhbaZEWTa5%2fasnzlI7" CS01153365 - TRATECYMQ - Colombia Withholding tax
feature_description: New IVA Withholding RETEIVA General Rate

Add a new CustomerApplicationEditForm  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=eb5d3755-7ce9-4eeb-a29a-4e3eb2a81b90&StorageDocPK=ce0c341d-5493-473b-a7c9-c8311bbcf75b&Hash=%2bla6gA4SCN0CAMjAaPSbmcz2cD0Yq49rA&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" JWA 27-Sep-24 13:19:  File CustomerApplicationForm.tif (Client Correspondence / Screenshots) I've added the screenshot for the customer application edit form.    2. Add a new bool column IDA_IsCustomerApplication in EdiIdentityApplication, and when it's being saved, we should check IDA_OH_ParentOrg is not empty or IDA_IDA_ParentApplication is not emtpy. JWU 24-Oct-24 17:24 GMT+08:00: Isn't the form creating customer applications? Can we check it inside the form? JWA 24-Oct-24 17:47 GMT+08:00: Check it in EdiIdentityApplicationValidation  2. After discussion, we can Add a none persistent property "IsCustomerApplication" in EdiIdentityApplication    3. In "EdiIdentityApplicationController", update the method GetForm    protected override IZForm GetForm(IBusiness businessEntity)  {   var application = businessEntity as EdiIdentityApplication;   if (application.IsCustomerApplication)  JWU 24-Oct-24 17:30 GMT+08:00: Can we use IDA_OH_ParentOrg or IDA_IDA_ParentApplication? JWA 24-Oct-24 17:47 GMT+08:00: For the new created application, there is no ParentOrg or ParentApplication, then we don't know which kind of form should be opened. JWA 25-Oct-24 14:51 GMT+08:00:  We will use the none persistent property IsCustomerApplication    {    return new CustomerApplicationForm(application);   }   else   {    return new EdiIdentityApplicationForm(application);   }  }    4. In "EdiIdentityApplicationModule", override the method GetNewActionMenuItems    protected override MenuItem[] GetNewStandardMenuItems()  {   var menuItems = base.GetNewStandardMenuItems();     var customerApplication = new ZMenuItem("New Azure Application", delegate { ShowNewForm(); });   var azureApplication = new ZMenuItem("New Customer Application", delegate { ShowNewCustomerApplicationForm(); });     NewMenuItem.MenuItems.Add(customerApplication);   NewMenuItem.MenuItems.Add(azureApplication);     return menuItems;  }    void ShowNewCustomerApplicationForm()  {   var newAppFunc = ()=>   {     var customerApplication = Factory.New<EdiIdentityApplication>();    customerApplication.IsCustomerApplication= true;    return customerApplication;   };   ShowNewFormCore(newAppFunc);  }

WKI_Summary: Turn off Audit Events for Declaration tables
details: JPG 24-Mar-25 15:42 GMT+11:00: The purpose of this WI is to turn off Audit Event logging (by default) for the main Declaration tables. See the following links for an overview of what we want to achieve:    https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/ArchiveManager/EUUiOSoELGRNsSGhAzlT16kBowtezPrVVdNV3H4dxM3N9g?e=FWtKxN    Guide: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/13383/Turning-off-Audit-Events  Sample PR: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/291327    REQ001: Remove the IsAutoLogged override from the following classes (that is, turn off auto logging):    BaseJobDeclaration  BaseJobComInvoiceHeader  CusEntryPayInfo    LY 09-Apr-25 10:30 GMT+01:00: Remove relevant business objects from AuditEventTest baseline https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FArchiveManager%2FArchiveManager%2FArchiveManager.Test%2FAuditEventTest.cs&version=GBmaster&line=107&lineEnd=108&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=1&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    REQ002: Add the following tables to AutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValue (https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FWorkflow%2FWorkflow.Business%2FAuditStmALog%2FAutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValues.cs&version=GBmaster&_a=contents)    BaseJobDeclaration  BaseJobComInvoiceHeader    This enable 2 things:  When the registry is on for a particular table, then StmALog events will be created as if IsAutoLogged were turned on.  When the registry if off, then NonPersistedStmALog events will be create. These will allow workflow to work on EDT/ADD events, but it will not actually persist the events in StmALog (which is the real goal here).    (Do not add CusEntryPayInfo, because we do not support workflow against that table.)    --    The three tables should already be in the Audit DB and visible on the Declaration form:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=1e0c4ffb-8314-4b9f-85b2-333c8c27b748&VersionNumber=25.3.24.25&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bjQqGxygot%2bGXvkNui0RvVK9hMBdK6j9P" WI00886436 - Enable Audit Data tab for all JobDeclaration Forms      TT7 03-Jul-25 09:57 GMT+10:00: IsAutoLogged has been updated. We just need to override its value to AutoLoggingState => AutologState.AutoLoggedToQueueOnly and Workflow will work as expected, no need to add the tables to AutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValue
product_candidate: Turn off Audit Events for Declaration tables

WKI_Summary: Dominican Republic - Set DO CED (Cedula) as Main Reg. Code
details: Country DOMINICAN REPUBLIC  Sub Project HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIUY0SYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=c4dc8562-2d37-49cf-8d1b-7a1ce3dc2f78&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bplrYsMywwXvLGTeNmSOWQ0zTd8ht0cpe" Project PRJ00037106  Head Project HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAUSSYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=5da8f849-6392-428a-bf02-6fa35d2a52be&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2ba6icvzlBehIlslRQuYs2zRHPSY5jcmNz" Project PRJ00029620  Topic Importance Comments    Set DO CED (Cédula) as MAIN registration code.            High Cedula (CED) is the oficial personal identification document and in CW is only accessible from Organisation > Details > Config > Registration Numbers > Codes.     This is not ideal as it requires additional user actions to set the client's principal personal id in case to classify an organization as a natural person, making the process less intuitive and user-friendly.   Scope:   HLD (High Level Design) Done Statements  When the Specification is completed, the following statements will be true:  DO CED Registration code is available from Organization > Details tab and not only from Organization > Details > Config > Registration Numbers > Codes tab, as it was before this development.  Other notes:
feature_description: Set DO CED (Cedula) as Main Reg. Code

WKI_Summary: [CCA] Consol ETD should NOT check Allocation Route Period if Booking/MBL exist
details: Done Statement  Once the Carrier Booking Number or Master Bill of Lading Number existed on the Consol, Consol's ETD should NOT be validated against the Start Date / Expiry Date of Allocation Route(s) utilised.    Both Rohlig and DHL have raised the same/similar request/scenario:    HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAUSSYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=d8368320-9922-44c9-b0b5-41061f310f3a&VersionNumber=25.3.7.316&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bs%2fgyGgpaGNctZwxgDD5VWpfpqwkLkeY%2f" Project PRJ00049515 - HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=d8368320-9922-44c9-b0b5-41061f310f3a&StorageDocPK=ae9c573e-9199-4c22-860d-b5424b1e3ec9&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bvlLbzF7uTHwyt8ysWDBTh6wA1F39k0KT" SRH 07-Mar-25 23:56:  File WTG DHL Workshop Summary - 24 to 26 Feb 2025[2] (WI Ref).docx (Memorandum of Understanding)    Context:  This work item is a Rohlig priority.    TLM 01-Apr-25 13:57 GMT+11:00:   HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/Shared/_wiki/wikis/Forwarding%20Work%20Item%20Wiki/15017/WI00829485-CCA-Consol-ETD-should-NOT-check-Allocation-Route-Period-if-Booking-or-MBL-Existed" WI00829485 - [CCA] Consol ETD should NOT check Allocation Route Period if Booking or MBL Existed - Overview    No expiry date validation errors occur on a Consol once it is attached to an Allocation Route.    TLM 12-Dec-24 10:17 GMT+11:00:   https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/Shared/_wiki/wikis/Forwarding%20Work%20Item%20Wiki/15017/WI00829485-CCA-Remove-the-expiry-date-validation-on-a-consol-if-it's-attached-to-a-route    # Done Statement  No expiry date validation errors occur on a Consol once it is attached to an Allocation Route.  # Context  Despite agreeing on a fixed allocation per period e.g. 10 TEU / week. Reality does not work that way necessarily. Vessels get delayed.   # Description  Validation of ETD should happen only when initially attempting to link a Consolidation to a specific Allocation Route ID, where the ETD should be validated against the Start & Expiry date.     Once the link has been established, there should not be any further checks. Even in the cases   - the ETD gets **beyond the Expiry date** of the Allocation Route    - the ETD gets **before the Start Date** of the Allocation Route
product_candidate: [CCA] Consol ETD should NOT check Allocation Route Period if Booking/MBL exist

WKI_Summary: Stop creation of NotEligible (NOT) pivots
details: ODN 27-Jun-25 11:05 GMT+10:00: We have recently started creating NOT (Not Eligible) pivots for all transactions, limited to Fiji:  HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/8421cc74-c2a0-4713-a332-8526eaa774b2?lang=en-gb" WI00810120 - Invoice Fiscalization - New EInvoicing status for not eligible transactions    This has caused at least one issue, which was fixed in a follow-up item:  HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/1b98aebb-6f03-486c-8860-bd628cd27639?lang=en-gb" WI00908781 - Duplicate SUB Pivot while posting Receipt    However, the intent of the original WI was only to display "Not Eligible" status in the transaction list for invoices that were not found to be eligible for e-Invoicing.   This could have been achieved with a custom display text when there was no pivot associated with the invoice.  We do not have any other use for these NOT pivots, and they would just be wasting space in the database and contribute to a degradation of performance over time.    DONE: Relevant changes from the original WI are reverted and we stop creating new "NOT" pivots.  DONE: Invoices that were not found to be eligible, keep showing this status in the relevant column instead of that column being left blank as before.  DONE: We only remove changes relevant to NotEligible pivots and leave other refactoring intact.    FOLLOW UP: Add a transformation to remove any NOT pivots from customer databases in a later item?  FOLLOW UP: Remove the database constraint that allows pivots with NOT type after transformation does the cleanup?    This is the PR that starts creating pivots for ineligible transactions:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/293019    Functional change to remove is here:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/293019?_a=files&path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FAccounting%2FBusiness%2FeInvoicing%2FElectronicInvoicingTransactionProxy.cs    NotEligible pivot type to be removed is defined here:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/293019?_a=files&path=%2FEnterprise%2FArchitecture%2FCore%2FCore.Test%2FCodeDescriptionPair%2FCodeDescriptionPairListTest.cs

WKI_Summary: Improve how Non Mandatory Release Captured Attributes are handled
details: LC3 16-Oct-24 08:51 GMT+08:00:   For functional test reviewer:  create an order containing a product with non mandatory + release captured attribute  1. Desktop: set Picked Date in Pick form, should not see error  2. Android: in pick screen, press submit button with empty attribute, should go to the next screen    JW6 18-Sep-24 14:02 GMT+08:00:   Done Statement:  We will tolerate empty RCAs if they are non mandatory, and this requires two changes:  1. On desktop Picking Screen, relax the validation when setting the picked date.  2. On Android Pick Product Screen, allow user to go to the next screen if the RCAs are empty and non mandatory.    CKR 17-Sep-24 13:08 GMT+10:00:   After revisiting this, I believe we should aim for a consensus that requires minimal effort to ensure consistency. This is not a common scenario, and I doubt any of our clients are using it this way (otherwise, they would have reported it, right?).  What if we allow clients to skip entering any attribute during picking on Android? Then, we could make this behavior consistent on Desktop, giving them the option to enter an RCA or not.  For such an edge case, I think it’s not worth investing time in making changes to WinCE, especially since it's going to be deprecated soon anyway.    JW6 12-Sep-24 15:42 GMT+08:00:   Split off from HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=c0258b17-6e94-4645-82fe-41ef0d42cbda&VersionNumber=24.9.12.124&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bME0pBxcn%2f3gEOYJ4jwEcqn7%2bFK0gKfSj" WI00795945 - Retrieve length of WZ_ReleaseCapturedSerialNumber and consume it.    The Release Captured Attributes fields on Android have an interactive problem, for example if you set Attribute1 to NON mandatory and Release Captured, then on RF picking screen you can't go to the next screen until entered something for it, and it doesn't have a notification like the Mandatory one.  On the other hand, when perform picking on desktop there is an error message says it's not Release Captured yet.    Leslie had checked with Christ, this is an edge case but we should make it consistent across different scenarios.  The first question is should we treat Release Captured Attributes as Mandatory even if the config on Client is NON Mandatory or Batch Number etc. If so do we need to add a hint on UI some where?    Then there are few places to make changes:  - RF pick product screen, show the error message when Release Captured Attributes are not entered despite of they are mandatory or not. (This might involves WinCE as well)  - On desktop when finalizing a pick which contains Release Captured lines, show an validation error when there are not release captured lines, just like when setting the RCA as mandatory.  - On desktop Release Screen, we can clear Release Captured Attributes is they are NON mandatory, depends on decision made above, we might need to change this behaviour as well. That is, RCAs must not be empty.
product_candidate: Improve how Non Mandatory Release Captured Attributes are handled

WKI_Summary: CPW: Commodities Grid Filters - Additional UX Improvements
details: BWD 23-Oct-24 10:38 GMT+11:00:   Background  UX Improvements were made to the Commdoities grid in: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=2d9ea506-4432-4eca-85f0-1d69ea9026a1&VersionNumber=24.10.23.55&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b7i5yX%2fg92yFbOG%2frun%2bUp2jQD%2ffGlC3J" WI00798797 - CPW: UX Commodities add Filter Panel and Controls    Problem Summary  Users do not know if any filters have been applied when the filter section is collapsed  Users need to open the filter section in order to clear the filters    Suggested Solution  1. Add a count of how many filters are applied next to "Hide/Show Filters". Like this: "Hide/Show Filters (2)"  NOTE: When there are no filters applied, do not include the brackets like "(0)". It should just be: "Hide/Show Filters"  2. Create a new "Remove Filters" button out of the collapsible element and next to the commodity count.  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=ef20330e-5d52-43c5-b797-9c39434b2830&StorageDocPK=93796b61-5c7d-40a4-880c-a711b76c6a7f&Hash=%2b%2f8x8%2fHnerbspBDEytICEq3r4lFbuOw4Q&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" BWD 23-Oct-24 10:41:  File Ux Improvements.tif (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.  When pressed, "Remove Filters" will delete all the existing filter rows (so that there are 0 rows left).  It should also trigger a search refresh so that all the commodities are shown in the grid without the user having to click "Find" again    DONE Statements  DONE: A count of filters applied is included next to the "Hide/Show Filters" text  DONE: A new "Remove Filters" button is created outside the collpsible element and next to the Commodities count
feature_description: Additional UX Improvements

WKI_Summary: FJ eInv - Add new Tax Code Group G and Rename Existing Code Description
details: JMN 15-Jul-25 16:15 GMT+10:00:   Background: VAT rate of 15% has been reduced to 12.5%, as a result, a new tax label (tax code group G) has been introduced.  Existing Code description should also be revised to avoid possible confusion. WKI_Summary: AM: ARC Should be Cancellable
details: AY2 02-Sep-24 16:29 GMT+10:00:   ARC is not (and in fact never has) dealt with cancellation tokens correctly.    https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/4236/Queues-in-service-tasks makes it clear that while processing should proceed to completion in cases where service task has a queue, it should also respond to cancellation.    We should make it so that ArchiveStage's (and its overrides) methods are aware of cancellation tokens. When a cancellation occurs:    1. Any currently executing batches can continue but new batches should not be started.  2. Upon attempting to begin the next batch, we simply return instead.  3, Any records that were not yet processed must remain in the queue (or we will have a massive headache in terms of implementing watermarks). These records may stay in the queue for quite a while (at least until the next run of ARC) and should not be immediately deleted in the ACL service task. In fact, ACL should not touch them at all and they should be deleted by the ON DELETE CASCADE foreign key AIM_S5_ParentSchedule.      AY2 03-Oct-24 15:29 GMT+10:00:   DBD  Note that first of all we are planning in the near future to separate the functionality of the current table dbo.ArchiveMainItemQueue into two tables, one for storing the queue of records to be processed, another for storing the cache of recently processed records.    This may need to be taken into account, but isn't enough of an influence to warrant a pre-req IMO.    1. Archive cleanup service task needs to be modified so that it does not clean up records that never began loading until a very long time has passed. These records were loaded into the queue, but likely timed out before they could be processed.  2. Cancellation token needs to be passed down all the way from ArchiveServiceTask to ExecuteStage and responded to. Upon cancellation, the current batch MUST finish but no new batches should start.    The key consideration here is that the queue will not be emptied in between runs. Of course, immediately after the cancellation is invoked, this won't happen. However, we need some way to ensure that records that aren't yet picked up will not be wiped out by the cleanup service or they will not be picked up again until the watermak comes around.    Luckily, we can just use the status columns in ArchiveMainItemQueue - if something is not loading, loaded, or skipped, then clearly it is waiting to be picked up, and we should wait a while before deleting it.

WKI_Summary: Brazil - ADD four OrgCusCodes to subclassify BR GOV organizations
details: Background  Cargowise must provide users in Brazil a way to subclassify Brazil (BR) GOV organizations as "Union"; "State", "City", "Federal District" government organisations.  This sub-classifcation requirement is new, and has become a requirement becauce of Brazil VAT law and eReporting of invoice changes.    When the Receivables organization is a government entity, the Seller must include an identifier in invoice e-reporting messages that indicates the level of government the organisation represents.  This indication is requied because different levels of government have different rights and obligations.    Soluition  Add Four OrgCusCodes to the BR list.  Define the four codes in a "Codes cannot co-exist" list for Brazil country.      New Codes    BR GUN Government Entity Union / Governmental da União  BR GES Government Entity State / Governmental Estado  BR GDF Govenment Entity Federal District / Governmental do Distrito Federal  BR GMN Government Entity Municipal / Governmental Município    Conditions  Only one of the four can exist
feature_description: ADD four OrgCusCodes to subclassify BR GOV organizations

WKI_Summary: Auto Trans: Expand scope of 'Allow Posting of Zero Value Invoices' Registry
details: AH6 09-Sep-24 13:22 GMT+10:00: This WI will expand the number of AR transaction types of the registry Allow Posting of Zero Balance Invoices. Currently this registry only caters for Periodic invoices. This will allow customers to prevent any zero balance invoices from being posted if there is a company policy or country law that dictates this.    AH6 10-Oct-24 14:41 GMT+11:00: Link to HLD: https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:x:/s/DevelopmentAccountingTeam143/EefNvZWZ3BZBltV66DFdLzIB6Jybenrx4tGMLzJ_b5gwag?e=d6E0eB  AH6 21-Jan-25 12:55 GMT+11:00:  Link to UAT: https://wisetechglobal-my.sharepoint.com/:x:/p/andy_harrison/EdOVt4j3EDFEuR77S3XQ5_cBE-OE1CMdrpx1ZX6K1QmydQ?e=7T8kxB  AH6 23-Jan-25 16:05 GMT+11:00: Link to UPN: https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/DevelopmentAccountingTeam143/EW5XWISL2thLmFHbp1VbRgsBYda7iMEz7zme1AmYts5zkA?e=lLbOES    Done statement: When registry 'Allow Posting of Zero Balance Invoices' is set to 'No', any automatic AR transaction with a zero balance can not be posted.    Whether it is a preference/policy of a customer, or it is law within a certain country, we need to give the customer the ability to block any AR transaction that has a zero balance from being posted.  The customer would therefore prescribe this functionality on an ‘opt in’ basis for each country or at system level depending on preferences.  Currently the Registry Allow Posting of Zero Balance Invoices only prevents Periodic Invoices from being posted if they have a zero balance.    We could expand this registry so that it covers all forms of AR transactions. This would therefore include for automatic transactions, the additions of:    Importing an AR XUT with zero balance: > 1 line item netting to 0  Importing an AR XUT with zero balance: 1 line item = 0  Attempting to post an AR XUS with zero balance using workflow trigger: > 1 line item netting to 0  Attempting to post an AR XUS with zero balance using workflow trigger: 1 line item = 0  CSV Import: > 1 line item netting to 0  CSV Import: 1 line item = 0  CSV Import: 1 comment line = 0  Auto post profit share charges: > 1 line item netting to 0  Job billing - revenue posting  Consol Agent Invoice posting     (incl. consol costs with "Include on Collect Invoice")     Posting job revenue using action item in operational module      The logic will need to be extended to include invoices that have comment lines only.    A consistent red dot error messages will need to be present in the 2 scenarios. We can use the existing one used for the AllowPosting of Zero Balance Invoices registry.     And alter the last section to reference the transaction type.   Note: Where a net zero position with an AR Invoice CRN, the preference from Bollore is for nothing to be posted.    MXD 29-Nov-24 15:26 GMT+08:00:   Please refer to:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/292891  For Test Only:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/295015
product_candidate: Expand scope of 'Allow Posting of Zero Value Invoices' Registry

WKI_Summary: CSC: PDS in DbSecurityLockDown
details: HZ 04-Nov-24 12:40 GMT+11:00:     Done statement:      Make DbSecurityLockDown not use a hardcoded SA password.    Any attempt to change sa password automatically can lead to incorrect password being set on the server.  For example the DSA task might be running on a machine that doesn't have the password. So it can never know what the correct password is.  We should avoid setting the password in DSA task.  On the other hand we still need to lockdown the system and check to make sure it has not been modified.        One possible solution we had was to have :    DSA check to see if it can login with the available credentials on the machine.  If it is not able to do so, it is one of the folowing cases :    1 - The user has somehow changed the SA password without the secrets utility.  2 - The user changed the password with secrets utility but they did not distribute the password to the DSA machine correctly.    In both cases we lock the system down and we dont let the user continue using CW1 until they follow a procedure and change the password again and distribute it correctly. The lockdown method will not change the pasword, but it will block the user from using the system.      HZ 08-Nov-24 16:02 GMT+11:00:   After discussion and considering different scenarios in a meeting the decision was to :    1 - In DSA task Disable the sa login if the system is closed. But dont modify it otherwise.   2 - In InitilizeServerSecurity we disable the SA login,   3 - We will never try to login with SA in any condition anymore. (backup and restore, always on, log shipping, server setup,... etc). No body will use sa login anymore.

WKI_Summary: CPW: Jobs can proceed without completing a commodity risk check
details: BWD 28-Jan-25 13:43 GMT+11:00:   Background  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAUSSYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=dc255fac-f021-4289-aefb-5963ca289c1e&VersionNumber=25.1.28.35&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bqL0FJrAyOBwW9SGvhAx3usy7sh1ZA5La" Project PRJ00050411  Registry setup will be done in: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=8106038f-4cb4-425b-9500-89e555519298&VersionNumber=25.1.28.35&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bGaHaSAvpuPYvplegGoKMcuJvPBVLmH2y" WI00857908 - CPW: Configure jobs to proceed without completing a commodity risk check    Problem Summary  Select customers will not take the ComplianceWise upgrade if they are prompted to complete a Commodity Risk check on every job.  CW1Support needs a way to configure select customer systems to allow jobs to proceed without completing a commodity risk check.    Suggested Solution  The following functionality will only be enabled when the registry is ticked from: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=8106038f-4cb4-425b-9500-89e555519298&VersionNumber=25.1.28.35&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bGaHaSAvpuPYvplegGoKMcuJvPBVLmH2y" WI00857908 - CPW: Configure jobs to proceed without completing a commodity risk check  Add a new commodity compliance risk status called "Not Assessed (NAS)" (Grey).  When a new Forwarding Shipment/Booking is created, the commodity compliance risk status will be set to "Not Assessed" and the job will not be blocked from proceeding (Clear overall compliance risk status if all other factors are clear).  The "Not Assessed" status should aggregate to linked consolidations and master shipments.  Existing jobs do not need to be auto-updated when the registry is enabled. Customers will need to update the statuses by either opening the job or clicking "Resynchronise Compliance Status".    NOTE: We will need to patch back this WI to GP2. This is so that we can login to the customer's systems who have not upgraded to 24.10 (where CPW was enabled) and enable this functionality before they upgrade to 24.10.    DONE Statements  DONE: When the registry is enabled, job's commodity compliance risk status is set to a non-blocking "Not Assessed" status.  DONE: When the registry is enabled, users can reclaculate existing jobs to get updated to the "Not Assessed" status.
product_candidate: Jobs can proceed without completing a commodity risk check
