WKI_Summary: MEXICO - New TAX ID to calculate 8% VAT (IVA) AND "2/3" IVA withholding (5.33%)
details: Country MÉXICO  Sub Project HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAG0SYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=f4633ef2-cb93-44a4-906b-cb9e51a305d5&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bpUlhJPovuu6xcRwpGBIfyHkgxx4cQoU5" Project PRJ00029637  Head Project HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAUSSYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=5da8f849-6392-428a-bf02-6fa35d2a52be&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2ba6icvzlBehIlslRQuYs2zRHPSY5jcmNz" Project PRJ00029620  Topic Importance Comments   New MX TAX ID (8% VAT and 5.33% of VAT Withholding     Scope:   HLD (High Level Design) Done Statements:  - We need to introduce a new VAT Withholding Tax ID for Mexico (MX).  - Mexico have a VAT Withholding rate for certain classes of transactions (i.e. Suppliers who are natural persons providing personal services 'Leases/Rentals' to a legal entity (our clients), located in a border area) that is two-thirds (5.33% of the 'Reduced' 8% VAT rate (Currently 8% for companies in border region).    Current Functionality:   *Standard VAT Rate in Mexico is 16%  *We currently support a Tax ID = IVAREF to calculate Standard VAT 16% and 10.66667% ('Extra Tax Rate') of VAT withholding (5.33% effective rate)  *Reduce 'Fronteriza' rate in Mexico is 8%  *We currently support a Tax ID = IVAREDRET to calculate Reduce VAT 8% and 4% ('Extra Tax Rate') of VAT withholding and Tax ID = IVAREDREB to calculate Reduce VAT 8% and 3% ('Extra Tax Rate')       Other notes:  Reference incident requesting new TAX ID and legal basis:   http://www.diputados.gob.mx/LeyesBiblio/regley/Reg_LIVA_250914.pdf  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=8a6bb0a2-d659-464f-803b-59f42491e76f&VersionNumber=25.4.2.29&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bo8n5mxjcKtXKWHXmw6ERxevdtAx28%2b3L" CS01917113 - NOAMARADT - Missing Border tax with 60% retention
feature_description: New TAX ID to calculate 8% VAT (IVA) AND "2/3" IVA withholding (5.33%)

Conditions:  Login company = VN(Vietnam)  Registry 'Enable E-Reporting Functionality - Receivables' is set to Yes    Apply the existing error message of the NAL option designed for the registry Negative Charges on Accounts Receivable Transaction.

WKI_Summary: PP: New STL collector for Return type receives (RET)
details: LBM 20-Mar-25 20:14 GMT+11:00:   Validations have been added in order for clients to not be able to game the system and have valid return receives.    For functional review,  1. Operational action to generate RMA from an order in the order module will now disallow RMA generation if the order has a related return receive.  2. Generate RMA from selected order lines now loads all related return receives on the order and disallow over returning. A new column is added on the GUI for generating RMA from order lines to indicate available quantity to return.  3. Manually creating a return receive will require a receive number as the order number of order to return. A warning is added on the receive number if it's empty or if the reference does not point to a departed order.  4. User is allowed to update the order to link by updating the receive number if no order has been linked to the receive yet. If a valid order is linked to the receive, then the receive number entry becomes read only.  5. Return receives are now disallowed from over returning or adding lines with products that were never released by the order. This validation only takes effect if the return receive is linked to an order.  6. Return receives are now not allowed to link to an order that has already been fully returned. A validation error will be shown to the user.  7. Receive lines based on the linked order's lines with the correct available quantities are automatically added to the return receive during save if the receive does not have lines and it's the first time the order is linked to the receive. Succeeding saves will not do this if the receive has been linked to the order already.  8. Return receives created from RF will display a warning if reference does not point to a valid order.  9. RF also disallows return receive creation if the referenced order is already fully returned.    MMC 06-Dec-24 14:12 GMT+11:00:   Looks like all auto created Return Receives currently link to a Parent Order, we should use this as the way to determine if a receive is a valid Return, that way it can't be gamed by customers.    Additionally, the operational action that generates Return Receives from Orders should have validation that prevents generating the Return if the Order is already linked to a Child Receive. The operational action returns the entire order, so if a return receive is already linked it does not make sense to use this operational action - they should use the Order Line Grid action for partial returns.    Additionally, the Menu Action Grid   on Order Lines that let's you create a Return Receive for the selected Order Lines should load all existing child Receives, sum up the current product totals and check if we're over the max.  Disallow creating the receive if any order line selected is over the max.    Additionally, if manually creating a "RET" receive, External Reference is immediately Mandatory (you cannot leave it empty for the docket ID).  Furthermore, the External Reference entered must match a warehouse order with the same external reference. On RunPreSaveValidation, link the Order and check the product totals just like for the Menu Action Grid, and add a validation error on any order line that's over the max. Additionally don't allow the save if the Order is already fully returned (otherwise they just create an unusable receive and get charged for it). Optionally, just from the desktop, on RunPreSaveValidation() when first saving the receive, we could auto fill all non returned products for the linked order.  Same logic applies when creating manually from Warehouse RF, the entered Receive reference, needs to be a valid Order Ref and do the same validation as when creating manually via desktop. Both if fully returned, and then for each unload of a product.    Update existing "WIN" STL Collector to ignore "RET" receives that have a parent Order.  Create a new STL Collector "WRT" that only collects "RET" receives with a Parent Order. BRS: Ensure product inform Finance of the new code when this is done!    BRS: Should we add a NoCheck constraint to ensure that any RET receives have a linked order?  MMC: Sounds good!    CKR 02-Dec-24 13:05 GMT+11:00:   We've got the approval from the Finance Team to move forward with this change (see email attached).    Following discussions with Brenton and Maciej:  1. We need to implement a mechanism to prevent customers from gaming the new feature by designating all their receives as RET to reduce costs.  2. BRS proposed allowing the creation of a RET receive only if it is linked to an existing order (even if from a different warehouse).  3. BRS also suggested implementing a validation rule to ensure that no more units can be returned than were originally released in the linked order. If this condition isn't met, the order cannot be saved.  4. In a future phase, we plan to introduce import capabilities for RET Receive types via CSV or UXML.    TG1 03-Sep-24 12:14 GMT+10:00:     Current Functionality : Existing STL 'WIN' includes both normal Receives and Returns so we can't distinguish    Desired Functionality: Create a new STL Collector to only look at 'RET' receive types    Additional information:    03/09/24: We want to be able to see the % of Returns across all clients to identify trends in usage  This will also allow us to potentially apply a different pricing if required (in agreement with Licensing and Sale Teams)    03/09   WIN, currently cant tell if its returns or receives  important to notify finance   add WRT code and update WIN to exclude returns   seat + transactional licensing = STL
product_candidate: New STL collector for Return type receives (RET)

WKI_Summary: Indonesia (ID) DocBuilder Macro Update to print NITKU code
details: PATCHING REQUIRED: This WI is a compliance requirement for issuing invoices in indonesia.    The NITKU of both the branch issuing an invoice and the Indonesia Business being invoiced must be included in the DocBuilder invoices along with the primary VAT registration details of both parties.      Background:   As part of tax transformation/ reformation in Indonesia, Indonesian tax office (DJP) introduced a new identification number for branch level taxpayers: 22-digit NITKU (The Identity Number of Place of Business Activities).   The NITKU number is required to be included as Tax Invoice XML for buyer and seller in Coretax (new tax system launched by DJP from Jan 2025).  To support this, we introduced new Org Reg Code ID NIT in HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/1195696a-ca6e-4e76-b182-3e1e512a8904?lang=en-gb" WI00861489 - Indonesia (ID) new branch level tax identification number - NITKU  Currently ID Login Companies uses ‘ID PPN’ to record a business’ NPWP Tax Registration Number. ID PPN for the login company and AR org are printed on DocBuilder invoice.    Reason for change:   We need to ensure DocBuilder invoice reflects the compliance identification numbers consistent with the Coretax eInvoice layout; we should also use this opportunity to align the Login Company TaxID macro with our common approach for other VAT enabled countries.    Change Required:  For Invoice issuing company:  • Update Login Company TaxID macro to Print Both ID PPN and ID NIT of Transaction Header Tax Branch / Branch org Proxy with label “NPWP #:  NITKU #:  “    For AR Org:  • Update RecipientLocalBusinessRegHeading and Number to Print ID NIT of Receivables Organisation as "Client NITKU #”  • Update RecipientTaxHeading as “Client NPWP #”    Note regarding Faktur Pajak document:   CW also has a legacy document template for ID - 'ARInvoice ID Faktur Pajak'. This Template is used in ID login companies to print a compliance document type "tax document" for AR (Receivable) Invoice transactions.  As of 2025, ID government is moving towarding e-Faktur process so tax invoices are issued using Coretax.   There is no specific government mandate to show NITKU to the Faktur Pajak document. Also as this is becoming an obsolete process, we decide not to add NITKU to the legacy 'ARInvoice ID Faktur Pajak' template.
product_candidate: Indonesia (ID) DocBuilder Macro Update to print NITKU code

WKI_Summary: RTD: Change WD_StartedReceiving to WD_StartedReceivingUtc
details: BRS 02-Oct-24 12:03 GMT+10:00:   FUNCTIONAL REVIEWER:  Test that:  Database upgrade worked  Regression test RF Unload process  Regression test the "Start Receiving" menu item in CW1 on a receive  Regression test that you can't set Hold Pallet ID Putaway after the receive has started receiving  Receives and receive lines show as "Not Started" before RF Unload has started, as "In-Progress" once RF Unload has started  Regression test the quantities (actual/expected/cancelled) before/after/during RF Unload for a receive in TM1    JW6 06-Sep-24 11:05 GMT+08:00:   Update schema to change WD_StartedReceiving to WD_StartedReceivingTimeUtc SMALLDATETIME NULL.    Write a Transformation to populate this new column, since we are renaming replacing a column, we should do this in the Pre Online Upgrade phase.   - Add a trigger on WD_StartedReceiving when updating and set WD_StartedReceivingTimeUtc to GETUTCDATE().   - Find Receives by WD_DocketType = 'INW' AND WD_StartedReceiving = 1, populate the column by finding the relevant creation time of ASNs and fallback to WD_ArrivalDate. (Maciej's original suggestion was to search StmAlog first, but I didn't see any related Event log been added after performing 'Start Receiving (Create ASN Lines)' on CW1, couldn't find it in HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Shared?path=%2FCargoWise.Definitions%2Fsrc%2FDefinitions%2FEvents%2FEventDefinitions.g.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster" EventDefinitions.g.cs either).    BRS: Maciej said that unloading an existing receive on RF will create some kind of event, I think we can possibly look for that. But checking create time on WhsASNLines is actually a good alternative to avoid StmALog.   - We should update by chunks to avoid full table scan, profile and see if a high water mark helps, maybe NR_RX__WD_DocketType_WD_SystemLastEditTimeUtc could help.    BRS: I think we should use GuidChunker with the PK and ranges of 1k docket PKs, it's the most proven approach for online transforms    BRS: We need to change parts of the user interface/logic (e.g. TM1 YAML) that use this field to use the new one too + publish a TAN about this field    See PopulateWhsPickFinalizedByColumn for example.

WKI_Summary: Support ProviderReferenceID to work as a PK in native XML
details: Done Statement  ====== WF4 - Coding =======  Add <ProviderReferenceID> tag as a property to <RateEntry> tag.  Add <ProviderReferenceID> tag as a property to <RateLine> tag.  The <ProviderReferenceID> tags act as the keys to search for RateEntries and RateLines. Note: they are not for RateLineItems.  ProviderReferenceID should NOT be a rate differentiator.  ProviderReferenceIDs of different RateEntries under the same RatingHeader must be different. They can be the same in different RatingHeaders.  ProviderReferenceIDs of different RateLines under the same RateEntry must be different. They can be the same in different RateEtries.  Maximum length of a ProviderReferenceID is 50 characters.    ====== WF4 - Coding UI =======  Show the new columns in RateEntry and RateLine grids.  Add RateEntry Provider Reference ID filter and RateLine Provider Reference ID filter to rate forms so that they can be applied to rates filter.    Reason For change(To explain Why)  ====== WF4 - Coding =======  Please read the background below. In short, UPS want to import their rates into CW using NativeXML import. The rates do not have PKs as ours do but UPS can generate the unique keys for each of RateEntries and RateLines.    What has been done (Technical Prespective)  ====== WF4 - Coding =======  Add TI_ProviderReferenceID column to RateEntry table in DB.  Add TL_ProviderReferenceID column to RateLine table in DB.  Modify EntityRepository: falls back to use ProviderReferenceID + ParentPK when there is no PK to find a db row for a RateEntry or RateLine entity. Since we don't require to have the IDs on RateLineItems, we decided to clear all ChildRateLineItems from a RateLine.  Modify RateInterceptor: With the change in EntityRepository: Ignore RateLineItem entities - by changing the action to IGNORE - when Parent RateLine entity action is DELETE, or when their action is DELETE. Force the action to be INSERT otherwise.    ====== WF4 - Coding UI =======  Add new RateEntry column to almost every EntryCollectionGUIInfo  Add ProviderReferenceID filter to Enterprise/Product/Operations/Rating/GUI/Base/RateEntryFilterStrip/RateEntryFilterProvider.cs  Add ProviderReferenceID filter to Enterprise/Product/Operations/Rating/GUI/Base/RateEntryFilterStrip/RateLineModuleFilters.cs  Refactor tests to hope that future changes don't need to modify many tests.      Background:  As part of investigation on cases raised by UPS on HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=3b36852e-208d-47c3-a56f-f6dbba3495b7&VersionNumber=24.9.12.124&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b2%2fh7%2fGY4lFAZjzHSby0J5LPSsDW%2fjrsw" CS01682302 - UPSSUPATL - Date issue on rate line entry, we understood that the current PKs available in CW, it is not something that can be used by our client during merge/update/delete as they don't have it on their side.  Therefore, there is an idea to add a column into a system which contains their RateID. this RateID to be used as a PK to find the record during XML import    So please investigate and create a POC of required changes to add a new column to rateentry and rateline, like TI_ProviderReferenceID and TL_ProviderReferenceID, 50 characters  TI_ProviderReferenceID should be unique per combination of header, rate type and company.  TL_ProviderReferenceID must be unique for its parent (for each rate entry)    if these fields are provided in the XML, then these fields will behave as PK and meaning that the matching record to be found by that key  please investigate and share what changes is required to be done to achieve this  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  AZR 15-Oct-24 11:02 GMT+11:00: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=de9024c2-42bf-47cb-a308-ee05f9a19acb&VersionNumber=24.10.15.42&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bKqDIrsUGHAzZbYAbldmcylCv2SAT5b25" WI00786544 - PK to be considered in Rate XML Import will be handled here  PAI 04-Oct-24 01:25 GMT+10:00:   Detailed Design:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Shared/pullrequest/276930  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/276932      AZR 12-Sep-24 13:53 GMT+10:00: My discussion with UPS  In regards to adding your Rate ID to be used as a PK, we are discussing internally if we can provide such a functionality. However, I'd like to confirm that you are able to provide such a ID to us. This ID must be unique per combination of header, rate type and company. I guess this ID must also be provided for RateLines as well. for RateLines's ID it should be unique at least per RateEntry. I need to ensure that you can provide such a unique ID to us and you will use it when Merging, Deleting and Updating.    Reply from UPS: Agreee if we have somewhere to put it ( a new element on input xml) and new field on grid, then Ok we agree this should be unique . Searchable in the grid but not editable by user on UI. This would have to be a rather large alphanumeric identifier, at least 50 characters.
product_candidate: Support ProviderReferenceID to work as a PK in native XML

details: AD4 14-Jan-25 17:31 GMT+11:00:   Update Note -     Multiple clients can have same basic endpoint.  CreateClient Api - creating 2 or more cleints with same endpoint does not throw an error. WKI_Summary: CT Status to be included in FHL messages for exports from IT
details: AFE 27-Dec-24 14:41 GMT+08:00:   For shipment, Entry numbers with MRN type are retrieved by GetMovementReferenceNumbers -> CreateMovementReferenceNumber -> GetAllMovementReferenceNumbersWithoutLeadingTypeCode in ShipmentExportAWBHeader.cs    In FHL, MRNs are populated by ConstructMessage -> AddOtherCustomsInformation -> AddOCIForMRNs in FHL.cs    Now we need to include CT status for air shipments from Italy right after the MRN, the following changes should be applied:    1. In IAWBMovementReferenceNumberMessageDetailsProvider.cs and MovementReferenceNumber.cs, add a new property CommunityTransitStatusCode  2. In ShipmentExportAWBHeader.CreateMovementReferenceNumber, set the CommunityTransitStatusCode to current shipment's JS_CommunityTransitStatus https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FExportAWB%2FExportAWBHeader%2FShipmentExportAWBHeader.cs&version=GBmaster&line=2397&lineEnd=2400&lineStartColumn=4&lineEndColumn=53&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  3. In FBase.AddOCIForMRNs, populate the CT Status after the MBN https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FAWB%2FBusiness%2FMessaging%2FFBase.cs&version=GBmaster&line=585&lineEnd=585&lineStartColumn=6&lineEndColumn=134&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    Requirement: Italian Customs Regulations mandate the electronic submission of MRN and its associated Customs Status for all shipments, ensuring proper tracking and handling. Failure to include the required data in FHL messages may result in shipment delays, penalties, or non-compliance with Customs Authorities at Milan MXP.    Done statement: CT Status to be included in FHL messages for exports from IT    Cargo Start technical guide: https://docs.cargostart.net/startcity/phases/l2/examples/
product_candidate: CT Status to be included in FHL messages for exports from IT

WKI_Summary: CCSUK (temporary storage) pre- vs post-arrivals
details: CKG 03-Apr-25 10:36 GMT+01:00:     Tech Design:    1, The field we need to add the validation to is bound to CM_FlightNo, therefore we need to add our logic to the CheckCM_FlightNo method in C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\GB\Core\Ccsuk\AirCargoInventory\BusinessObjects\CusMAWB\CusMAWBValidation.cs  So if the profile is agent (We can use Parent.IsProfileAndAgent), then do not show the MandatoryValidation.    2.  I don't think we need to do anything here as the message error will still be shown.    3.  We need to change the error message shown, so will have to replace the Mandatory Validation, with something like    if (Parent..CMFlightNo.IsEmpty)  {      Parent.CM_FlightNoInfo.AddMessageError("A flight number is mandatory for an ETSF record.  Supply a flight number or create an agent pre-arrival record using your agent, not ETSF, profile.");  }    4.  Change the logic in the SendToCommunity message in C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\GB\Core\Ccsuk\AirCargoInventory\Messaging\CcsukInventoryMessageManager.cs    To something like this...    internal bool SendToCommunity()  {   var reasonsWeCantSend = new StringCollection();   var warningsAboutSending = new StringCollection();     var awb = (CusMAWB)bizO;     if (awb != null && awb.IsProfileAShed && awb.CM_FlightNo.IsEmpty && (how.MessageSubType == CcsukTransmissionMessageFunction.CUSCAR.FRC.Subcode || how.MessageSubType == CcsukTransmissionMessageFunction.CUSCAR.FRI.Subcode))   {    reasonsWeCantSend.Add("It is not permitted to send this message using your ETSF profile when the bill lacks a flight number.  This sending will be aborted. \r\nSupply a flight number and re-try the sending, or if you do not have the flight number you may consider using your agent profile to create a pre-arrival record. \r\nIn doing the latter, it should be remembered that agent pre-arrival records are expunged (archived) if not arrived within 4 days.");   }     SendMessage(sendMessagesToCustoms,    reasonsWeCantSend,    warningsAboutSending,    new MessageBuilderDelegate[] { GetMessageBuilder }, how.MessageType + how.MessageSubType, CancellationTokenSource.Token);   return reasonsWeCantSend.Count == 0 && warningsAboutSending.Count == 0;  }      DJC 27-Mar-25 15:10 GMT+00:00:  Please see very long winded discussion in the attached.   We must change our CCSUK module's validation.   But as the incident shows, users ignore validation, so we need a hard block on sending too (without using red validation).     HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=eba86973-e70f-48a5-944a-2a9c9ac96424&StorageDocPK=4df8e662-6a13-4188-9489-54d7df8b5bf3&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bVnDEHc81nW%2brmggFUE1BHTCQpMcb8ZU9" DJC 27-Mar-25 15:12:  File d12516787908418caeacd7afa5dd73ef.bmp (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.      1. When the profile is an agent profile (2), do not show this blue validation on the flight number (1) when the flight number is missing.      2. Continue to show this blue validation when the profile is an ETSF (shed) profile and the flight number is missing.     3. Change the wording of this existing blue validation. It shoudl say "A flight number is mandatory for an ETSF record.  Supply a flight number or create an agent pre-arrival record using your agent, not ETSF, profile. "    4. If the user ignores this blue validation, and tries to send an FRI (create) or FRC (amend) message, block that messaging action.  You can achieve that by CcsukInventoryMessageManager.changing SendToCommunity() to add a piece of feedback to the reasonsWeCantSend collection.   Do so only if the AWB is a shed, the flight number is empty, and the message sub type is FRI/FRC; the result is something like this: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=eba86973-e70f-48a5-944a-2a9c9ac96424&StorageDocPK=0c73710e-63a4-4d19-9139-de637444dfaf&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bK%2fedTwPh0VtvqBzJY2M5adC60hqdpV49" DJC 27-Mar-25 15:29:  File 15d599e374d14c8596c4610a9f84941d.bmp (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.  Wording is "It is not permitted to send this message using your ETSF profile when the bill lacksa flight number.  This sending will be aborted.   Supply a flight number and re-try the sending, or if you do not have the flight number you may consider using your agent profile to create a pre-arrival record.   In doing the latter, it should be remembered that agent pre-arrival records are expunged (archived) if not arrived within 4 days."    Tips:    LicenceAndPimaHelper.IsFullShed(CusAwb)   how.MessageSubType == CcsukTransmissionMessageFunction.CUSCAR.FRC.Subcode  or CcsukTransmissionMessageFunction.CUSCAR.FRI.Subcode   CM_FlightNo      Desired effect:  Intermediate effects   Agents don't see blue validation when the flight number is missing   Sheds do see such blue validation   Sheds (if they ignore the blue validation) cannot send FRI/FRC messages without a flight number   Sheds can send all other messages without a flight number  Further effects:   Sheds dont' accidentlayy create a post-arrival record on CCSUK even though CW1 thinks it's a pre-arrival  Ultiumate effect:   CW1 and CCSUK both agree that a record is or is not a pre-arrival, and so we agree on whether to purge that data after 4 days.
feature_description: vs post-arrivals

May be better to set at the same places we set EM_ECC_CommunicationPartyConfig like https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FServices%2FServiceHost%2FHttpXmlServices%2FRequestProcessors%2FeAdaptorRequestProcessor.cs&version=GBmaster&line=56&lineEnd=59&lineStartColumn=10&lineEndColumn=11&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  -Need to ensure we also set EM_TransportType after HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=768097d3-a698-406e-a7d3-4bfecc57d78e&VersionNumber=25.1.14.50&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bSlP3zw888Z7wzcOdwFC2OnWT3A2jMwgx" WI00837367 - [EAD] Accept Individual EDI Message Types in eAdaptorNext Async    HSP 28-Jan-25 15:05 GMT+11:00:   - Instead of setting it directly we will populate the new field when adding a new EDI message to an EDIInterchangeEDIMessageCollection, with the transport type value from the interchange, making the assumption that EI_TransportType will be populated before we go to create and add a message to the collection  - This covers the cases of SOAP and eAdaptorNext/Async, exporting xml via trigger actions (as this also calls EServicesDelivery.BuildEServicesMessage), and the work item above to import xml without a <UniversalInterchange> tag (since this is implemented by first creating an interchange, adding a message to the collection, and deleting it before we save), and a couple other places we set the transport type  - For eAdaptor http / xml where there is no interchange we just need to populate the request and response messages in eAdaptorRequestProcessor with the eAdaptor transport type  - There is code from other teams that populates an interchange for a group of EDI messages, e.g: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FCustoms%2FAR%2FManifest%2FBusiness%2FMessage%2FMessageProcessors%2FARInterchangeProvider.cs&version=GBmaster&line=46&lineEnd=47&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=1&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  For these just need to go through and populate the new field on each of the messages with the transport type from the interchange, can find all of the cases by searching for the places where EI_TransportType is set    J30 25-Feb-25 17:50 GMT+11:00: For those EDI Messages with Interchange, instead of set EM_TransportType everywhere, just set it when Interchange save    ADP 05-Mar-25 11:33 GMT+11:00:   Discuss with Jack:    Testing:   eAdaptor   /sync (Test#1)   /async with Interchange (SOAP) (Test#2)    eAdaptorNext    /sync (Test#3) UNiversal each type and Native   /async    Direct message (Test#4) Universal And Native XML (a unique Universal XML not wrapped in in Interchange)    Messages wrapped in Interchange (Test#5) Universal XML and Native XML    Notes:  [Regression] Transport type is popularted with EAD for Interchange record  [New] Transport type is popualted with EAD fro the Message record    (Test#6) +Search Filter within the EDI message module.     (Test #7) Manual Import (eAdaptor) with Native XML ==> Transportt type = EAD  (Test #8) Manual Import (eAdaptor) with Universal  XML ==> Transportt type = EAD  (Test #9) Add Inbound function with Native XML ==> Transport type = Empty   (Test #10) Add Inbound function with Universal XML ==> Transportt type = EAD

WKI_Summary: [DOS] Use the Print Job's branch for date and time of digital signature
details: [Internal Only]  hi Jason.  DOS service task has a setting of CanRunInAnyBranch, which is a recommended setting. When this setting is active "the oldest active branch is chosen for the initial user context for the service task".   Currently, the service task just uses ZDateTime.Now, which falls back to current branch whatever it is.  We have following options to control the branch:  1. make this service task branch-specific (not recommended)   2. set context to the current branch on the invoice (SP_GB)  3. have a registry item with an override branch for all invoices. This can be per branch/company potentially    #2 looks best but need to check SP_GB on all those invoices Cushla has.    JSF 14-Apr-25 16:25 GMT+02:00: We decided to go with option 2.      A.G 15-Apr-25 07:57 GMT+10:00:   Tech Design  in DOS service task, we already fetch branches and go branch by branch. This makes it easy to set context for branch for multiple grouped print jobs.  Once branches are loaded, set temporary user context in a loop for SP_GB in a using, then proceed with all the processing normally.  When next branch is taken in the loop, switch context to that branch.
product_candidate: [DOS] Use the Print Job's branch for date and time of digital signature

WKI_Summary: DRY ICE REQUIREMENTS - MAWB
details: MN8 28-Aug-25 11:43 GMT+10:00:   Done Statement  Further to https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=8291872c-5914-4f91-938e-003e7bb73736 . For dangerous goods air , containing Carbon Dioxide, Solid (Dry Ice), UN 1845, the following information must be included in the "Nature of Goods" section of the air waybill:   UN 1845,  Proper Shipping Name (Dry Ice or Carbon Dioxide, Solid),   Class 9,   Number of Packages,   Net Quantity of Dry Ice in each package    Reason for the change   As per IATA TACT  and 49CFR there is an additional  "Class 9", decription Dry Ice or Carbon Dioxide, Solid
feature_description: MAWB

WKI_Summary: Bulk delivery feature for CCSUK
details: CKG 21-Aug-25 08:50 GMT+01:00:     Tech Design:    Note - I created this tech design to be fairly detailed.  Try using CoPilot to create the code for you. (Obviously still use TDD so tests first)      1.  Add registry setting to C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\CargoWise\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\GB\Core\Registry\Business\GBCustomsDataRegistry.cs  Ensure the registry setting is System scoped and is called "Allow bulk delivery at MAWB level".  The Category should be CCSUK and the default should be true    2. Add menu in C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\CargoWise\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\GB\Core\GUI\CCSUK\CcsukAirInventory\CcsukMenu.cs    Menu Caption : ''Mark all houses' released pieces as delivered"  Visibility: Only when  it is a master bill AND when the registry setting added in point 1 is true AND MAWB status = 1 AND PresenceOnNetworkStatus is NOT NO or DEL ANd the profile is a shed profile.  See MaybeAddCheckinAllPiecesMenu    3. When clicking the menu we need to look at all the OutTurns for the MAWB.    For each OutTurn   IF outTurn.IsReleasedAlready AND outTurn.IsDelivered = false    outTurn.IsDelivered = true   ELSE IF outTurn.ISReleasedAlready = false OR outTurn.IsDelivered = true    Keep track of the House number (C5_HouseBill) and any split number against the outturn (SplitReferenceToWhichThisPertains)  END    Now ensure the MAWB's Factory HasChanges is set to true (Do not perform a save at this point).    For any OutTurns which have not been delivered or are not released yet, then show a popup in the format     "The following houses had packages that are not yet released or are already delivered, and so have not been marked as delivered:   {0}"  where {0} is a CRLF-separated list of house+split numbers    If all OutTurns are successfully set to delivered, show a popup confirming this.  Wording is "Bulk marking of delivered is complete. {0} receipt rows over {1} house bills were marked as delivered."  Where 0 is the count of affected outturns, and 1 is the count of affected houses.       4. We need to add some columns in C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\CargoWise\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\GB\Core\GUI\CCSUK\CcsukAirInventory\CcsukMainMasterUserControlHelpers.cs      First we need to add some GenAddOnColumns to CusHAWB, these should be readonly(No Setter) and each have a partner method to set the property.  These new GenAddOnColumn should be as follows    "Are all pieces released" - When setting IsReleasedAlready to true on the OutTurn, if all the other OutTurns on the CUSHAWB has IsReleasedAlready  = true then set our new GenAddOnColumn to be true also.  "Are all pieces delivered" - When setting IsDeliveredto true on the OutTurn, if all the other OutTurns on the CUSHAWB has IsDelivered= true then set our new GenAddOnColumn to be true also.    Columns should be added to the ChildrenGrid, they are as follows    "All pieces are released" - This should be a ZCheckBoxColumnTypeInfo column and be bound to the new "Are all pieces released"  GenAddOnColumn we added previously  "All pieces are delivered" - This should be a ZCheckBoxColumnTypeInfo column and be bound to the new "Are all pieces delivered"  GenAddOnColumn we added previously    Clients may have 1000+ CusHAWB's so please consider performance when implementing this    DJC 18-Jul-25 09:02 GMT+01:00:  Similar to how we implemented the bulk checkin (receipt) feature, now please implement a bulk "deliver" feature.  Add columns to various grids to indicate that a bill has had all its packages released, and another for all its package delivered.         TODO.   1. Add a new registry, system scoped, bool, default true, named "Allow bulk delivery at MAWB level".  Category is the CCSUK part of the GB registry.     2. Add a new option to a master bill's CCSUK menu, very similar to the bulk checkin menu added in HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/b71149ec-1486-405a-99a1-de60869a222f?lang=en-gb" WI00354063 - Option to Bulk check in at mawb level, to mark all the master's house relevant bills' outturns as delivered.   Caption is "Mark all houses' released pieces as delivered".   Show the menu only when the bill is a master bill (not a house, not a basic), and when the above registry is enabled, and if the MAWB has status 1, and the presence is not NO and not DEL, and the profile is a shed profile. The status 1 check is the most expensive, so evaluate that last.     3. Handle clicking of the menu.   When clicked, find all the outturns on all the houses on the master.  If the outturn is "released already?" = true*, and "delivered?" = false, then set "delivered?" = true.   If the house has any outturn which is not released, keep track of the house number and any split number against the outturn (we will show those in a popup later).   *Note, "released already?" not "release now"  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=909f9436-52d1-4c6e-97ea-d0b3048d7e87&StorageDocPK=d9892af4-3b2a-4a91-8270-f3d2e8bf3dcf&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b9ACsXqQXcuhk7Z%2fN5FCnkuSHaNEQlXg6" DJC 18-Jul-25 09:12:  File c528fcdd414d457f93230b19b80f0b6e.jpg (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.  When all houses' outturns have been considered, ensure that the master's factory is set to HasChanges = true, but don't perform any save.  The user will save.   If there are any houses with an outturn that can't be delivered (it's not yet released, or already delivered), show a popup warning the user.  Wording is "The following houses had packages that are not yet released or are already delivered, and so have not been marked as delivered:   {0}"  where {0} is a CRLF-separated list of house+split numbers.   If all records are successfully set to delivered, show a popup confirming this.  Wording is "Bulk marking of delivered is complete. {0} receipt rows over {1} house bills were marked as delivered."  Where 0 is the count of affected outturns, and 1 is the count of affected houses.     Desired effect: we can quickly mark a thousand houses as having been delivered in one fell swoop, if we dispatch them fro the ETSF on a master level       4.  Add new columns to the grid of house bills under a master:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=909f9436-52d1-4c6e-97ea-d0b3048d7e87&StorageDocPK=03919ad2-56d4-4119-a53f-c2822b89fb0c&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bxjhtQ382LTAqTKZh2C6TmDKm0YAL4SjW" DJC 18-Jul-25 09:47:  File 6bc054a3823a4e37be7f60508d85b16d.jpg (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.  One is "All pieces are released" (bool)  Another is "All pieces are delivered" (bool).   Be aware that the customer asking for this has master bills of 1000+ houses.  It might be worthwhile to record the state of the job in a persistent field, rather than having  to recalculate it from all the outturns on the fly.   Assuming we take that approach add  new GenAddOnColumn fields to CusHAWB,  readonly (no setter), each with a partner method to set the property.   When setting CusOUtTurn.IsReleasedAlready to true, if all other outturns on the house are also released, then set this new "Are all pieces released" member to true via the method.   When setting CusOUtTurn.IsDelivered, if all other outturns on the house are also delivered, then set this new "Are all pieces delivered" member to true via the method.   Use linq to check that they're all ticked, which will give the optimum performance.   It's likley that each house as a small number of outturns, but liekly that there are a huge number of outturns per master (over many houses).     Desired effect: looking at the mawb form, we can see in the grid of columns quickly whcih houses are not released and which are not delivered, for remedial action

WKI_Summary: [EAD] Targeting a Branch for Universal Shipment using Recipient Role Org address
details: ADP 23-Jul-25 17:19 GMT+10:00:   When importing a Universal Shipment, there are a series of fallbacks to select the Branch that is used when processing the XML content.  This serie of fallbacks are described in the eAdaptor Developer Guide (5.1.5.2 – Targeting a Branch)   For E2E there is only one option before final default scenario. This option though, is limited to the use of a mapping between ‘Recipients Role’ with ‘Matching Ports’.     So, E2E users do not have a solution to match the ’Recipient‘ OrganizationAddress to a Branch Org Proxy. That is why, we are now introducing a new fallback option to solve this problem.    XC 28-Jul-25 16:01 GMT+10:00:   all the recent CR6 requesting this are in related items  in addition to the HLD doc  a simple flow to demonstrate the added logic is in eDoc    J30 19-Aug-25 16:20 GMT+10:00:   Steps:   1 Find Recipient Role's mapped organization address  2 Find the branch by organization address. (The logic is the same as the logic in option2 and option3. But we need add addtional ports checking logic which is in the document, but missed in the code before )  spike code:  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/pull/9659    J30 27-Aug-25 16:57 GMT+10:00:   As confirmed with Prod team, no need return the first branch when multiple branchs found:  when there are multiple branchs found or no branch found through home port, go to check addtional port;   when there are multiple branchs found or no branch found through addtional ports, go to next option;      J30 16-Oct-25 15:11 GMT+11:00:   As discussed with Christina, revise the sequence as below:    1.    Match using the Branch.Code element from the Universal Shipment  2.    Match the ’Recipient‘ OrganizationAddress to a Branch Org Proxy (If muliple branches found in the Org Proxy, use home port to filter )  3     Match the Recipient Role's mapped organization address  to a Branch Org Proxy (If muliple branches found in the Org Proxy, use home port to filter )  4.    Match the ’Recipient‘ OrganizationAddress Port to a Branch Port/Additional Related Port  5.    Match the Recipient Role's mapped organization address Port to a Branch Port/Additional Related Port  6.    Match using a Recipient Role and Port Code Match  7.    Default to the first branch of the target Company
product_candidate: [EAD] Targeting a Branch for Universal Shipment using Recipient Role Org address

WKI_Summary: [QTN][OOQ] Migration of E-mail Acceptance to NEO
details: Done Statement  Supporting Quotation Acceptance in NEO by Client via Email      Reason For change(To explain Why)  E-mail acceptance of One Off Quote or Quotation have leveraged WebTracker platform which to be retired and to be replaced by NEO that both of the e-mail acceptance functionalities need to be migrated to NEO.    Relevant eLearning:  https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=b8cb9adf-4b36-4531-bc0f-603011f66c47  https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=12632120-a0ce-44d3-8244-1d9d229ed0be    ODL 30-Apr-25 11:25 GMT+10:00: According to Sarah, this needs to be in DPR by June. I'm guessing this means ... 11th of June?      What has been done (Technical Prespective)  I kept the existing logic to go through the WebTracker as is still working and hasn't retired yet.   But when WebTracker is retired and clients moved on using NEO instead, the new hyperlink will be generated for NEO instead of WebTracker.  Then in this way we don't need to make any change in the email/document we generate currently.    GIVEN   Neo Hyperlinks is enabled => GlowRegistry.Instance.NeoEnableHyperlinksInDocumentMacros is true   Neo is enabled => LicenceFeatureCodeList.Codes.NeoFeature in Feature Control Manager  THEN   System will create NEO url based on the provided Alias and Glow Portals Root Url & the Business Object PK    I added the new CW1 Web Api to execute the logic of receiveing reply from the client and then send a notification email.  This Api will be called from a Coded Form Flow in Glow  And the Coded Form Flow is used in 2 separate Form Flows  Form Flow with alias "TrackingQuoteClientReplyAccept" to Accept the quote  Form Flow with alias "TrackingQuoteClientReplyNotAccept" for Request Further Discussion      PAI 05-Jun-25 11:38 GMT+10:00:   Functional Review Document:  In this WI we support Client Quotation Acceptance via email through NEO.  The exisitng logic in WebTracker is still working till the WebTracker is officially retiered.    Client is still receiving the same email/document and they can see 2 hyperlinks in it. But the link is pointing to Neo instead of WebTracker.    The new proposed hyperlink to NEO would look like the below  To Accept:  https://GlowPortal/goto/TrackingQuoteClientReplyAccept?entityPK={quotePK}  To Request Further Discussion:  https://GlowPortal/goto/TrackingQuoteClientReplyNotAccept?entityPK={quotePK}    For the hyperlinks to Neo the following registry item has to be enabled (the registry is disabled by default)  Glow > Neo > Enable Neo Hyperlinks in Document and Report Macros    The same logic will be run in the backround and user will be notified by email that the client clicked either of the links.
feature_description: mail Acceptance to NEO

WKI_Summary: Addition of Original Invoice Details to e-Invoice XML for Return of Purchase Inv
details: A25 03-Mar-25 13:11 GMT+03:00:    The Turkish Revenue Administration has introduced some changes to the e-invoice rules, one of which requires adding the original invoice details for the return of purchase invoices.  When posting a return of a purchase invoice, certain information from the original sales invoice must be included in the XML; otherwise, an error will occur. This enhancement will take effect on March 28, 2025.    According to the Schematron file, when the invoice type is TEVKIFATIADE or IADE, the cac:BillingReference field must be included in the XML. Additionally, it should contain cac:InvoiceDocumentReference/cbc:DocumentTypeCode = IADE to comply with the requirements.      PR:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/318485    DFR:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=170ec856-1ac4-4920-972c-1e17698ebe50&StorageDocPK=d3580b73-8429-4b4f-8082-2c4b5758062c&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2boV3atxCO81QleE6qNeXgTM0FUsgmByoD" BD 13-Mar-25 17:26:  File WI00877197 - Developer Functional Review.docx (Internal Correspondence)
product_candidate: Addition of Original Invoice Details to e
feature_description: Invoice XML for Return of Purchase Inv

WKI_Summary: Shape notes are copied in NCN Universal Copy
details: JR7 03-Apr-25 11:08 GMT+11:00:   HLD: HYPERLINK "https://wisetechglobal-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/p/jon_reilly/Ee8CvuUD0oBEv6TetkzH2wIBqRJKn5JRS3w7Bzak-OhClg?e=f3eISb" HLD.docx    KNB 15-Apr-25 11:46 GMT+10:00:   Let's proceed with Option 2 as recommended. If the technical design of the system does not support Option 2, then use Option 1.    JR7 02-May-25 11:32 GMT+10:00:   DBD: HYPERLINK "https://wisetechglobal-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/p/jon_reilly/EXHOB-uPNuBAnzodS0m45yMBhmaKdIquggTTIEDtY6vMJw?e=wgHxcB" DBD.docx    JR7 09-May-25 16:16 GMT+10:00:   The HLD originally only specified that we would enable "shape notes" as a property on UC template. However, since we created the technical design we discovered that there are a lot of other properties that should show up in the UC template for NCN shapes that do not! It is very easy technically to enable these all as properties, so I have expanded the scope of this WI to do that.  The other properties that we now have include:  Is Positioned  Left (distance shape is from left of diagram)  Top (distance shape is from top of diagram)  Width  Height  Z Index (The 'layer' the shape is in -defines which shapes it is behind/in front of)  Scroll Position  Background Color  Foreground Colour  Corner radius  Job Name  Shape Notes  Is Read Only  Is Pinned  Active  Display Completeness Indicator  Should Syncronise Schedule With Linked Entity  Buffer Type  Is Non Schedules  Shape Inspector Visible    I see no harm in adding all of these since if the user does not need one, they can simply not use it! Furthermore, I assume most users will not be creating their own copy templates but rather use existing published ones that we create and maintain
product_candidate: Shape notes are copied in NCN Universal Copy

WKI_Summary: [TKN] Extend 'Security Override' form to handle OIDC flow
details: see eDocs and HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=f8b9797a-6afb-4413-8650-61354d9a823d&VersionNumber=24.11.6.64&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b55u1DlLl2ZEeJJM7G6s9wPUXL96UCn3J" CS01761832 - MOREXPTPE1 - Token-based Authentication (message in eConvo 1 Nov and 6 Nov).    "Hi Thomas,    We're going to have to make an enhancement to CW1 to cater for this approval process on the 'Security Override' screen you shared if the approver is a different person.    In the meantime, there are other ways to handle this which are:  1. Give the operator permissions to approve the requests themselves, or  2. Have the operator hit the Approval Request button and their manager/supervisor can approve the requests using the respective approval module.    I will create a new WI to add the enhancement to CW1 to cater for the OIDC/token-auth flow directly from this 'Security Override' form if OIDC has been enabled. This is likely to only be available in CW1 in the coming months though.  If the above suggestions work for you, then you can proceed with enabling OIDC for CW1. If not, I'm afraid you will have to wait for the change to work its way through the release rings."    JSF 11-Nov-24 12:15 GMT+02:00:   In this WI we need to change the current behaviour when the security override pop-up screen is presented and OIDC is enabled for that customer.  I think we need to have a new button on the form that is only displayed when OIDC is enabled, and clicking the button will direct the user to their IdP to authenticate. We should probably also hide the username and password fields because these will no longer work when OIDC is enabled and the customer has enabled the token-based WCA client.  Perhaps the username and password section can be replaced with a new button with a label like "Approval request via your identity server" etc.  Upon successful authentication of the user against the customer's identity server, we'll need to crosscheck that the user who approved the request is actually authorised to do so in the CW1 security settings.  If the user that authenticated successfully against the customer's IdP is not actually allowed to approved these requests, the process must fail with an appropriate error message.  If the user that authenticated successfully against the customer's IdP is allowed to approved these requests, then we should continue the process as is currently working already.  We will need to amend the current documentation about security overrides to show this new flow if OIDC is enabled.      JZ3 15-Nov-24 13:52 GMT+11:00:   HLD > HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=1a543bec-bb33-4206-a02e-c52ece67d29c&StorageDocPK=583d64b9-152e-499d-993a-2635382c2e08&Hash=%2b%2ftTy56UbYPSgesSlGAiGwUxFCFT84Z3L&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" JZ3 15-Nov-24 13:51: File WI00826867_High Level Design.docx (High Level Design)   Workflow diagram > HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=1a543bec-bb33-4206-a02e-c52ece67d29c&StorageDocPK=7eec0e6e-4833-4015-be65-b8bd078f6e82&Hash=%2bh4hl0rI6LsZnf8%2bQOcdJ1CkxaLGU5niO&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" JZ3 15-Nov-24 13:59: File Credit_Apporval_Auth_Flow.pdf (Attachment)      JWU 25-Nov-24 18:19 GMT+08:00:  It's not secure for approver to type the credentials on other's browser, for instance, chrome would cache the login credentials. And someone could log in to CW1 as the approver next time. Could the approver approve the request when they log in CW1?      JZ3 19-Dec-24 10:44 GMT+11:00:   There are still functions that do not go through the queuing of approval request process and must rely on the spot authorization. So, we cannot deprecate this approval method.I did some research and seemed the standard OIDC process will limit our solution due to the user interaction requirement in the most used OIDC auth flow. Here's what I found and I am leanings towards option 4 as a quick win and in the future explore more with option 3.    1. The Code Grant and Implicit flow requires user credential being entered via user-agent, such as a browser. These grant types have security risks called out by Jeff above and is not suitable to address our problem.     2. The Resource Owner Password Grant (ROPG) in OIDC fits what we need, as it is uses the IDP username and password (not Cargowise password) and sends this information to the IDP in exchange for an access token. Most IDP advise on using this approach with caution, and there should be a high degree of trust between the user and the application (CargoWise). Each IDP use different approach to setup this grant and may or may not allow more than one grant type for an application. i.e. Code and ROPG to coexist.  Azure       > https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity-platform/v2-oauth-ropc/  Okta         > https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/implement-grant-type/ropassword/main/  OneLogin > https://developers.onelogin.com/openid-connect/api/password-grant#:~:text=Use%20this%20API%20to%20authenticate%20a%20given%20user%E2%80%99s,token%20generated%20via%20the%20OAuth%202.0%20Tokens%20API.    3. Go passwordless. Most IDP supports OTP via app. Other option is to leverage OTP like SMS but there could be a separate cost and possesses logistic headache with multiple telecom carriers worldwide.  Azure       > https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory-b2c/sign-in-options  > https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/authentication/howto-authentication-passwordless-phone  Okta         > HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=1a543bec-bb33-4206-a02e-c52ece67d29c&StorageDocPK=6fe0ec25-10d4-4c57-a9e5-75b3d87fd787&Hash=%2bqolOkYy%2bxnLziUxqPkLO%2f2poCTeNSF0H&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" JZ3 19-Dec-24 12:59:  File Whitepaper-How-to-Go-Passwordless-with-Okta.pdf (Attachment)  OneLogin > https://www.onelogin.com/blog/from-friction-to-freedom-automating-passwordless-authentication    4. Setup an approval password. Not an ODIC approach but like the generate SQL password function available to user with SQL reader role in CargoWise, this allows the user with security clearance for authorizing approval request to setup a password and use it when authorizing on the spot. This is the less complex option, handles the verification within CargoWise and we do not need to worry about the downstream impacts. We can use this approach to replace what we have currently regardless how user logs into CargoWise.    NCC 19-Dec-24 15:54 GMT+11:00:   - Solution 2 and 3 seems to not work with federation and MFA, at least when using Azure B2C, so that would rule out all of our hosted customers.  - Solution 4 is basicaly bypassing the IdP and have a password, without MFA. That might not satisfy the security requirement. The password can easily be shared.  - Maybe we can do something that looks closer to device flow, with the approver doing a sign in on their phone, assuming it is under their company policy. Or use a TOTP that would be generated by the approver?    JZ3 19-Dec-24 18:56 GMT+11:00:   Thanks for the feedback. TOTP from approver is an interesting idea.  I didn't include the device flow becuase the approval is done on the machine which is logged in by the user who initiated the request, we need to alter the approval process and use the approver's machine to perform the approval  I found this article, option 3 works with email for B2C but need to be done in custom policy, but unsure if work with federation > https://github.com/azure-ad-b2c/samples/blob/master/policies/passwordless-email/Readme.md? Others require thrid party app which is a constraint.  I have setup a meeting a disucsss this in more detail      JWU 20-Dec-24 15:48 GMT+08:00:   What about creating a dedicate account in IdP, which requires MFA everytime login?      JSF 15-Jan-25 15:37 GMT+02:00:   Option 1 > is probably not much less secure than typing in the password because a user could have a keylogging application installed to capture the keystrokes. They could also look over the shoulder of the manager while they punch in the password. We could look at having slightly different behaviour for this specific process flow which doesn't dump a refresh token onto the local machine for use later, or store any token locally. This needs technical input to assess feasability. If an employee is going to reuse their managers credentials deliberately, that's clearly fraud. I'd be very surprised if any employee would actually do this. What we want to ensure is that there is no way to do this accidentally or without the user knowing. If we cannot guarantee this behaviour by CW1 when OIDC in enabled then we need another approach. We don't want users getting fired for fraud when they didn't do it intentionally.  Option 3 > Is there a reason we could not use TOTPs in the federated IdPs mobile app used for MFA instead of SMSs? Customers that have enabled OIDC will all have MFA enabled via their IdPs mobile app.  Option 4 > Is this the new, dedicated role in the Staff module that has a static password? Similar to what we've done for hand-held devices?  Option 5 > Change user behaviour to use the approvals module and ditch the on-the-spot approval. Needs product input from other teams.  Option 6 > What about Option 1 but with a forced logout (or login as new user action) of CW1 after successful approval. The manager approves the request using the OIDC flow and after successful authentication, the job is saved and CW1 restarts, or invokes the existing "log in as new user" process. The user then needs to re-authenticate, overwriting the managers tokens. The login as new user wipes the tokens as far as I know, or at least the refresh token. Something to investigate.    What else did we discuss in the meeting?      JZ3 26-Feb-25 18:30 GMT+11:00:     WTG relies on the STL pricing model, which involves a license fee on active user accounts plus transaction fee on operation performed. Have reach out to Leith McDonald for insights      JZ3 21-Mar-25 12:53 GMT+11:00:     We have decided to proceed with Option 2. HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=1a543bec-bb33-4206-a02e-c52ece67d29c&StorageDocPK=8caf1197-7bdb-4054-ad44-6aaff24590df&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bAbG4pVtPdXwr4Rn5jGihbdgfLZ3ZfBaB" JZ3 21-Mar-25 13:03:  File WI00826867_High Level Design_v7.docx (High Level Design)    The functionality to generate this token should be grouped with other token generation features in the CargoWise help menu.     There will be a new CW registry item, which specifies the duration for which the access token remains valid. Customers have the flexibility to override this value according to their preference, with the value adjustable between 10 to 30 minutes. The minimum allowable time and the default is 10 minutes, and the maximum allowable time must be 30 minutes. A validation message must be shown if a user tries to exceed the minimum and maximum allowable values.    The new CargoWise registry item should be located under System > OpenID Connect   Registry title is "Set Security Override Authorization Token Expiry Time"   Registry hint is "This value specifies the expiration time of the security override authorization token after it is generated by CargoWise. Updating this value will adjust authorization token’s validity period.”    An approving users should possess the security right in CargoWise to generate the authorization token. This is managed through the security setting located at Manage > Receivables > On Credit Hold Controller. Please refer to screenshot HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=1a543bec-bb33-4206-a02e-c52ece67d29c&StorageDocPK=87649024-b656-4a2b-90b6-6417fb051185&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2baLKgv2dz%2fGfSzbdZmrx9ZT4Dq%2b2hmjcB" JZ3 21-Mar-25 13:00:  File OnCreditHoldControllerSec.tif (Attachment)  For further details, please refer to section 3 of update note titled HYPERLINK "https://wisetechglobal-my.sharepoint.com/personal/justin_zhang_wisetechglobal_com/Documents/Documents/Works/Security%20&%20Identity/WI00826867%20-%20TKN_Extend%20'Security%20Override'%20form%20to%20handle%20OIDC%20flow/WI00826867_High%20Level%20Design_v4_Que.docx" How to configure the Credit Controlled Documents Approval function?    The token should be single use only. After it has been used, it must be invalidated so that it cannot be used again later for additional approvals.      ====================================================================  JWA 21-Mar-25 16:04 GMT+08:00:   1. Create a class: SecurityOverrideJwtHelper, there are 2 methods:  string GenerateStaffJwt(string usercode)  It create a signed jwt with the private key from S2ST registry, the jwt should contains the claims including  "jti": the unique id of the token  "usercode": staff code  "nbf": token valid from  "exp": token expired date    GlbStaff ValidateStffJwt(string jwt)  It validate the the jwt with the certificate from the S2ST registry, then find the Glbstaff from the "usercode" claim.    2. Create a hidden registry to store the used token jti, remove the jti when it's expired during the validation period. Refer the similar logic for the support token    3. In the Help menu, add a menuitem to generate the signed jwt for the logged staff    4. In the Security Override form, if it's OIDC enabled, there will be only one textbox to let user input jwt, then the authorise process would be validate the jwt to find the staff, then check the staff security.    =======================  NCC 25-Mar-25 14:37 GMT+11:00:   - I think we can remove the registry item. 30 minutes is long, but so is 10 minutes.   - We cannot use a JWT here. The requirement is to have something that a human can remember (for 30 minutes?) or maybe scribe down on a piece of paper. So several digits, or maybe a combination of 3 short words like AppleMonkeyBike. To be agreed with product.  - We should reuse the StmAccessToken table:    - the parent table should be GlbStaff, with the parent ID being the primary key of the approver.    - it allows us to set the expiry automatically and ensure it is always used once using SAT_RemainingUseCount and SAT_ExpiresAt    - we need to define a new SAT_Type for this purpose  - To avoid the token being used to approve another form, we can display another token in the "Request approval" form, that should be entered when generating the token and stored in SAT_Scope. Upon validation of the token, we should match that the token entered matches the scope, or reject the approval. To be clarified what we can use as token, maybe a job ID or similar. Generating a code each time the form is displayed would not work as the user should be able to save and work on a different item.      ====================================================================  JWA 26-Mar-25 14:51 GMT+08:00:   1. Add a new access token type OneTimePassword in https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/blob/743562e4cf38ff6482b51769e9d7d344e3a952af/CargoWise.Definitions/src/Definitions/Authentication/AccessTokenTypes.cs#L3 JWA 15-Apr-25 14:22 GMT+08:00: Rename it to SecurityOverrideToken  2. In the Options menu of main form, add a new menuitem "Security Override Token", it will generate a 8 digits passcode for current user. In the database level, it will create a StmAccessToken and linked to the current Glbstaff. The OTP should have a valid period with 1 min.  3. Add a new registry item "System > Staff > Enable Security Override Token", when it's enabled and OIDC is enabled, user can generate an OTP and validate itself with this OTP in the Security override login form.  ====================================================================  NCC 31-Mar-25 09:03 GMT+11:00:  1. Not OneTimePassword, would need to be something more specific like "SecurityOverrideToken"  2. 1 min is definitely to short. Let's agree with product on:    - the lifetime of the token    - the length of the token    - if we need to prompt for something when generating the token, such as the staff code of the person being approved    - if we put a limit on tokens being generated (like only one token valid at a time?) or not    - who can see and use this security override token - do we want to tie that to the permission associated to the security override? Do we want other checks, for instance that there is no permanent password associated to the user or for instance it is not a robotic user?  3. Do we need a registry item, or can we just activate this if OIDC is enabled?        JZ3 15-Apr-25 13:21 GMT+10:00:     1) A new registry should be created to manage the enablement of token generation. This functionality should be activated when OIDC is enabled or can be activated at the customer's discretion. When OIDC is disabled, the user can determine whether this functionality will be deactivated.  JWA 15-Apr-25 14:11 GMT+08:00: Add a new registry "System > Security Override > Enable Security Override Token", I guess it means that this function can be activated/deactivated whatever if OIDC is enabled.  NCC 15-Apr-25 18:05 GMT+10:00: OK we can keep the registry item separate of OIDC, deactivated by default. Quickly discussed with Justin    2) We want to offer greater flexibility by allowing users to adjust the token expiration period. This adjustment will accommodate varying expectations and will be implemented through a new registry item. The proposed token expiry range is from 5 minutes to 30 minutes (a Noatum requirement), with 5 minutes being the default value.  JWA 15-Apr-25 14:12 GMT+08:00: Add new new registry "System > Security Override > Security Override Token Expiry Time", default value is 5 mins, customized range is 5-30.    3) The token should be 6 digits, as an 8-digit token is too lengthy and complex for a customer user to remember if they need to travel to the requesting user's device to authorize. We believe that 6 digits is the optimal length, and it is still widely used by most identity providers, such as Microsoft and Okta.  JWA 15-Apr-25 14:18 GMT+08:00: In the Options meue of main form, add a new menuitem "Security Override Token" to generate the token, use StmAccessToken table to store it.  NCC 15-Apr-25 18:05 GMT+10:00: We need a specific SAT_Type as discussed previously, so that the token is only used for Security Override  JWA 16-Apr-25 08:19 GMT+08:00: yeah a new type called SecurityOverrideToken    4) Token can only be used by a human i.e. A CW user account, not a system account like database developer role  JWA 15-Apr-25 14:36 GMT+08:00: The system account should not be able to login CW system, so it cannot generate such token.    5) Limit the generation of tokens such that the same token is generated until it has been used or it expires.  JWA 15-Apr-25 14:16 GMT+08:00: StmAccessToken stores such token so we can control the expiry date, one-off control, unique control.  NCC 15-Apr-25 18:05 GMT+10:00: Quickly discussed with Justin and Jason: we can revoke (or consume) the previous access token, so that we get a new valid token instead, and only one token remains valid.  Probably no need to consider weird edge cases here like concurrency or SQL lock, if in some circumstances we end up with two valid tokens in DB it's not a issue. We can keep it simple.  NCC 15-Apr-25 18:05 GMT+10:00: Question: Do we want to do some checks here before displaying the menu or generating the token? Can we check if the user is allowed to do security override, and maybe that it is actually using OIDC (ie not CWSupport, not a robotic user, OIDC is configured, ...)  JWA 16-Apr-25 09:18 GMT+08:00: When registry "Enable Security Override Token" is true and OIDC is enabled, user can generate the token.    6) When a token is generated, the same notification mechanism as the CWSupport token can be utilized i.e. A notification appears that token is copied. Event log should capture when, where and who performing a security override.  JWA 15-Apr-25 14:19 GMT+08:00: Add a messagebox to notify the token is generated. Add a StmALog when it's used to validated.  NCC 15-Apr-25 18:05 GMT+10:00: Proposal: Do not copy automatically, but allow the user to select the 6-digits token and copy it manually  NCC 15-Apr-25 18:05 GMT+10:00: Question: What are we using as parent for the StmALog? Is there something already existing for the security override that we need to adapt, or something new?      JWA 16-Apr-25 09:19 GMT+08:00:   1. Add a new access token type SecurityOverrideToken in https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/blob/743562e4cf38ff6482b51769e9d7d344e3a952af/CargoWise.Definitions/src/Definitions/Authentication/AccessTokenTypes.cs#L3  2. Add 2 new registry item "System > Security Override > Enable Security Override Token", "System > Security Override > Security Override Token Expiry Time", default value is 5 mins, customized range is 5-30.  NCC 17-Apr-25 08:24 GMT+10:00: Default for Enable Security Override Token is false  3. In the options menu of main form, add a new menuitem "Security Override Token", it's visible only when OIDC is enabled and "Enable Security Override Token" is true.  NCC 17-Apr-25 08:24 GMT+10:00: If not too complex, add a permission check so that unprivileges user are not seeing a feature they cannot use (better UX, but not stricly mandatory)  4. When the menuitem is clicked, a message box is showing the token, user can copy it manually.  5. there will be only one record for the token in the StmAccessToken, each time the new generated token will replace the existing one.  6. when the token is validated, a stmalog will be created to record the action and is linked to the current user logged in CW system.   NCC 17-Apr-25 08:24 GMT+10:00: To be confirmed with Justin, seems that this part is not required and is just there for non-regression (ie that the current logging for security approval is still working when using a token)

WKI_Summary: Update report: Compliance Sequences Book Profile, Remove ADD Event
details: Report: Compliance Sequences Book Profile  Path: Account -> Reports -> Compliance Sequences Book Profile  Sql: ComplianceSequencesBookProfile     Current:  sql get data from StmAlog, SL_SE_NKEvent = ADD    dbo.StmALog on XD_PK = SL_Parent AND SL_Table = 'AccComplianceSequence' AND SL_SE_NKEvent = 'ADD'    Automation/Workflow team, eventually will run the Delete Transform on Stmalog table to delete all the ADD/DEL/EDIT records. If you have any concerns about this transform please contact them directly.      Done: update the sql script to remove the usage of ADD event, ADD will be removed from StmAlog  Change another way to get the createTime or CreateUser  HDG 06-Aug-25 11:32 GMT+08:00:   See investigation result from Jim, the add event time is local time, there is no another database field stores system create time in local time.   ============================================================  SCOPE OF THIS WI:  1.Remove Added Date column from Compliance Sequences Book Profile report  2. Add 3 new columns to the report:     Caption :                      Map to:  Created Date (UTC) | AccComplianceSequence.XD_SystemCreateTimeUtc  Created By                  | AccComplianceSequence.XD_SystemCreateUser  Valid From                  | AccComplianceSequence.XD_StartDate   User should be able to add/remove the new columns from report using Configuration Management > Column Configuration tab.  NOTE: since Added Date is not default report column, the 3 newly added columns will not be added as default report columns either.   Update Note is required for this change.
product_candidate: Compliance Sequences Book Profile, Remove ADD Event

WKI_Summary: UK Supply Chain Security Shipment Inspection status changes
details: Description: In line with UK CAA (Civil Aviation Authority) requirements, the 'APP' (Approved) shipment inspection status can be recalculated to 'UNK' (Unknown) only in limited cases that typically result in the consignment losing its "Approved" security status, requiring reassessment or rescreening to ensure compliance with security protocols.    Done statements:  1. The Shipment > Inspection field for UK login companies (UK export) is automatically recalculated only in the following scenarios:  Organisation Changes: when any relevant organisation is removed, replaced or its address is changed on the Shipment or Consol (as per the Organisation types specified in the Organisations to Use for Supply Chain Security Registry item)   Shipment's Transport Mode or Origin changes     2. The registry setting Freight > Supply Chain Security >United Kingdom > Organisations to Use for Supply Chain Security is updated to reflect these changes.       BPD 18-Sep-24 15:01 GMT+10:00:     Detailed Build Design:   a) As listed in HLD, there are different fields when their value is added or changed, it recalculates the Shipment Inspection Type Code.   In this workitem, before this recaclulation we need to add a check such that for UK login company if  the inspection field is set to APP , we need to skip the recalculation of the shipment inspection code.    The re-setting of the inspection type code to UNK is happening at \Freight\Forwarding\Forwarding.Business\Shipment\AviationSecurity\AviationSecuritySupport.cs , SetApprovedShipperStatus(ZString reason, bool overrideUserEnteredValue) ,   We have to add an additional check before calling SetApprovedShipperStatus, for the following cases(taken from HLD):  1. Date fields:  o Consol  > Bill Issue \Freight\Forwarding\Forwarding.Business\Consol\ForwardingConsol.cs -> public override ZDateTime JK_MasterBillIssueDate(){...}  o Consol ETD \Freight\Forwarding\Forwarding.Business\Consol\ForwardingConsolTransportSupporter.cs -> void RecalculateShipmentInspectionTypes(ZString reason){...},NotifyETDChangedCore  o Shipment ETD \Freight\Forwarding\Forwarding.Business\Shipment\ForwardingShipment.cs ->  public override ZDateTime JS_E_DEP(){...)  o Shipment Creation \Freight\Forwarding\Forwarding.Business\Shipment\ForwardingShipment.cs ->  public override ZDateTime JS_SystemCreateTimeUtc() {...}  o Current Date : Please note I could not find any instance where Current Date triggers the recalculation of Shipment inspection type code and believe it is only ultimate date fallback when the calculation is triggered by something else - ie: in AviationSecuritySupport.ShipmentDateForAviationSecurity    and we are already checking the other dates ,so we should be good to not make any changes for this. During development, please add a unit test to verify the same.   reference code :internal ZString ShipmentDateTypeForAviationSecurity ,      return MasterBillIssueDate.IsValid ? AviationSecurityDateTypes.MasterBillIssueDate      : ConsolETD.IsValid ? AviationSecurityDateTypes.ConsolETD      : ShipmentBO.JS_E_DEP.IsValid ? AviationSecurityDateTypes.ShipmentETD      : ShipmentBO.JS_SystemCreateTimeUtc.IsValid ? AviationSecurityDateTypes.ShipmentCreatedDate      : AviationSecurityDateTypes.CurrentDate;  3. Shipment Changes:  o Destination  \Freight\Forwarding\Forwarding.Business\Shipment\ForwardingShipment.cs -> public override ZString JS_RL_NKDestination(){...)      4. Transport Changes:  o Load Port \Freight\Forwarding\Forwarding.Business\Consol\ForwardingConsolTransportSupporter.cs -> void RecalculateShipmentInspectionTypes(ZString reason){...} , NotifyLoadChangedCore  o Transport Mode Port \Freight\Forwarding\Forwarding.Business\Consol\ForwardingConsolTransportSupporter.cs -> void RecalculateShipmentInspectionTypes(ZString reason){...},NotifyTransportModeChangedCore  o 'Is Cargo Only' checkbox \Freight\Shared\Freight.Business\VoyageManagement\Voyage\JobVoyage.cs  -> public override ZBool JV_IsCargoOnly(){...}    5. Other Changes:  o Consol added or Removed, \Freight\Forwarding\Forwarding.Business\Shipment\ForwardingShipment.cs -> void Consols_CountChanged(object sender, CollectionCountChangedEventArgs e){...}                 For this please also crosscheck \Freight\Forwarding\Forwarding.Business\Consol\ForwardingConsolManyToManyCollection.cs protected override void OnAdded(BusinessObject bizOAdded){...} and protected override void OnRemoved(BusinessObject bizORemoved){..}    b) Changes to Registry  In /Enterprise/Product/Core/Registry/Business/Registry.Business/Freight/FreightDataRegistry.cs  In ShipmentInspectionOrganisationToUse_UK please update the registry hint as provided in HLD
product_candidate: UK Supply Chain Security Shipment Inspection status changes

WKI_Summary: PP: Record Allocation Log
details: RDZ 23-May-25 10:07 GMT+08:00:   For functional review, please test:  1. When Create Pick from Order Form. Allocation Log should be saved.  2. When allocate items on availabel inventory. Allocation Log should be saved after saving Pick.      BRS 27-Mar-25 15:35 GMT+11:00:   I think a simple implementation would be for OnSaving (if any allocation has occurred) to be considered a new "session" and populate all of the logs (could be a mix of manual and auto) at this point.    Then we can just store on the pick or similar what available inventories have been logged (or just iterate them all) and directly persist the logs rather than having to edit the note after single UI operations    If doing this, we would have to clear the allocation log after saving, as the logs are flushed to notes now and we don't want to duplicate them on successive saves.    MMC: Agreed with the above, OnSaving should do the logic of creating/appending to the Allocation Log Note, each "session" (include timestamp) is the contents of the logs when saving and the non-persistent logs should be cleared OnSaving.    MMC 26-Mar-25 12:51 GMT+11:00:   Auto Allocation Log for each available Inventory allocated is persisted for clients to View.    Technical Suggestion:  Add a new note type for Pick "Auto Allocation Log" - make it unique.    Whenever running auto-allocate, check if the "Auto Allocation Log" note exists, and create if not.  For each Available Inventory allocated, log the Inventory Key, and then all the rules involved in allocating it (including Priority).   Make sure each Auto Allocation Attempt (as a whole) is shown as separate sections (just use the current time as a way to separate each execution).  BRS: We should *not* have to change the logging or anything related to allocation rules for this, it should be possible to just persist the existing log after separating by each available inventory    If a user does any manual allocation - just Append another section that clearly Shows which inventory was manually allocated/deallocated and that it was manual. BRS: Log should already do that.    TG1 20-Feb-25 12:09 GMT+11:00:     Current Functionality: Allocation log only displays data when user clicks "Autoallocate Remaining Items" on the Pick screen.     Desired Functionality: Display allocation rule and priority chosen by autoallocation as pick is generated     Additional Information:    13/11/2024: It is impossible to analyse after picking has commenced. Scott had a case where we couldnt figure out which rule was used and why. Neither of us could replicate. An allocation log  would have been handy to analyse and investigate after the fact.  Users creating orders may not be advanced enough or have the responisbility to investigate at the time, usually it is a superuser (  like Scott who investigates later)  15/01/25: EV Cargo also had a similar incident.IN the event of multiple allocations and deallocations, only retain the latest allocation rule used   19/2/25 - Similar way like Auto rating log works. Add log under notes (Pick). If user manually allocate the inventory, it wipes out the log information.
