WKI_Summary: JP SCS - Add inspection type ETD
details: Regulation: MLIT (Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism) https://www.mlit.go.jp/koku/content/001469616.pdf  3. Aviation Security Measures for Air Cargo  To prevent acts of harm such as aircraft bombings, it is necessary for parties involved in the transportation of air cargo (excluding checked baggage, hereafter referred to as "air cargo") to collaborate and implement necessary measures to ensure that no explosives are present in the cargo. This includes air transport operators, those transporting cargo to airports, and consignors. Therefore, for air cargo, one of the following entities must conduct the necessary aviation security measures, such as inspecting the cargo to ensure that it does not contain explosives and taking measures to prevent the insertion of explosives from the time of cargo receipt until it is loaded onto the aircraft. These entities include:  Air transport operators, etc.  Specified air cargo transport operators, etc.  Consignors who have been confirmed to have taken necessary measures regarding the handling of air cargo by air transport operators or specified air cargo transport operators, etc.  For the inspection of air cargo, X-ray inspection devices, explosive detection devices using vapor or trace detection (ETD), or other equipment that meets necessary requirements and standards must be used, or an open inspection must be conducted to check for the presence of explosives.    SDF 08-Oct-24 10:19 GMT+08:00:   Done Statement:  New Inspection Type ETD (Explosives trace detection equipment - particles or vapour) is added to Japan  For the Japanese Default List of Inspection Types, make sure that the code ETD is added to the List, regardless of whether the“Override Default” option is checked.    Proposed Solution:  M04 08-Oct-24 15:32 GMT+11:00:   It is a similar case https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/commit/e22fc263c23e17208a1c9a5c719b56fe8c9d8590?refName=refs%2Fheads%2Fmaster&path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FRegistry%2FRegistry.Business%2FFreight%2FShipmentInspection%2FShipmentInspectionTypeLists.cs    1) In https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FRegistry%2FBusiness%2FRegistry.Business%2FFreight%2FShipmentInspection%2FShipmentInspectionTypeLists.cs&version=GBmaster&line=131&lineEnd=153&lineStartColumn=3&lineEndColumn=4&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents,  add new code "ETD" to this list.    2)We also need to use Transformation to handle cases where "Override Default" is checked. Registry name is 'ShipmentInspectionTypes_JP'.  M04 08-Oct-24 15:33 GMT+11:00:  I am unsure that we need to have a transformation. can you please first check. I do not think that we need transformation for this case. I have not seen it before.  Please refer to these examples:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/249932 or https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/211959

WKI_Summary: Display gathered transactions during functional test of STL collectors
details: At present, we encourage engineers to functionally test STL collector additions\updates through the STL and USS service task through the below content:    https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/2320/STL-Collector-Service-(STL)  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/2324/Usage-Submission-Service-(USS)    This generally requires access to elastic\kibana to be able to see the submitted transactions, which is more of a full end to end test, but can cause delays in the process if the engineer is not experienced with the portal or does not have access.    Engineers have expressed a desire to be able to display the gathered transactions in CargoWise immediately, rather than having to do a full end to end test and go to the portal.    They can achieve this at present by using the following hacky pull request https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/228455, see https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/15733/Bill-Collector-Functionality-Testing, but it would be much better if this functionality was built in to the product.    So we should look to officially add this functionality to the product as an option for functional testing, but in a much more robust and less hacky way.    ITN 20-Feb-25 10:09 GMT+11:00:     DESIGN:    I think the basic premise of the above pull request above is fine, we can use the existing StlRetrieverForm to trigger the collection of transactions and then display them in a form such as StlRetrieverCollectedDataForm.    I don't think we should butcher the IStlItem interface by adding the display collection to achieve it though.    Instead, I think we should change StlRetrieverMonthly.CollectAndSend to return a collection of the transactions gathered.  This would be passed up through the call stack all the way from BillingDataCollector.RetrieveFeatureData as an IEnumerable<IStlTransaction> collection, to keep things generic and clean.    We could then directly populate the collectedData from this returned collection and convert the transactions into BillingTransactionForDisplaying (perhaps with a better class name though).    This approach would be a lot cleaner and require a lot less modication to the rest of the production classes.
product_candidate: Display gathered transactions during functional test of STL collectors

WKI_Summary: Turn off Audit Events for Global Manifest tables
details: JPG 24-Mar-25 18:10 GMT+11:00: The purpose of this WI is to turn off Audit Event logging (by default) for the main Global Manifest (Asycuda...) tables. See the following links for an overview of what we want to achieve:    https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/ArchiveManager/EUUiOSoELGRNsSGhAzlT16kBowtezPrVVdNV3H4dxM3N9g?e=FWtKxN    Guide: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/13383/Turning-off-Audit-Events  Sample PR: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/291327    REQ001: Remove the IsAutoLogged override from the following classes (that is, turn off auto logging):    Enterprise.Customs.ManifestBase.AsycudaManifestHeader  Enterprise.Customs.ASYCUDA.Business.AsycudaManifestHeader  Enterprise.Customs.ASYCUDA.Business.AsycudaBill    LY 09-Apr-25 10:30 GMT+01:00: Remove relevant business objects from AuditEventTest baseline https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FArchiveManager%2FArchiveManager%2FArchiveManager.Test%2FAuditEventTest.cs&version=GBmaster&line=107&lineEnd=108&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=1&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    REQ002: Add the following tables to AutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValue (https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FWorkflow%2FWorkflow.Business%2FAuditStmALog%2FAutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValues.cs&version=GBmaster&_a=contents)    AsycudaManifestHeader  AsycudaBill    This enable 2 things:  When the registry is on for a particular table, then StmALog events will be created as if IsAutoLogged were turned on.  When the registry if off, then NonPersistedStmALog events will be create. These will allow workflow to work on EDT/ADD events, but it will not actually persist the events in StmALog (which is the real goal here).    --    The three tables should already be in the Audit DB and visible on the Global Manifest (and related) forms:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=a84f51df-222d-4573-80e7-6792629b5084&VersionNumber=25.3.24.25&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2b44IiZJlWXftyCrSQ%2f0VEkeTg9WeAvDnN" WI00887085 - Enable Audit Data tab for all Global Manifest (and related) Forms
product_candidate: Turn off Audit Events for Global Manifest tables

WKI_Summary: MCM: Capture Transport Company during RMA Process
details: LC3 20-May-25 15:30 GMT+08:00:   For functional review:  1. regression test   - unload in a warehouse that has only one dockdoor, select unload to dockdoor, the dock door screen should be skipped   - unload in a warehouse that has more than one dockdoors, select unload to dockdoor, the dock door screen should display dockdoor, not display transport company; regression test scan dock door location     suspend and select unload to dockdoor again, allow use recent dockdoor, the dockdoor field should be auto filled    2. test RMA unload   - unload RMA receive in a warehouse that has only one dockdoor, select unload to dockdoor, the dock door screen should show dockdoor (read-only and pre-filled) and transport company   - unload RMA receive in a warehouse that has more than one dockdoors, select unload to dockdoor, the dock door screen should display dockdoor and transport company; scan dockdoor should auto move to next screen     enter dockdoor and company click ok then suspend and select unload to dockdoor again, allow use recent dockdoor, the dockdoor and company field should be auto filled    3. test dock door screen - scan   - if scan invalid dockdoor, should show error dialog, focus on dockdoor   - if scan invalid company, should show error dialog, focus on company   - if scan a company that is not a carrier, should show error dialog, focus on company   - if scan valid dockdoor and company is empty, should focus on transport company   - if scan valid company and dockdoor is empty, should focus on dockdoor   - if scan valid dockdoor and company is not empty, should auto move to next screen   - if scan valid company and dockdoor is not empty, should auto move to next screen    4. test dock door screen - enter   - enter valid location + empty company, click ok, should move to next screen   - enter invalid location + empty company, click ok, should show error dialog, focus on dockdoor   - enter valid location + invalid company, click ok, should show error dialog, focus on company   - enter valid location + valid company, click ok, should move to next screen   - empty location + empty company, click ok, should show error dialog, focus on dockdoor    5. test dock door screen - checkbox   - if uncheck, should clear company   - if check, should auto fill company with linked order transport company    6. test transport company save   - unload RMA receive, enter transport company, click ok, open the receive in desktop cw1, the Transport filed should be populated   - suspend and unload the above RMA receive again, clear the transport company field, click ok, open the receive in desktop cw1, the Transport filed should be empty    MMC 04-Apr-25 11:17 GMT+11:00:   Done statement:  RF User can capture Transport Company for a Return Job.    Technical Suggestion:  When user selects ASN Unload or Unload to Dock Door, a Dock Door Screen is shown to select the Dock Door for the Unload Job.  Note that this screen is skipped if the system only has one Dock Door.    Change it so that if doing an RMA Unload Job, the Dock Door Screen always displays - and a new textbox appears to enter the Transport Company Code (this text box should be hidden for regular receives).  The Transport Company field will be blank but have a button next to/below it labelled something like "Select Shipping Carrier", which will fill in the Transport Company from the linked Order. BRS: Should this be a checkbox which makes the textbox go readonly, so we invoke a single request?  If only one Dock Door exists, then the Dock Door text box should be pre-filled & read only.  Scanning just the Dock Door should no longer immediately move to the next screen for an RMA unload, only if both fields are entered can we automatically move to the next screen.    On WebService side, we take the scanned/entered Transport Company, and if there is matching a valid organisation that is a Carrier, then we set that as the Transport Company on the Receive otherwise return an error.    PP Notes:  Instead of defaulting the Shipping carrier, a new text box is added on the dock door screen with a button 'use default shipping carrier'.  Create a separate Work Item to add a new filter (vote:3).    CKR 19-Feb-25 10:32 GMT+11:00:   Desired Functionality: Transport Company can be captured during the RMA RF Process     Additional Notes:   Business reasons: Clients are able to track Returns by Carrier (especially for Last Mile Delivery Transport Courriers).  The Transport Company that was on the shipped order can be automatically populated on the Return (via Desktop or RF) via a new configurable option.  On both Desktop and RF, user has the possibility to override the Transport Company.    In fact, this is already the case from Desktop where users can populate the Transport Company on the RMA receive job.  We want a similar option from the RF.
product_candidate: Capture Transport Company during RMA Process

WKI_Summary: WinCE Deprecation - Prepare and consume Registry Value for deprecation
details: YSH 14-Nov-24 08:26 GMT+11:00:   Design as follows:  Prepare a new CW1Support Only DateTime Registry   - Default the value to 01-December-2025 00:00:00 UTC    Consume this new registry item in Warehouse.Web   - Update BaseService.AllowedToRunService    - IFF the provided message is from a WinCE gun, then additionally check if the WinCE Deprecation date has been exceeded (compared to DateTime.UTCNow)    - If exceeded, return an error (note that we may need to change the client-side to ensure it expects this error)    Consume this new registry item in the local transport web service   - Update EnvController.Login to now verify the deprecation date    - If the WinCE Deprecation date has been exceeded, throw a SoapException    - Potentially update client side to process this exception if changes required    YSH 13-Nov-24 20:07 GMT+11:00:   Prepare a CW1Support only registry item that can be used to track the end date of the WinCE mobile application.     This registry item should be consumed by the webservice for WinCE logins, and should prevent the user from proceeding with the application.  Android usage should be unaffected    This registry item should additionally be consumed by the LocalTransport Web Service to prevent user from proceeding with the application.
feature_description: Prepare and consume Registry Value for deprecation

WKI_Summary: ACAS - Item 1-4 - Shipper/Consignee Phone and Email
details: Done: CW supports the following ACAS reporting requirements via FWB and FHL messgages:    1. Shipper Email  2. Shipper Phone Number (already supported)  3. Consignee Email  4. Consginee Phone Number (already supported)       Comments from Angela:  Email/Phone - We should document from the code how we calculate Shipper and Consignee phone numbers for FWB and FHL today - and the same should apply for emails.     Major points:   a) there is AWB address that takes preference and may have its phone/email as a fallback from the contact (or vice versa).  b) for DRT MAWB we use shipper/consignee from a shipment and not agents from a consol.     This is a must for correct update note documents, or users will not know where to add these emails to.      Example of OCI segment with SHP/CNE emails highlighted in green:    OCI/AU/SHP/CP/JOHN SMITH  /AU/SHP/CT/0297541125  /AU/SHP/MU/JOHNSMITH  /AU/SHP/MD/DHL.COM  /US/CNE/CP/AMY THOMPSON  /US/CNE/CT/886521336  /US/CNE/MU/AMYTHOMPSON  /US/CNE/MD/DHL.COM
feature_description: Item 1-4 - Shipper/Consignee Phone and Email

WKI_Summary: Gather and report transactions on customer Test\Training Systems
details: There have been several situations where product teams would like their STL collectors to run on customer Test\Training Systems to gather information from them.    We already run the STL service task and USS service task for Customer Test\Training Systems, but we only gather STS (system storage), as we bill for Test\Training storage.    Once HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/2b978bb7-e61a-4341-80a9-bfe4fb94c42f?lang=en-gb" WI00830740 - Submit billing/usage transactions to new billing gateway is complete, reporting this data will not cause any noticable strain on eHub infrastructure.    So we should be fine to start gathering and submitting data for all STL collectors on Test\Training systems.    However, we should report transactions from all STL collectors (other than STS) as usage transactions if the system is a Customer Test\Training one so they only go into kibana (not the billing database).
product_candidate: Gather and report transactions on customer Test\Training Systems

WKI_Summary: PP: Add Distribution Center Org as a Consolidation Criteria
details: BCU 14-May-25 15:26 GMT+10:00:     For functional Testing:    - Please test the Consolidation of Orders for Consolidation locations with these cases:  1) When the Distribution Center for the Order is provided  2) When the Distribution Center for the Order is not provided  3) When the Distribution Center for the Order is overriden    When Distribution Center is provided, its location should be used for determining the consolidation location instead of the consignee. When is not provided or not overriden, the consignee is used as before.      MMC 14-Mar-25 15:25 GMT+11:00:   Very straightforward, When considering Consolidation for an Order it currently groups by Consignee Address PK (as well as the other fields mentioned in CKR's notes).    Technical Suggestion:  If the distribution center is provided and not overriden (dunno why you can put an overriden address for a DC) then use that as the Address PK to consolidate by instead of ConsigneeAddress.  this means that an Order with no DC and with Consignee Address "123" and an Order with DC Address "123" will be consolidated together.    CKR 14-Jan-25 15:01 GMT+11:00:   Current Functionality: Consolidation currently considers Consignee, Date, Transport Company and Load ID.    Desired Functionality: Ability to consolidate the orders based on DC org.     Planning Poker Notes:    20/11/24 Distribution Centers are a prime candidate for Consolidation activity as there are multiple orders being sent to the same location which can be consolidated in a single handling unit, reducing costs on receiving and transport.    14/01/25: IF a DC is added on the order, it will consolidate by the DC (and not consignee anymore).
product_candidate: Add Distribution Center Org as a Consolidation Criteria

WKI_Summary: DMN: New security right for the Cut action on right click menu on the eDocs tab
details: JBK 12-Nov-24 08:09 GMT+11:00:   A new WI was created to implement this enhancement.  Please refer HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=37faac55-5083-4c0c-abed-13393bb36aa5&VersionNumber=24.11.12.73&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bZTEI0Bpo7cc8WWydyN2RaggkOqADc5tN" WI00275779 - DMN: New security right for the Cut action on right click menu on the eDocs tab for more details related to this WI.    DZG 06-Dec-24 12:24 GMT+11:00:   I am thinking if we should introduce new security right for Cut action, or reuse 'eDocs Permanent Delete' for Cut.  The reason is if uses disable the 'eDocs Permanent Delete ' security right, but have 'Cut' secruity right enabled, they could still delete docs permanently by Cut and Save.  If we reuse 'eDocs Permanent Delete' for cut, users won't be able to cut and save if 'eDocs Permanent Delete' is diabled.  But this can't resolve the cut and save issue when 'eDocs Permanent Delete' is enabled.    DZG 06-Dec-24 14:13 GMT+11:00:   After discussing with Jegan, we would like to have the new Cut security right to differentiate the actions of Cut and Delete Permanently.  So the detailed design would be as described as the one in WI00275779, by adding a new CutSpecificEDocsTypes
product_candidate: New security right for the Cut action on right click menu on the eDocs tab

WKI_Summary: Enable Audit Data tab for all JobDeclaration Forms
details: JPG 21-Mar-25 08:12 GMT+11:00: The Audit Database has been enabled for a number of customs tables, but none of the customs forms show the Audit Data tab. Thus, end-users cannot view audit data despite it being available.    PRE001: The Audit Data Plugin currently only supports children one level deep. (Linked directly by PK.) This means, we cannot show audit data for InvoiceLine, EntryLine, etc... Cluster Keys however provide us an easy way to load related records (more than one level deep) from the Audit Database without having to fetch with multiple parent PKs. Enable Cluster Key support for AuditEventCollection (incl. AuditEntry, AuditChildInfo).    PRE002: The following tables are already in the Audit Database, but doesn't have their _ClusterKey columns included. Please flag these for inclusion in the Audit db.    CusContainer  CusContainerInvoiceLinePivot  CusDecHouseBill  CusDecHouseContainerPack  CusDecHouseContainerPivot  CusEntryHeader  CusEntryHeaderCharges  CusEntryInstruction  CusEntryLine  CusEntryLineFee  CusEntryPayInfo  CusHouseContPackInvoiceHeaderPivot  CusHouseContPackInvoiceLinePivot  CusUnderbondDec  JobComInvLineRefs  JobComInvoiceHeader  JobComInvoiceHeaderRefs  JobComInvoiceLine  JobDeclaration    REQ001: Implement IAuditParent on BaseJobDeclaration. Please include the set of tables above as RelatedFkColumns.    REQ002: Add the "Audit" plugin to BaseJobDeclarationForm. e.g.    PlugIns.Add(ControllerIDs.Audit);
product_candidate: Enable Audit Data tab for all JobDeclaration Forms

WKI_Summary: [CWN.UPG] CW1 and CWN latest version lookup
details: For CW1:  The change for WI will stop CWN release being able to deliver to Licence Database with LD_Product = CW1, via  - Upgrade web service consumed by UPG service task  - My Account server download page  - Incident based auto upgrade service task (IUP)    For Licence Database with LD_Product = CW1, when it is on last version of CW1 (24.10.30.X), if latest version for matched release ring is product CWN, instead of serving CWN versions, the system will serve latest versions from higher release ring with version number 24.10.30.X.    There is should be only one release ring on 24.10.30.X at a time, depends on whether requesting latest or weekly stable. In the edge case where multiple release rings are found, pick the smallest version number (?)      For CWN:  The first CWN release is on DPR release ring with version 24.11.27.X. The initial polit system group include systems on STD / GP1 release rings. For those systems need to allow upgrades from 24.11.27.X, until CWN is available on STD / GP1 / GP2 release rings.        SCW 19-Nov-24 10:21 GMT+11:00:   Tech design:  Changes required to LatestReleaseBuildsDictionary (https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FClientExtensions%2FEDI%2FZClientEDI%2FZClientEDI.Business%2FReleaseBuilds%2FLatestReleaseBuildsDictionary.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster)    1) Add product parameter to all methods. Internal dictionary also needs to store product info. All methods only returns release build if database product matches release build product, i.e.   - if db product is CW1, returns release build with product ENT   - if db product is CWN, returns release build with product CWN   - if db product is other value, return null    2) Add logic for product CW1 latest version lookup   - Add new registry to indicate the last version of CW1 24.10.30.X   - If the latest version is on CWN (no latest CW1 version) and the installed version is on 24.10.30.X, get latest version from higher rings if version matches   e.g.   when latest DPR version is CWN, DPR will get release build 24.10.30.X from STD   when latest STD version is CWN, DPR, STD will get release build 24.10.30.X from GP1   when latest GP1 version is CWN, DPR, STD, GP1 will get release build 24.10.30.X from GP2   when latest GP2 version is CWN, DPR, STD, GP1, GP2 will get release build 24.10.30.X from CW1    3) Add logic for product CWN latest version lookup   - If there is NO CWN versions at all (including superseded versions) on the requested release ring, get latest version from lower rings   e.g.    when 24.11.27.X is on DPR only, STD, GP1, GP2 will get release build 24.11.27.X from DPR   when 24.11.27.X is on STD, GP1 and GP2 will get release build 24.11.27.X from STD   when 25.1.1.X is on STD, GP1 and GP2 will get release build 25.1.1.X from STD   when 25.1.1.X is on GP1, GP2 will get release build 25.1.1.X from GP1    Need to test edge case when there is no available version due to manual superseding all versions on a select release ring

WKI_Summary: NCTS ph 5 - support flow IE015 - IE928 - IE056 without discarding
details: WKC 12-Mar-25 15:07 GMT+00:00:  Technical Design  The logic is located at:  Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\GB\Core\GovernmentGateway.ServiceTasks\Ncts\Processors\Phase5\CC056CProcessor.cs    If the movement has meet all following criteria, the processor should perform those new logic as outlined by Daniel:  1. BM_MessageStatus = ACC  2. BM_Phase = 015 (Declaration)  3. BM_CustomsStatus = ACK/PRE    We probably need to add logic in MessageShouldBeDiscardedCore().    Alternative design: check whether any previous received message is a 928 response, perform those new logic as outlined by Daniel when found.      DJC 04-Mar-25 12:16 GMT+00:00:  Version 2 specs attached - HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=69ff7b3e-c096-4cc3-a2df-cb189ac3229e&StorageDocPK=e76bacb0-205d-40ce-8061-fb9e17bc5b42&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bKW9uece9R79TzwvwExoG6yMjis4jAyOY" DJC 04-Mar-25 12:19:  File WI00834086 v2.docx (Specification)                                                                                                                                  DJC 22-Nov-24 10:09 GMT+00:00:    We use the same business logic as Belgium, who are mad-keen marking messages as discarded based on the job's current status and the status that the new mesage would assign.  Great in theory, in practice it brings us to this issue.     Consider pre-requisite state following  the receipt of an IE928, which means that the normal job attains statuses Phase status=015, Message Status=ACC, Declaration/Customs status = ACK.  When processing IE056 (rejection upon presentation at office of departure), the above status and our current rules mean we refuse to update the job using the IE056, and mark the message as discarded. For example: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=69ff7b3e-c096-4cc3-a2df-cb189ac3229e&StorageDocPK=3ce48004-4909-408c-a81c-e7a77ea1e045&Hash=%2b7rhACZ5Q4gClPgPtkec5%2faoSV4w%2fxdau&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" DJC 22-Nov-24 10:14:  File b6afcc0ad32d4d439185d7ea047024f2.tif (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.  The UDE is that the job's status does not change to a negative one and still show ACK.   This flow is not currently supported, because this flow is not currenly documented by WTG nor by HMRC. But it is legitimate.     It's similar when the message status is SNT and the customs status is ACK.   HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=69ff7b3e-c096-4cc3-a2df-cb189ac3229e&StorageDocPK=2bb783af-0b7f-434d-8b8e-4aefffcb3ecc&Hash=%2bo1HNHkZIaHuAHwcnW8ALVQDL1h%2f1kh5x&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" DJC 22-Nov-24 10:14:  File cb2fb72b08ac4a0ab1b123173268d19c.tif (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.      TODO  When the message type is 056, and the current customs status is PRE or ACK:  Update the job's customs status.  Overide GetNewDeclarationStatus() in CC056CProcessor.  The new customs status is RJO (to be confirmed by ECPB team*), the same as when a prelodged departure does not get accepted within the timer.  Do not discard the message.     When IE056 immediately follows IE015:  Do NOT change the customs status of the job (as today). Continue, as today, to set message status INV.     DONE  The flow IE015-IE928-IE056 results in the job's customs status being changed to a negative one.       * Why RJO is a good choice for the customs status.   See the attached HTML document.  There's no flow for IE015-IE928-IE056.  There's also no flow for IE015-IE028-IE029 (simplified).           Brendon,    I propose changing Brendon's diagram like this (the orange edit is what we need for this WI and why it leads us to RJO status):   HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=69ff7b3e-c096-4cc3-a2df-cb189ac3229e&StorageDocPK=1c7f11fe-c251-41c3-8561-0e9f6096aa6d&Hash=%2bt5VgI9KJA0co6fzxx9qJWmzJYdPCZig5&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" DJC 16-Dec-24 13:37:  File Proposed changes to NCTS diagram.tif (Internal Correspondence)  The blue lines are required by https://developer.service.hmrc.gov.uk/guides/ctc-traders-phase5-tis/documentation/process_flows.html#control-by-office-of-departure  The oragne lines are not documented by HMRC yet, but are supported by the attached email:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=69ff7b3e-c096-4cc3-a2df-cb189ac3229e&StorageDocPK=06ca60f6-94a0-440d-9c40-8f7f0ec0f472&Hash=%2bJ7PHVas8vtcgf7WA8caP7%2fjnV4jPa%2fFM&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" DJC 22-Nov-24 11:02:  File ffce3db84959401cacf0eecd9e6b6724.tif (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.     Please approve and incorporate these changes into your master diagram.

WKI_Summary: Displaying the properties of STL Collectors in CargoWise
details: At times it would be handy if CargoWise displayed the list of property values for an STL collector definition somewhere in CargoWise.  For example, when I need to add or modify the STL collector definitions in the new reference database portal.    Quite often the property values are calculated as the class definition is loaded, so the final definition of the collector is not quite exactly how it is in the code.    The functionality at 'Help' -> 'STL Billing' -> 'Generate Dynamic STL Collector Script' comes close to what is needed, but it changes the property values to suit the process of inserting the data into SQL, which adds escape characters and adjusts line endings as required for the SQL script.    Perhaps we could make the following changes to provide the exact property values in the UI:    1) Rename the 'Generate Dynamic STL Collector Script' menu item to 'Dynamic Collector Definitions'.  2) Rename the 'Generate' button on that form to 'Generate SQL Script'.  3) Add a new button 'Display Collector Properties'.    The new button 'Display Collector Properties' would launch a form with a basic grid of all the property values for the collectors that were added in the previous form.    ITN 19-May-25 09:56 GMT+10:00:     DESIGN:    A similar approach can be taken as in HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/d2eb0074-636b-4efc-be3c-b43cae660ebc?lang=en-gb" WI00871995 - Display gathered transactions during functional test of STL collectors.  We can add a new basic ZChildForm like StlRetrieverCollectedDataForm which displays all the collector properties in a grid (eg StlCollectorForm) and a new NonPersistentBusinessObject and collection like StlTransactionForDisplayCollection and StlTransactionForDisplay (eg StlCollectorForDisplayCollection and StlCollectorForDisplay).  So then it will just be a simple matter of constructing the classes when the new button 'Display Collector Properties' is pressed.
product_candidate: Displaying the properties of STL Collectors in CargoWise

WKI_Summary: UY - E-Invoicing - Improve Reversal/Amendment procedure
details: Country: Uruguay    Scope of Changes:    Uruguay Reversal/Amendment procedure currently established that when an AR transaction has a Failed Status, if User performs a reversal/Amendment transaction associated to it, both transaction, the original and the reversal/amendment are automatically discarded.  When the original AR transaction is discarded (E-Reporting Status = DCD) it implies that this transcation cannot be Reset to Queued and when the Reversal/Amendment is discarded it implies that this transaction will never be sent/reported to the Tax Authority.    Recently, we have been having some scenarios where the original transaction has a Failed Status in CargoWise, but a Successfull Status for Uruguay Tax Authority, because of some internal communication issues.  Therefore, in these cases, the User contact us and we must update AR transaction Status to SNT by database, because this allows users to reset the AR transaction to Queued and corrcetly update the status to SUC.    Although this errors occur sporadically, we must review current Reversal/Amendment procedure in order to contemplate them, because modifying AR transactions status via databese is not the best procedure.    In the light of this situation, we have consulted with Uruguay PAC provider about the controls and validations that Uruguay Tax Authority (DGI) performs when receiving a Credit or Debit Note associated to a rejected transaction and the PAC has confirmed us that DGI validates that the invoice associted to the Credit/Debit Note is accepted. When it is not, the reversal/Amendment is also rejected.    Therefore, the aim of this work item is to improve the Reversal/Amendment procedure for Uruguay eInvoicing functionality to allow CargoWise to sent to DGI Credit and Debit Notes associated to a rejected transaction, beacuse it will allow Users to reset to Queued rejected transactions when needed, even if a Reversal/Amendment has been made to it.    Examples of Some Incidents requesting a DCD Status Update:    HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=4162a2fb-4235-4f04-afdc-6d1f280bc9be&VersionNumber=25.2.25.114&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bjd6HSX%2fSAzrm1dEYX%2b%2bWN67lLl7xZMcn" CS01882910 - DSVHHS - UY eINV status in DCD  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=c51fc8f2-af77-4ee2-9c98-3900d729dfe8&VersionNumber=25.2.25.114&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bxEIMy0s3dRn4yo18LcaWcUhxLjh%2fIbme" CS01698582 - AUSCARMVD - Factura DCD por Timeout - URUWARE
feature_description: E-Invoicing - Improve Reversal/Amendment procedure

I think we will need to ask SQL capability about the solution    DZG 11-Feb-25 15:07 GMT+11:00:   Thien has checked with Brett, and it's OK to just drop the columns from the table in schema.      TN2 13-Feb-25 14:34 GMT+11:00:   The column SC_ParentID is actually used to store and save its parent ID into db.   Allocate eDocs module -> Unallocated eDocs tab -> select unallocated eDocs, change the type to such as SHP (shipment) and "Create New Job", it will then save the SHP's ID into Unique ID column (SC_ParentID).  If we dont manually Allocate eDocs, (click Allocate button), the info is saved as if the eDocs is reserved for the Unique ID for later on.    This column is also used to store the barcode ref ID if it is not automatic allocated.  -> Cannot drop this SC_ParentID    DZG 21-Feb-25 14:50 GMT+11:00:   I had a discussion with Jer Min today, the SC_ParentID is only used for unallocated documents to store the reference to their parent business object. So we should keep it.  And I also had a look at the columns in StorageDocs table, seems some columns are not needed for the one in Main database, like SC_ImageDataHasValue, SC_EncryptedDataKey, SC_SCK_MasterKey, SC_ExternalStorageSize, SC_VersionID,  so the StorageDocs table for unallocated documents actually is quite different from the table for allocated documents. So I am thinking if we can remove these two columns from StorageDocs table,  but create a new table to replace the StorageDocs in Main DB with less columns. I am afraid if in the future we add more columns for allocated documents, they will all be added for unallocated documents.  We can set up a meeting to discuss this with Jer Min.

WKI_Summary: VN e-Invoicing | Adjustment - Reason is exceeding 100 characters long
details: When transmitting an adjustment invoice or credit note, inv>adj>rea is mapped from transaction description.   https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=fcb14186-acac-45ef-ae3b-9a82f9b41d7d (page 7, JSON field 'rea')  It usually exceeds the maximum length 100 characters and result in FPT error. "FPT's response: Error: Data too long for column 'adjrea' at row 1".  The workaround is to override the transaction description and requeue.     However, as the amendment is created from Job Billing, and the description is auto composed by reason code + user name, e.g. "AMENDMENT RELATED TO INV 00052184 - IAM - Incorrect Amounts Entered By DEW.Kenneth.Lee Incorrect Amounts".  It's quite annoying for the user to override after transmision and re-queue.   It happens that they will have to perform the action for every single adjustment.     The way to create adjustment positive invoice: Job billing > Amend with Invoice.  The way to create adjustment negative invoice: Job billing > Amend with Credit Note      SOLUTION:   option1. Add a warning message when creating adjustment INV/CRD with description > 100 characters.   option2. Add pre-validation   option3. truncate the inv>adj>rea to be 100 chracters during the mapping for VN eInvoicing.       Discussed internally and we are proposing option 2 - Add Prevalidation.   Prevalidation message:  The adjustment reason exceeds the 100-character limitation. Please override the description and re-queue the transaction.      HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/82f686a2-2581-42b2-b6e1-e6e41d9b13a5?lang=en-gb" CS01984165 - DEWELLHKG - Disallow invoice cancellation on FPT since now on.
feature_description: Invoicing | Adjustment - Reason is exceeding 100 characters long

WKI_Summary: CPW: Updated behaviour for Unsupported Countries and HS Codes
details: GMO 21-Oct-24 18:59 GMT+11:00: The nomenclature items have been chunked into a new work item, HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=678647ab-44ea-4ce3-97f5-d686f66ff591&VersionNumber=24.10.18.107&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b6AoO3LaGYSgCU23qRzKVifMsJYZeYOik" WI00819338 - CPW: Remove nomenclature condition checks  UPN: https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/DevelopmentROPETeam/ET9Ys4SauhJNuwT32nyD0OgBO3v7g5MK295_zMWE3esiWQ?e=am9xzO    Background  BW supports a subset of countries (AU,UK,EU,US,NZ,ZA,SG,etc.)  Currently, if a HS Code is not supported by BW, the commodity is marked as Potential Risk.    Problem Summary  If both the Origin and Destination country are not supported by BW, commodities are marked as PSK, resulting in the job being blocked.  This functionality results in majority of jobs being blocked.    We are unable to differentiate between a country being unsupported and a HS code being unsupported.    Suggested Solution  If a country is not supported, it should be ingored in the risk status calculation and an appropriate warning message should be displayed.  Mark commodities as CLR if both the Origin and Destination countries are not supported    If a country is supported, BW will check if the entire HS Code is valid. If it is not valid, it wil fall back to the longest matching HS Code. Example: 10 digits falls back to 8. An appropriate warning should be displayed in this scenario.  If the fallback does not find a match, the commodity should be set to Potential Risk and a warning should be displayed.  If a country is not supported, BW will check if the first 6 digits are valid as per the WCO HS Code system.    DONE Statements  DONE: Unsupported countries do not block the job  DONE: Entirely Invalid HS Codes block the job  DONE: Partially invalid HS Codes (eg. First 6 digits are valid) fallback to the valid digits.    BWD 18-Oct-24 16:26 GMT+11:00:   Background  BW supports a subset of countries (AU,UK,EU,US,NZ,ZA,SG,etc.)  BW returns nomenclature conditions that apply to a large set of commodity codes    Problem Summary  If both the Origin and Destination country are not supported by BW, commodities are marked as PSK, resulting in the job being blocked.  If nomenclature conditions apply to a commodity, it is marked as PSK and results in the job being blocked.    This functionality results in 95% of jobs being blocked.    Suggested Solution  Mark commodities as CLR if both the Origin and Destination countries are not supported  Mark commodities as CLR if only nomenclature conditions apply and there are no commodity-specific conditions.    DONE Statements  DONE: The job is not blocked if both the Origin and Destination countries are not supported by BW  DONE: The job is not blocked if only nomenclature conditions apply
product_candidate: Updated behaviour for Unsupported Countries and HS Codes

To set just the organisation (default to whatever address is relevant), setup the field in the operational action: WarehouseDocAddress+OrganisationPK    To set the organisation+address, setup the field in the operational action: WarehouseDocAddress+E2_OA_Address    BRS 15-Sep-25 09:30 GMT+10:00:   Our speculation is that there is just a missing public property on JobShipment for this address.    E.g. a consignee oeprational action can be made by adding "ConsigneeDeliveryAddress+OrganisationPK" via the property tree, but warehouse is simply not visible    TG1 10-Jul-25 11:09 GMT+10:00:     Current Functionality: Users have to manually add the Warehouse Org to the shipment address tab in order to create the related Warehouse Receive    Desired Functionality: Ability to bulk update the Warehouse Org on multiple shipment records    Additional information:     29/04/25: For the Order Manager / Warehouse Receive integration, it is possible to default the WHS but this might be tricky as there is some business logic behind which might not be compatible for the Shipment / Warehouse Receive integration. WKI_Summary: eTail V2 Outer Package Status
details: SDL 21-Aug-25 15:19 GMT+10:00:     Background:    There is no way to identify that an outer package has been scanned/received, currently when you scan an outer packge from the consol and the items are CLR the status of the items will change to RLM but nothing on the outer package.   When you dispatch an outer package there is a DCF event added. I propose we add additonal statuses as well as log events (like DCF) to the outer package so that when scanned/received or dipatched they can be identified       I used this consol in HYETIP for testing: HYPERLINK "https://svc-hyetip.cargowise.com/Services/link/ShowEditForm/JobConsol/201e8b02-b9b7-4858-9002-b1a1532e8773?LicenceCode=HYEGBLTIP&lang=en-gb" Consol C00005591 (Master Bill='48820375692')    Done:  1. Package Destination Status column and search filter have been added to ETL / EDP destination depot portals.  2. Package Destination Status column and search filter have been added to CW1  3. Events are logged on Outer Package when package is scanned and dispatched.

WKI_Summary: PVE should nudge BMS and BMT
details: DMK 04-Feb-25 07:31 GMT+11:00:   Currently, the PVE service task may refuse to execute when there are too many worfklows to process:    2025-01-30 00:25:26.4970|DEBUG|PVE|[PAH] > Processing 2616 change(s)  2025-01-30 00:25:26.6870|WARN|PVE|[PAH] Number of changes: 2616 greater than AutoAssignCapabilityTasksMaxNumberOfCDCChanges: 1000; Auto-Assignment will not be processed responsively and will be deferred to the Capability Task Auto-Assignment service task.  2025-01-30 00:25:26.6900|DEBUG|PVE|[PAH] > Processing completed  2025-01-30 00:25:26.6970|DEBUG|PVE|[PAH] > Updating Subscriber High Water Mark (LSN: 000325DA000001000017, SeqVal: 000325D500002E080029, Period: 2501)  2025-01-30 00:25:27.7870|DEBUG|PVE|[PTH] > Processing 2616 change(s)  2025-01-30 00:25:27.7900|WARN|PVE|[PTH] Number of changes: 2616 greater than TransferWorkflowComponentMaximumNumberOfCDCChanges: 1000; Workflow Transfers will not be processed responsively and will be deferred to the Buffer Management Schematic Transfer Runner service task.  2025-01-30 00:25:27.8270|DEBUG|PVE|[PTH] > Processing completed    The subscribers that can display such messages in logs:  - PTH - ProcessHeaderResponsiveTransferSubscriber - reacts to changes in workflows  - PTT - TagLinkResponsiveTransferSubscriber - reacts to changes in tag links (changes in tag links trigger transfer)  - PAH - ProcessHeaderResponsiveAssignmentSubscriber - reacts to changes in workflows    The maximum amounts are defined by the existing registry items:  - Transfer Workflow Component Maximum Number of Changes to Process through BI CDC - for both PTH and PTT  - Auto Assign Capability Tasks Maximum Number of Changes to Process through CDC - for PAH    DE:  When the PTH subscriber encounters too many changes, it should display the message and also nudge the BMS service task.  The same with PTT.  When the PAH subscriber encounters too many changes, it should display the message and also nudge the BMT service task (responsible for capability task auto-assignment).    Implementation:  I am introducing new registry items:  - Delay For Nudging The BMS Service Task By The PVE Service Task - a delay in minutes for nudging the BMS service task by the PVE service task (response to changes in workflows).  - Enable Nudging BMS Service Task By The PVE Service Task  - Delay For Nudging The BMT Service Task By The PVE Service Task - a delay in minutes for nudging the BMT service task by the PVE service task (response to changes in workflows).  - Enable Nudging BMT Service Task By The PVE Service Task    DMK 06-Feb-25 01:40 GMT+11:00:   Also, these two registry items, I believe, are not needed:  - Transfer Workflow Component On Changes Within X Minutes - for both PTH and PTT  - Auto Assign Capability Tasks On Changes Within X Minutes - for PAH    They were introduced to prevent processing too old changes when PVE was disabled for a long time and then was enabled again.  In fact, these two registry item do the same job:  - Transfer Workflow Component Maximum Number of Changes to Process through BI CDC  - Auto Assign Capability Tasks Maximum Number of Changes to Process through CDC    So, I've removed the redundant registry items.    DMK 06-Feb-25 12:12 GMT+11:00:   How to functionally test:  Please ensure these two items are no longer present in the registry:  - Transfer Workflow Component On Changes Within X Minutes  - Auto Assign Capability Tasks On Changes Within X Minutes    Then:  1) Set Transfer Workflow  Component Maximum Number of Changes to Process through BI CDC to 10 (the minimal value).  2) Set Delay For Nudging The BMS Service Task By The PVE Service Task to zero (no delay).  3) Modify 11 workflows (you can use operational actions or something).  4) Run CDC, AET, PVE.  Ensure there is a record in logs like "Nudged the BMS service task." This log should be recorded with the PTH subscriber.  5) Check the logs of the BMS service task. Ensure it started immediately.    Then you can play with the Delay For Nudging The BMS Service Task By The PVE Service Task registry item - set different delays in minutes and ensure the BMS runs with this delay.    Then do the same, but instead of modifying 11 workflows, modify 11 tag links. Running BMS should nudge PVE. The log should be recorded with the PTT subscriber.    Then:  1) Set Auto Assign Capability Tasks Maximum Number of Changes to Process through CDC to 10 (the minimal value).  2) Set Delay For Nudging The BMT Service Task By The PVE Service Task to zero (no delay).  3) Modify 11 workflows (you can use operational actions or something).  4) Run CDC, AET, PVE.  Ensure there is a record in logs like "Nudged the BMT service task."  5) Check the logs of the BMT service task. Ensure it started immediately.    Then you can similarly play with the Delay For Nudging The BMT Service Task By The PVE Service Task registry item - set different delays in minutes and ensure the BMT runs with this delay.
product_candidate: PVE should nudge BMS and BMT

WKI_Summary: CPW: Warning about HS Code length
details: JT3 02-Sep-24 09:54 GMT+10:00:     Problem Summary  When a HS code of more than 6 digits is added to a job, if it does not match a commodity code in either Origin or Destination, in the Commodities grid of the Compliance Risk tab, a warning message advises that only the first 6 digits are considered for compliance risk.   In reality, a match will be attempted to the four-digit HS code in the Tariff schedule, and a warning message will appear to notify the match is at the four-digit HS code. The matched four-digit HS code will be highlighted (see the Commodity Code warning section of the ComplianceWise master UPN - https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=499d436e-b256-45e7-8f73-35fd2396c30a)    Existing warning message: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=e87ca567-e378-484c-a1ee-6c3279892419&StorageDocPK=031e73f9-db19-429e-803e-7abcb24747ba&Hash=%2brFjgNtvFlh2TTNBqZ4oc56qTNpGIZxc5&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" JT3 02-Sep-24 10:17:  File Warning message.tif (Sample File) added to eDocs tab.    Solution:  Remove the existing warning message that mentions 6 digits, and the logic that brings up this warning message.    Create a new warning message that appears when a HS code of more than 6 numbers is displayed in the Commodities grid of the Compliance Risk tab. If this HS codes does not match a commodity code at either Origin or Destination, then the warning message advises that first 4 digits are considered for compliance risk.  NB: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=966c2463-dd68-4a1c-878b-8b002883c3e5&VersionNumber=24.9.2.50&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bv3u%2baU4SZCH%2ff6B1xZay7iycnVofqxEk" WI00716862 - CPW:check, confirm commodity bizo validation, modify if need change contains an investigation done by Mark Dai which lists all existing commodity grid warnings and the logic of when they should appear.    DONE Statements:  1. When a HS code of 6 numbers or more is shown in the Compliance Risk tab, if no matches are found at either Origin or Destination by the BW API, a warning symbol appears next to the HS code  2. The warning message reads as "This Harmonized Code is not recognized. Compliance alerts displayed are based on first 4 digits of the Harmonized Code."

WKI_Summary: IE - Improve IET service task logs
details: SNR 06-Jan-25 10:29 GMT+00:00: An incident was raised by DHL where in IET logs we show:    """Interchange #xxxxx: Status set to 'ERR' due to the following error: Error Processing Transaction ID Request Response.  There is an error in XML document (1, 2)."""    Upon investigation it was found that we set EDI Interchange to ERR as the interchange has ROS errors. Therefore, we need to improve the logs to directly show to ROS error, so that a user will check the logs and know that the issue is with Revenue and reach out to them rather than us.      MTB 07-Jan-25 10:42 GMT+00:00:   This refers to the IET service task.     There is an example of the failing interchange available on SG: Interchange Number: 78975  To replicate, we should be able to create a copy of this interchange locally and run the IET service task.   Note how, in TransactionIdCreator (line 84) we override InboundMessageCreator and call base in order to log the error. Essentially, if we cannot cast the message to a TransactionIdResponse we just throw the exception and get the error "There is an error in XML document (1, 2)"  What we need to do for TransactionIDCreator.CreateMessagesForInterchange is something similar to what we do for MessageCreator.CreateMessagesForInterchange i,e. parse the message, check for a ROS error, and display that error in the service task log.
feature_description: Improve IET service task logs

WKI_Summary: Costa Rica - Org. Reg. Codes - Add CID & CIJ validation+Improve DIM & NIT valida
details: Country COSTA RICA  Sub Project HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAG0SYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=a7a4e948-7a1e-4084-a4b0-e3ede2b55bf6&VersionNumber=25.1.14.50&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b%2fHkbK23%2fiktpGSZYs2H4syUo9RgS7Co8" Project PRJ00050347  Head Project HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAUSSYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=5da8f849-6392-428a-bf02-6fa35d2a52be&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2ba6icvzlBehIlslRQuYs2zRHPSY5jcmNz" Project PRJ00029620  Topic Importance Comments  Add data entry validation controls to CR CID organization registration code.    Add data entry validation controls to CR CIJ organization registration code.    Improve the warning/error Message that is displayed when enter an invalid CR DIM and CR NIT organization registration codes.   High  Currently even though users may input the organization registration codes CR CID and CR CIJ, CargoWise does not validate them. Therefore, we will add length, character and pattern validations to these orgenization registration codes to prevent Costa Rica Login Companies making data entry mistakes.  Although CR DIM and CR NIT Organization registration codes are validated by CargoWise, the Warning/Error Message that is displayed when the user enter an invalid CR DIM and CR NIT codes can be improved to be more useful for Costa Rica Login Companies.  Scope:   HLD (High Level Design) Done Statements:  When the Specification is completed, the following statements will be true:  CargoWise will validate Costa Rica Organization Registration Codes CID, CIJ, DIM and NIT. And if the user enter invalid information for these org reg codes, a meaningful wrning/error message will be displayed.  Other notes:
feature_description: Org. Reg. Codes - Add CID & CIJ validation+Improve DIM & NIT valida

details: DDD 23-Dec-24 17:57 GMT+08:00:     [Suggested Changes]  Steps to Add Purge Settings  two similar cases to refer  case1: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/commit/6d20cde76f8aa0732c8ea90a25b3189506ad2f75?refName=refs%2Fheads%2Fmaster&path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FAccounting%2FAccounting.ElectronicMessaging%2FAccountingElectronicMessagingEDIMessagePurgeSettingsConfig.cs&_a=contents  case 2: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/296963?_a=files    1.Create a New Class  In the relevant project, create a class to access the required Application Code and Message Subtype, inheriting from PurgeSettingsConfig.  remember to Set the remaining application codes also to be 12 months in the config calss (based on RJV's comments below)    2.Specify Purge Period for EDIInterchange with Application Code (see below)  3.Specify Purge Period for Each EDIMessage with Message Subtype (see below)    Team     Application Code Message Sub Type  International Logistics, ediForwarder CI3   (empty)  International Logistics, ediForwarder CMG   (empty)  International Logistics, ediForwarder CMG   CMG  International Logistics, ediForwarder CMG   CMV  International Logistics, ediForwarder CTR   (empty)  International Logistics, ediForwarder CTR   XXX  International Logistics, ediForwarder EDO   CAN  International Logistics, ediForwarder EDO   EDO  International Logistics, ediForwarder EDO   ORG  International Logistics, ediForwarder FWA   XXX  International Logistics, ediForwarder PAT   CAN  International Logistics, ediForwarder PAT   ORG  International Logistics, ediForwarder PAT   REP  International Logistics, ediForwarder PAT   XXX     4.Update Configuration Files   Add the new class to both the EnterpriseApplicationConfiguration.xml Message Purge Settings and MessagePurgeSettingsConfigList elements. ROH 13-Dec-24 11:36 GMT+11:00:   Please see: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=7f93820a-f37c-4218-ac8b-4802e5bb2453&VersionNumber=24.12.13.334&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bRPY8IhSwo35aCWbBjPa6FPkMqt4x%2fl1x" WI00809634 - Generate Error Report for Application Code/Message Sub type not in purge setting    From what I can tell, the application / subtype codes we need to address are:  Team     Application Code Message Sub Type  International Logistics, ediForwarder CI3   (empty)  International Logistics, ediForwarder CMG   (empty)  International Logistics, ediForwarder CMG   CMG  International Logistics, ediForwarder CMG   CMV  International Logistics, ediForwarder CTR   (empty)  International Logistics, ediForwarder CTR   XXX  International Logistics, ediForwarder EDO   CAN  International Logistics, ediForwarder EDO   EDO  International Logistics, ediForwarder EDO   ORG  International Logistics, ediForwarder FWA   XXX  International Logistics, ediForwarder PAT   CAN  International Logistics, ediForwarder PAT   ORG  International Logistics, ediForwarder PAT   REP  International Logistics, ediForwarder PAT   XXX    The instructions from the parent WI are below. WKI_Summary: MHD: Able to set same bearer auth via CreateClient API for multiple clients
details: AD4 14-Jan-25 17:44 GMT+11:00:     Multiple clients can have same bearer authentication.  CreateClient Api - creating 2 or more cleints with same bearer authentication does not throw an error.  Clients created with same bearer authentication point to a single record in MCE_MBE_BearerAuthNavigation table    AD4 13-Jan-25 12:50 GMT+11:00:   Detailed Design:  In MheServiceClientDbAccessor,  1. Add method RetrieveBeareAuthCredentialsAsync to get existing MheBeareAuthCredentials record by MBE_HTTPMethod MBE_CredentialType MBE_Credentials and MBE_AuthServerEndpoint  2. Create method CheckAndUpdateBearerAuthCredentialsAsync which calls RetrieveBearerAuthCredentialsAsync to check if the authentication details exist, if  present, then update the input client's authentication details to the DB BearerAuthCredentials record  3. In method CreateClientAsync, calls CheckAndUpdateBearerAuthCredentialsAsync before adding input mheClient to MheClients set    MHD: Able to set same bearer authentication via CreateClient API for multiple clients    Scope of this Work Item is: Changes to MHE registration CreateClient API to support set same bearer authentication for multiple clients    Background:  We need to register one WMS and many FreightSnap MHEs.  These FreightSnap MHEs will have same bearer authentication (in case they use bearer auth).  Currently, when we use registration CreateClient API to create multiple FreightSnap MHEs, second FreightSnap MHE client creation will throw bearer authentication duplication error
product_candidate: Able to set same bearer auth via CreateClient API for multiple clients

WKI_Summary: ICS2: include Overseas Territories for ICS2 rules
details: NX 12-Jun-25 10:25 GMT+08:00:   Proposed Changes  refer to HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=3fba22d1-d7c1-4c8d-94a2-bddf35592f57&StorageDocPK=3b8997bd-8224-46f6-8c87-061f314e81cb&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bloOe1tl3alSsD0wjm2hW3Eez0ir%2fcJHW" NX 12-Jun-25 10:45:  File update note WI00917637.docx (Update Notes)  $Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Forwarding.Business/Consol/ForwardingConsol.cs   1. rename SeaOrInlandWaterwaysTransports to ICS2Transports   2. Add to ICS2Transports if:    Add to ICS2Transports if the routing leg is discharging in Guadeloupe (GP), Martinique (MQ), French Guiana (GF), Réunion (RE), or Mayotte (YT).   3. refer to HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=8b0b72d7-e30d-4e45-8b98-3efda125ac2f&VersionNumber=25.6.12.40&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b6etIHv93kOO9hdDUpXUV3wR6vPx7jbFU" WI00839551 - Shipping Instruction - ICS2 should not apply when transit between EU, ICS2 should not apply when transit between EU      NDT 03-Jun-25 15:24 GMT+10:00:     Background:  As per https://taxation-customs.ec.europa.eu/taxation/vat/vat-directive/how-does-vat-work/territorial-scope_en French Overseas Territories are part of EU Customs territory and ICS2 applies.  The logic to default ICS2 data into the Shipping Instruction depends on the routing legs on a Consol. If ANY routing leg discharging in EU, Switzerland, Northern Ireland or Norway is detected, the ICS2 data sets are defaulted into the Shipping Instruction form.   Switzerland, Northern Ireland and Norway are hard coded whereas all other European countries are determined by the Economic Group under Maintain > Locations > Countries.  It was dertermined that any changes to EUN against the country code record would have too big an impact on Finance products and we are therefore asked to hardcode those additional locations for ICS2 purposes.    Done:  If any Routing Leg discharging in Guadeloupe (GP), Martinique (MQ), French Guiana (GF), Réunion (RE), and Mayotte (YT) is detected on a Consol, ICS2 dta now also defaults into the Shipping Instruction form.
product_candidate: include Overseas Territories for ICS2 rules

WKI_Summary: MAWB Form - Shipper and Consignee Account No. fields (ACAS item 7 support)
details: AFE 14-Jan-25 16:16 GMT+08:00:    # Done statements    As per HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=083492d5-0454-4731-8376-5c058ea8b323&StorageDocPK=9c3b65df-541c-44b7-ae97-7191f4da11a2&Hash=%2bPSNmlCaUMwf3IZdadm%2f28qaVt2HwvqnT&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" AFE 14-Jan-25 16:36:  File WI00853749_HLD.docx (High Level Design), Shipper and Consignee Account No. fields on MAWB should be populated automatically from:  1. Sending Agent and Receiving Agent organisation code for non-direct consols  2. attached shipment Consignor and Consignee organisation code for direct consols    # Proposed changes    - For Shipper Account, remove `Consol.IsCoLoad` in the if statement. `base.ShipperAccount` has taken care of the different cases for direct and non-direct air consols.  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FExportAWB%2FExportAWBHeader%2FConsolExportAWBHeader.cs&version=GBmaster&line=1820&lineEnd=1823&lineStartColumn=3&lineEndColumn=4&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    - For Consignee Account, apply the same change as Shipper Account  ```ExportAWBHeader.cs  protected virtual ZString ConsigneeAccount  {   get   {    var consignee = ConsigneeDocumentaryAddress?.Organisation;    return consignee != null ? consignee.OH_Code : ZString.Empty;   }  }  ```    ```ConsolExportAWBHeader  protected override ZString ConsigneeAccount  {   get { return Consol != null ? base.ConsigneeAccount : ZString.Empty; }  }  ```    Done: Shipper and Consignee Account No. fields automatically populate on MAWB form    This is a small change to better support ACAS item 7 (Customer Account Number) by automatically populatating the Account No. fields for Shipper/Consignee on the AWB form. This behaviour already works as expected for shipments and HAWB but it does not work for MAWB. For ACAS reporting of Customer Account Number, this means users do not have to manually enter the Account No. on the AWB form.    This change applies to shipments destined or transiting USA and US territories
feature_description: Shipper and Consignee Account No. fields (ACAS item 7 support)

WKI_Summary: GCT to detect MOD of the transport leg from SBR and match on event delivery
details: JK0 16-Oct-25 15:48 GMT+11:00: Source of UAT failure:  This was due to not dealing with null locations, as I incorrectly believed this was not possible. There was a test for that in the location updater. Will move logic to the processor instead and introduce an integration test, so any future changes are properly checked.    JK0 24-Sep-25 12:35 GMT+10:00: Test List  In ContainerEventTransportModeUpdaterTest:  - UpdateTransportModeOnEventDelivery_ForDEP_WhenOneClientSubscriptionTransportLegMatchesLoadPort  - UpdateTransportModeOnEventDelivery_ForFLO_WhenOneClientSubscriptionTransportLegMatchesLoadPort  ^Can be two separate tests that call some shared test function logic for action and assertion or just test cases on the same test    - UpdateTransportModeOnEventDelivery_ForARV_WhenOneClientSubscriptionTransportLegMatchesDischargePort  - UpdateTransportModeOnEventDelivery_ForFUL_WhenOneClientSubscriptionTransportLegMatchesDischargePort  ^Can be two separate tests that call some shared test function logic for action and assertion or just test cases on the same test    - DoesNotUpdateTransportModeOnEventDelivery_ForDEP_WhenMultipleClientSubscriptionTransportLegsMatchLoadPort  - DoesNotUpdateTransportModeOnEventDelivery_ForFLO_WhenMultipleClientSubscriptionTransportLegsMatchLoadPort  ^Can be two separate tests that call some shared test function logic for action and assertion or just test cases on the same test    - DoesNotUpdateTransportModeOnEventDelivery_ForARV_WhenMultipleClientSubscriptionTransportLegsMatchDischargePort    - DoesNotUpdateTransportModeOnEventDelivery_ForFUL_WhenMultipleClientSubscriptionTransportLegsMatchDischargePort  ^Can be two separate tests that call some shared test function logic for action and assertion or just test cases on the same test    * Make sure tests assert all expected logs properly, and verify in sanity check that logs actually show up in Kibana    - In ContainerEventDeliveryProcessorTest  ContainerEventTransportModeUpdaterIsCalled_WhenSetting_UpdateTransportModeToMatchClientSubscriptionTransportLegs_IsEnabled  ContainerEventTransportModeUpdaterIsNotCalled_WhenSetting_UpdateTransportModeToMatchClientSubscriptionTransportLegs_IsDisabled  ^ These can be semi-integration tests using the same test case but with the setting enabled/disabled differently for each    JK0 24-Sep-25 16:53 GMT+10:00: Update: This test file does not exist yet, so should create or investigate where to move these tests    In ClientSubscriptionTransportLegLocationMatcherTest:  - GetTransportLegsMatchingLocationAndCheckForExactMatch_WhenExactMatch_WithSeveralMatches_ReturnsAsExpected JK0 24-Sep-25 14:25 GMT+10:00: return True, out several matches  - GetTransportLegsMatchingLocationAndCheckForExactMatch_WhenExactMatch_WithOneMatch_ReturnsAsExpected JK0 24-Sep-25 14:26 GMT+10:00: return True, one match    - GetTransportLegsMatchingLocationAndCheckForExactMatch_WhenNoExactMatch_WithSeveralMatches_ReturnsAsExpected JK0 24-Sep-25 14:25 GMT+10:00: return False, out several matches  - GetTransportLegsMatchingLocationAndCheckForExactMatch_WhenNoExactMatch_WithOneMatch_ReturnsAsExpected JK0 24-Sep-25 14:26 GMT+10:00: return False, one match    CMA 23-Sep-25 13:25 GMT+10:00:   In ContainerEventDeliveryProcessor, where we call ContainerEventLocationUpdater, we can call a new class, ContainerEventTransportModeUpdater.    -To save overhead, move transportLegs deserialization out to ContainerEventDeliveryProcessor and pass into each class.  We should only update the transport mode on event if there is only 1 transport leg matching location to LoadPort (if DEP/FLO) or only 1 transport leg matching location to DischargePort (if ARV/FUL)  LocationMappings should also be considered. If there is an exact match use it, else check location mappings - this is done in GetMatchedLocationFromTransportLegs, logic should be moved to common location and shared   JK0 24-Sep-25 13:55 GMT+10:00: For this common/shared location - should move static function GetMatchedLocationTransportLegsAndCheckForExactMatch to a common class ClientSubscriptionTransportLegLocationMatcher, that can be DI injected into both ContainerEventLocationDeduplicator and ContainerEventTransportModeUpdater. This function just returns if a match was found and outputs the list of matches, which is what is needed in both classes.   The function should be renamed to GetTransportLegsMatchingLocationAndCheckForExactMatch, since the current name is confusing as it doesn't return a "MatchedLocation" type like the similarly named function in ContainerEventLocationupdater.  ^ i.e. GetMatchedLocationFromTransportLegs != GetMatchedLocationTransportLegsAndCheckForExactMatch AND they return different things (MatchedLocation object vs bool for exact match + list of matches)  ResolveAmbiguities and related logic can stay in ContainerEventLocationUpdater since we do not want to update on multiple matches for the new ContainerEventTransportModeUpdater    Logic can look like:   ContainerEventTransportModeUpdater calls ClientSubscriptionTransportLegLocationMatcher.GetMatchedLocationTransportLegsAndCheckForExactMatch - if output is > 1 then don't update transport mode, else update.   ContainerEventLocationUpdater calls ClientSubscriptionTransportLegLocationMatcher.GetMatchedLocationTransportLegsAndCheckForExactMatch identical to as it did before, just from shared class now  If there is any ambiguity we should not update the TransportMode e.g. 1 Leg with CNSHG LoadPort, 1 leg with CNSHA LoadPort, do not update transport mode when event comes in with CNSHA location   if TransportLegs has IWT and Event has SEA, update Event Transport Mode to IWT on delivery (the event itself still has TransportMode = SEA, similar to location updater) And vice versa for transport leg with SEA and Event IWT  We can have a setting to enable the updating of transport mode, or just to log. Run it for a week initially, analyse results, decide if making the switch is correct    YMK 23-Sep-25 15:01 GMT+10:00: Docs are available for review at https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/ContainerAutomation.Documentation/blob/main/Work-Item-Designs/WI00957262_TransportLegs_Mode_Detection/Design.md  EGLV change is planned in WI00966883 - SeaShanty: Vessel Events for IWT legs with IMO    CMA 19-Sep-25 15:58 GMT+10:00: This seems like a separate WI HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/8132e286-7ccf-4003-aff6-fa2902c02e6a?lang=en-gb" WI00966883 - SeaShanty: Vessel Events for IWT legs with IMO    DONE: GCT to detect MOD of the transport leg from the SBR and then match the MOD on event delivery.   DONE: GCT to substitute the MOD for IWT and SEA transport legs ONLY in order to correctly update routing legs. Do not substitute other TransportModes (e.g. RAI, ROA)   DONE: SS for EGLV gets AIS nudges for IWT vessels with IMO (or we will treat all vessels with IMO as SEA regardless of what carrier's event says)       SMS 29-Aug-25 22:04 GMT+10:00: GCT Similarly to related ports functionality, needs to be able to check SBR and make MOD consistent with the client subscription leg transport mode for event matching https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=0f4e5c59-ab01-4f4d-be94-75b8b4e85c4a  In this incident client has IWT for the feeder leg (imported  from GSS) - HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/c6481418-526a-42c8-83e6-8503f5540717?lang=en-gb" CS02052731 - HAVFREHKG - Unable to auto reflect the Updated ETA in Routing C00144928    The proposed solution might also help some customer that have set their inland transport leg to ROA but then carrier moves it via RAI.     Possible use cases:  1) In this incident client has IWT for the feeder leg (imported  from GSS) - HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/c6481418-526a-42c8-83e6-8503f5540717?lang=en-gb" CS02052731 - HAVFREHKG - Unable to auto reflect the Updated ETA in Routing C00144928  AEJEA -> KWSWK https://ctsportal.wtg.zone/clientsubscriptions/173184020. MOD = IWT > therefore GCT to deliver DEP/ARV for this leg (actual and estimates) as IWT   Currnetly DEP is sent as IWT https://ctsportal.wtg.zone/containerevents/4325269486 and ARV is sent as SEA https://ctsportal.wtg.zone/containerevents/4311209616  Transshipped PortEstimated Arrival DateEstimated Departure DateEstimated Connecting Vessel Voyage  KAOHSIUNG (TW)AUG-04-2025AUG-05-2025EVER LIBERAL 1680-066W  JEBEL ALI (AE)AUG-22-2025AUG-23-2025APL EAGLE 0KPB3W1PL    2) DSV might want to set this to SEA (because vessel has IMO) example DSV here HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/665d4aac-62ea-45ad-8cec-da9414262fae?lang=en-gb" CS02045370 - DSVHHS - DEP with wrong Transport Mode received  FIRAU ->DEHAM https://ctsportal.wtg.zone/clientsubscriptions/173698923 MOD = SEA >  GCT to deliver DEP/ARV for this leg (actual and estimates) as SEA   https://ctsportal.wtg.zone/containerevents#location=FIRAU&searchCarrierBookingReference=5015000158063)     3) inland transport leg e.g. USCHI-USNYC set to ROA but carrier moves it via RAI. GCT needs to check client SBR and deliver DEP/ARV event as ROA so routing tab in CW can update.     LKW 03-Sep-25 17:24 GMT+10:00:   read through the incident, understand there are limitations in SeaShanty/GCT to distinguish the transportMode of a leg (current logic seems to be if there is IMO, set as SEA, otherwise set as IWT). However in the real operation a IWT movement can also be done by a vessel (with IMO), it is difficult to define if a movement is categorized as SEA or IWT. So I think this part is fine.    However I'm quite conservative for point 3. If the movement was by RAI, that shall be delivered to the customer. If it really was by rail, customer shall update their consol to reflect the real operation, instead of receiving an update from Container Automation that "yes this leg was really moved by ROA". I think CA has the responsibility to help the customer identify the discrepancy.    Therefore I suggest to remove point3; the substution only applies between IWT and SEA and not other TransportModes. Say even if user input IWT but eventually we got events from carrier that the movement was ROA, we shouldn't just substitute  1. if GCT was wrong, correct the mapping  2. if customer was wrong, correct the input.    DBA 10-Sep-25 10:25 GMT+10:00:   Identified issue where we are not getting AIS nudges due to treating vessels with IMO as IWT (e.g. EGLV event says Dispatched by barge which would make MOD=IWT regardless of whether IMO is present or not). EGLV gets specifically affected as EGLV does not provide ATA. We can solve it by either treating MOD as SEA for every vessel that has IMO or accept nudging for IWT if vessel has IMO.    Interesting stats pulled by COnor for both SEA vs IWT and RAI vs ROA HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=2b190b31-af1d-415a-847c-7dd69434ad8e&StorageDocPK=e6d02af3-f994-40b9-96e3-5a213d87624a&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2baQ1P3g2oSlDTFVPzBXW%2bVyHr0Jh9qEvT" DBA 10-Sep-25 10:28:  File SEA_IWT_Mismatch_Updated.xlsx (Sample File)    It would be good to review each individual carrier's case but in general I think we are ok to proceed with the IWT & SEA substitution on delivery.    RJV 12-Sep-25 16:48 GMT+10:00:   Hi Dan,  I'm fine with substituting MOD in GCT based on routing transport mode. It is better to get this from GCT.    Thank you
product_candidate: GCT to detect MOD of the transport leg from SBR and match on event delivery

WKI_Summary: !CR7 - DHL [CCA][ALR] Allocation dedicated to Agents, Companies or Branches
details: Done Statement  Allocation Routes can be dedicated to Agents, Companies or Branches.    Initiated from HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=5f72cb7a-7c21-4335-a50b-c159cbcb91d3&VersionNumber=25.1.14.50&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bFtqm86Wjf3G1qMLD8j9Ca3t2A3RptRDc" CS01801550 - DHLGLOBNJ - POC AM002: Ability to set up Allocations using sub-segments or sub-allocations    CJP 11-Mar-25 13:24 GMT+11:00:   Parent Project: PRJ00051100  Project Wiki: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/Shared/_wiki/wikis/Forwarding%20Work%20Item%20Wiki/16479/PRJ00051100-CCA-DHL-Ocean-CCA-MVP-Allocation-dedicated-to-Agents-Companies-or-Branches      WI # Description Assigned To  WI00880963 Schema   WI00880967 Feature Flag   WI00880970 CW UI and Validation   WI00880964 GLOW UI and Validation   WI00880965 ADAW   WI00880966 Finalization       WI00880963 Done Statement:  - Schema change to support Organisation collection for Allocation Routes that are specified as Agents    WI00880967 Done Statement:  - Support Only registry feature flag to hide changes under PRJ00051100 while it is under development.    WI00880970 Done Statement:  - Related Record filter for searching Carrier Contract with Allocation Route records launched from other modules, such as Consols  - Column visible on Allocation Route grids that details the Agents organisations  - A Consol can be allocated to an Allocation Route if the Consol Sending and/or Receiving Agent is listed in the Allocation Routes > Agents list  - Alternatively if the Consol Sending and/or Receiving Agent is an Organization Proxy of a Branch under a Company with its Organization Proxy is included in the Allocation Routes > Agents list, the Consol can also be allocated  - All the above is hidden under support only feature flag introduced in WI00880967    WI00880964 Done Statement:  - New tab 'Agents' is added next to the sub-tab 'Named Account Clients' under tab 'Allocation Routes'  - New tab has grid (Schema is in WI00880963) that allows user to add Organizations to be selected as Agents for that particular Allocation Route  - Should be unique per Allocation Route (No duplicate Organizations for an Allocation Route)  - Related Record filter for filtering Allocation Routes in grid in CCA  - A Consol can be allocated to an Allocation Route if the Consol Sending and/or Receiving Agent is listed in the Allocation Routes > Agents list  - Alternatively if the Consol Sending and/or Receiving Agent is an Organization Proxy of a Branch under a Company with its Organization Proxy is included in the Allocation Routes > Agents list, the Consol can also be allocated  - All these changes should be hidden behind Support Only Feature Flag introduced in WI00880967    WI00880965 Done Statement:  - ADAW import supports Agent Organizations on Allocation Routes    WI00880966 Done Statement:  - Support Only feature flag introduced in WI00880967 is removed  - All requirements specified in the HLD of WI00854801 is addressed  - E2E testing of all functionality is done here.
feature_description: DHL [CCA][ALR] Allocation dedicated to Agents, Companies or Branches

WKI_Summary: !CR7 - DHL [CCA] Support Related Organisation for Customers specific Allocations
details: Done Statement  Named Account Clients (NAC) under Allocation Routes to be renamed as 'Customers'.  A new 'Exclusive' flag is introduced to Allocation Routes > Customers to indicate if the Allocation Routes can be used by the subsidiaries (AMG Related Party) of the Organisations listed under Customers or not.  Allocation Routes > Customers to be validated against Controlling Customer, fallback to Shipper/Consignee based on Incoterm selected of Shipment attached to Consol to be allocated.  Allocation Routes > Customers to be validated against Client, fallback to Shipper/Consignee based on Incoterm selected of Quick Booking / Booking with Quote to be allocated.  New 'AMG - Allocations Management Group' Type is introduced to 'Related Party' setup under Organisation to support nesting hierarchy setup and such setup is respected for searching/utilising Allocation Routes in Consol/QB/BWQ.  Update 'Maximum AMG Hierarchy Depth for Carrier Contract Allocations Search' registry: used only to enfore depth limit on Allocations Search. Validation of Allocation Routes against Consols/Bookings can be more flexible, so no fixed depth limit is required.
