WKI_Summary: ACAS - Item 11-12 - Customer Account Establishment Date and Billing Type
details: Done: CW supports the following ACAS reporting requirements via OCI segment in FWB and FHL messages:    11. Customer Account Establishment Date  12. Customer Account Billing Type    Build Design  JZ4 15-Jan-25 10:36 GMT+11:00:   11.   - NON-DRT  -- FWB  Organisation Creation Date of the Sending Agent  -- FHL  --- (has CCB) if Shipment > Addresses has a Controlling Customer record then Shipment > Addresses > Controlling Customer > Creation Date  --- (No  CCB)  If Consol > AWB > WT/VAL value is prepaid (P), Shipment > AWB > Creation Date of the Shipper Organisation  If Consol > AWB > WT/VAL value is collect (C), Shipment > AWB > Creation Date of the Consignee Organisation  If Shipment > Additional Detail > View/Edit AWB > WT/VAL is B (Both) then Shipment > Basic Registration > Incoterm is checked for P (Freight Prepaid) or C (Freight Collect) to determine the status    - DRT  -- (has CCB) if Shipment > Addresses has a Controlling Customer record then Shipment > Addresses > Controlling Customer > Creation Date  -- (No  CCB)  If Consol > AWB > WT/VAL value is prepaid (P), Consol > AWB > Creation Date of the Shipper Organisation  If Consol > AWB > WT/VAL value is collect (C), Consol > AWB > Creation Date of the Consignee Organisation   If Consol > AWB > WT/VAL is blank, then Shipment > Additional Detail > View/Edit AWB > WT/VAL is checked for P (Freight Prepaid) or C (Freight Collect) to determine   If Shipment > Additional Detail > View/Edit AWB > WT/VAL is B (Both) then Shipment > Basic Registration > Incoterm is checked for P (Freight Prepaid) or C (Freight Collect) to determine the status    Format: DDMMMYY    12.  Non-DRT  -- FWB  --- Organisation > A/P > Configuration > Credit Details > Agreed Payment Method  cannot determine: --- Registry > Accounting > Payable Defaults > Default Payment Type    -- FHL  --- (has CCB) if Shipment > Addresses has a Controlling Customer record then Organisation > A/P > Configuration > Credit Details > Agreed Payment Method  --- (No  CCB)  If Consol > AWB > WT/VAL value is prepaid (P), Shipment > AWB > Agreed Payment Method of the Shipper Organisation  If Consol > AWB > WT/VAL value is collect (C), Shipment > AWB > Agreed Payment Method of the Consignee Organisation  If Shipment > Additional Detail > View/Edit AWB > WT/VAL is B (Both) then Shipment > Basic Registration > Incoterm is checked for P (Freight Prepaid) or C (Freight Collect) to determine the status  cannot determine: --- Registry > Accounting > Payable Defaults > Default Payment Type      - DRT  -- (has CCB) if Shipment > Addresses has a Controlling Customer record then Organisation > A/P > Configuration > Credit Details > Agreed Payment Method  -- (No  CCB)  If Consol > AWB > WT/VAL value is prepaid (P), Consol > AWB > Agreed Payment Method of the Shipper Organisation  If Consol > AWB > WT/VAL value is collect (C), Consol > AWB > Agreed Payment Method of the Consignee Organisation  If Consol > AWB > WT/VAL is blank, then Shipment > Additional Detail > View/Edit AWB > WT/VAL is checked for P (Freight Prepaid) or C (Freight Collect) to determine   If Shipment > Additional Detail > View/Edit AWB > WT/VAL is B (Both) then Shipment > Basic Registration > Incoterm is checked for P (Freight Prepaid) or C (Freight Collect) to determine the status  cannot determine: --- Registry > Accounting > Payable Defaults > Default Payment Type      Warning should be added when ACAS is needed but the above message is not determined.    UT should cover the above cases and fallbacks.    Proposed code changes:  Create 2 new functions GetCustomerAccountEstablishmentDate(), GetCustomerAccountBillingType() to interface IACASCountryHandler  Implement these functions in class UsaACASCountryHandler to generate data based on consol carrier /shipmentHeader carrier (with different fallback scenarios, details are mentioned above)  Call these 2 functions in FBase.cs to generate these 2 lines  Call these 2 functions in ConsolAWBActions.cs to generate the warning
feature_description: Item 11-12 - Customer Account Establishment Date and Billing Type

WKI_Summary: [ING] Link Incidents to groups from Incident Form
details: Incidents can be linked to an ING from the ING. Some people involved in the incident are more likely to be looking at it from perspective of the incident, so add the ability to link the incident to the ING from the INC.    Specification: HYPERLINK "https://wisetechglobal-my.sharepoint.com/:x:/p/wally_crocker/EUVKQVWx7sZKuXbRiwDT1uoBtEBqSFh0IoOUJistoGWdag?e=E5qvpz" WI00927676 - Link groups from Incident Form.xlsx    CG6 18-Jul-25 10:41 GMT+08:00:   Tech Design:  1.Add IncidentManagementGroup in WorkTaskRelatedItemModuleInfo.cs  public static WorkTaskRelatedItemModuleInfo IncidentManagementGroup(BusinessObjectFactory factory)  {      return new WorkTaskRelatedItemModuleInfo      {          Caption = "Incident Management Group",          AllowNew = false,          AllowAttach = true,          ControllerID = ClientControllerRegistration.IncidentManagementGroup,          ModuleID = ClientModuleRegistration.IncidentManagementGroup,          FindBoxList = new IncidentManagementGroupCollection(factory),          AdditionalFilterForFindBox = null      };  }  2.update SupportedRelatedItemModules in SupportIncident.cs  public IEnumerable<WorkTaskRelatedItemModuleInfo> SupportedRelatedItemModules  {      get      {          yield return EDIWorkTaskRelatedItemModuleInfo.Issue(Factory);          yield return EDIWorkTaskRelatedItemModuleInfo.NewWorkItem(Factory, allowNew: true, GetLinkedToWorkItemAsDefectCausingWorkItemQuery());          yield return EDIWorkTaskRelatedItemModuleInfo.EDIProject(Factory);          yield return EDIWorkTaskRelatedItemModuleInfo.IncidentManagementGroup(Factory); // New          yield return EDIWorkTaskRelatedItemModuleInfo.GenericIncident(Factory, allowAttach: true, allowNew: true);          yield return EDIWorkTaskRelatedItemModuleInfo.Opportunity(Factory, allowNew: true, this);      }  }  3.  override AddAttachMenuItem() in EDIWorkTaskRelatedItemUserControl.cs    protected override void AddAttachMenuItem(KContextMenuStrip contextMenuStrip, string caption, ControllerID controllerID, EventHandler onClick)    {     if (controllerID == ClientControllerRegistration.IncidentManagementGroup)     {      AttachIncidentManagementGroupMenuItem = new ZToolStripMenuItem();      AttachIncidentManagementGroupMenuItem.Name = "attachIncidentManagementGroupButton";      AttachIncidentManagementGroupMenuItem.Text = Res.GetString("b7b4f55f-81c8-48a9-bb7f-b136de7b5e98", "Incident Management Group");        var controlledIncidentMenuItem = new ZToolStripMenuItem(ResString.GetMultilingualString("b988853e-3c8c-44fe-a9b8-9deda276c366", "Controlled Incident"));      controlledIncidentMenuItem.Click += ControlledIncidentMenuItem_Click;      AttachIncidentManagementGroupMenuItem.DropDownItems.Add(controlledIncidentMenuItem);        var relatedIncidentMenuItem = new ZToolStripMenuItem(ResString.GetMultilingualString("bf7ccb67-fc0d-442d-9b02-21787e0fa539", "Related Incident"), onClick);      AttachIncidentManagementGroupMenuItem.DropDownItems.Add(relatedIncidentMenuItem);        contextMenuStrip.Items.Add(AttachIncidentManagementGroupMenuItem);     }     else     {      base.AddAttachMenuItem(contextMenuStrip, caption, controllerID, onClick);     }    }      void ControlledIncidentMenuItem_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)    {     ModuleIdentifier moduleID = ClientModuleRegistration.IncidentManagementGroup;     LastAttacher = new LinkedIncidentsGridAttacher(RelatedItemSource.RelatedItems, new IncidentManagementGroupCollection(new BusinessObjectFactory()), moduleID, (SupportIncident)CurrentDataItem);     LastAttacher.Show((IZForm)FindForm());    }      5. Add a internal class in EDIWorkTaskRelatedItemUserControl.cs  internal class LinkedIncidentsGridAttacher : ZRecordAttacher  {   readonly SupportIncident supportIncident;     public LinkedIncidentsGridAttacher(IBusinessObjectCollection destinationCollection, IBusinessObjectCollection findBoxList, ModuleIdentifier moduleID, SupportIncident supportIncident)    : base(destinationCollection, findBoxList, moduleID)   {    this.supportIncident = supportIncident;   }     protected override bool AttachCore(BusinessObject bizO, List<BusinessObject> listToBulkAdd)   {    var loadedGroup = bizO.Factory.Load<IncidentManagementGroup>(bizO.PK);    if (loadedGroup != null && !loadedGroup.IsDeleted)    {     var result = DialogResult.Yes;     if (result != DialogResult.Cancel)     {      var link = supportIncident.Factory.New<IncidentManagementLink>();      link.INL_IM_Incident = supportIncident.PK;      link.INL_ING_Group = loadedGroup.PK;      link.INL_GS_NKResponder = loadedGroup.ING_GS_NKDefaultResponder;      link.INL_IsGroupControlled = result == DialogResult.Yes;      // RelatedItems.Add is used to add incidentManagementGroup to the RelatedItems of the incident, listToBulkAdd.Add is used to display the newly added items in the linked incidents grid before clicking the save button.      link.SupportIncident.RelatedItems.Add(loadedGroup);      listToBulkAdd.Add(link);      return true;     }    }      return false;   }  }
product_candidate: [ING] Link Incidents to groups from Incident Form

WKI_Summary: Turn off Audit Events for Exit Control
details: JPG 16-May-25 10:48 GMT+10:00:  The purpose of this WI is to turn off Audit Event logging (by default) for the main Exit Control tables. See the following links for an overview of what we want to achieve:    https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/ArchiveManager/EUUiOSoELGRNsSGhAzlT16kBowtezPrVVdNV3H4dxM3N9g?e=FWtKxN    Guide: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/13383/Turning-off-Audit-Events  Sample PR: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/291327    REQ001: Remove the AutoLoggingState override from the following classes (that is, turn off auto logging):    Enterprise.Customs.EU.ExitContro.Business.CusExitHeader    REQ002: Add the following tables to AutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValue (https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FWorkflow%2FWorkflow.Business%2FAuditStmALog%2FAutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValues.cs&version=GBmaster&_a=contents)    CusExitHeader    This enable 2 things:  When the registry is on for a particular table, then StmALog events will be created as if IsAutoLogged were turned on.  When the registry if off, then NonPersistedStmALog events will be create. These will allow workflow to work on EDT/ADD events, but it will not actually persist the events in StmALog (which is the real goal here).    --    The CusExitHeader table should already be in the Audit DB and visible on the Exit Control form:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=2a6853b7-0cdd-41fe-b9cc-cf2463081e1f&VersionNumber=25.5.16.53&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b88rAYOJNvY69ruWxoGh13P6eeLUF0ot7" WI00910020 - Enable Audit Data tab for Exit Control
product_candidate: Turn off Audit Events for Exit Control

WKI_Summary: Compliance requirement for including HS code on the AWB- add generic warning
details: Requirement: To ensure regulatory compliance, it is mandatory to include the Harmonised System (HS) code on the Air Waybill (AWB) where required by local customs authorities.    Done statement: For countries where a validation is not yet in place to notify users of a missing or mandatory HS code on the AWB (e.g. EU, UAE, Indonesia, etc.), a warning to be added to the 'Nature & Quantity of Goods' section of both the Master and House Air Waybills. This warning should inform users that an HS code is missing for at least one pack line of Sxxxxxxxx and may be required to meet local customs reporting requirements.      SDF 07-Jul-25 16:18 GMT+08:00:   In https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/master/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Forwarding.Business/ExportAWB/ExportAWBRateLines/NatureAndQtyOfGoodsValidation.cs    Modify the method CheckText(). When there is a packline that has not been assigned an HS Code, display the following warning:   "Certain airlines request an HS code for customs reporting purposes. Please enter the HS code on the pack line(s), or override and select H identifier to include it".     Note that this should not affect the content of the warning messages for the several countries listed in HLD.
product_candidate: Compliance requirement for including HS code on the AWB
feature_description: add generic warning

WKI_Summary: [MYA.SYN] Evaluate active staff count and trigger full sync request if mismatch
details: Requirement  Evaluate reported staff count implemented in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=8047942a-31f1-4754-a591-cea6d931745b&VersionNumber=24.10.15.42&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2beixhFh2wSxkn2S08Oyw0aDFWVXs3Cfh%2f" WI00816730 - [MYA.SYN] Client side version reporter sends active user count  If staff count is not present, do nothing  If staff count is present then evaluate against appropriate system user account list in ediprod  If match, do nothing  If mismatch, trigger full staff list sync request to client  Perform count comparison after any contact sync from the version report have been executed      This is an ediprod development      JH0 10-Jan-25 16:51 GMT+11:00:   We now also have HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=400c43ac-98c7-4807-ae99-d6462ece448c&VersionNumber=25.1.10.97&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bqdFZO5RG9SUStFVyHchdDfWEoRx1zVe5" WI00848156 - [MYA.SYN] Client side version reporter sends active branch count which is a prereq for this  I've updated the spec but it's based on the original spec for WI00816730    FMT 19-Feb-25 09:50 GMT+11:00: Design  UserAccountReport.cs  - update ExtractUserAccountInfo to retrieve the staff and branch count  UserAccountReportProcessor  - on Process, after everything was done #44, create the logic to branches and staffs  - to retrieve staff and branch count, use the same logic used to populate the xml (UserAccountReport.AddStaffCount and UserAccountReportAddTotalNonDemoBranchCount)  - if they don't match, request full Staff list from CW1 otherwise do nothing   - to request the list of staff we just need to call ClientStaffReportRequest.Send    FMT 04-Jun-25 10:46 GMT+10:00: Design Update:  on UserAccountReportProcessor.RequestStaffList, instead of comparing the StaffCount from the XML with the GlbStaff count we should compare against EdiCustomerUserAccount count  AGA 04-Jun-25 13:06 GMT+10:00: The EdiCustomerUserAccount count with EUA_LD = database.PK    FMT 17-Jul-25 10:54 GMT+10:00: Design Update: After discussing with John:  1- we will add a SYS log message when requesting the full list to inform the user  2- add a validation in the logic to request the full list, that we will request the full list just if the Licence Database is of the type Productions. The reason for this change is that when we call the UAR task, the service will just sync the users if the LD type = production, otherwise, the service task will just deactivate the current User Accounts if they are disabled in the CW1 system, it will not sync any new one, so the staff count will never match

WKI_Summary: Enhancement -  Print Tax Date in AR Invoice Document Registry
details: JMN 13-Sep-24 10:36 GMT+10:00: Enhance registry Print Tax Date in AR Invoice Document Registry so it prints the Latest available Tax Date (from the charge line) on Header Level.    This registry currently can print tax date on line level, header level or not print tax date.    For the Header Level printing selection, it currently selects the earliest recorded tax date from the transaction lines.    This enehancement is to enhance this selection so that it can print the latest tax date from the available transaction lines.    The requirement is important for Hungary as they deem the latest tax date as the significant date.
feature_description: Print Tax Date in AR Invoice Document Registry

WKI_Summary: [MYA.WTA] Return list of active contact_pks for each person_pk
details: A new service which gets a list of person_pk and for each person_pk in the list returns the list of active contact_pks:      * Input: List<string> person_pks      * Output: For each person_pk return list of active contact pks including:          OrgCode          WebAccess          Branch  Proposed timeline for this change: First week of September    Problem:  The problem is that we want to update our users' status with CW. Currently, when a user gets deactivated on CW, we don’t have any way to deactivate their account in WTA unless admins do that from AdminPro. In this project, we want to enable automatic deactivation. Using this service, we will get all the information we need to know whether this user is still active in the related domain on our side or not.  We need to call this service regularly (once a day) and update our users.      Varona Chen (VRC) 08-Oct-25 23:11 GMT+11:00:  web API endpoint has been created for WTA to call    VRC 09-Oct-25 15:48 GMT+11:00:   enhancement WI created to add index on OC_IsActive  https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/21683998-6641-454a-afbb-6089ec5b462d?lang=en-gb
product_candidate: [MYA.WTA] Return list of active contact_pks for each person_pk

WKI_Summary: Unify EDIInterchange Status and TransportType patterns
details: We currently store interchanges for eAdaptor, eHub and xT in the EDIInterchange table.    Each one of these uses different states in the EI_Status column and only xT messages leverage the new EI_TransportType column.    Ideally, they should all leverage the new TransportType column properly as the way to know this message is going through that particular type of transport.    Once they all leverage the TransportType, there should be no need for such divergence of the EI_Status.  They shouldn't each need their own status for queued or pending for example.    Once that has been achieved, then really there is less need for so many disparate indexes.  The patterns of use should be consistent and so should the indexes.    ITN 27-Mar-25 11:03 GMT+11:00:     Business Requirements:    What we are looking to do here is to make all interchanges consistently use the EI_Status and EI_TransportType when they are queued.  So the only difference between queued eAdaptor, eHub and xT interchanges should be the EI_TransportType.    So the following changes in EI_Status should occur:    HQU (eHubQueued) should be changed to QUE with EI_TransportType = HUB  AQU (eAdaptorQueued) should be changed to QUE with EI_TransportType = EAD    This will allow us to delete HQU and AQU from the list of possible EI_Status values (will require transformations).    ITN 08-Apr-25 15:27 GMT+10:00:     Design:    We decided that at present there are two many descrepancies between the different systems and service tasks that use EDIInterchange to successfully unify the indexes at present.  Having separate indexes is probably the most effective manner to manage it with high performance at present.    So in this WI we should focus on just unifying the status and transport types as per the business requirements above.
product_candidate: Unify EDIInterchange Status and TransportType patterns

WKI_Summary: Malaysia e-Invoice - Self-billed - allow MSIC 00000

Task 1:    In HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=f09c76e5-baba-4995-8c65-3d1c0d321afb&VersionNumber=24.9.2.50&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bqZWoyipcuhYnI8NsqXVR%2fJepRcSzWIM3" WI00659268 - Malaysia's SIC Number Validation , a list of MSIC code is added to CW1. WKI_Summary: TM2: Simplify product hierarchies in PRE
details: BRS 23-Oct-25 07:34 GMT+11:00:   FUNCTIONAL REVIEWER:    See design below. We are simplifying how the Products are setup for PRE to simplify the code, but also remove the unnecessary differences.  ProductStyle details, ABCCategory and UnitPrice have been applied to Products across: Allocation, Putaway, Cycle Count Task Creation and Task Breakdown (Unload, Transfer, Cycle Count, Pick)  Ensure other fields are still visible on the product, that the other fields specifically shown for allocation (pick face related) or putaway (putaway group, dangerous goods)    BRS 18-Aug-25 18:23 GMT+10:00:   Wip dev changes: HYPERLINK "https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/pull/9436" WI00919944 - TM2: Simplify product hierarchies in PRE by WTG-BrentonSmith · Pull Request #9436 · WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise    Required:  - Test and implement ctor for CycleCountProductFact  - Add tests for CycleCountLocationFactLoader  - Add implementation for CycleCountLocationFactLoader  - Task management tests and implementation    BRS 11-Aug-25 20:20 GMT+10:00:   ## Goal  Flatten product hierarchies by moving common fields into the base `IProductFact` so rule writers see a consistent, richer set of product attributes across PRE (including TM2).    Reduce interface sprawl and future maintenance as the current setup created tecnical debt.    ## Today  - `IProductFact` (base) shows only: Code, CategoryCode, CommodityCode.  - Extra fields live in derivatives:    - `IProductStyleFact`: StyleCode, StyleColorCode, StyleSizeCode, StyleClassificationCode.    - `IProductValueFact`: ABCCategoryCode, UnitPrice.    Where product fields appear today (by rule screen)  - Allocation (Order Line): shows base + Style fields + fields related to attribute/pickface usage.  - Putaway Inventory: shows base + Style + Value fields + StockUQ + DangerousGoods fields + PutawayGroup.  - TM2 Breakdown (Pick/Transfer/Unload): shows base fields only.  - Cycle Counting (Task creation and TM2 cycle count): shows base + Value fields.    ## Proposal (Flatten to base)  Move these fields into `IProductFact`:  - Style    - `ProductStyleCode`    - `ProductStyleColorCode`    - `ProductStyleSizeCode`    - `ProductStyleClassificationCode`  - Value    - `ABCCategoryCode`    - `UnitPrice`    And remove these from derived interfaces to avoid duplication. Keep truly context specific properties (e.g., PutawayGroupCode, DangerousGoods for Putaway, attribute fields for allocation) on their specialized interfaces.    HYPERLINK "https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/pull/4595" WI00919944 - TM2: Simplify product hierarchies in PRE by WTG-BrentonSmith · Pull Request #4595 · WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared    BRS 08-Jun-25 13:48 GMT+10:00:   I think the product hierarchies (inheriting from IProductFact) in PRE are unnecessarily complex, let's try and flatten these are much as possible    Specifically, I think IProductValueFact + IProductStyleFact should be in the base interface and StockUQ should be moved off putaway into the base.    As part of this, also use those more derived interfaces in the TM2 breakdown facts    Consult with product, recommend distinguishing between unnecessary fields and ones that are actually not useful. If adding a specific field to the base is "not useful" but reduces technical debt and simplifies future PRE usage, this is probably a good tradeoff.

WKI_Summary: Adjust DLY event update note
details: This work item is to edit the following update note: HYPERLINK "https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=19d3a597-79b3-4fb9-bf8b-b5f3f5ed08ac" Schedule Delayed Event Completion Trigger Action    The following excerpts from the update note can be interpreted as including functionality that this update was not intended to support at the time of release:    "It is possible for a trigger to have more than one (1) DLY completion trigger action configured. It is, therefore, possible for a trigger to have more than one (1) DLY event scheduled for the future. Each DLY event will be distinguishable by its different offset and/or reference values."    "Note that the original scheduled delayed events remain visible in the grid. At their scheduled time, the system will ignore scheduled delayed events if it finds more recently added delayed events  generated by the same DLY completion trigger action, as in this case. This ensures that each DLY  completion trigger action will only result in a single DLY event being raised."    It is not explained that a trigger with a single Completion Trigger (DLY) action can schedule multiple DLY events, but once one DLY event is raised, no futher DLY events can be raised from that same completion trigger action. The update note should be updated to make this clear.    A CR6 feature request has been raised to capture this gap for future consideration.    DMK 11-Sep-25 13:40 GMT+10:00:   Regarding the feature request. I think, the customer needs to be able to decide in each case whether the TAS actions to generate DLY events should be processed once or multiple times - in other words, whether we allow multiple generation of the same DLY event (events with the same key fields in the event reference) or not. In some cases it maybe enough to generate just one DLY event - for instance, prepare some documents in advance. That's how it's implemented now - DLY events are generated just once. Multiple generation in such cases may not be desirable. In other cases, in contrast, the customer (as in the incident) may want to process all TAS actions to generate multiple DLY events - for instance, to send an email on every change of an estimated arrival time. If we want to make it possible, the first approach is to add a new field to trigger action that will be available for DLY events only - a drop down list with options like "Action once" and "Action multiple times". In order to pass this information into WorkflowDelayedEventProcessor we'll probably need to add a new parameter to the TAS actions references in WorkflowDelayedEventScheduler (currently, TAS actions have ACT - action reference, EVT - event type, OFF - offset and EST - actual/estimate flag). WorkflowDelayedEventProcessor would get this parameter from the TAS action reference and decide if it needs to check if the DLY event was already generated. Thus, the customer will be able to set up this behaviour for every DLY action individually.    Also, consider the following. Currently, action references on DLY actions are needed to allow identification of all TAS actions related to the DLY action that generates them. We need it to determine if there are more recent TAS actions scheduled for the same DLY action. Maybe, "more recent action" is not a proper term - "the action with the latest scheduled time" is a better description. So, if the customer receives repetitive event estimations, only the one with the latest date time will result in DLY event generation. I think, it's not reflected in the update notes - probably we need to add it. And I am not sure if it's right. Now we have ScheduleOrRescheduleAction() on ActionScheduleProvider - currently, if it finds a scheduled action with the same targetPK, targetTableCode, etc. it reschedules it. We use job PK as targetPK. If we switch from using job PKs to DLY action PKs, we won't need the DLY action reference to identify scheduled actions. Or we could introduce a possibility to search scheduled actions by their tokens and use DLY action PK as a token. However, it raises questions on backward compatibility with already scheduled actions in the system, so this approach is not ideal. However, if we overcome the problem of backward compatibility, we won't need DLY action references for identifying "more recent schedules" - there will always be just one not yet executed schedule for a given DLY action. The behaviour will change: when the customer receives repetitive event estimations, the TAS action will be rescheduled every time resulting in only the last estimation to be effective. I think, it's more correct behaviour.  So, if we go this way, DLY action reference becomes not mandatory anymore and we can modify the behaviour this way: if the user sets a non-empty action reference for a DLY action, we don't change the existing behaviour: if the DLY event is generated, we don't generate it again - we check for existing events in StmALog with the same action reference. However, when the customer sets an empty action reference, we can skip this check allowing multiple DLY events generation. It's just a consideration. I think, we need to change the way how we schedule/reschedule actions to achive more consistent behaviour and maybe we will be able to benefit from that.

WKI_Summary: [S2S] Rollback Application in service task
details: JWU 23-Oct-24 15:34 GMT+08:00:   We manually rollback the application when the customer's license got teared down currently. However, we can make this process automatically.    License team would make the license database inactive when the customer does not use CW1 anymore. In our service task AAP, we could check the application whether the license is inactive, if yes, then rollback the application.    JWU 31-Oct-24 09:25 GMT+08:00:   1. Nudge AAP service task with query    [assembly: HostedServiceBusinessObjectBinding(   ClientSpecificCode = Clients.EDI,   ServiceTaskCode = AzureApplicationProcessingServiceTask.Code,   Table = LicenceDatabaseSchema.Constants.TableName,   Predicates = new[]   {    LicenceDatabaseSchema.Constants.LD_IsActive + "=N",    LicenceDatabaseSchema.Constants.LD_Product + "=CW1"   },   QueueName = "Inactive License Applications Queue"  )]    2. Service Task Query    LEFT JOIN {LicenceDatabaseSchema.Constants.SqlSchemaName}.{LicenceDatabaseSchema.Constants.TableName}   ON {LicenceDatabaseSchema.Constants.PK} = {EdiIdentityApplicationSchema.Constants.IDA_LD}    WHERE {EdiIdentityApplicationSchema.Constants.IDA_IsActive} = 1  AND (  {EdiIdentityApplicationSchema.Constants.IDA_ClientID} = ''    OR {EdiIdentityApplicationSchema.Constants.IDA_RedirectUrlStatus} = '{EdiIdentityApplicationRedirectUrlStatus.Codes.Nudged}'  OR ({EdiIdentityApplicationSchema.Constants.IDA_RedirectUrlStatus} ='{EdiIdentityApplicationRedirectUrlStatus.Codes.Scheduled}' AND  {EdiIdentityApplicationSchema.Constants.IDA_RedirectUrlLastSyncTimeUtc} < '{ZDateTime.UtcNow.AddDays(0 - EDIDataRegistry.Instance.AzureApplicationRedirectUrlSyncInterval.Value).ToISO8601String()}')    OR {EdiIdentityApplicationSchema.Constants.IDA_IsRollback} = 1    OR ({LicenceDatabaseSchema.Constants.LD_IsActive} = 0)    OR ({EdiIdentityCertificateSchema.Constants.ICE_IsActive} = 1  AND ({EdiIdentityCertificateSchema.Constants.ICE_ProcessingStatus} = '{EdiIdentityCertificateProcessingStatus.Codes.PRC}'  OR {EdiIdentityCertificateSchema.Constants.ICE_ProcessingStatus} = '{EdiIdentityCertificateProcessingStatus.Codes.CAN}'  OR {EdiIdentityCertificateSchema.Constants.ICE_CertificateExpiryDate} < '{ZDateTime.UtcNow.ToISO8601String()}')))    OR ({EdiIdentityApplicationSchema.Constants.IDA_IsActive} = 0 AND {LicenceDatabaseSchema.Constants.LD_IsActive} = 1)    3. Process Application     var license = application.LicenceDatabase;  if (license != null && !license.LD_IsActive)  {   application.IDA_IsRollback = true;  }    if (application.IDA_IsRollback && application.IDA_IsActive)  {   RollbackApplication(application);   processedSuccessfulCount++;   return;  }    if(license != null && license.LD_IsActive && !application.IDA_IsActive){   application.LD_IsActive= true; JWA 04-Nov-24 12:26 GMT+08:00: Need to set IDA_IsRollback to false as well   return;  }    JWA 31-Oct-24 14:21 GMT+08:00:   What if the LicenceDatabase item is actived again?    JWU 31-Oct-24 16:44 GMT+08:00:   We could not detect if the license database is from inactive to active. I'd say manually do it.     JWA 01-Nov-24 10:06 GMT+08:00:   We can add filter to find the applications to be activated, the sql should be like:  select * from Application left join Licencedatabase where LD_IsActive = 1 and IDA_IsRollback = 1

WKI_Summary: Removal of BIN prefix from FWB and FHL for air shipments to Bangladesh
details: AFE 22-May-25 11:29 GMT+08:00:   # Done Statements  Remove 'BIN' prefix from FWB/FHL messages for Import Air shipments to Bangladesh.    # Proposed Changes  The BIN type is the display text for 'VAT' code type, which was implemented by HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=c6534a37-3145-4cf2-9b80-c15b153182f6&VersionNumber=25.5.22.64&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bW6v6MbNAoqSn%2bvlJo6n%2f2wlpYLTuRdfO" WI00625329 - Bangladesh BIN (importer) in Manifest and Docstrip  The mapping is defined in the RefDocOrgCusCode table of the reference database, see HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=cf5c926b-19e2-4ec9-8b21-89b6bb4cc187&StorageDocPK=f664ac25-8491-4813-aa2d-3e36b6a69f22&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bqLPEHp0SVfusdOd%2fP9n6EIOsiZZET9Ne" AFE 22-May-25 13:05:  File Screenshot_2025-05-22_13-04-08.jpg (Internal Correspondence)    With that being said, the EH_ConsigneeTraderNoType property will be set to 'BIN' when trying to populate the AWB from 'VAT' code type  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FExportAWB%2FExportAWBHeader%2FExportAWBHeader.cs&version=GBmaster&line=2269&lineEnd=2269&lineStartColumn=4&lineEndColumn=107&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    In FWB/FHL messages, the EH_ConsigneeTraderNoType property is used in the FBase.GetConsigneeTraderCode and FBase.GetAlsoNotifyTraderCode methods  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FAWB%2FBusiness%2FMessaging%2FFBase.cs&version=GBmaster&line=495&lineEnd=517&lineStartColumn=3&lineEndColumn=4&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  We need to make the following changes to these two methods: When the shipment is Air and Import to Bangladesh, EH_ConsigneeTraderNoType = BIN, then leave out the code and generate the message only with the number, just like what the EOR/MVA/UID code does.  Create new VATCountryHandler for Bangladesh      --------  you can check following source code as well https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FExportAWB%2FExportAWBHeader%2FCountryHandlers%2FArgentinaVATCountryHandler.cs&version=GBmaster&line=7&lineEnd=7&lineStartColumn=2&lineEndColumn=54&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  SVI 06-May-25 15:55 GMT+10:00:  Reason for Change: Carriers are rejecting shipments when a BIN prefix is included in the FHL/FWB messages, as they receive similar rejections from BD Customs. The customs system truncates the numeric portion of the BIN when a prefix is present, leading to non-compliance. As a result, BD Customs has instructed carriers to ensure BINs are submitted in the correct format. Carriers are now passing this requirement down to forwarders.  Requirement: Remove BIN prefix from FWB and FHL for air imports to Bangladesh. Refer to the following document for further details:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=cf5c926b-19e2-4ec9-8b21-89b6bb4cc187&StorageDocPK=cdb69060-9b9f-4693-b914-7e73102e3d89&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=ediprod&Hash=%2bVYPSJlpzHdJucZ4jo838RDUgr%2fosdXh8" SVI 06-May-25 16:05:  File BIN prefix Bangladesh.docx (Client Correspondence / Screenshots)
product_candidate: Removal of BIN prefix from FWB and FHL for air shipments to Bangladesh

WKI_Summary: CPW: Security Rights for Commodity Risk Prompt
details: JT3 09-Jan-25 11:48 GMT+11:00:     Desired Effects:  1. Customers can control who has access to perform commodity risk check or decline     2. Customer must decide to perform check or decline on a job-by-job basis     3. Users without permission to make decision do not see the popup     4. Users that do not see the popup can escalate job for review     5. Job cannot proceed till decision is made      DONE Statements:   1. There is a security right for initiating compliance assessments on Shipments and Bookings  2. The security for declining a compliance assessment on Shipments and Bookings has been renamed. Functionality remains unchanged  3. Users without this security right cannot initiate a compliance assessment on Shipments/Bookings  4. Users without the security right to initiate or decline a compliance assessment, see a variation of the Commodity Risk prompt when trying to deliver a restricted document if the job is not Clear, and the compliance assessment has not been started. An workflow event is created
product_candidate: Security Rights for Commodity Risk Prompt

WKI_Summary: Hide "Unmatched Org Details" note description type from Notes
details: RCR 03-Mar-25 16:43 GMT+11:00:   1. We will hide the Notes with Description type "Unmatched Org Details" from the dropdown, so a user will not be able to manually select this Description type by mistake.  2. If the user however types this in using keyboard, we will not handle that. i.e. it will still show an error. I think the step taken in (1) is adequate to address users using this description type by mistake. Someone typing this in, even if it is not available in the dropdown sounds quite intentional.  3. native xml and UXML import generating "Unmatched Org Details" note will still continue to be supported like now.    Note for Dev:  Identify all modules where this notes description type is supported and remove. Try a better solution where changing in one common code propagates it uniformly across the system.  Provide the list of these modules so that it can be tested by product during UAT.  The Read only behaviour of this notes type hopefully is a common code, so the logic to hide from dropdowns can perhaps also be implemented similarly.    Done statements:  1. The "Unmatched Org Details" description type ([Any module record] -> Notes -> Description = Unmatched Org Details) will be hidden from Notes in all modules across CargoWise. This means users cannot find it in the dropdown menu either by scrolling, or typing in a part of the name (e.g. "Unmatch" etc.).   2. The "Unmatched Org Details" notes type can be inserted directly by the system as it currently happens with UXML when it does not find a matching Org. There is no change to this behaviour.  3. If the user manually types in "Unmatched Org Details" in the notes description field, it would be best to not allow it. Please assess if this is possible. If it is not possible, then we will allow it.  4. The behaviour of this note type shall not be impacted by the Configure unmatched Org setup:  https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=ae218164-03c9-4658-9f8b-f86f10f2ed76. The setting mentioned here govern whether unmatched orgnization is allowed and for which modules, and is meant for the the behaviour during XML import
product_candidate: Hide "Unmatched Org Details" note description type from Notes

WKI_Summary: [DOS] Document Signing Service - Change Digital Signature Wording
details: JZ3 10-Jun-25 12:37 GMT+10:00:     To address the text overflow issues within a AR invoice signature block, the digital signature was modified from "Digitally signed" to "Signed". However, multiple customer incidents have since been raised requesting the reinstatement of the original phrase "Digitally signed".    As reported in one of the incident: HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/8434a86a-7620-4dc2-8cdb-784e8ac80278?lang=en-gb" CS01958045 - LOGWINASC - India - Document Signing Service - Change Wording, our customers shared the following feedback: "Our customers in India have approached us, that our invoices that are signed by eMudhra via Document Signing Service are missing the word 'Digitally' on the stamp", and that most Indian companies they deal with expect the phrase ‘Digitally signed’ to be present on the invoices delivered.    This feedback highlights a collective expectation from within a region and suggests a need to reinstate or provide an option to include the phrase “Digitally signed” in the signature block for invoices issued in India.    We are considering a configurable option to control how beginning of the digital signature should appear on AR Invoices, this would allow users to choose between displaying the label "Signed by" or "Digitally signed by", depending on the context or user preference.    A.G 07-Aug-25 10:12 GMT+10:00:     Background  When digitally signing documents, we also add a digital signature, which looks like a stamp with some words saying things like "Digitally signed by".  This is partially customizable via the registry items but apparently not customizable enough.    Goal  1) Add a folder for registry items Registry --> Documents --> Document Signing Service --> Visible Signature Settings  2) Move a few existing registries inside of it  - Signing Service Signed By Label  - Visible Signature Font And Background Colors  - Override Signed By Username  - Signature Background Image  - Signature Image Positioning (this is a folder, move the whole thing)    2) Rename Registry Item  Signing Service Signed By Label --> Signed By Entity    3) Rename Registry Item  Override Signed By Username --> Signed By User    When renaming, please only change visible captions, do not change internal names, this is how data is stored in database and you'd need a transformation, which is a totally new story.    4) Add a registry item   Registry --> Documents --> Document Signing Service --> Visible Signature Settings --> Signed By Caption  this registry should be System level  registry options - Default    use a default registry item with a dropdown  dropdown should have 2 values  "Digitally Signed"  "Signed"  see SignatureImagePositioningAnchor as an example of a registry item with a dropdown.    JZ3 07-Aug-25 17:37 GMT+10:00: Make "Signed" the default value for this setting      Code locations  Documents registry  C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\CargoWise\Enterprise\Product\Documents\DocumentEngineCore\DocumentEngineCore\Registry\DocumentsDataRegistry.cs    Visible Signature  C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\CargoWise\Enterprise\Product\Documents\DocumentEngine\DocumentSigning\PdfVisibleSignatureGenerator.cs    Relevant WTA Course  https://wisetechacademy.com/asp/course/subject/app/0/0
feature_description: Change Digital Signature Wording

WKI_Summary: TR e-Invoice - Add Order Numbers to e-Invoice UBL-TR XML
details: A25 01-Oct-24 11:53 GMT+03:00: In this WI, a new OrderReference tag will be added to the UBL-TR XML for Order Numbers    Order Numbers will be obtained based on the attached Orders or manually entered Order Refs to Shipment or Consolidation    If there are multiple Orders reference, Order Numbers will be concatenated with comma and added under OrderReference in the XML    DOF :   1 - If there is only one Order reference then add the Order Number and Order Date for OrderReference    <OrderReference>    <ID>OrderNumber</ID>    <IssueDate>OrderDate</IssueDate>   </OrderReference>      2- If there are multiple reference then concatenate the Order Numbers and add Invoice date as Order Date   <OrderReference>    <ID>OrderNumber1,OrderNumber2,OrderNumber3</ID>    <IssueDate>InvoiceDate</IssueDate>   </OrderReference>    Based on this XSLT  templates also be modified for customers. This is out of scope for that WI
feature_description: Invoice - Add Order Numbers to e-Invoice UBL-TR XML

WKI_Summary: Identify preferred UNLOCO per Carrier EDI Code Mapping for GSS Import
details: LGN 14-Aug-25 10:32 GMT+10:00:   1. CargoWise Changes  a. Import Global Sailing Schedules Form  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/master/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Shared/Freight.OnlineSailingSchedules/Route.cs#L364  Update Route.Clone() so that you use the route.Carrier to create a dictionary using the values from the related EDI Code Mappings (using a query for OrgPatternMatchOverride similar to below) and then after cloning each leg, check if the OriginPortUnloco matches any of the mappings and change as required.  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/978a8c7a9df4df98247a39579d1f07e5db4f7e99/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Shared/Freight.Business/NumberGenerator/ValueSources/FreightValueSource.cs#L170    b. Universal XML Import  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/ac6ebbfa6db75703297eedede937d59b85768731/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Shared/Freight.DataTransfer/Freight/Universal/Reading/TransportLegDataObjectReader.cs#L229  Get related OrgHeader from carrierOrgAddress (OA_OH) and load the related EDI Code Mapping to a dictionary.   Map JW_RL_NKLoadPort and JW_RL_NKDiscPort to new code if required using the mapping dictionary.   Map related Sailing's JX_JA_RL_NKPortOfLoading and JX_JB_RL_NKPortOfDischarge to new code if required using the mapping dictionary.    2. GLOW side changes  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/Glow/blob/c3bb9526b7b57c2a4dc7ddc32b5db72fc386808b/DotNet/HTML/Client/Client/JS/Shared/VueExtenders/GSS/GSSImportAndLinkRoute.ts#L141  Update this in a similar way to above. Currently, OrgPatternMatchOverride does not exist in GLOW so it needs to be added as per the guide below.  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/Glow.Content/blob/fea507fcf4bce844168bbbc843be2683686a01d6/Home/Wiki-Content/Glow-Model-Update/GLOW-Model-Basic-steps-to-expose-your-table-to-GLOW.md    Then, to find the correct value, a breeze query similar to this can be made to retrieve the mapped value:   https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/Glow/blob/c3bb9526b7b57c2a4dc7ddc32b5db72fc386808b/DotNet/HTML/Client/Client/JS/Shared/VueExtenders/GSSSearchDataTableExtender.js#L227   Note: GSSController.cs seems to send relevant values to GLOW in GSSImportAndLinkRoute anyway, so values should go through Route.Clone(), so the same mapping logic is applied anyway.      Done Statement  For Carrier recognising an UNLOCO different from the most updated/accurate UNLOCO issued by official UNLOCO Code list, the 'PTC - Port' EDI Code Mapping (with Context=OCM) is used for converting Global Sailing Schedule (GSS) issued by the relevant Carrier to the correct UNLOCO record when the GSS is imported as Sailing Schedule in CW.    SRH 11-Aug-25 11:46 GMT+12:00:   HLD tasks are cancelled as it has already been reviewed and discussed in meeting on 07 Aug.
product_candidate: Identify preferred UNLOCO per Carrier EDI Code Mapping for GSS Import

WKI_Summary: [CargoTrackerRouter] Implement /PostLogin
details: J21 03-Feb-25 10:46 GMT+11:00:   /PostLogin endpoint will:      - validate the token      - returns dynamic html that save token in sessionStorage and redirect to the shipment url    For details, see the HLD of HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=c89bc539-70f8-493f-a267-f46e191f5e03&VersionNumber=25.2.3.7&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b0oBkWmnX0Isov5217q056CEbJazcCGva" WI00833620 - Route Visualizer to support S2ST authentication     DONE = /PostLogin has been implemented in CargoTrackerRouter    J21 11-Feb-25 12:58 GMT+11:00:   Design:    - Add domain URLs of CT/RV for different environments in `appsettings`.    - Create a new endpoint `/PostLogin` in `CargoTrackerRouter`:      - **Payload:**        - `uri`: A string that can be either a CT or RV URI, e.g., `/clients/YASPRD/`.        - `token`: A string representing the authentication token.      - **Validation:**        - Validate the provided token.      - **Response:**        - Return a dynamic HTML page that:          1. Saves the token in `sessionStorage`.          2. Redirects the user to the provided `uri` within the appropriate domain.       - Return 401 if token invalid    Example of the returned HTML:    ```html  <html>  <head>      <script>          // Save the token in sessionStorage          sessionStorage.setItem('token', '""{token}""');          // Redirect to the provided URL          window.location.href = '{domain}/{uri}';      </script>  </head>  <body>  </body>  </html>  ```

WKI_Summary: New Shipment STL Collector for Data Analysis Purposes
details: AFE 25-Jul-25 15:00 GMT+08:00:   Discussed with Anton, we have two possible options here to check which invoice is the first one:  1. Check the Job Invoice No./Post Date/Invoice Date under "Shipment > Billing > AR Invoices" tab.  2. Check the SIV event with the first Posted Time under "Shipment > Workflow & Tracking > Events" tab. (However, this might cause some performance issue)    Final decision: After talking to Jeeva and Anton, we all agree that use AH_SystemCreateTimeUTC as the transation date.    ADU 15-Jul-25 09:54 GMT+08:00:   Done Statement:  New STL Billing Collector is created under the feature code 'SHA'    MM7 17-Jul-25 09:56 GMT+10:00:   It seems that we don't have de-duplication based on billing references in STL collector. So, I think we need to collect data only one time.    ADU 16-Jul-25 12:50 GMT+08:00:   I checked with Ian—he confirmed that the billing database only de-duplicates records if the new submission is an exact match to a previously submitted one. Given the nature of our collector, that likely won’t be the case.    After discussion with Rajah, he suggest that in this case we should collect only at single point and we don't need different collectors at departue and arrival. We will go with only when first invoice is created.    ITN 16-Jul-25 10:33 GMT+10:00:   Hi Merlin,  The billing database only de-duplicates automatically if the submitted record is an exact match of the previous submitted record, which I believe will not be the case for your collector as per below.    So The concerns of duplicate data are valid if this collector will ultimately be billed.    However, if this is planned as a usage collector (non-billed), then duplicate data is less of a problem as it won't cause incorrect billing.  You could just be aware of it when you perform analysis of the data and live with it.  Alternatively you could split it up into multiple collectors (one for departures, one for arrivals) if that would make it easier to perform analysis of the data, but I'll leave it up to you and your team to debate and decide.    ROH 16-Jul-25 09:20 GMT+10:00:   Hi Merlin,  With the new design, the same shipment may be collected multiple times. (Eg: if JS_E_DEP, JS_E_ARV are added or edited).  We are not sure if the billing collector mechanism will automatically de-duplicate shipments that have previously been collected.  Can you please talk to Ian Thompson and check if it works automatically? Otherwise we'll need to come up with a different collection date.      Proposed Change:  1. Create new dynamic STL Collector  create new file under: Cargowise.Billing.Collectors/src/Collectors/Scripts/Logistics/ForwarderBillingShipment.cs    The script should be the same as the current https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/blob/master/Cargowise.Billing.Collectors/src/Collectors/Scripts/Logistics/ForwarderGeneralShipment.cs with the expection of TransactionDateUtc, and FeatureCode    The feature code should be 'SHA'     2. the script should be something like this:    For TransactionDateUtc :  Use First Invoice's post date    WITH ForwarderShipmentCTE AS  (   SELECT    -- Shipment fields    IsForwardRegistered = js.JS_IsForwardRegistered,    IsBooking = js.JS_IsBooking,    -- STL property fields    JH_PK = jh.JH_PK,    CompanyCode = gc.GC_Code,    BranchCode = gb.GB_Code,    TransactionDateUtc = inv.FirstInvoiceDate,    CreatingUserCode = jh.JH_SystemCreateUser,    -- billing references    BillingReference1 = js.JS_UniqueConsignRef,    BillingReference2 = jh.JH_JobLocalReference,    BillingReference3 = CONCAT(js.JS_RL_NKOrigin, '|', js.JS_RL_NKDestination),    BillingReference4 = CONCAT(js.JS_TransportMode, '|', js.JS_PackingMode, '|', js.JS_ShipmentType),    -- additional refs    HouseBill = js.JS_HouseBill,    Department = ge.GE_Code,    LocalClient = LocalClientOrg.OH_FullName,    OverseasAgent = OverseasAgentOrg.OH_FullName,    ETD = js.JS_E_DEP,    ETA = js.JS_E_ARV,    ServiceLevel = js.JS_RS_NKServiceLevel,    ReleaseType = js.JS_ReleaseType,    HouseBillType = js.JS_HouseBillOfLadingType,    DeliveryMode = js.JS_HBLContainerPackModeOverride,    PickupFrom = PickupFromAddress.OA_RL_NKRelatedPortCode,    PickupCFS = PickupCFSAddress.OA_RL_NKRelatedPortCode,    DeliverTo = DeliverToAddress.OA_RL_NKRelatedPortCode,    DeliveryCFS = DeliveryCFSAddress.OA_RL_NKRelatedPortCode,    GoodsValue = CONCAT(js.JS_RX_NKGoodsValueCurr, ' - ', js.JS_GoodsValue),    eBooking = CASE                       WHEN EXISTS (                          SELECT 1                           FROM dbo.StmALog ebk                           WHERE ebk.SL_Parent = js.JS_PK                           AND ebk.SL_SE_NKEvent = 'STU'                           AND ebk.SL_Table = 'JobShipment'                          AND ebk.SL_Reference LIKE '%NEW=EBK%'                      ) THEN 'Y'                       ELSE 'N'                   END,          eSI = CASE                   WHEN EXISTS (                      SELECT 1                       FROM dbo.StmALog esi                      WHERE esi.SL_Parent = js.JS_PK                       AND esi.SL_SE_NKEvent = 'STU'                       AND esi.SL_Table = 'JobShipment'                      AND esi.SL_Reference LIKE '%NEW=ESI%'                  ) THEN 'Y'                   ELSE 'N'               END,    Direction = CASE       WHEN Direction.Direction = 'EXP' THEN 'Export'        WHEN Direction.Direction = 'IMP' THEN 'Import'       WHEN Direction.Direction = 'CRO' THEN 'CrossTrade'       WHEN Direction.Direction = 'DOM' THEN 'Domestic'      END    FROM dbo.JobShipment js    INNER JOIN dbo.JobHeader jh ON js.JS_PK = jh.JH_ParentID    INNER JOIN dbo.GlbBranch gb ON gb.GB_PK = jh.JH_GB    INNER JOIN dbo.GlbCompany gc ON gc.GC_PK = gb.GB_GC    INNER JOIN dbo.GlbDepartment ge ON ge.GE_PK = jh.JH_GE    -- Local Client    LEFT JOIN dbo.OrgAddress LocalClientAddress ON LocalClientAddress.OA_PK = jh.JH_OA_LocalChargesAddr    LEFT JOIN dbo.OrgHeader LocalClientOrg ON LocalClientOrg.OH_PK = LocalClientAddress.OA_OH    -- Overseas Agent    LEFT JOIN dbo.OrgAddress OverseasAgentAddress ON OverseasAgentAddress.OA_PK = jh.JH_OA_AgentCollectAddr    LEFT JOIN dbo.OrgHeader OverseasAgentOrg ON OverseasAgentOrg.OH_PK = OverseasAgentAddress.OA_OH    -- Pickup From    LEFT JOIN dbo.JobDocAddress PickupFromDocAddress ON PickupFromDocAddress.E2_ParentID = js.JS_PK AND PickupFromDocAddress.E2_AddressType = 'CRG'    LEFT JOIN dbo.OrgAddress PickupFromAddress ON PickupFromAddress.OA_PK = PickupFromDocAddress.E2_OA_Address    -- Pickup CFS    LEFT JOIN dbo.OrgAddress PickupCFSAddress ON PickupCFSAddress.OA_PK = js.JS_OA_ExportReceivingDepot    -- Deliver To    LEFT JOIN dbo.JobDocAddress DeliverToDocAddress ON DeliverToDocAddress.E2_ParentID = js.JS_PK AND DeliverToDocAddress.E2_AddressType = 'CEG'    LEFT JOIN dbo.OrgAddress DeliverToAddress ON DeliverToAddress.OA_PK = DeliverToDocAddress.E2_OA_Address    -- Delivery CFS    LEFT JOIN dbo.OrgAddress DeliveryCFSAddress ON DeliveryCFSAddress.OA_PK = js.JS_OA_ImportReleaseDepot    -- Direction    CROSS APPLY (SELECT TOP 1 Direction from dbo.GetJobDirection(js.JS_RL_NKOrigin, js.JS_RL_NKDestination, gb.GB_RL_NKHomePort, gb.GB_RL_NKHomePort, ge.GE_Domestic, ge.GE_Export, ge.GE_Import, jh.JH_GC)) Direction    -- First invoice date    INNER JOIN (     SELECT       AL_JH,      MIN(AH_PostDate) AS FirstInvoiceDate     FROM dbo.AccTransactionHeader AH     INNER JOIN dbo.AccTransactionLines AL ON AL.AL_AH = AH.AH_PK     WHERE AH.AH_Ledger = 'AR'      AND AH.AH_TransactionType IN ('INV', 'CRD')      AND AL.AL_LineType = 'REV'     GROUP BY AL_JH    ) inv ON inv.AL_JH = jh.JH_PK  )  SELECT *   FROM ForwarderShipmentCTE s  WHERE (s.IsForwardRegistered = 1 OR s.IsBooking = 1)        RJV 15-Jul-25 08:10 GMT+10:00:   This collector functions similarly to the SHP collector that was enhanced as part of work item HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/7be57b6d-12bc-4a33-9a7b-69e4080c6984?lang=en-gb" WI00841798 - Enhancement to Shipment STL Collector.  The key difference lies in the collection point: data should now be collected at a later stage rather than at the job header date, to ensure more comprehensive data capture.  Please duplicate the SHP collector from the referenced work item and update the STL_TransactionDateUtc to reflect the later collection date. Set the STL_FeatureCode to SHA.    Suggestion to use below logic for STL_TransactionDateUtc   If Shipment.ETA Exist, collect when ETA is same as CurrentDate  Shipment.ETA Exist not exist then look for Shipment.ETD, collect when ETD is same as CurrentDate  When both ETA and ETD not exist then look for InvoiceDate, collect when InvoiceDate is same as CurrentDate
product_candidate: New Shipment STL Collector for Data Analysis Purposes

WKI_Summary: eTail V2 TW - HVLV XUE
details: HLD: https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/Product/Product%20Team%20Workspace/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B2F13961E-BF19-4C77-8700-B16B9238AEF7%7D&cid=a0255119-5470-4268-9d44-1e4a149cc2b8    Done:     When a HVLV Consignment/Item customs and relase status change a XUE can be sent to TW and update the CRN of the Package    previous dones are chunked:  SDL 10-Sep-25 10:55 GMT+10:00:     1. When a Outer Package in TW is scanned an XUE can be sent to HVLV and read into the HVLV Outer Package and update its linked HVLV Items statuses.  HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/18ad4c2d-1016-41e7-b1f2-6f23ae87e35c?lang=en-gb" WI00961778 - eTail V2 TW - HVLV OuterPackage status    2. When a Inner Package in TW is scanned an XUE can be sent to HVLV and read into the HVLV Item with the status updated. HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/75eb7339-0e00-408a-a46f-34b32d8e4bc3?lang=en-gb" WI00961779 - eTail V2 TW - HVLV Inner Package Status    3. When an Outturn is sent from the TW receipt consignment it can be read into the HVL shipment with HVLV Item details updated.  HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/c5ff3944-bb33-493c-a7ba-b678a77ee711?lang=en-gb" WI00961780 - eTail V2 TW - HVLV: Outturn to update HVLVItem    BZG 17-Sep-25 09:12 GMT+10:00:   Proposed HLD, also what's been done in the spike:  1. When HVI_ImportReleaseStatus is set to C(Clear), and its shipment already has a RCN(TW receive consignmen) job, a CustomsCleared universal event is sent from HVLVItem to the corresponding TW Package State and clears the package. (Consider HVI_ExportReleaseStatus if necessary)  2. The XUE matching logic is:   1)The matching key between HVLVItem and TW Package: HVI_ItemID <-> WhsItemPackageState.Package.PackageHeader.KPH_PackageID   2)The matching key between HVL Shipment and TW Receive Job is used for    if shipment has a valid housebill: JS_Housebill <-> WhsItemReceiveConsignment.WRC_ConsignmentID   if not: JS_UniqueConsignRef <-> WhsItemReceiveConsignment.WRC_ConsignmentID.WRC_ParentID
feature_description: HVLV XUE

WKI_Summary: Generate DDA event when document allocated using GAR trigger
details: KBV 11-Sep-24 11:20 GMT+10:00:     When printing/delivering a document, such as AR Invoice, the document is allocated to eDocs and this generates a DDA (Document Allocated) event on the invoice.  Similarly, when delivering AR Invoice using a SRN workflow trigger, the document is allocated to eDocs and generates a DDA (Document Allocated) event on the invoice.  However, when generating AR Invoice document to eDocs using a GAR (Generate AR Invoice) workflow trigger, document is allocated to eDocs but no DDA event is recorded on the invoice.    This enhancement is to Generate DDA (Document Allocated) event when document allocated using GAR trigger.  Please see attached escalation document.    SG5 20-Sep-24 10:45 GMT+08:00:   https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_search?action=contents&text=InvoicePrintTask.AttachARInvoiceToEdocs(invoice%2C%20notifications%2C%20token)&type=code&lp=code-Project&filters=ProjectFilters%7BCargoWise%7DRepositoryFilters%7BDev%7D&pageSize=25&result=DefaultCollection%2FCargoWise%2FDev%2FGBmaster%2F%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FAccounting%2FBusiness%2FARAP%2FInvoicing%2FPrinting%2FGenerateARInvoiceToEdocsProcessor.cs    https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_search?action=contents&text=class%20SendARInvoiceProcessor&type=code&lp=code-Project&filters=ProjectFilters%7BCargoWise%7DRepositoryFilters%7BDev%7D&pageSize=25&result=DefaultCollection%2FCargoWise%2FDev%2FGBmaster%2F%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FAccounting%2FBusiness%2FARAP%2FInvoicing%2FPrinting%2FSendARInvoiceProcessor.cs    SG5 30-Sep-24 12:57 GMT+08:00:     service task DOD will add file to eDoc when have DDV event  service LWM,LWK will run GAR  DDV will add DDA event, we can add DDA event to GAR  refer:  var document = LWM         printJob.SP_ParentGuid, printJob.SP_RelatedBusinessContext, fileName, printJob.SP_DocumentType, printJob.SP_EmailSubjectLine,         printJob.SP_SendToEDocs, GetAttachmentFileName(printJob.SP_EmailAttachments), language, dataType);  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_search?action=contents&text=var%20document%20%3D%20documentFactory.CreateAndAllocateDocument(&type=code&lp=code-Project&filters=ProjectFilters%7BCargoWise%7DRepositoryFilters%7BDev%7D&pageSize=25&result=DefaultCollection%2FCargoWise%2FDev%2FGBmaster%2F%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FDocuments%2FPrintProcessing%2FPrintProcessing%2FProcessors%2FEDocProcessor.cs    SG5 08-Oct-24 14:14 GMT+08:00:   HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=f5146730-adfd-4351-a010-0926e632140a&StorageDocPK=9933f6cc-3d21-4406-a908-d7b836284d50&Hash=%2b5X9H0guWrNsu%2fEJ%2b3oVEbutRtxXdP55f&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" SG5 08-Oct-24 15:19:  File WI00060542 design with review notes.docx (design)  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=f5146730-adfd-4351-a010-0926e632140a&StorageDocPK=5afad880-3dca-48c9-af73-5e343efcfcaa&Hash=%2bLzRJcuXJ6h94wGRF%2f%2fBzMgspiyNRrlIE&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" SG5 08-Oct-24 14:15:  File RE  WI00060542.msg (design review feedback)  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=68372bd1-4986-4c5e-94d7-dce80471c045&VersionNumber=24.10.8.41&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2buFBKQWie%2fmqZFuETbB%2f%2bOSnVQRRskddp" WI00061312 - New Trigger Action on RNV workflow to auto-deliver and/or print AR Invoice docs  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=f5146730-adfd-4351-a010-0926e632140a&VersionNumber=24.10.8.41&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b5rt89uPoBZL76JIxJSR%2bhF4mlAJjM0sF" WI00060542 - New Trigger Action on AR Invoice Workflow - Generate AR Invoice to eDocs      SG5 07-Nov-24 16:51 GMT+08:00:   https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/commit/efad7621ef28780b66bfecc1d1a279bf1b530d30?refName=refs%2Fheads%2Fmaster&_a=compare&path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FDocuments%2FDocumentEngine%2FCore%2FDocumentPack.cs

WKI_Summary: Exception RPT - Jobs with No Posted Rev or Cost - Add Active Status Filter
details: Exception Report - Jobs with No Posted Revenue or Cost  Inactive jobs have been included in the report by default under HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/NewWorkItem/df72e3bd-8ec9-434c-b5e6-1c85027b9415?lang=en-gb" WI00830383 - Include Inactive jobs in ALL Job Costing Reports - Chunk 3    In order to make the report more user friendly, we are going to provide an option for the user to print ALL/Active/Inactive jobs respectively.     DONE OF STATEMENT  TASK I. Add a filter Active Status to Exception Report - Jobs with No Posted Revenue or Costs.  It is a dropdown including ALL, Active and Inactive options.     Default to ALL -> both active and inactive jobs will be printed.   Active -> only active jobs will be printed.   Inactive -> only inactive jobs will be printed.     TASK II. Display the selected "Active Status" Filter at the top of the report.     TASK III. Add Active Status as an Optional Column.
feature_description: Jobs with No Posted Rev or Cost - Add Active Status Filter

WKI_Summary: Retreive Last Free Day from ONEY
details: LKW 08-Jul-25 11:48 GMT+10:00:   Found ONEY cargo tracking page shows a new section "Cargo Release & Customs" that has Last Free Day information available. We would want to capture that and deliver as Container Event.  e.g. MBL: TA5PT7061800 HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=994f782a-983a-4019-958d-2573aa4548ae&StorageDocPK=134e9e50-d217-4667-84c1-437b5cfacefc&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bwspmdGWji4qrQaSLmfBm7vGuhnUo3z%2fh" LKW 11-Jul-25 18:22:  File ONEY tracking example.jpg (Client Correspondence / Screenshots)    Currently all SRC event source are from OneStop in AU and PortConnect in NZ, also some from NVOCCs including SHPT, WAIC, CROI, NAQA.  Confirmed with Jeeva and Angela that Last Free Day milestone delivered through SRC event code, not using HYPERLINK "https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=5a3106c4-a513-4035-a983-a57d99f16d53" New Last Free Date (LFR) event    quote from Jeeva:  in transport leg level (including sailing schedules) we have CTO storage start date. We already use SRC to update these milestones and users are already using them for their own milestones and triggers. We should not change that.   The storage start date on the leg should update based on last free day received from carrier/terminal. So the best option is map the last free day + 1 to SRC. Then will update leg storage start date as of now.    This makes this not only simply an additional event mapping change. Require processing logic to convert event date time.  From research in ONEY webstie data source always have time 23:59 (meaning that the last free day day end)  suggest processing logic for event date time:  event date + 1 day  time set as 00:00    Please make this processing logic configurable to apply to other carriers if needed.  At the time of writing, we are not aware any other Ocean Carriers provide Last Free Day in cargo tracking. However that can happen in the future.  some current NVOCCs directly provide "Storage Start Date" which matches SRC directly, no need processing logic.    Customs Clearance field in the new section is also useful data, shall map as RLS.    Done:   new section "Cargo Release & Customs" is retireved from ONEY processor HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=994f782a-983a-4019-958d-2573aa4548ae&StorageDocPK=8869de74-e3ae-4c9c-9a42-3478a6a726f6&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bO5oTTA7ed9sN1sCmrS7tuBN8wow5e9fQ" LKW 11-Jul-25 18:23:  File quick try by Conor.png (Client Correspondence / Screenshots)  SRC and RLS event are mapped   ref: HYPERLINK "https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/Product/Product%20Team%20Workspace/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B4295A157-CF50-4FD5-98F3-9D45FDFBC496%7D&file=Sea%20Shanty%20Mapping.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=f1cd584a-fd1a-43d5-b55a-b1ce724099a8&isSPOFile=1&clickparams=eyJBcHBOYW1lIjoiVGVhbXMtRGVza3RvcCIsIkFwcFZlcnNpb24iOiI0OS8yMzEwMTIyNzcxMiIsIkhhc0ZlZGVyYXRlZFVzZXIiOmZhbHNlfQ%3D%3D" Sea Shanty Mapping.xlsx row 2518, 2519  SRC event datetime is correctly processed (event source keep as Carrier)    RJV 17-Jul-25 12:50 GMT+10:00:   Please refer highlighted line on HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=994f782a-983a-4019-958d-2573aa4548ae&StorageDocPK=9238a81b-a215-4dc0-8def-a37216a61fe8&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bYvNNvpW%2busHklWzhRjeQfTU8CCAk0gU%2f" RJV 17-Jul-25 12:49:  File CAV Event Format.jpg (Sample File). WKI_Summary: VN eInv - Prevent posting negative value by Registry when E-Reporting is enabled
details: IFG 02-Jan-25 18:41 GMT+08:00:   When the regsitry Negative Charges on Accounts Receivable Transaction is set to NAL(Negative charges Not Allowed - Stpos users from posting negative line amounts on AR Invoice, Credit Note or Adjustment Note transactions), the system will prevent a transaction to be posted if there are negative lines.  To comply with Tax Regulations in Vietnam, business are NOT allowed to post AR transaction with negative amounts on any lines.   HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=8cc912b6-6650-4b6b-a0f0-005f009dd795&VersionNumber=24.12.31.81&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b4ZLofXMpPaIdtD%2fGfUddDD%2ffnKh%2btGAB" CS01832725 - ENTETTLEH - SORY24023449 - VIETNAM E-INVOICE IN ERROR -  The above incident was raised due to the human error on posting transaction contains negative values.    To prevent such invalid submission, we will enforce the user to set this registry to NAL when there are negative lines contained in the invoice which is going to be posted.   Conditions:  Login company = VN(Vietnam)  Registry 'Enable E-Reporting Functionality - Receivables' is set to Yes    Apply the existing error message of the NAL option designed for the registry Negative Charges on Accounts Receivable Transaction.
feature_description: Prevent posting negative value by Registry when E-Reporting is enabled

WKI_Summary: !CR7 - HEL - Transport Mode Chargeable Conversion Registry Setting  for FSA
details: LGN 23-Jul-25 09:21 GMT+10:00:   FreightDataRegistry  - Add CodePairRegistryItem ChargeableFactorSeaAir with OLookUpEditType.TransportType (without SeaAir), to determine which transport mode's ChargeableFactorRegistryItem should be used when a Shipment is FSA  M04 24-Jul-25 11:08 GMT+10:00:  add two registry item based on HLD    ChargeableFactor  - In GetFreightChargeableFactor, first check for FSA and use the TransportMode registry specified in ChargeableFactorSeaAir:    static ChargeableFactor GetFreightChargeableFactor(bool isDomestic, string transportMode)  {   switch(transportMode)   {    case Core.Constants.TransportModes.SeaAir:     return GetFreightChargeableFactor(isDomestic, FreightDataRegistry.Instance.ChargeableFactorSeaAir.Value);    case Core.Constants.TransportModes.Air:      return ...   }  }      RJV 08-Jul-25 09:51 GMT+10:00:   A system level registry setting to configure which Transport Mode Chargeable Conversion Registry setting should be used for FSA and FAS  a. This setting would be applied to the Shipment > Basic Registration > Chargeable calculation.  b. Chargeable Weight calculation at Consol level would respect the Transport Mode to use relevant Chargeable Weight for Autorating Costing at Consol level.  c. Per our understanding, Chargeable Weight is not sent to Carrier for Booking that even we update/change the Shipment > Basic Registration > Chargeable Weight, it should not impact any EDI / message sending to Carrier.  Please note the above registry setting would NOT introduce a new chargeable conversion, it simply tells system when the Shipment is FSA or FAS, which Transport Mode's Chargeable Conversion Factor should be used.    Refer attached CR7 for more information
feature_description: HEL - Transport Mode Chargeable Conversion Registry Setting  for FSA

WKI_Summary: Debtor defaulting behaviour in charge line for inter company AP posting
details: RZ1 30-Jan-25 11:57 GMT+11:00:     When a job related AP invoice is imported (automatically or manually) from an inter company AR invoice, a charge line is added to the related billing job with cost posted, and the revenue side populated accordinly.    the debtor field of this charge line should only be defaulted if the default org is flagged as a AR org - for example, it might default to Local Client, in this case, if the Local Client is not flagged as a AR org, the debtor field should be left blank - this is the current behaviour when adding a standard job related AP invoice.    However, for AP invoice generated from inter company invoicing, the debtor field automatically populates the shipment's Local client, even when Local Client is not flagged as an AR org, this generates an error and prevents users from saving the job.    We need to change this behaviour to ensure consistency with standard AP invoices: for  inter company AP invoices that are job related, if the job's Local Client is not an AR org, the debtor field on the charge likne should remain blank.      FTL: HYPERLINK "https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/DevelopmentAccountingTeam-AccountingProductDocumentation/Shared%20Documents/Rotators%20Queue%20WIs/WI00862005%20Debtor%20defaulting%20behavior%20in%20charge%20line%20for%20inter%20company%20AP%20posting/WI00862005%20debtor%20defaulting%20behavior%20for%20inter%20company%20AP%20postingFTL.xlsm?d=wb4cc835da7414d17b9eacd8e4f838947&csf=1&web=1&e=8sTmsl" WI00862005 debtor defaulting behavior for inter company AP postingFTL.xlsm  UAT: HYPERLINK "https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/DevelopmentAccountingTeam-AccountingProductDocumentation/Shared%20Documents/Rotators%20Queue%20WIs/WI00862005%20Debtor%20defaulting%20behavior%20in%20charge%20line%20for%20inter%20company%20AP%20posting/WI00862005%20UAT.xlsm?d=w3ef071c5462c4f548d5c39c0790af47d&csf=1&web=1&e=AcrAXi" WI00862005 UAT.xlsm  UPN: HYPERLINK "https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/DevelopmentAccountingTeam-AccountingProductDocumentation/Shared%20Documents/Rotators%20Queue%20WIs/WI00862005%20Debtor%20defaulting%20behavior%20in%20charge%20line%20for%20inter%20company%20AP%20posting/WI00862005%20UPN.docx?d=wb9dfcb15e5dd4d5c9a832e5a60add468&csf=1&web=1&e=Nyy20l" WI00862005 UPN.docx

WKI_Summary: UY and PA - E-Invoicing - Reset Status to Queued Action for DLV Status
details: Countries: Uruguay and Panama    Scope of Changes:    In Uruguay and Panama Countries, when an electronic AR transaction is created in CargoWise, send to the relevant Tax Authority and the message can be successfully submitted, final Tax authority response can be inmediately returned to CargoWise or Tax Authority can delay some time in returning it.    For these cases, AR Transaction E-Reporting Status is updated to DLV (Delivered) in CargoWise, and then:    For Uruguay Country, xT consults for three times during a specific period of time (3, 8 and 24 hours respectively) if Uruguay Tax Authority final response is available:  1. If it is, a new XUE is sent to CW1 informing if AR Transaction was approved or rejected (AR Transactions Status is updated to SUC or FAL, based on Tax Authority response);  2. If not, AR Transaction remains as DLV and the User manual intervention is required.  For Panama Country, the User manual intervention is always required in order to update AR Transaction final status.    For both, Uruguay and Panama Cuntires, Users can manually update final E-Reporting Status by resetting the AR Transaction to queued from EDI Message.    The cons of this workaround is that this is time consuming since this is a one at one process.    Therefore, the aim of this Work Item is to allow Users in UY and PA Countries to Reset to Queue AR transactions with a DLV Status form the Actions menu in the Receivables Transactions Module.  This development has been implemented in Romania Country, through the following Work Item:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=c29f2595-758a-4c57-b04f-982dbd70ebac&VersionNumber=24.10.10.3&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bFoVQMyq9ESAbNmk3O0SIpcrTzMhdrUAH" WI00734788 - RO e-Inv 10.1.1 | Enhancements to Re-queue    In Uruguay, there are some Customers asking for an imporvement regarding the DLV E-Repoting Status update:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=2c7063ab-a358-49ea-b60c-0bd12051ef71&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bUIzKQlyvlzHAISfz3g7SICuupaqHOLc0" CS01034273 - DSVHHS - UY e-INV TXI Response Status SUC not able update in CW1
feature_description: E-Invoicing - Reset Status to Queued Action for DLV Status

WKI_Summary: VN e-Inv - Add Compliance Sequence column to Receivables Transactions
details: Add Compliance Sequence column to Receivables Transactions.   This could allow users to directly tell which compliance book was used from the grid other than drilling down into the AR Invoice detail.   See Spec attached for more details.     DONE OF STATEMENT:   1. Add Compliance Sequence column to Receivables Transactions. The Content in the Compliance Sequence column should be the same as the Compliance Sequence field in the details of AR Invoice, e.g. Code + Description.   2.
