WKI_Summary: DMN: User without security to DocManager can import eDocs via DMI
details: This is the follow up from HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=b09ed2e8-f672-4469-b2a7-65ef4dabb2d9&VersionNumber=24.11.28.88&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bLfqqDy8NHG54Na6dZbcofUnFzP7zCTP%2f" WI00823869, which only fixed the empty description problem to maintain current behaviour for the client.  The security problem raise in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=d9a9d800-236e-4999-96c4-0e165d755b79&VersionNumber=24.11.28.88&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b2kfSeU0b6alOqK7piU8xK6Y8KJQWwmIW" CS01767736 - SPARXHKG - The desc field under document storage is empty after the recent upgrade. shall be addressed here.    Problem:   When DMI service import eDocs from an email sent by a Staff who have no permission to DocManager, the eDocs can still be imported under the Staff's name.  Eg,   If user A is not allowed to use DocManager, it will not be able to access to eDocs tab and can't insert any edocs to any shipment.  However if he sends an email with subject DMI can allocate to a shipment, the attachment of the email will be attach to the eDocs of the shipment and it will appear to be added by user A      Tricky part  We can't simply change DMI to not import eDocs from sender who have no security, as it will break the client's workflow in the above incident.  However continue to ignore the security to allow DMI import eDocs from user without permission could be a security risk      TN2 13-Dec-24 15:57 GMT+11:00:  During DMI process, in ImportByUserInformation,   If we can get the security rights for the current user, checking the user security rights as #1 and #2 below.   If we cannot get the user rights, or the email subject is not valid for direct import, we just ignore the security checks, and do import as normal.    1/ If the current user does not have the security rights for the security setting at Manage > DocManager > Allocate eDocs, for the current company/branch/department  Add or throw exception to add log, “Unable to allocate document. Allocation has been rejected because the staff user does not have the appropriate security rights enabled for the security setting at Manage > DocManager > Allocate eDocs.”    2/ If the staff user does not have permission to upload specific document type, then the message will be   “Unable to allocate document. Allocation has been rejected because the staff user does not have the appropriate security rights enabled for the security setting at Manage > DocManager > Allocate eDocs > eDocs Tab > Upload Specific Document Type”.  In those 2 cases, the email status should be FAL.    DZG 09-Jan-25 11:11 GMT+11:00:    In DMI task, current user of the service is switched from ~BP to a staff member only when importing via emails AND the email sender is a staff member.  So, if the importing of documents is not via emails or email sender is not a staff member, DMI will continue to import using ~BP as current user.  If we check security right in ImportByUserInformation, we will also check security right for ~BP user, and we need to make sure ~BP has the right to the upload documents in current company/branch/department, I am not sure if ~BP has such  security right for all company/branch/department.    So to ignore the security check for ~BP user, we can  1. Check if current user is ~BP in ImportByUserInformation, if it's not ~BP then we do security check, but if there is more users we need to ignore in future, e.g. ImportByUserInformation is called by other workflows, we need to change this code, and very likely we will forget it.  2. Do security check for staffMember in this code https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FDocuments%2FDocumentScanning%2FDocumentScanning.Business%2FBatchProcessor%2FBatchImportManager.cs&version=GBmaster&line=697&lineEnd=697&lineStartColumn=6&lineEndColumn=62&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents, when staffMember is not null.    I think the second approach will be better as it won't block the others which call to ImportByUserInformation.    TN2 09-Jan-25 15:59 GMT+11:00:   The code should check permission in https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FDocuments%2FDocumentScanning%2FDocumentScanning.Business%2FBatchProcessor%2FBatchImportManager.cs&version=GBmaster&line=782&lineEnd=783&lineStartColumn=69&lineEndColumn=1&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents, in between "var codeRetriever" and "foreach (MailAttachment attachment in email.MailAttachments)", as we will need to access the doc type extracted from the email subject, and we don't want to run the security check for each attachment.  For the staffMember checking, it will check if staffMember is null or GS_IsSystemAccount = true to allow any doc type. Otherwise, it will get and check the security endpoint and show/add to log the error message.
product_candidate: User without security to DocManager can import eDocs via DMI

WKI_Summary: BAM: It is no longer possible to create AGG tables in the BAM tool
details: Done: It is no longer possible to create AGG tables in the BAM tool    LC1 05-Mar-25 12:36 GMT+11:00:   AGG tables are less performant than CUS tables (this can be either due to the cost they introduce to the ETL process, or to processes that query them).    This work item will encapsulate all work to prevent additional AGG tables from being added to the EDW in future. Initial thinking is to remove AGG table functionality from the BAM tool, so that we don't waste the time of developers from other teams (they don't go through the trouble of making an AGG table and we then reject it).    Converting existing non-performant AGG tables is handled in the below work item:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=357f1ca7-ff1e-4897-9cef-f25bdd88e500&VersionNumber=25.3.4.333&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bjbxFsXtnb5eUmiyZgxz0OtGjhel%2bnyST" WI00878269 - Poorly performing AGG tables have been migrated to CUS tables
product_candidate: It is no longer possible to create AGG tables in the BAM tool

details: AWC 30-Dec-24 11:51 GMT+11:00:   Requirement:  Make it so that a user with access to the LD moudle and EDIT access to LD can select one or more LD and RIGHT CLICK. WKI_Summary: PP: Auto generate Pallet ID when doing Transfers
details: EVG 27-Apr-25 18:59 GMT+08:00:   For functional review:  Please conduct tests on the generation functionality of Destination Pallet ID at both the Desktop and RF ends,   and also test the printing function of RF.  In addition, carry out necessary regression tests on the generation of Pallet ID for Receive.    MMC 28-Nov-24 14:53 GMT+11:00:   Done Statement:  Destination Pallet ID can be generated for an internal transfer via Desktop or RF.    Technical Suggestion:    Desktop  Add an action menu item "Generate New Pallet IDs"  This only works for internal transfers (not outbound/replenishment/inter whs etc)  All selected unfinalised lines without a destination Pallet ID will get a Pallet ID generated using the same settings that Receives does (OM_WhsGenerateSSCCOnInbound = 1 for SSCC otherwise Docket ID-001 etc), you can probably re-use PalletIDGenerator class almost entirely.    RF  During Transfer on RF, there is a possibly to specify a Destination Pallet ID. This is available from Multi Location Transfer or can be manually initiated from the other processes via the options menu.  On this screen (Transfer_UnallocatedPutawayViewModel I believe) add a check box "Generate & Print Pallet ID" (underneath Dest Pallet ID text box). This should be readonly until the Dest Location is entered.  If Dest Location is PickFace, ticking Print Pallet Id should show an error (can't have Pallet ID in PickFace etc) and not continue.  Note: Ignore "retain pallet IDs" setting as this is for an existing Pallet ID, not generating a new one.  If no errors, ticking the check box should generate a Pallet ID and set the value into the dest pallet ID field and make dest pallet ID field read only.  When pressing OK it should show the print dialog (just like Unload) for printing the Pallet ID label. If successfully selecting a printer should print the Pallet ID Lable (see PrintPalletID() webservice request).  Printing should only occur if the transferline was successfully Updated with the Pallet ID.    BRS 04-Nov-24 17:34 GMT+11:00:   Design agreed in planning poker was to use the receive approach (DocketID-001 etc. OR SSCC configured if OM_WhsGenerateSSCCOnInbound = 1)    This will require a menu item to initiate the generation on desktop.    Also require some way of doing this on RF too, check how unload handles this, including reprinting the label.    CKR 15-Oct-24 14:47 GMT+11:00:     Current Functionality: There is no method to generate a Pallet ID from Transfers (Desktop and RF)    Desired Functionality: Ability to generate a pallet ID from Transfers (if a new Pallet ID is required)    Planning Poker Notes:     RF and desktop does NOT automatically create a new Pallet ID   - eg if move overflow qty of 56 from a pallet of 948+56 to a new location - need to create a new Pallet ID (at the moment on the RF you manually have to enter the new Pallet ID (also in CW1 Transfer need to enter a new Pallet ID - there is no way to automatically create/generate the Pallet ID as per Receive ??    user should palletise and generate pallet ID during the Receive process? SF - what if moving overflow and creating new consolidated pallet - or whenever  you ever need to split a pallet for what ever reason.     You generate the Pallet ID based on which fountain?  On the receive it's clear as it takes the docket ID + increment  For transfers it's different and it can't use the same logic as the docket ID will be different and they may have already existing pre-printed LPNs for the new Pallet ID     13/05/24: Can we use Transfer Docket ID + increment?  07/06/24: SF to check with client what do they expect for the new Pallet ID generation: a new fountain or using the Transfer docket ID  19/06/24: - emailed Bill Reiner re above question, Transfer Docket or new Fountain  24/06/24: - Bill's reply 'Creating the pallet ID for these using the old Pallet ID _A would work or using the transfer ID number could also work. I just cant try to get hundreds of warehouse workers to enter this number the same way consistently    28/08/24: SF to update previous - done 28/8  17/09/24: Waiting for MMC return to discuss this item.  15/10/24: This needs investigation because multiple screens are impacted from the Transfer Module by DOM (David or Luigi or Jonathan for design)  Design team (Luke) needs to be involved from UI/UX perspective
product_candidate: Auto generate Pallet ID when doing Transfers

WKI_Summary: VN eInv - Do NOT allow Compliance Book created with blank Serial Prefix
details: Background:   Currently FPT allows Serial Prefix to be “NULL” when Submitting Invoice but DO Validate Serial Prefix during Cancellation. This results in Cancellation (CRD, reversal) error. See HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=91ea1412-9410-4860-b573-b849a5ee3e81&VersionNumber=25.1.7.108&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bMYoIM8wxPWhkv4gMRYppgk7ZJN%2bTQh2B" CS01832340 - ENTETTLEH - VIETNAM E INVOICE IN FAULTY - CREDIT NOTE ERROR    To prevent such cancellation failure from happening, we will add a vlidation on our side. As the serial prefix cannot be edited any more once the 1st compliance# has been assigned, it's better to add validation upon compliance book creation.     Done of Statment.  For VN only. All other countries should remain untouched.   Update the validation rule against the Series Prefix field when creating new Compliance Book.   When Registry Enable E-Reporting Functionality – Receivables is set to NO:   Keep the current behavior as is – pop up the warning as above if Serial Prefix is blank.  2. When Registry Enable E-Reporting Functionality – Receivables is set to YES:   Error out and do NOT allow compliance book to be created if Serial Prefix is blank.   Suggested Error: Please enter a Series Prefix.     ANY 09-Jan-25 11:16 GMT+11:00:   For Developers,  Please read the following wiki document, and follow the country compliance solution design, and DON'T include conditions like CountryCode == 'VN'   https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/11765/Accounting.CountryCompliance-solution
feature_description: Do NOT allow Compliance Book created with blank Serial Prefix

WKI_Summary: ZA country profile AWB currency change to USD
details: Business Requirement: To ensure compliance with IATA regulations, the system must accurately maintain and apply the applicable currency for each country of origin when issuing Air Waybills. According to IATA rules and TACT guidance, MAWBs must be issued in the currency applicable to the country of departure, or in a recognised applicable currency (e.g., USD or EUR), as defined per country. As part of this requirement, the applicable currency for South Africa (ZA) to be updated to USD. IAG Cargo also requested this change.       MM7 25-Aug-25 09:46 GMT+10:00:   Script  update RefCountry  set RN_RX_NKAirWaybillCurrency = 'USD'  where RN_Code = 'ZA'    Created incident: HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/a09d0a73-ffcc-46e9-b95f-7768e71065b2?lang=en-gb" CS02056338 - WISGLOSYD - Request to update RefCountry    Done statement:  ZA country uses USD as AWB currency instead of ZAR    Required by: 1st August 2025    Similar to HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/107f1095-3e84-4533-a754-dd660fb4b4b2?lang=en-gb" WI00921153 - BD country profile AWB currency change to USD      SKW 08-Aug-25 13:20 GMT+10:00:   We can do the same way as this work item did. HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/107f1095-3e84-4533-a754-dd660fb4b4b2?lang=en-gb" WI00921153 - BD country profile AWB currency change to USD  Please prepare the sql query of changing the currency, and create a CR9 to imform Ref team to apply the changes. HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/RefDataRepo/_wiki/wikis/RefDataRepo.wiki/11757/Request-a-SQL-Query-execution" Request a SQL Query execution - Overview
product_candidate: ZA country profile AWB currency change to USD

WKI_Summary: ZA Customs - ROO Certificate should have better system warning
details: FAR 17-Oct-24 18:07 GMT+02:00:   Specifications: https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/DevelopmentCustomsTeam/ETn_W6mH4kZKr4MzMurFxdABcma2xuCykEerPntwFypCMQ?e=hBLbAj      FAR 04-Sep-24 14:02 GMT+02:00:   Specification: https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/DevelopmentCustomsTeam/ES_CGv64ssZBj4H_jmYAEdkBdD9uw2WKyDINE_P-XKPM7w?e=VsV6ld      CKG 29-Oct-24 10:06 GMT+00:00:     Tech Design:    This is for South Africa Customs, so work should be done in the Customs.ZA solution    In C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\ZA\Business\Business\JobComInvoiceLine\JobComInvoiceLineValidation.cs  Method: CheckJI_ROOCert     Look at the bit that checks    IsImport = true   JI_PrimaryPreference is NOT Standard (100)   TradeAgreementCode is NOT empty    If all these conditions are satisfied, this is where we add the warming shown in the spec.    1.  Extract this logic into a methed on ZA's JobComInvoiceLine, called something like AreRooDetailsIncomplete()    2.  Replace the logic in ROOCert to use our new method.    3.  We now need to call this method when attempting to send a customs message    4. Best place is probably in C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\ZA\Business\MessageManagers\MessageManager.cs  Method: CanSendMessages  Although please use your best judgement if this doesn't seem right.    5.  Now when sending a message in ZA, we can send for multiple entries (CusEntryHeader) at the same time, so we will need to check each entry line for each entry header and collate the ones which fail the check.    We can start by looping round each Message Manager and getting the entry header, and then finding all Invoice Lines that we need to warn about by evaluating the method created in step 1 for each invoice line  Something like this...    ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------    foreach (var messageManager in GetAllMessageManagers().OfType<CUSDECMessageManager>())  {   var entry.messageManager.EntryHeader   var toWarnList = entry.AllEntryLines.SelectMany().Where(x => ((CusEntryLine)x).RandomLine.AreRooDetailsIncomplete);  }    //Use toWarnList here to display user popup    ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------    6.  Look in C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\ZA\Business\Business\CusEntryHeader\CusEntryHeader.cs  Method: IsOverwriteProvisionalPaymentAfterValues    To see how we show a popup that requires user input and then outputs to the Log    Insert similar into the code we created in step 5, listing each invoice line that has incomplete Roo details.  Maybe group by Entry Header using the LRN so the user can easily distinguish between the lines.
feature_description: ROO Certificate should have better system warning

WKI_Summary: [CCA] Consol assigned to Allow Freight Spot Rate NOT checked cannot have CQN
details: CJP 08-Sep-25 10:39 GMT+10:00:   https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/AllocationsManagement.Content/pull/26    Summary  A Consol cannot have a CQN number if it is allocated to Allocation Route(s) where 'Allow Freight Spot Rate' is NOT checked.    Rules    Condition(s)  Consol is allocated to one or more Allocation Route(s) where 'Allow Freight Spot Rate' is unchecked  Consol is assigned a Reference Number of type 'CQN - Carrier Quote Number'    Then  Show a hard-stop error: "The Consol has been assigned to Allocation Route(s) where 'Allow Freight Spot Rate' is unchecked. Carrier spot quotes are not permitted for this Consol, so a 'CQN – Carrier Quote Number' cannot be used."    Condition(s)  Consol is assigned a Reference Number of type 'CQN - Carrier Quote Number'  Consol is being allocated to one or more Allocation Route(s) where 'Allow Freight Spot Rate' is unchecked    Then  Show a hard-stop error: "The Consol has used carrier spot quotes with a 'CQN – Carrier Quote Number' in place. The Consol cannot been assigned to Allocation Route(s) where 'Allow Freight Spot Rate' is unchecked."      Notes  Consol can only be allocated to Allocation Route(s) where all 'Allow Freight Spot Rate' settings are either checked or unchecked (consistent with current behavior).    Out of Scope:  CQN is not mandatory even if 'Allow Freight Spot Rate' is checked (since the user may not request a Carrier Spot Quote immediately).  This validation does not apply to Quick Booking or Booking with Quote (both are early job stages).      Patch back to GP1      SRH 08-Sep-25 15:17 GMT+12:00:   Allow Freight Spot Rate was introduced in:  HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/72ace1e5-1cd0-4890-b509-089e195495dc?lang=en-gb" WI00866700 - !CR7 - DHL [CCA][ALR] Allow Freight Spot Rate for Allocation Routes       HMX 16-Sep-25 14:12 GMT+10:00:  Discussed with CJ and only one error on the Allocation ID will be included.
product_candidate: [CCA] Consol assigned to Allow Freight Spot Rate NOT checked cannot have CQN

WKI_Summary: All companies JobHeader get deactivated when deactivating Job, such as Shipment
details: https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/pull/576/files  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/pull/1038    https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/308351    Done steatement  1) New logic for deactivating Job.  2) Remove skipping logic for ReportJobIsChangedByDifferentCompany, which is added at HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=4ba4823e-fe6b-4675-9764-3a12fe908715&VersionNumber=24.11.26.77&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b6bpWQGHqiL3G974dFW0JEfULVFHsUmBl" WI00828020 - Job is not designed to be changed in different company.    -> Remove "BusinessContext.JobDeactivationForAllCompanies" and relevent codes.    RHG 21-Nov-24 16:02 GMT+10:00:   Recently I added a silent report to get understand what case will make JobHeader being changed by non-creation company.  And I found a case that deactivating Job.    When user deactivate shipment, we will deactivate all companies’ JobHeader as well.  This feature looks good at first glance.  However, the JobHeader is designed to be modified for its creation company since our financial logic are calculated by user-context, such as registry.  Something might get wrong when JobHeader is being saved by non-creation company user context.    For the reproducing steps,  Please check “E00012673-EET-PR1” & "Extra Problem -1" cases in "ESC_WI00828020.xlsx" eDoc.
product_candidate: All companies JobHeader get deactivated when deactivating Job, such as Shipment

WKI_Summary: [TKN] WiseCloud Token Client supports multiple domain hints
details: JWU 24-Jan-25 14:54 GMT+08:00:   There're some customers using more than 1 enterprise code, for example, noatum is using NLG & M36. They should be able to specify domain hint when they login WCA.     Quick summary from the discussion with Nic, Jason, Jay, Quince.    no change in UI  add a new parameter for domain hint. When domain hint is set, WCA would ignore the domain hint in the registry and use that instead  Customer to create shortcut to launch WCA with the domain hint they want  there's a few side impact to consider though:   Do we want a refresh token per domain hint? (require a little development for filename)  JWU 24-Jan-25 14:58 GMT+08:00: yes, probably one folder for each enterprise code.NCC 28-Jan-25 10:13 GMT+11:00: We could also use the file name since we have only one refresh token in a folder?  Do we need additional work to not override the registry item when the parameter is set?  JWU 24-Jan-25 15:36 GMT+08:00:  No, that's the point of this parameter NCC 28-Jan-25 10:01 GMT+11:00: That means that they will need a "shortcut" even for their main applications if they have one, as opening a shortcut would override the default domain hint.  (we did not discuss this in the call) that also mean that there's no automatic update of the domain hint in case of migration from one provider to another, or if we implement domain hint discovery JWU 24-Jan-25 15:35 GMT+08:00: customer would need to update it manually.      Below soultion could be for a CR7 if customer want  And for the more expensive solution:  Update the Windows registry to store more than one domain hint  When launching WCA, check if there is more than one domain hint in the registry  If not, continue as per today  if yes, prompt the user to select the domain hint, then try to log the user in using the refresh token, or their credentials   domain hint to be selected from a drop down + allow free text for first connection  When user successfully log in, add the domain hint to the registry item if it does not exist yet  Option: allow to delete domain hint from the list  Option: allow to select default domain hint that would be preselected in the drop down  Logout should bring back to the domain hint selection, so that user can enter a manual domain hint or select a different one    QD 26-Jan-25 12:18 GMT+08:00:   Deisgn:  1. Update in OidcLoginProvider.cs  1.1 Determines whether the startup is a shortcut and contains the DomainHint parameter, if so extract and return.  NCC 28-Jan-25 10:06 GMT+11:00: We do not want to determine if the startup is a shortcut - only if the parameter is present. We probably need some extra work to parse the parameter?    1.2Update RefreshTokenPath and AccessTokenPath  The location of the Token is determined according to DomainHit
product_candidate: [TKN] WiseCloud Token Client supports multiple domain hints

WKI_Summary: Attach Bookings option from Consol to force save
details: ASL 27-Feb-25 10:38 GMT+11:00: Done Statement  Users attaching (converting) Bookings to a Consol from the Consol > Actions > Attach Booking menu item are required to save before attaching, and the system now automatically saves upon selecting the Booking so the conversion occurs immediately.       Note this change is required in order to mitigate and resolve the concurrency issues that are regularly occurring (refer to HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=IssueManager&BusinessEntityPK=5026de48-e26a-482a-a81b-3d334e7f2ba5&VersionNumber=25.2.25.114&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2beLkR8Rj0bkzo6gJiTIk85tR6UiBVYFb1" Issue 00814773 )    We need to know the extent of the issues we will face from this change; one obvious one is the need to refresh the Shipment grid with any data that may have changed by the user in the Booking.     NLR 06-May-25 10:11 GMT+10:00:   - Reason for the change:  Without having the consol automatically save, the booking can exist as both booking and shipment until the consol is saved and the conversion is final.     - Done statement:  The Attach Bookings option is not available until the Consol is saved  The consol is automatically saved with the converted booking attached    DDD 12-May-25 16:01 GMT+08:00:   [Proposed Changes]    in C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Forwarding\Forwarding.GUI\Consol\ConsolForm.cs    1. add a check when intial Consol Form in  void SetupActionsMenu()  if (Consol.IsInDatabase)  {   ZFormMenuStrategy.AddActionsMenuItem(this, ResString.GetMultilingualString("ConsolForm|Menu|AttachBookings", "Attach Bookings"), AttachBookingModuleGridHelper.NewEventHandler(Consol));  }  else  {    // set the button Attach Bookings to ReadOnly  }     When we want to press the action menu, we should have something like this. It would be good to check if a similar option is available for the quoted booking we want to attach.  if (Consol.HasChanges)     {      Globals.Message.ShowError(Res.GetString("cb76b4c4-45fa-4d69-bc1f-89f2863e0b57", "Please save before attaching"));      return;     }  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.GUI%2FConsol%2FConsolForm.cs&version=GBmaster&line=377&lineEnd=382&lineStartColumn=4&lineEndColumn=1&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    we should save attached booking when we try to attach it customer will not press save button  it would be nice if it is possible to check if related booking is saved or not if it is not saved we should ask for it first  We might have concurrency as well we should consider that case as well. we are handling this case at the moment. we do not need error reporter in the code with this change I believe    CTS 29-May-25 11:56 GMT+10:00:     The pattern we should be using should be similar to `AttachLoadListToConsolGUIHelper` (WI00555521)  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/commit/da526ab351449a7e347a98c59efba2533f9034e5    See design notes:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=f97fe23c-076f-4a9d-bb6c-2403fde80207&StorageDocPK=ab5dcb67-230e-4dc1-afaf-1b77a49d2a14&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bByH73acMuNAZdc%2bQ0AXCXmURgxjjUE0V" CTS 29-May-25 11:56:  File design.md (Attachment)    We can implement app locks in a future work item to handle concurrent edits.

WKI_Summary: AM:(PE) Shipment archive/purge eligibility form and action menu
details: A50 19-Nov-24 12:10 GMT+11:00:    HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=0b8ed670-2e38-4a50-8903-7da2d8820c0b&VersionNumber=24.11.19.90&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bRf4Cf6rBzMaSACBcva%2fVR74yC0Qsh7hp" WI00759932 - AM: Shipment archive/purge eligibility chunk main archiveable filter  Refer to HLD and DDB in above WI      A50 19-Nov-24 12:11 GMT+11:00:     DONE = Non-blocking form created to run each OPS filter on a Shipment  DONE = Action menu item to run form on Shipment    PTW 17-Apr-25 10:24 GMT+10:00: Design Question - does this eligibility check belong in Shipments module (where users expect to find all details about shipments), or Job Management module (where all Job Headers can be inspected, which is where AM starts eligibility checks)?  Recommendation is Shipments Module as this is more intuitive for users who are typically inspecting an individual Shipment. If placed in Job Management, not all jobs present will be eligible for a form of archiving, which could complicate the design and user experience - and some jobs might have the option to check, and some would not. Further the context of Job Management which opens jobs to a profit/loss summary screen, is not closely related to archiving eligibility which again may confuse the user experience. Overall, Shipments Module will make this simpler to implement and more intuitive.
product_candidate: (PE) Shipment archive/purge eligibility form and action menu

WKI_Summary: eTail V2 - PreScreening Enhancements - Allow multiple values
details: NKG 12-Nov-24 17:42 GMT+11:00:     BACKGROUND:  CBP will start flagging non-compliant S321 entries in 2025. Section 321 treshold is 800 USD/Person per day. We currently allow to Pre-screen based on 'Goods Value' but in reality we check against HVC_GoodsValue AND the SUM of HVS_CustomsValue.  For S321, we should not consider HVS_CustomsValue, but we could consider HVS_IntrinsicValue.  We will allow maximum flexibility so Users can set this as they prefer.    Proposed solution: we add 'Items Customs Values' and 'Items Intrinsic Values' to the list of values in the 'Field Name' column. See HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=2051e89c-5143-4684-9ffd-d97e1a01d796&StorageDocPK=225134b2-5731-4fb1-87f7-4b562c069ff0&Hash=%2bXee%2fcz9fWKwGhl2eFpxaBnISWZqOam11&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" NKG 13-Nov-24 09:23:  File Values.tif (Attachment)  See NKG 12-Nov-24 17:37:  File PRJ00048898.docx (Project Plan) in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAUSSYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=36f8dad2-a04b-4d5e-a422-cff8ba8dc88c&VersionNumber=24.11.12.73&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bRMO5O0t%2bTDNWuUnTZCywDlVRN9qZ6b48" Project PRJ00048898    DONE 1: Users can Pre-screen based on HVC_GoodsValue, HVS_CustomsValue, and/or HVS_IntrinsicValue. Users can select one, a combination or all of those.  DONE 2: If selecting 'Goods Value', we only check against HVC_GoodsValue.    DONE:  1a. Under the Freight > HVLV > HVLV Pre-Screening registry setting, add "Total Lines Customs Value" and "Total Lines Intrinsic Value" to the Field Name list:  1b. Use the same characteristics as Field Name "Goods Value", which are currently an "Override De Minimis Value" checkbox and a text box where users can specify a USD value, as well as a "Check Same Consignee" checkbox. Note: any logic we have implemented behind these characteristics for "Goods Value" should be implemented for "Total Lines Customs Value" and "Total Lines Intrinsic Value" as well.    2a. When user selects "Goods Value", check against the HVC_GoodsValue of the Consignment ONLY, instead of the HVC_GoodsValue AND the SUM of HVS_CustomsValue currently.  2b. When user selects "Total Lines Customs Value", check against the SUM of HVS_CustomsValue of all Item Lines.  2c. When user selects "Total Lines Intrinsic Value", check against the SUM of HVS_IntrinsicValue of all Item Lines.    Note for devs: we will allow use this criteria when pre screening against multiple Shipments. Screening against multiple shipments will be added in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=bc30ce12-379f-4541-b634-303a428b6974&VersionNumber=24.11.13.50&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bdlvXCO%2bIz6HCtv6mYZ6Ah7WPFdCR4kSX" WI00829162 - eTail V2 - PreScreening Enhancements - Check against multiple Shipments.      TT6 26-Dec-24 12:43 GMT+08:00:     1. In HVLVConsignment.cs, rename TotalLineValues to TotalLineCustomsValues and add TotalLineIntrinsicValues  [DecimalPlaces(2)]  public ZDecimal TotalLineCustomsValues => ActiveItems.SelectMany(item => item.Lines.OfType<HVLVItemLine>()).Sum(line => line.HVS_CustomsValue);    [DecimalPlaces(2)]  public ZDecimal TotalLineIntrinsicValues => ActiveItems.SelectMany(item => item.Lines.OfType<HVLVItemLine>()).Sum(line => line.HVS_IntrinsicValue);    2. In HVLVPreScreeningField, add "Total Lines Customs Value" and "Total Lines Intrinsic Value" to constants.    abstract class Constants    {     public const string HVS_FormattedOriginTariff = "HVS_FormattedOriginTariff";     public const string HVS_FormattedDestinationTariff = "HVS_FormattedDestinationTariff";     public const string UserDefined = "UserDefined";     public const string SpecialCharacters = "SpecialCharacters";     public const string TotalLineCustomsValues = "TotalLineCustomsValues";     public const string TotalLineIntrinsicValues = "TotalLineIntrinsicValues";    }      3. In HVLVPreScreeningField, add "Total Lines Customs Value" and "Total Lines Intrinsic Value" to FieldDescriptionList.  result.AddPair(Res.GetString("c1be8a14-2cba-426b-b9b0-4db5f99ae0ba", "Total Lines Customs Value"), Constants.TotalLineCustomsValues);  result.AddPair(Res.GetString("da121fe0-9b78-4a1c-94ac-4a3421aae7d3", "Total Lines Intrinsic Value"), Constants.TotalLineIntrinsicValues);    4. Expand the IsDeminimusField of HVLVPreScreeningField to to cover "Total Lines Customs Value" and "Total Lines Intrinsic Value"  public ZBool IsDeminimusField => FieldName == HVLVConsignmentSchema.Constants.HVC_GoodsValue           || FieldName == Constants.TotalLineCustomsValues           || FieldName == Constants.TotalLineIntrinsicValues;    5. In \Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\eTail\Business\PreScreening\PreScreeningAction\CheckDeminimusValueAction.cs  Modify the PerformPreScreeningAndPopulateResult function to handle 3 types of Deminimus fields. below is just a code spike.      protected override void PerformPreScreeningAndPopulateResult(HVLVConsignmentPreScreeningResult result)    {     var goodsValueCurrencyCode = consignment.HVC_RX_NKGoodsValueCurrency;     var deminimusCurrencyCode = field.DeminimusCurrency;     var deminimusCurrency = RefCurrency.LoadFromCurrencyCode(consignment.Factory, deminimusCurrencyCode);       ZString caption;     Func<HVLVConsignment, decimal> selector = null;       if (!goodsValueCurrencyCode.IsEmpty)     {      ZDecimal valueToCheck = ZDecimal.Zero;      switch (field.FieldName)      {       case HVLVConsignmentSchema.Constants.HVC_GoodsValue:       {        valueToCheck = consignment.HVC_GoodsValue;        caption = (NoResString)"Combined Goods Value of the same consignee";        selector = hvlvConsignment => hvlvConsignment.HVC_GoodsValue;        break;       }         case HVLVPreScreeningField.Constants.TotalLineCustomsValues:       {        valueToCheck = consignment.TotalLineCustomsValues;        caption = (NoResString)"Combined Total Line Customs Values of the same consignee";        selector = hvlvConsignment => hvlvConsignment.TotalLineCustomsValues;         break;       }         case HVLVPreScreeningField.Constants.TotalLineIntrinsicValues:       {        valueToCheck = consignment.TotalLineIntrinsicValues;        caption = (NoResString)"Combined Total Line Intrinsic Values of the same consignee";        selector = hvlvConsignment => hvlvConsignment.TotalLineIntrinsicValues;         break;       }      }          if (deminimusCurrencyCode != goodsValueCurrencyCode)      {       valueToCheck = ConvertCurrency(valueToCheck, goodsValueCurrencyCode, deminimusCurrency);      }        CheckSingleConsignmentValue(valueToCheck, result, DataBoundResourceStrings.GetDataForProperty(typeof(HVLVConsignment), field.FieldName).Caption);     }       if (field.CheckSameConsignee)     {      var otherConsignmentsWithSameConsignee = consignment.ConsignmentsBelongToSameConsigneeExcludingParent.OfType<HVLVConsignment>().ToList();        if (otherConsignmentsWithSameConsignee.Any())      {       CheckConsignmentsValuesWithSameConsinee(selector, otherConsignmentsWithSameConsignee, deminimusCurrency, result, caption);      }     }    }    Code spike PR:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/299639
feature_description: PreScreening Enhancements - Allow multiple values

WKI_Summary: GSS: Return CO2 emissions estimate in GSS web API response
details: KSY 12-Feb-25 12:42 GMT+11:00:   Done statement: GSS web API response includes CO2 estimate at Route and Leg level.    PL1 05-Mar-25 11:35 GMT+11:00:   As per today's discussion:  Numeric elements "Co2eKgPerTeu" and "Co2eKgPerTonne" are added to the leg level of the response  If no value can be calculated, the response value is "null"  Aggregation to the schedule level will be handled by the receiving system (e.g. CargoWise)  Rounding will be handled by the receiving system  Sample: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=daad1e49-6443-4e4f-81ad-33f5c3f5ab95&StorageDocPK=3f819052-1ec6-496a-ac06-54a4b6abb9d8&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bPFgIY4KE0ljwt9qxlBe4vUGwkSmF7Ncm" PL1 05-Mar-25 11:42:  File GssResponse.json (Sample File)    PL1 05-Mar-25 11:55 GMT+11:00:   As per comment from Daniel Bahna, this change will require a separate Update Note (example: https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=3967476e-9024-4f90-848b-72662141ae1c) and an update to the GSS Technical Guide.    DBA 10-Mar-25 10:52 GMT+11:00: Ideally we should do this for GSS API v2 only. The long term plan is to decommission v1. Devs to confirm who is currentl using v1 (DHL only?) and I will reach out to them.      HL3 09-May-25 10:13 GMT+10:00:   The CO2 emission values look up can be done either before or after the Route and NRoute are combined. There should be an existing unique non-cluster index with the provider value (BP/Linescape) on the "LegCo2Emission" table, and this is suitable for the lookup for NRoute and Route as provider value is known.     If CO2 emission value lookup is done afterward, the provider value will be gone, then a separate index will be required.      HL3 14-May-25 17:41 GMT+10:00:   - Need to add caching for the CO2 emission values lookup.  - By default, hide the 2 new fields in the GSS response (using ignore attribute in the JSON serialization). New fields should only be present when the co2 function goes live.    THB 16-May-25 13:24 GMT+10:00:   Detailed Build Design:  Add Co2eKgPerTeu and Co2eKgPerTonne as nullable decimal fields to LegV2 - Mark these with `[property: JsonIgnore]` until this feature is released  Update swagger LegV2 examle with CO2 values  Use ICo2Accessor.GetAsync Accessor Method in RoutesControllerV2 to get CO2 values and add them to every LegV2 (could alternatively use entity framework joins when getting the legs if performance is better)    HL3 16-May-25 15:50 GMT+10:00:   Need to check the performance of the co2 emission values lookup and determine whether cacing is required and whether it could help improve the performance (given the large number of legs).    THB 19-May-25 09:40 GMT+10:00:   Test list:  Add a new test to RoutesControllerTests to check that CO2 values are returned by RoutesController.SearchAsync when a LegCo2Emission value exists  Add another test to RoutesControllerTests to check that null CO2 values are returned when no LegCo2Emission exists  The response should not return the co2 fields as they are excluded from the JSON serialization. May be mark the tests with ignore attribute. When the co2 changes go live, then remove the ignore attribute.   - These tests check the output of `SearchAsync`, this method is called just before a HTTP request is serialised, the new values will be hidden during serialisation so the test won't need to be changed      - Additionally, the E2E tests don't check individual properties of the JSON body so those tests wont need to be modified when CO2 is made public    THB 22-May-25 11:57 GMT+10:00:   Initial testing on docker before pushing to staging:  Using Locust on http://au2sp-sbpl-401.sand.wtg.zone:8088 test staging and thb-gss-web-api average response times for /api/v2/routes/search (4x30s Locust runs for warmup and then a 30s Locust run for the reports below)  Results without CO2 on old staging (http://au2sp-sbpl-401.sand.wtg.zone:8082): 80ms                                                             HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=daad1e49-6443-4e4f-81ad-33f5c3f5ab95&StorageDocPK=7efcb890-1a5a-4806-b0b6-305a4f8fb3f0&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bLvaG7YgoxR%2bZ7mJ8l6G76hgrKROais6e" THB 23-May-25 14:25:  File Staging 80ms.html (Attachment) added to eDocs tab.  Results for thb-gss-web-api (parallel 5 at a time) (http://au2sp-sbpl-401.sand.wtg.zone:8084): 120ms          HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=daad1e49-6443-4e4f-81ad-33f5c3f5ab95&StorageDocPK=1e48bccf-57f1-4fd4-a883-42566a728765&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b1mUwrZS05vEeLm1dMJ9nv880%2ffcjn0q%2b" THB 23-May-25 14:26:  File Parallel routes, sequential legs 120ms.html (Attachment) added to eDocs tab.    THB 29-May-25 10:05 GMT+10:00:   Performance testing on staging:  Locust on http://au2sp-sbpl-401.sand.wtg.zone:8088 is used to find average response times for /api/v2/routes/search  Results for staging (http://au2sp-sbpl-401.sand.wtg.zone:8082): 130ms      HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=daad1e49-6443-4e4f-81ad-33f5c3f5ab95&StorageDocPK=fef9d2db-d174-476e-bcff-3e57c021f1aa&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2biUvVfkyCz57GkJyNq51s9JeXw6VX0pC8" THB 30-May-25 10:24:  File Staging 130ms.html (Attachment) added to eDocs tab.  Made a request for AUSYD -> CNSHA which has 400+ routes and 1000+ legs, didn't overload the server or time out  Ran Locust with 20 Users for 5 minutes, no errors were thrown    THB 02-Jun-25 10:27 GMT+10:00  Feature validation for CO2 values:  Co2eKgPerTeu and Co2eKgPerTonne are included in Swagger APIv2 Schemas -> Leg, and /api/v2/routes/search http://au2sp-sbpl-401.sand.wtg.zone:8082/index.html?urls.primaryName=GSSv2  Staging /api/v2/routes/search filters that return CO2:  LoadPort: AUSYD, DischargePort: USNYC, Imo: 9495038, 9627978  LoadPort: AUSYD, DischargePort: CNSHA, Imo: 9991147  LoadPort: KRPUS, DischargePort: CNSHA, Imo: 9704609

WKI_Summary: DMN: eDocs S3 Encryption Master Key Rotation
details: When we introduced eDocs encryption for S3 storage, we created a master key but it never get rotated. We said that it will have a rotation service in future  Need to consult with the security team when we design this.  Master key is currently storaged as plain text in the DB, which is an intermittent solution as there is a bigger plan to move CW1 secrets out of the database.  Old master key should be kept forever as the existing eDocs's are encrypted with datakey that is encrypted with the old master key.    DE: Able to create and use a new Master Key for a given period (Quarterly or yearly).      TN2 11-Feb-25 13:29 GMT+11:00:   Just to rotate the master key the DBD should be as follows:  1/ Add a new registry item to store the rotation period  Registry Path: System > DocManager > S3 Storage  Registry Name: eDocs Encryption Master Key Rotation Period (Days)  Registry Code: EDocsEncryptionMasterKeyRotationPeriod  Registry Description: The number of days that the eDocs encryption master key should be rotated.  Default Value : 60    2/ Add a new service task to run one a month, and generate a new master key if the current master key age is more than the value defined in registry item    3/ The new eDocs (after editted or newly created) will use the new master key to encrypt the data key    DZG 12-Feb-25 10:28 GMT+11:00:   Regarding point 2 of adding a new service to run once a month, I would perfer to modifying StorageDocsMasterKayProvder.GetCurrentMasterKey(), we need to make sure it's thread safe.  public static StorageDocsMasterKey GetCurrentMasterKey()  {   var query = new ZDBOnlyQuery(typeof(StorageDocsMasterKey));   query.ReLoadExistingRows = true;   query.MaximumRows = 1;   query.OrderBy = StorageDocsMasterKeySchema.Constants.SCK_SystemCreateTimeUtc + " DESC";     var result = FactoryInstance.LoadTop1<StorageDocsMasterKey>(query);   var masterKeyDaysToKeep = DocManagerRegistry.Instance.EDocsEncryptionMasterKeyRotationPeriod;   if (result == null || result.SCK_SystemCreateTimeUtc.AddDays(masterKeyDaysToKeep) < ZDateTime.UtcToday)   {    result = FactoryInstance.New<StorageDocsMasterKey>();    result.SCK_KeyValue = StorageDocsEncryptionHelper.NewMasterKey();    FactoryInstance.Save();   }   return result;  }      JMK 26-Feb-25 12:05 GMT+11:00:   Please note: Master key is not used to encrypt eDocs directly. It is used to encrypt data key, and data key is used to encrypted the edocs. So if the master key has been changed, the data key should remain the same although it could be re-encrypted with the new master key, if the eDoc is modified.  We are not expecting all data key to be re-encrypted when a new master key is created. The new master key is only used for new data key or when re-encrypt an existing data key
product_candidate: eDocs S3 Encryption Master Key Rotation

WKI_Summary: [OOQ] Registry Ship>Packages>Default Number of Decimal Places on OOQ
details: Done Statement  Changed the flow for rounding decimal in measurement of volume in OOQ .    Reason for change (To explain Why)  Currently, in OOQ, when the volume is calculated by height/length/width/count, it will be first rounded by the scale in the schema, then be rounded up/down by registry setting. It will cause the issue in this sequence.     What has been done (Technical Perspective)  Removed the flow of first rounding by the scale in the schema.    ===============================================================================================  Problem Description  Priority enhancement creted from HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=1f21a847-fc55-4ec2-9853-12db82148c11&VersionNumber=24.11.25.18&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bGftoApvkt5TkW%2f9rJv%2btpZ8r0GTOCzjZ" CS01765060 - SCFGLOSIN - Different volumn but same dimensions  Registry Shipments > Packages > Default Number of Decimal Places: It controls SHP but not OOQ     Done Statement  Registry Shipments > Packages > Default Number of Decimal Places is applicable to OOQ   ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------      AZR 29-Nov-24 11:20 GMT+11:00:   Rounding is applied based on "Registry> Shipments > Packages > Default Number of Decimal Places" when Volume is calculated from dimensions on OOQ  Currently this functionality works on shipments and bookings but not on OOQ.  See https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FShared%2FFreight.Business%2FPackLines%2FPackLine.cs&version=GBmaster&line=3242&lineEnd=3242&lineStartColumn=53&lineEndColumn=68&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents
product_candidate: [OOQ] Registry Ship>Packages>Default Number of Decimal Places on OOQ

WKI_Summary: EU H7 - Publish XUE only if Bill is linked to HVLV
details: SNW 28-Mar-25 10:46 GMT+08:00:    Because add new columns was not suggested, we decide to use HVLTRF log + bill created time to check whether a bill should add a CES log or not.(Add CES log only when bill created time is before HVL TRF log time)  To implement that, we made some other changes:  1. Add HVL TRF log to related customs job after sync data too, not just create data.  2. When add HVL TRF log to AU&NZ Cargo Report, the parameter has been changed from REF to JOB, example: from '|REF=S0000001001|TYP=HVL' to '|JOB=S0000001001|TYP=HVL'          HC4 10-Mar-25 12:07 GMT+11:00 (Updated):  see spike https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/317496     J01 06-Dec-24 14:59 GMT+11:00:   Setting HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=fcbcff3a-a3b8-4768-8b2c-06f2b9b85ac4&VersionNumber=24.12.6.37&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bK0DF%2foWKxqBKFttk%2fDSh1lE3I1gKYPtY" WI00830732 - EU H7 - Add collector as pre-req, as that WI will handle linking HVLV with H7.    'NKG 25-Nov-24 16:58 GMT+11:00:   BACKGROUND: in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=fb05234d-0398-4736-9af7-18eb69aa7aec&VersionNumber=24.11.25.18&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bJp2HshKWbn%2f7kQv8S1LuuPNpC0mt0CwN" WI00794799 - EU H7 - Populate Import/Export Customs Clearance Status in HVLV we automated the update of HVC_ImportCustomsClearanceStatus upon update of ABL_BillStatus. For doing so, we publish a XUE from H7.  We did not limit the publishing of this XUE to Bills that have a linked HVLV Consignment, meaning that every time ABL_BillStatus is updated, a XUE is published.     AU/NZ Cargo Reports should have some kind of logic for only publishing when a HVLV Consignment is linked. We could reuse that.    DONE: XUE is only published if H7 Bills is linked to HVLV Consignment.    HC4 04-Dec-24 16:45 GMT+11:00:   Proposed Changes:  Option1:  When updating ABL_BillStatus in https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FCustoms%2FEU%2FH7%2FBusiness%2FBusinessObjects%2FAsycudaBill%2FAsycudaBill.cs, check whether ABL_JS_Shipment can be found in HVL_ConsignmentHeader, and relevant consignment can be found in HVL_Consignment, add the event log only when such consignment exists.  Option2:  Because we added an event type CustomsEntryStatus when setting BillStatus in https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FCustoms%2FEU%2FH7%2FBusiness%2FBusinessObjects%2FAsycudaBill%2FAsycudaBill.cs, then while handling OnUniversalEventAddedCore in https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FeTail%2FDataTransfer%2FUniversal%2FHVLVConsignment%2FHVLVConsignmentDataContextManager.cs, we can only assign value when DataContextKey is not empty in switch case AutoEvents.CustomsEntryStatusCode.
feature_description: Publish XUE only if Bill is linked to HVLV

WKI_Summary: 'Customs Charges on Freight Jobs'  setting to include OBR & OBO charge groups
details: NRS 18-Feb-25 10:46 GMT+11:00:     Current Behaviour:   The 'Customs Charges on Freight jobs' registry setting only affects charge lines where the charge group belongs to BON  (Customs Brokerage (Stand alone brokerage, No shipment)), BRK (Customs Brokerage/Agency/Entry Fees) or CDS (Customs Duty / Tax/ Entry Fees and other disbursements) charge groups    Gap:   The setting should also affect Charge lines where the charge group belongs to OBR (Origin Customs Brokerage) or  OBO (Origin Customs Brokerage (stand alone brokerage, no shipment))    Solution:   Update the Registry setting so that the OBO & OBR Charge Groups are also included.
product_candidate: 'Customs Charges on Freight Jobs'  setting to include OBR & OBO charge groups

WKI_Summary: DMN:(CR6) MFD Doc Type
details: JA3 04-Jun-25 09:02 GMT+10:00: Split this work into two parts. On this WI we will add a warning when a user deactivates a document type that is used in a template.    On HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=5c27b596-b206-4db9-bfca-cfbd9d6ba2f8&VersionNumber=25.6.4.30&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bHcmTMHZWiexAK8T7ElIr6Wpzg6saGTE3" WI00918113 - Dealing with an inactive Document Type we can look at the next steps.    HLD update accordingly.    J51 21-May-25 16:41 GMT+10:00:   Within the RunPreSaveValidationCore() method check if isActive has changed and it is now false check if templates are using the type if so a popup warning box will say “Warning! There are templates that are assigned to this Document Type.”     DZG 23-May-25 09:08 GMT+10:00:   Product woud like to have an eDoc attached for detailed build design, so it's better to create a word document for it and upload to eDocs.  From the wording above, I am not sure which RunPreSaveValidationCore it is, please post a link to the source code in DevOps repo.  In HLD, it also requires to add a log in DOD service task, when the doc type is deactivated, please add design about how to implement this requirement.   - In the DOD Service task log, add a warning record if the Document Type allocated to an eDoc is inactive. This entry in the log will say “Warning: This eDoc is being assigned to the Document type '<XYZ>', which is currently inactive.”    J51 29-May-25 11:34 GMT+10:00:   In the file RefDocTypeValidation.cs add an override to validate that if isActive (RT_IsActive) flag is false then check if there are templates that are using the deactived type, if so a popup warning box will say “Warning! There are templates that are assigned to this Document Type.”    A possible spot might me in the StmPrintJob.cs in the case of saving to an eDocs it should check the record of the doctype and if this type is not active (The corresponding RT_IsActive flag being false) then log “Warning: This eDoc is being assigned to the Document type '<XYZ>', which is currently inactive.” using the HostLogger.Log class and method. Another file that might be worth looking at is the DocumentJobTaskTest.cs as it also appears to test logging a message during the process of sending a system generated document to the eDoc tab.    DZG 04-Jun-25 12:53 GMT+10:00:   HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=c632feb7-3f3f-4ca4-aa74-1e402d6da95b&StorageDocPK=e34c5464-ed60-4c4a-a3d1-629c6301be83&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bmc1503CyCrJ5S%2b7vtIOjVnSXumjGI3LE" DZG 04-Jun-25 12:53:  File WI00889468 Detailed Build Design.docx (High Level Design)    JMK 18-Jun-25 12:13 GMT+10:00:   I believe we should not allow users to save if they are deactivating a Doc Type that is still being used by any template. Allowing this won't solve the problem, as users can simply ignore the warning, and the issue will persist. Additionally, the warning message only appears once, and if we permit this action, showing more warnings or logging during DOD or other processes will not be effective.  Unless there is a specific use case that justifies allowing the deactivation of a Doc Type while it is still being used by a template, we should not permit this action.    DZG 23-Jul-25 09:44 GMT+10:00:   One more scenario to address, when there is already an inactive doc type being used by any doc template, we should show the error message when the inactive doc type is modified and saved.

WKI_Summary: CC:Handling Mandatory Attributes
details: TG1 16-Jul-25 15:42 GMT+10:00:     Chunk from HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/f29324bc-fa6d-442a-8b00-e38ed6cfc771?lang=en-gb" WI00934788 - Cycle Count UX Improvement    After discussed with team, we will go with option B  When Attributes (include packing date and expiry Date) is mandatory, during Cycle Count, it enforces data entry before allowing the user to proceed to the next step.      TG1 10-Jul-25 11:20 GMT+10:00:     We have identified several areas for improvement within the Cycle Count module to enhance clarity, usability, and user experience:    4) Handling Mandatory Attributes – Further Discussion Required  Two options are under consideration for managing mandatory attribute fields during cycle counts:  A:Have a specific message when cycle count scanned attribute is missing and a specific message when cycle count scanned attribute is incorrect to aler the user  B:  for the mandatory attributes, enforce data entry before allowing the user to proceed to the next step.        J25 02-Sep-25 14:09 GMT+10:00:   It has been decided that this WI will be merged with: HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/d08551b5-c298-45fd-9ea3-bf582e90d1d6?lang=en-gb" WI00938186 - CC: Rename the 'Next' Button on the RF Scan Attributes Page    We have identified several areas for improvement within the Cycle Count module to enhance clarity, usability, and user experience:    3) Rename the 'Next' Button on the RF Scan Attributes Page  Currently, on the RF device, when users manually enter attributes, there is no Transition Text Button available.  The 'Next' button is misleading. It currently navigates to the 'Scan Quantity' page instead of moving to the next attribute field.  Proposed Enhancement:  Rename the 'Next' button to reflect its actual function, such as “Proceed to Quantity”    J25 02-Sep-25 09:36 GMT+10:00:   Change from next to proceed here:    https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/Glow/blob/350b4777a7ae4708fff4a4c18c93d4dba59e7ea0/CargoWiseOne/Configuration/BPMFormFlow/ProductWarehouse/WRF/55935be71cc44b4e972619781171d514.yaml#L115C1-L122C12      J25 02-Sep-25 14:15 GMT+10:00:   During the cycle count processes, whenever an attribute is mandatory and left empty, when the user attempts to go to the next page, a toast will show explaining that certain fields are left blank: "Attribute(s) <attribute_name> is/are empty. Please scan the attribute(s)."     DBD:   1. Update the required form flows to have a new condition checking the value of any mandatory attributes, show toast and don't save if any are empty, continue normally if not.   2. Update this form flow to show "Proceed" instead of "Next" https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/Glow/blob/350b4777a7ae4708fff4a4c18c93d4dba59e7ea0/CargoWiseOne/Configuration/BPMFormFlow/ProductWarehouse/WRF/55935be71cc44b4e972619781171d514.yaml#L115C1-L122C12  3. Update any FE tests to reflect these changes.   Once done, the user should not be able to save changes during cycle counting when any mandatory attributes are empty, and the next button on the scan attributes page should say "Proceed" instead of "Next", better reflecting its functionality and reducing confusion for customers.

WKI_Summary: Reduce CW1Support token lifetime
details: JZ3 04-Oct-24 12:37 GMT+10:00:     This is related to incident raised HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=f03a555e-47d6-4637-8a34-80c778572f6b&VersionNumber=24.10.4.95&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bYlmMeFkxlzqs8MJpnGfQSmP4%2b9sOQCZ6" CS01754838 - WISGLOSYD - CW1Support token shared with Self-Hosted MUST expire after one use    We need to reduce the CW1Support token life span so that after/shortly after the CW1Support token is used, it should be no longer be valid. When user attempt to log into CW1 using the token after it has expired, the user should get the error message indicating the token is no longer valid. When CW1Support token expires, user already logged in successfully should not be affected.      A.G 04-Oct-24 13:14 GMT+10:00:   tech design  in this WI, we will just reduce the token lifetime from 60 to 5 minutes. This should resolve the majority of concerns. It will be re-usable within those 5 minutes but will expire afterwards.    JSF 04-Oct-24 16:02 GMT+02:00:   Please decide whether we need to proceed with this WI or not? There are two ways that the CW1Support token is generated and used;  1. Via incidents for customer systems, and  2. via Help menu for internal systems and UATs  It looks like this change addresses the second item which isn't particularly urgent or necessary, as in, why can't a token intended for internal use last for an hour?  The first point already has a timer set to 90 seconds. For some reason, yet to be determined, the token is lasting for around 7 minutes, which kinda sucks because it's 7 minutes and not 90 seconds, but 7 minutes is not terrible.  Perhaps the focus of this WI should shift to figuring out why the 90s expiry isn't being observed as expected.    A.G 08-Oct-24 07:39 GMT+11:00:   yes, I agree, let's repurpose this WI to determine why it takes 7 minutes to expire instead of 90 seconds as it was intended. This WI however has a lower priority than the other one on the incident.  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=1995f408-9784-40cc-b44a-da0d767e63e3&VersionNumber=24.10.7.3&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bs%2b7ONqjcx2gYS12pq7w87rhGxrCY009J" WI00812743 - Update CW1Support token to be single use only - this one should be done first unless it is a very quick fix to go down from 7 minutes to 90 seconds.      A.G 08-Oct-24 13:55 GMT+11:00:   Investigation outcome  ok so 5 minutes is the default ClockSkew https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.identitymodel.tokens.tokenvalidationparameters.defaultclockskew?view=msal-web-dotnet-latest#microsoft-identitymodel-tokens-tokenvalidationparameters-defaultclockskew    if we want to decrease 5 min + 90 seconds to something else, we must also reduce ClockSkew parameter.  This can be done by adding a parameter to JwtSecurity.VerifySignedJwt(RSA rsa, string token, int clockSkew = 5)  I'm not 100% sure it is needed though, 7 minutes is not too bad.  Talked to Ben.  Ben Graham  1:58 pm  It's good enough.     In this case we leave it at 6m30s and need to document it in the relevant update note if it exists. Product people will need to find relevant documentation to update OR create a new one. But I guess it must exist somewhere already.

details: A25 10-Jul-25 23:05 GMT+03:00:     When the debtor is not e-invoice registered, while posting an eligible e-invoice transactions if there is no PEC registration code ( which is an ordinary email address for non e-invoice registered organizations ) is defined for debtor, an error is raised.    However, it is possible to post the transaction without email notification, so instead of raising an error we should allow user to post the transaction and display a warning message. WKI_Summary: PP: New STL collector for Return type receives (RET)
details: LBM 20-Mar-25 20:14 GMT+11:00:   Validations have been added in order for clients to not be able to game the system and have valid return receives.    For functional review,  1. Operational action to generate RMA from an order in the order module will now disallow RMA generation if the order has a related return receive.  2. Generate RMA from selected order lines now loads all related return receives on the order and disallow over returning. A new column is added on the GUI for generating RMA from order lines to indicate available quantity to return.  3. Manually creating a return receive will require a receive number as the order number of order to return. A warning is added on the receive number if it's empty or if the reference does not point to a departed order.  4. User is allowed to update the order to link by updating the receive number if no order has been linked to the receive yet. If a valid order is linked to the receive, then the receive number entry becomes read only.  5. Return receives are now disallowed from over returning or adding lines with products that were never released by the order. This validation only takes effect if the return receive is linked to an order.  6. Return receives are now not allowed to link to an order that has already been fully returned. A validation error will be shown to the user.  7. Receive lines based on the linked order's lines with the correct available quantities are automatically added to the return receive during save if the receive does not have lines and it's the first time the order is linked to the receive. Succeeding saves will not do this if the receive has been linked to the order already.  8. Return receives created from RF will display a warning if reference does not point to a valid order.  9. RF also disallows return receive creation if the referenced order is already fully returned.    MMC 06-Dec-24 14:12 GMT+11:00:   Looks like all auto created Return Receives currently link to a Parent Order, we should use this as the way to determine if a receive is a valid Return, that way it can't be gamed by customers.    Additionally, the operational action that generates Return Receives from Orders should have validation that prevents generating the Return if the Order is already linked to a Child Receive. The operational action returns the entire order, so if a return receive is already linked it does not make sense to use this operational action - they should use the Order Line Grid action for partial returns.    Additionally, the Menu Action Grid   on Order Lines that let's you create a Return Receive for the selected Order Lines should load all existing child Receives, sum up the current product totals and check if we're over the max.  Disallow creating the receive if any order line selected is over the max.    Additionally, if manually creating a "RET" receive, External Reference is immediately Mandatory (you cannot leave it empty for the docket ID).  Furthermore, the External Reference entered must match a warehouse order with the same external reference. On RunPreSaveValidation, link the Order and check the product totals just like for the Menu Action Grid, and add a validation error on any order line that's over the max. Additionally don't allow the save if the Order is already fully returned (otherwise they just create an unusable receive and get charged for it). Optionally, just from the desktop, on RunPreSaveValidation() when first saving the receive, we could auto fill all non returned products for the linked order.  Same logic applies when creating manually from Warehouse RF, the entered Receive reference, needs to be a valid Order Ref and do the same validation as when creating manually via desktop. Both if fully returned, and then for each unload of a product.    Update existing "WIN" STL Collector to ignore "RET" receives that have a parent Order.  Create a new STL Collector "WRT" that only collects "RET" receives with a Parent Order. BRS: Ensure product inform Finance of the new code when this is done!    BRS: Should we add a NoCheck constraint to ensure that any RET receives have a linked order?  MMC: Sounds good!    CKR 02-Dec-24 13:05 GMT+11:00:   We've got the approval from the Finance Team to move forward with this change (see email attached).    Following discussions with Brenton and Maciej:  1. We need to implement a mechanism to prevent customers from gaming the new feature by designating all their receives as RET to reduce costs.  2. BRS proposed allowing the creation of a RET receive only if it is linked to an existing order (even if from a different warehouse).  3. BRS also suggested implementing a validation rule to ensure that no more units can be returned than were originally released in the linked order. If this condition isn't met, the order cannot be saved.  4. In a future phase, we plan to introduce import capabilities for RET Receive types via CSV or UXML.    TG1 03-Sep-24 12:14 GMT+10:00:     Current Functionality : Existing STL 'WIN' includes both normal Receives and Returns so we can't distinguish    Desired Functionality: Create a new STL Collector to only look at 'RET' receive types    Additional information:    03/09/24: We want to be able to see the % of Returns across all clients to identify trends in usage  This will also allow us to potentially apply a different pricing if required (in agreement with Licensing and Sale Teams)    03/09   WIN, currently cant tell if its returns or receives  important to notify finance   add WRT code and update WIN to exclude returns   seat + transactional licensing = STL
product_candidate: New STL collector for Return type receives (RET)

WKI_Summary: VN eInv - Adjustment - Mapping Change - Items.Type and Items.Status
details: CURRENT LOGIC:  For both Positive Adjustment (Amend with Invoice), and Negative Adjustment (Amend with Credit Note), now we are hardcoding "DCG" for Items.Type This result in NEGATIVE sign printed in positive adjustment.   See Mapping Guide for Adjustment. Page15. HYPERLINK "https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=fcb14186-acac-45ef-ae3b-9a82f9b41d7d" CargoWiseUpdateNote20210930b  |||>Type: Hard coded as 'DCG' which means it is a decreasing adjustment.     Attached are sample files for Postive Adjustment and Negative Adjustment, the corresponding Jsons, and the response from FPT.     SOLUTION:  As per FPT, we should transmit "DCT" for Items.Type for increasement, and "DCG" for Items.Type for decreasement.  Additionally, if we leave Status as blank, then it will always be defaulted to 1, which is incorrect for decreasement.   Please make sure the consistent data in your json as follow:    If  you want to increase adjustment, then your json must include:  + General information:   "ud": 1  + Line item:  "type": "DCT"  "status": 1 (if this tag is not used, the default value is 1)    Example Json: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=de61962a-8d5d-440c-9788-e4ecf9e55107&StorageDocPK=daa4a02c-2ac3-4533-b97b-2976bb33930d&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bIBsMJcFMb%2bm2Nmvpv2kS2i4d%2fieM0mzW" IFG 06-Mar-25 13:51:  File json Positive Adj.json (Sample File)    If  you want to decrease adjustment, then your json must include:  + General information:  "ud": 0  + Line item:  "type": "DCG"  "status": 0    Example Json: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=de61962a-8d5d-440c-9788-e4ecf9e55107&StorageDocPK=164b56b6-702d-418f-a0a4-a9ac89892898&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bFdLyFnFeJjSjsOsJvjcwz8xNlzfmIM9u" IFG 06-Mar-25 13:51:  File json - Negative Adj.json (Sample File)    DONE OF STATMENT  1. Hardcode "DCT" for Items.Type for Positive Adjustment(Amend with Invoice), and "DCG" for Items.Type for Negative Adjustment(Amend with Credit Note).   2. Add a new field, Items.Status.   Hardcode "1" for Positive Adjustment(Amend with Invoice), and '0' for Negative Adjustment (Amend with Credit Note).       ANY 10-Mar-25 11:55 GMT+11:00:   Relevant Code:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FAccounting%2FAccounting.ElectronicMessaging%2FVietnam%2FEInvoice%2FAdjustInvoice%2FVietnamEInvoiceAdjustmentCreator.cs&version=GBmaster&line=127&lineEnd=127&lineStartColumn=6&lineEndColumn=50&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents

WKI_Summary: GCT: validation for ATD - actual DEP cannot be before GOU CY/GIN CTO (origin)
details: SMS 12-June-25 13:50 GMT+10:00: We should try to eliminate cases where we deliver DEPs that conflict with other events (similar to ArrivalAfterUnloadEventValidator).   Revised DONE statement:   invalidate actual DEP only if ALL containers have FLO/GIN/GOU after the DEP to reduce the risk of outlying GOU CY / GIN / FLO  SS/GCT to turn the invalid DEP (if before GOU CY / GIN / FLO) to AUX (instead of discarding the event), same for all the DEP events received after from carrier. Always log AUX for ATD events.  customers may still receive ATD for the job if carrier revised ATD (that pass validation) or if ATD is found from AIS.    CMA 11-Jun-25 14:43 GMT+10:00:   FLO Event should first be validated against before GIN/GOU as it is more reliable, and will also contain the Vessel information.  Will be logging only before deciding which carriers to enable    CMA 04-Jun-25 10:17 GMT+10:00:   Will create DepartureAfterGateEventValidator in GCT, similar to ArrivalAfterUnloadEventValidator, it will match on Location/Container/VesselInfo  If the latest GIN/GOU event is after DEP event, the DEP event will be converted to AUX  Actuals only    LKW 02-Jun-25 18:25 GMT+10:00:   agree to remove 2nd dones statement as we cannot guarantee GOU/GIN data to be present  rewrite Done Statement as below:  "For any actual DEP from carriers, if there were GOU/GIN event times later than the DEP event time, do not deliver actual DEP and deliver AUX with the DEP datetime instead  if there were no GOU/GIN as reference, still deliver actual DEP"    acceptable to only apply to reviewed problem carriers, including:  ZIMU (both SS and EDI)  WHLC  MAEU (EDI)  CMDU    Still suggest to do the checking in GCT instead of SeaShanty to cover the problem cases from MAERSK and ZIM push EDI. (attached sample cases in eDocs)    YMK 03-Jun-25 16:27 GMT+10:00: Also, suggest to apply validation for events which we are going to deliver and compare with already delivered events only (the similar approach to ATA validation).  CMA 04-Jun-25 10:15 GMT+10:00: ATA Validation is on events, not deliveries, will do the same for ATD    CMA 02-Jun-25 10:50 GMT+10:00:    We would prefer to only validate for the problem carriers. A blanket approach may negatively effect some carriers without a full investigation... e.g. missing GOU/FLO events or some other nuances we are not aware of.  Also, as we want to compare against other events for the same subscription, it is probably better to validate in SeaShanty, as GCT only receieves updates so would need to add a read operation to validate against other events.   Create new class EventValidator  ContainerEventDataRetriever can call the validator.  Validation will only be performed if carrier code is in CarriersForATDEventValidation   If there is an actual DEP event for the first SEA leg,  validate it against GOU CY / GIN / FLO  at same location. If before any event, or none exist, convert to AUX and log    YMK 02-Jun-25 11:55 GMT+10:00: I agree with Conor, the DONE statement below is very dangerous. Also, GCT should not lookup anything in AIS. We should perform this check in SS for selected carriers only.  -----------------------------    DONE STATEMENT: we have validation for ATD against both GOU CY/GIN CTO:   1) SS/GCT to turn the invalid DEP (if before GOU / GIN) to AUX (instead of discarding the event), same for all the DEP events received after from carrier. Always log AUX for ATD events.  2) Send actual DEP event only if there are GOU CY / GIN / FLO events earlier than DEP. If no GOU CY / GIN / FLO events are received at origin - not able to validate or lookup to AIS - expected outcome is to send only AUX.    SMS 21-May-25 23:50 GMT+10:00:   related incident:   HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/b6ab3aef-a8c3-43ad-b235-d263ef3eebe1?lang=en-gb" CS01965269 - UPSSUPATL - Odd ATD via Container Automation - C00175515    There might be also an issue that GOU CY or FLO CTO are incorrect and might prevent carrier's DEP but AIS and AUX as a fall back should be sufficient.     The issue here is wrong carrier data. The actual DEP is incorrect and also the AUX events. (we have sent an email to CMA CGM).  We have never received the correct actual DEP.  Still, the DEP we delivered to the customer is not logical as its event date is before the date of the Empty pick up.  https://ctsportal.wtg.zone/containerevents#eventType=&isActual=true&location=HNPCR&searchCarrierBookingReference=HDA0135185    Yuriy on the sequencing call suggested to create an investigation WI or workflow to identify potential DEP issue per carrier before applying a blanket approach. Agree that it would be valuable.     LKW 23-May-25 12:31 GMT+10:00:   overall I agree to make this validation in general across all carriers.    attached stats querying GCT data from Feb to Apr 2025.  There were lots of cases where DEP event was earlier than GOU at the same location.  Main carriers that have these problem cases:  SHPT  ZIMU  WAIC  WHLC  CMDU  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=0a5c6bf8-38cd-4a40-9b87-ff9d6d91630d&StorageDocPK=ed168e85-7613-4129-a9a5-a17460c4e547&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bpigQsx%2fxG%2bB%2bYUFkVGl3RnmkX50CdBjs" LKW 23-May-25 12:33:  File DEP before GOU sample cases.xlsx (Sample File)  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=0a5c6bf8-38cd-4a40-9b87-ff9d6d91630d&StorageDocPK=a6af7700-0c02-49a8-b471-4961d0885ede&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b2bI5gdkz35cWDrkwX3FzfkfP72jozbUh" LKW 23-May-25 12:33:  File WI00912098 problem cases investigaion.docx (Sample File)    also thought that the sample concept applies for DEP earlier than GIN, did some checking as well  major affected carriers are similar, but overall there were more cases that GOU  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=0a5c6bf8-38cd-4a40-9b87-ff9d6d91630d&StorageDocPK=844d4d63-3a25-4008-b881-4ec7c1972503&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2biaqFwsyejF7DtkGLWh%2fQ0oKfiFhjIMJm" LKW 23-May-25 12:36:  File DEP before GIN sample cases.xlsx (Sample File)    can have the validation against both GOU/GIN or only GOU.  Instead of discarding the DEP, i think this DEP from Carrier also fits to be an AUX event. just that it will be an AUX event before the actual DEP event (that we hopefully shall get from AIS at the current time)    as a side note, maybe worth reaching out to ZIMU and CMDU on their data quality as they are official channels. (not much hope in SHPT/WAIC as they always blame their sources)  there a long list of examples in eDocs    SMS 26-May-25 23:24 GMT+10:00: I've contacted ZIM and CMA providing examples (thanks!) and will wait to hear from them - however it's clear they don't have validation in place for actual DEP to be after GOU CY/GIN.   Proposed solution is to have validation against both GOU CY/GIN CTO - then have GCT to turn the invalid DEP (if before GOU / GIN) to AUX (instead of discarding the event), same for all the DEP events received after from carrier. Always log AUX - send DEP only if actual GOU CY / GIN events are earlier than DEP.   If no GOU CY / GIN / FLO event is received - not able to validate or lookup to AIS, send only AUX.    SMS 30-May-25 20:59 GMT+10:00: ZIM confirmed they have no validation for ATD - no response from CMA. Full info in eDocs.
feature_description: actual DEP cannot be before GOU CY/GIN CTO (origin)
