WKI_Summary: Allow customers to skip .NET upgrade check
details: System administrators for self-host customers, but not WiseCloud customers, should be allowed to skip the .NET Upgrade check.    See https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/325812?_a=files&path=%2FEnterprise%2FArchitecture%2FCore%2FCore%2FEnvironment%2FRegistry%2FRawDataRegistry.cs for the things that need to change.    Change this so that non-WiseCloud-hosted customers can edit these registry items. I think the flag we need is RegistryOptions.IsOnlyEditableBySupportIfHosted.    Write/update unit tests.    KM5 28-Apr-25 10:56 GMT+10:00:   Mention these in  .NET 8 customer UN: https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=6edd4257-dd13-4c51-b677-8c8d195599e4  and update   Internal UN: https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=5defb51f-9265-4f8a-aaa2-92de51afd133    DVJ 30-Apr-25 16:13 GMT+10:00: I disagree about mentioning them in customer-facing update notes. I think it is too risky that customers will bypass them and end up in a worse situation. Most of the incidents to date are from customers who have not understood the existng update note. I think we should only publish it to customers once we improve the usability so we can be more confident customers will only use it when it is safe to do so.      DVJ 02-May-25 10:25 GMT+10:00:     To clarify what this is and isn't for:    Valid examples:  ? Customer has decommissioned a machine that is still showing up in the list because it was used in the last 14 days  ? Customer wants to install .NET 8 and upgrade CargoWise without waiting 24 hours for CargoWise to refresh its list of .NET versions  ? Customer has a large pool of terminal servers and it is impractical to force CargoWise to re-run on every server to force it to detect the new .NET version  ? Customer has a dev/test environment where developer desktop PCs make ad hoc CargoWise connections which they don't want to block the upgrade    Invalid examples:  ? Customer decides that they don't care about .NET 8 because CargoWise still seems to work without it. This is not something we can support because we are free to make future changes to CargoWise such that any part of the system may start needing .NET 8 at any time without further notice.  ? Customer installed just the Desktop runtime or Hosting Bundle and CargoWise still seems to work. This is not something we can support.  ? Customer just wants to make the error message go away without understanding it.      BVC 09-May-25 18:53 GMT+10:00: Update  Don't update the client update note.  Do update the internal update note with more info.  Update the code and unit-tests to;   only show the deps that are missing per machine  Use the same name in both lists.  include link to where to download runtime
product_candidate: Allow customers to skip .NET upgrade check

WKI_Summary: AM: Watermark Date Based Processing for OPS and PDR
details: AW6 07-Aug-25 16:01 GMT+10:00:   Done Statements  1. An option to use On or Before Date When Watermark is Reset for OPS and PDR Schedules    ‘Use Archive Records On or Before When Watermark is Reset'  enabled by default when a new Archive Schedule is created   Can be manually disabled   If not enabled initially, the system automatically activates it when the watermark is reset.  2. The Watermark date is displayed in the OPS and PDR Schedules     JBK 30-Jul-25 10:38 GMT+10:00:     Problem Statement:    In the current implementation of Archive Manager, when OPS (Operational Jobs) and PDR (Purge Documents and Records) Archive Schedule jobs complete within the time limit defined in the Max Run Duration, the watermark date is reset to the default value of 01/01/0001 12:00:00 AM. As a result, when these jobs are executed again, they reprocess from the earliest possible date. This leads to unnecessary re-evaluation of previously skipped records, resulting in:    Significant performance degradation due to repetitive processing.  Increased resource consumption without any additional value.    To mitigate this inefficiency, the following enhancement is proposed:    New Options Introduced:    'Archive Records On or Before When Watermark is Reset 'for OPS schedules.  'Purge Records On or Before When Watermark is Reset' for PDR schedules.    These options will be enabled by default when a new Archive Schedule is created, though users can manually disable them.  If the option is not enabled initially, the system will automatically activate it when the watermark is reset.    Upon auto-enablement:    A log message will be written to the ARC Service Task log.  A notice will be included in the Archive Summary report for transparency and traceability.    Nice-to-Have Enhancement (Optional):    Display the current watermark date directly within the Archive Schedule UI to give users visibility into job progression and reset behavior.    This change ensures Archive Manager avoids unnecessary processing, reduces system overhead, and improves the overall efficiency of archive and purge operations.
product_candidate: Watermark Date Based Processing for OPS and PDR

WKI_Summary: Malaysia (MY) add new Exclude Tax ID for Service Tax
details: Change Required:   Add a new Tax ID 'SVCEXL' with Auxiliary Type = 'SER' & Type = 'EXL' as a dedicated Exclude type tax ID for Service Tax system,  Stop deploying 'EXCLUDE' Tax ID to Malaysia Login Companies. Users in existing companies with 'EXCLUDE' Tax ID can mark it as 'Inactive'    Background:        In 2018, the Malaysia Government introduced a Service Tax on Taxable Services. The previous Goods and Services Tax system no longer applies in Malaysia.        consequently in 2018 we implemented change so DocBuilder Invoices generated from Malaysia Login Companies, which  clearly differentiates ‘Service Tax’ from ‘GST’:          1. When printing a transaction containing Service Tax ID’s (Auxiliary type = ‘SER’) the DocBuilder Invoice will include Service Tax related details and Organization Registration numbers.        2. When printing an Invoice containing GST Tax IDs (Auxiliary type is empty) the document will include GST related details and Organization Registration numbers.        https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=c38c3f96-1ece-4245-81ac-0d48664cbbe7       Problem we are rectifying:  > The 'EXCLUDE' Tax ID in MY was introduced without an Auxiliary Type (WI00311389 - Add Excluded Tax IDs - add Exclude tax ID to remaining countries).  > Therefore when printing an invoice with of 'EXCLUDE' Tax ID, DocBuilder Invoice includes GST related details - this is incorrect as 'GST' concepts no longer applies in Malaysia since 2018         FLN 05-Jun-25 11:56 GMT+10:00: I have checked and can confirm: for other countries with Auxiliary tax types, their Exclude Tax ID setting are correct and doesn't have unexpected impacts on     NH1 11 Jun 2025 - Another similar work item: WI00567124
product_candidate: Malaysia (MY) add new Exclude Tax ID for Service Tax

WKI_Summary: Print HBL/HAWB with Debtors (No Validation) under Origin/Destination Company
details: Done Statement  We expect charges would be printed properly on HBL/HAWB only when it is printed under the Origin or Destination Company.  When printing HBL/HAWB, Charges can always be printed even the Debtor is NOT one of the following:  Consignor  Consignee  Controlling Customer  IFT Related Party of Consignor  IFT Related Party of Consignee  IFT Related Party of Controlling Customer      CTS 11-Aug-25 11:40 GMT+10:00:     # Done Statement    Remove restrictive organization proxy rules from the IsChargeValid method in HouseBillCharges.cs to allow charges from any valid debtor regardless of their relationship to shipment parties.    # Problem Summary    The current logic for printing charges on HBL/HAWB documents is overly restrictive and fails when the Debtor is a Local Client that is not directly related to shipment parties (Consignor, Consignee, Controlling Customer, or Overseas Agent). This prevents valid charges from being printed on HBL/HAWB documents.    # Root Cause Analysis    Caused by WI00795425 due to the HLD logic being too restrictive. We only know what logic to change based on customer feedback.    The problem is located in the `IsChargeValid` method in `HouseBillCharges.cs` (lines 160-180). The method contains overly restrictive organization proxy validation logic that filters out valid charges when:  1. **Charge debtor is an organization proxy** (internal overseas office)  2. **Debtor is not directly related to shipment parties** (consignor, consignee, controlling customer)  3. **Debtor is not in IFT (Invoice Freight To) relationships** with shipment parties    **Current Problematic Logic:**  ```csharp  return c.SellAmount > 0      && c.SellAccount != null      && (          c.SellAccount == job.AgentCollect          || (!IsOrgProxy(c.SellAccount)              || IsOrgProxy(c.SellAccount)                  && (c.SellAccount == consignor                      || c.SellAccount == controllingCustomer                      || IsIFTToRelatedParty(c.SellAccount, controllingCustomer)                      || IsIFTToRelatedParty(c.SellAccount, consignor)))      );  ```  This validation prevents legitimate charges from being included when the debtor doesn't meet these strict relationship criteria.    # Proposed Solution    The fix is simply to **remove the restrictive organization proxy validation** from the `IsChargeValid` method. Instead of validating debtor relationships to shipment parties, the method should allow any valid charge where:  1. **Sell amount > 0**  2. **SellAccount is not null**    3. **Basic account validation passes**    ```csharp  bool IsChargeValid(JobCharge c, JobHeader job, bool isOrigin)  {      if (isOrigin)      {          return c.SellAmount > 0              && c.SellAccount != null              && (c.SellAccount == job.AgentCollect || !IsOrgProxy(c.SellAccount));              // Remove complex organization proxy relationship validation      }      return c.SellAmount > 0          && c.SellAccount != null          && c.SellAccount == job.LocalCharges;  }  ```
product_candidate: Print HBL/HAWB with Debtors (No Validation) under Origin/Destination Company

The behaviour of this filter strip should be similar to the behaviour of the Current Component filter strip. However, I've found some weird thing about the Current Component filter strip and going to modify it - see eDocs: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=e841c48f-235d-474c-8e00-047dd254356d&StorageDocPK=31b5e3b5-0535-436c-81b1-8f6b18ae1f39&Hash=%2bJXrfHZzx3bBMBWfn2PUO5LF5GTAKx7rc&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" DMK 14-Nov-24 10:26:  File Current Component and Dedicated Buffer filter strips.docx (Specification).  We'll need to publish an update note to that.    DMK 14-Nov-24 12:24 GMT+11:00:   I've decided to dedicate this workflow to modifying the Current Component filter strip only. The filter strip for the Dedicated Buffer property will be implemented in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=b250753e-09a0-4cfd-8f56-68609686e2c4&VersionNumber=24.11.14.105&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2byjuO6QA4UwmDUMdszhnQB58lm7Z%2bnEPA" WI00830180 - Implement a filter strip for the Dedicated Buffer property on workflows.    It turned out that the Current Component filter strip just did not work properly with Is Blank and Is Not Blank options. WKI_Summary: TM2: Change event driven cycle counts to be the highest priority
details: BRS 08-Nov-24 09:56 GMT+11:00:   There is the ability for the system to create cycle counts in the following scenarios:  Short pick in a location  Alternate putaway in a location during picking  Either "Reallocate" clicked, or another location scanned  Location that is empty in the system is not verified empty by the RF operator  Max touch count is met    These are all created with a priority of 0 which is the lowest priority.    For TM2, we want to let users control the grouping and assignment of these tasks, and it makes sense for the first 3 (but not Max Touch Count) to be treated as the highest priority as we already know there is an accuracy error.    Make the following changes:  WhsAutoInventoryAccuracyManager to make auto zero confirmation cycle count lines with a priority of 1 instead of 0  PutawayPallet and PutawayHelper in the RF web service to also create cycle count  (see part that uses IWhsCycleCountLocationCreator)  PickLineUpdater to also create a cycle count with a priority of 1 instead of 0 (see part that uses IWhsCycleCountLocationCreator)
product_candidate: Change event driven cycle counts to be the highest priority

Populate Data into Route and Leg  Introduce CFS Cut Off, CTO Cut Off, Hazardous Cut Off and Reefer Cut Off fields into Leg. Implement changes to the following files,  - Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Shared/Freight.OnlineSailingSchedules/Leg.cs - SetValues(), Clone()  public void SetValues(ServiceModel.Leg leg, ServiceModel.Route route, bool IsFirstLeg)  {   if(IsFirstLeg){   CFSCutOff = route.CFSCutOff ?? ZDateTime.Empty;   CTOCutOff = route.CTOCutOff ?? Update UI - New Global Sailing Schedules Form  Add CFS Cut Off, CTO Cut Off, Hazardous Cut Off and Reefer Cut Off columns to Connections grid. Implement changes to the following files,  - Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Shared/Freight.GUI/OnlineSailingSchedules/OnlineSailingSchedulesFilterControl.Designer.cs  3. Populate data on Consol Routing tab  - Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Shared/Freight.OnlineSailingSchedules/Route.cs - SetTransportData()  void SetTransportData(Transport transport, Leg leg)  {   transport.JW_TransportMode = MapTransportMode(leg.LegType, leg.VesselName);   transport.JW_DepotCutOff = leg.CFSCutOff;   transport.JW_TerminalCutOff = leg.CTOCutOff;                  .......  }    ASL 04-Jul-25 16:13 GMT+10:00: At this time, its unlikely we will receive more than 1 set of Cut Off dates per route (ie. one set per leg), but we store these dates in the Schedule on the leg level (port pairs), and its also displayed on the Consol per leg. For now, we will implement the fields at the Leg level, and not the Route level. If it's provided at the Route level, we will assume its for the 1st leg only.    PHS 24-Jun-25 09:38 GMT+10:00:   DONE:   CW GSS displays the following Cut-Off fields and values in the leg level grid (bottom grid):   CTO Cut-Off  CFS Cut-Off  Haz Cut-Off  Reefer Cut-Off  CW GSS has the ability to import those values to CW jobs, and update the respective fields:  CW > Consol > Routing > top grid (CTO, CFS, Hazardous, Reefer)  CW > Consol > Routing > bottom grid > Origin Details > CTO Cut Off + CFS Cut Off (Haz and Reefer fields do not seem to exist yet)    Notes:   Those fields and values ready exist on the GSS API.  GSS API provides Cut-Off values for any Carrier (VOCC or NVOCC) that provide them to ILS, including MSCU, ONEY, WAIC, SHPT, etc.  Once Cut-Off values imported to CW jobs, they will not be regularly updated the same way GSS updates ETDs and ETAs - this is because ETDs and ETAs updates come from Vessel schedule data, not p2p. ILS only retrieves Cut-Offs from p2p, not vessel schedules at this stage.    Important!:   Need to check if Booking Confirmations update Cut-Off fields in CW jobs, and if we allow GSS imports to override values from Booking Confirmations.    Reason:   This work stems from a UPSs requirement to automatically populate Shipco's (SCAC: SHPT) CFS Cut-Off values in in CW > Consols, instead of entering them manually.  WorldwideAlliance (SCAC: WAIC) who manage Shipco's schedules, said they provide these CFS Cut-Off fields and values on their p2p API, which ILS retrieves their p2p schedules from.  ILS team has added these fields and values on GSS API, which will feed to CW GSS once those fields are added there.  ILS decided to not just limit the scope to CFS Cut-Offs and Shipco, but to include CTO, Haz, Reefer Cut-Offs, and for any NVO from WAIC, and any other Carrier which provide these values. WKI_Summary: Indonesia (ID) - New Org Registration code ID NIT to record NITKU or orgs
details: PATCHING REQUIRED: This Wi is a compliance requirement for issuing invoices in indonesia.    Users must be able to record the ID NIT (NITKU) against the org proxy of each indonesia branch and against receivables organisations in Indonesia.  The NITKU of both the branch issuing an invoice and the Indonesia Business being invoiced must be included in invoices along with the primary VAT registration details of both parties.      This Work Item Change required:  Add a new org registration code for Indonesia Login Companies    Code: ID NIT    Description: Business Activity Location Identity Number (NITKU)    Primary = Y, Main = Y, Category = Organization Number        Background:   As part of tax transformation/ reformation in Indonesia, Indonesian tax office (DJP) introduced a new identification number for branch level taxpayers: 22-digit NITKU (The Identity Number of Place of Business Activities).   The first 16 digits are the NPWP (Taxpayer Identification Number) of the parent entity and the last 6 digits are the serial number. For central office, the last 6 digits are all zero.  The NITKU number is required to be included as Tax Invoice XML for buyer and seller in Coretax (new tax system launched by DJP from Jan 2025).  Currently ID Login Companies uses ‘ID PPN’ to record a business’ NPWP Tax Registration Number. ID PPN for the login company and AR org are printed on DocBuilder invoice.        In HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/f78c1ac9-777f-4e50-9bb1-909652c80d49?lang=en-gb" WI00863476 - Indonesia (ID) DocBuilder Macro Improvement to print NITKU code, we will enhance DocBuilder Invoice macro when Login Company = ID to print NITKU number of Login company and AR org. It is to be completed after this WI.
feature_description: New Org Registration code ID NIT to record NITKU or orgs

WKI_Summary: [TF] SPR - Payables Module- Add new Service Code filter
details: Problem::  > In India Login Companies, the TDS tax system is used to create Notional SPR Tax Transactions when posting Payables Invoices.  > In India, it is common for Payables organisations to grant very long credit terms (eg. post an invoice today, and the due date is three months time)  > In India, it is common for TDS realization obligations to occur at the end of each month for specific classes (service code) of TDS, even though the related payables invoice has not been paid because the due date is still in the future.  > Currently, in CargoWise users can manage this manually by identifying invoices with notional tax and using an Action to realise TDS one invoice at a time.  Our product problem is  > Users must realise TDS one invoice at a time. The system does not support a bulk action  > There is no "only return me invoices with notional tax" module filter. Users must sort the grid using the "Notional Withholding" tax column to find transctions to realise.   > There is no "only return me invoices with tax transctions with a specific service code" module filter.  Users must know which TDS service codes are used when posting invoices for different suppliers to know which invioces to realise.      Business Need:    > Enhance the "Realise Payments Basis Withholding Tax" action available in the  Payables Transactions and Payables Enqjuiries modules of Login Companies with at least one AP SPR Tax Configuration.  It is done in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=3fbd0637-28f9-4466-8009-1f8ac72c7199&VersionNumber=24.7.12.59&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2brx%2bYfAa%2fOsr69%2fVuHzADNm3j7Q8HcgRI" WI00768062 - [TF] SPR - Payables Module- Bulk SPR realization Action.    > Introduce two Tax Transaction related filters to limit results in the grid to transctions with tax transctions meeting the filter criteria       1.  "Notional WHT" filter     When ticked, filter will return transactions with at least one Notional WHT tax transaction (Ledger AP + SPR Tax Transction that is NOT cancelled and has an empty Realized date).    It is done in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=ff623685-baa6-4500-914f-0ca9c581ba8f&VersionNumber=24.9.12.124&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b6Ns8tboQ%2bwPW4If%2fnwzkpzcPP%2bCHb%2fi9" WI00802570 - [TF] SPR - Payables Module- Add new Notional Tax filter.            2. "Service Code" filter      evaluates the value recorded against a Tax Transaction Service Code.    It is done in this WI.         3. Filter display rules:     Filters only show WHEN the current login company has at least one active Payables Ledger SPR Tax Configuration recorded against the Company record or a Branch of the Company record.      Create a new "Tax Transactions" group in the Filter dropdown list. Position after the "Financial details" filter group.            CHECKIN:   If save to do, we will patch to ensure these changes are in the August GP1 Promotion (scheduled for 21 Aug).  We will not patch if this change is risky.      Technical details  This WI depends on Notional WHT WI as this filter need to have the same sub group as Notional WHT filter as they are filters for the same table linked to main module table (AccTransactionHeader) via subquery.    Performance of both filters was checked in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=094e0a03-8426-4414-8c05-fad9620043a5&VersionNumber=24.9.12.124&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bD0Wz8M5aWB5nvkjSWdGXNgbxq3S7l1xW" WI00771107 - [TF] SPR - Payables Module- 2 new filters: Notional Tax, Tax Transaction Svc Cod. Please see execution plans in eDocs.   There is no business case for this filter to be used alone. Users do not need to find all ever posted taxes with particular service code. That is why we do not need to create separate index for this field. But we should have an index that will improve this filter performance when it is used together with Notional WHT filter. This will be addressed in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=6d7b10c5-ded0-4300-890c-07a24e1bea87&VersionNumber=24.9.12.124&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bWNmNvbGKVQr1dF7bHvzitMaZ%2fErkpaUg" WI00802748 - [TF] SPR - Add index to AccTaxTransaction table for Notional Tax filter.
feature_description: Payables Module- Add new Service Code filter

WKI_Summary: Job Deactivation Configuration
details: LW 05-Nov-24 15:17 GMT+10:00:   Done Statement:  By default, users will not be allowed to deactivate job header once accounting transaction has been posted.  However, system administrators will be able to override the system behaviour (at company level) to allow users to deactivate job header where only the special JRJ has been posted and no active WIPs/ACRs (WIP and ACR have been posted but reversed) and no posted/reversed AR/AP INV, CRD, ADJ and standard JRJ).   Note: We may provide more option in the future so this solution should be scalable.       LW 30-Oct-24 16:57 GMT+10:00:   This work item was originally created to evaluate if we should 'shift' the point of special JRJ later (i.e. on the creation of the first accounting transaction) to allow user to be able to deactivate the job in the event it was created accidentally.   However, this has a few negative implications:  1. These invoicing jobs will not be charged which should not be the case, as the current billing model will always levied a charge for any invoicing job created.Though we allow deactivation and reactivation.   2. It will result in complex billing as job can be created in one calendar month and charge in another calendar month.     So the conclusion was to keep the special JRJ creation point (i.e. when invoicing job is created), and we have to consider the impact to the customers given they cannot deactivate these disbursement jobs any more.       Background:  When the new Electronic Process Fee feature is enabled, the special JRJ will always be posted.   Consequently, the users will no longer be able to deactivate the invoicing job.      Done Statement:  We need to think about what are the implication to the user who is now not able to deactivate job that they may have created accidentally, and the relative implications.  Based on previous discussion with Warehouse team, one of the problem the customers face was that they cannot exclude such job from some of the operation reports resulting in inaccurate operation result.

WKI_Summary: HU eInvoicing - enhance mapping of invoiceAppearance and completenessIndicator
details: JMN 03-Dec-24 11:42 GMT+11:00: This workitem will change the mapping of the 2: invoiceAppearance and completenessIndicator    invoiceAppearance  Currently, invoiceAppearance is automatically set to ELECTRONIC or UNKNOWN (when the organization is a Natural Person).  In this workitem, we will add a new logic in identifying invoiceAppearance.    The new logic will be, if Debtor Organization has HU:IDM registration THEN use the value specified as HU:IDM to map inoviceAppearance.  Otherwise, use existing logic and set to either ELECTRONIC or UNKNOWN.    completenessIndicator  This element is currently set to True when ELECTRONIC and False when UNKNOWN/    The new logic is always set this to False because CargoWise only sends the invoice information and not the invoice itself.
feature_description: enhance mapping of invoiceAppearance and completenessIndicator

WKI_Summary: [QTN][OOQ] Migration of E-mail Acceptance to NEO
details: Done Statement  Supporting Quotation Acceptance in NEO by Client via Email      Reason For change(To explain Why)  E-mail acceptance of One Off Quote or Quotation have leveraged WebTracker platform which to be retired and to be replaced by NEO that both of the e-mail acceptance functionalities need to be migrated to NEO.    Relevant eLearning:  https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=b8cb9adf-4b36-4531-bc0f-603011f66c47  https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=12632120-a0ce-44d3-8244-1d9d229ed0be    ODL 30-Apr-25 11:25 GMT+10:00: According to Sarah, this needs to be in DPR by June. I'm guessing this means ... 11th of June?      What has been done (Technical Prespective)  I kept the existing logic to go through the WebTracker as is still working and hasn't retired yet.   But when WebTracker is retired and clients moved on using NEO instead, the new hyperlink will be generated for NEO instead of WebTracker.  Then in this way we don't need to make any change in the email/document we generate currently.    GIVEN   Neo Hyperlinks is enabled => GlowRegistry.Instance.NeoEnableHyperlinksInDocumentMacros is true   Neo is enabled => LicenceFeatureCodeList.Codes.NeoFeature in Feature Control Manager  THEN   System will create NEO url based on the provided Alias and Glow Portals Root Url & the Business Object PK    I added the new CW1 Web Api to execute the logic of receiveing reply from the client and then send a notification email.  This Api will be called from a Coded Form Flow in Glow  And the Coded Form Flow is used in 2 separate Form Flows  Form Flow with alias "TrackingQuoteClientReplyAccept" to Accept the quote  Form Flow with alias "TrackingQuoteClientReplyNotAccept" for Request Further Discussion      PAI 05-Jun-25 11:38 GMT+10:00:   Functional Review Document:  In this WI we support Client Quotation Acceptance via email through NEO.  The exisitng logic in WebTracker is still working till the WebTracker is officially retiered.    Client is still receiving the same email/document and they can see 2 hyperlinks in it. But the link is pointing to Neo instead of WebTracker.    The new proposed hyperlink to NEO would look like the below  To Accept:  https://GlowPortal/goto/TrackingQuoteClientReplyAccept?entityPK={quotePK}  To Request Further Discussion:  https://GlowPortal/goto/TrackingQuoteClientReplyNotAccept?entityPK={quotePK}    For the hyperlinks to Neo the following registry item has to be enabled (the registry is disabled by default)  Glow > Neo > Enable Neo Hyperlinks in Document and Report Macros    The same logic will be run in the backround and user will be notified by email that the client clicked either of the links.
feature_description: mail Acceptance to NEO

WKI_Summary: EDW: The EDW is our preferred data source for enabled reports
details: PMN 10-Sep-25 11:24 GMT+10:00:   Won't be patched back to GP1 following meeting w/ Jose and Ewan.      Done: The EDW is our preferred data source for enabled reports    Related to HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=6c1ab5ca-fc6b-4bc0-8099-416379d72663&VersionNumber=25.4.10.282&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bQM5N93Ni3pnTKX32dcSIf1vWovtXEzWX" WI00876061 - EDW: We don't need the List Of Supported Reports Using EDW As Data Source regist, in which we want to remove the List Of Supported Reports Using EDW As Data Source registry setting. This registry is unnecessary now we have the Data, EdwData, and EdwOnlyData data source tags that can be included in DocEngine templates.      PMN 03-Jul-25 13:08 GMT+10:00:   Updated logic for displaying the tickbox on the report form as we've discovered the template is parsed before rendering the form. This allows us to check the report data sources in advance.    If EET is active (EDW is present and up-to-date) AND...  all report sources are Data: do not show the tickbox; observe report data sources  all report sources are Data or EDWData: show the tickbox; interpret all sources as Data if the tickbox is ticked; observe report data sources if the tickbox is not ticked  all report sources are EDWData: show the tickbox; interpret all sources as Data if the tickbox is ticked; observe report data sources if the tickbox is not ticked  any report sources are EDWOnlyData: do not show the tickbox; observe report data sources    If EET is inactive (EDW is not present or not up-to-date) AND...  all report sources are Data: do not show the tickbox; observe report data sources  all report sources are Data or EDWData: do not show the tickbox; present a message that the EDW is unavailable and all data will be taken from the main database  all report sources are EDWData: do not show the tickbox; present a message that the EDW is unavailable and all data will be taken from the main database  any report sources are EDWOnlyData: do not show the tickbox; present a message that the EDW is unavailable and the report cannot be run; do not allow the report to be run (disable the buttons?)
product_candidate: The EDW is our preferred data source for enabled reports

WKI_Summary: [TKN] Add CWSupport login data to logs
details: Copy Paste from eRequest:    "Can we please get stats on the number of log ins by staff for CWSupport into client production and test?    It would be beneficial if data was ingested in elastic and showed columns, amongst the others, for:    Event time Token Generated   Incident where token was entered  ENT-DB Code and Login In time  Staff Code    We can then monitor the number of logins and understand the reasons behind them and how we can further reduce the need to log into customer systems."    Let's investigate how best to do this.    Note from BAS:    "BAS 22-Jul-25 08:04 GMT+10:00: why am I chasing myself here - what is the actual question?  We should not be accessing customer systems arbitrarily. The risk of potential insider trading, personal data access etc is a real and present risk.  Given the rarity of when it should be occurring, there should be little data to collate, so send it through, get it logged centrally so we understand both when the token is issued (as intent) and the use (as action)."      JSF 18-Aug-25 16:37 GMT+02:00:   Hi Anton/Jeff/Nic,    What are we able to collect here?  Where will it be stored?  How will it be accessed?    JWU 17-Sep-25 11:00 GMT+08:00:   we can use a Dynamic STL collector to fetch the data from customers' database and synce it to Kibana (it's out of the box).     here're some examples and wiki about how to use Dynamic STL collector.    https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/blob/59ca22902055ec97e36ce8c21158d87227f166a8/Cargowise.Billing.Collectors/src/Collectors/Scripts/Accounting/AccCashAdvanceRequestUsageCollector.cs  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/16259/MDM-Experience-in-STL-(Non-Billing)  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/16252/MDM-Experience-in-STL-(Billing)    QD 22-Sep-25 17:47 GMT+08:00:   1.Add new class at https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/tree/59ca22902055ec97e36ce8c21158d87227f166a8/Cargowise.Billing.Collectors/src/Collectors/Scripts/MasterData   public class CWSupportLoginRecordsCollector : RefStlScriptWithDefaults   {    public override bool UsedInBilling => false;    public override string FeatureCode => "LOG";    public override string RoleName => "CWSupport";    public override string ModuleName => "I&S";    public override string FunctionName => "CWSupport Login Records";    public override string FeatureName => "CWSupport Login Records";    public override string CompanyCode => string.Empty;    public override string BranchCode => string.Empty;    public override string BillingReference1 => string.Empty;    public override string GuidReference => $"cast(cast((DATEPART(year, {Constants.StartDateTimeInclusiveParamName})*10000) + (DATEPART(month, {Constants.StartDateTimeInclusiveParamName})*100) + DATEPART(day, {Constants.StartDateTimeInclusiveParamName}) as varbinary(16)) as uniqueidentifier)";    public override string TransactionDateUtc => "@StartDateTimeInclusive";    public override string FromClause => "MainResult";    public override string WhereClause => string.Empty;    public override string PreparationScript => Constants.MonthAsDateVariableScript + @";   WITH SourceData AS (      SELECT           SL_PK,          SL_Reference       FROM dbo.StmALog a      WHERE a.SL_Table = 'GlbStaff'         AND a.SL_Parent = 'ABE1D8D8-A709-4BFA-88E3-53997AA925E2'         AND a.SL_SE_NKEvent = 'LGI'   ),  SplitData AS (      SELECT           s.SL_PK,           s.SL_Reference,          LTRIM(RTRIM(value)) AS SplitValue,          ordinal AS RowNum      FROM SourceData s      CROSS APPLY STRING_SPLIT(s.SL_Reference, ',', 1)  ),  MainResult AS  (   SELECT     MAX(CASE WHEN RowNum = 1 THEN SplitValue END) AS IncidentNumber,    MAX(CASE WHEN RowNum = 2 THEN SplitValue END) AS UserCode,    MAX(CASE WHEN RowNum = 3 THEN SplitValue END) AS MachineName,    MAX(CASE WHEN RowNum = 4 THEN SplitValue END) AS LocalIPAddress,    MAX(CASE WHEN RowNum = 5 THEN SplitValue END) AS UserName,    MAX(CASE WHEN RowNum = 6 THEN SplitValue END) AS DeviceName   FROM SplitData  GROUP BY SL_PK  )";    public override string AdditionalRefs => @"CONVERT(VARBINARY(MAX), CONVERT(VARCHAR(MAX),  (   SELECT    MainResult.IncidentNumber,    MainResult.UserCode,    MainResult.MachineName,    MainResult.LocalIPAddress,    MainResult.UserName,    MainResult.DeviceName   FOR JSON PATH, WITHOUT_ARRAY_WRAPPER  )))";   }    2.Add CWSupportLoginRecordsCollector  to here  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/418ec0d4694bddd5bc794eab27ab5a9bdd47c014/Enterprise/Architecture/Core/Core/Configuration/StlDynamicCollectorsListConfiguration.xml
product_candidate: [TKN] Add CWSupport login data to logs

WKI_Summary: Deprecated columns in Audit are removed as part of the audit retention process
details: Done: Columns with old data definitions (with names of the format CW!!D-YYYYMMDD...etc) are removed as part of the audit data retention process once YYYYMMDD moves outside the Audit Retention Period.    HLD  UDE: We use lots of Audit DB space for columns that aren't used/useful.  DE: We use less/no Audit DB space for columns that aren't used/useful.  Obst.: Columns that are no longer used are retained in the database indefinitely.  IO: Columns that are no longer used are not retained in the database indefinitely.  Action: Remove deprecated columns from the Audit DB in line with the Audit Retention Period.      Background  When a column definition is changed, we rename the column in the Audit DB with the current data definition and data in the format CW!!D-{{YYYYMMDD-HHMM}}!{{existing_column_name}}.    This column should not receive any new data. Each new row is added with a NULL value in this column.  Like all columns, data that is older than the retention period is removed each month. Eventually, the column contains nothing but NULLs as no new data has been added within the retention period.  At this time, the column can be removed from the table entirely.
product_candidate: Deprecated columns in Audit are removed as part of the audit retention process

WKI_Summary: CPW: Resync on job load if job is current else customer has option to resync
details: JT3 19-Mar-25 13:59 GMT+11:00:     Problem Summary:  When a job is opened, it is automatically resynchronized regardless of how old the job is. This creates events in the job, and workflow templates to be re-applied since the addition of these events, means the job is now modified. Triggers, tasks and milestone from these reapplied templates can be refired based on past events, if the event they are based on, is already in the job. See HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/5063800d-634c-439f-91da-a8b5fd886afe?lang=en-gb" CS01787830 - YUSLOGTYO - [DPS] DPE Event added when View Shipment for further details    Solution:  Only resynchronize on job open if the job is "current" - we already do this check in our stored procedure. This will stop triggers being fired for old job that are already completed.    DONE statements  1. When I open a job that is not current, the compliance risk status is not resynchronized  2. When I open a job that is current, the compliance risk status is resynchronized    AWC 19-Mar-25 14:24 GMT+11:00:   If the job is not current, I have an option to update the status
product_candidate: Resync on job load if job is current else customer has option to resync

WKI_Summary: CDS imports, show 5/14 (dispatch country) at item level
details: WKC 21-May-25 10:02 GMT+01:00:  Please reuse the PR from Davide (https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/317745) and include the changes to CDS entry print report below. That should simplify the check-in process.    DJC 23-Apr-25 15:55 GMT+01:00:   The change for messaging is good. Please make a further change to address the same point for the CDS entry print, this field: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=90b271b7-3ca6-4b9a-8ba0-d57a45cf2ea7&StorageDocPK=e2868412-8208-41da-9c94-72158419778c&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=ediprod&Hash=%2bEsC0jjyHQEeMnYe3S5o%2bzMkAXMIKyRWD" DJC 23-Apr-25 15:56:  File 1fa246373470487da2c5862455dd27b1.jpg (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.  Sadly it's a change to the XLS file. HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=90b271b7-3ca6-4b9a-8ba0-d57a45cf2ea7&StorageDocPK=5ba2eaeb-a561-46be-a181-98b8f6548f21&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=ediprod&Hash=%2bmBg6sNrsCkla%2bRSTGg%2bnvIfH6tGnj6zz" DJC 23-Apr-25 15:58:  File f6fec8de180845e580323fc6b082499c.jpg (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.    If you want to check in the work so far (https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/317745) separately before we attend to the document, that's fine. But don't delay - both the messaging and document changes should be available to customers at the same time.     I've created a new WF to achieve this; CU1 please chunk (and checkin) as you see fit.       Thanks                        CKG 19-Feb-25 13:37 GMT+00:00:     Tech Design:    These changes are only for Import declarations    1. Add a control to theimport form, somewhere in C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\GB\Core\GUI\JobDeclarationForms\InvoiceLineUserControl\ImportInvoiceLineUserControl.cs  It hasn't been added to the EU form, but Germany do add it to the form, see C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\DE\Core\GUI\JobDeclaration\InvoiceLineUserControl\InvoiceLineDetailsUserControl.Designer.cs  for inspiration.    2.  Also add a column to the invoice lines grid    3.Override MergeJI_RN_NKCountryOfExportCore in C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\GB\Core\Business\ConfigurationProviders\EntryLineConfiguration.cs  to return true;    4.  Override JI_RN_NKCountryOfExport in C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\GB\Core\Business\Declaration\JobComInvoiceLine\JobComInvoiceLine.cs  to allow you to set the correct captions.    5. Ensure the default value of JI_RN_NKCountryOfExport is a blank string.    6.  Set the lookup list to be the same that is given for the Goods Origin which is the GoodsOrigin property in C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\EU\Core\Business\Declaration\JobDeclaration\JobDeclarationLookups.cs     7. Provide blue message error if the user enters a value that is not in the list, blank is fine.    8.  Change logic so that if a value has been captured in JI_RN_NKCountryOfExport we should output this at line level, otherwise do we what do today and output JE_GoodOrigin.    Change will probably be in protected virtual void PopulateExportCountryID(IGovernmentAgencyGoodsItem goodsItem) method located in C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\GB\Core\CDS\Messaging\MessageBuilders\MessageBuilder.cs    Firstly we currently check if there is a consignor and if so output the country code for its address, we still need this check, but if JE_RN_NKCountryOfExport is populated, we use that instead of the consignors address.  Then if the else part we check to see if JE_RN_NKCountryOfExport has a value, if so we use that, otherwise we fallback and use JE_GoodsOrigin as we do today.    9.  Obviously ensure we dont make any change for exports    ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------    DJC 13-Feb-25 10:16 GMT+00:00:  When goods are taken out of a warehouse or IP, the dispatch country may be needed at line level.  This is because multiple goods (from multiple original into-procedure entries) may be taken out together, and because CDS itself has a bug whereby if you declare dispatch country GB (as CW1 will do) but preferential origin in EU, it thinks the item is a GB-NI move, and waives VAT.   So we need a solution to allow the dispatch country at itme level, but falling back to the header (JE_GoodsOrigin)      1. For GB CDS imports, add a field for JI_RN_NKCountryOfExport to the invoice line control.  Base EU may already offer it. You can put it anywhere that fits, but make sure that it won't clash with other fields which may show/hide variably.    2. Add a column for it in the grid.   3. INclude JI_RN_NKCountryOfExport in the entry line merge key (see EU's includeJI_RN_NKCountryOfExportInLineMergeKey)  4. Caption for column/ fields is "[UCC 5/14] Dispatch/Export Country/Region",  "[UCC 5/14] Dispatch", "Dispatch"  5. Default value should be blank.   6. Lookup list should be the same country codes as offered for JE_GoodsOrgin  7. Validation is:  blank is OK, in list is OK, not blank but not-in-list is not OK (blue list-error notification)  8. Change the CDS messaging for imports only. Currently we take the header-level export coutnry (JE_GoodsOrigin) and send it at the line level for all lines. Change this so that if the entry line's random invoice line has a value, send that , else fall up and send the JE_GoodsOrigin value as now.   9. No change for exports. Continue to capture and to send JE_GoodsOrigin at headr onlyu     Desired effect:  User can set a per-item export/dispatch country  It is sent in the CDS message for that item  Users don't have to set an origin on all lines, only the lines that differ from the header.     Test cases  Import declaration, header level goods origin = US, two invoice lines. Set merge = NON.   a.  Blank value for dispatch country on both invoice lines.  Send US for both entry lines.   b.  Value CA for one invoice line, blank for the other. Send CA for the first entry line, US for the other .   c.  Value CA for one invoice line, MX for the other. Send CA for the first entry line, MX for the other .   d. Check that a nonstandard value XS (Serbia) is in the list and does not incur blue validation when selected.  Check the list has a handful of the standard values from ISO3166 , e.g. FR, DE, US, CA, MX. Check it also has GB.   e. Check that blank doesn't incur validation.   f. Check that a garbage value does incure validation.
product_candidate: CDS imports, show 5/14 (dispatch country) at item level

WKI_Summary: [LIC] Move Licensing Data from StmActivityLog
details: Background  Archive Manager working on improving its functionality, as part of our investigation WI00712474 - AM: (STM) Move licensing details out of StmActivityLog   we identified, that Licening data, is written into STMActivityLog tab, (please see eDocs attached).   Brett S, suggested to move that data into a dedicated table,   I had a quick chat with Samuel W, and he suggested to raise a ticket for your team to do further investigation. to understand how much work there is to do.     CG6 25-Apr-25 10:53 GMT+08:00:   Tech Design:  1.LicenceUsageLog inherits StmActivityLog, so we need to create a new LicenceUsageLog table to replace StmActivityLog (CargoWise.Shared/CargoWise.DbUpgrader/src/Resource/Resource/AutoGenerated/Schema_Main/Licence/LicenceUsageLog.sql)  CREATE TABLE LicenceUsageLog (    LUL_PK UNIQUEIDENTIFIER NOT NULL CONSTRAINT PK_UX__LU_PK PRIMARY KEY NONCLUSTERED,    LUL_LicenceModule VARCHAR(3) DEFAULT '' NOT NULL,   -- S7_FormCaption      LUL_LicenceType VARCHAR(3) DEFAULT '' NOT NULL,      --  S7_MouseClicks    LUL_UsageTimeUtc SMALLDATETIME NULL,    LUL_GS_NKUser VARCHAR(3) DEFAULT '' NOT NULL,    LUL_ParentID UNIQUEIDENTIFIER NULL,    LUL_ParentTableCode VARCHAR(3) DEFAULT '' NOT NULL,       LUL_SystemCreateTimeUtc SMALLDATETIME NOT NULL,      LUL_SystemCreateUser CHAR(3) DEFAULT '' NOT NULL,       LUL_SystemLastEditTimeUtc SMALLDATETIME NOT NULL,       LUL_SystemLastEditUser CHAR(3) DEFAULT '' NOT NULL,    CONSTRAINT Constraint_LU_LicenceType      CHECK (LU_LicenceType IN ('CPT', 'NON', 'ODM', 'OPN', 'OTM', 'PUR', 'REN', 'SRU', 'TRI')),    CONSTRAINT Constraint_LU_UsageTimeUtc_Check      CHECK (LU_UsageTimeUtc IS NOT NULL),    CONSTRAINT Constraint_LUL_SystemCreateUser        CHECK (LUL_SystemCreateUser <> ''),    CONSTRAINT Constraint_LUL_SystemLastEditUser        CHECK (LUL_SystemLastEditUser <> ''),    INDEX NR_RC__LUL_UsageTimeUtc CLUSTERED (LUL_UsageTimeUtc),  );    ALTER TABLE LicenceUsageLog SET (LOCK_ESCALATION = DI`SABLE);  2.Run regen to generate schema and businessObject related to LicenceUsageLog.  3.Change the codes of LicenceUsageReportBuilder, LicenceConsumptionLogCreator, LicenceUsageFilterBusinessObject, etc., and replace StmActivityLogSchema with LicenceUsageLogSchema  4.Use transformation to transfer data in StmActivityLog to LicenceUsageLog:  namespace Enterprise.DbUpgrader.Transformations.Transforms.ArchiveManager  {   public class MigrateAndCleanStmActivityLog : DataTransformation   {    public override string UserDescription => "Migrate valid data to LicenceUsageLog and clean StmActivityLog";      const string tableName = "LicenceUsageLog";      const string migrateDataLowWatermarkPropertyName = "MigrateValidData_LowWatermark";    const string cleanOldDataLowWatermarkPropertyName = "CleanOldData_LowWatermark";      protected virtual int BatchSize => 1000;      protected override void OfflinePostUpgradeTransform()    {     if (!DbObjectCreator.TableExists(Db.Connection, Db.Connection.CurrentDatabase, tableName))     {      manager?.ShowInfoMessage($"No {tableName} table");      return;     }     MigrateValidData();     CleanOldData();    }      void MigrateValidData()    {     long totalNumberOfRows = DataUtils.GetApproximateRowCountForTable(Db.Connection, StmActivityLogSchema.Constants.TableName);       var operation = new GuidChunkingOperation(manager, BatchSize, totalNumberOfRows, MigrateDataWithChunking, migrateDataLowWatermarkPropertyName);     operation.DoChunking();    }      void MigrateDataWithChunking(Guid lowerBound, Guid upperBound)    {     var migrateSql = @"                  INSERT INTO dbo.LicenceUsageLog (                      LUL_PK,                      LUL_LicenceModule,                      LUL_LicenceType,                      LUL_UsageTimeUtc,                      LUL_GS_NKUser,                      LUL_ParentID,                      LUL_ParentTableCode                  )                  SELECT                       S7_PK,                      S7_FormCaption,                      CASE S7_MouseClicks                          WHEN 13 THEN 'NON'                          WHEN 23 THEN 'PUR'                          WHEN 33 THEN 'REN'                          WHEN 43 THEN 'TRI'                          WHEN 53 THEN 'OTM'                          WHEN 63 THEN 'OPN'                          WHEN 73 THEN 'SRU'                          WHEN 93 THEN 'ODM'                          WHEN 103 THEN 'CPT'                          ELSE 'NON'                      END AS LU_LicenceType,                      S7_OpenDateTimeUtc,                      S7_GS_NKUser,                      S7_ParentID,                      S7_ParentTableCode                  FROM dbo.StmActivityLog                  WHERE S7_PK BETWEEN @lowerBound AND @upperBound                  WHERE S7_ControllerID LIKE 'd0d2148a-6188-47b4-8d59-70e591518437%'              ";       using (var command = Db.Connection.Command(migrateSql))     {      int migratedRows = command.ExecuteNonQuery();      manager?.ShowInfoMessage($"Migrate valid data to LicenceUsageLog: {migratedRows} rows were migrated");     }    }      void CleanOldData()    {     long totalNumberOfRows = DataUtils.GetApproximateRowCountForTable(Db.Connection, StmActivityLogSchema.Constants.TableName);       var operation = new GuidChunkingOperation(manager, BatchSize, totalNumberOfRows, CleanDataWithChunking, cleanOldDataLowWatermarkPropertyName);     operation.DoChunking();    }      void CleanDataWithChunking(Guid lowerBound, Guid upperBound)    {     var sqlDeleteBatch = @"                  DELETE FROM dbo.StmActivityLog                   FROM dbo.StmActivityLog WITH (FORCESEEK, INDEX(PK_UX__S7_PK))                  WHERE S7_PK BETWEEN @startGuid AND @endGuid                  AND                       S7_ControllerID LIKE 'd0d2148a-6188-47b4-8d59-70e591518437%'              ";       using (var command = Db.Connection.Command(sqlDeleteBatch))     {      command.AddParameter("@startGuid", SqlDbType.UniqueIdentifier, lowerBound);      command.AddParameter("@endGuid", SqlDbType.UniqueIdentifier, upperBound);        command.ExecuteNonQuery();     }    }   }  }        SCW 09-Sep-25 13:38 GMT+10:00:   Column rename HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/e3ed25fd-638c-4be8-a1a4-1c36fc2d1e11?lang=en-gb" WI00961252 - [LIC] Rename LicenceUsageLog column

WKI_Summary: Addition of Original Invoice Details to e-Invoice XML for Return of Purchase Inv
details: A25 03-Mar-25 13:11 GMT+03:00:    The Turkish Revenue Administration has introduced some changes to the e-invoice rules, one of which requires adding the original invoice details for the return of purchase invoices.  When posting a return of a purchase invoice, certain information from the original sales invoice must be included in the XML; otherwise, an error will occur. This enhancement will take effect on March 28, 2025.    According to the Schematron file, when the invoice type is TEVKIFATIADE or IADE, the cac:BillingReference field must be included in the XML. Additionally, it should contain cac:InvoiceDocumentReference/cbc:DocumentTypeCode = IADE to comply with the requirements.      PR:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/318485    DFR:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=170ec856-1ac4-4920-972c-1e17698ebe50&StorageDocPK=d3580b73-8429-4b4f-8082-2c4b5758062c&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2boV3atxCO81QleE6qNeXgTM0FUsgmByoD" BD 13-Mar-25 17:26:  File WI00877197 - Developer Functional Review.docx (Internal Correspondence)
product_candidate: Addition of Original Invoice Details to e
feature_description: Invoice XML for Return of Purchase Inv

WKI_Summary: CPW: Reduce unneeded 'override clear' reset on job save
details: Reported incidents:  HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/397dc93d-ba09-4bf4-8222-30637876dfc2?lang=en-gb" CS01911558 - TRAEXPELP - Override Clear function required after each save  HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/e67a6266-8826-4aae-972b-e87448071423?lang=en-gb" CS01909041 - DEHLICPFK - No "Job Clear" anymore  HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/54d0235e-24c6-4a0a-881c-ab3f8e748abd?lang=en-gb" CS01923538 - LOGWINASC - Compliance Risk Feature Behavior    Background:  A job has a compliance risk on it  User overrides the status to CLEAR  User makes some change to the job which are not flagged as a risk. They expect should not have material impact on job risk  The override status is reset  User needs to override to CLEAR again    JT3 16-Apr-25 16:49 GMT+10:00: Speaking with Andrew Cumming, we have agreed that if a job is override clear, when a party/location/commodity is added to the job (regardless of whether its clear or not), it SHOULD reset override clear HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=23a23b5f-2a3d-4a9b-b457-3967dd8ebb4b&StorageDocPK=417172df-f3a7-4427-a9f4-4efda9925a4c&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=ediprod&Hash=%2bk6RW8HlYDzRhjk%2fD2WrumR09RB3Jcp07" GMO 16-Apr-25 22:28:  File WI00887048 1-pager.docx (Escalation Document)      DONE statement  1. When a job is override clear and a party/location/commoditiy is removed, the job remains as override clear  2. When a job is override clear and a party/location/commoditiy is added , the override clear status is reset  3. When a job is override clear and a party/location/commoditiy is updated, the override clear status is reset      Comments from Gretel:  here are my thoughts for CS01909041 - DEHLICPFK - No "Job Clear" anymore as requested.      The reason we reset when a party, location or commodity is added or changed is because the changed detail may result in a different clearing decision.      The customer has used an interesting scenarios where they have added a new party and don't understand why the override clear reset "because the party is not in Yemen".      This would actually work the same in DPS for jobs and job clear. If a party is added, the job clear status will reset. https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=578e4757-f969-40ce-b07a-f58f582e8449. So I think we can provide some learning here and see what the customer says.      Your note says that you would not expect the override clear to reset when the detail that has changed is not a risk is worth exploring I think. Where the solution to reset when any party changes may have been ok for DPS for jobs, we have a pain point where ComplianceWise is costing to much time/work.      I don't think we would ever not reset an override clear job if a risky party is added even if the party is not in the location (as the customer has suggested).      We would want to consider if there is a case where a clear party, location or commodity added would ever result in a different compliance decision.     JT3 08-Apr-25 10:07 GMT+10:00:   Regarding Gretel's comment about "We would want to consider if there is a case where a clear party, location or commodity added would ever result in a different compliance decision." - I think such a case does exist where a party is not on any denied party list and is thus "CLR", but for one reason or another, a forwarder wants nothing to do with that party ie. HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/f5a108c9-5a90-4834-8153-debfdb00a37c?lang=en-gb" CS01450790 - PRIAIRLIG - Create company-specific denied party list
product_candidate: Reduce unneeded 'override clear' reset on job save

WKI_Summary: TM1: Add Planned Orders to Load Job
details: MMC 28-Oct-24 15:15 GMT+11:00:   Follow up after 'HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=259c1dba-4cb3-4985-a909-cef629ba8e59&VersionNumber=24.10.28.5&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bq%2fiTZtwnSggCxIcz8WMiiF2yOwgdLFqq" WI00720038 - TM1: Add Loading task index fields'    We want to see the Planned Orders to Load for a Load Job. Ideally we want to use PkgPackage for this, but putting these in Lucene is potentially problematic, so lets show planned orders.  To achieve this, we need to make IWhsOrder have a task category (WTT).  Further to this, we need to add a RelatedParentReference to the Planned Load via WD_WLO_PlannedLoad so that it appears as a child for the Load Job. BRS: Confirmed with Maciej that this gets cleared before pivots are made  BRS: For consistency, i think it should also self reference itself in RELATEDPARENTREFERENCE when WD_WLO_PlannedLoad is set, so the planned load task shows when drilling down to the order.  We need a Line Type of "Planned Order to Load" or similar.  Additionally we need a new column for the Task called "External Reference" which returns the order's WD_ExternalReference. This can be used in other Line Types as well where appropriate. BRS: Use EXTERNALREFERENCE type that already exists for WTJ, set it on all WTT types following what was used on their parents.    Line status should be not started, Client/Whs/Subtype and the audit fields should be set, but no line level fields should be. To Location can be the load's planned dock door.  Don't set any quantities, as any number we set is likely wrong and may appear in places besides TM1 tasks
product_candidate: Add Planned Orders to Load Job

WKI_Summary: [MYA.UPG] Generate Schema Files from MYA download upgrade package
details: The problem we are trying to solve is to get our customers the schemas files before deploying/downloading new CargoWise version and potentially breaking their integrations.     Currently, the only ways to get these schemas are:   If CargoWise version is already installed/deployed > going to EDI Message module > Action menu > download  If they can download CargoWise installation package > they can found the schemas in the Binaries folder    Option 2 is the earliest way to get the schemas without actually deploying CargoWise, but it is require to fully download the heavy installation package. It is still not good customer experience. Server Download page sounds to be good palce to get the schemas early on, per package version.    In this Work Item, we want to be able to generate the schema files and expose it as a link in the server download page of MYA alongside the request package upgrade packages.      PYN 08-May-25 13:10 GMT+08:00:     Tech Design:    1. Create a hyperlink in Downloads.aspx called "XML Schemas" between "Details" and "Request Upgrade Package" of the same style as "Details".    2. Create an aspx file called "XMLSchemas.aspx" that will perform the download operation and accept secure query string for the selected version.    3. Create a Registry in WiseTech Global Client Extensions -> My Account -> Download to store the cache folder which is used to save the cache XML Schema files.    4.1 When IBP service task ImportReleaseBuilds(), extract XML Schema files from installation package send to web shared folder.  4.2 When IBP service task CleanupOldReleaseBuilds(), delete the version matched XML Schema files from web shared folder as superseded versions are not visible to customer users on MyAccount.  4.3 When the client requests XML Schema files, pass the currently logged-in user information, the server side verify the authentication, if passes, download files to the client, otherwise return a verification error.   SCW: Also need to handle the scenario where XML schema file doesn't exist for the selected version    Since the web server cannot access the bin folder in the build package, eAdapter team is moving the XML Schema files to the install package (.edp), so we need to wait until their work item is completed before we can start the coding workflow.  Prerequisite WIs:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=NewWorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=0ddd041a-f925-4486-935f-cbf51a4234d2&VersionNumber=25.5.8.614&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b5yXUio2olyr3R%2fjsXaCEzTJ%2fGxGpVe%2fT" WI00907018 - [EAD][ADH] Copy NXML/UXML Schemas within Install packages  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=293899b8-5574-4c96-95d7-cc27a5920ba9&VersionNumber=25.6.19.380&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2butIbdjIbxkK49aFxdDoPiUJU9AvjyB81" WI00913781 - [XRM] Copy the files for the Build Package to the Install Package    5. When the dropdown version changes, the cmbDropDownVersion_SelectedIndexChanged function will be called and we need to change the query string of XMLSchemas as well.    6. If the package or XML Schema files does not exist, "XML Schemas" should not be displayed in the download page.
product_candidate: [MYA.UPG] Generate Schema Files from MYA download upgrade package

WKI_Summary: Add Supply Type and Tax Branch to Charge Code Analysis Summary Reports
details: Patching Required - the ability to filter by Supply Type and Tax Branch is essential for user sites like DHL in Brazil    Module:  Accounts > Receivables > Reports  Accounts > Payables > Reports      Background:   In HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/7714b052-5fe3-47a4-bf88-287ee4de1fb6?lang=en-gb" WI00529629 - Add Supply Type and Tax Branch to AP/AR Charge Code Analysis - Detail Reports, we added Supply Type and Tax Branch to the detailed version of the Charge Code reports. This WI is to enhance the summary version of the Charge Code reports.    Problem:    We support Supply Type and Tax Branch - key attributes that explains the tax treatment of a charge line.   Currently there is no ability to report summarised amount of Revenue and Cost to a particular Supply Type and/or Tax Branch.  For DHL Brazil, this information is critical for understanding and explaining their taxable revenue they have recorded.    Scope of Change  Receivables Reports:  1. Charge Code Analysis - Summary by Charge Code;   2. Charge Code Analysis - Summary by Receivables Account  Payables Reports:  3. Charge Code Analysis - Summary by Charge Code;   4. Charge Code Analysis - Summary by Payables Account    Changes required:  - Add Supply Type filter, limiting results to Revenue/Cost charges lines with the nominated Supply Type.  - Add Line Tax Branch Filter, limiting results to Revenue/Cost Charge lines whose transaction header Tax Branch matches with the selected Tax Branch  - Additional fix for Receivables Report > Charge Code Analysis - Summary by Charge Code: Fix the Display Label and Heading Text for 'Account Code' and 'Account Name' data columns to match underlying data      Done statement:   Users can analyze total turnover by Charge code for a particular Supply Type and/or Tax Branch
product_candidate: Add Supply Type and Tax Branch to Charge Code Analysis Summary Reports

WKI_Summary: ACAS - Item 10 - Verified Known Consignor- Add fallback
details: Requirement: The current system behaviour has a gap when the inspection status needs to be changed from "Approved" (calculated based on the shipper's known status) to another inspection status due to the consignment being tampered with, and when the supply chain security module is not enabled. To address this, we will be adding a fallback to a current behaviour, i.e we will check the inspection field (current behaviour) and if it’s APP, Y will be populated in the FWB/FHL. If it’s other than APP, the fallback will be to check the organisation’s  (either consignor or local client) known status.    Done: If the shipment's inspection status is other than APP inspection status on the shipment, Y or N will be populated in check the organisation’s  (either consignor or local client) known status.      SDF 13-Feb-25 16:38 GMT+08:00:     1)This indicator only works for Consol that transit through or to the United States. SVI: to add "and U.S. Territories"  we already have  HasDestinationOrTransitInUSA in https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FExportAWB%2FExportAWBHeader%2FExportAWBHeader.cs&version=GBmaster&line=3995&lineEnd=3995&lineStartColumn=15&lineEndColumn=43&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents.  If this condition is not met, then we should not add this indicator.  SDF 25-Feb-25 10:55 GMT+08:00:  We already have ShouldApplyACAS() https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FExportAWB%2FExportAWBHeader%2FCountryHandlers%2FUsaACASCountryHandler.cs&version=GBmaster&line=37&lineEnd=37&lineStartColumn=15&lineEndColumn=32&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents      2)If the Inspection status is anything other than APP (Approved), the system will check whether the consignor/local client holds a valid Known/Approved status.     Note that either a Consignor or Local Client must be set to Yes/Warning within the Registry Freight > Supply Chain Security > select relevant country > Organizations to Use for Supply Chain Security.      - If the Consignor is set to Yes/Warning, the system will check the Consignor’s Known/Approved status.      - If the Local Client is set to Yes/Warning, and the Consignor is set to No, the system will check the Local Client’s Known/Approved status.       - If both the Consignor and Local Client are set to Yes/Warning, the system will check the Consignor’s Known/Approved status.        We first need to check whether the Shipment's Inspection Type Code(JS_InspectionType) is APP, and if not, then follow the rules above to check whether the Shipment's Consignor or Local Client holds a valid Known/Approved status.   The logic here is similar to Method GetErrorsForRelevantOrganisationsWithoutAviationSecurityApproval(https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FShipment%2FAviationSecurity%2FAviationSecuritySupport.cs&version=GBmaster&line=114&lineEnd=114&lineStartColumn=24&lineEndColumn=90&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents),   it checks whether all organizations set to YES have valid Known/Approved status,  but for this WI we only care about organizations with OrganizationCodes CON(SupplyChainSecurityOrganisationTypes.Consignor) and LOC(SupplyChainSecurityOrganisationTypes.LocalClient).        3)The US Government ACAS program has been updated to enable additional shipment data related to the shipper and consignee of air cargo shipments to be reported via the OCI (Other Customs Information) segment of FWB and FHL messages submitted to airlines.    We need to add indicator to the OCI segment of FWB(https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FAWB%2FBusiness%2FMessaging%2FFWB.cs&version=GC5134398624d7e3a7f43d0d43740eef5bf0472ff0&line=866&lineEnd=866&lineStartColumn=8&lineEndColumn=34&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents)   and FHL(https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FAWB%2FBusiness%2FMessaging%2FFHL.cs&version=GC5134398624d7e3a7f43d0d43740eef5bf0472ff0&line=290&lineEnd=290&lineStartColumn=8&lineEndColumn=34&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents) messages.  This is similar to adding GDRN numbers, you can refer to this PR: HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/225479" Pull request 225479: WI00719921 - Swiss Entry Number & Inclusion in FWB/FHL - Repos      SDF 25-Feb-25 10:56 GMT+08:00: We just need to change the logic of IsVerifiedKnownConsignor() in https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FExportAWB%2FExportAWBHeader%2FCountryHandlers%2FUsaACASCountryHandler.cs&version=GBmaster&line=42&lineEnd=42&lineStartColumn=15&lineEndColumn=39&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents
feature_description: Item 10 - Verified Known Consignor- Add fallback

WKI_Summary: add MID add, query options to UXML data Import
details: currently we do not support the ability to locate the ORG code via the MID OR the ability to auto-create an Org and query it, based on the MID (US Customs)    We want to add these features already supported in the Data Wizard and Native XML for products...    HYPERLINK "https://aus01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwisetechacademy.com%2Fsearch%3Fquickstart%3Deeaf1750-4723-4139-9d18-22e1fc468326&data=05%7C02%7CCraig.Seelig%40wisetechglobal.com%7Cf912d75577724f78650008de06fd9c30%7C8b493985e1b44b95ade698acafdbdb01%7C0%7C0%7C638955883472867129%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=pQlabr6MKPsCi62CgSwHXnlc7wjGSLrI5wZ%2BdW%2FIJyo%3D&reserved=0" Ability to populate Manufacturer details from the MID (Manufacturer ID) using either the Native XML import process for a Product or the Import Data Wizard from the Invoice Lines grid in a Customs Declaration    HYPERLINK "https://aus01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com%2Flink%2FShowEditForm%2FSupportIncident%2Feb26fd20-87c7-4cbf-9964-1d263a52637c&data=05%7C02%7CCraig.Seelig%40wisetechglobal.com%7Cf912d75577724f78650008de06fd9c30%7C8b493985e1b44b95ade698acafdbdb01%7C0%7C0%7C638955883472879877%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=Cx23dRg9cUalJqxszAVIOsOnX%2FsT83MXda4XB%2Fv1Xa8%3D&reserved=0" CS02088053 - UPSSUPATL - US Customs Automatic MID Query to Universal XML Imports

WKI_Summary: AE Manifest - Get MPCI ID for UNB Segment from Logged in Company Branch 1st
details: Please find the spec in the link below:  https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/DevelopmentCustomsTeam/ES4_4jC-bTlMt_7Ux3m-S2gBNu0SxOYOnXV3k9T8cH-D9w?e=oqLvaq    VWG 01-Sep-25 10:58 GMT+08:00:   - Please check out C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\CargoWise\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\AE\Manifest\Business\Messaging\UCMP\ManifestInterchangeSegmentProvider.cs,  -> GetInterchangeHeader -> senderInternalId     - Please check all the code where AeOrgProxyForManifestMessage is called, e.g. AEMessageSendingNotificationHelper.GetExtraMessageSendingNotificationCore      For reference only     record OrgProxyMPCIResult(OrgProxyType proxyType, OrgHeader orgHeader, ZString MPCI);      enum OrgProxyType   {    CurrentCompany,    CurrentBranch,    RegistryBranch   }     OrgProxyMPCIResult AeOrgProxyForManifestMessage(BusinessObjectFactory factory)   {   }      MRW 01-Sep-25 14:35 GMT+08:00:   The following addtional changes are confirmed with Sheldon and Nishaal:  1. For AE login, use the same fallback logic: First check Branch's org proxy, then check Company's org proxy. However, UAE does not have 'Default Branch for Manifest Submission' Registry item, skip the last step.    2. Change the warning/error messages before sending Manifest and saving Bill to a more generic one.  Current:  For warning messages before sending manifest, there are 2.  One for not finding the Default Branch for Non-AE login:  "To create a message for the United Arab Emirates you must link the current logged in company to an AE Branch in the Registry, Customs>Country or Region Specific>United Arab Emirates>Default Branch for Manifest Submission. This is so that the correct OrgProxy is selected for determining the Manifest EDI Profile."  Another one for not finding MPC ID on Org Proxy:  "The Organization Proxy {0} of your login branch or the default branch for manifest submission does not have an MPCI Identification Number Configured. Please set the MPCI Identification Number received from NAIC in the Organization Proxy Config."     For errors messages in Bill Validation, there also 2 messages similar to above. (Introduced in HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/82f213ad-0d04-4294-b1e2-acd4cfbda597" WI00949034 - AE Manifest - Update BGM Document Identifier generation)  One for not finding the Default Branch for Non-AE login:  "To create Sender Reference you must link the current logged in company to an AE Branch in the Registry, Customs>Country or Region Specific>United Arab Emirates>Default Branch for Manifest Submission. This is so that the correct OrgProxy is selected for determining the Manifest EDI Profile."  Another one for not finding MPC ID on Org Proxy:  "The Organization Proxy {0} of your login branch or the default branch for manifest submission does not have an MPCI Identification Number Configured. Please set the MPCI Identification Number received from NAIC in the Organization Proxy Config."    Propose:  Combine both these messages into one, and use the same message for validations before sending Manifest and saving Bill.  "The Organization Proxy of your login branch/company or the default branch for manifest submission does not have an MPCI Identification Number Configured. Please set the MPCI Identification Number received from NAIC in the Organization Proxy Config. Alternatively, link the current logged in company to an AE Branch in the Registry, Customs>Country or Region Specific>United Arab Emirates>Default Branch for Manifest Submission. This is so that the correct OrgProxy is selected for determining the Manifest EDI Profile."
feature_description: Get MPCI ID for UNB Segment from Logged in Company Branch 1st

WKI_Summary: Enhance FPOS (Place of Supply) Configuration to permit UNLOCO
details: Summary Requirement:  Extend existing Place of Supply Type Configuration to allow recording UNLOCO for the Login Company's Country.  Add a UNLOCO option to the Fixed Place of Supply Type Configuration registry to enable UNLOCO for Login Company Country to be recorded.      PATCHING required:  Changes will be checked in to Alpha, and patched to DPR, STD and GP1 (our current GP1 is 25.6.18)    Change Required:  1. Registry: Update Registry: Fixed Place of Supply Type Configuration     ADD 'UNLOCO' as an option in Fixed Place of Supply Type Configuration Registry     example of expected use: Brazil Login Companies will tick both  'A UNLOCO in Login Country/Region' AND 'A Country/Region'.  2. Behaviour: Record 'UNL' as the Place of Supply Location Type When saving a UNLOCO value as Place of Supply  3. Behaviour: FPOS default and lookup options WHEN registry enables UNLOCO as FPOS Type Configuration.  WHEN the UNLOCO option of the Fixed Place of Supply Type Configuration registry is ticked  THEN   Permit UNLOCO for that login company's country to be recorded as FPOS against job charges and charge lines.  Allow users to look up for a different UNLOCO from the Login Company Country and override the defaulted FPOS value on a transaction line    Brazil UNLOCO update   -we will deploy IBGE municipio as a "local code" recorded against each BR UNLOCO. This is done in HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/96c01396-01c0-42da-978c-dc7acb202321?lang=en-gb" WI00943198 - Add Brazil IBGE City Codes as BR UNLOCO 'Local Codes' to support BR Tax Reform   -these local codes will be deployed using service tasks in the same way country/state/currency/unloco records are already maintained without upgrade.      In HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/68752da7-384b-4f98-8763-bea00b18ed52?lang=en-gb" WI00951462 - Enhance FPOS element in XUS and XUT to include UNLOCO and Local Codes,  we will populate UNLOCO code and Local Codes collection under <PlaceOfSupply> element in XUS and XUT
product_candidate: Enhance FPOS (Place of Supply) Configuration to permit UNLOCO

WKI_Summary: Costa Rica - Add new Compliance Sub Type, Ledge of Use & Transaction Type of Use
details: Country COSTA RICA  Sub Project HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAG0SYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=0c3e5f8a-7ccd-4d91-9534-10fbb868de2a&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b70rFVn0Th%2bpGq7I75LrqgZbTyCsmQSPT" Project PRJ00029632  Head Project HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAUSSYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=5da8f849-6392-428a-bf02-6fa35d2a52be&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2ba6icvzlBehIlslRQuYs2zRHPSY5jcmNz" Project PRJ00029620  Topic Importance Comments  Extend Costa Rica Compliance Sub Type list to include "Factura de Exportación" for Receivables and Payables.    Assign the correct Ledger of Use for the new                  compliance sub type "Factura de Exportación".    Update the "Transaction Type of Use" in Country Compliance Info for Costa Rica Login Companies.   High  Currently CargoWise Compliance Sub Type list for Costa Rica only includes Local Invoice, Debit Note and Credit Note for Receivables and Payables.  CargoWise should flag relevant Compliance Sub Types for Receivables and Payables transactions for Costa Rica Country. It means to especify which ones will ONLY be used against Payables INV and CRD transactions, which ones will ONLY be used against Receivableds INV and CRD transactions and which ones will be use in both, Receivables and Payables INV and CRD transactions.  CargoWise should flag relevant Compliance Sub Types for INV and CRD transactions for Costa Rica Country. It means to especify  which ones will ONLY be used against INV transactions and which ones will ONLY be used against CRD transactions.  Scope:   HLD (High Level Design) Done Statements:  When the Specification is completed, the following statements will be true:  Colombia Compliance Subt Type list will include "Factura de Exportación".  Only relevant Compliance Sub Types will be able for Receivables and/or Payables transactions.  Only relevant Compliance Sub Types will be able for INV or CRD transactions.  Other notes:
feature_description: Add new Compliance Sub Type, Ledge of Use & Transaction Type of Use
