details: Country COSTA RICA  Sub Project HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAG0SYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=0c3e5f8a-7ccd-4d91-9534-10fbb868de2a&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b70rFVn0Th%2bpGq7I75LrqgZbTyCsmQSPT" Project PRJ00029632  Head Project HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAUSSYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=5da8f849-6392-428a-bf02-6fa35d2a52be&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2ba6icvzlBehIlslRQuYs2zRHPSY5jcmNz" Project PRJ00029620  Topic Importance Comments  Extend Costa Rica Compliance Sub Type list to include "Tiquete Electronico" for Receivables only.    Assign the correct Ledger of Use for the new                  compliance sub type "Tiquete Electronico".    Update the "Transaction Type of Use" in Country Compliance Info for Costa Rica Login Companies.   High  Currently CargoWise Compliance Sub Type list for Costa Rica only includes Local Invoice, Debit Note and Credit Note and Exportation Invoices for Receivables and Payables.  CargoWise should flag relevant Compliance Sub Types for Receivables and Payables transactions for Costa Rica Country. It means to especify which ones will ONLY be used against Payables INV and CRD transactions, which ones will ONLY be used against Receivableds INV and CRD transactions and which ones will be use in both, Receivables and Payables INV and CRD transactions.  CargoWise should flag relevant Compliance Sub Types for INV and CRD transactions for Costa Rica Country. It means to especify  which ones will ONLY be used against INV transactions and which ones will ONLY be used against CRD transactions.  Scope:   HLD (High Level Design) Done Statements:  When the Specification is completed, the following statements will be true:  Colombia Compliance Subt Type list will include "Tiquete de exportación".  Only relevant Compliance Sub Types will be able for Receivables and/or Payables transactions.  Only relevant Compliance Sub Types will be able for INV or CRD transactions.  Other notes:  CPC 11-Jul-25 14:28 GMT-05:00: During implementation, I discovered that the filter strip on the Payables Transactions page does not take the ledger into account when building the filter for Compliance Sub Type. The spec currently requires that the new TQE subtype not appear in that dropdown, but as it stands now, that control always shows all subtypes. In talking with Maria, we will probably revise the spec to remove this requirement.

WKI_Summary: ZA Customs - Separate Credit Terms/Payment Terms Logic
details: KH1 27-Mar-25 09:38 GMT+00:00: Note: confirmed with SVR (task 100-101) we can use [-99,999] for Payment Terms rather than the [-999,999] specified in the specification.    CKG 24-Mar-25 13:30 GMT+00:00:     Tech Design:    Firstly make sure any changes are controlled by the ZAINVDET FUNCS record    Credit Terms    1.  When JE_MessageType is anything other than 'EXP' we should not show the list, so we can just return an empty CodeDescriptionPairList  2.  When  JE_MessageType is 'EXP' we should return a list that has 'ADV', 'NEP' and the number 001 - 999.  Make sure to include the word days in the description.  3.  The code for this lookup can be found in C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\ZA\Business\Business\CusEntryInstruction\CusEntryInstructionLookups.cs.    Customs Rule    Please implement the various validation rules defined in the spec, this validation will need to be located in C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\ZA\Business\Business\CusEntryInstruction\CusEntryInstructionValidation.cs, method CheckCEI_CreditTerms    1. When JE_MessageType = 'EXP' and CreditTerms are blank then show relevant blue message error.  The code to do this is already present, we just need to restrcit it to 'EXP' jobs  2. When JE_MessageType = 'EXP' and the credit terms entered are not found in the list then show relevant blue message error.  This ListValidation is also present already and just needs restricting to 'EXP' jobs.  3.When JE_MessageType = 'IMP' or 'EXW' and credit terms have been capture show the relevant blue message error as per the spec.    Customs Message    We should already be outputting this as mentioned in the spec, please check    Payment Terms    GUI changes will need to be made here C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\ZA\GUI\JobDeclaration\InvoiceHeaderUserControl.cs    1.  Add a column to the grid and a control to the main form on the invoice headers tab, caption 'Payment Terms', bind this to JZ_PaymentTerms  2.  Control should be a drop down and the lookup list should contain numbers -999 to 999, make sure to include 000 and ensure all are 3 characters, ie 056 not 56.  3. I'm going to assume we want the word days added to the description like for credit terms.    Validation    Add validation to C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\ZA\Business\Business\JobComInvoiceHeader\JobComInvoiceHeaderValidation.cs, in CheckJZ_PaymentTerms    1.  If JZ_PaymentTerms is not found in the list then add blue message message, should be able to use ListValidation  2.  When JE_MessageType is 'IMP or 'EXP or 'EXW with CEI_Style of '46' or '47' and JZ_PaymentTerms is blank then show a blue message error.    Customs Message    Change to be made in C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\ZA\Business\MessageBuilders\CUSDEC\CUSDECMessageTextBuilder.cs, method PopulateSG18Segment    1.   We currently output this segment with this code    patSegment.TermsTimeInformation.NumberOfPeriods = new List<ZString> { CreditTermsCodeList.Codes.ADV, CreditTermsCodeList.Codes.NEP }.Contains(provider.CreditTerms) ? "0" : provider.PaymentTerms;    provider.PaymentTerms actually looks at the credit terms, this needs changing to look at JZ_PaymentTerms.    Change the logic to output JZ_PaymentTerms if JE_MessageType is 'IMP or 'EXP or 'EXW with CEI_Style of '46' or '47'.  Ensure to putpout the PAT+ bit even if JZ_PaymentTerms is blank            Please find the link to the spec below:  https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/DevelopmentCustomsTeam/EbzJpobOgGhFnUTEITgQqp8BzYbSSaUUs4Ba2zcDCg1iGw?e=Gavet9      Done:  Payment Terms can be captured against invoice headers & included in the Customs Message from the Invoice headers, Credit Terms are only valid for Export Jobs & captured in the entry Instruction tab    NRP 17-Mar-25 11:46 GMT+02:00: Add Payment Terms on the Invoice Header, use existing field - JZ_PaymentTerms.  CUSDEC mapping to use the separate fields where applicable.
feature_description: Separate Credit Terms/Payment Terms Logic

WKI_Summary: Add Client Side Date Validation To Android
details: BL3 29-Apr-25 13:49 GMT+10:00:   BL3 19-May-25 09:51 GMT+10:00:     Functional Testing:  When unloading products that support ExpiryDate and PackingDate, RF shows errors if the date is too far in the past or too far into the future.    YSH 06-Mar-25 15:03 GMT+11:00:   Currently:   - WhsDocketLineValidation defines a dynamic range for dates. Specifically:    - We have varying ranges for Expiry Date by docket line type:     - For Receive Line, this comes out as DateRangeValidation.MaximumFutureYears value for future years     - For Receive Line, the value for past years is dynamic relative to the state of the ReceiveLine. It is either the default TypeValidationLimits value, or it is DateRangeValidation.MaximumPastYears      -  default TypeValidationLimits value is what is used when editable      -  DateRangeValidation.MaximumPastYears is used when readonly       - For Transfer Line, this comes out as DateRangeValidation.MaximumFutureYears value for future years     - For Transfer Line, this comes out as DateRangeValidation.MaximumPastYears for past years       - Warehouse Web does not have any cases of creating an adjustment line, nor should an RF user ever dynamically create an order line, so concerns for other line types arent as much of an issue      - We have varying ranges for Packing Date by docket line type:     - For all docket line types, this comes out as the default TypeValidationLimits value for future years     - For Receive Line, the value for past years is dynamic relative to the state of the ReceiveLine. It is either the default TypeValidationLimits value, or it is DateRangeValidation.MaximumPastYears      -  default TypeValidationLimits value is what is used when editable      -  DateRangeValidation.MaximumPastYears is used when readonly     - For Transfer Line, this comes out as DateRangeValidation.MaximumPastYears for past years     - At a high level the values are dynamic to the status of the docket line, and dependent of the time of execution (though that probably is less likely to change during single runtime)    Design as follows:  Warehouse.Transactions   - Create new public static methods    - WhsDocketLineValidation.GetExpectedExpiryDateValidationRange(bool showWarningOnAllPastDates, bool shouldDefaultToMaximumPastYearsForError)    - WhsDocketLineValidation.GetExpectedPackingDateValidationRange(bool shouldDefaultToMaximumPastYearsForError)     - Refactor existing validations to consume these methods    Warehouse.Web   - Update WhsProductPartAttributesInfo to now feature new int properties regarding date ranges:    - PackingDateMaximumPastYears    - PackingDateMaximumFutureYears    - ExpiryDateMaximumPastYears    - ExpiryDateMaximumFutureYears     - When creating a new WhsDocketLineInfo, we will also be creating and populating WhsProductPartAttributesInfo    - If ExpiryDate / PackingDate are not used, dont worry about populating these new properties    - If ExpiryDate/ PackingDate are used, populate them:     - Use the new WhsDocketLineValidation methods to find the appropriate range, and devise a minimum + maximum date accordingly.      - showWarningOnAllPastDates can always be false, that is not something we care about in RF     - shouldDefaultToMaximumPastYearsForError should be:      - True for Transfer + Adjustment lines      - WhsReceiveLine.ShouldIgnoreOutOfRangeDates for receive lines      - False for any other lines. If during construction we are referencing a newly created line (such as for GetNewWhsReceiveLine web method), default to false    Perform Regens in both WinCE + Android  Warehouse RF (Android)   - Update our validation of expiry date + packing date on any screen the user might scan it.    - Critical cases will be UnloadProcessor.ValidateAllNonSerialAttributes + TransferProcessor.ValidateAllMandatoryAttributesEntered.     - Review if any other screens support scanning of expiry + packing date     - Picking shouldnt involve users scanning expiry/packing dates, but review if any do just in case    BRS 04-Feb-25 15:26 GMT+11:00:   Continuation of HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=79dde9b6-d41e-4f57-822f-46472dae6b98&VersionNumber=25.2.4.52&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bBPTE7NVr%2b9%2bhvW4FdrRGeh%2fIGMGO9Yyj" WI00863809 - Warehouse RF gun can not enter expiry date for year 2030    Let's investigate the impacts of the lack of date validation in Warehouse RF and implement client side validation that matches CW1's validation.    To avoid problems like that defect from above, we should probably find a way to share the date range with CW1 and Android (via the web service most likely)
product_candidate: Add Client Side Date Validation To Android

WKI_Summary: Add Two Transaction Header e-Reporting references to four Receivables reports.
details: This Work Item:  Add two optional display columns to four Receivable Reports.    1. Add a column to print the AHF_Number recorded for a transaction with SUC (Successful) eReporting status  2. Add a column to print the AIB_GovernmentAllocatedNumber recorded for a transaction with SUC (Successful) eReporting status    Leave values empty when eReporting status is not SUC; or when the fields are empty.    Four Reports to update:  Module: Receivables > Reports         Report Menu           Related Report Template            Tax Transaction - Tax   Configuration Tax Detail           Tax Transaction - Tax   Configuration Tax Detail            Aged Outstanding Transactions -   Detail in Invoice Currency           AR Aged Outstanding Transactions   - Detail in Invoice Currency            Aged Outstanding Transactions -   Detail in Local Currency           AR Aged Outstanding Transactions   -Detail in Local Currency            Transactions by Compliance Sub   Type and Compliance Number           AR Transactions by Compliance Sub   Type and Compliance Number      FLN 19-Jun-25 13:28 GMT+10:00: During design, Ariel discovered for the following three countries, they don't record key eInvoicing reference data in AIB_GovernmentAllocatedNumber:  For South Korea, they use AH1_Reference (in AccTransactionHeaderReference table) and display in E-Reporting Govt # column  For Malaysia and Isreal, they use AH_GovernmentAllocatedID (in AccTransactionHeader table) and display in E-Reporting Govt # column  For AHF_Number, they all use it to record government authorisation and that's displayed in E-Reporting Auth # column which is the 'standard way'    Decision: We have decided to keep the new columns simple. They are only populated if the eReporting status is SUC and one shows whatever is in AHF_Number; the other AIB_GovernmentAllocatedNumber..  For Israel or Malaysia, there are some information in different database fields. If users identify they need those references in these reports, we would add more optional columns to the reports.  Right now I am not aware of anyone wanting those values printed here.  I do know we have a real need to print AHF_Number and AIB_GovernmentAllocatedNumber
feature_description: Reporting references to four Receivables reports.

WKI_Summary: CO2: Schema change to rename 'TotalCO2e' to 'CO2eWTW'
details: JKF 31-Jul-25 17:02 GMT+10:00:   HYPERLINK "https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/Product/Product%20Team%20Workspace/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BD3336CB9-A28D-4F02-9566-25768FE55777%7D&file=WI00925833%20-%20DBD.docx&action=default&mobileredirect=true" WI00925833 - DBD  DNN 01-Aug-25 11:44 GMT+10:00: will also need data transformation    AA5 28-Jul-25 10:35 GMT+10:00:   Just need to be careful while renaming as Total can have different meanings e.g., Total can also mean the total of all the legs or it can also mean WTT + TTW. CO2e values are most likely stored at many levels e.g., job level, routing leg level etc. So need to carefully consider renaming options.     JT5 10-Jul-25 11:53 GMT+10:00:   We should also consider refactoring to use the general methods for emissions (GetEmissionTotals(), SetEmissionTotal()) replacing GetTotalCO2e() and SetTotalCO2e() after this change. I did this in a few places in the previous WI but only around the response importing code - there's probably several more places which use these methods.    JT5 20-Jun-25 15:34 GMT+10:00:   Reason for Change:  In HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/ce316df6-e425-4e1f-9937-57f4ac676973?lang=en-gb" WI00874274 - CO2: Save in db also other greenhouse gases, not required to be shown, we add new columns for each emission type to the DB.  For consistency, we should rename the existing 'JCO_TotalCO2e' column to 'JCO_CO2eWTW', as this is the value that this column represents.  This change likely requires a transformation.    Done Statement:  - JCO_TotalCO2e column has been renamed to JCO_CO2eWTW to match other emission total columns.

WKI_Summary: [ATR] Add Autorating Log for printing Dest. Charges on HBL/HAWB
details: KNT 13-Jan-25 10:31 GMT+11:00:   In UPN, we should also describe that if system cannot find the true destination company >autorating will not perform for that company > autorating log not exist  how system find the true destination company ? Refer to https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=0d75dca2-914f-4abc-b679-1e5124666cb3    Done Statement  When Autorating is run for printing charges billed by Destination as Collect on HBL/HAWB, an information message together with the Autorating Log is displayed.  We do NOT need to save the Log but user can copy the 'text' of the Autorating Log if further investigation/review is needed.  The message is as follows:  ...  Charges intended to be billed by Destination Company<Company Code> have not yet been created at Destination.   Autorating Revenue is executed for the Destination Company <Company Code> with <#> Charges found and printed as Collect Charges. (<#> is the number of Charges found.)  This process will not create Job Header nor charges under the Destination Company.  {Autorating Log}  ...    Reason For change(To explain Why)  To let user know that the job has not yet been created at destination.    What has been done (Technical Prespective)  `AutoRateOverseasJob` in `HouseBillCharges.cs` now displays a messagebox. This is also cached using `Factory.GetCachedValue` as there is some ugly logic in document engine causing multiple `HouseBillCharges` to be created and `AutorateOverseasJob` to be called multiple times.      ===============================================================================================  AZR 16-Sep-24 13:47 GMT+10:00:   Expected Change (as per eConversation): to pop up a window and say:  Charges intended to be billed by Destination Company<Company Code> have not yet been created at Destination.   Autorating Revenue is executed for the Destination Company <Company Code> with <#> Charges found and printed as Collect Charges. (<#> is the number of Charges found.)  This process will not create Job Header nor charges under the Destination Company.    Then the Autorating Log  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  When printing charges using Documents > Departure > Bill of Lading > Bill of Lading. We calculate charges for Destination as Collect for multple 2 HBL's. This results in running the autorating for HBL twice. As a result, a popup would appear twice. We must in some way know if HBL would need to be autorated for destination as collect prior to it running.    SRH 06-Sep-24 16:53 GMT+12:00:     In HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=2c4eda5b-5af9-42df-b341-5bebbd468981&VersionNumber=24.9.6.137&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bY79ybXG5rCzIT40qmhM2cHDxDIbG9HPU" WI00756408 - !CR7 - UPS [ATR] HBL/HAWB prints both Origin and Destination charges, when HBL/HAWB is printed at Origin, even before Destination Office/Company opens the same Shipment, charges to be billed by Destination could be printed as Collect.  However, there is NO information if the Destination Charges could not be found or how charges are loaded/calculated/filtered in the Autorating process.  Per the logic/behaviour that how/when charges to be billed by Destination to be printed as Collect on HBL/HAWB, refer to UPN (NOT HLD) in above WI.    In this WI, we are going to add the following:  When printing HBL/HAWB and when we need to 'Autorate' charges on behalf of Destination Company, following message together with Autorating Log is displayed:  Autorating Revenue is run for the Destination Company <Company Code> with <#> Charges found and printed as Collect Charges.  <#> is the number of Charges found.  E.g.  Autorating Revenue is run for the Destination Company 'DUS' with 2 Charges found and printed as Collect Charges.  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  AZR 09-Sep-24 12:16 GMT+10:00: If we add the logs to Notes, save button will be enabled. We could either add to Notes or show a popup of autorating logs    SVS 13-Sep-24 11:54 GMT+10:00:     We have a nice looking popup window at the end of autorating charges of the destination company with the following message:    Charges intended to be billed by Destination Company<Company Code> have not yet been created at Destination.   Autorating Revenue is run for the Destination Company <Company Code> with <#> Charges found and printed as Collect Charges. (<#> is the number of Charges found.)  This process will not create Job Header nor charges under the Destination Company.    Then the Autorating Log    Charges for the destination company are autorated here:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FDocuments%2FHouseBillCharges.cs&version=GBmaster&line=194&lineEnd=233&lineStartColumn=2&lineEndColumn=3&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    Check how other autorating popups are implemented, it is not a simple form/messagebox show. We don't want these popups in tests which will stop the test from running. There is an interface IAutoRatingGUIInteractor, I believe we should somehow reuse it.
product_candidate: [ATR] Add Autorating Log for printing Dest. Charges on HBL/HAWB

WKI_Summary: VN eInv | Unit, Qty, Price Enhancement
details: From HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/d4efea44-71d1-4a1c-a985-1cdf9ba6e4fa?lang=en-gb" CS02058448 - BOLLOGPAR1 - Issued with display wrong unit on BCN shipment on e-tax invoice.    BACKGROUND:   Registry: Buyers Consol Apportioned Charge Code Groups.   When the charge group is added to the registry, then it will be autorated through the Buyers Consol and apportioned by chargeable amount.   The charge amount can be calculated and apportioned correctly. However, the quantity displayed in the Calculation window reflects the Total quantity of the whole consol, other than the sub shipment only.   This leads the Total quantity transmitted along with VN e-Invoice, resulted in the formula calculation failure: Qty * Unit Price = Amt.     For more details, see the Document HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=374d39ca-7c9b-4eeb-92d7-3a409f828252&StorageDocPK=1576dec0-4214-450a-b63f-b9c05b908b31&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bGXICYWmRActeFEG1pNNEQyBVBPk4JdWV" OZ 10-Sep-25 17:30:  File BCN -Autorate.docx (Specification) attached to the eDocs tab.     PROPOSED SOLUTION:   VN Clients have complained about the qty/unit in the e-Invoice template for a couple times due to different edge cases/scenarios. In order to prevent such complaining occurs in the future, we'd like to add the validation during the mapping, and alter the logic as below:   Use the current mapping logic to calculate the quantity, unit, price and amount field. Ideally, it should follow the formula that Quanity * Price = Amount. If NOT, then:   Hardcode the fields as  Quantity = 1  Unit = Unit (taking Registry of 'Unit Measurement Text Override' into consideration)  Price = Amount    EXAMPLE:   Quanity = 45.66, Price = 260000, Amount = 2610400  45.66 * 260000 <> 2610400  Then:  Quantity = 1  Unit = Unit  Price =2610400  Amount = 2610400
product_candidate: VN eInv | Unit, Qty, Price Enhancement

WKI_Summary: Change commodity bypass registry default to NO
details: Background:  It was decided that CPW commodity screening will no longer be commercialised under the STL model.   At the same time, we have on our roadmap, the intention to develop a 'screening policy' (incl auto-screening) functionality.   Many of our large customers are bypassing the pop-up already  We are about to rollout compliancewise with commodity screening to standalone customs jobs. This will introduce the commodity blocking for a new group of users.     In consideration of the above, we will change the DEFAULT for the registry that was created in: HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/5bedc124-ebf3-4a30-95e1-c1b874a0c945?lang=en-gb" WI00878355 - CPW: Commodity Risk Assessment optional for all customers  The default will be changed to FALSE such that the commodity risk assessment popup is suppressed and the default commodity status is not assessed.    DONE:  The DEFAULT VALUE of Compliance > Commodity Risk Assessment Decision is changed to NO  If the user had overridden the registry to YES prior to upgrade, then the value will remain YES post upgrade
product_candidate: Change commodity bypass registry default to NO

WKI_Summary: VN eInvoicing | Support Sending FPT invoice to Local Debtors Only
details: From HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/d3481e05-d45c-40b5-8431-34c71dfcc8b2?lang=en-gb" CS01911365 - BOLLOGPAR1 - Vietnam eInvoicing FPT System - disable auto send for overseas debtor    Bollore is looking forward to an option to send FPT invoice to Local Debtors only.     Possible Solutions:   Option 1:    Add another option to Registry > Export Multiple Debtor Organization Contact Email.   LOC –  Local Debtors Only – The system will export the email address of single Debtor Organization Contact using existing fallback rules for local debtors only.   With the above option selected, system should NOT export email address if debtor is in foreign country. Thus FPT will not send email to the recipient as no email address found.     Option 2:   Add a new Registry – Mail Tax Invoice to Foreign Debtors   Default: YES   Update Mapping Logic of field “sendfile”: Yes -> 1, No -> 0
product_candidate: VN eInvoicing | Support Sending FPT invoice to Local Debtors Only

WKI_Summary: Windsor framework - SPIMM - category of goods
details: CKG 27-Jan-25 20:32 GMT+00:00:     Tech Design:    Req 1    - Add a new AddInfo to the GB JobComInvoiceLine, set the captions as per the spec.  - Add new CodeDescriptionPairList to hold the possible values  - Add new dropdown field to both the JobComInvoiceLine control (Only for GB to XI imports) and also to the products control, found in Maintain -> Customs -> Products  - Add the validations as per the spec, note Validation 2 is only for the invoice line.    Req 2    - When selecting a product on the invoice line, use CusClassPivot to populate the new SPIMM control on the invoice line from the category on the pivot        D04 30-Dec-24 15:17 GMT+00:00: Specification here : https://wisetechglobal-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/p/david_stephen1/EaqS8x5WES1Hv0BtJloYs4sBrCnvpGmJCwzaOLg_1zLDnw?e=FJvovA    DONE : We have a SPIMM Category field available for GB to NI Customs import declarations and products. The chosen SPIMM category on a product is carried over to the customs declaration when selected.    DJC 17-Dec-24 06:59 GMT+00:00:  Capture the 'category' of goods on an invoice line, to ensure that an H8 controlled declaration, or a full declaration, is the right choice.   Knowing the cateogry of goods is a feature that will be useful to our customers.     David to create a full design.     Features needed.   1. Capture the categorisation of the goods in a new field (AddINfo) on JobComInvoiceLine.  Captions are: "Category",  "SPIMM category", "Category of goods for SPIMM", "Simplified Procedure for Internal Market Movements category of goods".   2. Show the field on the invoice line.  Can go anywhere but make sure the field's position is not shared with another fields with variable visibility.   3. Corresponding new field on CusClassPartPivot and form (Maintain > Customs > Products)   4. Set the invoice line field from the pivot when selecting a product  5. Values allowed for the new fields are: blank, 1, 2. Descriptions are "Standard", "Category 1" and "Category 2" respectively.   6. The default value is blank (standard).   7. No need to add the invoice line field to the line merge key.  The commodity code is in the key and is sufficient.   8. Validate the value of the invoice line and pivot fields: must be in list  9.  Further validate the value on the invoice line field:  if the attached entry instruction is type H8, and the goods are category 1, add blue validation saying "Goods included in Category 1 are excluded from Simplified Process for Internal Market Movements (SPIMM/H8). Full declaration details are required."      https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/simplified-process-for-internal-market-movements-spimm-category-of-goods-guidance/category-of-goods
feature_description: SPIMM - category of goods

WKI_Summary: !CR7 - DHL [CCA][ALR] Allow Freight Spot Rate for Allocation Routes
details: M80 14-Apr-25 09:41 GMT+10:00    Done Statement    Allocation Route under Carrier Contract can be setup to allow 'Spot Rate', which means even if the Carrier Contract has been specified, Charges under 'FRT' charge to be excluded when Autorating Costs.    Reason For change(To explain Why)  This has been done to support the new AllowFreightSpotRates flag on the RatingContractAllocationLine that the Job has.    What has been done (Technical Prespective)  Rating adapter now exposes a new flag for AllowFreightSpotRates which is default false.     Consol and QuoteBooking rating adapters override the logic and retrieve the flag's value off of their related Allocation Line.  With QuotedBookings rating adapter, it will only try getting the value if it is a QB or BWQ.    NonApplicableRateLineRemover now has a new option for this logic called SkipInternationalFreightChargeCodeWithAllowFreightSpotRate,   if the option has the flag as true, it will check if the criteria has AllowFreightSpotRates being true, and also has CarrierContractNumbers.   If these conditions are both true, then it will remove all RateLines that have the ChargeCode set to the same as the ChargeCode in the registry.    Freight Autorater now passes the new SkipInternationalFreightChargeCodeWithAllowFreightSpotRate flag to the NonApplicableRateLineRemover.      CJP 26-Mar-25 13:05 GMT+11:00:   Parent Project: PRJ00051306  HLD WI: WI00866700  Project Wiki: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/Shared/_wiki/wikis/Forwarding%20Work%20Item%20Wiki/16765/PRJ00051306-Allow-Freight-Spot-Rate-for-Allocation-Routes    SVS 25-Mar-25 16:59 GMT+11:00:     Done Statment    Allocation Route under Carrier Contract can be setup to allow 'Spot Rate', which means even if the Carrier Contract has been specified, Charges under 'FRT' charge to be excluded when Autorating Costs. This WI is only about autorating. The rest, including the schema change, will be done by CCA team in:  HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/57da7816-4e0c-40c1-a155-4fc4464ff5f5?lang=en-gb" WI00887670 - [CCA] Allocation Routes now allow Freight Spot Rate for CCA - Schema Change      HKW 31-Mar-25 12:05 GMT+11:00:   Project: HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/Project/65f69237-7bd3-447f-8fd0-24eb5b8c43ab?LicenceCode=EDIAUSSYD&lang=en-gb" Project PRJ00051306  Project NCN: HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/NetworkDiagram/26213f55-b14e-43c7-8861-d604fe759b67?lang=en-gb" +DHL Ocean CCA - Freight Spot Rate for Carrier Contract on Allocation Routes (CR7)  Re-classifying from CCA workItem to Rating workItem

WKI_Summary: GVMS - new declaration types, haulier type, container
details: KH1 21-May-25 16:41 GMT+01:00: the following changes together should cover all six points of the specification, but do please double check    Enterprise.Customs.GB.GVMS: CodeDescriptionPairLists\GVMSCustomsReference.xml  Change description of code DUC (replace CHIEF with CDS - this covers point 1).  Add code MTP Manual Transit Procedure (for point 2).  Add code UKC UK Carrier (for point 3).    Enterprise.Customs.GB.GVMS: CusSupportingInfo\GvmsItemReferencePartitions.cs  - add ManualTransitProcedure (to CustomsReferenceCodes, this should make it available to the first grid)  - add UKCarrier (to EidrReferenceCodes, this should make it available to the third grid)    Enterprise.Customs.GB.GVMS: CodeDescriptionPairLists\GVMSHaulierType.xml (new file, named like this to follow the existing convention)  - populate this list with the values from point 5 below (the list, not the code mapping).    Enterprise.Customs.GB.GVMS: BusinessObject\GvmsAsycudaManifestHeader\AsycudaManifestHeaderLookups.cs  - add a new list for HaulierTypeList, this just needs something like public CodeDescriptionPairList HaulierTypeList => Factory.GetCachedValue<GVMSHaulierType>();    Enterprise.Customs.GB.GVMS: BusinessObject\GvmsAsycudaManifestHeader\AsycudaManifestHeader.cs  - add HaulierType to the schema and add the matching property (similar pattern to the existing properties, see RouteId as an example).  -- set the caption of the HaulierType property to "Haulier Type" using the ResourceStringData attribute; this will affect the UI.  -- set the list of the HaulierType property to HaulierTypeList    Enterprise.Customs.GB.GVMS: BusinessObject\GvmsAsycudaManifestHeader\AsycudaManifestHeaderValidation.cs  - add a method to validate the new property, see how it works for RouteId and EmptyVehicle (with ValidateX and CheckX) - and add something similar for HaulierType. The check method just needs to do ListValidation.MessageErrorIfInvalidCode to add the blue error when invalid, but allow it to be empty, as specified in point 5 below.    Enterprise.Customs.GB.GVMS.GUI: GVMSUserControl  - change the caption of the group box holding the third grid (i.e., EidrReferencesGroupBox), to "Customs References - Other" - change it in CaptionResourceString.Caption (this covers point 4).  - consider renaming the EidrReferences(GroubBox|Grid) controls to match (replace Eidr with Other). This will involve many files but it will be good for future maintenance (less confusion) and the "Rename..." function of VS will probably do most of the work without issue.  - add a new dropdown (copy/paste one of the existing ones and just place it somewhere sensible, the layout doesn't matter here). Give it a sensible name (HaulierTypeDropEdit probably), and bind it to HaulierType.    GVMSManifestControlBag.cs  - add a ControlReference property for the new HaulierTypeDropEdit control.    GVMSManifestLayout.cs  - remove the line that adds CustomsOfficeDropEdit  - in its place add our new HaulierTypeDropEdit    Enterprise.Customs.GB.GVMS: Messaging\GvmsManifestSenderWrapper ; GVMSMessageDataObject ; IGvmsMessageBuilder  - add mtpDeclaration - mtbGoods - sAndSMasterRefNum -- populated in the wrapper from CSI_ReferenceNumber2 from CSI_Code with code ManualTransitProcedure (look at how this works for the property sAndSMasterRefNum in wrapper for the ImportControlSystemEntrySummaryDeclaration code, it will work something like that). A bit awkward because you need to define types for the mtpDeclaration and mtpGoods levels, and create the mtpGoods objects for each reference, but the classes will all be very simple (look through GVMSMessageDataObject file for examples, and see how they are used in the wrapper). This covers point 2.  - add ukcDeclaration - fpoEORI -- similar to above (easier because there's only one object level), but this time populating from CSI_ReferenceNumber for the code UKCarrier. This covers point 3.  - add haulierType -- in the wrapper override for this property, get the code value from the property HaulierType of header and convert it to another string using the mapping defined in the specification for point 5 below.  - override containerReferenceNums in the wrapper (it already exists in GVMSMessageDataObject and IGvmsMessageBuilder so no need to add it there). The wrapper override should return null if there are no non-blank containers (test to make sure this has to correct behaviour), or a List<string> populated with the (non-blank) reference numbers from ACN_ContainerNumber (from header.Containers). This covers point 6.      D04 20-May-25 09:44 GMT+01:00: My additions/comments in orange/bold below    DJC 16-May-25 14:51 GMT+01:00:      I've been a bit slack staying up to date with GVMS.  Here are some changes.       1. Change description of DUC to talk only of CDS not CHIEF  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=f2b7f601-7809-456f-9876-172a2e516991&StorageDocPK=69f1d022-ce01-4f7c-88c4-c15f082c948f&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2be7l%2fmaLC%2fQqhNIfp5ATzk%2bKowgZK0SeX" DJC 16-May-25 14:53:  File 9dc0083ed30d41418f18946987fbc75b.jpg (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.    2. Add mtpDeclaration (code MTP, D04: Description: Manual Transit Procedure) to the first grid.   Write the S&S field (CSI_ReferenceNumber2) to schema mtpDeclaration>mtpGoods    Example:  {    "direction": "UK_INBOUND",    "isUnaccompanied": false,    "vehicleRegNum": "AB19 DEF",    "plannedCrossing": {      "routeId": "63",      "localDateTimeOfDeparture": "2021-08-11T10:58"    },    "mtpDeclaration": {      "mtpGoods": [        {          "sAndSMasterRefNum": "25GB123456"        },        {          "sAndSMasterRefNum": "25GB123457"        }      ]    }  }    3. Add new type UKC to the third grid  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=f2b7f601-7809-456f-9876-172a2e516991&StorageDocPK=6dd36c95-5cea-4858-8e18-60b318ed98bf&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bt2EN4b4fCT2iSkEhDkWGlVWD6gdiDtxB" DJC 16-May-25 14:57:  File 0fbd9822e8ef408c95da88243e5f7522.jpg (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.  Write "EORI/reference" (CSI_ReferenceNumber) to this type ukcDeclaration>fpoEORI:  Example:  {    "direction": "GB_TO_NI",    "isUnaccompanied": false,    "vehicleRegNum": "AB19 DEF",    "trailerRegistrationNums": [      "KF293716",      "GH28372S"    ],    "plannedCrossing": {      "routeId": "2",      "localDateTimeOfDeparture": "2024-04-02T10:58"    },    "ukcDeclaration": {      "fpoEORI": "GB123456789012"    }  }      4. Change the caption of the third grid to "Customs References - Other"    5.  Add a new dropdown field to the form in place where the customs office currently shows.  Delete the customs office field (not needed).   Bind it to a new GenAddOn field  Caption is "Haulier Type".    Default empty.   Validation, must be empty or in list, blue message error if bad data.   List: STD ("Standard"); FPO ("Fast Parcel Operators that are members of the Anti-Smuggling Network"); OTH ("Fast Parcel Operators that are not members of the ASN and are not moving goods with a Memorandum of Understanding"), MIL ("NATO or Ministry of Defence"), RMG ("Royal Mail Group"), ET ("Extra-Territorial Office of Exchange").  If the value is blank, it's OK to delete or not save the GenAddOn.   If not blank, write it to the message in field haulierType.    When writing, map the haulierType codes as follows:   CW1 - message   ---------------------------------------   STD - "STANDARD"   FTP - "FPO_ASN" D04: this should say FPO - "FPO_ASN"   OTH - "FPO_OTHER"   MIL - "NATO_MOD"   RMG - "RMG"   ET - "ETOE"   (Blank) - do not write this node at all if blank.     6.  Start writing the container numbers from the containers tab:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=f2b7f601-7809-456f-9876-172a2e516991&StorageDocPK=53ea7f49-d136-40a5-8044-ef19423e299c&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bfCymnszGPqI6KGraq9PxVdyUOaN2qJFy" DJC 16-May-25 15:12:  File 15c53dbe80b34f04a76130d4123f932b.jpg (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.  Schema element:  containerReferenceNums  Don't write this node if there are no non-blank containers D04: In other words - Do not write this node if all the containers are blank    7.  Change GVMIT=7 from SAD to MTP on the reference data portal (DJC to do that, https://refdbrepoupdate.wisecloud.zone/Portal/RefCusCodeListUserViewDetailsForm/3cbeeef1-ce67-40bf-9eaf-672a0b7560b0)        Reference:   API - https://developer.service.hmrc.gov.uk/api-documentation/docs/api/service/goods-movement-system-haulier-api/1.0/oas/page#operation/Create%20Goods%20Movement%20Record  New schemas - https://developer.service.hmrc.gov.uk/api-documentation/docs/api/download/goods-movement-system-haulier-api/1.0/gvms-schemas.zip  Desired effect - we can send the new data to GVMS

WKI_Summary: [BIL] Create Staff Security for STL Billing
details: Follow up work item: HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/4214c4b3-408d-44c4-9473-cccc315e0c7f?lang=en-gb" WI00812279 - [BIL] Admin function on Billing STL module to reset STL milestone  Do the update note here.    Upon further investigation, there is no security right set for STL Billing.   In this work item, we will add one. This can only be checked-in after clear coordination with the Finance Team.    The staff security right staff permission cannot be checked in together with the code.  This needs to be requested from the relevant stakeholders.    Done Statement  IF i go to Staff and Resources > Staff > Security Rights > Manage > Receivables >   THEN  i will see STL Billing node    IF I go to STL Billing node  THEN  I can see Admin functions node     IF Admin functions node permission is granted to the staff  THEN  the Admin functions in STL Billing is enabled  ELSE  this is greyed out      AX 07-Apr-25 14:56 GMT+08:00:   1.add these in the EDISecurityCheckpoints  public void AddSTLBillAdminCheckpoints(IZSecurity securityInstance)  {   var securityDefinitions = ((SecurityCore)securityInstance);   securityDefinitions.AddClientSpecificSecurityCheckpoint(    Constants.STLBillingReferenceName, (NoResString)Constants.STLBillingDisplayName, securityDefinitions.Receivables);   securityDefinitions.AddClientSpecificSecurityCheckpoint(    Constants.STLBillingAdminFunctionReferenceName, (NoResString)Constants.STLBillingAdminFunctionDisplayName, securityDefinitions.FindCheckPoint(new CheckpointLookupKey(Constants.STLBillingReferenceName)));  }    public static SecurityCheckpoint STLBilling  {   get { return Env.Security.FindCheckPoint(new CheckpointLookupKey(Constants.STLBillingReferenceName)); }  }    public static SecurityCheckpoint STLBillingAdminFunction  {   get { return Env.Security.FindCheckPoint(new CheckpointLookupKey(Constants.STLBillingAdminFunctionReferenceName)); }  }    2.add the SecurityCheckpoint for StlBillingModule, change at StlBillingModule  public override SecurityCheckpoint SecurityCheckpoint  {   get { return EDISecurityCheckpoints.STLBilling; }  }    3. add check logic at StlBillingForm  void SetUpAdminMenuItem()  {   var adminFunctionAllowed = EDISecurityCheckpoints.STLBillingAdminFunction.IsAllowed;   foreach (var item in adminMenuItem.MenuItems)   {    if (item is MenuItem menuItem)    {     menuItem.Enabled = adminFunctionAllowed;    }   }  }
product_candidate: [BIL] Create Staff Security for STL Billing

WKI_Summary: Turn off Audit Events for CusTempStorage
details: JPG 21-Jul-25 12:11 GMT+10:00: The purpose of this WI is to turn off Audit Event logging (by default) for the main Exit Control tables. See the following links for an overview of what we want to achieve:    https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/ArchiveManager/EUUiOSoELGRNsSGhAzlT16kBowtezPrVVdNV3H4dxM3N9g?e=FWtKxN    Guide: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/13383/Turning-off-Audit-Events  Sample PR: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/291327    REQ001: Remove the AutoLoggingState override from the following classes (that is, turn off auto logging):    Enterprise.Customs.DE.Business.CusTempStorage.CusTempStorageJobHeader  Enterprise.Customs.ES.Business.CusTempStorage.CusTempStorageJobHeader  Enterprise.Customs.FR.Business.CusTempStorage.CusTempStorageJobHeader  Enterprise.Customs.PL.Business.CusTempStorage.CusTempStorageJobHeader    ### M82 23-Oct-25 18:45 GMT+11:00: Note, this should instead say to set property `AutoLoggingState => AutologState.AutoLoggedToQueueOnly`. Otherwise existing WF triggers based on ADD/EDT will no longer work.    REQ002: Add the following tables to AutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValue (https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/master/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Workflow/Workflow.Business/AuditStmALog/AutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValues.cs)    CusTempStorageJobHeader    This enable 2 things:  When the registry is on for a particular table, then StmALog events will be created as if IsAutoLogged were turned on.  When the registry if off, then NonPersistedStmALog events will be create. These will allow workflow to work on EDT/ADD events, but it will not actually persist the events in StmALog (which is the real goal here).  LY 29-Sep-25 11:09 GMT+01:00: REQ002 removed based on the discussion in https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/pull/4548#discussion_r2252847083    --    The CusTempStorage tables should already be in the Audit DB and visible on the respective forms:  HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/3b0975f3-b022-490d-8ec1-d276a67e8c4d?lang=en-gb" WI00939842 - Enable Audit Data tab for CusTempStorage    LY 23-Jul-25 10:48 GMT+01:00: REQ001 AutoLoggingState.AutoLoggedToQueueOnly allows the NonPersistedStmALog to be created when the configuration in REQ002 is off.  Similar WI HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/8d236099-f217-43fd-80be-530a74d708a8?lang=en-gb" WI00888614 - Turn off Audit Events for Permit tables
product_candidate: Turn off Audit Events for CusTempStorage

WKI_Summary: eTail V2 expand HVLV/FHL registry setting
details: Background:    There is a requiment to either send FHL messages at the HVM shipment or HVLV Cosnignment level or both.    Currently,  when enabling the existing registry setting  will send 1 FHL for each HVM shipment  will not send FHL for HVL shipment  will send 1 FHL for each consignments under HVL shipment    when the registry is disabled  will send 1 FHL for each HVM shipment  will send 1 FHL for each HVL shipment only if there is no HVM shipment, otherwise HVL shipment is excluded  will not send FHL for consignments    Check below WIs for current FHL behavior:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=3b7ab285-67e5-48dc-b123-5f5f66141581&VersionNumber=25.6.25.26&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bbAywlD3diIZpCGa4OdNPsiHjSi6T6rBg" WI00604883 - eTail V2.DHL FHL Messaging for HVM Shipment  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=3ac5e7a5-51ba-45fe-acaa-d3472c67a015&VersionNumber=25.6.25.26&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2ba3qI%2bmBOAfGxw3k253tKIT%2bhf20chpw6" WI00712037 - eTail V2 HVLV FHL messages sent for HVL shipments when registry is disabled     In this WI i propose we expand on the existing registry setting to allow which ever options fits the customers needs.     New Registry with 3 options (note this allows multi choice):  when HVM is ticked: send 1 FHL for HVM shipment  when HVL is ticked: send 1 FHL for HVL shipment  when HVC is ticked: send 1 FHL for consignment    Done:    The Enable HVLV FHL Messaging registry is now changed to have 3 check boxes.  HVM, HVL, and HVC.    Tick the check boxes will send FHL message for the corresponding level.  3 check boxes are not exclusive and can be ticked together.    Existing registry is transformed to the new registry setting.  Enabled existing registry is transformed to HVM + HVC  Disabled existing registry is transformed to HVM+HVL
product_candidate: eTail V2 expand HVLV/FHL registry setting

WKI_Summary: [MYA.SSO] New audit data subscriber service task for user account report
details: UAR service task uses high water mark to filter GlbStaff record with GS_SystemLastEditTimeUTC changes after last service task run. In the case when GS_LastActivityDate is updated which tiggers GS_SystemLastEditTimeUTC to update, this approach generates unnecessary user account reports. Also in the user account report it only include several fields. Changes in other fields of GlbStaff records result in unnecessary user account reports.    To solve this problem a better approach is to use audit data. With audit data there is exisitng subscriber framework to support service task to process changes logged in audit database.    https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/8884/Audit-Data-Subscriber-Framework      Proposed changes:  - Add new subscriber service task to handle updates in GlbStaff fields that are incluced in user account report, generate and send user account report for staff records required data sync with ediprod  - Update UAR service task to only handle full staff list request      AX 30-Jul-25 11:10 GMT+08:00:   1. Change at IUserAccountReportSender, make SendReport add one paramater  UserAccountReport SendReport(DateTime lastRunTime, bool runFullStaffList = false);    2. Change at UserAccountReportingServiceTask, when invoke SendReport, make runFullStaffList = true  var userAccountReport = sender.SendReport(lastRunTime, true);    3. adjust the service task Schedule, maybe 1 day ?    4. add a new serviceTask name "UserAccountSubscriberServiceTask" at AuditDataServices.sln    5. Then back to EDI, create a Subscriber, can refer to the implementation of this class "Enterprise.Client.EDI.EServices.LicenceSync.AuditSubscribers.LicenceDatabaseSubscriber"
product_candidate: [MYA.SSO] New audit data subscriber service task for user account report

WKI_Summary: DMN: To identify the Document Origin and add to Event References
details: JBK 04-Feb-25 08:37 GMT+11:00:   There is an possibility of expanding the current functionality:  Automatically identify and update the document source by the system, eliminating the need for manual updates. No override option is provided.  Automatically identify and update the document source by the system, with an option to override it manually if needed.  Challenges:  If the system updates the document source, default Document Source Codes must be defined. However, creating these codes could pose a challenge, as they may conflict with existing Document Source Codes set by customers in their system.      Alternate Options:  Adding the System Document Source captured by the system automatically to the DDI event Reference column. WKI_Summary: [WIN] Feature control for Winzor auth options
details: As we discussed in today's meeting, we need to implement the new Feature Control functionality documented here:    https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=8e738ff6-c3c7-4d55-bd52-a201395f7db0  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/15969/Implementing-Feature-Control-in-Code    We've been warned by some people that the documentation may create confusion and so it'll be best to speak directly with PET who built it, or other people (like DJ) who have implemented it successfully.    This WI will work hand-in-hand with what was done in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=94722b4b-cd20-434b-aacd-294d260c2527&VersionNumber=25.6.30.1&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bIiZLA8EmDuFNUo1dBXhwVVwUqQafNbh%2b" WI00915986 - Adapt existing Winzor OIDC registry setting for direct connections with Entra   Use the feature control logic to show or hide values in the auth options drop down list in the new OIDC registry settings for Winzor. Jeff checking on the feasability of this with PET.  Ideally we would want some atomic level of detail per customer using the license database to show or hide values as they'be been configured for those specific customers.  For example, we might want UPS to see the WiseTech Federation item only for now and the WiseTech IdP later, while most of the smaller customers being lined up for using the WTG IdP may only see the WTG IdP as an option.  In a similar way, we might elect to show the Entra ID Direct Connection (DC) to other customers, or any such comination that makes sense for a.) the specific phase of roll-out, b.) what the customers can actually use (IdP, federation or DC), and c.) timing requirements of the roll-out, where we might want to enable Winzor for a big customer which cannot use the WTG IdP yet.  Having this functionality gives WTG all the control, but also gives the customer some level of control to make the appropriate selection based on discussions with their KAMs, or the phase or timing of a roll-out.      JWA 02-Jul-25 17:58 GMT+08:00:   Based on my investigation, we can set the list in the feature control module, and load the data and deserialize from the CW side and bind it to the dropdown list control.    Some demo code:    1. Add a new feature control code in https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/blob/master/CargoWise.Definitions/src/Definitions/Licensing/LicenceFeatureCodeList.cs  public const string OIDCConfigList = "OIDCList"    2. In CW side, add a property in OIDCConfig class and bind it to the dropdownlist    public CodeDescriptionList OIDCOptions  {   get   {    var featuredData = ObjectFactory.Get<IFeatureControlManager>().GetFeatureData(OIDCConfigList);    var options = featureData.TryDeserializeParameterAsJson<List<CodeDescription>>();    return options;   }  }    Then we can add an item in Feature control module, use the code and config a json for the list.    A.G 03-Jul-25 08:10 GMT+10:00:   the above might work but we were advised against using json due to it being brittle and error-prone.  The general idea is to a very basic setup.     3 separate features (one per dropdownitem) here  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/blob/master/CargoWise.Definitions/src/Definitions/Licensing/LicenceFeatureCodeList.cs  3 ifs in some list provider in registry   that's it.  let's go this simple way.      JWA 04-Jul-25 09:18 GMT+08:00:   After discussion, we finally decide to use 3 seprate codes.  1. add 3 codes in  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/blob/master/CargoWise.Definitions/src/Definitions/Licensing/LicenceFeatureCodeList.cs   public const string OIDCB2CFederation = "B2CFED"   public const string OIDCWTGIdP = "WTGIDP";   public const string OIDCEntraID = "ENTRAID"    2. in CW side, add a property in OIDCConfig class and bind it to the dropdownlist      public CodeDescriptionPairList OIDCOptions    {     get     {      if (oidcOptions == null)      {       oidcOptions = new CodeDescriptionPairList();         if (ObjectFactory.Get<IFeatureControlManager>().GetFeatureData(OIDCWTGIdP) != null)       {        oidcOptions.AddPair(LoginOptionsList.Codes.WTGIdP, LoginOptionsList.Descriptions.WTGIdP);       }         if (ObjectFactory.Get<IFeatureControlManager>().GetFeatureData(OIDCB2CFederation) != null)       {        oidcOptions.AddPair(LoginOptionsList.Codes.B2CFederation, LoginOptionsList.Descriptions.B2CFederation);       }         if (ObjectFactory.Get<IFeatureControlManager>().GetFeatureData(OIDCEntraID) != null)       {        oidcOptions.AddPair(LoginOptionsList.Codes.EntraID, LoginOptionsList.Descriptions.EntraID);       }      }      return oidcOptions;     }    }    CodeDescriptionPairList oidcOptions;      JSF 06-Jul-25 10:44 GMT+02:00: Regarding this point for Option 1: "Cons: Harder to manage down the track as there's no way to aggregate separate features as far as I understand.", can we not do something similar to what we did for seeing if a customer has been enabled for OIDC using the daily report that the PET team built? So basically, when that process runs each day, it reports back to ediProd and then store this data somewhere so that we can check which customers are using which option at any time?
product_candidate: [WIN] Feature control for Winzor auth options

WKI_Summary: PP: Ability to change user assigned on cycle count Tasks with a Start Time
details: DBE 20-Nov-24 06:38 GMT+11:00:   For functional reviewer, please Test:  - Unstarted Cycle count tasks can updated in Glow as they can in Alpha  - Users without the Cycle Count manager role receive an error when trying to update started cycle counts  - Started cycle counts assigned to an active user and started less than a day ago display an error.  - Started cycle counts assigned to an active user and started more than a day ago can be updated.  - Started cycle counts assigned to an INactive user can updated no matter when they started.  - When selecting multiple cycle counts to update. The user should be asked to enter the new values only once. Then all selected cycle counts will be updated to the same value.    DBE 12-Nov-24 10:44 GMT+11:00:   After conversations with Yuvraj and Christ I am updating the design to:  pop 1 dialog is any of the selected CCs are started and can be validly updated.   if only started CCs are selected but the user elects not update no messages should be shown.    DBE 04-Nov-24 15:50 GMT+11:00:   New design is update "PWH - WCC - CCL - Update Multiple Cycle Count Locations" to:  If the assigned user is active and the start time is less than 8 hours  1 day ago => show current can't edit error. DBE: AddHours is not implemented in FormFlows yet. It is possible see https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/_git/Glow/commit/0f5f795a8ede6bc29b08c09d0d1e831b77a3f945?refName=refs%2Fheads%2Fmaster&_a=compare but the amount of changes should be separated into another Glow team involved WI.  If the assigned user is not active or the start time is greater than 8 hours 1 day ago => show confirmation message "cc hasnt been actioned for a while or the user is inactive" Click yes to clear start time and move to edit form.    DBE 25-Oct-24 13:24 GMT+11:00:   From investigation StartTime is already cleared when the user backs out of the cycle count so for the new design.  Add a new "Clear Start Time" action for admin users. This action removes the start time but only when (1) Count is not complete; (2) Start time is a day old or the user is in-active.    BRS 23-Oct-24 09:48 GMT+11:00:   As covered in the notes below from Maciej, ensure that any approach for suspending a Cycle Count task on RF will also clear the StartTime. It is already restarted on resumption, so doing this will allow the admin to edit the task.    Confirm that doing this does allow the admin to edit the task's assigned using the existing Update menu item.    CKR 15-Oct-24 14:51 GMT+11:00:     Current Functionality: If a cycle count is started - has an 'In Progress' status, then it has to be completed by that user.     Desired Functionality:  Provide the ability to change the user, rather than the workaround on setting as complete (by same user) and then Admin creating a recount task.    Planning Poker Notes:    Painpoint: count has been started but not completed. User left and now task is stuck    17/9/24: How can I remove assigned/started cycle counts for employees that are not with us/ not working inventory anymore.  I try to delete the task but get an error that it has started, even if it has been started how can i cancel this? If an operator leaves how do i reassign or remove the task?  I have some assigned to the warehouse manager i need to remove.    17/9/24: SF - can lose connection,shift change and operator id/password not known, operator has left the organisation    10/10/24: this is an edge case where the user who started cannot complete. workaround = user who started the cycle count can always 'end cycle count' which will generate a recount which can be allocated to another user    Possible solution is to have superuser ability to cancel task,  if assigned and user has started the task, BUT the user is not on the task in that specific time. Key to know if someone is currently working on the count task    15/10/24: MMC suggested to clear the start time on suspension, so the task is no longer in progress and can be assigned to another user (or cancelled if needed)
product_candidate: Ability to change user assigned on cycle count Tasks with a Start Time

WKI_Summary: Allow Operational Records to be deactivated with Special JRJ & Reversed WIP/ACR
details: BACKGROUND:  With Disbursement License Fee implemented, it happens that user accidently enters a shipment and need cancel it. We will provide an option for the user to mark this kind of jobs as INACTIVE (as long as there's JRJ posted only and no open WIP/ACR).   Besides, once the jobs have been marked as INACTIVE, we should allow the operational records, e.g. Shipment to be deactivated.     CURRENT BEHAVIOR:   See attachment. In Standard CW1, it appears Shipment cannot be deactivated even though all related Jobs have been marked as Inactive.     DONE OF STATEMENTS:   Allow all operational records(e.g. Shipment, WareHouse Jobs, etc.) to be deactivsted as long as the related accounting jobs have been marked as Inactive.     OZ 18-Nov-24 17:26 GMT+08:00:  After investigating further, it would impact any existing logic if we allow operational records to be deactivated based on the active/inactive status of related jobs. For example, if the system deactivates shipment via Service Task/Trigger Action, it will check related jobs and see if it could be deactivated. If not, then just deactivate the Shipment itself but leave the job as active.   If we update the logic as described above, then the shipment could NOT be deactivated in this scenario. This will violate any user behavior and cause customer unsatisfaction.     After discussion, we have made the following conclusion:   Update the logic of Operational Record Deactivation and it relies on the Registry > Job Deactivation Configuration.   When DEF is selected, then everything remains the same.   When NPL is selected, then any Operational Record with the Special JRJ & reversed WIP/ACR is now allowed to deactivate.   Note, we just exclude/bypass any Jobs with Special JRJ & reversed WIP/ACR when checking the related Jobs while remain the other logic as the same.  Therefore, when deactivating the Shipment via Service Task/Trigger Action, the shipment itself could still be deactivated while keeping the related job open(active) if the job has anything else other than Special JRJ & reversed WIP/ACR.
product_candidate: Allow Operational Records to be deactivated with Special JRJ & Reversed WIP/ACR

WKI_Summary: Validate DG weight/volume when DG has gross weight limit type (IATA)
details: AQD 09-Jan-25 14:27 GMT+11:00:    Done Statement: When a UN DG Substance from any standard has a 'Weight Limit Type' of 'Gross Weight Limit', new warnings are written showing validation type required.    Context:  Investigation undertaken. All gross weight validation types for pack max qty types identified under IATA 2025 DG table. Attached in edocs.  Specific warnings written to address the needs of all possible package types.  Data types and new warnings attached. WKI_Summary: Solution for Confirmation creation around Actual Pickup & Actual Delivery dates
details: QJ 30-Apr-25 15:05 GMT+08:00:   Apply the The Freight > Shipment > Automatically Create Confirmations for Loose Cargo registry item to Actual Pickup/Delivery field, which should be located in  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FShared%2FFreight.Business%2FJobDocsAndCartage%2FJobDocsAndCartage.cs&version=GBmaster&line=706&lineEnd=779&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=4&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  ```  public override ZDateTime JP_PickupCartageCompleted  {   // ...   if (shipment != null)   {    ConfirmTimesSyncHelper.SetConfirmTimes(shipment, ConfirmTimesSyncHelper.ConfirmType.Pickup, ConfirmTimesSyncHelper.ConfirmDateType.Actual, originalValue, value, true);    ConfirmTimesSyncHelper.SetConfirmTimes(shipment, ConfirmTimesSyncHelper.ConfirmType.Pickup, ConfirmTimesSyncHelper.ConfirmDateType.Actual, originalValue, value, shipment.AutoCreateLooseConfirmations);   }   // ...  }  public override ZDateTime JP_DeliveryCartageCompleted  {   // ...   if (shipment != null)   {    ConfirmTimesSyncHelper.SetConfirmTimes(shipment, ConfirmTimesSyncHelper.ConfirmType.Delivery, ConfirmTimesSyncHelper.ConfirmDateType.Actual, originalValue, value, true);    ConfirmTimesSyncHelper.SetConfirmTimes(shipment, ConfirmTimesSyncHelper.ConfirmType.Delivery, ConfirmTimesSyncHelper.ConfirmDateType.Actual, originalValue, value, shipment.AutoCreateLooseConfirmations);   }   // ...  }  ```  Almost everything has been done in Scott's previous abandoned PR: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/289156?_a=files  And you can refer to HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=41230e99-e559-4521-a64b-cfd12ed23f4b&VersionNumber=24.11.21.101&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b0meWR808gioSskXuFgwSfxRC2xMwrC9w" WI00825751 - Actual pickup information is populating in Pickup confi for more context    YD 16-Apr-25 16:35 GMT+10:00: The Freight > Shipment > Automatically Create Confirmations for Loose Cargo registry item currently only applies to the Estimated Pickup/Delivery field when set to "No" (i.e. confirmations will not be automatically created when the estimate is entered, and a popup is shown prompting the user to create one). However, this does not apply to Actuals and the confirmations are created automatically when actual dates are entered.   Done: This WI is to enhance the current registry so that this feature is extended to Actuals too (i.e. if the registry is set to "No", do not create confirmations automatically but prompt the user to create them instead).   Registry setting for automatic creation of confirmations for Loose Cargo - https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=e043beee-ec51-470c-93f4-b75965c37d8f    ASL 21-Nov-24 14:56 GMT+11:00: See the root of the issue outlined in this incident and subsequent investigation work item:   Incident (see eDocs for escalation notes/reproduction steps) HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=db4a907f-08ce-4a27-a47a-ebee97ab844f&VersionNumber=24.11.21.101&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bmXd69nnIhepSjxJ0I2rkukj9WMUgvx5q" CS01747605 - QBELOGHAM - Actual pickup information is populating in Pickup confirmation tab  Work Item (refer to Work Item notes on the investigation) HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=41230e99-e559-4521-a64b-cfd12ed23f4b&VersionNumber=24.11.21.101&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b0meWR808gioSskXuFgwSfxRC2xMwrC9w" WI00825751 - Actual pickup information is populating in Pickup confi    We could resolve this by allowing the customers to choose if they wish to create a Confirmation upon entering the Actual Pickup or Delivery date (if one didnt already exist) and thus accept the consequences of either a. having a confirmation or b. the repercussions of not having a confirmation    Some things we should be doing in this work item;  1. Investigating why the Actual Pickup (PCF) and Actual Delivery (DCF) dates need to have a Confirmation  2. What the negative consequences would be if we stopped creating a confirmation for this.   3. How we can prevent the error shown in these escalation notes from happening in future: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=7b1531ee-94d0-435c-a650-eeaf92b0e5ab&StorageDocPK=2d602d9d-6a99-4f1b-a21d-7de25f41a133&Hash=%2bHZhgwTjp9GmtQKoHgDflIs0aTW4Wao3l&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" ASL 21-Nov-24 15:00:  File Reproduction Steps.docx (Escalation Document)

Add a registry item, branch scoped, bool, default false, name "Send CDS 3/17", Description "For supported message types, send the declarant's name and address (3/17) in addition to always sending the declarant ID (3/18)".     2.   C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\GB\Core\CDS\Messaging\MessageBuilders\MessageBuilder.cs  For CDS imports and exports, except for specific message types, the logic is now:     If the source declarant is present (not null)    if the declarant has an ID     Then write the ID     If registry is set      Also write name/address    else     Write only name/address           3. Upload Specific Document Types" to "Upload Specific Document Types"  - Move "Level Specific Document" from child of DocManager to child of "eDocs Tab"  - Move "eDocs Cut Specific Document Types" from child of DocManager to child of "eDocs Tab", rename from "eDocs Cut Specific Document Types" to "Cut Permanently Specific Document Types"  - DMN: Security rights for updating dates in Document Tracking    Write post offline transformations to update all related records in GlbSecurity for GlbGroup and GlbStaff  There is the abstract class MoveSecurityRightsBetweenParents that can help for the moving security rights       TN2 01-May-25 15:12 GMT+10:00:   The transformation is to make sure the security rights are the same before and after moving security from 1 parent to another one, as the security rights are inherited from its parent or parent of parent  For example:   A (all denied as root) -> A1 (all allowed) -> A2 (inherited allowed from A1)  B (all denied as root)  Now, we want to move A2 to B, we need the transformation to set A2 under B should be allowed      Another example:  A (all denied as root) -> A1 (all allowed) -> A2 (specified denied for branch AAA)  B (all denied as root) -> B1 (all denied)  When moving A2 to child of B1, we still need to make sure it is denied for branch AAA  In this case, the transformation might not do anything as the A2 denied has record in GlbSecurity     TN2 05-May-25 16:31 GMT+10:00:   Please note this case as the final security rights are denied: HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/NewWorkItem/a6d3cfb3-619e-4e13-901d-fd16e2fac35b?lang=en-gb" WI00064793 - WKI_Summary: CPW: ComplianceWise enabled by default on Forwarding modules
details: GMO 27-Sep-24 21:08 GMT+10:00:     Problem  ComplianceWise needs to be the default compliance system for CargoWise One. However, because ComplianceWise covers much more than Denied Party Screening for jobs, due to the short notice we need to be able to give customers the ability to opt out of compliancewise and continue to utilise Denied Party Screening for jobs to give themselves more time to prepare.     Solution   The registry setting Freight > Compliance > Enable ComplianceWise is ‘ticked’ by default. This will enable ComplianceWise by default.   We can provide customers with the option to opt out before taking the upgrade. On upgrade, the system will not change the registry if the default is overridden on an instance.   Once the upgrade has been taken and CPW is enabled, we need to decide what to do.    DONE Statements    CW1 enhancement  ComplianceWise is enabled as the default compliance system for CargoWise Forwarding modules.   Customers are able to opt out of ComplianceWise after taking the CW1 version with this change. The registry Freight > Compliance > Enable ComplianceWise can be overriden by a customer. Currently, customers cannot disable ComplianceWise on a module once it has been enabled.  Customers are able to opt out of ComplianceWise before taking upgrade so their CargoWise One system never switches over.    Update note  Customers are given sufficient notice about this product change as its released through the CW1 ring release process. Target is 2nd October DPR that is promoted to 13 Nov GP1.  We have content that explains the important of ComplianceWise and why customers should use it over the DPS for Jobs system.  We have content that explains what a customer needs to do to transition back to the DPS for Jobs system  We ensure the transition to CPW guide covers all steps customers should take before enabling ComplianceWise for Freight   Currently does not cover security rights.   Include What happens when a restricted action is triggered by ComplianceWise statuses are not calculated yet (it will block the action)   The ComplianceWise master update note has also been revised to explain ComplianceWise is enabled by default on Forwarding modules.    Customer communication  We have notified key customers of this change via email  October customer newsletter, announce the change  Direct via Key Account Managers (optional?)  We have updated support content for GPS
product_candidate: ComplianceWise enabled by default on Forwarding modules

WKI_Summary: Universal Transaction Batch (XUB) - Defaulting Branch and Department
details: JMN 18-Feb-25 09:27 GMT+11:00: When importing Universal Transaction Batch in eAdaptor, the defaulting branch and department being used is linked to the user ~AD (Automated Data Import). The branch and department that is specified in the XML is ignored. This is not consistent with other XML types and it is causing problem for Companies that does not have Department = BRN in use since ~AD user's default department is BRN.     In this workitem we should fix the import logic and use the specified Branch and Department if they are available in the XML. If they are not available then we can use existing logic.    Related:  HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/93570147-d73f-406c-b940-380d7bb40589?lang=en-gb" CS01832354 - JOHSCOBWI - xml for AP PAY transactions failing, part 3
feature_description: Defaulting Branch and Department

WKI_Summary: [DOS] Improve troubleshooting of DOS
details: Context    We need to improve troubleshooting capabilities of the DOS service task. Existing logs are not always enough to track down quickly what's going on.  Also, we need to add further safeguards for jobs getting stuck since every signing of the document costs $$$ and an eternal loop can end up costing a lot.    Objective    1) add debug logs. We will be able to enable and see what happens. (They can be enabled/disabled in registry temporarily, debug logs are not shown by default) - [JSF 22-Nov-24 08:55 GMT+02:00: if we have to enable them, in the event of a problem, does the customer need to restart DOS for the change to take affect? Also, where will the logs be accessible from?]  2) look for any exceptions and fail jobs instead  3) add a session monitor dictionary. We will add an item after signing hash for this item. If the same item is signed again in the same session, we fail this job.  4) decrease min run time      Tech Design  1. add debug logs in various places. Since it is set in registry, DOS will need to restart. The logs will be available in the normal logs place in the service task.  2. service task is single instance, so we don't need to worry about concurrency or multiple threads. Add a dictionary with a job PK as a key and new object containing hash and a counter. If there's nothing in the dictionary, add an item. If there's something in the dictionary, use a generated hash. If counter is >10 (exact number to be determined) then fail job. We need to try more than once because a job may retry, then the job may retry without a batch etc. If a job is failed this way, send an issue report to investigate.  3. set min run time to 5 min  4. investigate additional scenarios where it can get stuck if any   4.1 possibly fail a batch when success jobs > total jobs in the loop, meaning something got stuck, send an issue.    NCC 26-Nov-24 16:27 GMT+11:00:   Main comments:  - Clarify what should be stored in the dictionary and how it should be used.  - Consider improving test cases by using Moq and verify that we call Sign only once for a document.  - For exceptions, we should not catch all of them. https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/5400/Service-task-error-handling  - See if it is possible to check at the end if the job has either been removed from the DOS queue, or the Retry counter has been increased, to avoid always processing the same item. If not directly possible in the main code, this could be done at least in the unit tests.      Tech Design  1. add debug logs in various places. Since it is set in registry, DOS will need to restart. The logs will be available in the normal logs place in the service task. Check if any info logs need to be added too.  2. service task is single instance, so we don't need to worry about concurrency or multiple threads. Add a list of job PKs. Add to the list after externally signing. If the same is getting signed again, fail this job.  3. set min run time to 5 min  4. investigate additional scenarios where it can get stuck if any   4.1 possibly fail a batch when success jobs > total jobs in the loop, meaning something got stuck, send an issue.  5. See if it is possible to check at the end if the job has either been removed from the DOS queue, or the Retry counter has been increased, to avoid always processing the same item      JZ3 05-Nov-25 15:25 GMT+11:00: DOS schedule frequence update note to be done in HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/b029ab03-6d13-4cbd-8776-0b7b6de043ec?lang=en-gb" WI00986966 - [DOS] Create update note for DOS frequency reduction

WKI_Summary: JP SCS - Add inspection type ETD
details: Regulation: MLIT (Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism) https://www.mlit.go.jp/koku/content/001469616.pdf  3. Aviation Security Measures for Air Cargo  To prevent acts of harm such as aircraft bombings, it is necessary for parties involved in the transportation of air cargo (excluding checked baggage, hereafter referred to as "air cargo") to collaborate and implement necessary measures to ensure that no explosives are present in the cargo. This includes air transport operators, those transporting cargo to airports, and consignors. Therefore, for air cargo, one of the following entities must conduct the necessary aviation security measures, such as inspecting the cargo to ensure that it does not contain explosives and taking measures to prevent the insertion of explosives from the time of cargo receipt until it is loaded onto the aircraft. These entities include:  Air transport operators, etc.  Specified air cargo transport operators, etc.  Consignors who have been confirmed to have taken necessary measures regarding the handling of air cargo by air transport operators or specified air cargo transport operators, etc.  For the inspection of air cargo, X-ray inspection devices, explosive detection devices using vapor or trace detection (ETD), or other equipment that meets necessary requirements and standards must be used, or an open inspection must be conducted to check for the presence of explosives.    SDF 08-Oct-24 10:19 GMT+08:00:   Done Statement:  New Inspection Type ETD (Explosives trace detection equipment - particles or vapour) is added to Japan  For the Japanese Default List of Inspection Types, make sure that the code ETD is added to the List, regardless of whether the“Override Default” option is checked.
