WKI_Summary: AP Amend with Credit Note copy Transaction Header Branch and Department
details: KBV 31-Oct-24 09:18 GMT+11:00: This work item is for any team to pick up as soon as possible, please.      Background: In PRJ00033073 we added a new function Amend with Credit Note for AP Invoices tab in job billing.     During investigation of intercompany related incident CS01443898, we identified the current AP Amend with Credit Note function does not copy Transaction Header Branch and Department from the original invoice. This behaviour is different from AR Amend with Credit Note function (AR Amending Credit Note copies Trx Header Branch and Department from the original invoice).  This work item is to align the AP Amend with Credit Note with AR Amend with Credit Note function from job billing.  The Standard AP Amending behaviour logic is applied to Intercompany Credit Note therefore this is the prerequisite to HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=a3eae239-1a7d-46dd-bdbb-94d675afbd8f&VersionNumber=24.12.12.84&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bW2NBkH0vLvJwflvwhbn7PYa1HY6xB7HM" WI00738314 - Interco Invoice Reversal CRD doesn't have same Trx Header Branch as Parent    Done statement:     When using 'Amend with Credit Note' function for Payables Transactions, the Transaction Header Branch and Department on the original AP invoice are copied to the AP Amending Credit Note.  When user create an AP credit note from Payables Transactions module and manually select an Original Transaction Reference, the Transaction Header Branch and Department on the original AP invoice are copied to the AP Amending Credit Note.    Related UPN and References:   Understanding Job Header and Transaction Branches/Departments on Accounting Transactions https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=02085dca-06c0-4c20-9e9e-5b1287028254    AP Invoice Amendments now copy details from the Original Invoice https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=6aedbb34-2816-4147-bbc5-7b89fc5f7069  New function ‘Amend with Credit Note’ for AP Invoices under Job Billing https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=9b56db66-b528-44df-bf7d-e4f523b4f9c8  AR and AP Credit Notes – Original Reference, Original Invoice Number and Date https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=f785981f-85d9-403e-b4db-880849a06a59  Previous WI relevant to this topic - WI00327014 - Copy invoice lines from original invoice to credit note
product_candidate: AP Amend with Credit Note copy Transaction Header Branch and Department

WKI_Summary: TR e-INV - Receivables Agreed Payment Method Mapping for e-Invoice XML
details: A25 22-Jul-25 23:30 GMT+03:00:     When generating UBL XML for Türkiye e-Invoices, it’s essential to use UN/EDIFACT 4461 payment means codes to avoid errors from the government system.  Currently, there’s no mapping feature available for the defined Receivables Credit Agreed Payment Methods in the registry.  As a result, customers need to manually specify the UN Payment Means Code and assign one of these codes to a debtor organization as the agreed payment method.  If they don't do so and instead use one of the predefined codes, they encounter an error indicating that the payment means code is incorrect.  To address this, we will implement a hardcoded mapping for the predefined codes and use the provided value for any overridden codes.    https://service.unece.org/trade/untdid/d02a/tred/tred4461.htm
feature_description: INV - Receivables Agreed Payment Method Mapping for e-Invoice XML

WKI_Summary: GCT: ArrivalAfterUnloadEventValidator convert to AUX
details: CMA 04-Jun-25 14:07 GMT+10:00:   ArrivalAfterUnloadEventValidator will convert ARV to STU with Type = "Change of ATA rejected" & Reason = "ATA received after freight unload" when invalid. We are now moving towards AUX events for invalidated DEP/ARV. So we should do the same in this validator.  We need to confirm with Product the EventParameters    Done Statement: ArrivalAfterUnloadEventValidator converts invalid ARV to AUX    SMS 26-Jun-25 21:13 GMT+10:00: AUX is designed for carrier events only - we need to convert events from STU (STU with Type = "Change of ATA rejected" & Reason = "ATA received after freight unload") to AUX only if source is carrier (SeaShanty Carrier, SeaShanty BlackPearl and all carrier EDI events to AUX). AIS would remain as STU.   HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=ed5ab9b3-46f2-4e87-83b6-a7d2e2030e24&StorageDocPK=680fc72c-60f4-41c4-b22c-10a92fa090e1&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bMywV7KVe84Gq3PmPlcFTxqEf4UF0xKFx" SMS 07-Jul-25 15:34:  File Copy of ProviderCountATAtoSTU.xlsx (Sample File)      HLD in eDocs HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=ed5ab9b3-46f2-4e87-83b6-a7d2e2030e24&StorageDocPK=74035281-4314-41be-898b-d325dc2185a5&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2blyvvPoN1o%2bLQZCzWiC3CpzSUJzOKqb8W" SMS 26-Jun-25 21:46:  File WI00918300 - HLD ArrivalAfterUnloadEventValidator convert to AUX.docx (High Level Design)  AUX currently only support  those event parameters: HYPERLINK "https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=bbbb3925-3d85-49f6-b659-2f4dbbcf439a" New ‘Auxiliary’ Event Type  FAC Facility where the event took place, such as CFS (Depot), CNE (Consignee), CY (Container Yard), etc.   LOC Location of the Event   MOD Transport Mode   EVT Event Type – either Departure (DEP) or Arrival (ARV)   FRM Event Source- either ‘Carrier’ or ‘NVOCC’    I've asked CW team to add additional parameters for AUX to support the below TYP and RES for transparency and better communication with customers. HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/69d9405c-dc92-40f6-a9da-dd75801da57d?lang=en-gb" WI00928491 - 'AUX': Add TYP and RES parameters for Container Automation     Type = "Change of ATA rejected" & Reason = "ATA received after freight unload"     UPNs for reference   HYPERLINK "https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=e283676e-ac4e-4f58-9bc1-49e342221056" Carrier-reported Actual Departure and Arrival events are visible as Auxiliary (AUX) events in Container Automation  HYPERLINK "https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=b87e1d32-cf60-4c22-add8-ad6c3010c055" Handling of abnormal arrival events received after unloading     CMA 04-Jul-25 09:34 GMT+10:00:   Hi Silvia,    Currently there is no filtering on ArrivalAfterUnloadEventValidator so we would need to add one to only set AUX if carrier event.  Also, this brings up more questions about the new ActualDepartureEventValidator.   1. It currently validates on SeaShanty Carrier Event OR any other provider. Is this correct? Or do we also not want to validate on Port Authority providers, for example. Also what should we consider events from BlackPearl? Technically they come from carrier too?  It would be good to get a list of providers that should be excluded from the validation.     2. Validation is quite different between ARV and DEP if we proceed this way. If Source is AIS for example the ARV would be updated to STU. But the DEP would skip validation completely, do we want to align these methods? Update to STU for both, or skip validation completely for both?    3. What should the event parameters be for these AUX events? currently the DEP validator will set:  EventCode=DEP|Facility=CTO|From=Carrier|Location=PABLB|TransportMode=SEA  Do we need to add TYP & RES for it also?    4. Should we consider if client supports AUX events before updating to it? If client does not support AUX should we keep as STU?    CMA 07-Jul-25 10:11 GMT+10:00:   1. Changes needed to both ActualDepartureEventValidator & ArrivalAfterUnloadEventValidator to only update to AUX if carrier event. In ArrivalAfterUnloadEventValidator if non carrier event we will continue to set as STU.  2. We need to agree upon a list of Providers & Event sources that should not be updated to AUX. Silvia suggests "CargoSmart, OneStop, Port Connect, RailInc, Terminator" I would probably add any PortAuthority provider to that list + AIS.  IsCarrierEvent method of ContainerEventDeduplicator should be moved out to a common method and called in these validators (the method itself looks like it needs some additional checks for new providers like Railinc).  3. TYP & RES parameters not supported by AUX yet. Silvia has said we are ok to ignore these for now, can add them later    SMS 07-Jul-25 15:23 GMT+10:00: Hi Conor. Thanks for the list - PortAuthority providers  + AIS would remain as STU.   SeaShanty Carrier, SeaShanty BlackPearl and all carrier EDI events to AUX. WKI_Summary: CT Status to be included in OCI segment of direct FWB messages for IT exports
details: KL8 25-Jul-25 12:39 GMT+10:00:     Add code below to CreateMovementReferenceNumber method in class ConsolExportAWBHeader    if (Consol.IsDirect   &&GlbCompany.CurrentCompany.Country.Code == Core.Constants.CountryCodes.Italy    && shipment.Origin != null   && shipment.Origin.RL_RN_NKCountryCode == Core.Constants.CountryCodes.Italy   && shipment.IsExport())  {   movementReferenceNumber.CommunityTransitStatusCode = shipment.JS_CommunityTransitStatus;  }    RNR 18-Jul-25 10:17 GMT+10:00:     Following on from HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=NewWorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=05ae78ac-7bcc-4a62-8ab1-953684ea0e45&VersionNumber=25.7.10.58&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b7Fgf4goT3ujUF99lDONrMfkDZ3bNIytc" WI00840684 - CT Status to be included in FHL messages for exports from IT where we implemented inclusion of CT Status for each MRN of a Shipment in the OCI segment of the FHL message, CT Status of each MRN of the HAWB linked to a direct MAWB needs to be included in the OCI segment of the FWB message - this is in addition to existing functionality for Consols with Shipment(s) with mixed CT Statuses, where the most severe CT Status is sent in the COR segment of the FWB.    Requirement: Italian Customs Regulations mandate the electronic submission of MRN and its associated Customs Status for all shipments, ensuring proper tracking and handling. Failure to include the required data in direct FWB messages may result in shipment delays, rejections, penalties or non-compliance with Customs Authorities at Milan MXP.    Done Statement: CT Status of each MRN of the HAWB linked to a direct MAWB needs to be included in the OCI segment of the FWB message for Italian air exports. WKI_Summary: eTail V2.CUS Deactivate Customs Job if Primary Fields Changed - AU
details: UPDATES:    QL 16-May-25 14:34 GMT+10:00:     After discussion on 16/05, here's the plan for changing the deactivating behaviour:    AU AIR/SEA Cargo Report: will always be one Customs job linked to a HVL shipment, so much simpler    DONE: New warning dialogs in HLD HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=fcc6ded7-85cc-456d-8d22-9b840dba4320&StorageDocPK=4ddf02d3-b327-4fd1-8785-3172f2f253d2&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b5lWvpQyHbLkPkwcmVrdrquKyo0anVlrs" QL 16-May-25 14:38:  File HLD WI00822220 - eTail V2. CUS. Improve. Deactivate Customs Job if Primary Fields Changed_v2.docx (High Level Design) is in place upon save and existing Customs job is updated when primary fields are updated.      NZ AIR/SEA Cargo Report (ICR/CRE): NZ is more complicated where we will have single job case and multiple jobs case:     1. Single Customs job for a HVL shipment: if HVLV consignments do not exceed the Customs Entry Line max limit (registry controlled), then only 1 Customs job will be created.    2. Multiple Customs jobs for a HVL shipment: If HVLV consignments exceed the Customs Entry Line max, then multiple Customs jobs will be created with each job not exceeding the limit. For example if the limit is 9999 and HVL shipment is having 15K consignments, 2 ICRs will be creaeted with the 1st one having 9999 lines and 2nd one having 5001 lines.     3. Multiple HVL shipments merged into 1 Customs job: as we support merging HVL shipments from the same consol to 1 Customs job (registry controlled), then there will be cases where multiple HVL shipments are on 1 Customs job. For example, if a consol has 3 HVL shipments with each shipment having 1000 consignments, when creating ICR for shipment 1, 1000 consignments are on ICR 1. When creating ICR for the 2nd shipment, 1000 consignments from 2nd shipment will be merged into ICR 1. Same for when creating the 3rd.      DONE:     1. Single Customs job for a HVL shipment case: new warning dialogs in HLD HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=fcc6ded7-85cc-456d-8d22-9b840dba4320&StorageDocPK=4ddf02d3-b327-4fd1-8785-3172f2f253d2&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b5lWvpQyHbLkPkwcmVrdrquKyo0anVlrs" QL 16-May-25 14:38:  File HLD WI00822220 - eTail V2. CUS. Improve. Deactivate Customs Job if Primary Fields Changed_v2.docx (High Level Design) is in place upon save and existing Customs job is updated when primary fields are updated.  2. Multiple Customs jobs for a HVL shipment case: new warning dialogs in HLD HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=fcc6ded7-85cc-456d-8d22-9b840dba4320&StorageDocPK=4ddf02d3-b327-4fd1-8785-3172f2f253d2&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b5lWvpQyHbLkPkwcmVrdrquKyo0anVlrs" QL 16-May-25 14:38:  File HLD WI00822220 - eTail V2. CUS. Improve. Deactivate Customs Job if Primary Fields Changed_v2.docx (High Level Design) is in place upon save. When 'Sync' is used, updates are synced to all existing Customs Jobs associated with the HVL shipment when primary fields are updated.  3. Multiple HVL shipments merged into 1 Customs job case: new warning dialog in HLD HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=fcc6ded7-85cc-456d-8d22-9b840dba4320&StorageDocPK=4ddf02d3-b327-4fd1-8785-3172f2f253d2&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b5lWvpQyHbLkPkwcmVrdrquKyo0anVlrs" QL 16-May-25 14:38:  File HLD WI00822220 - eTail V2. CUS. Improve. Deactivate Customs Job if Primary Fields Changed_v2.docx (High Level Design) is in place upon save and existing Customs job is updated when primary fields are updated.    @Dev: we can chunk this WI if needed.       NEW IDEA: to avoid having multiple jobs created for NZ case, we can potentially limit the number of NZ HVL shipment consignments to be in line with Customs job limit and split the shipment if it exceeds the limit. For example, if the Customs registry limit is 9999 and the Consignments created/imported is 15K, then we split into 2 shipments. So it will always be 1 HVL shipment to 1 Customs job, makes mathing a lot easier. This needs investigation and verification and should be implemented as country specific solution, in this case NZ. --- a  new WI to investigate               DONE:  - Saving HVLV Job with updated "primary" fields" is allowed regardless of whether any Customs Jobs were already created for it   - HVL to Customs job data syncing is allowed if the Customer was warned of the potential disruption that the syncing may cause and made a conscious choice to proceed with it.     BACKGROUND:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=3dacb26f-c1a4-47e0-a28b-b16f71723e92&VersionNumber=24.10.28.5&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bHtoBxRGWlS%2fPFSLMzbGeXgBYac1xsN%2fC" WI00675891 - eTail V2.CUS Deactivate Existing Job When Primary Fields Changed caused:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=6639e3c0-5e8e-42f7-966d-9416725165a6&VersionNumber=24.10.28.5&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bwPIL3XMRoMY%2bnSjyvXpXEvStVw5qyqHY" CS01776189 - CTFREISYD - Disable 'Deactivate Customs Jobs After Main Fields Updated for HVL Jobs?'  CTP are asking to remove recently introduced Customs Job deactivation due to an edge case they have.
product_candidate: eTail V2.CUS Deactivate Customs Job if Primary Fields Changed
feature_description: AU

WKI_Summary: Display gathered transactions during functional test of STL collectors
details: At present, we encourage engineers to functionally test STL collector additions\updates through the STL and USS service task through the below content:    https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/2320/STL-Collector-Service-(STL)  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/2324/Usage-Submission-Service-(USS)    This generally requires access to elastic\kibana to be able to see the submitted transactions, which is more of a full end to end test, but can cause delays in the process if the engineer is not experienced with the portal or does not have access.    Engineers have expressed a desire to be able to display the gathered transactions in CargoWise immediately, rather than having to do a full end to end test and go to the portal.    They can achieve this at present by using the following hacky pull request https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/228455, see https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/15733/Bill-Collector-Functionality-Testing, but it would be much better if this functionality was built in to the product.    So we should look to officially add this functionality to the product as an option for functional testing, but in a much more robust and less hacky way.    ITN 20-Feb-25 10:09 GMT+11:00:     DESIGN:    I think the basic premise of the above pull request above is fine, we can use the existing StlRetrieverForm to trigger the collection of transactions and then display them in a form such as StlRetrieverCollectedDataForm.    I don't think we should butcher the IStlItem interface by adding the display collection to achieve it though.    Instead, I think we should change StlRetrieverMonthly.CollectAndSend to return a collection of the transactions gathered.  This would be passed up through the call stack all the way from BillingDataCollector.RetrieveFeatureData as an IEnumerable<IStlTransaction> collection, to keep things generic and clean.    We could then directly populate the collectedData from this returned collection and convert the transactions into BillingTransactionForDisplaying (perhaps with a better class name though).    This approach would be a lot cleaner and require a lot less modication to the rest of the production classes.
product_candidate: Display gathered transactions during functional test of STL collectors

WKI_Summary: Turn off Audit Events for Global Manifest tables
details: JPG 24-Mar-25 18:10 GMT+11:00: The purpose of this WI is to turn off Audit Event logging (by default) for the main Global Manifest (Asycuda...) tables. See the following links for an overview of what we want to achieve:    https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/ArchiveManager/EUUiOSoELGRNsSGhAzlT16kBowtezPrVVdNV3H4dxM3N9g?e=FWtKxN    Guide: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/13383/Turning-off-Audit-Events  Sample PR: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/291327    REQ001: Remove the IsAutoLogged override from the following classes (that is, turn off auto logging):    Enterprise.Customs.ManifestBase.AsycudaManifestHeader  Enterprise.Customs.ASYCUDA.Business.AsycudaManifestHeader  Enterprise.Customs.ASYCUDA.Business.AsycudaBill    LY 09-Apr-25 10:30 GMT+01:00: Remove relevant business objects from AuditEventTest baseline https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FArchiveManager%2FArchiveManager%2FArchiveManager.Test%2FAuditEventTest.cs&version=GBmaster&line=107&lineEnd=108&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=1&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    REQ002: Add the following tables to AutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValue (https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FWorkflow%2FWorkflow.Business%2FAuditStmALog%2FAutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValues.cs&version=GBmaster&_a=contents)    AsycudaManifestHeader  AsycudaBill    This enable 2 things:  When the registry is on for a particular table, then StmALog events will be created as if IsAutoLogged were turned on.  When the registry if off, then NonPersistedStmALog events will be create. These will allow workflow to work on EDT/ADD events, but it will not actually persist the events in StmALog (which is the real goal here).    --    The three tables should already be in the Audit DB and visible on the Global Manifest (and related) forms:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=a84f51df-222d-4573-80e7-6792629b5084&VersionNumber=25.3.24.25&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2b44IiZJlWXftyCrSQ%2f0VEkeTg9WeAvDnN" WI00887085 - Enable Audit Data tab for all Global Manifest (and related) Forms
product_candidate: Turn off Audit Events for Global Manifest tables

details: YSH 02-Sep-25 11:35 GMT+10:00:   For Functional Review:   - New functionality:    - Diagnostics has been moved into the Register screen    - Release has been moved into the Outbound module    - New Tasks button has been added into the Main Menu. Notably new buttons design    YSH 29-Aug-25 11:02 GMT+10:00:   Following discussions with Product and Design team, our final design and goals for this work item are as follows:   - Apply the proposed changes in button layout as described below   - Move the Settings and Logout Button into the top right using Material Design icons in the toolbar   - Update the Application toolbar to now be the Supply Brand colour #371ee1   - Update the button styling across our application    - Buttons should have rounded edges and a light outline to help identify them    - Colouring, fonts and other styles should not be updated for the buttons   - New tasks button should now be conditionally visible based on if the warehouse supports Task Management    - Button should direct to the Get Next Task module in Glow using SSO    - Get Next Task module should function as expected once launched    An update note should be published for the new revised main menu, and updated button stylings + toolbars    CKR 27-Aug-25 17:04 GMT+10:00:     Luke's design proposition for the new Main Menu https://www.figma.com/design/KdOg97A13ZQazhgL6QhWO4/DPW---Product-Warehouse-Master-File?node-id=9505-14051&t=qsrixMXVPzn1eLqx-1    In a Nutshell:  (1) We put 'Diagnostics' + 'Register' under 'Settings'  (2) We put 'Release' under 'Outbound' (If it was up to me, I would remove it entirely)  (3) Legacy Modules are put at the top  (4) Glow Modules are in the middle with an icon to emphasize that it opens the other app  (5) 'Settings' and 'Logout' at the bottom    YSH 26-Aug-25 11:50 GMT+10:00:   Review the RF main menu and determine if any UX changes are appropriate.  Consider how adding a TM2 menu might work here.

WKI_Summary: NZ AddInfo - Move JI_ConcessionCode to real field JI_ConcessionOrder
details: NZ AddInfo has JI_ConcessionCode to represent the tariff concession code.  There is now a real column in the Invoice Line table to contain this value.    In this WI we need to change the code to use the real column (JI_ConcessionOrder) instead of using JI_ConcessionCode.  The current maxLength of JI_ConcessionCode will need to be applied to JI_ConcessionOrder using the MaxLength attribute.  As part of this change the existing data in the database will need to be copied from the addinfo into the real column.    See this WI for a similar change.    HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/6c923006-d6fc-4d04-a3a1-8f05a6f6caa3?lang=en-gb" WI00864928 - [NZ] Migrate AddInfo fields to JobComInvoiceLine
feature_description: Move JI_ConcessionCode to real field JI_ConcessionOrder

WKI_Summary: PP: Add 'Use for Document' checkbox to Product CSV Template
details: EVG 07-Nov-24 14:28 GMT+08:00:   For functional review:  Please test importing product barcodes via csv file, we have added logic for importing UseForDocuments and some basic validations for pack type and UseForDocuments,   please test the following scenarios:  1. packtype is not convertible  2. packtype is weight or volume and not stock unit  3. packtype is not stock unit and setting use for documents flag  4. more than one barcode's use for documents flag is set  5. none use for documents flag is set but has barcode with pack type same as the product's stock unit.  Other regression tests for importing product and barcodes are also needed.     BRS 21-Oct-24 19:41 GMT+11:00:   TECHNICAL DESIGN:  Add Barcode1_UseForDocuments, Barcode2_UseForDocuments, Barcode3_UseForDocuments, Barcode4_UseForDocuments, Barcode5_UseForDocuments to the OrgSupplierPartDataLoad schema, including parsing that from the CSV in AddPartBarcode  This column should be optional and treated as false if it's not present  Read this value into OrgSupplierPartBarcode.PH_UseForDocuments  Implement basic UseForDocuments validation on this field (see CheckPH_UseForDocuments)  Cannot be set if the pack type is not the StockKeepingUnit. Being careful to handle a changed StockKeepingUnit in the import too.  Must only be set on a single barcode per product, being careful to handle the flag being swapped between 2 barcodes in a single import.  For ideas on how this has been done, see IsValidChangeOnPartAttribReleaseCaptured and ValidateProduct, but be careful about the edge cases above. Planning Poker Notes:    Client has 26000 products, cannot use operational action, has to do one at a time    16/9/24: ability to update this field 'Use for Documents' in Product CSV load

WKI_Summary: [BIL] Implement Minimum Fee for non-CW1 products
details: Do requirement 2 in this work item.  Spec is in HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/a0efa845-7c5c-495e-ae28-daba4f9ab985?lang=en-gb" WI00894806 - [BIL] Enable Minimum Fee for all pricelists      TXZ:  Design:  1. Get min fee code from registry.  2. Insert the min fee code if the LD does not have usages at all & the LD is a master db.    sample code:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FClientExtensions%2FEDI%2FZClientEDI%2FZClientEDI%2FClientConfiguration%2FBillingUsageSchema.cs&version=GBmaster&line=6290&lineEnd=6290&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=8&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  EdiGetChargeableUsageGenericUsage     -- insert min fee   DECLARE @SettingsXml XML = (SELECT CAST(SD_BinaryValue AS NVARCHAR(MAX)) FROM dbo.StmData WHERE SD_Name = 'UsageMinimumFeeSettings');   IF @SettingsXml IS NOT NULL    BEGIN    DECLARE @MinFeeCode varchar(3) =     (     SELECT TOP 1 MinFeeCode     FROM     (      SELECT        ProductCode = NodeTable.Item.value('ProductCode[1]', 'varchar(3)'),       MinFeeCode = NodeTable.Item.value('MinimumFeeCode[1]', 'varchar(3)')      FROM         @SettingsXml.nodes('/UsageMinimumFeeSettings/MinimumFeeUsageList/MinimumFeeUsage') AS NodeTable(Item)     ) R WHERE ProductCode = @Category    );       IF @MinFeeCode IS NOT NULL    BEGIN     INSERT INTO @Result (LD_PK, SubCode, UnitCount)     SELECT LD.LD_PK, @MinFeeCode, 1     FROM dbo.LicenceDatabase LD     LEFT JOIN dbo.EdiLicenceDatabaseConsolidationHistory          ON EDH_Period = @Period AND EDH_LD = LD.LD_PK AND EDH_LD_ConsolidatedDatabase != LD.LD_PK      LEFT JOIN @Result R ON R.LD_PK = LD.LD_PK     WHERE LD_Product = @Category       AND LD_LicenceType = 'PRD'       AND LD_IsActive = 1       AND R.LD_PK IS NULL  -- no usages yet.       AND EDH_LD IS NULL;  -- master LD only.    END   END
feature_description: CW1 products

WKI_Summary: PP: Add Distribution Center Org as a Consolidation Criteria
details: BCU 14-May-25 15:26 GMT+10:00:     For functional Testing:    - Please test the Consolidation of Orders for Consolidation locations with these cases:  1) When the Distribution Center for the Order is provided  2) When the Distribution Center for the Order is not provided  3) When the Distribution Center for the Order is overriden    When Distribution Center is provided, its location should be used for determining the consolidation location instead of the consignee. When is not provided or not overriden, the consignee is used as before.      MMC 14-Mar-25 15:25 GMT+11:00:   Very straightforward, When considering Consolidation for an Order it currently groups by Consignee Address PK (as well as the other fields mentioned in CKR's notes).    Technical Suggestion:  If the distribution center is provided and not overriden (dunno why you can put an overriden address for a DC) then use that as the Address PK to consolidate by instead of ConsigneeAddress.  this means that an Order with no DC and with Consignee Address "123" and an Order with DC Address "123" will be consolidated together.    CKR 14-Jan-25 15:01 GMT+11:00:   Current Functionality: Consolidation currently considers Consignee, Date, Transport Company and Load ID.    Desired Functionality: Ability to consolidate the orders based on DC org.     Planning Poker Notes:    20/11/24 Distribution Centers are a prime candidate for Consolidation activity as there are multiple orders being sent to the same location which can be consolidated in a single handling unit, reducing costs on receiving and transport.    14/01/25: IF a DC is added on the order, it will consolidate by the DC (and not consignee anymore).
product_candidate: Add Distribution Center Org as a Consolidation Criteria

WKI_Summary: FR e-Inv - Suffixe and Routage
details: JJ1 16-Feb-25 22:54 GMT+11:00:   Two new IDs are required for French organizations: Suffixe and Routage    They require additional and separate validations.    Suffixe can only be populated if the alreday existing SIRET ID is not recorded - and vice versa. In other words only one of these two IDs may be recorded for an organization.    The new Routage ID may ONLY be recorded if the SIRET ID is also recorded.
feature_description: Inv - Suffixe and Routage

WKI_Summary: DE AR E-inv: Issue warning on missing IBAN in Europe
details: JJ1 14-Feb-25 01:45 GMT+11:00:   All European countries have IBAN numbers available and having them recorded in the system is important for international transfers. Issuing a warning if the IBAN is missing makes sense.    There are many other countries having using IBAN, but since I am not sure if they are actively using it, the warning will be limited to the european countries for now:    Austria (AT)  Belgium (BE)  Bulgaria (BG)  Croatia (HR)  Cyprus (CY)  Czechia (CZ)  Denmark (DK)  Estonia (EE)  Finland (FI)  France (FR)  Germany (DE)  Greece (GR (Eurostat: EL))  Hungary (HU)  Ireland (IE)  Italy (IT)  Latvia (LV)  Lithuania (LT)  Luxembourg (LU)  Malta (MT)  Netherlands (NL)  Poland (PL)  Portugal (PT)  Romania (RO)  Slovakia (SK)  Slovenia (SI)  Spain (ES)  Sweden (SE)  Iceland (IS)  Liechtenstein (LI)  Norway (NO)  Switzerland (CH)  Albania (AL)  Bosnia and Herzegovina (BA)  Moldova, Republic of (MD)  Montenegro (ME)  North Macedonia (MK)  Serbia (RS)  Turkey (TR)  Ukraine (UA)  Andorra (AD)  Belarus (BY)  Monaco (MC)  Russian Federation (RU)  San Marino (SM)  United Kingdom (GB)    Maybe there is a property on each country like continent that can be used.

WKI_Summary: ACAS - Item 7 - Customer Account Issuer [NEW LOGIC]
details: TL4 26-Mar-25 14:18 GMT+11:00:     Desciption:  The ACAS item 7 "customer account issuer" product design changes from "Two Character Code" to "three-digit MAWB prefix".    Reason for Change:  Change of product HLD.    Existing Issue (for defects only):  n/a    Done statement:  (Copy from product team notes below) The Customer Account Issuer (AI) for a non-direct FWB will capture the three-digit MAWB prefix for ACAS reporting purposes.    Suggested Changes (Detailed Build Design):  Change this line   https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FExportAWB%2FExportAWBHeader%2FCountryHandlers%2FUsaACASCountryHandler.cs&version=GBmaster&line=339&lineEnd=340&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=81&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  to:  return consolHeader.Consol?.ShippingLine?.MiscServ?.Airline?.RM_EagleAddedAirlinePrefixOrAccountingCode;      RNR 20-Mar-25 09:05 GMT+11:00: This WI is required to correct the current logic for capturing and reporting the Customer Account Issuer for non-direct FWB from two-letter Airline code to three-digit MAWB prefix - this is as per Page 11 (Item 15) of https://www.cbp.gov/sites/default/files/2024-09/Enhanced%20ACAS%20FAQ%20CBP%20V2.3%20Sep%2023%20%28508%20compliant%29_0.pdf. WKI_Summary: [TF] Permit Posting and Discard Tax Trans WHEN no Rate for Tax Rate Source = ORG
details: TB 20-Mar-25 10:15 GMT+11:00:     SCOPE of Change    Permit Posting of INV and CRD   WHEN Tax Transaction Tax ID Rate Source is 'ORG'   AND no rate exists on the Organisation for the Tax Date    > Discard Tax Transaction WHEN Tax ID rate source = 'ORG' and no rate exists on the organsiation for the Tax Date    > Applies to all invoicing (eg. Miscelleaneous, Job Invoice, Consol Invoice, Periodic Invoice)      Our problem:  Sometimes we prevent posting when no Org Rate exists, other times we permit posting.  We have different behaviours in different parts of the system and this inconsistency is bad System currently prevents posting and shows an error in some places (eg. Fowarding shipment)  and shows a warning and proceeds with posting in other places (eg. periodic invoice)    Change Required when Tax ID Rate Source = ORG  When Tax ID Rate source = ORG  (organisation rate only)  AND no org rate exists for the relevant Tax Date  Discard Tax Transaction   Allow posting to proceed.    Note:  KEEP error and prevent posting for other "scenarios" where we currently prevent posting when no rate exists (possibly Rate Source = TID)
product_candidate: [TF] Permit Posting and Discard Tax Trans WHEN no Rate for Tax Rate Source = ORG

WKI_Summary: CC:Improve Result Message & Display Error Logs/Reasons in the Cycle Count Module
details: TG1 16-Jul-25 15:37 GMT+10:00:     Chunk from HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/f29324bc-fa6d-442a-8b00-e38ed6cfc771?lang=en-gb" WI00934788 - Cycle Count UX Improvement      TG1 10-Jul-25 11:20 GMT+10:00:     We have identified several areas for improvement within the Cycle Count module to enhance clarity, usability, and user experience:    1) Improve Result Message on Variance Acceptance  When a user accepts a cycle count variance, the system displays the message:  “Please check the following results: Location xxxxx – Variance is accepted successfully.”    This is misleading. In reality, once a variance is approved, it triggers a service task, and validation is not immediate. If an issue occurs during processing, the Authorized Action will display an error, and the status remains OPN    Update the message to reflect the actual process. Suggested revised message:  “Please check the following results: Location xxxxx – Request has been submitted and is in the processing queue.      2) Display Error Logs/Reasons in the Cycle Count Module  Currently When an error occurs during cycle count processing, users must go back to the Service Task in CW to view the error log and reason.  Proposed Enhancement:  Expose error logs and reasons directly within the Cycle Count module, improving error traceability.      J25 14-Aug-25 11:49 GMT+10:00:  Changes as follows:   Make a WhsCycleCountLocation + Note relation   Port adhoc view (WhsCycleCountLocationForModule) columns onto the WhsCycleCountLocation entity.   Swap SDT to use the entity -> keep column parity/behavior -> Notes row action should be automatically added.   Pass entity logs into the new notes entity.   Add “View Notes” entry from the cycle count variance page and ensure this matches with the correct Cycle Count task.      Refer to spikes:  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/pull/4618/files  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/Glow/pull/8501/files
product_candidate: Improve Result Message & Display Error Logs/Reasons in the Cycle Count Module

WKI_Summary: PP: Export the Print Package Sequence in Order Universal XML
details: RDZ 19-Mar-25 12:59 GMT+08:00:   For functional review please test:  For order which pick is Cartonised.  The packages only set sequences after select "(Re)Print All Package Labels".    MMC 03-Dec-24 11:21 GMT+11:00:   Done Statement:  Print Sequence is exported in Order Universal XML    Technical Suggestion:  Package Sequence is not currently designed to work across package Jobs (Orders). That being said there is a "PackageSequenceType" property on the PackingParent which determines how the sequencing is set, which gives a bit of precedent on allowing a change.    I would suggest adding a new PackageSequenceType of "Consolidated" or similar to refer to the Package Sequence being across multiple Jobs.    If the PackageSequenceType is Consolidated, then the PackageSequencer does not set the sequence of the package ever. Any new package manually added will simply have a sequence of 0 (not sequenced).  PackageSequenceType is Consolidated if the order's pick is Cartonised.  Package Sequence should get set when Print All Package Labels is clicked. The Pick can't have any changes when clicking this menu, it should then sort the packages in the order they're currently sorted, set the Package Sequence and then save.  Then it should build the Doc Pack as before except sort by the sequence which was set just previously.    Reprinting should do the same, in case resequencing was necessary (maybe some packages were deleted).    Lastly export the Package Sequence as the "ItemNo" property on the PackingLing Universal Data Object.    CKR 28-Oct-24 08:24 GMT+11:00:     Current Functionality: The Package print Sequence is currently not stored in the system.    Desired Functionality: When using Package Label Allocation, the packages are created in the same sequence as the labels are printed. This sequence number is stored as a 0against the package (package sequence field), and that field can be exported in the Order UXML.    Planning Poker Notes:    25/10/24: Declined as a CR7 (too expensive) - Advised client we will still add it to the roadmap
product_candidate: Export the Print Package Sequence in Order Universal XML

WKI_Summary: ACAS - Item 12 - Customer Account Billing Type [NEW LOGIC]
details: SKW 13-May-25 13:51 GMT+10:00:   This work item will bring some changes for existing functionality to find the Customer Account Billing Type. HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/NewWorkItem/5e8e0ccf-fde3-4053-b67b-43e15db63dc1?lang=en-gb" WI00835773 - ACAS - Item 11-12 - Customer Account Establishment Date and Billing Type  Current logic is here. https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FExportAWB%2FExportAWBHeader%2FCountryHandlers%2FUsaACASCountryHandler.cs&version=GBmaster&line=587&lineEnd=587&lineStartColumn=15&lineEndColumn=44&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    SKW 26-May-25 15:19 GMT+10:00:   1. For controller customer, consignor and consignee, it will change to check field <OH_IsDebtor>(is 'Receivables'), and then get it from OB_ARCreditAgreedPaymentMethod field. If no agree payment method found, it will get registry Accounting > Receivable Defaults > Default Receipt Type   Current logic is check is Payables and get it from OB_APCreditAgreedPaymentMethod and get Accounting > Payable Defaults > Default Payment Type     For sending agent, it remain the same.    2. Add DefaultReceiptType in Accounting.cs to get registry value Accounting > Receivable Defaults > Default Receipt Type     3. Add (PPY, BLL) to CWToACASBillingTypeDictionary  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FExportAWB%2FExportAWBHeader%2FCountryHandlers%2FUsaACASCountryHandler.cs&version=GBmaster&line=750&lineEnd=750&lineStartColumn=46&lineEndColumn=75&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    4. When load data (include OB_ARCreditAgreedPaymentMethod ) from OrgCompanyData, it will be changed to filtered by US companyPK. Currently it is filtered by logged in company PK.  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FMasterFiles%2FBusiness%2FMasterFiles.Business%2FOrganisation%2FMain%2FOrgHeader%2FOrgHeader.cs&version=GBmaster&line=1860&lineEnd=1860&lineStartColumn=4&lineEndColumn=80&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  We need to find the OrgCompanyData from the company located in US to ensure the AgreedPaymentMethod field has the correct value.  If there is one US company and AgreedPaymentMethod  has value, then return the value.  If there is no US company, or no data for US company, return empty as not found.  if there is more than one US company, return registry Accounting > Receivable Defaults > Default Receipt Type (for OB_ARCreditAgreedPaymentMethod) or Accounting > Payable Defaults > Default Payment Type (for OB_APCreditAgreedPaymentMethod).    Spike PR: HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/334922?_a=files" Pull request 334922: WI00884098 Spike - Repos    RNR 17-Apr-25 12:01 GMT+10:00: As development had yet to be started, system enhancements to consider "BILL - Periodic Billing" and checking A/P and A/R setup using country account location for the determined Org. will be handled in this WI. Revised HLD here: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=b94e6579-c4d8-4e41-b60a-a41658571dbb&StorageDocPK=878af6b9-7c41-4ab2-a253-a5ea63a50aa7&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=ediprod&Hash=%2buTkV5%2f%2b0%2fZdnV24n9Oq0pMElmBgDYqID" RNR 17-Apr-25 12:19:  File HLD v2.docx (High Level Design) for reference.    RNR 10-Apr-25 10:49 GMT+10:00: Request to consider "BILL - Periodic Billing" will be raised in a new WI once agreement is reached with DHL, as well as any possible changes to existing logic around Controlling Customer fallback to Pickup/Delivery Agent instead of Shipper/Consignee.    EHG 18-Mar-25 13:40 GMT+11:00: This WI needs to be patched.    RNR 17-Mar-25 14:48 GMT+11:00: RNR 17-Apr-25 12:25 GMT+10:00: *** UPDATED ***    Done Statement:    1. For non-direct FWB we should check for 'Payables' flag in Organisation, FHL we should check for 'Receivables' flag in Organisation and direct FWB we should check 'Receivables' flag in Organisation;  2. For the FWB of a non-direct Consol, system checks A/P tab of the Sending Agent then sends its Agreed Payment Method in the message and if blank, falls back to System Registry;  3. For the FHL of a non-direct Consol, system checks the A/R tab of the determined Org. (Controlling Customer, Shipper or Consignee) then sends its Agreed Payment Method in the message and if blank, falls back to System Registry;  4. For the FWB of a direct Consol, system checks the A/R tab of the determined Org. (Controlling Customer, Shipper or Consignee) then sends its Agreed Payment Method in the message and if blank, falls back to System Registry;  5. For all message and Org. types, if the determined Org. is flagged as both A/P and A/R, system checks the A/R tab then sends its Agreed Payment Method in the message and if blank, falls back to System Registry;  6. For all message and Org. types, Agreed Payment Method is captured based on the country location of the determined Organisation (i.e. Sending Agent, Controlling Customer, Shipper or Consignee) record and if blank, falls back to System Registry;  7. New mapping to be added for ACAS code "BILL - Periodic Billing" - should be mapped to CargoWise code "PPY" and sent within FWB/FHL messages;
feature_description: Item 12 - Customer Account Billing Type [NEW LOGIC]

Currently, there is validation that does not allow incident to be created against a non-production system. It is not clear why this validation exists. WKI_Summary: Job Billing Exchange Rate - add Start and Expiry Date
details: JMN 11-Nov-24 12:09 GMT+11:00:     In Job Billing Exchange Rate Currencies Section, add 2 new columns called Start Date and Expiry Date.    For existing rules prior to this change, the Start and Expiry date fields will be blank. Blank Start and End Date would mean that the rule is active indefinitely.    Validations Needed:  1. Ensure that users cannot create overlapping rule. Only 1 rule can be active for a specific time per currency.  2. When Start Date is populated, it is mandatory to have an Expiry Date. Leaving it blank should be prevented.  3. When Expiry Date is populated, it is mandatory to have a Start Date. Leaving it blank should be prevented.  4. Validation to ensure that Expiry is Greater than or equal to Start Date.    Logic:  When determining what exchange rate source to apply, The Preference Date identified should be used to match and look for the applicable Ex Rate Type within the Start and Expiry Date.    Note: Time is not needed, just date.    TPH 12-Nov-24 16:55 GMT+11:00:   We also need validation for end date >= start date
feature_description: add Start and Expiry Date

WKI_Summary: Add Staff Assignments - Product filters
details: The following filters should be added to the Organisation module    1. Add "Staff Assignments - Product" filter  2. Add "Product" to the Staff Assignments filters (shown when user selects the "Staff Assignments" filter and then click the "..." button)    Other Staff Assignments filters already exist and should be used as a reference for the design of the new filters:  Staff Assignments - Company  Staff Assignments - Department  Staff Assignments - Staff  Staff Assignments - Role    FMT 10-Feb-25 10:34 GMT+11:00: Design: Note, this change should be done on EDI    For #1:  in EDIOrganisationFilterBusinessObjectCore  - Add a new filter called "Staff Assignments - Product"  - Create a "AddTextFilter" that will load the products in a dropdown component where the user can select it (see "Staff Assignments - Role" filter in the base class)  - We need to add the list of products to this filter (see LicenceDatabaseLookups.ProductTypeList for example)  - We need to use the prodperty "staffAssignments", from the base class, as Category    For #2, we need to create a new EDI specific class for StaffAssignmentsFilterBusinessObject, should be called "EDIStaffAssignmentsFilterBusinessObject"  We need to add this new EDI class to the ClientOverride.cs file, so we can use it  In EDIStaffAssignmentsFilterBusinessObject:  - Add a "AddTextFilter" called Product, this will have a load the producs to show in the dropdown (same as above)  - Make sure the Product filter Visibility is set to "FilterVisibility.AlwaysVisible" as the other filters
feature_description: Product filters

WKI_Summary: Extend Audit Tab for other entities besides the Parent Object
details: DH5 13-Aug-25 08:54 GMT+10:00:   Done Statement  The Audit Tab is extended to enable for Non-Cdc tables, and connects the audit tab to other related business objects.    Reason For change(To explain Why)  Tables such as QuotedBookings, don't exist inside of the Audit Tab, however are connected to numerous other business objects which are.    What has been done (Technical Prespective)  An interface IAuditHost, has been created and for tables such as QuotedBookings, those which inherit it all the audit/cdc checks are redirected to the related business objects rather than the host itself.      ===============================================================================================      DH5 16-Jul-25 11:12 GMT+10:00:   Problem:  HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/30f803c9-62b2-4c8c-a034-6242eff4f9b1?lang=en-gb" WI00877668 - Stop logging ADD\DEL\EDT StmAlogs  Within QuotedBookingForm, we can't add the audit tab because QuotedBooking isn't a audit database table, nor captured by CDC. However, there are multiple Tables which are captured by the Audit DB and CDC, such as RatingHeader and RateOneOffShipment, which are logged inside of the QuotedBookingForm. Thus we cannot turn off logging for those business objects for StmALog, without losing logging capabilities for QuotedBookingForm.     Thus, to extend the audit tab, to not only focus on the Parent Business Object of a form, and allow for other entities to be checked and used so that it can be enabled for QuotedBookingForm.
product_candidate: Extend Audit Tab for other entities besides the Parent Object

WKI_Summary: Argentina - Electronic Invoice - MTXCA - New field condicionIVAReceptor required
details: *** TOP PRIORITY ***    Very important: This Work Item contains compliance changes required by Argentina's tax office.  For this reason, we need to patch it in CW1 too (in the latest version 2024.10.30.nnnn)  Also, since the changes are mandatory from April 15 2025, we need to patch it manually in every ring.  As an importan remark, DHL is waiting for this WI to run tests in a training database.    Attached to eDoc is "Resolucion General 5616-2024" for legal support.        ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  There's a modification in the MTXCA web service (new version 0.25, released Jan 15, 2025))  The condicionIVAReceptor has been added and it's mandatory  The changes are mandatory from April 15, 2025
feature_description: Electronic Invoice - MTXCA - New field condicionIVAReceptor required

WKI_Summary: CPW: Prompt to check commodity risk for single document delivery restrictions
details: JT3 12-Dec-24 11:30 GMT+11:00:   Background  Users can configure delivery restrictions against specific documents. More info: https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=29e9b10f-1cbe-4623-86a5-7a54b02c75db  NOTE: For UDF restrictions, if the macro is true, we allow the document to be delivered. If the macro is false, we block the document from being delivered.    Originally, we only showed the commodity risk check popup when the Delivery Restriction type was set to CNH.    HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=afede558-eceb-4b90-a8d5-d2a7edfd10e9&VersionNumber=24.12.12.84&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bAjExrY0Cr9Tr6MwxgiaflluWe5LOTCjO" WI00840444 - CPW: Prompt to check commodity risk when document has delivery restrictions  Now, the commodity risk check prompt appears when the commodity risk check has not been initiated AND the document is set up as either:  1. Delivery Restriction Type = CNH  2. Delivery Restriction Type = UDF (with any macro)  3. Delivery Resiction Type = NON AND secondary Delivery Restrictions are set up    We do not take into account the macros being used against the UDF.    Problem  #2 and #3 above are too broad. A customer may have a macro set up that is just looking to check if the job has a description included. In this case, they should not be prompted to initiate the commodity risk check.    UDF restrictions do not consider compliance statuses.  This means that the commodity risk check prompt may appear when a UDF restriction is set up that has nothing to do with compliance statuses.  Secondary UDF delivery restrictions can apply to individual documents - see https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=c3e9a42d-03a6-4ea3-a1d8-10b46cf3daec    Desired Effects  Commodity Risk Prompt is displayed when a document has secondary UDF delivery restrictions. This is an expansion of HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=afede558-eceb-4b90-a8d5-d2a7edfd10e9&VersionNumber=24.12.12.84&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bAjExrY0Cr9Tr6MwxgiaflluWe5LOTCjO" WI00840444 - CPW: Prompt to check commodity risk when document has delivery restrictions    DONE Statements  1. If a restricted document has a UDF delivery restriction macro that includes Job Compliance Status or Commodities Compliance Risk status, when users attempt delivery of this document, the risk prompt is displayed   2. If a restricted document has a UDF delivery restriction macro that does not include Job Compliance Status or Commodities Compliance Risk status, when users attempt delivery of this document, the risk prompt is not displayed   3. If a restricted document has a secondary UDF delivery restriction macro that includes Job Compliance Status or Commodities Compliance Risk status, when users attempt delivery of this document, the risk prompt is displayed   4. If a restricted document has a secondary UDF delivery restriction macro that does not include Job Compliance Status or Commodities Compliance Risk status, when users attempt delivery of this document, the risk prompt is not displayed
product_candidate: Prompt to check commodity risk for single document delivery restrictions

WKI_Summary: CPW: Freight Movement Restriction registry - no pop-up if disabled for job
details: AWC 05-Feb-25 17:42 GMT+11:00:     DONE Statements  1. The 'review commodity risk' prompt does not appear for a given job if the setting in registry (Compliance > Compliance Risk Freight Movement Restriction) disables freight movement restriction for that job      Background notes  If I have a document with restriction set to "CHN" then I will get the 'review commodity risk' prompt when I try to produce the doc on a job where the assessment isn't done yet.      If the document has this set to "NON" then I will NOT get the prompt to 'review commodity risk'. This is current behaviour    There is a registry "Compliance Risk Freight Movement Restriction". I can set it to "NO" (description 'Do not apply any movement restrictions (for compliance risk)').   I would expect this to nullify the 'movement restricted' aspect of "CHN" and therefore, logically, also not trigger the 'review commodity risk' prompt when generating documents. But it doesn't do that - the prompt still appears. If client has set this registry to NO, then clearly it doesn't make logical sense to prompt for commodity check.  Same applies if the registry is set to only restrict export or import jobs (and the job direction doesn't match)    This registry controls other pop-up warnings which should stay as is.
feature_description: no pop-up if disabled for job

WKI_Summary: Validation for multiple VAT rates
details: R09 29-Sep-25 12:13 GMT+01:00:     1. Add a public bool and a protected virtual bool to control opting in/out the valdiation in the JobComInvoiceLine business object.  default to false on EU level  C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\CargoWise\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\EU\Core\Business\Declaration\JobComInvoiceLine\JobComInvoiceLine.cs    overide the bool to set to true in GB  C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\CargoWise\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\GB\Core\Business\Declaration\JobComInvoiceLine\JobComInvoiceLine.cs    2. The validation should be added to C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\CargoWise\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Customs\EU\Core\Business\Declaration\JobComInvoiceLine\JobComInvoiceLineValidation.cs  Just override CheckJI_ZZF_NKTaxType()  The full list should be Parent.Lookups.TaxOrFeeList, while applicable rates are Parent.Lookups.TaxOrFeeCodeList        CKG 18-Sep-25 17:05 GMT+01:00:     For rotator      DJC 28-Aug-25 13:47 GMT+01:00:   See discussion on incident.  Also see this image: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=e915cc9b-3a90-4d6e-ac5a-d030f28f79cf&StorageDocPK=bb155144-b980-43ad-ad92-1dcb9019cf81&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b06Oz85YH7lAhJz5Lrjq5LXewpGvWyCov" DJC 28-Aug-25 13:47:  File c270aef158664c518bcf555b94050b14.jpg (Client Correspondence / Screenshots)      TODO  In EU solution.   1. In the invoice line configuration, add a new option to allow opting in to the validation.   2. Change validation on JI_ZZF_NKTaxType.   If the list offers more than one value, but fewer than all possible values (which is a fallback case when insufficient data is avaialble to pick only applicable rates, it just offers all rows from RefCusTaxOrFee), and if the selected rate is not the lowest rate of those in the dropdown list, show a yellow warning.   "Not the lowest" rate means that ZZF_Value of the RefCusTaxOrFee record represented by JI_ZZF_NKTaxType==ZZF_Code is higher than any other RefCusTaxOrFee for codes offered in the dropdown list.  Be careful to only compare against those in the dropdown list, not simply against every possible rate in RefCusTaxOrFee.   So in the example show i the first case in the image, the rate for 666 (0.2) is higher than the rate for 673 (0), so we get a warning.  3. Wording is "More than one VAT rate may apply and the rate selected is not the lowest rate of those offered."    In GB  4. Opt in to the functionality offered in (1).       Desired effect:   For a commodity that attracts multiple rates like 6107110000, if we select 666 (in GB) we see a validation warning that its not the lowest.   If we select 673 for this commodity, we see no warning (cos it is the lowest).    If we pick a commodity which attracts only one rate, we see no warning.   If the commodity's VAT rates can't be determined (e.g. no RefCusVATApplicability, or no RefCusTariff found), and all rates are offered, no validation warning is given for any selection.

WKI_Summary: Add EInvoice Columns to AP Invoice tabs
details: HDG 27-Mar-25 09:53 GMT+08:00:     When registry ‘Enable E-Reporting Functionality -  Payables' is set to Yes for a company. In this login company, Shipment > Billing > AP Invoices , the E-Reporting related columns should be visible and should be available in Customise Columns form for users to select/deselect. IT and MY E-Reporting function supports Payables transactions, while neither of them support  AP E-Reporting info in job-billing tabs e.g. Shipment & Consol. WKI_Summary: Universal copy supports NCNs including related jobs and dependencies
details: JR7 24-Sep-24 11:51 GMT+10:00:   We want to extend HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=9a0baf61-ef9e-4998-ad6b-8de6cc23d658&VersionNumber=24.9.24.73&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b5V0zCwLI%2fheOWnJyU5ye%2fJWl2cn6yLfO" WI00659649 - Universal copy supports workflow relationships to be able to clone NCNs with WIs and WI dependencies.      AE 10-Oct-24 18:37 GMT+11:00: Per my conversations with Jon    DE: Users can copy whole diagrams including the underlying jobs and their relationships. This satisfies the use case of running exactly the same project a second time,  A couple of considerations for this      Layout data needs to be included  Happy to further restrict the possible job types for copy  Agreed including the different job types in the copy tree menu is the best path forward. This means all the different job types can have defined behaviour  Agreed to limit copy scope to just the diagram.  Everything explicit on the diagram will be recreated when copying - a hidden link isn't copied (We have to make sure explicitly displayed workflow to workflow or workflow to job links are copied without duplication)    Test Cases:  Copying a diagram includes relationships that are visibly present on the diagram at any level - JLW or WF level  Existing copy schedules shouldn't break  Copying a diagram includes all the layout infomration and other information  Jobs are saved based on the copy template - eg: copying all the common criteria information etc, if workflows arent copied, then the workflows should be created by templates. But JLW to JLW relationships explicit on the diagram should be preserved too.    There should be intelligent defaults too.    It is possible Jon will need to restrict the applicable job types so we may need a second UPN if needed.
product_candidate: Universal copy supports NCNs including related jobs and dependencies

WKI_Summary: RTD: Hide widgets from other modules in warehouse dashboard
details: JW6 09-Oct-25 13:46 GMT+08:00:   Currently when adding widget from the Widget library, we can see all the widgets including the one from other modules.  Update this to only show Product Warehouse widgets from the Product Warehouse Dashboard.    Update ControlTowerDefaultLayoutSchema to add a new property visibleCategory similar to defaultCategory.  When visibleCategory is provided, pass it to provideControlTowerWidgetVisibility and use it to filter the availableCategories.  In ControlTowerWidgetEditorTreeView, hide the categories without widgets.  In ProductWarehouseDashboard, set the visibleCategory to ControlTowerCategory.ProductWarehouse, so we can only see Product Warehouse widgets on this dashboard.    Since Product want this functionality to be patched back, we should minimise the scope, and I'll create another item to do the part for serialization/deserialization with visibleCategory in PB.    DMC 09-Oct-25 17:59 GMT+11:00:   Can we use `visibleCategories` (plural) and take a list of categories rather than a single one? Although it's not a hard requirement now, I could see this being more flexible for other dashboards in the future that might want a small subset of widgets (e.g, all "warehouse" related categories or something) and it's probably the same amount of effort.  Also need to ensure that feature control code is still respected, regardless of the supplied visible categories. Rest sounds reasonable to me, pls ensure the README documentation is updated also :)
product_candidate: Hide widgets from other modules in warehouse dashboard

WKI_Summary: Disable propagation of clearance to entry from CCSUK consignment
details: DJC 12-Jun-25 10:06 GMT+01:00:  See discussion on 3    Under CHIEF, no explicit clearance notification was send to for the entry.  Only the linked CCSUK consignment got a clearance notification.   So when the CCSUK consignment saw clear, CW1 would try to find the linked entry in several ways (foreign key for when using shipment-linked jobs, declaration's MUCR, declaration's agent's reference), then update that entry to clear too.  It would then send queries to CHIEF to try to find the exact clearance time.     With CDS, our entry explicitly gets a clearance message. So this propagation is not needed any more.     We get in a confusing situation if the user starts one entry for the consignment, abandons it, makes a new entry which clears the consignment.  CW1 may incorrectly find the first entry (if they're on the same shipment, or if the entry's declaration still references the consignment via its MUCR or agent ref).  CW1 will likely mark the original entry as clear.     The problem has existed for ages but was so obscure (only for abandoned entries when linked to a shipment - could also see it for standalone cases {no shipment} but could be avoided by wiping the MUCR on the abandonded dec) that we only saw it a couple of times.  But now it is time to improve it.       Disable this.     TODO  Delete method ConsignmentStatusUpdater.UpdateCusEntryHeaderToClearedIfNecessary.     If nothing uses class FindCusEntryHeaderFromAwbAndAgentReferenceHelper, delete it too.     Desired effect: processing an FSN clearance message for a CCSUK consignment that is linked, strongly or weakly, to a declaration & entry, we do not update the entry to clear.  Only the processing of DMSCLE shoud update an import entry to clear.
product_candidate: Disable propagation of clearance to entry from CCSUK consignment

WKI_Summary: Calendar Year as Digits should support 1, 2 or 4 digits (like Accounting Year)
details: LW 18-Feb-25 15:01 GMT+10:00:   During Olivia's review, it was found that the 'Calendar Year as Digits' is current restricted to 4 digits.   And this is not in line with the remark.  "CALENDER YEAR AS 1, 2 OR 4 DIGITS. FOR EXAMPLE: AS A SINGLE DIGIT(2024 = 4, 2020 = 0), AS A DOUBLE DIGIT(2024 = 24, 2020 = 20) AND AS 4 DIGITS(2024 = 2024)"    Done Statement:  1. The 'Calendar Year as Digits" should have the same logic as 'Accounting Year as Digits'.  2. The spelling of 'Calendar Year' in the remark needs to be corrected. It should be 'Calendar' and not 'Calender'.  "CALENDER YEAR AS 1, 2 OR 4 DIGITS. FOR EXAMPLE: AS A SINGLE DIGIT(2024 = 4, 2020 = 0), AS A DOUBLE DIGIT(2024 = 24, 2020 = 20) AND AS 4 DIGITS(2024 = 2024)"
product_candidate: Calendar Year as Digits should support 1, 2 or 4 digits (like Accounting Year)

M04 07-Aug-25 16:06 GMT+10:00: :we should do it at the end workflow  Add NIT for Iran in https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/0dd8d391fdd578d3cb467a6bc1ad8c46a1aa4c75/Enterprise/Product/Operations/MasterFiles/Business/MasterFiles.Business/Organisation/Main/OrgHelperClasses/OrgCodeLists.cs#L149C3-L200C4    M04 07-Aug-25 15:58 GMT+10:00:  I believe that we need to add new record for [RefDocOrgCusCode] for Iran for AWB  AFE 19-Aug-25 09:18 GMT+08:00: The new record will be added in HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/d12d4ae7-6475-477d-b4c8-648b157c2bd3" CS02051273 - WISGLOSYD - Insertion request to RefDocOrgCusCode by the Reference Data team    Workflow1 - MAWB)  We need to add this code M04 07-Aug-25 16:13 GMT+10:00:   1.Display of the NID Number on the MAWB  The National ID Number (NID) is now defaulted to the Master Waybill for imports into Iran as follows:   • Consol Type is DRT: the NID number of Shipment > Consignee’s Organization defaults  • Consol Type is anything other than DRT: the NID number of Consol > Receiving Agent’s Organization defaults     Create a new method to populate the default value of EH_ConsigneeTraderNoType according to the above requirements.   Then add it into PopulateCore()  M04 07-Aug-25 15:52 GMT+10:00:  it is better  to add a method in base class as a virtual and implement it oin consolexportawbheader  there are many examples for other countries https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/0dd8d391fdd578d3cb467a6bc1ad8c46a1aa4c75/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Forwarding.Business/ExportAWB/ExportAWBHeader/ExportAWBHeader.cs#L3566C3-L3576C4  Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Forwarding.Business/ExportAWB/ExportAWBHeader/CountryHandlers      https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/0dd8d391fdd578d3cb467a6bc1ad8c46a1aa4c75/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Forwarding.Business/ExportAWB/ExportAWBHeader/ConsolExportAWBHeader.cs#L1362C1-L1367C4,       2 .A warning validation is now displayed on the Consignee’s Comp. ID box of the MAWB for imports into Iran if the NID number is blank for that organization Show following warning message à “The Consignee’s NID (National ID Number) is required for imports to Iran”.  M04 07-Aug-25 16:04 GMT+10:00:  there are different example Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Forwarding.Business/ExportAWB/ExportAWBHeader/Validations //SDF 07-Aug-25 14:31 GMT+08:00:  I agree, you can refer to BrazilImportAWBHeaderValidator and create a new class named IranImportAWBHeaderValidator  Based on the requirements above, override the CheckEH_ConsigneeTraderNoType() method in the ConsolExportAWBHeaderValidation class.     Workflow2 - FWB)   1.National ID number is included in the FWB  2.Postal Code(EH_ConsigneePostCode) of the Consignee is included in the FWB    In https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/0dd8d391fdd578d3cb467a6bc1ad8c46a1aa4c75/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/AWB/Business/Messaging/FWB.cs#L895C1-L917C4, add National ID and Postal Code to the OCI section.  You can refer to this PR: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/236334    SVI 30-May-25 17:06 GMT+10:00:     Reason for the change: The Iranian authorities (Islamic republic of Iran Civil Aviation Authority) implemented the mandatory requirements for collecting Consignee's National ID numbers, Postal Codes, and Harmonized System (HS) Codes for air cargo shipments. As per the legal obligations requested details to be provided by air carrier on master AWB level.  Compliance investigation: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=baf747f3-ac63-4250-9eda-3f77874603b5&VersionNumber=25.5.30.17&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bGjHjAGpeO1%2fJybsS4IcwlMtcd%2bCsO3cw" WI00782794 - Iran Air Imports - NID of CNE, CNE postal code and HS Code mandatory in MAWB/FWB    Done:   The Consignee's National Identification Number (NID) should default to the MAWB and be included in the OCI segment of the FWB:  Sample: OCI/IR/CNE/T/NID 1234567890  The Consignee's postal code should also be included in the OCI segment of the FWB:  Sample: OCI/IR/CNE/T/PC 1234567890  An error validation to be shown in the ‘Nature & Quantity of Goods’ section of the MAWB when the HS code is not entered on all packlines in the Shipment > Packing tab for imports to Iran.  A warning validation to be shown in the Consignee (Comp. ID) field when the party is located in Iran and does not have a National ID number saved against their organization for imports to Iran.  The Document Organization Registration Mapping module now supports requirements for Iran as regulating country
feature_description: NID, postal code, and HS codes on MAWB/FWB

WKI_Summary: [UDB]Key Element Filtering for Parallel Processing
details: AET 21-Aug-25 14:05 GMT+10:00:   I have talked to Christina and we have decided that we should have two seperate registry items where we have one for Universal Shipment and another registry for Universal Event. Also it was decided that we should have Min Length, Max Length and Key Value(s) in three seperate columns on the same table.    AET 25-Aug-25 16:15 GMT+10:00:   Due to the performance concerns related to the "Analyse Historical Data" function it has been decided that we're not going to implement it in this WI.    AET 15-Sep-25 12:04 GMT+10:00:   Before testing make sure to disable UMI and UMQ service tasks  To check the key values run Select * from StmQueueState    Check that there is a new category located at eServices > Universal XML called "Key Element Filtering Configuration"  Check that in this category there are two registry items called "Universal Event" and "Universal Shipment"  In each registry item check there is a table with 4 rows called "Key Element, Min Value, Max Value and Excluded Values"  Check that for Key Element it has a drop down with the appropriate elements (lists can be found in eDocs). Also check that it has validation to check that a value has been provided, the value is in the list and that the key element have not been duplicated between rows  Check that for Min Length there is validation to ensure that the value is between 2-99 or is 0 (this means that we don't apply min length filtering) only if a Max length or Excluded Value(s) have been provided  Check that for Max Length there is validation to ensure that the value is between 1-99 or is 0 (this means that we don't apply max length filtering) only if a Min Length or Excluded Values(s) have been provided  Check that for Excluded Values there is validation to ensure that it has filled out if no Min Length or Max Length has been provided  Check that there is validation to ensure that a Key Element has been provided if filter conditions have been specified  Check that when UMK generates key for an Universal Event/Shipment it does not generate keys for key elements that don't meet the specified Minimum Length, Maximum Length or is the same as a specified Excluded Value  Check that when UMK generates key for an UniversalEvent/Shipment it does generate keys for key elements that either meet the specified Minimum Length, Maximum Length or is not the same as a specified Excluded Value. Also check that if a key element doesn't have a specified filter then it's always included.  Check that the filters are not applied when using "Generate Key for Universal XML" feature in the EDI message action menu

WKI_Summary: BD country profile AWB currency change to USD
details: Business Requirement: To ensure compliance with IATA regulations, the system must accurately maintain and apply the applicable currency for each country of origin when issuing Air Waybills. According to IATA rules and TACT guidance, MAWBs must be issued in the currency applicable to the country of departure, or in a recognised applicable currency (e.g., USD or EUR), as defined per country. As part of this requirement, the applicable currency for Bangladesh (BD) to be updated to USD.    Done statement:  BD country uses USD as AWB currency instead of BDT    Similar to HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=96545b5f-5757-4504-a72e-23cfd8c34690&VersionNumber=25.6.11.22&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bPJIzpjsXhHEz0S0gTniRjtQZWJlBShQh" WI00178002 - GTR: TR country profile AWB currency change to USD    BPD 10-Jul-25 11:48 GMT+10:00:   Detailed Build Design :  In Database/Odyssey/Data/Public/RefCountry/RefCountry.xml.gz  in the xml , for Bangladesh  we need to set airwaybillcurrency to USD  <RN_RX_NKAirWaybillCurrency>USD</RN_RX_NKAirWaybillCurrency>    simlar to done for Turkey(TR).    M04 10-Jul-25 12:24 GMT+10:00: I think you still need to use generator.exe to change RefCountryUpgradeTask    SKW 18-Jul-25 13:36 GMT+10:00:   The wiki page to refer to: HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/18939/How-to-update-data-in-RefXXX-tables" How to update data in RefXXX tables - Overview    SKW 21-Jul-25 12:58 GMT+10:00:   Based on Ref team's guide, for data change in RefCountry, we need to raise an incident.     "RefCountry data set has migrated to Ref Service , which means that the xml file is obsolete . To request change, pls raise HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/RefDataRepo/_wiki/wikis/RefDataRepo.wiki/11757/Request-a-SQL-Query-execution" Request a SQL Query execution - Overview with the data change."
product_candidate: BD country profile AWB currency change to USD

WKI_Summary: CW1Support login should have a visible Staff Record
details: Deliverable  The CW1Support login should have a visible Staff record.  The entire Staff record will be in View/Read Only mode and cannot be modified by anybody.  Users should be able to go to the Logs > Change Logs tab and do a search to see all LGI & LGO events.  This will provide clarity to who has logged into the system with the CW1Support login record.    Why is this needed?  Currently the login details for CW1Support are not visible and from time to time I get asked by people (from both customers and WTG staff) of a way to see who logged in and made a change to something since the logs only show that a change was made by CW1Support.  When the login details for CW1Support are visible, in the Change Logs it will show all relevant details of the login in the Reference and Event Details columns.    Currently the only way to see this is through a complex (complex to me) process through SQL (see HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=694d5819-90ce-46c9-8b2c-c259282f9e21&StorageDocPK=82c1f759-c874-4644-8a73-3d5e27a31290&Hash=%2bB774em%2bHxb%2bk9p4ZErQLfTmJqE1ZPnZu&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" CST 02-Oct-24 09:44:  File CW1Support Login Visibility.xlsx (Internal Correspondence))    Additionally with this being visible, customers would have visibility of our cw1support logins just in case it is needed for audits or whatever.
product_candidate: CW1Support login should have a visible Staff Record
