Stop adding ADD/EDT/DEL StmALog records for these tables (business objects);  2. Add Audit tab page to GUI forms of this tables (if they have edit form and visible Logs tab page);  3. Check Workflow is not affected (I think neither of these business objects support Workflow);    MEN 02-Jun-25 09:34 GMT+10:00:   Please see HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=1f916938-c624-416a-b344-1cfb3d947252&StorageDocPK=f1a13d61-f244-458c-9d42-64967bc483f1&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bqGlElt6IS5qFvhGIulyYu%2f49fS%2fkHd8V" MEN 02-Jun-25 09:34:  File WI00884888 - Investigate remove audit logs.docx (Internal Correspondence)    ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////    MEN 10-Jun-25 09:04 GMT+10:00:   We decided to proceed with the second approach. Created a new tab page called ZAuditTabPage and added it instead of Change Logs page in the registry form.  One thing to note is that when the registryItemPk is not stored in the database, we need a non-persisted business object to hold the "metadata" required for audit of this page together with the registryItemPk. That's why I created StmDataForAudit class.  Spike updated at:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/337305  Another thing to mention is after some investigation, I finally got CDC working locally for StmData. These seemed to be necessary:  1. Start the process controller service (there's a service task called CDC which writes data into Audit database)  2. Set registry System > BI > CDC > Reset CDC to true and then force upgrade so that the Audit database is recreated and starts working.  So, now the above tab shows the audit records successfully.  ========  Now we can go on and remove the code that writes manual logs (with any test code associated with them):  - RegistryItemTag.AddLog  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FRegistry%2FBusiness%2FRegistry.Business%2FRegistryItemTag%2FRegistryItemTag.cs&version=GBmaster&line=173&lineEnd=173&lineStartColumn=3&lineEndColumn=91&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  - A registry setting to enable this log: EnableEnhancedLogging  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FRegistry%2FBusiness%2FRegistry.Business%2FSystem%2FSystemDataRegistry.cs&version=GBmaster&line=5825&lineEnd=5841&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=4&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  - RegistryItemLogs : NonPersistentBusinessObject  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FRegistry%2FBusiness%2FRegistry.Business%2FRegistryItemLogs.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster      MEN 06-Jun-25 10:58 GMT+10:00:   I've been trying to add a dynamic Audit Data tab to the registry form, and I still have an issue.  To be honest, I'm not sure that I'm on the correct path because I still lack expertise on how the BusinessObjects are bound.     Approach (1)  So far I've created this spike:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/337305  Using the Audit plugin, the Audit Data tab is added to the page. But the issue is in this form, for business entity, an instance of class ?HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FRegistry%2FGUI%2FRegistry.GUI%2FForm%2FRegistryFormManager.cs&version=GBmaster&_a=contents" RegistryFormManager is being used. And this instance has a PK of its own.  But I need to change that PK every time the current Registry Item is changed, so that it will be used as in ?HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FBusinessIntelligence%2FBiIntegration%2FProduct%2FAuditDataServices%2FBusiness%2FPlugIn%2FAuditEventCollection.cs&version=GBmaster&line=100&lineEnd=100&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=86&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents" this place to query the audit data.  Unfortunately I haven't been able to do that, and the PK is fixed. Is this approach correct at all?     Approach (2)  My other approach was I did try to avoid using the plugin, and tried create the tab and dispose it every time, just like ?HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FRegistry%2FGUI%2FRegistry.GUI%2FForm%2FRegistryForm.cs&version=GBmaster&line=819&lineEnd=860&lineStartColumn=3&lineEndColumn=4&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents" how Logs tab is working at the moment.  But that resulted in some binding exceptions which I could not figure out.  Was approach (2) the correct one? And I should have tried to make the binding work?  Should I try to create a new tab page in ZArchitecture.GUI similar ?HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FArchitecture%2FGUI.UserControls%2FUserControls%2FZStmNote%2FZStmNoteForRegistryItemTabPage.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster" ZStmNoteForRegistryItemTabPage to and use that?      Maybe I should study the data binding from ?HYPERLINK "https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/Development/Development%20Team%20Workspace/_layouts/15/Doc2.aspx?action=edit&sourcedoc=%7Bbbd47738-26f1-4813-a31a-4e63572536fd%7D&wdOrigin=TEAMS-MAGLEV.undefined_ns.rwc&wdExp=TEAMS-TREATMENT&wdhostclicktime=1722945508760&web=1&wdLOR=c0D4AC408-706C-44D8-941C-7FFCCF4367A2" this document carefully?

WKI_Summary: Task Notes now supports Spell Check
details: Enhancement Request  Add in Spell Check functionality to the Task Notes text box.  I believe that this is the same box used for the Notes tab as well, so Spell Check should (might) be available there as well.  This should include all normal spell check functionality that exists, the "on the fly" check that will red squiggly underline an incorrectly spelled word as well as the right click action menu spell check items.    M.K 21-May-25 10:40 GMT+10:00:  For example of how Spell Check works and implemented, plese see message text box on eConversation tab page on this form.      MEN 21-May-25 16:30 GMT+10:00:   We need to do similar to eConversations.  In eConversations, an instance of SpellChecker is created by calling SpellChecker.InitialiseSpellcheck(econversationMessageTextBox, nameof(econversationMessageTextBox));  passing in a ZAutoCompleteTextBox.  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FEConversation%2FGUI%2FEConversationFullControl.cs&version=GBmaster&line=44&lineEnd=44&lineStartColumn=4&lineEndColumn=119&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents      SpellChecker will listen on the event of the textbox and also adds itself to the context menu.  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FArchitecture%2FGUI%2FEnterprise.ZArchitecture.GUI%2FTools%2FSpellCheck%2FSpellChecker.cs&version=GBmaster&line=86&lineEnd=109&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=7&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FArchitecture%2FGUI%2FEnterprise.ZArchitecture.GUI%2FTools%2FSpellCheck%2FSpellChecker.cs&version=GBmaster&line=285&lineEnd=285&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=50&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents        MEN 29-May-25 14:46 GMT+10:00:   After applying the spell check for TaskWithDetailsControl, DAT reported some tests failures:  https://crikey.wtg.zone/TestResults/98f4effe-221a-44a8-a54b-f17b8f5df46e      After doing investigations, I realized, for these textboxes, there's a hook to add "Pull requests" menu here:   https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FClientExtensions%2FEDI%2FZClientEDI%2FZClientEDI%2FIncidentManager%2FGUI%2FWorkflow%2FGitPullRequestMenuItem.cs&version=GBmaster&line=200&lineEnd=200&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=84&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    This event handler was being added to the textbox AFTER spell check was initialized. Here:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FClientExtensions%2FEDI%2FZClientEDI%2FZClientEDI%2FIncidentManager%2FGUI%2FWorkflow%2FEDITaskWithDetailsAndFilterControl.cs&version=GBmaster&line=42&lineEnd=42&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=60&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    But spell checker triggers ZTextBoxBaseContextMenuManager.InitializeContextMenu when we initialize it. Therefore, the next time it's called the contextMenuStrip is allready not null, and therefore the above hook for ExtraMenuItems would never be called.  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FArchitecture%2FGUI%2FEnterprise.ZArchitecture.GUI%2FControls%2FZTextBox%2FZTextBoxBaseContextMenuManager.cs&version=GBmaster&line=53&lineEnd=56&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=5&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    So, for fixing, I moved the initialization of spell checker from constructor to OnLoad so that any hooks in the other components are registered before triggering ZTextBoxBaseContextMenuManager.InitializeContextMenu.    ALSO, I noticed that the key string that we pass for SpellChecker.InitialiseSpellcheck is used for checking disable/enabled of spell checking on that text box, and should be unique.  Therefore, I added name of the parent control as a prefix to make that more unique.
product_candidate: Task Notes now supports Spell Check

WKI_Summary: APPSEC. WebPrint: lockout after several login attempts
details: M.K 30-Jun-25 11:25 GMT+10:00:  Add a temporary lockout to WebPrint web service after several authentiaction attempts with invalid passwords.  This should only lockout one user (identified by IP or some other unique id).  It should not lockout by User Name - it is used by all WebPrint Client, and we should not block all normal WebPrint Clients from working if someone tries brutforce log in.      Description from HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/6298c639-c2b7-4ccf-b07a-b2381a23dbf5?lang=en-gb" CS01995706 - WISGLOSYD - APPSEC. WebPrint threats:    Description:  The application was found to lack account lockout mechanism and   allowed successful login after multiple incorrect login attempts. An attacker   could attempt to authenticate to the web application using a password list   generated from common or previously breached passwords to gain unauthorised   access to account.    Reproduction steps:  1. Make a large number of login attampts with incorrect password  2. Make a request with correct password -> login will be successful    Impacts:  1. A lack of account lockout or authentication cooldown functionalities allow   attackers to trivially perform brute-force or credential stuffing attacks against the   affected endpoints.     Remediation:  1. Implement Rate Limiting

WKI_Summary: CW to CW: Update matching logic for subsquent messages (AMD, BR SI)
details: VPL 07-Mar-25 14:07 GMT+11:00:   Proposed Changes:  C:\git\wtg\Cargowise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Agency\Agency.DataTransfer\Universal\Common\AgencyShipmentMatcher.cs  AddPossibleMatchForAgencyShipment()   - for Booking Amendment and Booking Withdrawal, add HIR Reference       CreateMatchDelegate()   When processing Booking Amendment and Booking WithDrawal message, first try to match the Booking Request Amendment/Withdrawal to the Liner & Agency Booking by matching Booking Number and AdditionalReferenceNumber ‘HIR’.   If no match found, fallback to the current matching logic based on Booking Party and Booking Number      **To indicate the record is a Booking or Bill of Lading, use !agencyShipment.IsBillOfLadingStage          NDT 20-Dec-24 14:03 GMT+11:00:     Background:  The current matching logic for amendment messages or any subsquent message for existing jobs in L&A is   We validate the booking received from the customer for amendments by matching the booking number and booking party    Done:  Instead of using the booking party, we match using the HIR reference and booking number.  The HIR is generated in eHub when the original booking request is sent, and it is stored in carrier booking.   When amendments or withdrawals are sent, the original HIR is added to the XML in eHub.   We can use this along with the booking number to validate, instead of using the booking party.  Apply same rule to Shipping Instruction, with fallback to Booking Party & Booking Number.
product_candidate: Update matching logic for subsquent messages (AMD, BR SI)

WKI_Summary: Org Registration Code Validation Update - VN VAT - Feb 2025 law changed format
details: Country:        VN  OrgCusCod:  VAT     Problem:  Format / check digit validation of the VN VAT organisation code is out of date.    A Viet Nam February 2025 law change (Circular 86) introduced changes: https://thuvienphapluat.vn/van-ban/EN/Thue-Phi-Le-Phi/Circular-86-2024-TT-BTC-taxpayer-registration/648715/tieng-anh.aspx  A fix is now required to update the validation of TINs in Vietname to support the new format    This is a defect because the system is applying obsolete validation rules   An Update note explaining the new rules will need to be published      Last time VN VAT validation rules changed:   2023 WI that made : HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/bd174a51-cece-4ac6-b77b-f482d20a65bf?lang=en-gb" WI00579959 - Viet Nam (VN) - Change to Organization Registration Code Validation of VN VAT         Validation Warning vs Error background note:  Validation when adding a VN VAT org code can show as an error or warning.  It will show as an error when the VN VAT record in the 'Strict Enforcement of Registration Number Formats' registry is ticked.  It will show as a warning when the record in the registry is not ticked.    Please refer to Chile RUT (CL RUT) code validation error message as an example
feature_description: VN VAT - Feb 2025 law changed format

WKI_Summary: Global Search - Display Alerts when index search is behind
details: Problem Statement:  Users are unaware when the GLOW Indexing system is unhealthy or service tasks are not running.    Done Statement:  Visual warning alert indicator on both global search and index search screens when the index is unhealthy or the service tasks are not running.      BDS 01-Nov-24 13:06 GMT+11:00:   Also needs a warning if service tasks are dead, the search becomes outdated, or doesn't return anything      From the attached incident:    There are occasions when the GLOW Indexing system could be delayed. Usually do to a problem that gets reported in SCOM via /Glow/wtg/status health check.    For example this morning the Index was roughly 2 hours behind because of some hosting issues.    I think we need some visual indicator to end users to tell them that the index search is not up-to-date and they may not find recent data / changes.  Perhaps if /Glow/wtg/status is reporting unhealthy index then we just want to show something on the Module Search Screen as well as the Global Search box?    HAY 05-Dec-24 08:57 GMT+08:00:   add waning message in QuickSearch box in Legacy CW1 and module filter's description.  the Cw Next  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=90a59769-0310-4462-aae2-2de780297a7e&VersionNumber=24.12.4.57&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bJo9W4CmHGWX6knBCzczE14AksHcy5Ttw" WI00838320 - CW Next Home: Display alert and/or error on Global search result to handle.

details: Using the doc builder functionality the required system design elements and basic form are available from the Supplier Booking record to create a Cargo receipt /packing List   Once the cargo has been received a packing list (allow title change to cargo receipt) can be created for the cargo that has been received from the supplier booking.    (no sample given by UPS we could request or design as flexible doc strips)    J36 02-Sep-25 14:03 GMT+12:00: Work item HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/68b08e5d-0b1a-427a-92a1-b1a2ca0ba1a5?lang=en-gb" WI00914361 - IOM [UPS MVP] - SBK create Booking Confirmation (Sys doc elements) has already created some of these doc strips      AFE 08-Sep-25 13:22 GMT+08:00:     # Reason for change  Allow user to be able to create the Cargo Receipt document from a Supplier Booking    # Done Statement  A User is now able to print a Cargo Receipt from a Supplier Booking after receiving cargo into the CFS    # Proposed Change    Go to CW1 > Supplier Booking > Documents, click on the Customise menu, and create a new document called "Cargo Receipt " following the instructions here: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/13227/Adding-new-System-defined-Document-Menu    This document should only be available when the Load Mode is CFS or LSE    As per the HLD, we need to use some existing DocStrips, and create new DocStrips for the new document following the instruction here: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/13207/Adding-new-DocStrips-in-DocBuilder-System-Document-Element    1. Line 2 - "Company Logo"    2. Line 3 - "Document Title with Page Numbers"    3. Line 4 - "Recipient with Job Number", DocWrappers are 1) JobNumber (JSB_BookingId), 2) Date (the docuement created date) - reuse new docstrip created on WI00914361    4. Line 5 - "Order Manager Supplier Company Name & Address & Phone & Fax + Buyer Company Name & Address & Phone & Fax". This DocStrip was created in HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/68b08e5d-0b1a-427a-92a1-b1a2ca0ba1a5" WI00914361 - IOM [UPS MVP] - SBK create Booking Confirmation (Sys doc elements)    5. Line 6 - Create new DocStrip called "Order Manager Controlling Customer + CFS Address", DocWrappers are 1) Controlling Customer (Booking > Addresses - Controlling Customer), 2) CFS Address (Booking > CFS Address)    6. Line 7 - Copy the DocStrip "Goods Description + Consol Number + Container Mode" and rename it to "Order Manager Goods Description + Transport Mode + Load Mode", DocStrips are 1) Goods Description (JSB_DetailedGoodsDescription), 2) Transport Mode (JSB_TransportMode), 3) Load Mode (JSB_LoadMode)    7. Line 8 - "Order Manager Port of Loading + Port of Discharge + Origin + Destination". This DocStrip was created in HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/68b08e5d-0b1a-427a-92a1-b1a2ca0ba1a5" WI00914361 - IOM [UPS MVP] - SBK create Booking Confirmation (Sys doc elements)    8. Line 9 & 10 - Create new DocStrip called "Order Manager Cargo Receipt", DocWrappers are 1) Order NO. (Booking > Booking Line > Order Line > Order > Order No.), 2) Part No. (Booking > Booking Line > Part No.), 3) Description (Booking > Booking Line > Description, fallback to JSB_DetailedGoodsDescription if blank), 4) Marks and Numbers (Booking > Booking Line > Marks and Number, fallback to Booking > Marks and Numbers if blank), 5) Booked Quantity + Unit of QTY (Booking > Booking Line > Booked Quantity + Unit of QTY), 6) Total Received Quantity + Unit of QTY (Booking > Booking Line > Received Quantity + Unit of QTY), 7) Total Received Packages + Packages Unit (Booking > Booking Line > Received Packages + Unit), 8) Total Received Weight + Unit (Booking > Booking Line > Received Weight + Unit), 9) Total Received Volume + Unit (Booking > Booking Line > Received Volume + Unit)    9. Line 11 - "Signoff"    10. Line 12 - "Separator - End of Document"    CNF 13-Oct-25 15:04 GMT+11:00:   Total Received packages/weight and volume - source from:  LCL - CFS receipt: Total received fields  LOOSE - Dispatch: Total dispatched fields    CNF 15-Oct-25 12:56 GMT+11:00: doc type FCR

WKI_Summary: GLWOM Requests: New workflow trigger action and Additional Contexts
details: IY 10-Sep-25 18:42 GMT+10:00:    remove insert macro from the context menu for workflow trigger action REQ  PGN 28-Aug-25 10:58 GMT+10:00: for clarity the trigger action must be accessible from both Workflow trigger actions AND milestone trigger actions.    EYG 28-Jul-25 17:29 GMT+08:00:   Done Statement  could support REQ for Completion Trigger Actions if related business object could support request  could set request type if type of Completion Trigger Actions is REQ (request type code must be compatible with business object, we should set request type from booking to the order)  could set message context if type of Completion Trigger Actions is REQ  when trigger condition is met, and request type is set, request should be generated    Suggested Changes    regen  add nullable column PQ_RQT_RequestType for request type into ProcessTaskNotification    CW1   C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\CargoWise\Enterprise\Product\Operations\MasterFiles\Business\MasterFiles.Business\Workflow\WorkflowDescriptor\WorkflowTriggerActionTypeConstants\WorkflowTriggerActionTypeConstants.cs  add REQ type    C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\CargoWise\Enterprise\Product\Operations\MasterFiles\Business\MasterFiles.Business\Workflow\TriggerActionRunners\ExternalRequestTriggerActionRunner.cs  create request according to the business object and related request type    C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\CargoWise\Enterprise\Product\Operations\MasterFiles\Business\MasterFiles.Business\Workflow\WorkflowDescriptor\WorkflowDescriptor.cs  GetProcessorForTriggerActionType  add logic to handle request type and call ExternalRequestTriggerActionRunner    GetWorkflowTriggerActionTypes  check if current WorkflowDescriptor could support user validation by calling GetValidationToolSettings and then return REQ type or not.  IY 28-Aug-25 14:54 GMT+10:00:   Confirmed with Evan here we only check ValidationToolSettings.RequestTypeJobType, no need to check registry    C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\CargoWise\Enterprise\Product\Operations\MasterFiles\Business\MasterFiles.Business\Workflow\ProcessTaskNotification\ProcessTaskNotification.cs  mark other columns and request type according to TriggerActionType    STZ 08-Aug-25 10:02 GMT+10:00: We cannot use the email macro, thats html, we should use the same macro engine that the request use for evaluation        PGN 29-Apr-25 15:53 GMT+10:00: This work needs to be suspended - we cannot do both workflow triggers and validation actions in this phase. This is also not an easy problem to solve and needs consultation with the workflow team.  Suspending this work until next phase as we only need one solution for current phase delivery.  The solution to the problem of attaching a shipment to a consol is not to use the ATC event, we will hard-code the validation to run when a shipment is attached to a consol.    EMF 05-Mar-25 09:57 GMT+08:00:   in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=b68d3be5-7adf-4319-9d25-f99a844575cb&VersionNumber=24.12.13.334&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bxxpbhOR3YDf29o%2fF7WFgXdPndraiEz24" WI00836394 - GLWOM Requests: Requests generation   scenario 3 Consol estimated departure/arrival dates (new – trigger based), details in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=5b6b3b12-cd2a-48a7-9fe1-33da74bd406e&StorageDocPK=a9f21b8b-8935-4991-8036-edcc72953193&Hash=%2bvvBz%2bXYG5Q4QkTwfcTD3EA12Nn8vWoPU&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" PGN 02-Dec-24 08:51:  File RequestGenerationV2.docx (High Level Design) page 3 "Notes on item 3 – consol ETD/ETA" section  We need a new workflow trigger action to be able to create a request, and Additional Context fields to provide configurable request information.  A new HLD is needed.    EMF 15-Apr-25 15:12 GMT+08:00:   In previous design HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=5b6b3b12-cd2a-48a7-9fe1-33da74bd406e&StorageDocPK=a9f21b8b-8935-4991-8036-edcc72953193&Hash=%2bvvBz%2bXYG5Q4QkTwfcTD3EA12Nn8vWoPU&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" PGN 02-Dec-24 08:51:  File RequestGenerationV2.docx (High Level Design), we have this scenario  3. When attaching a shipment to a consol, a request is raised when:   a. The consol estimated departure is before the shipment window start date   b. The consol estimated arrival is after the shipment window end date    And we thought these consol conditions may need to be driven from workflow, otherwise we have to add temporary code to the shipment attachment process, which is unnecessarily risky and could affect non-AOM users.  So we proposed a possible solution for consol ETA/ETD. When ATC - attach event on the shipment happens, we use a marco to trigger a new workflow action REQ - Create Request, and need Additional context field to pass parameters needed by request generation.    We will need to decide if this solution for consol ETA/ETD request trigger scenario still make sense when we have the scope of Requests - Phase 2.  like do we really need to add this workflow trigger action only for consol ETA/ETD fixed scenario or more.
product_candidate: New workflow trigger action and Additional Contexts

WKI_Summary: Warning when removing user that is last member of a group
details: Problem Statement  When deactivating a Staff user and a Group that they used to belong to now has zero members and the Group is used as a Notifiction Group, there is no warning shown to user.  When a Group set as a Notification Group is empty, this can result in the notification being sent to the ALL group, resulting in spam to all users about something they do not care about or maybe even have rights to complete tasks or whatever.    Done Statements  When a Staff user is deactivated and a group that they were a member of is a used in a Notification setting in the Registry and is empty, a warning should be shown.  The Groups grid on Staff records shows the number of members in it    Expected Benefits of Done Statements  The user will be warned that a group used as a Notification Group is empty  The user can see how many members are in the Group when looking at it on the Staff record    TST 28-Aug-25 14:47 GMT+10:00: need to check both cases, staff form where you remove a group (making the notifications group empty), group form where you remove a staff (making the notifications group empty)    MRY 28-Aug-25 13:03 GMT+08:00: We should not do anything on the staff form.    From HLD:   ·     When on a Staff record and removing Groups and one will now be empty, there should not be any message shown about empty Groups, it is only to be shown on Groups.
product_candidate: Warning when removing user that is last member of a group

WKI_Summary: [FTS] Implement Index Search for Moulde 100 - LDaaS Devices
details: HYPERLINK "https://wisetechglobal-my.sharepoint.com/:x:/p/matt_qiu/EbH9ZBMIRqtEiWKGrxUQwh8BxRlPD88gCpnjSrrwQyRGig?e=nusruv&isSPOFile=1&ovuser=8b493985-e1b4-4b95-ade6-98acafdbdb01%2CDamien.Li%40wisetechglobal.com&clickparams=eyJBcHBOYW1lIjoiVGVhbXMtRGVza3RvcCIsIkFwcFZlcnNpb24iOiI0OS8yNTAzMTMyMTAxNCIsIkhhc0ZlZGVyYXRlZFVzZXIiOmZhbHNlfQ%3D%3D" Module Analysis Record Sheet.xlsx    Notes  - Priority: P2  - Technical Feasibility: Feasible  - Data Audit/CDC: Yes  - GLOW Indexing Capability: Supported  - Verified by FTS Team: No  - Data Volume Assessment: DmgDeviceHeader - 4,510 records (ediProd)    WY 24-Jun-25 14:28 GMT+08:00:   [!IMPORTANT]only want to support Global Search for this module, no need to support module search because of the less data    WY 23-Jun-25 13:10 GMT+08:00:   Background  1) Dev side  LDaaS Devices module and LDaaS Device Models module share the same table - DmgDeviceHeader    the data source of these 2 modules is decided by DmgDeviceHeader - CDH_IsTemplate    LDaaS Devices - CDH_IsTemplate == false  LDaaS Device Models - CDH_IsTemplate == true    2) Glow side  DmgDeviceHeader has been split into 2 entity types  a) IDmgDeviceHeaderDevice - CDH_IsTemplate == false  b) IDmgDeviceHeaderTemplate - CDH_IsTemplate == true    3) Dev side doesn't know Glow's 2 entity types    Design  1) Glow: only add 2 index fields(Identifier & Description) in Glow\CargoWiseOne\Configuration\Index\IDmgDeviceHeaderDevice.yaml  2) Dev: add one case in GlobalSearch.EntityFilterMap to display well for LDaaS Devices module  3) Dev: in GlobalSearch.cs, manually specify the relationship for  IDmgDeviceHeaderDevice - LDaaS Devices  IDmgDeviceHeaderTemplate - LDaaS Device Models  4) for HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/9eb10f80-6773-4c1c-8829-e429dfc33d6c" WI00918372 - [FTS] Implement Index Search for Moulde 99 - LDaaS Device Models, they have the similar DDB

WKI_Summary: Document Delivery to eDocs: type PDF no longer defaults
details: CDZ 16-May-25 15:28 GMT+08:00:   Root Cause :   In HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/NewWorkItem/a5a99e18-5b45-4d1c-aaee-97858eae367f?lang=en-gb" WI00649681 - Ability to password protect an excel report, if we choose eDoc delivery method, the delivery type will be changed to editable (see AttachmentType_ReadOnly in DocDeliveryContact.cs)  But the attachment type always be empty in GetDefaultAttachmentType method, which cause this issue.    -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  From incident:  when delivering documents/inovoices to Deliver "eDoc" the Type "pdf" is no longer defaulted.  before last release, type was always defaulted to pdf as soon as eDoc is selected. since monday, the type remains empty and pdf has to manually be selected before the document can be deliverd to eDoc    JNC 16-May-25 08:44 GMT+08:00:   Duplicate to HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/9475ca81-5336-4cfc-9c19-ce476fa6e725" WI00909538 - Attachment Type Cleared automatically when eDoc selected as Delivery  Comments copied from there:    Defect Background & Summary  Not only did HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/NewWorkItem/a5a99e18-5b45-4d1c-aaee-97858eae367f?lang=en-gb" WI00649681 - Ability to password protect an excel report allow users to deliver documents and reports in Excel formats with open & modify passwords but it also opened up allocating password protected Excel files to the eDocs.  This is all great and stuff.  But it also had an unintended side effect with the strait to eDocs delivery option on the Deliver Documents form.  When that option is selected, the file type field was not selectable and the file would be allocated in the format System > DocManager > eDoc Import File Format.  Now since that check in, when users select eDoc delivery, the Attachment/File type option is now editable and is empty.    Proposed Fix  On the attached incident HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/0ed45a25-489a-4f78-9bc0-45071c8f2757?lang=en-gb" CS01953298 - LOGWINASC - Attachment Type Cleared automatically when eDoc selected as Delivery, and on task 83, Justin proposed the following fix which sounds like a great plan:    So seems like we can make a defect WI to fix:   - If the registry System > DocManager > Allocate Password Protected Excel Spreadsheets is enabled, and the Password Required field is flagged for the document, we make the type selectable.    - Otherwise, we make it readonly - keep it same as before, so that customers won't get confused.       JNC 15-May-25 13:15 GMT+08:00:   Well, above is my yesterday's thoughts, now I think we can make it simpler:   If eDoc is selected, we still make the Attachment/File type editable and selectable, but we can pre-fill it with the value from registry System > DocManager > eDoc Import File Format, no need to consider Allocate Password Protected Excel Spreadsheets.

WKI_Summary: [AuditLogs] Turn Off Audit logs for workflow tables
details: AO 04-Dec-24 13:16 GMT+11:00:   Remove CustomLogReferenceSuffix and turn IsAutoLogged off for workflow tables    J30 11-Dec-24 17:27 GMT+11:00:     Impacted table should include:    GenCustomAddOnRule  StmEvent  ProcessTaskTemplate (Not in HLD)  ProcessCompanyLinkRule  ProcessFieldChangeRule    ProcessWorkflowExceptionType is in HLD, but seems it doesn't override IsAutoLogged    Steps:  1 remove IsAutoLogged overiding from above classes  2 Remove CustomLogReferenceSuffix from above classes if there is, like ProcessTaskTemplate   3 Add table name to AutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigurationValues    J30 13-Dec-24 17:00 GMT+11:00:   Add below for EDIMessage:    EDIMessageContentFilter  EDIMessageDeliveryContextSelector  EDIMessagePurpose    J30 23-Jan-25 17:39 GMT+11:00:     1 Add below for related Form test     protected override bool AllowTopLevelBusinessObjectNotBeAutoLogged   {   get { return true; }   }    2 Move ClearCache logic in ProcessFieldChangeRule from OnSaving to OnSaved  This happens because we add [ProcessFieldChangeRuleSchema.Constants.TableName] = (false, false, false) to AutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValues. When ProcessFieldChangeRule is being saved, an stmALog change occurs after the OnSaving() method is called in ProcessFieldChangeRule. This stmAlog change causes ProcessFieldChangeRules to be loaded into the cache again. However, since the ProcessFieldChangeRule hasn't been saved yet at that point, the cache cannot be refreshed.    J30 28-Jan-25 18:09 GMT+11:00:   TestEnableAddAndEditLogsItemsRegistryItem_WithSomeOverriddenItems_ContainsOverridenAndDefaults has out of index issue before, when the defaul values size > 2  the new stmEvent will not add stmAlog any more as we turn off the autologging, modify some test cases for count how many logs processed.    J30 02-Feb-25 12:56 GMT+11:00:   Currently, the parent BO is saved with an updated SystemLastEditTimeUtc when a child changes when ShouldLogIfOnlyChildrenChanged = true.    https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FArchitecture%2FBusiness%2FZArchitecture.Business%2FBusiness%2FBusinessObjectLogging%2FBusinessObjectLoggingStrategy.cs&version=GBmaster&line=89&lineEnd=89&lineStartColumn=4&lineEndColumn=32&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents      var loggersForChangesInChildren = businessObjectLoggers.Value.Where(b => b.ShouldLogIfOnlyChildrenChanged(businessObject)).ToList();    If we disable audit logging without adding a registry entry, businessObjectLoggers.Value becomes null (previously, it was AutoAdminBusinessObjectLogger). As a result, the parent BO cannot update SystemLastEditTimeUtc and save.  Currently, this affects ProcessFieldChangeRule, preventing it from clearing the cache when its child BO's ProcessFieldChangeField changes. Other BOs with parent-child relationships may also be affected. We may need solve this problem later.  As a temporary solution, suggest adding ProcessFieldChangeRule to the registry until we figure out how to properly resolve this issue.    J30 03-Feb-25 17:05 GMT+11:00:   Remove ProcessFieldChangeRule this time for above issue.    J30 21-May-25 10:45 GMT+10:00:   Resume changes for ProcessFieldChangeRule after the issue fixed
product_candidate: [AuditLogs] Turn Off Audit logs for workflow tables

WKI_Summary: [EAD] Interchange Sender Proxy to support Native
details: Original UPN  https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=aace073a-dccb-44eb-acad-a58ea9fc6d88    EDI message security right is being implemented in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&LicenceCode=EDIAUSSYD&ControllerID=Project&BusinessEntityPK=b8540298-59ca-449f-9b02-44b77ab51851&VersionNumber=25.4.2.29&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bjtzzlvi2rRg%2bGgvCeH6cjLnb31tp%2bYMN" Project PRJ00044411 which is relying on the correct user context being set  For eAdaptor Next Async, when there is no Staff Proxy set on EDI Client, setting User Context falls back to the method described in above linked UPN which is based on EDI Interchange sender. This method applies to EDI messages created from eHub, xT, eAdaptor SOAP, eAdaptor Next Async with Interchange  This method was introduced only for Universal, it should support Native also     Move the registry item "Interchange Sender Proxy Users" from under eServices->Universal XML to under eServices directly since it will apply to Universal and Native  Change wording to  "This setting maps EDI Interchange sender code to a corresponding Staff Proxy user. When an EDI message is processed by UMI/NMI service task, the system checks the sender code and assigns the associated Staff code as the processing user. If no match is found, the default system user is used instead."    ADP 23-May-25 14:59 GMT+10:00:   assigns the associated Staff code as the processing users  as seen in the other WI, the processing user is referenced to:  Message record> Create User  Message record> Last Edit User  Message record> Notes> By User    J30 27-May-25 18:02 GMT+10:00:   Update NativeHandler at here: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FNativeDataTransfer%2FDataTransfer.Native%2FEnterprise.DataTransfer.Native.Business%2FNativeHandler.cs&version=GBmaster&line=68&lineEnd=68&lineStartColumn=8&lineEndColumn=12&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  The logic is simliar to https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FUniversalDataBuss%2FUniversalDataBuss.Management%2FManagement%2FUserContextExtractor.cs&version=GBmaster&line=104&lineEnd=104&lineStartColumn=23&lineEndColumn=44&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    Change the category of InterchangeSenderProxyUsers: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FRegistry%2FBusiness%2FRegistry.Business%2FeServices%2FeAdaptorRegistry.cs&version=GBmaster&line=255&lineEnd=255&lineStartColumn=18&lineEndColumn=40&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    J30 10-Jun-25 12:57 GMT+10:00:   As confirmed with Christina, Just like with UXML, the last editor of the EDI message should be Proxy user, but the creator doesn’t necessarily have to be.
product_candidate: [EAD] Interchange Sender Proxy to support Native

WKI_Summary: [EAD][OUTBOUND][EHC] Add EI_RetryCount as a Criteria to EHC for eAdaptor
details: AR7 26-Jun-25 15:32 GMT+10:00:   We have EHC service task in CW which is responsible for checking a few health-check criteria and send notifications via the means specified by the customers (email, etc) in case something is wrong in the outbound interchanges.  One of its responsibilities is to find if there has been any new failed eAdaptor outbound interchanges and send an alert/notification to the customer if any. The problem with the current logic is that it only checks for Failed interchange status which never happens for eAdaptor interchanges as eAdaptor outbound doesn't fail any interchange and tries forever.    The goal of this work item is putting `EI_RetryCount` for the EDI Interchange into play i.e. EHC service task should check for outbound EDI Interchanges belonging to eAdaptor with AQU status and EI_RetryCount greater than or equal to a threshold (the threshold should be configurable in registry. An item in "eServices > eAdaptor > Health Check > Failed EDI Interchange" with minimum allowed value of 1), and notify them as failed interchanges.        Note to the developer:    The code for this part is located in `Enterprise/Product/Core/eHubMessaging/ServiceTasks/HealthChecks/FailedEDIInterchangeHealthCheck/eAdaptorOutboundFailedEDIInterchangeCheckJob.cs`. The class inherits from `FailedEDIInterchangeCheckJob`. We probably need to make changes to the base class and the eAdaptor-specific inheriting one. We should ensure that the base class can still work as before if the retry count is not supplied (like for eHub or xT cases).      AQN 08-Jul-25 09:39 GMT+10:00:   I have added a new registry named eAdaptorFailedEDIInterchangeRetryThreshold under eServices > eAdaptor > Health Check > Failed EDI Interchange to keep the value of retry threshold. AQU status has been recently changed to QUE. Now in failed EDIInterchange check job, we are checking the QUE status along with retry count threshold in addition to the previous failed status.
product_candidate: [EAD][OUTBOUND][EHC] Add EI_RetryCount as a Criteria to EHC for eAdaptor

Please, clarify - do we only deliver CAV as AUX for events that come from Terminator or PortConnect ?  CAVs pushed by carriers through EDI will be still considered duplicates. WKI_Summary: ACAS - Add ACAS sub-tab to MAWB and HAWB forms
details: M04 20-Mar-25 13:48 GMT+11:00:     We already have an AccountingInformation table, which we are using in the export AWB header. There is an Accounting tab in the AWB parameters, where the data is based on specific types representing customer-related account information.    Therefore, we can extend this by introducing a new types specifically for US ACAS. In the lookup for the export AWB, we can maintain the existing structure, but in the ACAS tab, we can filter by ACAS types. This approach provides flexibility while helping us avoid performance issues.  The table name is ExportAWBAccountingInformation  We can add new type for Acas in the [EA_InformationID] "AWBHeaderManager.AWBAccountingInformations.EA_InformationID"  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FArchitecture%2FCore%2FCore%2FCodeDescriptionPair%2FCodeDescriptionPairList.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster    We will have   public interface ICustomerAccountInfoProvider   {    ZBool IsVerifiedKnownConsignor { get; }    ZString CustomerAccountIssuer { get; }    ZString CustomerAccountNumber { get; }      ZString CustomerAccountHolder { get; }    ZString CustomerAccountName { get; }    ZString CustomerAccountShippingFrequency { get; }    ZString AccountEstablishmentDate { get; }    ZString AccountBillingType { get; }      ZBool ShouldProvideVerifiedKnownConsignor { get; }    ZBool ShouldProvideCustomerAccountIssuerAndNumber { get; }    ZBool ShouldProvideCustomerAccountHolderAndName { get; }    ZBool ShouldProvideCustomerAccountShippingFrequency { get; }    ZBool ShouldProvideAccountEstablishmentDateAndBillingType { get; }    ZBool ShouldProvideEmailInfo { get; }   } after refactoring https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/308816?_a=files    We need to modify lockup for Accountinfo in the AWB table to show Types like before,  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FExportAWB%2FExportAWBAccountingInformation%2FExportAWBAccountingInformationLookups.cs&version=GBmaster&line=20&lineEnd=20&lineStartColumn=2&lineEndColumn=53&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  We can put override info in the EA_Information  We do not need to have schema change  If we have these param in the table which means that we have overrided it. if we do not have value which means that we are using calculated values. no need schema change    We might need to modify in this part as well. this refactoring can help better approach https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/308816?_a=files we should not call the metod two times we can handle it by filtering in the app level    https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FExportAWB%2FExportAWBHeader%2FExportAWBHeader.cs&version=GBmaster&line=941&lineEnd=997&lineStartColumn=3&lineEndColumn=4&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  We need to introduce new types for ACAS information because, when storing them in ExportAWBAccountingInformation, we must distinguish which type corresponds to which field.    2- UI Changes per HLD   3- For FWB and FHL, we should return the overridden value if it has been overridden; otherwise, it should remain as before. WKI_Summary: Registry item Service Task Unload Timeout is used for single purpose
details: HYPERLINK "https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/Development/Development%20Team%20Workspace/_layouts/15/doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B3cadbe0b-4c1b-4e55-8e8a-45370596d740%7D&action=edit" HLD - WI00948030 - Registry item Service Task Unload Timeout is used for single purpose.docx  RTN 21-Aug-25 10:38 GMT+10:00:   Problem:   We have 1 registry item (ServiceTaskUnloadTimeout) which is controlling multiple parts of the Process Controller Behaviour     1) Timeout length for creation of runners   2) Idle timeout of runners   3) Timeout length for clean shutdown of runners prior to force killing the runner    Solution:   Split this 1 registry item into separate registry items for each individual section      In HOST  1.  On creation of runners - after creating the runner process, wait for this amount of time for a ready signal from the runner before giving up and killing the runner process.  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/1acd91cb5b0337e0c2874312867893324ee5e733/Enterprise/Product/Core/ServiceManager/ServiceManager/ServiceManager.Host/Helpers/ProcessRunner/ProcessServiceRunnerFactory.cs#L61   new registry item: RunnerStartupTimeout    - Description: Time that the Host will wait for the runner to start up and become ready for commands. If exceeded the runner process will be forcefully killed    2.  CheckIdleStatus - check for runners that have been idle for longer than this timeout value and Stop any runners that have.  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/1acd91cb5b0337e0c2874312867893324ee5e733/Enterprise/Product/Core/ServiceManager/ServiceManager/ServiceManager.Host/Helpers/ProcessRunner/ProcessRunnerPool.cs#L234   new registry item: RunnerIdleTimeout    - Description: If a runner has not executed a service task in more than this time period, it will shutdown    In RUNNER  3.  When the runner tries to shut down, it tries to wait for the grpc channel to close gracefully, but after this timeout it gives up and just shuts down.  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/1acd91cb5b0337e0c2874312867893324ee5e733/Enterprise/Product/Core/ServiceManager/ServiceManager/ServiceManager.Runner.CW/GrpcRunner.cs#L43   rename registry item: Service TaskUnloadTimeout => RunnerShutdownTimeout    - Description: When shutting down a runner we allow a certain time for the communication channel to gracefully shutdown, after this period the process is forcefully killed    4. RunnerMessageWaitTime:   Time that the runner will wait before it considers the host non-responsive and shuts itself down    All will be the same format as the service task unload timeout    RTN 28-Aug-25 09:34 GMT+10:00:   Thought, all new registry items or should 1 be a rename?  I think all new, because we need to ensure that the RunnerMessageWait Time starts off larger than RunnerIdleTimeout  All new registry items makes this easy
product_candidate: Registry item Service Task Unload Timeout is used for single purpose

WKI_Summary: Index Search by Country
details: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=3ec8c27c-e238-4ebe-903e-6032923d5d80&StorageDocPK=a9bba4cd-7d34-462a-aa68-316293ecd1cb&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b7rtheZfR5fMEHyP2nSuKilap49msKkpL" DL4 09-Sep-25 09:34:  File Escalation for CS02056685 - DEHLICPFK - Index Search by Country.docx (Escalation Document)      DL4 09-Sep-25 09:34 GMT+08:00:  The problem's origin is a technical limitation within the IndexSearchModuleNKFilter. It currently supports only four comparison operators: IsBlank, IsNotBlank, exact, and not equal. It critically lacks the "StartsWith" functionality required to fulfil the user's request.     Recognizing that searching UN/LOCODE fields by country is a high-frequency, universal requirement, we will specifically add a new "StartsWith" comparison operator for these filters as a priority within this initiative to quickly resolve this critical pain point.      WY 09-Sep-25 11:15 GMT+08:00:   There should be no problem technically, but I'd like to reserve my opinion on the functional implementation    Background  1) NKFilter, nature key filter, normally we use the entity code(GlbStaff.GS_Code, RefUNLOCO.RL_Code) to associate one entity  2) GuidFilter, foreign key filter, we directly use the DB table field to associate one entity  3) For the current incident, we are talking about NKFilter  4) In Index Search mode, the current comparison operator list of NKFilter is: exact, not equal, is blank, is not blank  5) In SQL mode, NKFilter has one extra comparison operator - filter match(it's not supported for Index Search)      Concerns  1) Because it's an NKFilter, we can treat this filter as a whole entity instead of one specific field of the entity, so the current comparison operator list makes sense well.    I think adding 'starts with' breaks the form and definition of this filter, should the whole ENTITY start with some strings? or should the whole ENTITY not start with some strings?    It becomes a TextFilter and an NKFilter, fine, if other customers raise incidents to add 'no starts with' or 'none exact' or 'any exact', what will we do? continue supporting these?    2) NKFilter and GuidFilter have no GUI differences in fact, so if customers raise incidents to add 'starts with' for GuidFilter? How can we explain this well? From a technical point of view, this is not possible because we are using one specific GUID to associate entities    Feel free to discuss more.

WKI_Summary: [EAD] Add feature code for eAdaptor Next
details: XC 12-Mar-25 23:38 GMT+11:00:     Reason for Change:     CW1 branch and CWN branch will merge as one  March 19 DPR is the new base for CW, That is 2 April STD, 30 April GP1, 23 July GP2    For customers who take the upgrade, if they were continute to use EDI client module and EDI Communication Modes module we need to add them using the new feature code framework    Proposed Changes:   https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/blob/e18d02c7442a4a58a1d1c370040eb2489b6f2f10/CargoWise.Definitions/src/Definitions/Licensing/LicenceFeatureCodeList.cs   Add new code: eAdaptorNextFeature, EADNXTFTR     Done Statement  Add new feature codes for eAdaptor Next which include the access of both EDI Client Module and EDI Communication Modes Module  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/blob/e18d02c7442a4a58a1d1c370040eb2489b6f2f10/CargoWise.Definitions/src/Definitions/Licensing/LicenceFeatureCodeList.cs    For DEV: add new codes to the feature code lists as per HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/15969/Implementing-Feature-Control-in-Code?anchor=1.-define-your-feature-control-code" Implementing Feature Control in Code - Overview  For PRODUCT: once above code change is checked-in, go to Feature Control module in ediProd and add new rule for existing clients using eAdaptor next  refer to instruction in HYPERLINK "https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=8e738ff6-c3c7-4d55-bd52-a201395f7db0" CargoWiseUpdateNote20240807h (page 4-7)    2. Currently in Organisation Record- > Details -> Config -> EDI Communication  EDI client field is visible for any system that's CWN  We need to hide that (or grey out), only show it when the feature code EADNXTFTR is enabled for the system    AR7 13-Mar-25 13:12 GMT+11:00:   More resources regarding this:    https://wisetechglobal-my.sharepoint.com/:w:/p/david_james/EavNTgxgQfRBgk0Pg8lJo1oB5UUtHO3bNFsNwRiuHvV60w?e=zlXsSy  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/15969/Implementing-Feature-Control-in-Code    AMZ 18-Mar-25 17:57 GMT+11:00:   What I am testing:    1: You cannot see the EDI Client Mode Module or the EDI Communication Mode Module through Maintain > EDI Message  2: When opening an Organization Record (any existing organization works for this test). Navigate to Details > Config > EDI Communications; check that the EDI Client Column is hidden and not available when using the 'Customize Columns' feature.

WKI_Summary: Deliver second actual CAV (either from terminal or carrier) as AUX event.
details: LKW 22-Aug-25 16:06 GMT+10:00:   further alignment with Jeeva and Dan:  CAV: keep mapping Department=Carrier / Department=Terminals  Keep as-is behavior to deliver both container level CAV from carrier and vessel level CAV from OneStop when both are available  in CW, expect container level CAV will only update Container CTO Available, vessel level CAV from OneStop wil only update Routing CTO Available  No special handling to be done for OneStop vessel level CAV. CAV still delivered, no AUX created        DN4 20-Aug-25 10:51 GMT+10:00: Also NOTE: This need to deploy in 3 places: Terminator, SS and GCT    DN4 19-Aug-25 15:03 GMT+10:00: Noted by Conor: After his check in, some event parameters (e.g. TransportMode) is available from SavedProviderContainerEventDetails. So we can delay calls to ParseEventParameters() until later    DN4 08-Aug-25 13:15 GMT+10:00: Move to second phase, where Aux event is generated    DN4 24-Jul-25 17:49 GMT+10:00: Adding Department=Terminal into EventParameters could also be done from the sources  In GCT: PortConnectEventsMessageConverter  In Terminator (SeaShanty): POVRRetriever and TRNMRetriever  For OneStop in SeaShanty, in VesselEventsRetriever.Helpers.cs, method CreateUniversalEvent(). (NOTE: we also need to identified which IPortCallsDataSource is terminal)  However, that raise the question, should we add "Department=Terminal" to all events from terminals ?  LKW 25-Jul-25 10:31 GMT+10:00: only EventType=CAV needs the Department=Terminal  CAV (Cargo Available) from carrier means that carrier is happy to release the cargo; but it does not necessarily mean the customer can pick up the cargo from the terminal. There can be terminal operations/customs inspections happening.  CAV from terminal means the terminal is happy to release the cargo, which really means the cargo can be picked up.  So CAV from different party may have different interpretations, not soley due to it having a different data source    DN4 23-Jul-25 17:34 GMT+10:00: May add another ContainerEventDeliveryAction: CavReplacementAux --> for better communicate to AuxiliaryEventCreator    DN4 23-Jul-25 09:48 GMT+10:00:   Will need change in two places:   1. AuxiliaryEventCreator: when the source event is CAV, then       a. If eventParameters[Department]=Terminal, then replace it with eventParameters[From]=Terminal. Otherwise leave it as is      b. Set eventParameters[EventCode] = "CAV"  2. ContainerEventDeduplication: if an "actual CAV" is duplicated, delivery action should be ReplacementAux instead  LKW 23-Jul-25 12:01 GMT+10:00: reminder this duplicate checking needs special handling to ignore "Department" paramter.  DN4 23-Jul-25 17:28 GMT+10:00: Checking of EventParameter is within GetContainerEventDuplicates() method, so we should add a method to exclude "Department" parameters when searching for duplicated "Actual CAV"    Notes: May add another setting into ContainerEventDeliveryProcessorSettings, which listed all provider codes that are terminal (e.g. OneStop, PortConnect, Terminator)  Questions: Does this WI also update existing CAV, adding "eventParameters[Department]=Terminal" ?  LKW 23-Jul-25 12:02 GMT+10:00: Yes that is the first point in the revised Done Statement  DN4 23-Jul-25 16:56 GMT+10:00: The container event is parsed from UniversalEvent in NewContainerUniversalEventProcessor.Parse() --> we can add "Department" to eventParameters there.  However, some event will have ProviderCode="SeaShanty", EventSource=OneStop (see: https://ctsportal.wtg.zone/containerevents#eventParameters=&eventSource=OneStop&eventType=CAV&providerCode=), while others have ProviderCode=PortConnect (see https://ctsportal.wtg.zone/containerevents#eventParameters=&eventSource=&eventType=CAV&providerCode=PortConnect)      LKW 21-Jul-25 12:30 GMT+10:00:   solution change refer to below highlighted option B  Option B: Deliver Terminal CAV as AUX   when there is another actual CAV (either from terminal or carrier), instead of just not delivering it, deliver an AUX event.  AUX event FRM=<party> can indicate the event source  Customers that care about precise terminal CAV can configure their workflow on AUX to update CTO Available   idea illustration: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=d54a272c-9ef3-46a8-b19a-c4ed8f2fabc4&StorageDocPK=84eadf4d-c833-4907-8d7a-7414f588740f&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2byJ6kmzMKXSdhjoTZnPKT19UUpQXXO3ZF" LKW 19-Jun-25 17:19:  File Option B - Deliver Terminal CAV as AUX.pdf (Client Correspondence / Screenshots)    expected behavior (test case):  CAV from carrier received in GCT (Department=Carrier)  CAV delivered to CW  then CAV from terminal received in GCT (Deparment=Terminal...to-be mapped per providers like OneStop, PortConnect, Terminator)  detected CAV as duplicate*, CAV is not delivered to CW   an replacement AUX event is delivered (From=Terminal based on the deduplicated CAV)    note: OneStop CAVs will not fall into this case because their CAV have ANYCONTAINERNUMBER and will not be treated as duplicate    regression in current expected behavior if terminal CAV came before carrier CAV   CAV from terminal received in GCT  CAV delivered to CW  then CAV from carrier received in GCT (Department=Carrier)  deteced CAV as duplicate*, CAV is not delivered to CW   an replacement AUX event is delivered (From=Carrier based on the deduplicated CAV)    Revised Done statement:  add "Department=Terminal" to event parameters for CAV created from OneStop, PortConnect, Terminator  when checking for duplication of CAV event, if there were duplicate actual CAV delievered before (except Department*, all other parameters are the same), an replacement AUX is delivered  UPN is published  LKW 21-Jul-25 18:38 GMT+10:00:   I've ever thought of not adding Department to CAV so that GCT can detect duplicate easily based on current design  if so, how can GCT set the "From" party in the AUX event? by manitaining a list of providers that are classified as "Terminals"? (e.g. Terminator, PortConnect)    YMK 22-Jul-25 11:59 GMT+10:00: Yes, we can check the event source. Please, clarify - do we only deliver CAV as AUX for events that come from Terminator or PortConnect ?  CAVs pushed by carriers through EDI will be still considered duplicates.  LKW 23-Jul-25 12:00 GMT+10:00:  correct      RJV 18-Jul-25 13:24 GMT+10:00:   We can go with the Option B, delivering terminal CAV as AUX.    LKW 19-Jun-25 15:53 GMT+10:00:     per analysis in data files, found challenges in effectively executing the current proposed solution (deliver Carrier CAV as AUX if we have port integration at the ARV location):    1. Locations where there is port integration <> has CAV provided  e.g.  OneStop integration includes NZLYT and PHMNL, but UNLOCOs that support CAV excludes NZLYT and PHMNL. Also while we do receive terminal CAV at AUMEL, there were significant missing terminal CAV cases in AUMEL across different terminals, checking root causewith OneStop support.  ref data file: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=d54a272c-9ef3-46a8-b19a-c4ed8f2fabc4&StorageDocPK=5edbc69f-942d-4960-acd0-98150be577b4&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bmTmaYlXcvSrIpMcbF9CXb%2bGiEZRbLsio" LKW 19-Jun-25 15:54:  File OneStopCAVanalysis_v4.xlsx (Sample File)    2. For some UNLOCO, only partial terminals have integrations (e.g. US terminals, DPW (to-be)); but it is difficult to configure down to terminal level as we do not necessarily have that info from corresponding ARV/FUL of container.    This creates a risk where we expect to have Terminal CAV, but end up not receiving Terminal CAV; and then results in no actual CAV delivered to the consol.  If the terminal CAV does not provide it for some reason, it is out of our control.  illustration: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=d54a272c-9ef3-46a8-b19a-c4ed8f2fabc4&StorageDocPK=b86040a4-97cf-43ae-8966-b84fd9a602c3&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bArUIMpsqB2snnVoxCHqFVcgLMK3dnrOL" LKW 20-Jun-25 10:15:  File challenges in current solution.pdf (Client Correspondence / Screenshots)    Counter propose two new options for the solution:  Option B: Deliver Terminal CAV as AUX   when there is another actual CAV (either from terminal or carrier), instead of just not delivering it, deliver an AUX event.  AUX event FRM=<party> can indicate the event source  Customers that care about precise terminal CAV can configure their workflow on AUX to update CTO Available (@RJH is this feasible?)  idea illustration: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=d54a272c-9ef3-46a8-b19a-c4ed8f2fabc4&StorageDocPK=84eadf4d-c833-4907-8d7a-7414f588740f&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2byJ6kmzMKXSdhjoTZnPKT19UUpQXXO3ZF" LKW 19-Jun-25 17:19:  File Option B - Deliver Terminal CAV as AUX.pdf (Client Correspondence / Screenshots)    Option C: New Event Code for Terminal CAV  keep delivering Carrier CAV as CAV like today, no impact to general customer base  setup new event code for Terminal CAV, CA remap OneStop and Trinium CAVs to this event  If there is Terminal CAV, deliver new event separately  require change in CW to process new event type; and will update CTO Available field  (today if there was an estimated CAV delivered, then later an actual CAV delivered, it also will result an update in CTO Available field)  idea illustration:HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=d54a272c-9ef3-46a8-b19a-c4ed8f2fabc4&StorageDocPK=45792972-b0f9-4ea9-985b-8145a795ff90&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bvtpeXZyvR115ae1dyKqtrqLEGZ72%2fQYW" LKW 19-Jun-25 17:19:  File Option C - New Event Code for Terminal CAV.pdf (Client Correspondence / Screenshots)    I would suggest option C as it is a cleaner differentiation, shall be lowest impact to customers and most manageable in the long run when we expand on terminal integrations. (e.g. DP World seems to be able to provide both releases as separate events)  Require review with Rajah Jeevaraj for new decision. On leave until 07-July    CMA 06-Jun-25 09:50 GMT+10:00:   Exclude PortConnect UNLOCO's  OneStop UNLOCO's are ('AUADL', 'AUBEL', 'AUBNE', 'AUDAM', 'AUDRW', 'AUEPR', 'AUFRE', 'AUMEL', 'AUPHE', 'AUPKL', 'AUSYD', 'NZLYT', 'PECLL', 'PHMNL') + TRNM locations    DN4 04-Jun-25 10:49 GMT+10:00: We should be able to do this in ContainerEventDeliveryProcessor.  At the moment, we already send AUX event for ARV/DEP with delivery action AdditionalAux or ReplacementAux    We should update containerEventDeliveryResolver.Resolve(), such that CAV with event source from Carrier & Unloco from a specified list of UNLOCOs with resulted in ReplacementAux instead of Deliver.  On checking, if they're CAV event, then we will create AUX event from it with the modified event parameters.    Current, from the mapping files, the following Unlocos is applied: AUADL,AUBEL,AUBNE,AUDAM,AUDRW,AUFRE,AUMEL,AUPHE,AUPKL,AUSYD,NZAKL,NZLYT,NZTIU,NZTRG,PECLL,PHMNL,PHMNN,PHMNS,USJAX,USLAX,USMIA,USMOB,USNYC,USOAK,USSEA  (put these into configuration file ContainerEventDeliveryProcessorSettings)    LKW 02-Jun-25 11:47 GMT+10:00:   initiated from HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/e0e1ddef-d9f3-4436-a2b5-005dfd2ccf28?lang=en-gb" WI00907053 - Review CAV mapping from carriers (from incident)  Background:  today CAV events delivered to CW will auto update 'CTO Available' field   'CTO Available' in CW intends to represent Cargo Availability from Terminal.  CAV from carriers may not exactly represent CTO Available, but it is still a useful information for customers to plan their pickup. We shall still be delivering these events to CW and CW shall still be updating the CTO Available field to trigger workflows.  However we shall prioritize CAV from Terminals if possible.(especially like in incidents, customers take CAV from OneStop to compare against the delivered CAV from carrier).   This depends on whether CA has a data source to get Terminal CAV for that location.     proposed logic flow: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=d54a272c-9ef3-46a8-b19a-c4ed8f2fabc4&StorageDocPK=9059c8b7-887f-4445-87b9-e26dd6cd5ea7&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bUH5SfXFMGH3t11d5a2mwl1SckANV1mEf" LKW 02-Jun-25 13:46:  File to-be CAV logic flow.png (Attachment)    Done Statement:  Setup a list of UNLOCOs where "Terminal level CAV available" for prioriting Terminal CAVs  initial UNLOCOs: AU ports covered by OneStop, US terminals covered by Trinium integration   ref HYPERLINK "https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/Product/Product%20Team%20Workspace/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B4295A157-CF50-4FD5-98F3-9D45FDFBC496%7D&file=Sea%20Shanty%20Mapping.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=f1cd584a-fd1a-43d5-b55a-b1ce724099a8&isSPOFile=1&clickparams=eyJBcHBOYW1lIjoiVGVhbXMtRGVza3RvcCIsIkFwcFZlcnNpb24iOiI0OS8yMzEwMTIyNzcxMiIsIkhhc0ZlZGVyYXRlZFVzZXIiOmZhbHNlfQ%3D%3D" Sea Shanty Mapping.xlsx "Ports" where Event Types contains 'CAV'   PortConnect is excluded because it is enabled for one customer TOLL  GCT add logic when determining delivery action for CAV events.  if event source from Carrier & UNLOCO in terminalCAVsupported, do not deliver. Generate an AUX event with Parameter: Facility=CTO| Location=<eventlocation>|EventCode=CAV|From=Carrier. (do not repeat Department = Carrier)  AUX delivered to CW will be for customer's reference only  (expect the terminal CAV will be delivered from Terminal data source for the subscription)    Update Note is publisehd     SMS 04-Jun-25 03:58 GMT+10:00: queries:  1) Are we assuming that if UNLOCO in terminalCAVsupported e.g. AUSYD - CAV will always be delivered from terminal or port provider?   2) Are we assuming that terminal/port provider CAV is also more timely that carrier? Just for timeliness considerations/impact.   3) Do we need any further analysis done to validate the above assumptions?  Actual CAVs https://ctsportal.wtg.zone/containerevents#eventSource=&eventType=CAV&isActual=true&searchCarrierBookingReference=  Note on point 2. DONE above for clarity - AUX will not trigger any field update in CW but it will be used by customer for reference and potential workflow triggers/miletones.

WKI_Summary: SQL Server password policy
details: Use PasswordControl to validate the password supplied in SetSQLPasswordForm.    CW staff password complexity requirements can be configured in the registry under *Registry > Password Controls*, which allows users to tweak a few options like minimum length, minumum numbers, minimum non-alphanumeric etc. which is validated when changing passwords  - https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/4b5c6b399522b05965ce1245cfe9f4e367cf16b1/Enterprise/Product/Operations/MasterFiles/Business/MasterFiles.Business/Global/Staff/GlbStaff/Password/PasswordControl.cs#L137    You should also consider all of the passwords that have already been set that do not meet these complexity requirements.

WKI_Summary: [Macros][MCR] Implement Database Store Expression Caching Provider
details: AR7 30-Dec-24 15:55 GMT+11:00:   Dependent on HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=dc449a1d-e2f4-4e4b-ba64-1ddf1c6fe718&VersionNumber=24.12.29.8&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bBdv%2fqESdqGQR31D9cF%2fDYI0pY%2f%2bHTf8I" WI00848223 - [Macros] Implement an Abstract Caching Provider Mechanism for Expressions  Design and implement a database-store caching provider designed in the above work item for in CargoWise.Macros. We might need to create a new table. Or might be able to simply use dbo.StmData for this purpose.    KNC 06-Jun-25 10:03 GMT+10:00:     Part 1 - DataStore  The goal of this part is to create a class responsible for reading from and writing to the StmNote table.  Read – Given an identifier, retrieve the serialized SyntaxNodes associated with that identifier as a JSON-formatted string object.  Write – Given an identifier and serialized SyntaxNodes in JSON format, store this in the StmNote table.  Stored in StmNote:      ST_ParentID: Workflow Template Parent PK      ST_NoteText: Serialized JSON      ST_Description: "Serialized Macro SyntaxNode V1.0""      Part 2 - Persistant Cache    Memory AST Cache is empty - MAC  Persistant AST Cache is empty (New) - PAC  Queried Serialized AST Cache is empty (New) - QAC    If MAC Miss   Try Get QAC   If  QAC Miss Else Return    Try Get PAC    if PAC Miss else populate QAC return     Compile and Serialize Expression     MAC Stored     QAC Stored     PAC Stored    Questions:  First run heavy DB hits  Should we introuduce a first run variable.   If we miss PAC don't try again with the same ST_ParentID   However, writes to PAC is still heavy    Update Mechanism, if me miss all the cache. We can't delete all notes accociated with ST_ParentID  Should we do it based on when Template is saved.   Load all serialized expression check which one doesn't get hit - Delete BUT this means we'll need to reserialize everything for comparison   We could also store the macro in database as well, but no separator would work   We could store it with different note context and match via a GUID in front of of macrotext and Serialized JSON   Wait we already store Template Variable in StmNote we can just pre
product_candidate: [Macros][MCR] Implement Database Store Expression Caching Provider

WKI_Summary: FB: Reefer Settings (Air Vent & Humidty) display and validations
details: LZG 23-Apr-25 14:06 GMT+08:00:   Done Statement:   HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=e3956b77-9f15-4637-9f6f-3cab01ce3952&StorageDocPK=1138b145-90d7-4273-bccc-d40888aa17e5&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=ediprod&Hash=%2bnL%2biHIFtF3XRyyeW3BUXTAqNPukMlIaS" RJV 16-Apr-25 17:26:  File HLD[2].docx (High Level Design)     Proposed Changes:  WW 24-Apr-25 11:17 GMT+10:00: Only apply below change to the new form. (Don't add based on the registry, just add change to the new form). We will add a note in the UPN.  The whole purpose is that we no longer need to maintain the old form version.  1) Air Vent field text display   Enterprise/Product/Documents/ExcelTemplates/Forms/Forwarding/BookingRequest2.xls   Enterprise/Product/Documents/ExcelTemplates/Forms/Forwarding/BookingRequest3.xls     Enterprise/Product/Documents/ExcelTemplates/Forms/Forwarding/ShippingInstruction2.xls   Enterprise/Product/Documents/ExcelTemplates/Forms/Forwarding/ShippingInstruction3.xls     Enterprise/Product/Documents/ExcelTemplates/Forms/Forwarding/ShippingOrder.xls   Enterprise/Product/Documents/ExcelTemplates/Forms/Forwarding/ShippingOrder2.xls      Enterprise/Product/Documents/ExcelTemplates/Forms/Forwarding/eManifest.xls     When no air flow unit is selected by user, display "Air Vent: Closed"   When any air flow unit is selected (not empty), display e.g. "Air Vent (Open): 0 MQH"    WW 24-Apr-25 11:17 GMT+10:00: below logic is already shared between old and new forms, so it is fine that the same change can reflect on old form. No need to add additional calculation for new form.  2) Validation for 'AOH' Carrier Requirement   Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Documents/DocDataObjects/CarrierMessage/CarrierMessageDataBuilder.cs    AddContainersAirflowOrHumidityValidation   Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Documents/DocDataObjects/CN/ShippingOrder/ShippingOrderBuilder.cs    AddContainersAirflowOrHumidityValidation     1. Change the validation back to error.   2. Only display the above error when Air Vent unit is entered, and Humidity is NOT zero when the carrier has 'AOH' flag. This means that no error should display when Air Vent is 0 + no unit, and Humidity is zero.    WW 24-Apr-25 11:17 GMT+10:00: below logic is new, so only add it to the new form.  3) New Validations   Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Documents/DocDataObjects/CarrierMessage/CarrierMessageDataBuilder.cs    AddContainerValidation   Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Documents/DocDataObjects/CN/ShippingOrder/ShippingOrderBuilder.cs    AddContainersValidation   Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Documents/DocDataObjects/CN/eManifest/EManifestBuilder.cs (Shipment)    AddContainerValidation      1. Validation for 'Air Vent (Open): 0 MQH/2L/P1'     AirVentFlow.Value is zero, AirVentFlow.Unit.Code is not empty    Warning: "Air Ventilation will be set to 'Open' when the flow rate is 0 MQH. If you need the vent to remain 'Closed,' remove the flow rate unit in Consol > Containers > Refrigeration > Air Vent Setting > Unit."   2. Validation for non-zero + '2L'     AirVentFlow.Value is non-zero, AirVentFlow.Unit.Code is '2L'    Warning:"Carriers accept airflow measurements exclusively in metric units. Any airflow specified as 'cubic feet per minute (2L)' will be automatically converted to 'cubic meters per hour (MQH)' during transmission."    Confirmed with Wayne. We do not need to make changes to eTerminal Release Manifest form(Consol).    RJV 16-Apr-25 17:25 GMT+10:00:   Refer HLD:HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=e3956b77-9f15-4637-9f6f-3cab01ce3952&StorageDocPK=1138b145-90d7-4273-bccc-d40888aa17e5&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=ediprod&Hash=%2bnL%2biHIFtF3XRyyeW3BUXTAqNPukMlIaS" RJV 16-Apr-25 17:26:  File HLD[2].docx (High Level Design)       WW 03-Mar-25 14:36 GMT+11:00:   To opmimise our user experience with the air vent settings, especially when it comes to a carrier with 'AOH' carrier requirement flag (e.g. Maersk), follow changes are required:    Problem 1: The validation "This carrier requires temperature-controlled container to include either Airflow or Humidity, not both." was changed from error to warning in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=NewWorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=d722e1b0-f2f9-4a7f-b63d-2a6c826c2566&VersionNumber=25.3.3.20&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bz5JKvCct6mADoRiGk4zjN8%2fqGEbwQ%2bYU" WI00638753 - Allow user to send Booking Request to MAEU without AirVent/Humidity.  This currently allows our customer to send both Air Vent and Humidity to Maersk. However, when both are provided, Maersk will interpret Air Vent as CLOSED. (See Melinda's comments in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=aab6fe25-df96-4a20-b5f0-f75741501fdf&VersionNumber=25.3.3.20&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bRXPbfVUbypz6Fsft6H8iJIXw8Icdq35j" WI00748254 - OCM: BR Maersk - Send Closed Vent)  Solution: Change the validation back to error.    Problem 2: The validation "This carrier requires temperature-controlled container to include either Airflow or Humidity, not both." appears when air vent is closed (no unit) and no humidity is setup.  However, this scenario is accepted by Maersk. See HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=063b50a7-c50f-48a1-8c3b-83b43afcad70&StorageDocPK=548e5988-ebb0-4576-937d-a86d71977b08&Hash=%2bFJfQr67P6gEr1pxN9pnVfN7nJg%2bTHuQZ&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" WW 03-Mar-25 14:48:  File EDI-58927 _ Cargowise _ EDI Booking request _ Ventilation[0].msg (Client Correspondence / Screenshots)  Solution: Only display this error when Air Vent unit is entered and Humidity is NOT zero when the carrier has 'AOH' flag.    Problem 3: Currently when 0+blank unit is setup, our form builder is only showing "Air Vent: 0", which is not clear to our users whether it is open or not.  Solution: When no air flow unit is selected by user, display "Air Vent: Closed"                 When any air flow unit is selected (not empty), display e.g. "Air Vent (Open): 0 MQH"     Test scenarios. Check BR/SI/SO/EM forms for text display, while only BR/SI/SO forms for the validation.  1. Both Air Vent and Humidity are entered not zero  Maersk: should display the validation error. Air flow text on FB should be e.g. "Air Vent (Open): 2 MQH"   Other carrier: No error should display. Air flow text on FB should be like "Air Vent (Open): 2 MQH"     2. Only Air Vent is entered not zero. Humidity is zero.  Maersk and other carriers: no error should display. Air flow text on FB should be e.g. "Air Vent (Open): 2 MQH"     3. Only Humidity is entered not zero. Air Vent is 0 + no unit.  Maersk and other carriers: no error should display. Air flow text on FB should be "Air Vent: Closed"    4. Air Vent is 0 + no unit, and Humidity is zero.  Maersk and other carriers: no error should display. Air flow text on FB should be "Air Vent: Closed"    5. Air vent is 0 + MQH, and Humidity is zero.  Maersk and other carriers: no error should display. Air flow text on FB should be "Air Vent (Open): 0 MQH"    6. Air vent is 0 + MQH, and Humidity is NOT zero.  Maersk: should display the validation error. Air flow text on FB should be "Air Vent (Open): 0 MQH"   Other carrier: No error should display. Air flow text on FB should be "Air Vent (Open): 0 MQH"     Previous Maersk mapping change will be cancelled in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=5fea4bcf-b430-4b10-b306-fda69dbaa9a6&VersionNumber=25.3.3.20&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bHVKIiElNwa0nzKqgEq5Az1%2fUaiZ8Ta%2bm" WI00876957 - OCM: Revert the change in WI00748254
product_candidate: Reefer Settings (Air Vent & Humidty) display and validations

WKI_Summary: [CCA] Support Contracts with same ID & Carrier but NOT Overlapping Date Range
details: SRH 29-Sep-25 16:14 GMT+13:00: UPN to be prepared in subject WI covering both subject WI and also changes in HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/a552a33c-add7-44da-b093-20d2f80a0bd7?lang=en-gb" WI00951767 - [CCA] Prompt user to auto-fix overlapping contracts in CCA portal      User Story:  As a contract manager, I would like to check Contract Date Range, Service Provider and Contract ID combination to identify a unique contract, so that we can solve this business case - sometimes carriers may use the same Contract ID, and extend the expiry date or at a later date range.    Problem:  Couldn't create and save a contract if the contract ID and Service Provider combination already exists, but date ranges are different.    Done Statement:  Check Contract Date Range, Service Provider and Contract ID combination to identify a unique contract.    Refer to the HLD in the eDocs tab, for detailed logic and scenarios.      DS2 25-Oct-24 16:17 GMT+11:00:   The suggestion is to split out the defaulting logic with multiple contracts:    HYPERLINK "https://teams.microsoft.com/l/message/19:7f5582f5d1ea4f14826e0ef46469751c@thread.skype/1729659372058?tenantId=8b493985-e1b4-4b95-ade6-98acafdbdb01&groupId=b6f21079-0274-4a08-b1d4-f8f21a4fe5cf&parentMessageId=1729659372058&teamName=Development%20International%20Team&channelName=Allocations%20Management&createdTime=1729659372058" Chanjun Park: WI00810162 - [CCA] Contract validity checks date range  posted in Development International Team / Allocations Management on Wednesday, 23 October, 2024 3:56 pm   .  My suggestion for phase 1, if there is an overlapping contract, an error message is shown in Glow, e.g.  This contract (CONTRACTA, 12-Feb-2024, No expiry) overlaps with another active contract (CONTRACTB, 25-Feb-2024, 29-April-2024) with the same Service Provider (MAELINZZ).    On the consolidation & booking grids in CW1, read-only information about the start/expiry date of the contract should be shown.  There will be a lot of places in Glow that need to be updated to use these new fields.    CJP 02-Jul-25 15:29 GMT+10:00:   See notes here  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/Shared/_wiki/wikis/Forwarding%20Work%20Item%20Wiki/18602/WI00810162-CCA-Support-Contracts-with-same-ID-Carrier-but-NOT-Overlapping-Date-Range    LS 18-Aug-25 14:47 GMT+10:00: Phase 2 to be completed under HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/a552a33c-add7-44da-b093-20d2f80a0bd7?lang=en-gb" WI00951767 - [CCA] Prompt user to auto-fix overlapping contracts in CCA portal
product_candidate: [CCA] Support Contracts with same ID & Carrier but NOT Overlapping Date Range
