WKI_Summary: EInv: validation message when overriding EDI Communication Mode
details: Done Statement: a validation warning and confirmation messages is shown to the user when entering an EDI Communication Mode for GEI messages    On Org > Details > Config > EDI Communications    Doing this is a legitimate case for using middleware to do eInvoicing. But, sometimes, customers do this incorrectly.  We want to put a barrier up to make it harder for people to do the wrong thing.    Proposed barrier:  * Validation Warning - suspect this will have little effect  * Pop up confirmation - this should have a bigger impact  * Additional Update Note - the pop up can link to an update note which outlines the legitimate use case, and consequince if the customer has no middleware implementation of their own (apparently, we aren't allowed to do this ??)      UPN: https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/DevelopmentAccountingTeam-AccountingProductDocumentation/Shared%20Documents/Standalone%20Workitems/WI00857868/UPN%20-%20WI00857868%20-%20EInv%20validation%20message%20when%20overriding%20EDI%20Communication%20Mode.docx?d=wcbe23ec446c2428598ee50dac4793455&csf=1&web=1&e=gIR8el    UAT: https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/DevelopmentAccountingTeam-AccountingProductDocumentation/Shared%20Documents/Standalone%20Workitems/WI00857868/UAT_WI00857868%20-%20EInv%20-%20validation%20message%20when%20overriding%20EDI%20Communication%20Mode.xlsm?d=we70fb21b5a84489dbd4d610b2ba41e15&csf=1&web=1&e=bDJuy4
product_candidate: validation message when overriding EDI Communication Mode

WKI_Summary: GLWOM - Add Buyer to the SBK in viewable form only

KPN 11-Oct-25 11:16 GMT+08:00:   Reason for the change  To view the Buyer in the same area as the Controlling Customer, Consignee Address when you have a Supplier Booking open    Done  When a supplier booking is opened, the Buyer code and address is visible under Buyer Addresses, in read-only format. WKI_Summary: [DDD] - Calculate DDD from the values imported via XML
details: AWP 23-Jan-25 12:36 GMT+11:00: Decision tree updated after clarification.    AWP 21-Jan-25 08:16 GMT+11:00:   Updated decision tree to specify what happens when automatic calculation is not active for the transport mode    Decision Tree    DDD automatic calculation is active when the registry item CalculateDeliveryDueDateByTransportMode is enabled for Air Freight, currently the only supported transport mode.    Import requirements are similar for Forwarding Shipments and for Bookings    Conditions                                                                  Decision Node    1.  DDD Element is present in the XML                                         1        1.  The DDD Value in the XML is not blank                               1.1       leaf node          => Use the DDD Value from the XML        2.  The DDD Value in the XML is blank AND                               1.2              automatic calculation is active for transport mode            1.  All necessary parameters are present                            1.2.1     leaf node (for both new and modified shipments)              => the DDD value will be calculated            2.  Not all necessary parameters are present                        1.2.2     leaf node              => the DDD value will be cleared        3.  The DDD Value in the XML is blank AND                               1.3       leaf node              automatic calculation is not active for transport mode          => the DDD value will be cleared    2.  DDD Element is not present in the XML                                     2        1.  A new shipment/booking is being created AND                         2.1              automatic calculation is active for transport mode            1.  All necessary parameters are present                            2.1.1     leaf node              => the DDD value will be calculated            2.  Not all necessary parameters are present                        2.1.2     leaf node              => the DDD value will be left blank        2.  An existing shipment/booking is being modified AND                  2.2              automatic calculation is active for transport mode            1.  No necessary parameters have changed                            2.1.1     leaf node              => the DDD value will be left unchanged            2.  Necessary parameters have changed                               2.2.2                1.  All necessary parameters are present                        2.2.2.1   leaf node                  => the DDD value will be calculated                2.  Not all necessary parameters are present                    2.2.2.2   leaf node                  => the DDD value will be left unchanged        3.  A new shipment/booking is being created AND                         2.3       leaf node              automatic calculation is not active for transport mode          => the DDD value will be left blank        4.  An existing shipment/booking is being modified AND                  2.4       leaf node              automatic calculation is not active for transport mode          => the DDD value will be left unchanged    === below this line are obsolete ===    AWP 12-Dec-24 14:29 GMT+11:00:     Update after review    Decision Tree    DDD automatic calculation is active when the registry item CalculateDeliveryDueDateByTransportMode is enabled for Air Freight, currently the only supported transport mode.    Import requirements are similar for Forwarding Shipments and for Bookings    Conditions                                                                  Decision Node    1.  DDD Value is present in the XML                                         1        1.  The DDD Value in the XML is not empty                               1.1       leaf node          => Use the DDD Value from the XML        2.  The DDD Value in the XML is empty                                   1.2            1.  All necessary parameters are present                            1.2.1     leaf node              => the DDD value will be calculated            2.  Not all necessary parameters are present                        1.2.2     leaf node              => the DDD value will be cleared    2.  DDD Value is not present in the XML                                     2        1.  A new shipment/booking is being created                             2.1            1.  All necessary parameters are present                            2.1.1     leaf node              => the DDD value will be calculated            2.  Not all necessary parameters are present                        2.1.2     leaf node              => the DDD value will be left blank        2.  An existing shipment/booking is being modified                      2.2            1.  No necessary parameters have changed                            2.1.1     leaf node              => the DDD value will be left unchanged            2.  Necessary parameters have changed                               2.2.2                1.  All necessary parameters are present                        2.2.2.1   leaf node                  => the DDD value will be calculated                2.  Not all necessary parameters are present                    2.2.2.2   leaf node                  => the DDD value will be left unchanged    === below this line are obsolete ===    AWP 12-Dec-24 08:38 GMT+11:00:     Overrides the previous rules    Decision Tree    DDD automatic calculation is active when the registry item CalculateDeliveryDueDateByTransportMode is enabled for Air Freight, currently the only supported transport mode.    Import requirements are similar for Forwarding Shipments and for Bookings    Conditions                                                                  Decision Node    1.  DDD Value is present in the XML        1.  The DDD Value in the XML is not empty          => Use the DDD Value from the XML                                   1.1            2.  The DDD Value in the XML is empty                1.  All necessary parameters are present              => the DDD value will be calculated                             1.2.1                    2.  Not all necessary parameters are present              => the DDD value will be cleared                                1.2.2    2.  DDD Value is not present in the XML        1.  A new shipment/booking is being created                1.  All necessary parameters are present              => the DDD value will be calculated                             2.1.1                    2.  Not all necessary parameters are present              => the DDD value will be cleared                                2.1.2        2.  An existing shipment/booking is being modified            1.  No necessary parameters have changed              => the DDD value will be left unchanged                         2.2.1                    2.  Necessary parameters have changed                1.  All necessary parameters are present                  => the DDD value will be calculated                         2.2.2.1                                2.  Not all necessary parameters are present                                1.  All necessary parameters were present previously                      => the DDD values will be cleared                       2.2.2.2.1                                    2.  Not all necessary parameters were present previously                      => the DDD value will be left unchanged                 2.2.2.2.2    === Obsolete below this line ===    AWP 05-Dec-24 13:40 GMT+11:00:   DDD automatic calculation is active when the registry item CalculateDeliveryDueDateByTransportMode is enabled for Air Freight, currently the only supported transport mode.    Import requirements are similar for Forwarding Shipments and for Bookings    WHEN a new shipment/booking is created via XML   AND all necessary parameters are present   THEN the DDD is calculated.    WHEN an existing shipment/booking is updated via XML   AND no necessary parameters have changed   THEN the DDD is not calculated or modified    WHEN an existing shipment/booking is updated via XML   AND the DDD is not already present   AND all necessary parameters are present   THEN the DDD is calculated    WHEN an existing shipment/booking is updated via XML   AND the DDD is already present   AND all necessary parameters are present   AND parameters have changed   THEN the DDD is recalculated  MM7 10-Dec-24 15:10 GMT+11:00: Let's talk about this case with Elena. I think we shouldn't calculate DDD in this case.  AWP 11-Dec-24 14:59 GMT+11:00: Agreed - I am already in discussion with Elena over changes to this.    WHEN an existing shipment/booking is updated via XML   AND the DDD is already present   AND all necessary parameters are present   AND parameters have not changed   THEN the DDD is not recalculated    WHEN an existing shipment/booking is updated via XML   AND the DDD is already present   AND some necessary parameters are missing   AND at least one missing parameter was previously missing   THEN DDD is left unchanged    WHEN an existing shipment/booking is updated via XML   AND the DDD is already present   AND some necessary parameters are missing   AND no missing parameter was previously missing   THEN DDD is set to empty    The DDE and RDD events should be raised as per normal (existing manual) functionality.    Notes/Delivery Due Date Calculation Log is updated as per normal (existing manual) functionality.    The proposed code modification is to the function ForwardingShipment.CalculateDeliveryDueDateIfNecessary() to ensure all these cases are covered correctly.      EZK 19-Nov-24 17:40 GMT+11:00:   When a Forwarding Shipment or Booking is created from the imported Universal XML, and all values required for calculation of DDD are present, the system should automatically calculate the Delivery Due Date.   Please refer to the Escalation document and the UPS incident attached.
feature_description: Calculate DDD from the values imported via XML

WKI_Summary: AM:(ESC) Change LoadArchiveSet from SQL to C#
details: KGG 14-Oct-25 09:22 GMT+11:00:   !!Please read before funcitonal testing!!  I've organised each of the archive systems for testing into individual workflows, and each of these functional review workflows run simultaneously  Please take care not to accidentally put your tasks in another workflow, that includes being careful of sequence numbers spilling over  All of the review workflows are prerequisites to the check-in so please ensure that you have closed all of the tasks in your workflow once you have completed testing  If the archive system has already been tested, please cancel the review task and leave a note in the task description    KGG 14-May-25 18:11 GMT+10:00:   Currently, we do not have the ability to apply filters to related records loaded as part of an archive set. The easiest way to remedy this is to stop loading archive sets in the stored procedure and, instead, load the archive sets in C# code itself.    DONE = all MainArchiveableFilters the same formatting as the JobHeaderArchiveableFilter (broken up into individual filters)  DONE = Switch all archive systems (except HAR, PAR, DOT, and all MAI systems like RED, PAL and PDE) using the LoadArchiveSet stored procedure     First coding workflow: change all the MainArchiveableFilters so they match JobHeaderArchiveableFilter 's formatting (except HAR)  Second coding workflow: Switch archive systems (except HAR, PAR, DOT, and all MAI systems like RED, PAL and PDE) to load archive sets in code instead of in SQL    Sharepoint progress page: https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/sites/ArchiveManager/Lists/Progress%20Page/DispForm.aspx?ID=2    KGG 04-Sep-25 12:40 GMT+10:00:   Handing over to Aiden (A05) as I'm going on leave. At the time of writing this, it's been undergoing an extensive sanity check for approximately the last 2 days to ensure performance has been maintained. Once the sanity check has passed, it's ready for a regression test. All archive systems (except HAR, PAL, and RED) are affected by these changes. What needs to be functionally tested are that the same sets are loaded/skipped.
product_candidate: (ESC) Change LoadArchiveSet from SQL to C#

WKI_Summary: Deletion of RefDeliveryDayMap
details: CST 21-Nov-24 15:08 GMT+11:00:  See attached incident for more details.  And this would probably require a TAN rather than a UPN.    Detailed Build Design:  This module was made accessible to developers only in 02-Feb-2009 WI00014858.  Therefore the chance that any client is using it or even knows what it is is exactly 0% and we can remove it without any cleanup needed.  We could archive attached eDocs, Notes, Logs and the values of the bizo itself on related branch, but I don't see the point as none of this would have been visible to clients for 2.5 decades (!).  There is one thing we may need a transform for - removing 'RefDeliveryDayMap' from the uberfactory cached tables (SystemDataRegistry.cs). Not sure what happens if a cached table literally doesn't exist anymore.    TST 02-Dec-24 16:38 GMT+11:00: Transform not needed as having an illegal table in CachedTables is OK (we just use for HashMap.Contains, we never iterate it)  One thing I didn't delete is translations in Resources.xml files. Not sure if this is necessary but would need automation as there's too many of them.

details: LGN 10-Sep-25 12:01 GMT+10:00:   Proposed changes:  1. Locating new Document menu  Go to CW1 > Container Load List > Documents and click Customise menu, create a new document "Container Load List Manifest" as per https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Wiki.Archive/blob/master/CargoWise-Wiki/Documents-%26-Reports/Adding-new-System-defined-Document-Menu.md  To view the Container Load List module, you have to enable Advanced Order Manager with Feature Control Management, following the guide below: https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Wiki.Archive/blob/740fa8acc7f215e872a1049b99ffd4d967be6b1f/CargoWise-Wiki/International/Order-Manager/Knowledge-Share/Feature-Control-Code-necessary-for-Advanced-Order-Manager.md    2. Adding docstrips  Following the latest HLD HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=ba9a6f9e-388b-4730-aa83-28b8e438efc2&StorageDocPK=c21cbc2a-c4c3-4e90-a4d3-6a6d4ae41612&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b0YV0lYmhLotfGwMhflURWcqzYOs5cYOy" LGN 10-Sep-25 15:58: File WI00917525_V2 Identify Requirements Design Document CLL Manifest.xlsx (High Level Design)  we will have to create and use existing Docstrips for the document as per  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Wiki.Archive/blob/master/CargoWise-Wiki/Documents-%26-Reports/Adding-new-DocStrips-in-DocBuilder-System-Document-Element.md:  Additionally, to use existing docstrips, copying the active system defined docstrips over from another module is most likely needed as there are no documents that currently exist for Container Load List.  Make note to check that the docwrappers for these existing docStrips work in the new Container Load List module.   From the CommonContainerLoadList, you follow the relationships as following to display the : CommonContainerLoadList.LoadListLines, ContainerLoadListLine.Container, CommonContainer.Consol      HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/68b08e5d-0b1a-427a-92a1-b1a2ca0ba1a5" WI00914361 - IOM [UPS MVP] - SBK create Booking Confirmation (Sys doc elements) can be used as a reference for this WI as the majority of it has been completed.  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------    Using the doc builder functionality the required system design element and basic form are available from the CLL record to create a manifest of the final loading done by the supplier. Essentially a container manifest of what was packed.    (no sample given by UPS we could request or design as flexible doc strips)    CLL - Container load list for FCL  Effectively this is like the Booking Confirmation - but from the actual load plan records.  Ensure you can see the load by container.    Need learning material / Rough picture of what is required    ASL 01-Sep-25 10:44 GMT+10:00: Some points to clarify here:    1. UPS do not need both a landscape & portrait version. Lets stick to Portrait for this first document  2. See the spec in eDocs for the docStrips which we need to create new from scratch HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=ba9a6f9e-388b-4730-aa83-28b8e438efc2&StorageDocPK=00a8dca6-2600-457d-9c40-7e5d0040ec2c&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bs0CvQZO7O%2fx%2bX%2bwVJjnurxM2OdwrY7nC" ASL 01-Sep-25 10:47: File WI00917525_Identify Requirements Design Document.xlsx (High Level Design)  3. a Container Load List (CLL) in AOM must be connected to a Consol, therefore the Container information will be pulled from the Consol to the CLL  4. The Load Sequence of the Cargo within the Container is found when CLL has a status of PLC, SHP or CNV. Select Container Load List > Select lines & edit quantities > When you click on the relevant container number, you can view the load sequence.  5. Right now, this document is one per Container.
feature_description: From a CLL record I can create a container manifest Document

WKI_Summary: Validate matching communication mode on demand instead at every save
details: NFR 31-Oct-24 10:09 GMT+11:00:   Background:  Performance issues reported by DSV - HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=292637f5-4353-4f59-80d7-798edd262e7c&VersionNumber=24.10.31.343&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b11SrAsfkblraoT102BUc2lHkvSPuBGDr" CS01727125 - DSVHHS - Save action on ASM takes long  Analysis shows the validation for communication modes is a major contributor for the total save time for large ASM shipments    DHL also reported in the past where a Registry was provided as a workaround - HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=4912efa2-d7dc-47b6-bbb6-d2292a265fd6&VersionNumber=24.10.31.343&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bhsKWSjo%2fagxFuTde3XCPBnoomwpIS79h" WI00443904 - Quick fix: Toggle for validation warning on X* trigger actions  "Registry > Workflow Manager > Trigger Action Communication Mode Validation".    Done:  The validation check for matching communication mode at every Save do not make sense and will be discontinued.  Introduce an option on job "Actions > Validate communication mode".  This will then show the warning on all trigger actions which fails the validation.      AO 06-Nov-24 10:33 GMT+11:00:   DBD:  A simple change could be to override RunPreSaveValidationCore to not call ValidateAll- instead it can just call another private method.  CheckPQ_Calc_TriggerParty    DBD: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/286374
product_candidate: Validate matching communication mode on demand instead at every save

WKI_Summary: Tighten up MS365 OAuth 2.0 Token Registry validation
details: Done  Both the Physical Server > Mail > OAuth 2.0 > Microsoft 365 > Incoming > OAuth 2.0 Access Token for Incoming and Physical Server > Mail > OAuth 2.0 > Microsoft 365 > Outgoing > OAuth 2.0 Access Token for Outgoing Registry settings have validation to prevent tokens acquired with an incorrect email account.    Problem Description  When an OAuth 2.0 token is acquired with an incorrect email account, this can lead to issues, mostly with Inbound mail however there might be some edge cases with Outbound mail.  Inbound - If token is granted with the credentials of another email account other than the system email account, it can lead to downloading email from that inbox and not from the system email inbox.  Outbound - Emails might be sent from the incorrect mailbox and can cause issues with the From sender with insufficient Send As permissions.  And other potential problems    BEE 25-Sep-25 16:36 GMT+10:00:   Confirmed with Craig that the Incoming should validate against the MailboxUserName and the outgoing should validate against the SMTPUserName    BEE 13-Oct-25 15:12 GMT+11:00:   Confirmed with Craig that if Username is empty/blank, then need to also raise a validation error with a message to indicate that it needs a value    BEE 14-Oct-25 14:18 GMT+11:00:   Confirmed with Craig that validation needs to be also done on Incoming/Outgoing usernames for the case when a Token is already present (and saved) and the user updates the Username. Require that the token be empty or matches the Token username. This will be done in a different workflow to the ms365token validation
product_candidate: Tighten up MS365 OAuth 2.0 Token Registry validation

WKI_Summary: Chad (TD) VAT rate change from Jan 2024
details: Background:  2024 Finance Act is passed on 28 Dec 2023. It includes changes regarding VAT rates:    1. The standard Value Added Tax rate is cut from 18% to 17.5% from 1 January 2024.  2. An additional centime to finance provinces and municipalities is introduced with a rate of 10%. This additional 10% centime applies to VAT thus bringing the final effective Standard Rate to 19.25% (17.5% x 1.1%)  for all taxable transactions and 9.9% (9% x 1.1%) for reduced rates products.    This results in an effective rate of 19.25% for the Standard VAT and 9.9% for Reduced Rate VAT    FLN 16-May-25 15:00 GMT+10:00: Due to timing issue also there has been very little news coverage and customer incidents about this change, we missed the change in 2024. There are two customers in Chad. One (Geodis) informed us about this change in May 2025.    Change Required:  • Product: Set end date on STD rate 18% as 31 December 2023  • Add new rate for STD 19.25% with start date 1 January 2024    References:  Facture Electronique Normalisee - government e-Invoice reporting portal:  https://fen.finances.gouv.td/  The guide was published in mid 2024 and confirms the standard vat rate is 19.25% and does not need dissection into it's national/city components    Chad tax office website is: https://dgi.td/  Within that website there is an official link to the Facturation Electronique Normalisee (FEN) portal pages
product_candidate: Chad (TD) VAT rate change from Jan 2024

WKI_Summary: [AIR][FUL/FLO/RCV] Add TYP=COMPLETE for final event
details: MM7 09-Sep-24 08:57 GMT+10:00:   Problem Description  According to the findings of this work item's investigation: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=221f6628-2fc0-48a1-be2b-53580a776f43&VersionNumber=24.9.9.12&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b9S1vfX8o8Y4sw7XcQhVpEaBnVNKZxvCI" WI00787774 - Missing FUL on partial/split cargo (AIR Consols)  Method: CreateRecreateOrUpdateEventLog  Will replace a log if it has no reference free text and if the params are a subset of the params about to be added    e.g.   Log A (EventCode: ARV Reference: "|ABC=123") exists in memory    Call CreateRecreateOrUpdateEventLog with Log B (EventCode: ARV, Reference: "Propagated Shipments|ABC=123|DEF=456")    Log B will currently replace Log A by replacing the whole reference instead of adding a new log  This is because the "Free Text Reference" or the text before the first | is empty and the params of logA are a subset of the params of logB.  This logic has always been like this and is used everywhere.    In our case, it happens when we have both Consol and Customs Declaration in FUL event. The events will be propagated from shipment to consol.     In Processing "FUL", "FLO", and "RCV" events: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FConsol%2FForwardingConsol.cs&version=GBmaster&line=9306&lineEnd=9307&lineStartColumn=6&lineEndColumn=32&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  We create a final event, when the number of partial parts reaches total.  The final event that we add it here https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FArchitecture%2FBusiness%2FZArchitecture.Business%2FBusiness%2FEventManagement%2FPartialEventHandler.cs&version=GBmaster&line=42&lineEnd=58&lineStartColumn=4&lineEndColumn=5&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    Its parameters are less then the one that has been propagated by shipment via its declaration. Therefore, it would be replaced by it.      Done Statement  Final "FUL", "FLO", "RCV" event, shouldn't be replaced by any propagated event. It should have an extra parameter in its reference to make it different from partial events.    Proposed Solution  To avoid this, we can add a "TYP" for "FUL", "FLO", and "RCV" event. When they are partial, it is "Parial" and when we add the final event, its type is "Complete". It helps our customers to distinguish "PARTIAL" event, from "COMPLETE" event. It also prevents CreateRecreateOrUpdateEventLog event replacment.    Current:  |FAC=CTO|LOC=GBLHR|TTL=48     |FAC=CTO|FDT=2024-04-09|LOC=GBLHR|PTL=8|TTL=48|VFL=TG916     The first event is a subset of the second so they are considered the same so add the new parameters and don't duplicate     Possible solution  |FAC=CTO|LOC=GBLHR|TTL=48|TYP=COMPLETE     |FAC=CTO|FDT=2024-04-09|LOC=GBLHR|PTL=8|TTL=48|VFL=TG916|TYP=PARTIAL     Now they are considered different as TYP param is different

WKI_Summary: [LWLOGS] LWM logs each iteration
details: LWM logs the number of things it deleted from the StmALogQueue or StmALogQueueWTE when it's done.   However there's a 500ms wait before it retries.   In busy systems this mean LWM can be running for hours and then it logs it's done 10 million things.  This makes it look like LWM is stuck but it's working fine  If LWM does >0 things log it   Happens in QueueLogs : ILogWalkerOperation    AET 10-Sep-25 17:13 GMT+10:00:   After discussing with Jamie it was decided that we should change the format of the logs so that they're like [LogsQueued:1] and also have it log every minute and when it finished processing.      AET 15-Sep-25 14:02 GMT+10:00:   Check that when LWM has finished running it logs [LogsQueued:{TotalNumberOfLogsProcessed}]  Check that after a minute of continuous running LWM logs [LogsQueued:{TotalNumberOfLogsCurrentlyProcessed}]    To force LWM to run for a minute you could try running the script below multiple times to create a large number of logs for LWM to process which should force LWM to run for longer than a minute. WKI_Summary: Schedule Now is logged
details: PZG 23-Apr-25 11:23 GMT+10:00:   HLD  Add a log record to a specific service task's logs if it is scheduled by user manually.  The log record should only be created if the run request is enqueued successfully.  The log record should be added before other logs produced by the service task itself.  Log level should be information.  Content of the log entry "xxx/{GUID} is scheduled manually by user xxx".  ---------------------    Detailed Design  In ScheduleNowController.ScheduleNow(), we need to get current user's 3 digit code and pass it as a param to the schedule action request  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FServiceManager%2FServiceManager%2FServiceManager.Module%2FScheduleNow%2FScheduleNowController.cs&version=GBmaster&line=33&lineEnd=33&lineStartColumn=18&lineEndColumn=104&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    On Host side, if the request is enqueued successfully, we get the service task logger and log the message "xxx/GUID is scheduled manually by user xxx".  Note host logger won't be used here as product team wants the log message in service task's log so customers can easily understand why their service task has a run which doesn't follow the schedule.    ---------------------    The only thing I'd like you to check extra is how beneficial would it be to split automatic and manual requests to different endpoints? Look at this from the perspective of Kestrel web service we're goint to use please.    Pros of splitting  separation of concerns  easier to scale  route parameters are processed slightly faster than query parameters  Cons of splitting  redundant code - shared logic (auth, validation, etc) might need to be duplicated or extracted into middleware/filters  slightly more routing overhead, but the impact should be negligible    To summarize, the performance differences are unlikely to be measurable. Splitting to different endpoints will make codebase easier to read & maintain, which makes it more favorable.

WKI_Summary: Allow to adjust Pre-Allocations for exceeded Dimensions
details: SDF 03-Apr-25 11:24 GMT+08:00:     You can test this module by referring to the UAT documentation HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=6675abc4-cf22-4227-a535-d9b713bf190d&StorageDocPK=03a89902-92f1-4acd-8cc4-25100b6a9388&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bHntXPtJL4SaXawRX5WcNEwg5zR3L8zOD" SDF 10-Apr-25 12:30:  File DHL Testing_GTT_v5.xlsm (Unit Acceptance Testing).    We need to introduce a new Registry for this WI to control the visibility of the new functions. Do not expose these functions to customers before all the functions mentioned in the High-Level Design are completed, and also ensure that the existing behaviors are not affected. Once all the functions are completed, this newly added Registry can be deleted.      Workflow1(Registry):  Within the 'Consol Pre-Allocations' Registry to restrict Percentage options for 'Dimensions' to 100% as read-only value when the Restriction is selected.  The free-text Percentage for other Measure values – Weight/Chargeable Weight/Volume/No of Shipment remains the same  1) In HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FRegistry%2FBusiness%2FRegistry.Business%2FFreight%2FFreightDataRegistry.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster" FreightDataRegistry.cs - Repos, add a Registry named "Enable Enhanced Consol Pre-Allocation Check" which is only visible to Support.  Path: Registry -> Freight -> Consolidation    2) In HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FRegistry%2FRegistry%2FForwarding%2FPreAllocationCheck%2FPreAllocationCheck.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster" PreAllocationCheck.cs - Repos, for Dimensions, regardless of which Action is selected, make Percentage_ReadOnly return true.  protected bool Percentage_ReadOnly  {   get { return IsNone || Measure == Measures.Dimensions; }  }    3)  For the Percentage of Dimensions, HLD only mentions that the percentage must be 100 when Restriction is selected, but it doesn't mention what the percentage should be when None is selected, the existing behavior is that when "None" is selected, the percentage is 100%. Therefore, I think we can always fix the percentage of Dimensions at 100.  In this case, it seems that we don't need to use Transformation to handle the historical data of Dimensions, because its percentage is fixed at 100% permanently and it is read-only.  If you think it is necessary to process the historical data, you can refer to HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FDatabase%2FOdyssey%2FTransformations%2FTransformations%2FTransforms%2FRegistry%2FUpdateUSOverseasTerritoriesExportStatement.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster" UpdateUSOverseasTerritoriesExportStatement.cs - Repos. tip:HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=4026e4e4-4b0b-4305-9ede-3ffc86279b6a&StorageDocPK=85474dbf-702d-4a2e-9426-1a13632ab0a3&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2b6IjITO6CuNvbUpRSDOKYcwTtaW9oLVQD" SDF 08-Apr-25 16:55:  File Image_1.png (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.  However, I think a separate Workflow should be created for this step and it should be completed at the end. M04 13-May-25 10:46 GMT+10:00:  We need to have transformation if Dimention percantage is not 100 while it has a restriction value    Workflow2(GUI):  The adjustment dialog box should show the same message (as now) and within a Consol line to display pre-allocated max dims and a new value of the Length and/or Width and/or Height whichever is greater in the shipment so users can easily identify which parameter is exceeding the Pre-Allocation dims values.   1)Modify method CheckPacklineDimensionsAreUnderMaximumAllowableDimensions() in HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FPackLine%2FForwardingPackLineValidation.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster" ForwardingPackLineValidation.cs - Repos and modify method CheckPacklineDimensionsAreUnderMaximumAllowableDimensions() in HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FConsol%2FForwardingConsolValidation.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster" ForwardingConsolValidation.cs - Repos , if the value of Registry 'Enable Enhanced Consol Pre-Allocation Check' is true, no error message is displayed.  These methods create error messages that prevent us from saving the data, perhaps we can change them to warning messages, please confirm with product team. HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=4026e4e4-4b0b-4305-9ede-3ffc86279b6a&StorageDocPK=257f623e-7123-4c41-b493-9d04678ea46f&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bV1KJlo4V6ovwXfxeXIOz19oO7LLakaTY" SDF 10-Apr-25 12:08:  File image_2.png (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab. please confirm I agree it would be better to be warning    2)In https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FConsol%2FForwardingConsol.cs&version=GBmaster&line=808&lineEnd=808&lineStartColumn=15&lineEndColumn=51&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents,   Modify this property to ensure that when the dimensions of the packlines exceed the pre - allocated dimensions of the Consol, if the value of the Registry 'Enable Enhanced Consol Pre - Allocation Check' is true, a pop - up window will appear.    3)In HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.GUI%2FConsol%2FAllocationAdjustment%2FAllocationAdjustmentDialog.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster" AllocationAdjustmentDialog.cs - Repos, add new fields to the table according to the requirements of the HLD. They are invisible if the value of Registry 'Enable Enhanced Consol Pre-Allocation Check' is false.      Workflow3(Authentication and Adjust):  1)When users have one or both security rights, they should be able to adjust the Pre-Allocation values including dims and these values will be updated accordingly. Other users without security rights should be able to work on a job without any issues.  No code modification required    2)When adjusting the dims, the greater value of Length and/or Width and/or Height should be updated.   1) In HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FShared%2FFreight.Business%2FHelperClasses%2FShipmentVsConsol%2FShipmentVsConsolMessageHelper.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster" ShipmentVsConsolMessageHelper.cs - Repos, modify the method CheckConsolAllowsAttachingShipmentWithMaximumAllowablePacklineAndContainerDimensions(), it will prevent users from attaching Shipment to Consol. HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=4026e4e4-4b0b-4305-9ede-3ffc86279b6a&StorageDocPK=6203ff34-3281-48ac-ae18-5e27a7a52439&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bJbfxNUOHera%2fV%2fFScymh8CoIQTIA46sN" SDF 10-Apr-25 12:07:  File image_3.png (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.  If the value of Registry 'Enable Enhanced Consol Pre-Allocation Check' is true, no error message is displayed.    2)In https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FConsol%2FAllocationAdjustment%2FAllocationAdjustment.cs&version=GBmaster&line=272&lineEnd=272&lineStartColumn=3&lineEndColumn=42&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents,  Modify this method Adjust(GlbStaff authorizer) to ajust the dimensions. Remember to add the corresponding modification log    3) Delete the code related to the Registry 'Enable Enhanced Consol Pre-Allocation Check'  M04 13-May-25 12:37 GMT+10:00:   Note: we should consider this case for Attaching consolidation to Shipment  It should work exactly the same way when either attaching shipment to a consol or consol to a shipment or changing dimensions in a shipment when already attached to consol, if the shipment dimensions are greater than the dimensions of a consol's Pre-Allocation it should not allow to attach or change dimensions unless an authorised person approves it and increases the Consol's Pre-Allocated dimensions. We should apply the same behaviour that already exists for other values - Weigh, volume etc.      Hi Mohammad, to answer your questions:  1- what will happen if customer has a restriction dimension with different value not 100 (check if we need transformation or not) (registry)? Before this change we already had a rule to set up Dimensions Restriction to 100% for this to work correctly. With this change we are restricting the possibility to have any other value than 100%. So I assume we may need a transformation, after which if a customer's Registry has a setting as Restriction for Dimensions and the percentage value is any value - it should change to 100% after transformation.      2- what will happen if we attach a consolidation to a shipment (should we check something)?   It should work exactly the same way when either attaching shipment to a consol or consol to a shipment or changing dimensions in a shipment when already attached to consol, if the shipment dimensions are greater than the dimensions of a consol's Pre-Allocation it should not allow to attach or change dimensions unless an authorised person approves it and increases the Consol's Pre-Allocated dimensions. We should apply the same behaviour that already exists for other values - Weigh, volume etc.      EZK 27-Mar-25 11:01 GMT+11:00:   Currently, the system allows to adjust the Consol's Pre-Allocation values by a user with two Security Rights when shipment(s) with the exceeded Weight/Chargeable Weight/Volume/No of Shipments values of are being linked to Consol. It does not work the same way for the exceeded Dimensions as dimensions attribute was added to the Registry at a later stage with a hard stop. Users with security rights to edit Pre-allocations (including for Gateway consols) can attach shipments with the exceeded dimensions without an option to adjust the Max Dims, however it causes issues to users without security rights to update any non-related fields on shipment and save shipments. We need to replace the hard stop validation with a Dialog box to allow to 'Adjust' dimensions in the Pre-Allocation tab to align with the behaviour for other values and prevent errors for users without security rights.     Related Update Notes and Work Items:    1. Enhancement to the Verification / Pre-Allocation functionality for Consolidations, 21 Mar 2011  https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=abb39311-5beb-44b2-a9e3-cba21eb79acd                                                                                                        This UPN introduced a warning and a restriction within a Registry and the Security Rights when exceeding pre-allocated percentages specified on weight, volume, chargeable amount and number of shipments. The dialog box allows to adjust the Pre-Allocation values by a user with Security rights. The dimensions were not part of this UPN.    2. “Possible Oversize” column on Shipments module grid and Consol Shipments grid, 15 Nov 2017  https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=19616736-61cd-4033-900a-948599b9a906   This UPN introduced the hard coded maximum dimensions for Air and Sea Freight with a warning of possible oversize. This will not work always for Air Freight due to different Aircraft types. The enhancement work is planned in WI00692787 (Point 5).     3. Cargo dimensions on Consols. Shipment Packs validation against pre-allocated maximum size, 07 Dec 2021  https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=2024c211-3751-4499-83c6-d69c58299b50   This UPN added Dimensions to the Registry and a hard stop error when shipment dimensions exceed the Consol's Pre-Allocated Max Dims. There is no dialog box with an option to Adjust Consol's Dims by a user with security Rights like it is for other values as per UPN 1. This UPN also introduced a validation when Consol has ULD attached, the maximum dims values are validated against the ‘Actual’ measurements of each container and an error is given if a container size exceeds the Max Dims.   The following changes required to this UPN:   - Replace a hard stop error with a dialog box with an option to Adjust Consol's pre-allocated Dimensions (same way as other values) when they are exceeding in shipment. Only users with two Security Rights will be able to adjust Dims on the Pre-Allocation tab as it works for other values.   - Within the 'Consol Pre-Allocations' Registry to restrict Percentage options for 'Dimensions' to either 0 for None or 100% for Restriction   - The validation between Max Dims and ULD size has been removed in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=c76a1123-95d0-49f0-92dd-bf45e96d9b4d&VersionNumber=25.3.28.148&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2buc4wb6VT14F3T%2fcaAGZ3rYUcbS3sc1Vi" WI00692783 - Remove ULD Max Dims control. Remove this behaviour from UPN.   - The new behaviour for ULDs is being hanlded in WI0069287 (Point 5).    4. New Security Right to restrict editing of Gateway Consol Pre-Allocations, 02 May 2024  https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=bc37fd57-7f56-4897-837b-8c749d9b952e   This UPN introduced a new Security Right for Gateway Department allowing to adjust pre-allocated Weight, Volume, Dimensions, Chargeable or No. of shipments values on the Gateway Consol. However, when a Gateway user with Security Rights adjusts the values via a dialog box, it only adjusts the Weight, Volume, Chargeable and No. of shipments but it does not adjust Dimensions but just attacehs the shipmebt- with exceeded dims. The Dimensions seem to have been overlooked assuming the adjustment works the same way for all values.    - By replacing the hard stop for Dimensions in above UPN (Point 3) with a Dialog box should fix the behaviour of this UPN and work as described.     5. HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=8b998b41-fdfe-4988-8403-33f0128f56d6&VersionNumber=25.3.28.148&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bf%2b8q%2bbTFL1ilZlcRge5q%2bJC4l%2bAkV6YA" WI00692787 - [Consol] ULD Dimensions/Pre-Allocation Dimensions Validation - implement the proposed changes (HLD is available, to be reviewed and updated if needed):   - when the Pre-Allocated Max Dims and ULD are present on Consol - validate shipment dimensions against the Pre-Allocation Max Dims only   - when Max Dims are not present in Pre-Allocation tab but ULD is assigned - validate shipments dimensions against the ULD size.         ASL 16-Dec-24 09:16 GMT+11:00: Done Statement  Introducing a new security setting for Pre-Allocation controls that allow you to now control what happens when the pre-allocated dimensions of a Consol are exceeded.       See previous comments from HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=53823808-cf38-4f32-87a7-6104061c0c28&VersionNumber=24.12.15.37&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bmC3XHiq6rUMJVN3ClpdU0Hwh6k5N09y1" WI00836839 - Enhancements needed for Pre-Allocation behaviours  ST0 29-Nov-24 13:53 GMT+11:00:     The pre-allocation function and its security rights are explained in this update note: "Enhancement to the Verification / Pre-Allocation functionality for Consolidations" https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=abb39311-5beb-44b2-a9e3-cba21eb79acd as well as under HYPERLINK "https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=2024c211-3751-4499-83c6-d69c58299b50" CargoWiseUpdateNote20210624b    However would ike to have a clarification on the below behaviours please:    Case 1:    When the security right is granted, system allows to attach shipments whose totals exceed the consol pre-allocation weight/volume/No of shipment/Chargeable weight as expected  However, even when the security right is granted, shipments with dimensions more than consol pre-allocation dimensions are not allowed and an error is shown. Is this expected?   Ideally if other attributes are allowed to exceed consol values is there any particular reason to prevent dimensions?      Notes:    In the older UPN (HYPERLINK "https://aus01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwisetechacademy.com%2Fsearch%3Fquickstart%3Dabb39311-5beb-44b2-a9e3-cba21eb79acd&data=05%7C02%7CSharon.Thomas%40wisetechglobal.com%7C42181411444c456887da08dd0ff38953%7C8b493985e1b44b95ade698acafdbdb01%7C0%7C0%7C638684260831624387%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=lS6kQwctYQuklEDEkku0UcqwbUNsOxM3yXpvxrpe2vI%3D&reserved=0" ediEnterpriseupdatenote20110321) there was no reference to ‘Dimensions’ in the registry, as at that point in time dimensions was not considered as an attribute for restriction purposes. Later a new UPN HYPERLINK "https://aus01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwisetechacademy.com%2Fsearch%3Fquickstart%3D2024c211-3751-4499-83c6-d69c58299b50&data=05%7C02%7CSharon.Thomas%40wisetechglobal.com%7C42181411444c456887da08dd0ff38953%7C8b493985e1b44b95ade698acafdbdb01%7C0%7C0%7C638684260831638503%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=UYkgcxwRycZdezKni3KWIid8M%2FS5Qeyrg3DuJaAbu7M%3D&reserved=0" CargoWiseUpdateNote20210624b brought in dimensions as an attribute for restriction purposes. Could be that the security rights was not integrated for the dimensions attribute. Developer has also confirmed that irrespective of the security rights, a user cannot attach a shipments to a consol that has a higher dimensions than consol pre-allocation dimensions.    What would be our way forward as this is something DHL has raised a concern on now.      Case 2:    As per UPN, the restrictions for dimensions will only apply if it is set as a 100% in the registry.  But when I tested it with 90%, the dimension restriction applied. Please check Test case 8. Shall we raise this as a defect?
feature_description: Allocations for exceeded Dimensions

WKI_Summary: Allow to adjust Pre-Allocations for exceeded Dimensions
details: SDF 03-Apr-25 11:24 GMT+08:00:     You can test this module by referring to the UAT documentation HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=6675abc4-cf22-4227-a535-d9b713bf190d&StorageDocPK=03a89902-92f1-4acd-8cc4-25100b6a9388&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bHntXPtJL4SaXawRX5WcNEwg5zR3L8zOD" SDF 10-Apr-25 12:30:  File DHL Testing_GTT_v5.xlsm (Unit Acceptance Testing).    We need to introduce a new Registry for this WI to control the visibility of the new functions. Do not expose these functions to customers before all the functions mentioned in the High-Level Design are completed, and also ensure that the existing behaviors are not affected. Once all the functions are completed, this newly added Registry can be deleted.      Workflow1(Registry):  Within the 'Consol Pre-Allocations' Registry to restrict Percentage options for 'Dimensions' to 100% as read-only value when the Restriction is selected.  The free-text Percentage for other Measure values – Weight/Chargeable Weight/Volume/No of Shipment remains the same  1) In HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FRegistry%2FBusiness%2FRegistry.Business%2FFreight%2FFreightDataRegistry.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster" FreightDataRegistry.cs - Repos, add a Registry named "Enable Enhanced Consol Pre-Allocation Check" which is only visible to Support.  Path: Registry -> Freight -> Consolidation    2) In HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FRegistry%2FRegistry%2FForwarding%2FPreAllocationCheck%2FPreAllocationCheck.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster" PreAllocationCheck.cs - Repos, for Dimensions, regardless of which Action is selected, make Percentage_ReadOnly return true.  protected bool Percentage_ReadOnly  {   get { return IsNone || Measure == Measures.Dimensions; }  }    3)  For the Percentage of Dimensions, HLD only mentions that the percentage must be 100 when Restriction is selected, but it doesn't mention what the percentage should be when None is selected, the existing behavior is that when "None" is selected, the percentage is 100%. Therefore, I think we can always fix the percentage of Dimensions at 100.  In this case, it seems that we don't need to use Transformation to handle the historical data of Dimensions, because its percentage is fixed at 100% permanently and it is read-only.  If you think it is necessary to process the historical data, you can refer to HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FDatabase%2FOdyssey%2FTransformations%2FTransformations%2FTransforms%2FRegistry%2FUpdateUSOverseasTerritoriesExportStatement.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster" UpdateUSOverseasTerritoriesExportStatement.cs - Repos. tip:HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=4026e4e4-4b0b-4305-9ede-3ffc86279b6a&StorageDocPK=85474dbf-702d-4a2e-9426-1a13632ab0a3&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2b6IjITO6CuNvbUpRSDOKYcwTtaW9oLVQD" SDF 08-Apr-25 16:55:  File Image_1.png (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.  However, I think a separate Workflow should be created for this step and it should be completed at the end. M04 13-May-25 10:46 GMT+10:00:  We need to have transformation if Dimention percantage is not 100 while it has a restriction value    Workflow2(GUI):  The adjustment dialog box should show the same message (as now) and within a Consol line to display pre-allocated max dims and a new value of the Length and/or Width and/or Height whichever is greater in the shipment so users can easily identify which parameter is exceeding the Pre-Allocation dims values.   1)Modify method CheckPacklineDimensionsAreUnderMaximumAllowableDimensions() in HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FPackLine%2FForwardingPackLineValidation.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster" ForwardingPackLineValidation.cs - Repos and modify method CheckPacklineDimensionsAreUnderMaximumAllowableDimensions() in HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FConsol%2FForwardingConsolValidation.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster" ForwardingConsolValidation.cs - Repos , if the value of Registry 'Enable Enhanced Consol Pre-Allocation Check' is true, no error message is displayed.  These methods create error messages that prevent us from saving the data, perhaps we can change them to warning messages, please confirm with product team. HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=4026e4e4-4b0b-4305-9ede-3ffc86279b6a&StorageDocPK=257f623e-7123-4c41-b493-9d04678ea46f&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bV1KJlo4V6ovwXfxeXIOz19oO7LLakaTY" SDF 10-Apr-25 12:08:  File image_2.png (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab. please confirm I agree it would be better to be warning    2)In https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FConsol%2FForwardingConsol.cs&version=GBmaster&line=808&lineEnd=808&lineStartColumn=15&lineEndColumn=51&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents,   Modify this property to ensure that when the dimensions of the packlines exceed the pre - allocated dimensions of the Consol, if the value of the Registry 'Enable Enhanced Consol Pre - Allocation Check' is true, a pop - up window will appear.    3)In HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.GUI%2FConsol%2FAllocationAdjustment%2FAllocationAdjustmentDialog.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster" AllocationAdjustmentDialog.cs - Repos, add new fields to the table according to the requirements of the HLD. They are invisible if the value of Registry 'Enable Enhanced Consol Pre-Allocation Check' is false.      Workflow3(Authentication and Adjust):  1)When users have one or both security rights, they should be able to adjust the Pre-Allocation values including dims and these values will be updated accordingly. Other users without security rights should be able to work on a job without any issues.  No code modification required    2)When adjusting the dims, the greater value of Length and/or Width and/or Height should be updated.   1) In HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FShared%2FFreight.Business%2FHelperClasses%2FShipmentVsConsol%2FShipmentVsConsolMessageHelper.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster" ShipmentVsConsolMessageHelper.cs - Repos, modify the method CheckConsolAllowsAttachingShipmentWithMaximumAllowablePacklineAndContainerDimensions(), it will prevent users from attaching Shipment to Consol. HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=4026e4e4-4b0b-4305-9ede-3ffc86279b6a&StorageDocPK=6203ff34-3281-48ac-ae18-5e27a7a52439&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bJbfxNUOHera%2fV%2fFScymh8CoIQTIA46sN" SDF 10-Apr-25 12:07:  File image_3.png (Internal Correspondence) added to eDocs tab.  If the value of Registry 'Enable Enhanced Consol Pre-Allocation Check' is true, no error message is displayed.    2)In https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FConsol%2FAllocationAdjustment%2FAllocationAdjustment.cs&version=GBmaster&line=272&lineEnd=272&lineStartColumn=3&lineEndColumn=42&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents,  Modify this method Adjust(GlbStaff authorizer) to ajust the dimensions. Remember to add the corresponding modification log    3) Delete the code related to the Registry 'Enable Enhanced Consol Pre-Allocation Check'  M04 13-May-25 12:37 GMT+10:00:   Note: we should consider this case for Attaching consolidation to Shipment  It should work exactly the same way when either attaching shipment to a consol or consol to a shipment or changing dimensions in a shipment when already attached to consol, if the shipment dimensions are greater than the dimensions of a consol's Pre-Allocation it should not allow to attach or change dimensions unless an authorised person approves it and increases the Consol's Pre-Allocated dimensions. We should apply the same behaviour that already exists for other values - Weigh, volume etc.      Hi Mohammad, to answer your questions:  1- what will happen if customer has a restriction dimension with different value not 100 (check if we need transformation or not) (registry)? Before this change we already had a rule to set up Dimensions Restriction to 100% for this to work correctly. With this change we are restricting the possibility to have any other value than 100%. So I assume we may need a transformation, after which if a customer's Registry has a setting as Restriction for Dimensions and the percentage value is any value - it should change to 100% after transformation.      2- what will happen if we attach a consolidation to a shipment (should we check something)?   It should work exactly the same way when either attaching shipment to a consol or consol to a shipment or changing dimensions in a shipment when already attached to consol, if the shipment dimensions are greater than the dimensions of a consol's Pre-Allocation it should not allow to attach or change dimensions unless an authorised person approves it and increases the Consol's Pre-Allocated dimensions. We should apply the same behaviour that already exists for other values - Weigh, volume etc.      EZK 27-Mar-25 11:01 GMT+11:00:   Currently, the system allows to adjust the Consol's Pre-Allocation values by a user with two Security Rights when shipment(s) with the exceeded Weight/Chargeable Weight/Volume/No of Shipments values of are being linked to Consol. It does not work the same way for the exceeded Dimensions as dimensions attribute was added to the Registry at a later stage with a hard stop. Users with security rights to edit Pre-allocations (including for Gateway consols) can attach shipments with the exceeded dimensions without an option to adjust the Max Dims, however it causes issues to users without security rights to update any non-related fields on shipment and save shipments. We need to replace the hard stop validation with a Dialog box to allow to 'Adjust' dimensions in the Pre-Allocation tab to align with the behaviour for other values and prevent errors for users without security rights.     Related Update Notes and Work Items:    1. Enhancement to the Verification / Pre-Allocation functionality for Consolidations, 21 Mar 2011  https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=abb39311-5beb-44b2-a9e3-cba21eb79acd                                                                                                        This UPN introduced a warning and a restriction within a Registry and the Security Rights when exceeding pre-allocated percentages specified on weight, volume, chargeable amount and number of shipments. The dialog box allows to adjust the Pre-Allocation values by a user with Security rights. The dimensions were not part of this UPN.    2. “Possible Oversize” column on Shipments module grid and Consol Shipments grid, 15 Nov 2017  https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=19616736-61cd-4033-900a-948599b9a906   This UPN introduced the hard coded maximum dimensions for Air and Sea Freight with a warning of possible oversize. This will not work always for Air Freight due to different Aircraft types. The enhancement work is planned in WI00692787 (Point 5).     3. Cargo dimensions on Consols. Shipment Packs validation against pre-allocated maximum size, 07 Dec 2021  https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=2024c211-3751-4499-83c6-d69c58299b50   This UPN added Dimensions to the Registry and a hard stop error when shipment dimensions exceed the Consol's Pre-Allocated Max Dims. There is no dialog box with an option to Adjust Consol's Dims by a user with security Rights like it is for other values as per UPN 1. This UPN also introduced a validation when Consol has ULD attached, the maximum dims values are validated against the ‘Actual’ measurements of each container and an error is given if a container size exceeds the Max Dims.   The following changes required to this UPN:   - Replace a hard stop error with a dialog box with an option to Adjust Consol's pre-allocated Dimensions (same way as other values) when they are exceeding in shipment. Only users with two Security Rights will be able to adjust Dims on the Pre-Allocation tab as it works for other values.   - Within the 'Consol Pre-Allocations' Registry to restrict Percentage options for 'Dimensions' to either 0 for None or 100% for Restriction   - The validation between Max Dims and ULD size has been removed in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=c76a1123-95d0-49f0-92dd-bf45e96d9b4d&VersionNumber=25.3.28.148&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2buc4wb6VT14F3T%2fcaAGZ3rYUcbS3sc1Vi" WI00692783 - Remove ULD Max Dims control. Remove this behaviour from UPN.   - The new behaviour for ULDs is being hanlded in WI0069287 (Point 5).    4. New Security Right to restrict editing of Gateway Consol Pre-Allocations, 02 May 2024  https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=bc37fd57-7f56-4897-837b-8c749d9b952e   This UPN introduced a new Security Right for Gateway Department allowing to adjust pre-allocated Weight, Volume, Dimensions, Chargeable or No. of shipments values on the Gateway Consol. However, when a Gateway user with Security Rights adjusts the values via a dialog box, it only adjusts the Weight, Volume, Chargeable and No. of shipments but it does not adjust Dimensions but just attacehs the shipmebt- with exceeded dims. The Dimensions seem to have been overlooked assuming the adjustment works the same way for all values.    - By replacing the hard stop for Dimensions in above UPN (Point 3) with a Dialog box should fix the behaviour of this UPN and work as described.     5. HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=8b998b41-fdfe-4988-8403-33f0128f56d6&VersionNumber=25.3.28.148&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bf%2b8q%2bbTFL1ilZlcRge5q%2bJC4l%2bAkV6YA" WI00692787 - [Consol] ULD Dimensions/Pre-Allocation Dimensions Validation - implement the proposed changes (HLD is available, to be reviewed and updated if needed):   - when the Pre-Allocated Max Dims and ULD are present on Consol - validate shipment dimensions against the Pre-Allocation Max Dims only   - when Max Dims are not present in Pre-Allocation tab but ULD is assigned - validate shipments dimensions against the ULD size.         ASL 16-Dec-24 09:16 GMT+11:00: Done Statement  Introducing a new security setting for Pre-Allocation controls that allow you to now control what happens when the pre-allocated dimensions of a Consol are exceeded. Is this expected? WKI_Summary: IOM [UPS MVP] - SBK create Booking Confirmation (Sys doc elements)
details: Done Statement - As a user from a supplier booking I can create a booking confirmation document.    J36 27-May-25 10:18 GMT+12:00: Speaking to Steven we will need to design the system document elements and the document to be allow the user to be able to create this document. All elements and design should be flexible to allow reuse in other areas.    Sample booking confirmation in Edocs (ISF elements are very US specific- review if required)    AFE 13-Aug-25 14:32 GMT+08:00:     # Reason for change  Allow user to be able to create the booking confirmation document    # Done Statement  User can create a booking confirmation document from a supplier booking in both CW1 and Glow    # Proposed Change  Go to CW1 > Supplier Booking > Documents and click Customise menu, create a new document "Supplier Booking Confirmation" as per https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/13227/Adding-new-System-defined-Document-Menu    According to the Document Design (2) of latest HLD, We need to use the exsiting DocStrips, and create some new DocStrips for the new document as per https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/13207/Adding-new-DocStrips-in-DocBuilder-System-Document-Element:  1. Line 2 - "Company Logo"    2. Line 3 - "Document Title with Page Numbers"    3. Line 4 - "Recipient with Job Number", DocWrappers are 1. JobNumber (JSB_BookingId), 2. Date (the docuement created date)    4. Line 5 - "Supplier Company Name & Address & Phone & Fax + Buyer Company Name & Address & Phone & Fax", DocWrappers are 1. Supplier/Consignor (Booking > Addresses - Supplier), 2. Buyer/Consignee (Booking > Booking Line > Order Line > Order(Buyer))    5. Line 6 - Copy the DocStrip "Consignor Company Name & Address + Consignee Company Name & Address", rename it to "Order Manager Controlling Customer + Manfacturer". DocWrappers are 1. CONTROLLING CUSTOMER (Booking > Addresses - Controlling Customer), 2. NOTIFY PARTY (Booking > Addresses - Notify Party)    6. Line 8 & 9 - Copy the DocStrip "Factory Dates + Container Type + Packs (Weight + Vol)", rename it to "Order Manager Factory Dates + Container Type + Packs (Weight + Vol) + Supplier Booking Status + Load Mode" and create a second line in the same DocStrip for the last 3 fields. DocWrappers are 1. CARGO AVAILABLE DATE (JSB_CargoAvailableDate), 2. CONTAINER MODE (JSB_ContainerMode), 3. TRANSPORT MODE (JSB_TransportMode), 4. PACKS (Total Packs of all Booking lines), 5. WEIGHT (TotalWeight + TotalWeightUnit), 6. VOLUME (TotalVolume + TotalVolumeUnit), 7. SUPPLIER BOOKING STATUS (JSB_Status), 8. LOAD MODE (JSB_LoadMode), 9. INCOTERM (JSB_IncoTerm)    AFE 22-Aug-25 14:31 GMT+08:00: If Booking Load Mode = CY, add two more fields: Planned Container Type and Count; If Booking Load Mode = CFS, add one more field: CFS Address    7. Line 11 - "Port of Loading + Port of Discharge + Origin + Destination", DocWrappers are 1. PORT OF LOADING (JSB_RL_NKLoadPort), 2. PORT OF DISCHARGE (JSB_RL_NKDischargePort), 3. ORIGIN (JSB_RL_NKOrigin), 4. DESTINATION (JSB_RL_NKDestination)    8. Line 13 - "Detailed Goods Description + Marks And Numbers", DocWrappers are 1. GOODS DESCRIPTION (JSB_DetailedGoodsDescription), 2. MARKS AND NUMBERS (JSB_MarksAndNumbers)    9. WKI_Summary: [EAD][INC] XUS extracted from Brokerage tab
details: Allow selection of Universal Shipment XML primary data source using the Message Profile and Message Purpose mechanisms that are available in CargoWiseOne.    A configuration will be added to a Message Profile that allows the selection of primary data source for Universal Shipment XML.     Options will include:  Brokerage Data   Shipment Data     When the Message Profile has been allocated to a Message Purpose and the Purpose has been selected on a Trigger Action, will adopt the approach indicated by the configuration on the message profile. If there is no option set on the Message Profile, system default behaviour will govern the primary data source.      JR3 20-Sep-24 11:44 GMT+10:00:   Message profiles can be selected on trigger actions via a 'Purpose Code'. It can also be passed into a 'UniversalShipmentRequest' via the 'MessageProfile' element, both should support this new configuration.  I think on the Message Profile module we should add a new tab to the 'XUS -Universal Shipment' tab, something like 'Additional Configuration', this will allow others in the future to extend with similar configuration        SH5 17-Oct-24 14:25 GMT+11:00:  We need to redesign the UI to address this issue and involve the UX team in the process. Let's focus on resolving the first issue for now, and we can create a separate work item for the UI improvements afterward.    KNC 02-Dec-24 15:27 GMT+11:00:   possible UI merge conflict

WKI_Summary: GLWOM: Mark a request completed by reviewer or staff
details: EYG 25-Jul-25 14:38 GMT+08:00:   Done Statement  1. staff user and reviewer could close request in main search grid or within a job record when REQ_Status is not CLS.   if reviewer contact is empty, any of reviewer org's contact would close request, otherwise contact user must be same to the reviewer' contact of the request.  2. when closing request   REQ_Status must be not CLS   Confirm Dialog would show when closing request. if the users choose Yes, then close request and create event, otherwise do nothing.   REQ status would be changed to CLS   RQS - request closed event  should be created to its parent job record.  3. close request operaiton should be done using a row action or button  4.  close request operaiton should work in OSX, NEO, NST  5.  Response’ column is available in OSX, NST, and NEO. They are filterable and sortable too.     Suggested Changes.  1 add code form flow for close request, caption: Close as completed    condition:     current user is staff,     current user is contact user and request reviewer contact is not null and request reviewer contact is same to contact of current contact user,     current user is contact user and request reviewer contact is empty and request reviewer org is same to org of current contact user   body    check REQ status must not be CLS    show confirm dialog     YES: create RQS event to its parent job and then save     NO:  do nothing return   add formflow to modules OSX, NEO,NST    2 modify formflow "OM Open External Request" to support "Close as completed" operation   add footer transition for close request "Close as completed" and call above code form flow.    3 C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\Glow\CargoWiseOne\Configuration\SecurityRoles\OrderManagerCustomer.yaml   REQ_Status should be allown for contact users as current security configuration does not allow modification for REQ_Status.    4 C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\Glow\DotNet\Business\Forwarding\Business.Forwarding.Service\Order\Security\ExternalRequestSecurityChangeExtender.cs   check if the contact users have rights to close the request.      Done:  1. As per HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=b3fcf6f0-284e-4820-902c-69c895bb46fd&VersionNumber=25.5.1.112&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=ediprod&Hash=%2bPNcZBymlXlr8dYlDWMLADdyzBsKZjzWm" WI00883506 - GLWOM: Request Phase 2 - Core Validation Design, users now have the ability to 'Set a request to complete'  2. Requestee Completed and Response columns are visible columns in Requests search grid and Requests dialog  3. Request can only be marked as completed when the the requestee_response is true    Note this requirement:  1.       A RQS – Request Closed event is added to parent job records such as order, supplier booking, container load list, and container load plan.    This means the REQUEST parent, not the parent of the job. For example, if the request is on the ORL, SBL, CLI or CPL, the RQS event is added to the line level event.    Product: Due to above, I suggest we change the status from CLS – Completed to CLS – Closed to at least minimize potential confusion. The side effect is that the close request button can be confused with closing the form. Maybe we can use ‘Finalize’ button?      Workflow shows 'CLS - Closed as Completed' so, we can changed to CLS-Closed without too much impact.
product_candidate: Mark a request completed by reviewer or staff

WKI_Summary: [CCA] Support XML Integration for Carrier Contract
details: Done Statement:   Support XML integration for importing and exporting data for Carrier Contract.    DS2 02-Apr-25 16:06 GMT+11:00:   Primary purpose:  * DHL want to automate reading the Carrier Contract > Allocation Routes collection  * DHL want to automate adding, updating and deleting routes from Carrier Contract > Allocation Routes collections (collection size: 500+ routes).  * The "DHL Smart Engine" ingests the data, and updates the allocation routes, some of the operations include     * Splitting an allocation route into several allocation routes (updating 1 route and creating several routes, referred to as "sub-allocations")     * Re-adjusting these sub-allocations - deleting, updating and creating routes in a single XML.  * Described in more detail in the HLD.    Dev notes: https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/AllocationsManagement.Content/pull/32    MLY 19-Dec-24 14:46 GMT+11:00:   CS reference: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=8f6519a5-cffd-4dce-8d6f-8f8d354b0715&VersionNumber=25.3.17.12&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bH4eZQu54iMX%2frKosO%2fZLS%2bwD2D6yvT1Z" CS01801531 - DHLGLOBNJ - POC AM001: Ability to integrate with other systems via API or XML integration

WKI_Summary: St. Kitts (KN) temporarily cut Standard VAT from 17% to 13% 1Jan to 30 June 2025
details: This Work Item:  > STD Rate Reference deployment for KN  - 13% 1 Jan to 30 Jun 2025  - 17% before & after those dates            Background: The Government of St. Kitts and Nevis has announced a reduction in the standard Value-Added Tax (VAT) rate from 17% to 13% for the first half of 2025.   This VAT Relief Holiday, effective from January 1, 2025, aims to alleviate financial pressures on citizens and promote economic stability by lowering costs for goods and services previously taxed at the standard rate.    HYPERLINK "https://www.vatcalc.com/st-kitts/st-kitts-cuts-vat-to-13-jan-to-jun-2025/" St Kitts cuts VAT to 13% Jan to Jun 2025 - vatcalc.com    As of Jan 2025, we have only one customer with a Login Company in KN - UPS
product_candidate: St. Kitts (KN) temporarily cut Standard VAT from 17% to 13% 1Jan to 30 June 2025

WKI_Summary: [EAD] Accept Individual EDI Message Types in eAdaptorNext Async
details: AR7 02-Dec-24 14:30 GMT+11:00:   Currently, we just accept <UniversalInterchange> which might contain one or multiple individual messages. So, client middleware should even wrap their single messages in <UniversalInterchange> element in the request. The goal of this work item is making it possible to send an individual message directly to eAdaptor Async in addition to supporting <UniversalInterchange> as before.      SH5 09-Dec-24 08:23 GMT+11:00:     Requirements  Scenario 1: Processing UniversalInterchange Files    Input:  A UniversalInterchange file is received.    Expected Outcome:  1. The system creates an EDI Interchange.  2. The system generates one or more EDI Messages from the EDI Interchange.  3. The EDI Messages are processed as per the standard processing flow.      Scenario 2: Processing UXML/NXML Files Without UniversalInterchange    Input:  A UXML or NXML file is received without an accompanying UniversalInterchange.    Expected Outcome:  1. The system directly creates one EDI Message per UXML or NXML received.  2. The EDI Messages are processed as per the standard processing flow.    AR7 27-Dec-24 11:28 GMT+11:00:   Detailed Build Design:    Processing of async requests is done in eAdaptorAsyncRequestProcessor class. Currently, it only accepts UniversalInterchange root elements with the following structure:    <UniversalInterchange>   <Header>    <SenderID>A</SenderID>    <RecipientID>B</RecipientID>   </Header>   <Body>    <!--Message Bodies Come Here-->    <UniversalEvent>     ...    </UniversalEvent>    <UniversalShipment>     ...    </UniversalShipment>    ...   </Body>  </UniversalInterchange>    Most probably, the easiest way to also accept individual messages without any breaking changes is checking for the root element and wrap it in a UniversalInterchange element with a header and body and then pass it again to the processing pipeline. SenderID and RecipientID can be set with dummy values and the interchange can be deleted in OnInterchangeCreated and EM_EI value of message reset in event handler of MessageCreated event of IMessageHandler. For  efficient wrapping of the message stream in a UniversalInterchange with header and body without having to copy/load/read the original request stream once into memory and reiterating over it, we can create two wrapper prefix and wrapper postfix streams with the pre and post contents and then create a stream that wraps prefix, request, and post-fix streams and represents them as a single stream. A sample open-source implementation of this can be found here:    https://github.com/jplane/MultiStream/blob/master/MultiStream.Lib/MultiStream.cs
product_candidate: [EAD] Accept Individual EDI Message Types in eAdaptorNext Async
