WKI_Summary: Mobility: Add upgrade barcodes for Android 8 & 10 devices to the staging portal
details: CS6 25-Jul-25 10:58 GMT+10:00:    Please refer to the AND staging portal for the final design HYPERLINK "https://www.figma.com/proto/Tb53Set40snReK8McnN3Cr/AND-%E2%80%A2-DESIGN?page-id=54%3A697&node-id=54-3275&p=f&viewport=-5033%2C104%2C0.5&t=hvCS4GtlHBIg4yAT-1&scaling=min-zoom&content-scaling=fixed&starting-point-node-id=54%3A2851" AND • DESIGN - Final Version - Neutral Background    In this WI, we will be adding to the existing staging portal. See edocs for HLD.      CS6 01-Jul-25 16:06 GMT+10:00:   Provide a link to customers on the staging portal allowing them to access Upgrade barcodes for:  1. Zebra devices runnning on Android 8 and 10  2. Datalogic devices running on Android 10 and lower versions of Android so that they can upgrade to the latest Android 11 version.    J52 02-Jul-25 15:02 GMT+10:00:     Removing Android 8 and 10 Support Roadmap (draft)    1. Create a document with upgrade barcodes to Android 11 and 13, and place a link to it in the staging notes of the staging portal.  2. Add support for the MC3400 (Nippon Express is expected to send it to us in late July) as a recommended/direct replacement for the MC3300 which only goes up to Android 8.  3. Add a warning on the GlowClient app which will inform customers on Android 8/10 to either update their device to a newer Android version if compatible, or to purchase a new device compatible with Android 11 and newer. (after we confirm MC3400 support)  4. Closer to the end of support date, we can use information collected from the Data Usage Collector (from HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/f44dfda9-1291-4912-9800-14da94ab0a79?lang=en-gb" WI00892314 - Mobility: Data Usage Collector to include Enterprise Code and Server Code) to directly contact customers on older Android versions to update/upgrade their devices. (Q4 2025)  5. We officially end support for Android 8 and 10. (February 2026)  6. We refactor the code base to remove Android 8 and 10 specific logic, bump up the minSdk, remove the options from the staging portal and change the entry for "MC3300" on the staging portal to "MC3300x/ax". (After February 2026)
product_candidate: Add upgrade barcodes for Android 8 & 10 devices to the staging portal

WKI_Summary: IOM [UPS MVP] - Note Inheritence
details: UPS request incident CS01406721  19/05 Meeting UPS want the following flow of notes  Order line > Booking > Shipment      26/05 Alternative suggested to UPS as Order line does not currently handle notes. Agreed on incident new flow.    The other alternative is to use a note from the order header? There is a 'Goods Handling Instruction' on the order header which could be used in this case?  My suggestion is this note could be shown on a booking. Then we add a booking note that could be shown on a shipment.    Note type <Goods handling Instructions>  Order > Booking  Booking > Shipment    UPS Comment 'Hi Jessie, I reviewed this with the team and the response was that this is reasonable "so long as the PO Goods Handling note is automatically transferred forward from the PO to the Booking so that the user does not have to copy/paste if from Order to SB. And that it is very easy to view SB notes on the Shipment screens."      LC8 17-Jul-25 12:51 GMT+08:00:   Reason for the change:    UPS want the following flow of notes  Orders > Supplier Booking  Orders > Shipments J36 30-Jul-25 16:44 GMT+12:00: removed from this requirement  Supplier Booking > Shipments  Supplier Booking > Container Load List  Supplier Booking > Container Load Plan    Done Statement:   Notes on Order Header and allowing the information to be seen from other records:Booking?CLL?CLP?Shipments  1.When I am in a Supplier booking record I can see notes from related order entities order note context matches.  2.When I am in a Shipment I can see notes from related order entities if order note context matches.  3.When I am in a Shipment I can see notes from related Supplier Booking entities if SBK note context matches.  4.When I am in a Container Load List I can see notes from related Supplier Booking entities if SBK note context matches.  5.When I am in a Container Load Plan I can see notes from related Supplier Booking entities if SBK note context matches. WKI_Summary: Airline Connect -No flight update nor message logs
details: M04 18-Nov-24 16:54 GMT+11:00:     please investigate and fix     https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FDocuments%2FDocDataObjects%2FAirBookingRequest%2FAirBookingResponseConsolCostingImporter.cs&version=GBmaster&line=82&lineEnd=126&lineStartColumn=5&lineEndColumn=6&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    In this area, we need to check if the console does not have a job header; if it doesn't, we should skip updating the cost.  We have a refactoring item, HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=7bcf0062-1fe2-44b6-80f4-2841ccb76042&VersionNumber=24.11.18.14&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bbAixl2xZrieCYdSYekWPal4Ae8sU06z6" WI00831547 - Refactoring Import Cost for AirBooking to use ConsolCostImporter Accounting, to address the general issue and to call the accounting source code for importing costs.    JP0 19-Nov-24 11:04 GMT+11:00:     When the consol does not have a job header, the method identified above will attempt to create a job header with mutex and this is causing downstream issues.     The proposed change would be to only proceed with calculating charges if a job header already exists; it would also involve removing this section of code which logs an error when the job header was not successfully created: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FDocuments%2FDocDataObjects%2FAirBookingRequest%2FAirBookingResponseConsolCostingImporter.cs&version=GBmaster&line=108&lineEnd=115&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=8&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents

WKI_Summary: The GLOW > Services > Indexing Service now defaults to Yes
details: This enhancement will update the GLOW > Services > Indexing Service Registry setting to Yes from No.  This setting is what enabled the Global Search functionality and can only be set by support in Hosted systems.  Since we are rolling out Index Search for similar lucene based searches, we should make this available by default now.  Other than updating the default value to Yes, there is no other functional changes.  This was originally added in this enhancement, https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=63db6410-b57e-47fd-a20e-0ce521d5adb6.    Food for thought:  Defaulting to Yes and in the off chance that a client does not have GLOW Web Services installed, nothing bad should happen
product_candidate: The GLOW > Services > Indexing Service now defaults to Yes

WKI_Summary: Ability for WTG Staff members to self-service and trigger the Github Invite
details: WY 29-Apr-25 17:38 GMT+08:00:   HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=bb3538b8-d881-48a1-9490-57b13129931b&StorageDocPK=e40c7ebc-2628-4065-b7b3-ac6c5c342da2&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=ediprod&Hash=%2bYV5TDELGf1SqQo0HHObAFqU2PhTbWM6f" WY 29-Apr-25 17:38: File self test.xlsx (Attachment)      A.K 16-Apr-25 15:33 GMT+10:00:     Background/Problem Description  When WTG onboards users that need to have access to Github - the users are added to the group GHUSERS, this change gets synced with AD, then with Azure AD, which triggers Github action - email invite is being send to the freshly joined user.  This process, however, has significant limitation and, therefore, does not work very well in practice.  The flaw is - github email invitation has hardcoded 7 days expiry date AND WTG onboarding team sets up users well in advance, so when a user becomes active, starts their work and opens their email inbox - the invitation from github is already expired and the invite needs to be re-send.  This invovles user creating CR9 , which puts pressure on DevTools team which (at the moment) happens to be responsible for the github access.  In order to re-send the invitation, product person from DevTools removes the user from GHUSERS and adds them back. This kicks off the chain of events described above and the github invite gets re-sent.    Desired effect  WTG Users can trigger Github invite themselves.    Suggested Solution  Add menu item to Staff form menu: "Actions->Send Github invite"  If user clicks this menu item, they are removed(if needed) and (re-)added to GHUSERS group, essentially replicating manual workaround the DevTool product person does to resolve these CR9s.  This shoudl be EDI client specific behaviour.    Further improvement  There is a follow up wi - have an automated process (service task or gitrhub process) that automatically sends github invites on the staff start date.  This work is out of scope of this WI and will be done in: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=cd70c9ee-ef50-4446-9f34-6a1daf2ac1c5&VersionNumber=25.4.17.2&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=ediprod&Hash=%2b34HHnABSz%2bKVSL39en6eDbGKhKmKu6wy" WI00898078 - Automate sending github invites
product_candidate: Ability for WTG Staff members to self
feature_description: service and trigger the Github Invite

WKI_Summary: Option to Exclude Additional Reference from Key extraction
details: Currently there are a couple of registries that have configurable 'Additional Reference' that user can configure on their job for different modules, and UMK is extracting each AdditionalReferenceType+value in inbound XUS as Key   This is causing unnessary key extraction and in turn unnessary dependency    e.g. DSV 's use case is they are updating one of the Additional Reference values across multiple jobs, they can be done in parallel but because the type+value for the additional reference is the same in all the XMLs, they are put into the same queue  Examples of current behaviour HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=c02c7c78-4d41-45fa-be2a-364312f4584c&StorageDocPK=bf26ff2f-3741-4e4b-808d-34d30d295c0d&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bZeRrLFUkxS1XytLpPhJt%2bNvmqH6U7Vaz" Registry Item Sample XML and Key.docx    Proposed change  UPN HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=c02c7c78-4d41-45fa-be2a-364312f4584c&StorageDocPK=8917f259-d62a-4d73-83af-914264db995a&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bcIHYhvmKP57c%2fVB8C3IfHXQlM3KC3VTR" XC 14-Aug-25 12:25:  File CargoWiseUpdateNote Additional Reference[0].docx (Update Notes)  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=c02c7c78-4d41-45fa-be2a-364312f4584c&StorageDocPK=93d6d4b5-953d-48cc-9a9c-8d1122c2453f&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bkatiobZ6eXG52Q2BdQuGB%2f8KQPeoaSIf" Functional Expectation.docx before vs after    MDH 14-Aug-25 17:37 GMT+10:00:   There is a problem with the old design. We have duplicate additional reference keys in different registries. And we cannot map these reference codes to the XML document type being processed. So we decided to have an independent registry for this.  Create a new registry item "Additional Reference Types Excluded from Key Evaluation" under eServices -> Universal Xml  It should be of type CodeDescriptionPairListRegistryItem  when generating keys in ShipmentDataContextManager, we exclude values sepecifed in this registry. Both code and description should match the registry to be excluded. If the description is not provided in the XML, then we only check the code (reffer to UPN)    ===================================  Old Design    AR7 10-Jul-25 12:36 GMT+10:00:   Suggested change after final discussion with Christina: Add a column to the grid of these registry items:    Registry > Freight > Customs Numbers > Customs Additional Reference Number Types  Registry > Transport> Land & Port Transport > Land Transport > Consignment Additional Reference Types  Registry > Transport> Land & Port Transport > Land Transport > Run Sheet Additional Reference Types  Registry > Transport> Land & Port Transport > Port Transport > Additional Reference Types  Registry > Transport> Transport Bookings > Additional Reference Types  Registry > Warehouse > General > Additional Reference Types  Registry > Warehouse > Transit Warehouse > Package Additional Reference Types    named "Parallel Processing Key" which is checked by default. Users can override and uncheck it. During key generation, we need to check the registry item and only emit additional reference items as keys if the registry item is checked.    AR7 10-Jul-25 12:28 GMT+10:00:   Notes for dev:     1- Code that currently adds all additional references as keys:    https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/2b50a4ea075903d537efd397093f0393998b1159/Enterprise/Product/Core/UniversalDataBuss/UniversalDataBuss.Management/Management/DataContextManagers/ShipmentDataContextManager.cs?plain=1#L74C1-L76C1      MDH 14-Jul-25 14:40 GMT+10:00:   Add a "IsParallelProcessingKey" property to these classes:  CustomsReferenceNumberType: https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/16486ad55083ed2c0cbd3f7589d47a5e3dcd4cae/Enterprise/Product/Core/Registry/Business/Registry.Business/Freight/Shipment/CustomsReferenceNumberType.cs#L14-L14  TransportReferenceNumberType: https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/16486ad55083ed2c0cbd3f7589d47a5e3dcd4cae/Enterprise/Product/Operations/TransportCommon/TransportCommon.Registry/Business/TransportReferenceNumberType.cs#L16-L16    GUI controls to update:  CustomsReferenceNumberTypesRegistryControl: https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/16486ad55083ed2c0cbd3f7589d47a5e3dcd4cae/Enterprise/Product/Core/Registry/GUI/Registry.GUI/RegistryItemEditors/CustomsReferenceNumbers/CustomsReferenceNumberTypesRegistryControl.Designer.cs  TransportReferenceNumberTypesRegistryControl: https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/16486ad55083ed2c0cbd3f7589d47a5e3dcd4cae/Enterprise/Product/Operations/TransportCommon/TransportCommon.GUI/Registry/TransportReferenceNumberTypesRegistryControl.Designer.cs    These registry items use a CodeDescriptionPair:  WarehouseDocketReferenceType: https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/16486ad55083ed2c0cbd3f7589d47a5e3dcd4cae/Enterprise/Product/Core/Registry/Business/Registry.Business/Warehouse/WarehouseDataRegistry.cs#L2641-L2641  PackageAdditionalReferenceType: https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/16486ad55083ed2c0cbd3f7589d47a5e3dcd4cae/Enterprise/Product/Core/Registry/Business/Registry.Business/Warehouse/WarehouseDataRegistry.cs#L1972-L1972  Changing the data type of these is not easy. We decided to drop them for now. From Christina:  "The request was for forwarding registry - additional reference  the reason transport + warehouse were added because we want a uniformed approach for the function  and introducing a new registry item just to cater for them defeat that purpose"    So, thses are the only items we add the extra checkbox:    Registry > Freight > Customs Numbers > Customs Additional Reference Number Types  Registry > Transport> Land & Port Transport > Land Transport > Consignment Additional Reference Types  Registry > Transport> Land & Port Transport > Land Transport > Run Sheet Additional Reference Types  Registry > Transport> Transport Bookings > Additional Reference Types    To use the IsParallelProcessingKey value in ShipmentDataContextManager:  - Create an interface IReferenceTypeParallelProcessingKeyDecider in on of the Integration projects:      public interface IReferenceTypeParallelProcessingKeyDecider    {     IEnumerable<(ZString referenceType, bool isParallelPorcessingKey)> GetProcessingReferenceTypes();    }    - Add it as a ListObject to "EnterpriseApplicationConfiguration.xml"  - Add a method like this to ShipmentDataContextManager:    IEnumerable<AdditionalReference> FilterIsParallelProcessingKey(DataObjectList<AdditionalReference> additionalReferenceCollection)    {     if (additionalReferenceCollection == null)     {      return null;     }     var deciders = ObjectFactory.Get<ListObject>("IReferenceTypeParallelProcessingKeyDecider").Cast<IReferenceTypeParallelProcessingKeyDecider>();     return additionalReferenceCollection.Where(r =>     {      if (r.Type?.Code == (ZString?)null)      {       return false;      }      var types = deciders.SelectMany(d => d.GetProcessingReferenceTypes()).ToDictionary(a => a.referenceType, a => a.isParallelPorcessingKey);      if(types.TryGetValue(r.Type?.Code ?? ZString.Empty, out var isParallelProcessingKey))      {       return isParallelProcessingKey;      }      return true;     });    }  - in ShipmentDataContextManager.GetShipmentKeys, filter shipment.AdditionalReferenceCollection using this method:         ConcatIgnoreNull(FilterIsParallelProcessingKey(shipment.AdditionalReferenceCollection)?.SelectNonNull(r => ...    - Add implementations of IReferenceTypeParallelProcessingKeyDecider for all of the registry items above and return IsParallelProcessingKey based on the Reference Type.
product_candidate: Option to Exclude Additional Reference from Key extraction

WKI_Summary: Verbose logging for carrier
details: Done  Verbose logging for carrier is added- Many carrier will be present so we should have option to enable verbose logging for specific carrier otherwise will be very difficult to debug     OA 19-Dec-24 18:04 GMT+11:00:     Detailed Done Statement-  Update the logger to use a scoped version via the ForContext property.  Implement a custom ILogEventFilter class to filter log events based on verbosity, and integrate it into the logger configuration.  Create a singleton class, such as LogLevelManager, to manage centralized logic for verbosity. This class will be utilized by both ILogEventFilter to check for relevant properties and APIs to set property names.  Develop an API to add property names for verbose logging into a cache. The API should accept a property name and an optional expiration time (defaulting to 30 minutes).

WKI_Summary: Vietnam (VN) extends 8% reduced VAT rate from 30 June 2025 to Dec 2026
details: Background: On 17 June 2025, the National Assembly passed Resolution to extend the 8% VAT until 31 Dec 2026 (from the original end date of 30 June 2025).  • The Draft Decree has been issued and is being promulgated in law (as of 26 June 2025)  • Compared to the previous resolutions, the new one expands the coverage of the VAT reduction to some areas including transportation, logistics, and IT products and services.    Change required:  Product to make the following REF Rate changes:  a) Unpublish the STD 10% with start date 1 July 2025 and end date 31 Dec 9999 end date   b) Change the end date on current 8% STD rate from 30 June 2025 to 31 Dec 2026  c) Add a new STD rate record for 10% with start date 1 Jan 2027 and end date 31 Dec 9999
product_candidate: Vietnam (VN) extends 8% reduced VAT rate from 30 June 2025 to Dec 2026

WKI_Summary: CN - Display Separate Debit and Credit Movement, Excel Template part
details: SPX 26-Jun-25 08:57 GMT+08:00:   This WI is depending on the WI: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=a083c3cb-9081-41b3-882c-275750fba425&VersionNumber=25.6.26.345&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b46%2b3tdhx64CdoZlBhvdTVeAdDhunhmn%2f" WI00895624 - CN - Display Separate Debit and Credit Movement ,Only Sql part  We need to finish the excel template part in the current WI  The report name is: China GL Account Balance with Debit/Credit Movements  The report can only draw data from EDW database, So for the main ReportData, we need to use EDWOnlyData  you can create the new excel tempalte based on the tempalte of China GL Account Balance    More deteils can be found in the HLD of the project: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=3c35ef6e-ea48-4921-a98d-5ce637523d51&StorageDocPK=104e0c69-c08c-4565-b1ac-792df3596a60&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bWwyEMi05UKYTd8tR1B9%2byjInUKnLgTIV" SPX 26-Jun-25 09:00:  File PRJ00051020 - HLD_Update 20250611.xlsx (High Level Design)    FSL 08-Jul-25 21:43 GMT+08:00:   Dependency WI: HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/cf5a31a5-9776-4415-8d49-044c22aede8d" WI00902522 - Convert ExcelTemplates to SDK-style and multi-target it

WKI_Summary: GLWOM: SPT Import Existing Consol - Additional Filters
details: DMC 12-Sep-24 12:46 GMT+10:00:   Reason for Change  Split out from HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=2bf5816f-7c1d-461e-817a-9a29371ac649&VersionNumber=24.9.12.124&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bMDLCK3iVi%2bSV32PVVQBFoETf4Ag51d5m" WI00779866 - GLWOM: SPT Import Existing Consol    There are a few filters from the HLD which we didn't implement because they calculated properties from related entities so they will need custom filter strategies:   - ETD (Consol First Leg)   - ETA (Consol Last Leg)   - Vessel Name (Consol Main Leg)   - Voyage/Flight (Consol Main Leg)   - CTO Cut Off (Consol First Leg    There was also a performance concern from Shen's review which this will hopefully fix as well!    Done Statement  - We have added custom filters which are filterable for the above list for the IJobConsol entity type  - We have added these new custom filters as default filters to the "Import shipments from consol" button as per the HLD    Proposed Changes  Create new filter strategy/strategies in DotNet/Business/Forwarding/Business.Forwarding/OrderManager for the columns mentioned aove  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/Glow/_git/Glow?path=%2FDotNet%2FBusiness%2FForwarding%2FBusiness.Forwarding%2FOrderManager&_a=contents&version=GBmaster  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/10274/How-to-use-ICustomFilterStrategy   https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/sites/StackOverflow/questions/Forms/AllItems.aspx?id=%2Fsites%2FStackOverflow%2Fquestions%2FPDF%2F4641%5FHow%20do%20I%20create%20a%20custom%20filter%20strategy%20in%20GLOW%20%28e%2Eg%2C%20for%20calculated%20properties%29%2Epdf&parent=%2Fsites%2FStackOverflow%2Fquestions%2FPDF    ShipmentPlanningWizardFormExtender.ts  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/Glow/_git/Glow?path=%2FDotNet%2FBusiness%2FForwarding%2FBusiness.Forwarding%2FOrderManager%2FShipmentPlanningWizardFormExtender.ts&_a=contents&version=GBmaster   - Add the following filters as default filters to the "Import shipments from consol" dialog    DMC 20-Sep-24 16:31 GMT+10:00:   This one is harder than it first seems.     This is the expression for the calculated property TransportFirstLeg  TransportRoutings.OrderBy(JW_LegOrder).First()>  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/Glow/_git/Glow?path=%2FCargoWiseOne%2FConfiguration%2FRules%2FIJobConsol.yaml&version=GBmaster&line=178&lineEnd=178&lineStartColumn=14&lineEndColumn=62&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.Business%2FConsol%2FForwardingConsol.cs&version=GBmaster&line=2035&lineEnd=2035&lineStartColumn=5&lineEndColumn=101&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    We want filters on the first, last and main legs, which all involve similar queries.    Unfortunately, filter strategies return a predicate which down the stack are applied as a "where" to the query  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/Glow/_git/Glow?path=%2FDotNet%2FHTML%2FClient%2FClient%2FJS%2FShared%2FFilters%2FDbMappingOverrideFilterDecorator.js&version=GBmaster&line=137&lineEnd=137&lineStartColumn=8&lineEndColumn=39&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    These predicates can only understand OData models & properties and the OData query API doesn't support this kind of filtering (e.g, doing an OrderBy().First()). We also can't do a separate query here, since we can't evaluate it for every row.    The only thing I can think might be possible is to create an Adhoc View for TransportFirstLeg, etc, and then query from it. I haven't had enough time to actually investigate if this is plausible or not.    JHK 21-Sep-24 06:31 GMT+10:00:   Instead of custom filters, could we use the Index - Search Mode?    There are defined filters for each of those on some Index\entity:    for example, on Index\ICusContainer.yaml   it defines ETA/ETD as   - name: ETA    propertyPath: JobDeclaration.TransportRoutings.LastBy(JW_LegOrder).JW_ETA    keyField: true  - name: ETD    propertyPath: JobDeclaration.TransportRoutings.FirstBy(JW_LegOrder).JW_ETD    keyField: true  - name: VESSELCODE    propertyPath: JobDeclaration.TransportRoutings.FirstBy(JW_LegOrder).JW_Vessel    keyField: true  - name: VOYAGEFLIGHT    propertyPath: JobDeclaration.TransportRoutings.FirstBy(JW_LegOrder).JW_VoyageFlight    keyField: true  on Index\ICYContainerLoadList.yaml  - name: CTOCUTOFF    propertyPath: Booking.JobContainers.JobConsol.TransportRoutings.JW_TerminalCutOff    DMC 23-Sep-24 09:09 GMT+10:00:   Hi Johanne,    It looks we could  use index search for this advanced search if we wanted to, technically    We would need to pass in advancedSearchMode: "Index" into the lookup metadata factory create arguments:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/Glow/_git/Glow?path=%2FDotNet%2FBusiness%2FForwarding%2FBusiness.Forwarding%2FOrderManager%2FShipmentPlanningToolFormExtender.ts&version=GBmaster&line=120&lineEnd=120&lineStartColumn=17&lineEndColumn=70&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/Glow/_git/Glow?path=%2FDotNet%2FHTML%2FClient%2FClient%2FJS%2FShared%2FLookups%2FLookupMetadataFactory.js&version=GBmaster&line=40&lineEnd=46&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=2&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/Glow/_git/Glow?path=%2FDotNet%2FHTML%2FClient%2FClient%2FJS%2FShared%2FLookups%2FLookupMetadataFactory.js&version=GBmaster&line=75&lineEnd=82&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=2&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    It's a plausible idea & it's great because we already have the filter defined as you identified! However, we would need to be OK with the index delay and I'm not sure product will be OK with this, so you should run it by them before we go ahead.  If they say yes -- and we do it for "Import shipments from consol", we should also do it for the "Import shipments" lookup to be consistent.    Otherwise, we need to investigate a different way to get these filters working in entity search. If it's impossible/too hard, maybe we can see with product if a filter on all legs is fine, rather than first/last/main specifically.    DMC 23-Sep-24 17:38 GMT+10:00:   I spoke with Paul. he thinks that we can live with the index delay. Since it's a planning tool, there's no reason to assume DHL and our customers will need immediate data availability, customers probably won't notice it. He's concerned about being able to demo it, but has agreed that they can work around it.  So -- I say we go for it. Not only do we already have filters, but it would also have performance benefits. Hopefully it's as easy as outlined above!    As I mentioned, I think we would need both lookups to be on the index for consistency.    JHK 24-Sep-24 06:33 GMT+10:00:     The change to use the index search will require changes to :  ShipmentPlanningToolFormExtender.ts  for ShipmentPlanningToolAttachToConsolDialog:  - set advancedSearchMode to "Index"  - change propertynames to Index property names (see Index/IJobConsol.yaml)  - remove the filter() - breeze Predicate logic and replace with defaultFilter with IsImplicit = true  - change the defaultFilter to use Index property names  Will need to do something similar for ShipmentPlanningToolAttachDialog  trying to get it to work for Consol's first.  Index\IJobConsol.yaml  - add property for JK_PK  - add property for CONTAINERMODE (JK_ConsolMode)  - add property for BOOKINGREFERENCE (JK_BookingReference)  - add property for CTOCUTOFF (TransportRoutings.FirstBy(JW_LegOrder).JW_TerminalCutOff)  - add property for VESSELCODE (TransportRoutings.FirstBy(JW_LegOrder).JW_Vessel)  - add property for ConsolHasShipments ( JobConShipLinks.Count() )
feature_description: Additional Filters

WKI_Summary: AM: Transformation to Delete Watermark StmALogs
details: CGG 03-Jun-25 09:46 GMT+10:00:     Done=Transform that deletes StmALogs where SL_SE_NKEvent="STU" AND SL_Table="StmScheduleTask" AND SL_Reference LIKE '%Processed records older than%'    Background  We used to add a log to StmALog like below:  _ = Logs.AddNew(AutoEvents.StatusUpdated, stageText + " Processed records older than " + watermark.ToString());    However we removed this when removing other manual logging of ADD/EDT/DEL events in archive manager because there was no reason that we were adding this log to StmALog. It was not used anywhere, and we already have archive manager service task logs which tell us when the watermark is updated, and we can also check in the database what the watermark is. And since there is an effort to reduce the size of StmALog, since this process seemed unnecessary, we decided to remove it.  HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/50cb9778-254b-47eb-bc19-c7fc332340b8?lang=en-gb" WI00885380 - AM:(SL) Remove Manual Logging of ADD/EDT/DEL Logs    We now need a transform to delete these logs from StmALog to help reduce the size of StmALog.    A50 07-Jul-25 16:05 GMT+10:00: The workflow template for this one is wrong so I'm going to reapply ours    A50 07-Jul-25 16:18 GMT+10:00:  From Caitlin https://github.com/search?q=repo%3AWiseTechGlobal%2FCargoWise%20PurgeGhostRecordsFromStmALog&type=code may be of use

WKI_Summary: FB: ICS2 requirement -Payment Method and Validation for Goods Desc and Marks
details: Reason of change:  ICS2 Compliance    MEI 27-Apr-25 11:40 GMT+10:00: Mapping change in HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/c599a00a-0ce7-4ef8-aa06-d9eb65142b01?lang=en-gb" WI00837403 - OCM: ICS2 - CargoSmart Dec Change for Carrier Filing    VPL 25-Oct-24 13:57 GMT+11:00:   Proposed Changes  refer to : HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=8c02909c-0e98-4c38-a43b-a72ff6ee7d32&StorageDocPK=59939a21-af62-43ac-bd4f-500ba0b9ad34&Hash=%2bnsstvn7qcWWDMOzG8nIS2oLdMhwuOkfk&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" VPL 25-Oct-24 14:01:  File HLD[3].docx (High Level Design)   $Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Forwarding\Documents\DocDataObjects\CarrierMessage\CarrierMessageData.cs    - add property "HBLPaymentType"(RYS 25-Oct-24 15:32 GMT+08:00: I believe it should be PackingLine level)     $Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Forwarding\Documents\DocDataObjects\CarrierMessage\ShippingInstructionBuilder.cs    AddPackingLineValidation     $Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Forwarding\Documents\DocDataObjects\Builders\PackingLineBuilder.cs    default HBLPaymentType    Validation for Marks and Numbers/Goods Description     $Dev\Enterprise\Product\Documents\ExcelTemplates\Forms\Forwarding\ShippingInstruction2.xls ?WW: only apply changes to the Excel with Grouping Method?   $Dev\Enterprise\Product\Documents\ExcelTemplates\Forms\Forwarding\ShippingInstruction3.xls    - add new property     $Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Forwarding\Documents\DataTransfer\CarrierMessage\CarrierMessageDataObjectWriter.cs        PopulatePaymentInstructions      RJV 24-Oct-24 14:53 GMT+11:00:   Apply these changes only into the new form only.    WW 14-Oct-24 16:54 GMT+11:00:   1. Method of Payment  Currently we are sending Method of Payment as "NP- Not Provided" in our IFTMIN.  However, INTTRA/Carriers removed this value from their Implementation Guide because ICS2 system doesn't accept this value any more.  Following payment types are allowed to be sent in our IFTMIN.  A - Payment in cash   B - Payment by credit card   C - Payment by cheque   D - Other   H - Electronic funds transfer   Y - Account holder with carrier   Z - Not pre-paid    We can default to "D - Other" for now in the message but in this work item we need to find a solution to write payment method of each House Bill in the XML.  Add a new field 'Payment Method' for each packline under Goods Details/Goods and Equipment Details section.   Once a method is selected, Pack Lines under the same Shipment should be updated to the same.  Default as empty, display an error if it is not entered.    2. Validation for Marks and Numbers  When 'ICS2 Declarant EORI' field exist, 'Marks and Numbers' field becomes mandatory. An error should display if it is empty.  If it is not empty, a warning should display if it exceeds 512 characters    3. Validation for Goods Description  When 'ICS2 Declarant EORI' field exist, 'Goods Description' field is entered, display a warning if it exceeds 512 characters.
feature_description: Payment Method and Validation for Goods Desc and Marks

WKI_Summary: EBL: change matching logic for addresses receiving in USXML from Bolero
details: JR 15-Apr-25 17:18 GMT+10:00:   Reason for change: Change the fallback logic between TRI and company name + address for eBL and eHBL  Proposed Changes:      C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Forwarding\Forwarding.DataTransfer\Universal\Consol\Reading\ConsolDataObjectReader.cs   AddOrganizationAddressDetailsToOriginalBillNotes    Reverse the fallback order:     If Company name and any of [Address1, address2, City, Country, Postcode, State] of the organizationAddress are not empty, output address details.    Otherwise, check TRI part.          C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Forwarding\Forwarding.DataTransfer\Universal\Shipment\OriginalBillNotes\OriginalBillNotesUpdaterForEventReceiver.cs   AddOrganizationAddressDetailsToOriginalBillNotes    Do the similar change with consol side.    RJV 02-Apr-25 16:34 GMT+11:00:   Refer: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=d31dd8df-bf37-4022-b187-238812dd2285&StorageDocPK=ab054604-105e-43d7-b483-ab145c861ffe&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bm8pqxycs3t36Kw7hxHqfp39X7MAv0QcR" RJV 02-Apr-25 16:33:  File HLD.docx (High Level Design)      NDT 18-Mar-25 18:41 GMT+11:00:     Background:  In HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=dc904d10-5592-4a5d-b52b-702404a4f186&VersionNumber=25.3.17.12&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bxD2XcdAY81x6VszvHoU%2be4Jk3XbTsn5Q" WI00575926 - EBL: Display Electronic Bill Of Lading Details on Consol we have implemented the matching logic for TRI/Addresses received in incoming UXML from Bolero as follows:  if TRI is found with matching Premises Address, use matching address.   if TRI is found without matching Premises Address, fallback to main address.   If TRI not found, use name and address received in the message    At the time, Bolero was not sending us Addresses.    Done:  We take Name and Address from the UXML first, then fallback to TRI  Apply same logic for eMBL and eHBL.
product_candidate: change matching logic for addresses receiving in USXML from Bolero

WKI_Summary: [EPG] Make EPG schedule editable by user
details: AET 18-Aug-25 14:57 GMT+10:00:   Detailed Build Design:  Change the value of https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/f748ce1bfef905273be823d43dcb9b909d64c14f/Enterprise/Product/Core/ServiceManager/ServiceManager.Tasks/MessagePurgeProcessor/MessagePurgeServiceTask.cs#L25 from "1day" to "1hour".    ADP 11-Aug-25 14:32 GMT+10:00:   As a user (Support or Non-Support) I can't set frequency of EPG Service task, up to 1hour (Setting: Hourly=1 or Minute=60 or Seconds= 3600)  Acceptance Criteria:  WHEN Minute >= 60 or Second >=3600:0  THEN the user can save the modifications  WHEN Minute < 60 or Second <3600:0  THEN the validation error appears: The task must not be more frequent every 1 hour(s)    XC 31-jul-25 17:57 GMT+10:00:   see incident in related item    EPG currently has default schedule of 1 day when it runs into error or for whatever reason it does not complete its purging cycle, it need to wait until the next day  We need to solve the running into error separately  but to help DSV cope with the problem at hand we can make EPG schedule editable by user, if they want to run it more frequently than 1 day they should have the option to
product_candidate: [EPG] Make EPG schedule editable by user

WKI_Summary: Enhanced Report Generation Details
details: Deliverable  To provide enhanced logging details for report generation that details why a report was selected to run on one server versus another.    Background  An enhancement long ago on HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=1fcaae91-b8ac-436f-8acb-96344fd1b659&VersionNumber=24.10.1.75&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bhMDhE15fzEihYOy8icY1vjqhnEsJD2ri" WI00071674 - Use of AlwaysOn replicas for running reports made it possible to have reports generated on replica servers based on a variety of criteria (from the Update Note):  • If the installation is not set to AlwaysOn, the primary server will be used for running reports.  The User is not able to change the registry parameter;    • The primary server will be used if a report is configured as “must run on primary”;    • The primary server will be used if the installation is part of an AlwayOn group and the user  has set the “Old data threshold” parameter to “0”;    • The system calculates the difference in time between the most recent entry in StmAlog on  the primary and secondary servers.    • If the time difference between the servers is less than or equal to the allowed threshold the  secondary server will be used.    • If the time difference between the servers is greater than the allowed threshold the primary  server will be used.    Further Deliverable Information  With this enhancement a Registry setting should be introduced to provide logging data explaining why a report was selected to run on server X versus server Y.    Registry Setting Location, Reports settings are scattered between numerous locations  Under Documents  Under System > Reports  (this might be the best choice for the location simply based upon the other settings in this grouping)    The setting can be a simple Yes/No setting, defaults to No and named something like Enable Enhanced Report Details or Enable Enhanced Report Logging    Where the enhanced logging appears  On the SRR task Log Files (I am not too keen on this as it can make the logs of the task very messy)  To me the logical choice would be on the Reports Statistics tab for the report run.  Every report generated, regardless of scheduled or ad-hoc/on demand, has an entry in Reports Statistics.  On the Details tab is not ideal, there is not enough "real estate" there for it.  I think the best place for this would be to add a Note with the details of why the report was generated on server X  Having it on Report Statistics will keep SRR logs clean and the detailed data on the report generation details  Report Statistics are purged automatcally based on a Reports registry item that is not located in the two locations mentioned above, System > Database > User Options > Purge Report Statistics Logs older than n days.  So with this purging, Notes will not "Live Forever" in what is it, StmNote????

WKI_Summary: [HS-Prio] CWNext News: user blocked by Mandatory-to-read Announcements
details: LSZ 09-Sep-25 10:36 GMT+08:00: There is a difference in open news item between cargowise next and cargowise one.   In CargowiseOne :https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/294a0345ce50a4ffb96ad0d6beeaf4b49688d84d/Enterprise/Product/Main/Enterprise.Main/CargoWise.Main/Startup/MainForm/StartupUserControl.cs#L362-L368  we will mark it as read after we click the news item.  but in CargoWiseNext:  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/294a0345ce50a4ffb96ad0d6beeaf4b49688d84d/Enterprise/Product/Main/Enterprise.Main/CargoWise.Main/Navigation/NewsViewModel.cs#L161-L223  we only open the link, we don't  mark it as readable.      Design:  We need to add logic of mark it as read and refresh news in NewsViewModel.    pr: https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/pull/13001      LSZ 10-Sep-25 13:43 GMT+08:00: As discussed in standup meeting,  There was a discussion before that some customers complained that the news or announcements disappeared from the list if we click them.  So I just need to pass false for parameter HideReadItems  here https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/49bf443493dce793ac9c87625ac22592bc16d4a2/Enterprise/Product/Main/Enterprise.Main/CargoWise.Main/Navigation/NewsViewModel.cs#L293.  And we don't need to refresh news anymore.     LNS 02-Oct-25 07:54 GMT+10:00:     Introduced in DPR version: YES  Introduced in STD version: YES  Introduced in GP1 version: YES  Introduced in GP2 version: YES  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  1) What is the business impact?   Local/Global, how often could a customer experience it during their daily operations?- Customers that have mandatory news configured are warned with a dialog that there are mandatory news to read.    - Customers that have mandatory news configured see a warning dialog noticing there are mandatory news to read.  - The user read it, but CargoWise Next doesn't mark it as read, causing the dialog show up again every time the application is loaded.    2) Based on the business impact, what is the appropriate criticality in order to deliver the patch in a timely manner?   (CR1-3 WI deliver patches immediately, upon completion, CR4 wait for the next weekly release, on a Friday)    CR4 - it is possible to dismiss the dialog and use the system. The problem is that it will show up next time the application is loaded.    3) What are the conditions under which the defect is reproduced?   Document it and reference the document as a link below    - Mandatory news is set ON.    4) Is there a workaround?   Document it and provide clear information.    - Close the dialog or set mandatory news OFF until the fix is available.    5) Provide the standard response that you wish our customer to receive for this issue    The root cause of the issue has being idenified and a fix is on its way.   As a workaround, consider switching OFF mandatory news till the fix is completed.      -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Resolved in DPR version  Resolved in STD version  Resolved in GP1 version  Resolved in GP2 version  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
feature_description: to-read Announcements

WKI_Summary: Defer Template Application when saving
details: 1. When a user clicks Save & Close, do template applicaiton in the background (in LWK service task)  2. Provide a registry settings for 1 that is on by default. Also add the option to do this on all Saves but make this off by default    Potential future addition:  Add an option to defer template application for all objects that are not the top level object, For example, if a consol has 20 shipments, only apply templates to the consol from it's form, defer the 20 shipments template application to LWK    This applies to the UI only    ZMN 20-Jun-25 14:15 GMT+10:00:   When reload form is clicked, it would call SynchronizeAndSaveIfNeededwhere we are saving without adding isSave/IsSave&Close service. Thus the TemplateApplication cannot be defered there. We could set the same service on the factory in the ZForm.RelaodForm method and handle any internal save in the same way as if the user clicked 'Save'.  Maybe unrelated to this WI. Don't think we need to handle this case now    ZMN 23-Jun-25 11:17 GMT+10:00:   Functionality test list attached in edoc

WKI_Summary: Request to Increase Character Limit for Email Subject Field
details: CST 24-Oct-24 13:20 GMT+11:00:  Look into increasing the text field in the Email Subject field on the Customise Document Menus form.  This is not an increase of the size of the Subject line itself.  It is an increase in the size of this field so that operators can input macros to populate the subject line details.  This field is currently limited to 256 characters, matching the allowed Subject length.  However with a few macros added in, that exception will be reached.      As there is not much "free land" on that form, maybe something like what is on the Shipment form with Description and Marks and Number fields where there is a button to open a popup with a bigger text field to use.  Or maybe something like on Workflows for the HTML Message Content where when you click into the field, it "temporarily expands" to show more lines. WKI_Summary: IOM [UPS MVP] - Supplier can add 'Special instructions' to a supplier booking
details: A supplier should be able to add free text notes with instructions when creating a supplier booking.    This note will be entered in a text field 'special instructions' on the supplier booking and converted to notes.    EYG 17-Sep-25 12:17 GMT+08:00:   Done Statement  Given a vendor or supplier is creating a booking  When they enter a note into the booking template and save the booking  Then the note is stored in the system’s notes functionality  And it is associated with that booking  And when an internal user views the booking’s notes section Then the note is visible with the correct content, creator, and time stamp Description  this will behave in the same was as the detailed Good instruction how it is entered on the screen then saves into the note format.    Suggested Changes  C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\Glow\CargoWiseOne\Configuration\Entities\IJobSupplierBooking.yaml  C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\Glow\CargoWiseOne\Configuration\Rules\IJobSupplierBooking.yaml   add property SpecialInstructions by using SetNoteTextWithDescriptionAsync with description "Special Instructions"   set readonly condition like existing property "DetailedGoodsDescription" (CanEditBooking)    C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\Glow\CargoWiseOne\Configuration\BPMForm\OrderManager\36756adc4c3a4277b2d1f5629b9d4438.yaml   add above property SpecialInstructions after JSB_GoodsDescription    CargoWiseOne/Configuration/Entities/INote[[IJobSupplierBooking]].yaml  add "Special Instructions"  to availableNoteTypes    CargoWiseOne/Configuration/Rules/INote[[IJobSupplierBooking]].yaml  add "Special Instructions" to condtion to support our new note description    DotNet/Business/Forwarding/Business.Forwarding.Service/Order/OrderManagerNoteChangeExtender.cs  add "Special Instructions"  to availableNoteTypes OnChangeNote

WKI_Summary: FB: Introduce validations on HBL form
details: RYS 08-Feb-25 08:54 GMT+08:00:   Proposed Changes:  C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Forwarding\Documents\DocDataObjects\HouseBill\PublishHouseBillCommand.cs  Check if there is message errors in Invoke() like what we did for Send message button    C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Forwarding\Documents\DocDataObjects\HouseBill\HouseBillBuilder.cs  Add validation messages based on the SPE    NDT 19-Nov-24 16:06 GMT+11:00:     Problem:  It is currently possible to print HBL or even 'publish' the eHBL without vessel, portpairs, cargo details, Issuer, etc.    Done:  Please do some investigation what minimum data sets are mandatory on a FCL or LCL SEA HBL. We  may need to consult customers who issue House Bills.    Online I found that all data identifying contract parties and the cargo in question are required data sets on a Bill of Lading, as follows:  The following legally mandatory data must be included in the form, otherwise a validation error should occur on the House Bill preventing delivery pr publishing of the form.  Also, DCSA has a minimum set of data required for eBL issuing - email attached      Type of commodity or cargo transported.  Less Than Full Container Load, or LCL, type light shipments must include the number of packages and description of each package. For example, type of commodity and packaging, number of units, handling instructions, volume and weight.  Heavy Full Container Load, or FCL, shipments must include, in addition to the above information, the container numbers and count + Seal Numbers.     Shipper’s, Consignee' data unless to Order (And Notify where applicable)  Full name, telephone and e-mail address of the person sending/receiving the goods.    Vessel details  Name and voyage number of the vessel on which the goods are being transported.    Place of initial receipt  Place where the shipping company takes possession of the cargo. For example, exporting/importing company’s facilities, port collection center or shipping company’s own warehouse, among other options.    Port of origin and port of discharge as well as place of delivery    Date of Shipment AKA Loaded on board date    Issuer, meaning company logo or name of the B/L issuer

WKI_Summary: [EAD][ADH] EDI Message Profile Data Context improvements
details: David Sorrell (AET) 29-Apr-25 14:51 GMT+10:00:  Functional testing notes:  For the universal transaction and universal shipment tab when the filter type is EXC and the selected "Schema Element" is "SubShipmentCollection" the "Data Context" cell should be editable.  For the universal transaction and universal shipment tab when the filter type is EXC and the selected "Schema Element" is "SubShipmentCollection" and the "Data Context" cell is empty a validation error with the message "Please enter a Data Context" should be shown.  For the universal transaction and universal shipment tab when the filter type is EXC and the selected "Schema Element" is not "SubShipmentCollection" then the "Data Context" cell should not have a value and should be readonly.  When switching from "SubShipmentCollection" to another value the "Data Context" cell should be cleared.  When the filter type is set to INC then the "Data Context" cell should be read only no matter what  Important!!!: Please ensure that this change is able to work in multiple languages. As it could potentially be an edge case.      David Sorrell (AET) 22-Apr-25 16:41 GMT+10:00:  Note; when changing the "Schema Element" from SubShipmentCollection to another value, the value in the Data Context column should be cleared.  Source: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=d580914d-c686-42f2-99cb-0a1ef6880ba7&VersionNumber=25.4.4.58&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bsbojzYQmqf5hV6vCnVOy%2bJQLMQWRqCm%2f" CS01909535 - EMOTRAINC - Can sub shipments to be delete from the transimission?      ADP 08-Apr-25 14:45 GMT+10:00:     Problem Description:  Following Mahmood feedback, I think we can create a WI for enhancement.  It appears that ''Data Context'' column in the EDI Message Profile form has only been created for Schema Element = SubShipmentCollection.  See screenshot EDIMessageProfile.png. For other Schema Elements ''Data Context'' is not applicable.    When excluding elements from the message profile, if SubShipmentCollection is selected as Schema Element then the Data Context must be specified.  When value of Data Context is left empty by a user, then no SubShipmentCollection are included/excluded from the XML. Nothing happens, it is like to configuration is ignored, which is confusing behaviours.    When the Data Context is specified then only SubShipment with the related DataContext are excluded/inlcuded from the XML:  <SubShipment><DataContext><DataSourceCollection><DataSource><Type>  See Type.png    Acceptance Criteria:  '-- XUE tab --  GIVEN EDI Message Profile form is open  AND XUE - Universal Event tab is selected  AND Filter Type 'INC Exclude' is chosen  WHEN a schema element different from SubShipmentCollection is chosen  THEN Data Context column is greyed out (read-only) and empty    GIVEN EDI Message Profile form is open  AND XUE - Universal Event tab is selected  AND Filter Type 'EXC Exclude' is chosen  WHEN a schema element different from SubShipmentCollection is chosen  THEN Data Context column is greyed out (read-only) and empty    '-- XUS tab --  GIVEN EDI Message Profile form is open  AND XUS - Universal Shipment tab is selected  AND Filter Type 'EXC Exclude' is chosen  WHEN a schema element different from SubShipmentCollection is chosen  THEN Data Context column is greyed out (read-only) and empty    GIVEN EDI Message Profile form is open  AND XUS - Universal Shipment tab is selected  AND Filter Type 'EXC Exclude' is chosen  WHEN schema element is SubShipmentCollection  THEN Data Context column is marked as mandatory    GIVEN EDI Message Profile form is open  AND XUS - Universal Shipment tab is selected  AND Filter Type 'INC Include' is chosen  WHEN a schema element different from SubShipmentCollection is chosen  THEN Data Context column is greyed out (read-only) and empty    GIVEN EDI Message Profile form is open  AND XUS - Universal Shipment tab is selected  AND Filter Type 'INC Include' is chosen  WHEN schema element is SubShipmentCollection  THEN Data Context column is marked as mandatory    '-- XUT tab --  GIVEN EDI Message Profile form is open  AND XUT - Universal Transaction tab is selected  AND Filter Type 'EXC Exclude' is chosen  WHEN a schema element different from SubShipmentCollection is chosen  THEN Data Context column is greyed out (read-only) and empty    GIVEN EDI Message Profile form is open  AND XUT - Universal Transaction tab is selected  AND Filter Type 'EXC Exclude' is chosen  WHEN schema element is SubShipmentCollection  THEN Data Context column is marked as mandatory    GIVEN EDI Message Profile form is open  AND XUT - Universal Transaction tab is selected  AND Filter Type 'INC Include' is chosen  WHEN a schema element different from SubShipmentCollection is chosen  THEN Data Context column is greyed out (read-only) and empty    GIVEN EDI Message Profile form is open  AND XUT - Universal Transaction tab is selected  AND Filter Type 'INC Include' is chosen  WHEN schema element is SubShipmentCollection  THEN Data Context column is marked as mandatory      MDH 08-Apr-25 13:06 GMT+10:00:   Hi Audric,  In order to remove SubShipmentCollection from the output XML, in the EDI Message profile, Data Context should be selected. And it applies ONLY to SubShipmentCollection. it seems that this is a special element. And if the incorrect context is selected, it will not be removed.  This change added in this work item: HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/6769834e-45b8-4d68-be9e-8658d0df658a?lang=en-gb" WI00601341 - eTail V2 XUS SubShipmentCollection EDI message profile filter
product_candidate: [EAD][ADH] EDI Message Profile Data Context improvements

WKI_Summary: Fiji (FJ) VAT Rate reduced to 12.5%  from 15% effective 1 Aug 2025
details: Background:    As part of Fiji's 2025–2026 National Budget, the government announced a reduction in the Value-Added Tax (VAT) rate from 15% to 12.5%, effective August 1, 2025. This measure aims to alleviate the cost of living for Fijian households.     2025–2026 Budget Supplement HYPERLINK "https://www.finance.gov.fj/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/2025-2026-Budget-Supplement.pdf" 2025-2026-Budget-Supplement.pdf  2025–2026 Budget Address https://www.finance.gov.fj/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/2025-2026-Budget-Address-2.pdf    https://www.vatcalc.com/fiji/fiji-raises-vat-to-15-august-2023-2/    Change Required:  New STD Tax Rate: Product to change the STD rate from 15% to 12.5% effectively from 1 Aug 2025.  1. Set end date on STD rate 15% as 31 Jul 2025.  2. Add new STD rate reference 12.5% start date 1 Aug 2025.    We will introduce a new Tax Message Group 'G' for the 12.5% rate and update the Tax Message Group description of existing Rated Groups via HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/056832b7-e903-40f7-91b3-b00e10ec7ffd?lang=en-gb" WI00937552 - FJ New Tax Code Group G | eINV test and update
product_candidate: Fiji (FJ) VAT Rate reduced to 12.5%  from 15% effective 1 Aug 2025

WKI_Summary: Web Print SVC, causes port exhaustion on webserver when source has no printers
details: M.K 20-Dec-24 10:40 GMT+11:00:  From logs extract in incident problem description, it looks like WebPrint Client is continuously tries to connect to service with SignalR (for print nudging) and fails.  We can improve this by pausing SignalR connection attempts for some period (e.g. for an hour) if it has continuous errors trying to connect or frequently disconnects.  This should reduce load on WebPrint web service in such scenarios.    So suggested task:   - count in WebPrint Client process attempts to connect to SignalR;   - if there are more then N connections in M minutes, pause reconnection for T minutes and force disconnect of SignalR (to ensure all open connections are closed);   - ensure that after T minutes WebPrint Client is trying to reconnect to SignalR again;   - perhaps make this configurable in WebPrint Client Configuration: enable/disable, N connection attempts in M minutes, T minutes for pause;   - write a warning log when pausing SignalR;   - it may need an Update Note for new configuration options.    M.K 07-Jan-25 08:46 GMT+11:00: Update Note will be needed for description of new WebPrint configuration options (Nudging Pause).
product_candidate: Web Print SVC, causes port exhaustion on webserver when source has no printers

details: HDG 20-Aug-25 19:05 GMT+08:00:   SCOPE OF THIS WI  list of tables:  RefCurrency    To Dev, make necessary changes against listed tables, so that  1. With this change, newly created EDT & ADD event with reference, will use new event type "AEL - Accounting Edit Log" (to replace EDT) and "AAL - Accounting Add Log" (to replace ADD).   2. Transformation of existing EDT event with reference to AEL, transformation of existing ADD event with reference to AAL. Please include the table name in pull request, to differentiate these tables in same work item.    To Product,   a. Make sure FR covers all scenarios listed in 1~5 above.  b.Update Note should be created with below key points:  Point 1 - When AAL and/or AEL event with reference will be logged.  Point 2 - Transformation of existing ADD and/or EDT event with event reference to AAL/AEL event with event reference.  Point 3 - The system ceased to auto record ADD and EDT events with/without event reference  Point 4 - Where work flow and trigger action are relevant, the ADD and EDT events will continue to be triggered but will not be logged. WKI_Summary: [DateTimes] UXML Task, Milestone and Exception support offsets
details: Change the following UXML properties to ZDateTimeOffset  WorkflowException.Date  WorkflowException.ActionedDate  WorkflowException.EndDate    Milestone.EstimatedDate  Milestone.ActualDate    Task.CompletedTimeUTC  Task.EstimatedStartTimeUTC  Task.ActualStartTimeUTC    Similar to other dates we have changed to offset, the offset will respect the registry eAdaptorRegistry.Instance.ZDateTimeOffsetInOutboundXML which can turn the offset off in outgoing XML This registry no longer exists    UTC dates have also been changed to offsets for consistency, however their offset will always be +00:00    Task and Milestone do not have readers so you cannot import them. For WorkflowException if the incoming XML has no offset, the current branch offset is used (no change in behaviour)  If the XML does have an offset, use that
product_candidate: [DateTimes] UXML Task, Milestone and Exception support offsets

WKI_Summary: GLWOM: Stop assigning containers to OPL planned pack lines
details: PGN 23-Oct-24 11:33 GMT+11:00: !!DANGER WILL ROBINSON!! - This has the potential to break forwarding, so we must be very, very, very sure it's only affecting SPT pack lines.  Regression tests should be included.    Related: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=66f232f3-07f3-4d6c-b5f8-279193abfbdd&VersionNumber=24.10.3.44&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b0729JyFc9C8S1iLH%2bfcR1huYfy8sfmQP" WI00810785 - GLWOM: Match SBK and CLL line to SPT line during conversion    S37 22-Apr-25 14:47 GMT+10:00:   Definition of SPT planned pack lines fits both:   1. Has JL_JSL_BookingLine link   2. One of the below    a. From LSE booking where the booking is not CNV    b. From non-lse booking and has no CLL_JL_PackLine link    S37 03-Oct-24 14:35 GMT+10:00:   Reason for change  SPT generated pack lines can have containers attached if shipment is attached to a consol that has containers    Current Issue  Attaching a shipment to a consol automatically allocates all of the pack lines to the first container.  This is the default behavior but for shipment planning tool, we don't want this for OPS/OPL planned pack lines.    Done Statement  1. Pack line (that is created by 'advanced order manager - Shipment Planning Tool') is not assigned with a container when shipment is attached to the consol that has containers  2. When a pack line is created by 'advanced order manager - Shipment Planning Tool', it is not assigned with a consol container the shipment is attached to.  S37 22-Apr-25 14:41 GMT+10:00:    3. Adding a container to a consol does not populate the SPT planned pack lines with that container    EYG 17-Apr-25 10:42 GMT+08:00:   Affected  attach consol to shipment  attach shipment to consol  add (first) new container to consol  convert SPT >>> SGF 23-Apr-25 15:46 GMT+10:00: If you mean both (a) generate packline to existing shipment that is already attached to consol via SPT and (b) convert CLL, CLP, and SBK when SPT is used, then it is correct.    Investigation  C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Shared\Freight.Business\PackLines\OuterPackLineCollection.cs  OnAdded  when adding new pack line, it may call CurrentConsol.AllocatePackLine(line);      EYG 17-Apr-25 12:43 GMT+08:00:   we should split this work item into two workflow  Part 1  Done Statement  when we converting SPT shipment and generate pack lines, these pack lines should not been allocated to container of related consol.  SGF 23-Apr-25 15:57 GMT+10:00: Please also add "when generate packline to existing shipment that is already attached to consol via SPT, the pack line should not be allocated to container of related consol"    Proposal Solution  C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Forwarding\Forwarding.ServiceTasks\Orders\Converters\OrderShipmentPlanningLineConverter.cs  ConvertToShipment  call TemporarilyDisableAutomaticPackingIntoContainer of shipment to prevent allocating pack line when calling PopulateBookingLineToPackLine    Part 2  Done Statement  when pack line is generated from SPT shipment   if it is from LSE booking, when booking is not converted, we should not allocated container automatically when attaching consol to the shipment or attach shipment to consol, or add first container to the related consol   if it is not from LSE booking, and the pack line does not link CLL/CLP lines, , we should not allocated container automatically when attaching consol to the shipment or attach shipment to consol, or add first container to the related consol    Proposal Solution  C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Shared\Freight.Business\Consol\CommonConsol.cs  AllocateShipment  if packline is SPT but still not converted,  should not call AllocatePackLine ?please be carefull here, it may cause performance issue?      AW7 26-May-25 10:32 GMT+10:00:   Attached the SQL execution plan in eDocs
product_candidate: Stop assigning containers to OPL planned pack lines

WKI_Summary: Macros can access temporal data
details: JCD 17-Oct-25 14:39 GMT+11:00:   Goal  I can access a staff's current GlbEmploymentLocation, GlbEmploymentTeam and GlbEmploymentHistory tables from workflow macros    Background  WTA can trigger automatic enrollments via workflow: https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=78381c7e-32d2-42f2-964a-e4bc6eab5ca3    They would like to trigger enrollments on the following changes:    Current working location - Country field (GlbEmploymentLocation)  Current team (Team and Parent Team) (GlbEmploymentTeam)  Current role (Job Title and Job Family) (GlbEmploymentHistory)    As part of their workflow configuration, they need to access information about these fields too.    Some artificial examples:  * When a staff member joins the security team, they need to complete the "security fundamentals" WTA course  * When a staff works from Australia, they need to complete a "insider trading" course    This means they will need to add conditions referencing these HRM records, such as `staff.CurrentTeam.GET_TeamCode == "SECURITY"` so they can fire the course only for changes to that specific team.    Note  GEL contains some sensitive columns. For staff who work fully remote, GEL will contain their home address. Country is too broad therefore does not risk someones privacy - it can be permitted to workflow macros. More specific information that can be used to identify an individual - such as the full street address - should be restricted entirely.    Related: HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/3738af78-da41-4dba-9cff-30a1fb15afc5?lang=en-gb" WI00977585 - Expand ECL logging    Closely related: HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/3b01f92c-6717-45bf-9bd1-a31e574661b9?lang=en-gb" CS02109388 - WISGLOSYD - Sync 2 new attributes from HRM to AD  This requires two properties off temporal tables we're already exposing in this WI. I can add them in this WI.

WKI_Summary: [Macros] Support MCR for Template Company Rules
details: Add support for MCR-style macros for Template Company Rule conditions    We already added a PCR_MacroType column for ProcessCompanyLinkRules to determine the macro engine that is being used (currently defaults to UDF), which should be exposed in the Template Company Rules form / filter module. Just need the design from product to decide exactly what this should look like, what variables should be available in MCR for Template Company Rules, and any other features. Currently for UDF for Template Company Rules you can just access any fields on the template / job in the condition.    Template Company Rules are only evaluated here, to get them to work for MCR we just need to process the condition with MacroValueEvaluator instead (like we do for trigger conditions) if the PCR_MacroType is MCR, and pass in any context that's needed.  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FMasterFiles%2FBusiness%2FMasterFiles.Business%2FWorkflow%2FTemplateApplication%2FTemplateApplicationScopeEnforcer.cs&version=GBmaster&line=158&lineEnd=159&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=1&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents
product_candidate: [Macros] Support MCR for Template Company Rules

WKI_Summary: IOM [MVP UPS] - New expected receipt date on SBK
details: Reason for the change  UPS want Expected receival date preference is terminology inline with receipt process. A new field need to be added in the OSX portal to record an expected receipt/ receival date  for a supplier booking. This is the date the cargo is expected to be received/receipted into the CFS which can vary from the supplier booking Cargo Ready date when the supplier will have the goods ready for handover.    Done statements  A new planning tab is added to a supplier booking for information managed by the Freight frowarder after the booked is placed.  A new field is added to the supplier booking to record the expected receipt date.  All new fields are only visbile in OSX portals and not in NEO.    AW7 04-Sep-25 08:42 GMT+10:00:   Proposed changes:  Chunk 1 - adding column to JSB and JSL - dev regen:  JobSupplierBooking add column:  JSB_ExpectedReceiptDate DATE NULL,    JobSupplierBookingLine.sql add column:  JSL_ExpectedReceiptDate DATE NULL,    KPN 11-Sep-25 13:27 GMT+08:00: According to HLD, this date should only be added on JobSupplierBooking, please update Chunk2 as well. And HLD says "A new date and time field has been added", I'm not sure if this field should be DATE or DATETIMEOFFSET.  AW7 12-Sep-25 11:39 GMT+10:00: I have asked Jessie to clarify both  It's a date or date and time field, and  If the estimated date will be editable in future.    Run regen    PR for the chunk 1:  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/pull/12668  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/pull/5213    https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/pull/13783  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/pull/5352      Chunk 2 - Glow side changes:    The below TVF need to be updated to get the receipt date for the different grids  GetJobSupplierBookingsWithSecurityContext.sql    Entities:  IJobSupplierBooking.yaml:    - propertyPath: JSB_ExpectedReceiptDate      width: "200"      mode: Optional  ......  properties:    JSB_ExpectedReceiptDate:      readOnly: '%.UserIsContact'    IJobSupplierBookingLine.yaml:    - propertyPath: Booking.JSB_ExpectedReceiptDate      width: !!int 250      mode: Default      readOnly: "true"    IJobSupplierBookingLine.yaml:    - propertyPath: JSL_ExpectedReceiptDate      width: !!int 210        Form:  New tab will be need to added in the form Supplier Booking Details to cater for this work item as well as WI00954659.    36756adc4c3a4277b2d1f5629b9d4438.yaml  ORM Supplier Booking Details - similar to the below however the visibility condition need to modified            <control              code="TAB"              id="035cdbe0-fde4-4d2f-9587-b1ff928ffb93">              <placeholder                name="Caption"                value="Planning"                resid="44bf24b0-243b-4ddd-9c2e-c1ad733fa4a0" />              <placeholder                name="VisibilityCondition"                value="JSB_Status != "INC" || IsInCancelOperation == "YES" || IsInPopup" />            </control>            <control              code="TAI"              id="954a5599-061f-4b5c-80e5-319e5460fc82">              <placeholder                name="VisibilityCondition"                value="JSB_Status != "INC" || IsInCancelOperation == "YES" || IsInPopup" />              <placeholder                name="Eager"                value="True" />              <placeholder                name="Style"                value="justify-content: center" />              <placeholder                name="Padding"                value="py-3" />              <control                code="BOX"                id="69baf6a7-dace-45a0-8e69-dbc43d73d058">                <placeholder                  name="Style"                  value="justify-content: center" />                <placeholder                  name="Layout"                  value="grid" />                <control                  code="BOX"                  id="91371e07-1555-4241-a046-318ccc2f2149">                  <placeholder                    name="Layout"                    value="flex" />                  <placeholder                    name="FlexDirection"                    value="flex-column" />                  <placeholder                    name="FlexAlign"                    value="align-center" />                  <placeholder                    name="Columns"                    value="col-12 col-md-10 col-lg-8 col-xl-7" />                  <control                    code="PNL"                    id="e55d7c91-f344-4d8b-a5dd-cf62cb41cca3">                    <placeholder                      name="Caption"                      value="Cargo Dates"                      resid="1b020b12-7021-48ee-8dd6-b7a95a96e3ac" />                    <control                      code="DAE"                      id="60d3cfb7-db6f-4967-ac17-911c08e687c3"                      binding="JSB_ExpectedReceiptDate" />                  </control>                </control>              </control>            </control>    Need to add expected receipt date to the below forms  7cbc8e7475bd4b1c836fd7abbafe6221.yaml (OSX CFS Receive Cargo)  38cd15ef23274163a655d66a1d91418c.yaml (OSX Container Load Plan Assembly Details)      KPN 11-Sep-25 13:31 GMT+08:00:  Why !%.UserIsContact, HLD says "This record is visible in NEO and OSX portals."  AW7 12-Sep-25 11:39 GMT+10:00: I have asked Jessie to clarify as all the other conversations suggest the estimate date is visible to the OSX portal only   AW7 15-Sep-25 10:31 GMT+10:00: It will be visible for both NEO and OSX, however it's readonly in NEO. The below property will be set on Entity IJobSupplierBooking.yaml:  properties:    JSB_ExpectedReceiptDate:      readOnly: '%.UserIsContact'    refer to the below spike:  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/Glow/pull/9994    KPN 15-Sep-25 14:18 GMT+08:00:  Please also add to OrderMangerCustomer.yaml    Form-flow:  Defaulting the expected receipt date from supplier booking to supplier booking lines will be done in the below form-flow:  ORS - CFS - Set Default Receipt Values (1de84e742ee14aea947aa44266326f19.yaml )  Modify the existing form-flow to add additional steps to set the default value on supplier booking lines from supplier booking if expected receipt date on booked line is blank and not blank on supplier booking.    A StmLog event need to be created when the expected receipt date is set on supplier booking, this event will need to have the receipt date as one of the RFN parameter so that the user can use it to configure the workflow template to trigger milestone event.   Proposed solution is to create a supplier booking change extender to create the StmLog event if the expected receipt date has been updated. The booking number and expected date will be in the event log lie the below:   TYP=REC|RFN=SBK:SB00001220|DATE?  KPN 11-Sep-25 13:33 GMT+08:00:  Which file should be modified?  AW7 12-Sep-25 11:34 GMT+10:00: There is existing code which sends the WHR event whe Finish Receipt is clicked the code is in OrderManagerCommandRules.CommitCFSReceiptAsync. This event can be used to populate the actual time on the milestone. Another WHR event will be triggered when the estimated date is updated, this will be done via the change extender - refer to the below sipke.  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/Glow/pull/9994      AW7 16-Sep-25 16:25 GMT+10:00:   There has been a discussion on whether to use Date or DateTimeOffset. CFS receipt process is a local activity and there is no timezone need to be considered. So we decided to go with Date.      AW7 26-Sep-25 11:55 GMT+10:00:   There is slight difference with the format of the WHR event referenct between the code and HLD. HLD use "|" to separate the SBK number and Date, however this will cause issue as the code after the pipe need to be pre-defined in CargoWise and DATE is not in the pre-defined list.    Have confirmed with Jessie, the format of the reference will look like:  "|TYP=REC|RFN=SBK:SB00000016, DATE:26-Sep-2025"    If an estimated receipt date is removed then it will look like  "|TYP=REC|RFN=SBK:SB00000016, DATE:"
feature_description: New expected receipt date on SBK

details: ROH 11-Apr-25 10:45 GMT+10:00:   Added WI00823977 as pre-req as requested by Bogdan Shchekin. See edocs.    LS6 28-May-25 09:46 GMT+08:00:   Similar WI HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/417ce246-8894-4cd6-9d96-f7377164e2e1" WI00883054 - Removing Audit Event (ADD/EDT/DEL) Logs from AccPeriodManagement Table    LS6 10-Apr-25 17:22 GMT+08:00:   Confirmed with Merlin, we have chunked this WI to several workflows for the 7 tables to be changed based on their scope.    LS6 21-Mar-25 16:13 GMT+08:00:   Because this change has deleted all the "IsAutoLogged => true" override in all solutions under /Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight as Mohammad suggested, we will not have the audit events from StmALog table, which will case a a lot of tests which depend on audit events to fail.  We need to look into each of the test to see if we can remove the dependency of the audit events. If not, we need further discussion with System Component team.    DDD 11-Mar-25 16:56 GMT+08:00:   Background:   - Audit Logs are currently Stored within STMALog table.   - STMALog is the biggest Table and Audit logs are the biggest contributor for the size of the table.     Objectvies:  - Move Audit events from STMALOG to Audit DB. Ensure CDC is enabled on all tables for wirting audit events to STMALOG  - Identify Teams responsible for Implementing the Change (System Comp)  - Ensure Milestones and triggers can still Fire for ADD\EDT events (automation)  - No ADD\DEL\EDT events recors are added to STMALog (individual Teams)  - All exisitng ADD\DEL\EDT events Records are deleted from STMAlog Table (individual teams)  -Add Constraints in STMALog for ADD\DEL\EDT events (System Comp)    Done Statement  1. delete override IsAutoLogged from classes in our solutions   C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Shared\Freight.sln   C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Forwarding\Forwarding.sln   C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Forwarding\AWB\Enterprise.Freight.Forwarding.AWB.sln    M04 12-Mar-25 10:04 GMT+11:00:   we need to check all different area in the freight solution /Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight  search this path in the devops    2. Add relevant tables to AutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValues       for details ,please refer this wiki: https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/13383/Turning-off-Audit-Events  here is a similar pr from Ecommerce - Development : https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/316812    Tips: (regarding to how to find relevant tables: )  Automation team has a project that would stop loggging into STMAlog we need to check status of that project and what does it do, we don't want to cross over and do the same work if automation is already doing this.   another note for development team  Consider Brett's comment: "Anything that implementes IWorkflowProvider can write directly into StmALogQueue instead of StmALog for ADD\DEL\EDT this will maintain exisitng Behavour with minimal Code change and complete consistency with what happening right now"    M04 12-Mar-25 10:02 GMT+11:00:   better to check https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/309180?_a=files    ROH 03-Mar-25 16:17 GMT+11:00:   Please see instructions and spreadsheet on attached incident.  We should probably have separate workflows for each affected table - please create them as necessary and estimate and chunk tasks.
