WKI_Summary: ACAS - Item 9 - Customer Account Shipping Frequency [Slow PrintFinalMaster FIX]
details: Done: CW does not hang/freeze when Print Final Master is executed for air consols destined or transiting US for ACAS Reporting    Initial HLD has been updated to remove the ATD check and use the Shipment ETD for the calculation to address the issue:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=988b2db8-2ab6-48c8-80d7-166fbf119f67&StorageDocPK=0579904f-b2f0-4034-9b7c-32e4b617a675&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2b%2bTPV2%2f0N2X2z5lLg5dh%2bv3x9ioUdXKPO" EHG 12-Mar-25 16:09:  File WI00881780_HLD.docx (Escalation Document)      SKW 13-Mar-25 10:34 GMT+11:00:   1. Update 4 queries to use shipment ETD instead of transport ATD to get shipment count in the past 30 days.   Those are in SqlForConsolSendingAgent, SqlForControllingCustomer, SqlForShipper, SqlForConsignee.  2. We need to refactor the query a bit more. Loading data from the view could be the root cause for the delay  Since the ETD value can get directly from JobShipment table, so we don't need to join ViewShipmentAndConsolTransports.  3. Calculating the frequency happens twice, one during validation and the other one during generating FWB/FHL message.  Need investigate if there is a way to avoid the duplicate calculation.    SKW 13-Mar-25 16:55 GMT+11:00:   For the point 3, use consol.AWBHeader.GetACASCountryHandler() to get the existed ACASCountry handler in the validation methods (ValidateACASForFWB and ValidateACASForFHL), instead of create a new ACASCountryHandler.
feature_description: Item 9 - Customer Account Shipping Frequency [Slow PrintFinalMaster FIX]

WKI_Summary: Scale out - use of secondary 'more broadly' - Module Search Filters
details: This WI is for scaling out module search filters to secondary SQL servers.  Note, this WI does not cover all of the request from Brett.  For more details, see the attached CS incidnet.    On Task 30 of the attached incident are the following notes from both Alex & Mykola:    A.K 29-Jan-25 13:14 GMT+11:00:   Secondary nodes are readonly, so their use would be limited to queries that retrieve data (no updates/inserts).    Couple of use cases which natually would fit here is module searches and reports.  Report already have use of secondary servers, but modules look like really low hanging fruit, especially after Lucene indexing support was added.    When Lucene support for the module  is On - we get the PKs of found records from Lucene server and then load the records from [primary] DB into the BizCollection bound to the module grid.  So it should be realtively easy to substitue Lucene indexing (as a source of PKs) with query to the secondary SQL node instead.  The final load of records by PKs will run on primary DB, but this query is fast and cheap.    For module filters we will have three options for search: SQL on primary/Lucene/SQL on Secondary.    All in all, I'd suggest to implement this approach as on option on module search filters and, if successful, see what other places can benefit from it.    M.K 24-Jan-25 14:07 GMT+11:00:  My understanding of request from Brett is:  It is more then search using secondary SQL servers (nodes), but also maintaning and synchronizing them and dynamically adding and removing.  But maintaning secondary servers is for Architecture Performance team.  A.K: I think we can assume the maintanance and synchronizing has been taken care of already.    In Core we can add functionality to do search/filtering in module screens using secondary servers.  Plus grid colors logic (when it hits db to check if rows match color rule filters).  A.K: with grid colouring I think we have higher risk lower reward situation.  records in the grid will be loaded from primary server, but coloring them based on secondary might result in incorrect colouring.  Also - I don't think colouring puts much load on primary server.  Also - coloring has been recently moved to background thread and this could add a bit of complexity.  So I would leave colouring for the time being (do it in the next phase if deemed worth it).    I do not think this particular request is directly related to Lucene. Lucene indexes are calculated from db data, but I do not know how exactly it happens (via direct access to db data, or to data transactions). If it is direct access to db data - then it can use secondary SQL servers for that.  A.K: this would be parrallel to Lucene implemenation, i.e. alternative to the Lucene.    For search in modules with secondary SQL servers (classic/legacy filters), we can:    - add some property in code for modules if they can be used with secondary servers data,    - add registries to enable use of secondary server for modules - either many registry items for each module, or one registry item with list of enabled modules;    - for each enabled module configure how old can be data in secondary server to be used for search;  Then do same logic as report generator: find most idle secondary server with fresh enough data to do search, or if not found - use primary server.  When opening record for edit - load it from primary server.  A.K yep, something like this.
feature_description: use of secondary 'more broadly' - Module Search Filters

WKI_Summary: Redirection to AirlineConnect
details: BPD 03-Sep-25 17:00 GMT+10:00:   Detailed Build Design :    1) When user clicks on Consol > Electronic Messaging > Carrier > Air Cargo Booking Request , we need to display a pop up with information of redirection to AirlineConnect,  instead of loading Air Cargo Booking Request Form  In Code please refer to:  Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Forwarding\Documents\DocDataObjects\Supporters\ForwardingDocDataObjectProvider.cs  IReadOnlyDictionary<string, Func<ForwardingConsol, IDocDataObjectParameters, object>> ConsolDocDataObjectMapping    Re-assign current form builder to a new pop-up  Change [DataContext.AirBookingRequest] = (consol, parameters) => new AirBookingRequestBuilder(consol).Build(),  To  we can create RedirectAirBookingToAirlineConnect.cs,where we implement the pop-up as listed in HLD  (Note to Developer : please crosscheck during development if it would be better to create this in Freight\Forwarding\Forwarding.GUI or Freight\Forwarding\Documents\GUI or Freight\Forwarding\Documents\DocDataObjects\AirBookingRequest)    2) Add contents of the pop up message:  Please add the contents of pop-up as mentioned in HLD.  To show a Do not show this message again checkbox we can utilize :  Enterprise/Architecture/GUI/Environment/User/ZMessageBoxWithCheckbox.cs    An example of its usage is in : Enterprise/Architecture/GUI/Enterprise.ZArchitecture.GUI/Controls/Grid/ZGrid.cs -> void ShowDragAndDropTips()    3) After the user closes the pop up message, they should be redirected to AirlineConnect  The path to Airline Connect should follow similar to the Consol > Actions > AirlineConnect path  This path implements the following section of code:  Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Forwarding.GUI/Consol/ConsolForm.cs -> void AirMarketplaceMenuItem_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)  Please implement similar validations when the pop up is closed and if validations are statisfied launch AirlineConnect.    References:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/5450/How-to-load-the-Booking-Air-Rate-Selector-in-Dev  HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/NewWorkItem/8051d117-238c-491f-b9ec-391bc0f150d2?lang=en-gb" WI00526638 - AirMarketPlace - New Menu Item & Market Place Form Creation  HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/NewWorkItem/a2cae5bb-db12-4ce1-a2e0-885cdb815f22?lang=en-gb" WI00663162 - AirlineConnect: [Re-brand] Official product name change  HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/2c2b87c2-9156-416f-86d8-820616e4514b?lang=en-gb" WI00300594 - FormBuilder - eBooking form Template (no messaging)    Note to product team :  According to the added details in workitem, I have understood we will be making Air Cargo Booking Request form obsolete after the current work item and WI00837377 . Please note there are significant code sections dedicated to building Air Cargo Booking Request form.   If Air Cargo Booking Request form  is going to be obsolete after these two work items, we will also need to clean up sections that build Air Cargo Booking Request form. This has not been addressed in this work item, where we have only implemented Redirection Pop-up as listed in  HLD. Please help create another work item for detailed investigation to cleanup the code relating to Air Cargo Booking Request form  section, If/When it will be obsolete. Thank you.    SNF 06-Aug-25 12:12 GMT+10:00:     In today’s weekly AirlineConnect call, the following decisions were made:    A banner will not be introduced on the legacy form.    Users initiating the path Consol > Electronic Messaging > Carrier > Air Cargo Booking Request will be redirected to the new AirlineConnect UI.    A pop-up, similar to the one in the original HLD, will be displayed to inform users of the redirection, the updated path, and provide links to AirlineConnect resources.    The target completion date is 03/09/25 (DPR cut) to ensure availability in GP1 after 15/10/25.    The updated HLD can be accessed [here].    WI00837377 has been updated; it will no longer include a support registry option to toggle the legacy path on or off—access will be fully removed.    These changes were discussed and agreed upon with representatives from EHG, MAS, BZS, TS2, A13, and SNF.        SNF 17-Jul-25 11:11 GMT+10:00:     Done statement:     The banner message for the legacy Air Cargo Booking Request Form has been completed and is now live. It lets users know that the legacy form will be retired in the near future and encourages them to start using AirlineConnect instead.    What’s included:    A clear message explaining the upcoming change  Reassurance that users can still make single-airline bookings, with added benefits of multi-airline search  Helpful links to AirlineConnect guides and training videos  A placeholder note so we can easily add the official decommissioning date once confirmed    This should give users everything they need to make a smooth transition.  Please find the suggest banner wording in eDocs.

WKI_Summary: Enhance module search with option to use binary collation for wildcard text sear
details: A.K 26-May-25 15:53 GMT+10:00:     Background  In attached incident DSV came up with suggestions  1) Using binary collation for wild card searches:  COLLATE Latin1_General_100_BIN2  2) Using [undocumented] QUERYTRACEON 8649 flag to enforce SQL server to consider parallelism      This WI is to implement suggestion 1).    More info: HYPERLINK "https://www.mssqltips.com/sqlservertip/8100/optimize-sql-like-wildcard-searches/" Optimize SQL LIKE Wildcard Searches    Suggested solution  Add registry item Registry->Optimization->Enable Binary Collation for Wildcard Searches for Text Module filters. (or something alonmg these lines)  The registry item should be OFF by default, preserving existing behaviour.    If it's on - then Text filters that use "contains" as would generate:    LOWER(GS_FullName) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_BIN2 like LOWER('%BOB%')    instead of;    GS_FullName like N'%BOB%'     JSW 17-Jun-25 15:34 GMT+08:00:   One question, should we only change logic of "contains"?  Or change other conditions which will generate 'like' word in sql query. Such as 'not starting', 'contains' etc.    I think we should change other conditions.
product_candidate: Enhance module search with option to use binary collation for wildcard text sear

WKI_Summary: Add Brazil IBGE City Codes as BR UNLOCO 'Local Codes' to support BR Tax Reform
details: FLN 13-Aug-25 21:32 GMT+10:00:   This WI will be implemeted after Accounting Dev have added 'ACC' Usage code via HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/NewWorkItem/473e5517-b3e0-4d32-8507-465a44398f03?lang=en-gb" WI00949935 - High Priority - UNLOCO Local Code - Add Local Useage Code 'ACC'    Background:  UNLOCO Local Code:   Ref Team has existing architecture to store and maintain 'Local Codes'   'Local Codes' are used for certain UNLOCO in customs messaging.    Accounting Product Needs  Brazil VAT Tax Reform takes effect from Jan 2026.  The new Brazil VAT law introduces 'Destination Based' Tax principle.   It requires the IBGE code (Brazil's national statistics assigned code) of the buyer's city be recorded on the electronic invoices.  Brazil has more than 5500 cities. We confirmed the BR UNLOCO name matches with IBGE city name very closely.  Using UNLOCO of a buyer's city provides greater reliability than using the city name from org address (given there couldn't be different spellings etc).  As Local Codes are managed via Ref DB, this method also provides ability to implement quick update in ongoing maintenance since no coding/patching is required.    Done Statement:  One BR City IBGE code is recorded  under 'Local Codes' grid for each BR UNLOCO as long as mapping exists.   Country/Region = BR, Usage Type = 'ACC', Code = 7 digits IBGE code.    Method:   Initial upload - Accounting Product team will provide Ref team a mapping file to map BR UNLOCO to BR IBGE City Code. Mapping will be based on State + City name as there are multiple cities with the same names in Brazil.  Ongoing Maintenance - IBGE codes are updated by BR Government annually. Accounting Product team are happy to maintain Brazil ACC 'Local Codes' once Ref team provides a tool.    How this will be used in Accounting module:  When user creates an AR invoice in Brazil, the existing Fixed Place of Supply (FPOS) rule will be used to default UNLOCO of the Debtor's address on the billing line when Debtor is in BR  This information is then included in eInvoicing XML to be sent to the respective BR city tax office.    Accounting team will extend the existing FPOS function in separate WIs to support this.
product_candidate: Add Brazil IBGE City Codes as BR UNLOCO 'Local Codes' to support BR Tax Reform

WKI_Summary: SQL 2022 is now minimum version for alpha
details: SQL 2022 is now minimum version for alpha. CargoWise Cloud has finally completed the rollout so we can go ahead and make 2022 the minimum version now.    All associated content will need updating.    -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  GBE 25-Jun-25 11:06 GMT+10:00:   That's correct, I can confirm that the DAT images do not change as a result of this work item.    MZT 25-Jun-25 10:08 GMT+10:00:   About (3. remove SQL 2019 image): No, we're removing the support from CargoWise. Not all of the products at once. (note that DAT builds every WTG product, not just CW).   Instead, you need to change the minimum SQL capability to SQL2022 in this file:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FCommon%2FTesting%2FEnterprise.Dat.Implementation%2FEnterprise.Dat.Adapter%2FTestDiscovery.cs&version=GBmaster&line=326&lineEnd=328&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=87&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    DDI 24-Jun-25 15:49 GMT+08:00:   [Detailed Design]    1. Make change to SqlServerVersionNumber. Remove all 2019 related content. Make SQL 2022 minimum there.  2. Add SQL2022 as minimum requirement for Dev testing. And make sure all tests pass.  3. We need a new VM image which enables SQL 2022 only. Remove SQL 2019. This parts includes new image creation and deployment. Possible need to contact Lee Coady. Note, there is a bit of code to switch SQL Service off and on, which needs concern.    Also, referring to what we did for adding SQL 2022 support in SqlServerVersionNumber last time is required, which can check what's missing in the above design. QBELOGHAM - How to remove the EORI code Automatically for Italy //CR5  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=e4151e62-daa1-4dd6-8504-47d7a0e08eef&VersionNumber=24.10.18.107&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bmhi2mUkTXpLKSjHW7d9MutpEj4fSK5YF" CS01738659 - DHLGLOBNJ - ICS2 - EU Customs Advance Cargo Information System  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=e3497cde-762c-42dc-be09-c5e5d28cadde&VersionNumber=24.10.18.107&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bg3jfsL1wmwEPzhXUk1HIhzSp%2bJQW0BH9" CS01759784 - GEOWILDXB - ICS2 Declarant EORI - Default  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=802a183f-df89-41ca-9b7c-e1c72a5d9bde&VersionNumber=24.11.13.50&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bSzw3%2bz732bvtCBSA5fXi7hgwEziVlOel" CS01791844 - LEMANCPH - ICS2 - how to indicate that Carrier will always do filing.      WW 15-Oct-24 17:00 GMT+11:00:   This UPN can be used to calculate whether to default as carrier-filing or self-filing for ICS2 on SI form.  https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=de388b92-3c3e-4f6e-a6a0-1ee228b9a1ae    WW 30-Sep-24 16:33 GMT+10:00:   Original request was from DHL in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=SupportIncident&BusinessEntityPK=1e1dfa0b-3ff9-4a84-9801-3319a196bcaf&VersionNumber=24.9.29.29&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b5pYV66xo3oBYtR%2f%2bUU9twAVMac724pe9" CS01147157 - DHLGLOBNJ - ICS2 - EU Customs Advance Cargo Information System  DHL has decided to use a common Supplementary Declarant EORI for all of their EU shipments.  Based on the current logic, the S.D. EORI is always defaulted from the Consol's Receiving Agent, so users have to override this field everytime as workaround.    Suggested solution:   Add a new Party Type "Supplementary Declarant" under Organization > Fwd/Agent > Details tab.the Organization is "Receiving Agent" on a Consol job, default the related "Supplementary Declarant" under the Consol > Addresses tab  (Try to utilize "Direction", "Transport Mode", "Location", "Imp Ctry/Rgn." fields to refine defaulting logic)    Above will also require a new Address Type "Supplementary Declarant" to be added under Consol  > Addresses tab. Read-Only.    Shipping Instruction "ICS2 Declarant EORI" field will default from Consol > Addresses > Supplementary Declarant [EOR number] as priority.blank or not exist, fallback to the current logic.
product_candidate: Default same Supplementary Decalarant for multiple Receiving Agent

WKI_Summary: IOM [UPS MVP] -Event Cascading (milestones)
details: UPS requirements require to have Cascading events for milestone behaviour in AOM    Update note on current system behaviour  https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=8427bb67-7a97-4030-b899-fa52363fbe29    Figjam board  https://www.figma.com/board/kQ1g3M1ku4EGyynkjdUTxK/Milestones?node-id=59-183&t=MTaYiaQbMBJfUII9-1    We need to create relationship links so that events will cascade between the entities.  J36 26-Aug-25 13:40 GMT+12:00: On speaking to Nisha have added a requirement for an event context of SBK- Suppleir bookings to shipments. This may require to be chunked.    KPN 08-Sep-25 15:52 GMT+08:00:   Reason for the change  Add Parent Child relationship established in AOM entities    Done  Events from a Consol when linked set up to will cascade to a Supplier Booking.  Events from a Consol when linked via a container Load Plan will cascade to a Supplier booking  Events from a Supplier booking once converted will cascade to a shipment  A SBK context for cascading behaviour has been added for shipments.    Proposal Solution  For SBK -> Shipment  Add context type SBK  Master types list https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/a30d379918117ee1755ad6757c3ca4c72e961bfb/Enterprise/Product/Operations/MasterFiles/Business/MasterFiles.Business/Workflow/WorkflowDescriptor/EventContext/WorkflowEventContext.cs#L104C18-L104C28  1. Add code des pair https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/master/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Forwarding.Business/Shipment/EventContext/ForwardingShipmentWorkflowEventContextMasterTypes.xml  2. Add types list in https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/a30d379918117ee1755ad6757c3ca4c72e961bfb/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Forwarding.DataTransfer/WorkflowDescriptors/ForwardingShipmentWorkflowDescriptor.cs#L1017, shoud display for ForwardingShipmentWorkflowEventContextMasterClassifiers.Codes.Every    Add cascading matching logic  Find related entities in cascading events starting from https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/a30d379918117ee1755ad6757c3ca4c72e961bfb/Enterprise/Product/Operations/MasterFiles/Business/MasterFiles.Business/Workflow/ProcessTasks/Triggers/TriggerConditions/TriggerConditionEvaluator.cs#L106  1. Add related entity matching logic in https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/a30d379918117ee1755ad6757c3ca4c72e961bfb/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Forwarding.DataTransfer/WorkflowDescriptors/ForwardingShipmentWorkflowDescriptor.cs#L1067    For Event Cascading  Add filter SBK in https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/blob/88d6d89ea30ad43951a38cecf743eae79530b4b9/CargoWise.DbUpgrader/src/Scripts/Scripts.Definitions/Core/Workflow/GetCascadingProcessTasksForConsol.sql#L4    Spike:  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/pull/5261  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/pull/13071    References  1. Trigger condition: https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=03fb6e30-1f03-4c06-8cc7-70556251bf17  2. How do I set up trigger actions for shipments based on consolidation events?: https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=060fea0a-5aca-4c3d-9d86-1233548d7886  3. Understanding Cascading and Propagating Behaviors https://wisetechacademy.com/search?searchText=propagate+event  4. Cascading and propogating.  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/3a4a33dae6bfba7878715229193b8a4125a43cef/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Forwarding.Business/Consol/Workflow/ForwardingConsolProcessHandlingInfo.cs#L14  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/blob/d00fc425a97125aa5bde16cad7bd166aea98369f/CargoWise.DbUpgrader/src/Scripts/Scripts.Definitions/Core/Workflow/GetCascadingProcessTasksForConsol.sql#L5    How to setup for this WI  Below SHP01, SBK01, CON01 are examples, and they are related.  Event code is example.  For event from consol to supplier booking:  1. Open SBK01, add a milestone with event code = EXR, and Cascading = true  2. Open CON01, in Workflow & Tracking - Events tab, manually add EXR event, (or trigger event)  3. Open SBK01, the actual start time of milestone added in 1 should not be empty.     For event from supplier booking to shipment  Similar to Reference 2.  1. In the SHP template, set cascading context to SBK.   1.1 Or in SHP01 form, add a trigger or milestone, and set Cascading = true, Cascading context = SBK  2. Open one supplier booking, e.g. SBK01 add an event(trigger an event, or manually add an event in the Events tab)  3. Above event should cascad to related shipment SHP01. Open SHP01, the actual start time of trigger or milestome added in 1.1 is not empty.    If user wants to update field when the milestone is triggered, user can add FLD in completion trigger actions. And run service task LWM, LWK  https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=ee9a7ebe-3f6e-4d1b-aa49-46ad7c1957d3
feature_description: Event Cascading (milestones)

WKI_Summary: GLWOM: CLP add location filters for booking information
details: WCR 02-Jul-25 17:00 GMT+10:00:   Additional functionality has been requested during usability review to add Goods Description and Marks and Numbers to the NEO CLP page so that it makes sense to add the columns/filters to the NEO portal.    Refer UPS incident CS01754255     Note original request was to serch on CFS address this has now been agreed the ability to focus on the Booking location should be added.      DVA 14-Mar-25 15:07 GMT+08:00:   Detailed Build Design  Reason For Change  Enhance user experience with additional filtering options and sortable columns.    Current Issue  Limited filtering and sorting options make it hard to find and organize container load plans.    Done Statement  Add filtering and sorting for Planned Load Port, Planned Discharge Port, First Load Port, Final Discharge Port, Created By, Goods Description, and Marks and Numbers.      Suggested Changes  1. In Business Rules > CFS Container Load List (ICFSContainerLoadList) > Global Search, add mapping for the following fields:  EMF 08-Apr-25 10:41 GMT+08:00:      Index Name Property Path  Planned Load Port  PLANNEDLOADPORT CLH_RL_NKPlannedLoadPort  Planned Discharge Port PLANNEDDISCHARGEPORT CLH_RL_NKPlannedDischargePort  First Load Port ORIGINPORT JobContainers.JobConsol.JK_RL_NKLoadPort  Final Discharge Port DESTINATIONPORT JobContainers.JobConsol.JK_RL_NKDischargePort  Created By Create User Code CREATEUSERNAME CLH_SystemCreateUser  Goods Description GOODSDESCRIPTION CLH_GoodsDescription  Marks and Numbers MARKSANDNUMBERS CLH_MarksAndNumbers    EMF 09-May-25 10:30 GMT+08:00:   First Load Port and Final Discharge port have been removed because CLP have multiple related consols.    EMF 16-Apr-25 08:58 GMT+08:00:   I checked with GLOW team, we should be able to add index for these two large columns CLH_GoodsDescription VARCHAR(35)  CLH_MarksAndNumbers NVARCHAR(MAX)     2, In Visual Design > OSX Container Load Plans and ODX - Container Load Plans > Field Configuration  add the new columns mapped to the new indexes added in ICFSContainerLoadList and specify the captions for the following columns:   - Create User Name (using glow convention Create User Code)   - Load Port -> Planned Load Port   - Discharge Port -> Planned Discharge Port   - Origin Port -> First Load Port   - Destination Port -> Final Discharge Port   - Goods Description   - Mark and Numbers
product_candidate: CLP add location filters for booking information

WKI_Summary: [EAD] Add UTC Unix Timestamp in all UXML/NXML
details:
J30 19-Dec-24 15:47 GMT+11:00: As agreed, we will put Timestamp to DataContext in Native xml too. If there is no DataConext before, like manually export, we will add an empty DataContext. The result is like below:
.... ... {UNIXTimeStamp UTC} //creation time of the message ... ....
.... XC 13-Dec-24 11:45 GMT+11:00: for UXML the TimeStamp should be in DataContext as it's specific to that EDI message/XML, shouldn't be in job data ...... {UNIXTimeStamp UTC} //creation time of the message ..... ...... J30 20-Nov-24 11:39 GMT+11:00: Dev handover: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=6e2328bb-f946-4ab4-b91f-16efed424a68&StorageDocPK=b822e663-9105-49c4-9cca-9a2474c47cff&Hash=%2bVrQAunLUY99hkZsMx2ic7TykE%2baCa6Rt&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd" J30 20-Nov-24 11:39: File Dev_WI00822867.docx (Internal Correspondence) J30 11-Nov-24 10:41 GMT+11:00: Detail Design: For universal XML: 1 Add Timestamp property in TopLevelDataObject like below, similiar to TopLevelDataObject_MessageNumberCollection         [MaxLength(15)]         [DataProperty]         public ZString? Timestamp { get; set; } [DataProperty] is must in TopLevelDataObject, otherwise the GetChildElementHandler will ignore it as it is in parent class. 2 add a method to TopLevelDataObjectWriter to set unix time like below         protected virtual void PopulateCommonProperties(TBusinessObject sourceBO, TDataObject dataObject)         {             var dateTime = ZDateTime.UtcNow;             var unixEpoch = new DateTime(1970, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0, DateTimeKind.Utc);             dataObject.TimeStamp = (dateTime - unixEpoch).TotalSeconds.ToString("F2", CultureInfo.InvariantCulture);         } For Native XML: 1 Add Timestamp property in HeaderData public string Timestamp { get; set; } 2 In NativeXmlSerializer, set the value of Timestamp in HeaderData. J30 11-Nov-24 10:38 GMT+11:00: As confirmed with product team: 1) use ; 2) put in header for native xml 3) use xml generate time J30 08-Nov-24 16:55 GMT+11:00: 1 Should it be or ? 2 For native XML, can we place within the header like or , as shown below? The should only contain fields from business domain objects.
YOUAUS_AU true ... ... ...
3 The XML is generated before the message creation. I may use the XML generation time instead of the message creation time, which could lead to a difference of a few milliseconds. Are there any concerns with this approach? ADP 29-Oct-24 17:10 GMT+11:00: Both Universal and Native XML schemas get enhanced with a tag that 2. Add TimeStamp in all UXML/NXML ...... ...... E CargoWise One Support ...... {UNIXTimeStamp UTC} //creation time of the message ...... ...... ......
product_candidate: [EAD] Add UTC Unix Timestamp in all UXML/NXML

WKI_Summary: Differentiating CCA Record Consumption in Operational Transactions via Linkage
details: Done Statement  The proposed change aims to distinguish between two types of transactions (Consol/QB/BWQ) :  Transactions that consume a Carrier Contract without a corresponding CCA record, and  Transactions that truly consume a Carrier Contract with a relevant CCA record. WKI_Summary: Turn off Audit Events for Product tables
details: JPG 24-Mar-25 17:25 GMT+11:00: The purpose of this WI is to turn off Audit Event logging (by default) for the main Product (OrgSupplierPart) tables. See the following links for an overview of what we want to achieve:    https://wisetechglobal.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/ArchiveManager/EUUiOSoELGRNsSGhAzlT16kBowtezPrVVdNV3H4dxM3N9g?e=FWtKxN    https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_wiki/wikis/CargoWise.wiki/13383/Turning-off-Audit-Events    REQ001: Remove the IsAutoLogged override from the following classes (that is, turn off auto logging):    Enterprise.MasterFiles.Business.OrgSupplierPart  BaseCusClassPartPivot    REQ002: OrgPartRelation has IsAutoLogged = false, but it has custom EDT events. These should no longer belogged when the Registry setting below is off. When it is on the the events should log as usual for backwards compatibility.  Refer to new description below    REQ003: Add the following tables to AutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValue (https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FWorkflow%2FWorkflow.Business%2FAuditStmALog%2FAutoLoggedTablesDefaultConfigValues.cs&version=GBmaster&_a=contents)    OrgSupplierPart  CusClassPartPivot    This enable 2 things:  When the registry is on for a particular table, then StmALog events will be created as if IsAutoLogged were turned on.  When the registry if off, then NonPersistedStmALog events will be create. These will allow workflow to work on EDT/ADD events, but it will not actually persist the events in StmALog (which is the real goal here).    (Do not add CusClassPartPivot, because we do not support workflow against that table.)  LY 06-Aug-25 09:30 GMT+01:00: REQ003 removed based on the discussion in https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/pull/4548#discussion_r2252847083  --    These tables should already be in the Audit DB and visible on the Product form:  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowEditForm&ControllerID=WorkItem&BusinessEntityPK=83f735ab-19db-47c1-92c3-6b50bdca8b4c&VersionNumber=25.3.24.25&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=EDIPROD&Hash=%2bsTdskTefOKSjTwb%2ffnVLEOoA5F43Opp9" WI00887247 - Enable Audit Data tab for Products    DN 12-May-25 17:22 GMT+10:00: DEV: Possibly we need to add IAuditParent.RelatedAuditChildren to OrgSupplierPart to make CusClassPartPivot visible on Audit Data Tab unless it's already added in WI00887247    LY 25-Jul-25 14:53 GMT+01:00:   For REQ002 There have been some discussions around keeping these logs or moving them to new event codes and it was determined that the purpose for these events are only for audit and highly likely not for workflow, these events will be deprecated in favour of Audit DB.    REQ002:   Add the fields below to Audit DB  - OU_Relationship  - OU_OH  - OU_OP  - CCA_99TariffCode  - CCA_TreatmentCode  - CD_SPI    Deprecate the events in   - https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/5e4471000ec0b3a956261e49d51ef0298d02095d/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Customs/Shared/Business/Business/BusinessObjects/CusClassPartPivot/BaseCusClassPartPivot.cs#L495-L518 and remove all usage of LogIfPropertyValueChange  - https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/5e4471000ec0b3a956261e49d51ef0298d02095d/Enterprise/Product/Operations/MasterFiles/Business/MasterFiles.Business/Organisation/Other/OrgPartRelation/OrgPartRelation.cs#L525-L559
product_candidate: Turn off Audit Events for Product tables

WKI_Summary: Update EDI Client guide to include CSR format requirement
details: HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/2ec7be03-7364-4b9c-a1c2-fbaff1f469bb?lang=en-gb" CS02082000 - LOGSYSBOK - Inbound eAdapter Next - Certificate error    added below into EDI Client Details guide        The CSR must be in PEM format. PEM format requires the header and footer lines:      -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----      (base64-encoded content)      -----END CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----            The base64-encoded content should be split into lines of no more than 64 characters each. Do not add extra spaces or characters at the end of any line. Do not remove all line breaks and make the base64 block a single line—this can cause parsing errors when generate certificate.
product_candidate: Update EDI Client guide to include CSR format requirement

WKI_Summary: [HS] CWNext RecentMessages: improve performance of refresh
details: LNS 31-Jul-25 15:51 GMT+10:00:   - Collect peformance metrics  - Investigate opportunities to improve performance  - Collect performance metrics to compare    LNS 12-Aug-25 15:02 GMT+10:00:   Conisder flatten the data and send it to Lucene DB. It should be faster reading data from there and would not compete with others for the DB.  It seems that JCP_ParticipantID doesn't have an index, and it is the starting point for the whole query.    Find attached the sqlplan extracted from ediProd. We can ask for a 'stats' backup of ediprod raising a CR9 to dba team.  HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=44d79eed-a371-4455-b3b8-8b92d73c1ba9&StorageDocPK=391da791-f98d-4765-93af-13393cc7429e&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bIUpH6VNVu99AhRiSmpkD1EcmGXp%2b%2fiMC" LNS 12-Aug-25 15:06:  File RecentMessages.sqlplan (Recent Message SQL Plan from ediProd)    LNS 14-Aug-25 10:31 GMT+10:00:   Short-term solution proposal:  Filter the result set to return only messages where the posted date is within the last 4 weeks.    ...  and jcm.JCM_PostedTimeUtc > DATEADD(WEEK, -4, GETDATE())  ...    Long-term solution: to be investigated and proposed considering using the lucene database. It will be done in a separate workflow.    LNS 15-Aug-25 10:25 GMT+10:00:   Waiting for HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/3eb52720-a5b2-423c-8280-c511c6bbf879?lang=en-gb" CS02047658 - WISGLOSYD - SQL Plan on ediProd      LNS 22-Aug-25 14:16 GMT+10:00:   Short-term solution:    Analysing the SQL Plan extracted from ediProd, the addition of a PostedTimeUtc in the query filter doesn't reduce significantly the cost of execution.    As the table dbo.JobConversationParticipant does not have an index for JCP_ParticipantID field, the query execution run though too many records.  Because of that, we are creating an index to the table, as follows: HYPERLINK "https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/pull/4857"      In addition to that, we are adding a Registry parameter that allows users to set the last date for messages displayed in the Recent Messages widget.    LNS 16-Sep-25 11:53 GMT+10:00:   Long-term solution will be done in a separate work item: HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/972860b1-3509-42a6-87df-09a04de4e49c?lang=en-gb" WI00963896 - [HS] CWNext RecentMessages: improve performance of refresh - long term solution

WKI_Summary: [Macros] New MCR Date Macros
details: HSP 09-May-25 11:41 GMT+10:00:   Added these macros to MCR:  NowDateTimeOffset - returns Now but with offset info included e.g NowDateTimeOffset.Offset.TotalMinutes gives difference between current timezone offset and UTC  datetime.ToLocal()  datetime.ToUtc()  DateDiff and DateTi meAsString should be achievable with the existing Variance() and datetime.Format() macros - see Jamie's comments below    ---------------    Add support for these macros in MCR:    <DateDiff("startDate", "endDate", "unitType")>  <DateTimeAsString('{DateValue}', '{DateFormatString}' [,Calendar:{CalendarInfo}] [,{ConvertFromUtcToLocal}])>  <ConvertUTCDateTimeToLocal('{DateValue}')>  <UTCTimeOffset>  (Can be implemented with DataDiff. But I think it's better to have it separately)      equivalent ValueProviders are here:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FDocuments%2FDocumentEngine%2FValueProviders%2FMacros%2FDateTimeAsString.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster    New macros should probably be implemented here:  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FCore%2FEnterprise.Macro%2FEnterprise.Macro%2FGenericLibrary.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster    ZMN 17-Apr-25 12:53 GMT+10:00:   <DateDiff("startDate", "endDate", "unitType")>  startDate and endDate should also accept manually entered values. E.g. "19/04/2025 11:15:30"  This DateTime should accept all format dd/mm/yyyy | mm/dd/yyyy | yyyy/mm/dd   Currently in UDF, there is a `using (Culture.SetTemporarily(Culture.Default))` setting the Culture to be {en-AU}, Thus in `DateTimeOffset.TryParse` we always tried to parse as dd/MM/yyyy  We should treat manually entered values as a ZDateTime, thus it should be correctly Parsed based on Branch/CargoWiseOne Environment.  I think here we should use Culture.CurrentCompanyCountryCulture as the Culture for Parsing.  After converting startDate & endDate to DateTime, we can calculate the difference and convert to correct Unit.  Need throw exception if 1: TryParse return false 2: unitType is invalid (not days/hours/mins any of those)    <DateTimeAsString('{DateValue}', '{DateFormatString}' [,Calendar:{CalendarInfo}] [,{ConvertFromUtcToLocal}])>  DateValue should be correctly parsed as that in Macro DateDiff  if ConvertFromUtcToLocal is True, use Env.Time.GetLocalTimeFromDateTimeOffset for convertion     Supportable format should be the same as that in HYPERLINK "https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FCommon%2FArchitecture%2FTypes%2FCargoWise.Types%2FZTypes%2FZDateTime.cs&_a=contents&version=GBmaster" ZDateTime.cs  https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FCommon%2FArchitecture%2FTypes%2FCargoWise.Types%2FZTypes%2FZDateTime.cs&version=GBmaster&line=1129&lineEnd=1140&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=72&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  All results should be presented/evaluated as a string in GUI/Actual condition evaluation. Returning the DateTime after conversion is enough.  Need throw exception if 1: TryParse return false 2: CalendarInfo is invalid    <ConvertUTCDateTimeToLocal('{DateValue}')>  DateValue should also accept manually entered values  DateValue should be correctly parsed as that in Macro DateDiff  After DateValue is correctly parsed, we can get local time by Env.Time.GetLocalTimeFromUtc(DateValue);    <UTCTimeOffset>  Return (int)ZDateTimeOffset.Now.Offset.TotalMinutes;      JR3 29-Apr-25 14:13 GMT+10:00:   These should all require DateTime objects similar to Variance(), If you have a string you want to be a DateTime you should use  datetime.Parse("08/18/2018 07:22:16 -2:00") or datetime.DateTime(2021, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1). datetime.Parse is explained at the end of HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=af819fbe-b3a8-419f-ae78-8aa648eafb89&StorageDocPK=6c2ce00a-2964-42f8-b089-c9dbc2247579&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&ServerName=ediprod.db.wtg.zone&DatabaseName=ediprod&Hash=%2bFpvsRlIbhXPAKBYhFJFKnpOIISqIl98N" JR3 29-Apr-25 15:37:  File DateTimeProperties.docx (Internal Correspondence)    <ConvertUTCDateTimeToLocal('{DateValue}')>    <DateDiff("startDate", "endDate", "unitType")> : Can be acheived with existing Variance function   Simplify as:   Given a UTC DateTime can call UtcDateTime.ToLocal()  Given a Local DateTime can call LocalDateTime.ToUtc()    <UTCTimeOffset>  Now currently returns ZDateTime.Now, make NowDateTimeOffset  Then you can call NowDateTimeOffset.Offset.TotalMinutes    <DateTimeAsString('{DateValue}', '{DateFormatString}' [,Calendar:{CalendarInfo}] [,{ConvertFromUtcToLocal}])>  Can already do this:  Now.Format("dd:MM:yy") = 29:04:25  Now.Format("D")  = Tuesday, 29 April 2025  Now.Format("F")  = Tuesday, April 29, 2025 3:45:30 PM     Here's a full list: HYPERLINK WKI_Summary: IOM [UPS MVP] - Transport mode is added to order Lines
details: PGN 10-Sep-25 15:25 GMT+10:00: Angela agreed that short term we will have a transport mode on the order line that is blank by default. If the order line transport mode is blank it will assume the order header value applies. This is the same as the manufacturer and the incoterms.  Does this require a transformation if the new field can be blank?     IY 03-Sep-25 17:21 GMT+10:00:   Reason for the change  an order line may need to be shipped using a different transport mode and container mode than originally planned. To accommodate such cases, new fields ‘transport mode’ and ‘Container mode’ are now added to be specified at the Order Line level, rather than relying solely on the Order Header. This change will provide greater flexibility and responsiveness in managing logistics, ensuring timely deliveries even under changing circumstances.    Done  Transport Mode and Container Mode are added on order lines.    Proposal Solution  Chunk 1 regen  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/blob/9f17c467e4f5d72545ff29ec9e31b5c189ad40eb/CargoWise.DbUpgrader/src/Resource/Resource/AutoGenerated/Schema_Main/Forwarding/JobOrderLine.sql  add JO_TransportMode CHAR(3) DEFAULT '' NOT NULL, JO_ContainerMode CHAR(3) DEFAULT '' NOT NULL  STZ 05-Sep-25 17:16 GMT+10:00: make sure we have constraints for it    Chunk 2 CW1  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/4bda44b94dcf558982eaf6317042e9926fb23072/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Forwarding.Business/Orders/OrderLine/OrderLine.cs  add  transport mode, Container mode    HYPERLINK for OrderLineGrid & OrderLineDetail in OSX and NEO      UPS Incident CS01775486    Done statement - Transport Mode is now available on order lines.    J36 11-Aug-25 14:56 GMT+12:00: Consider any OM lite implications etc.  J36 13-Aug-25 11:05 GMT+12:00: Consider defaulting behaviour when creating a supplier booking from the order line- consider load mode ?      ANG 13-Aug-25 10:15 GMT+10:00:   Option 1:  Have new on Order Line called "Transport Mode" and it can default always from Order Header, but users could override.  Option 2:  Call new field "Transport Mode Override" and it will be blank by default and imply that it will take the mode from the Header.     Supplier Booking can be created for multiple lines even if they have different transport mode from the header.   When a shipment is created we will need to look at the Order Line transport mode (in option 1 no fallback, in option 2 with fallback to Order Header, which makes me believe Option 1 is more straight forward Steven Zhang, please review).     Re Event.  Create STU - Status updated, parameters TYP=Transport Mode; OLD=old mode; NEW=new mode; RFN = Order Line Number.    Event Details will read:  Status Updated: Transport Mode Order Line Number from Old Mode to New Mode  E.g. Status Updated: Transport Mode 123456 from Sea to Air    J36 26-Aug-25 11:30 GMT+12:00: Validaitons on Transport mode were removed with WI00919409. All other order header fields eg Ship Window Date, Required EXW, origin etc do no have fall down behaviour so decision made to follow ANG option 2.  As transport Mode and Container mode are related decision to add both is made to ensure LCL verses FCL scenario is covered.  J36 26-Aug-25 13:05 GMT+12:00: Angel confirmed possible performance issues with option 2 arranging a call to discuss.    J36 28-Aug-25 11:11 GMT+12:00: Call results -Igor and Steven had a discussion, and agreed, that it's better to keep line values blank with the fallback (major issue would be concurrency).  So we are going with our original plan.  And add a task/WI for David Stephen to visualise header values next to line values (e.g. a control that shows line value and underneath small header value or something, can't be done on the grid or can it?)      This is for the record (on WI) why this decision was made:  Igor:typical one. if a header was A, a line was B  then header changed to B, then later to C - should you update B to C on a line, or not  default logic would, but we don't know, depends. someone would say a line should stay B  another problem - technical complexity. it has to work in both cw and glow, so typically it's a complex sql trigger on top of all other logic, and it has to deal with concurrency on all levels to abort if anyone changed any value  my recommendation is to show header value next to line value in edit screens; and line value, fallback to header value in read only screens     Steven:   The first problem probably must be solved from a UI level and let the user decide what to do.   The second problem is problematic. I think Igor has a point.  If we do a fallback on line to header, we might run into performance issue on dashboard, report which involving "OR" condition.  If we copy value, we will have to deal with concurrency issues.  But since dealing with concurrency is considerably harder than resolving performance problem (since we can move dashboard report to EDW or index).  I think it is probably better to keep it as a fallback.
feature_description: Transport mode is added to order Lines

WKI_Summary: IOM [UPS] - Container Load List & Container Load Plan Filters
details: In the container load list and container load plan, UPS requires the following to be added to the filters and columns:  delivery location name & address (sorted on another work item for CS01698215)  supplier name & address make filterable and sortable in CLP  CFS name & address. (address in CFS review)    J36 02-Apr-25 10:03 GMT+13:00: Understand from Paul it is hard to make this sortable but filterable should be a viable option.  J36 07-Apr-25 09:10 GMT+12:00: Option is already available can close this WI now delivered. GettingUPS to check and sign off.  14/05 UPS confirmed not available ask Stephen to review.    HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/6ba2cf1a-1ca4-47a6-894f-3c3f21fe0869?lang=en-gb" WI00852607 - IOM [UPS] - Container Load List & Container Load Plan Filters    Reason for change  Support supplier filtering and sorting on SBK lines in CLP Available CFS Supplier Booking Lines grid    Done  Supplier code and name are filterable and sortable in CLP grid    Proposed change  Add AdHocView JobSupplierBookingLineDocAddressView  We can't use JSL_PK because that will incur error like following:   error 0113: Multiplicity is not valid in Role '' in relationship ''. Because the Dependent Role refers to the key properties, the upper bound of the multiplicity of the Dependent Role must be 1.  So we link SBK line to the AHV using JSL_BookingLineId, using it like a NK_FK.  Add JobSupplierBookingLineDocAddressView.SupplierCode and SupplierName to the following grids.    OSX Container Load Plan Assembly Details  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/Glow/blob/2e0296702bbf14fb5aa1408183e90df1ebaa4c73/CargoWiseOne/Configuration/BPMForm/38cd15ef23274163a655d66a1d91418c.yaml#L913  ODX Container Load Plan Assembly Details?  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/Glow/blob/2e0296702bbf14fb5aa1408183e90df1ebaa4c73/CargoWiseOne/Configuration/BPMForm/5c68a7d9031741e4b622ab1bce6d2c7d.yaml#L857    These now will be sortable and filterable.    Note: we'll need to restrict the adhoc view - booking line ID is continuous and could be used to traverse if not properly restricted.  We should return JSL_PK in the view, and use the same restriction on job supplier booking line.    See spike   https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/Glow/pull/6945  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/pull/3827    S37 03-Jul-25 18:28 GMT+10:00:  Self notes:  ExpandPath to include JobSupplierBookingLineDocAddressView - possible optimization.    Similar usages can be see on the CLL. But being aware that CLL is mono-supplier, we probably won't provide any value by making them sortable and filterable, other than consistency.  ORM Container Load List Details  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/Glow/blob/2e0296702bbf14fb5aa1408183e90df1ebaa4c73/CargoWiseOne/Configuration/BPMForm/39825fbd22584a1a9d8a992f1d145fe7.yaml#L3242    SELECT   JSL_BookingLineId as JSLE2_PK,   CASE WHEN E2_AddressOverride = 1 THEN E2_CompanyName ELSE OH_Code END AS SupplierCode,   CASE WHEN E2_AddressOverride = 1 THEN E2_CompanyName ELSE CASE WHEN OA_CompanyNameOverride != '' THEN OA_CompanyNameOverride ELSE OH_FullName END END AS SupplierName  FROM   dbo.JobDocAddress   INNER JOIN dbo.OrgAddress ON OA_PK = E2_OA_Address   INNER JOIN dbo.OrgHeader ON OH_PK = OA_OH   INNER JOIN dbo.JobSupplierBookingLine ON E2_ParentID = JSL_JSB_Booking  WHERE   E2_AddressType = 'SUD'   AND E2_AddressSequence = 0    YS1 15-Jul-25 16:01 GMT+10:00:   I did some investigation about sorting calculated properties in glow, looks like the adHocView is the recommanded and only solution.    So, based only Shen's spike I've created the PR below:  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/Glow/pull/7422  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Shared/pull/4083
feature_description: Container Load List & Container Load Plan Filters

WKI_Summary: FB: 4-digit restriction on US/Canada Manifest Self-Filer ID
details: JR 02-Sep-25 10:26 GMT+10:00:   Proposed Changes:      C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\CargoWise\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Forwarding\Documents\DocDataObjects\CarrierMessage\ShippingInstructionBuilder.cs   PopulateCountrySpecificFields    Add a new validation function to Validate USCanadaManifestSelfFilerIDInfo and give a message error when USCanadaManifestSelfFilerID is not 4 characters.    MEI 01-Sep-25 14:04 GMT+10:00:   The issue was reported by HMM. Standard EDFACT D99B IFTMIN did not restrict the value to 4 digits. In the MIG, FTX C108 is for free text, free text value within 512 characters.  Considering the fact it's SCAC sent in C10803, e.g FTX+CCI++MFS+1:US:SCAC, I think it's ok to add the restriction of "4 characters" on Shipping Instruction form.    WW 08-Jul-25 09:44 GMT+10:00:   Problem Description:  Currently our Shipping Instruction form allows users to enter free text in the US/Canada Manifest Self-Filer ID field.  This has caused errors in carrier system. Most of the cases are when users enter both US and CA SCAC in the field with a slash in between.  See below example message links.  https://ehubadmin.wtg.zone/Messages/Details?AM_PK=b29d0b8f-ffc9-4611-9fed-4767204b25f9  https://ehubadmin.wtg.zone/Messages/Details?AM_PK=26b35e2f-65dd-4c88-a5aa-379b2b76519f    Proposed Solution:  Restrict the field "US/Canada Manifest Self-Filer ID" to 4 digit only in the Shipping Instruction form.
feature_description: digit restriction on US/Canada Manifest Self-Filer ID

WKI_Summary: Viet Nam (VN) extend 8% VAT rate to 30 June 2025
details: Background: the VN National Assembly also approved the further reduction in the VAT rate from 10% to 8% for a number of goods and services in the first half of 2025 to 30 June 2025. A 2% VAT rate cut on essentials first brought in by the Vietnamese Ministry of Finance in February 2022 is to be extended. Currently the 2% VAT rate is set to conclude on 31 Dec 2024.    FLN 13-Dec-24 15:37 GMT+11:00: Investigation Conclusion  My investigation confirmed on 30 November 2024, the National Assembly passed Resolution 174/2024/QH15 on the 8th Session of the 15th National Assembly, including content related to a 2% reduction in VAT to 30 June 2025.  This confirms the current 8% reduced standard VAT rate that was set to conclude on 31 Dec 2024 is being extended to 30 June 2025.  The Draft Decree has been issued and is being promulgated in law (as of 13 Dec 2025)  The change inherits all the existing contents in the latest reduced rate extension contents in Decree 72/2024/ND-CP dated 30 June 2024.
product_candidate: Viet Nam (VN) extend 8% VAT rate to 30 June 2025

WKI_Summary: [FTS]Display max records returned message in module query
details: HAY 02-Sep-25 15:35 GMT+08:00:   Add a warning message in the filterStrip under the following scenarios:    When the count of index search results is greater than the value set in Registry -> Glow -> Services -> Maximum Number Of Module Filters Search Results.  When the module is in the lowWatermarkList.    Display the warning message in accordance with:  Registry -> GLOW -> Services -> Indexing Service Searchability Period Default  Registry -> Glow -> Services -> Indexing Service Searchability Period Overrides      WY 21-Jul-25 16:20 GMT+08:00:   UDE(Update)  Currently, at least 2 registries may affect the returned data for Index Search mode, however we didn't correctly tell people this point, and they may not realise this potential problem and mistakenly think that the actual data is just that much.    1) Registry -> Glow -> Services -> Maximum Number Of Module Filters Search Results  This registry controls the specific amount of returned data for modules that have enabled Index Search, according to the current filter conditions, the actual results count is higher than its default value(200) in most cases    2) Registry -> Glow -> Services -> Indexing Service Searchability Period Overrides  This registry uses the column field (configured on Glow side, normally it's XX_SystemLastEditTimeUtc) to index data from a recent period of time, just in order to avoid indexing too old data    * Please note: this registry has the side effects, e.g.   a) ProcessTask is configured in the above registry  b) JobShipment is not configured in the above registry  c) There is one field in IJobShipment.yaml    - name: LastCompletedMilestone    propertyPath: ProcessTasks.P9_Description    where: JS_ShipmentType == "HVL" && ProcessTasks.P9_Type == "MIL" && ProcessTasks.P9_Status == "LST"    If we use this filter to search old data that comes from ProcessTask, we may get no results as well    DL4 15-Jul-25 11:17 GMT+08:00:   Historical data - You should be mindful that setting the time range too extensively might impact the system’s performance.    WY 14-May-25 17:03 GMT+08:00:   UDE:  Modules that have enabled Index Search only return 200 records(configured in registry: Registry -> Glow -> Services -> Maximum Number Of Module Filters Search Results)  However, according to the current filter conditions, the actual results count is higher than this in most cases.  People may not realise this potential problem and mistakenly think that the actual data is just that much.    BTW: this registry - IndexSearchabilityPeriodOverrides also limits the data count according to lowWatermarks(configured on Glow side, normally limited by XX_SystemLastEditTimeUtc, just in order to avoid indexing too old data)    DE:  In some way, we inform people that we actually limit the max number of data returned when enabling Index Search.
product_candidate: [FTS]Display max records returned message in module query

WKI_Summary: Staff Record for This is WiseCloud Support is not editable
details: Current UDE  In WiseCloud hosted databases there is an account created called "This is WiseCloud Support" with a staff code of "SUP".  This is only used to fire off Database Healthcheck Notifications and other system related notifications to our Hosting team.  This record is editable by users, which can:  Record can be deactivated  Email Address can be modified  Account can be made into one with log in rights  And more stupid things that I cannot think of right now      Ideal DE  This should be locked for editing, just like how we have locked down the Staff record for CWSupport/E    RVE 02-Apr-25 09:41 GMT+11:00:   https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FMasterFiles%2FGUI%2FGlobal%2FGlbStaff%2FGlbStaffForm.cs&version=GBmaster&line=220&lineEnd=220&lineStartColumn=5&lineEndColumn=117&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents  This code in the GlbStaffForm checks if the user is a system account and sets the whole form to readonly. CWSupport is a system account and is thus readonly.  edi.support is not a system account    RVE 02-Apr-25 14:03 GMT+11:00:   DBD:  In GlbStaffForm.cs https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FMasterFiles%2FGUI%2FGlobal%2FGlbStaff%2FGlbStaffForm.cs&version=GBmaster&_a=contents  1. Add private bool method IsSystemCreatedAccount(GlbStaff staff) which returns true if staff has GS_IsSystemAccount == true or GS_LoginName == "edi.support"  2. Modify GlbStaffForm.DisplayMode property like so  return Staff != null && !Staff.IsDeleted && IsSystemCreatedAccount(Staff) ? ODisplayMode.ReadOnly : base.DisplayMode;
product_candidate: Staff Record for This is WiseCloud Support is not editable

WKI_Summary: Don't scan printers by PJM in WiseCloud-hosted systems
details: WiseCloud-hosted systems can print documents only using WebPrint and not using service task.  So there is no need to scan available printers on Process Controller servers.    This scan is being done in PJM service task PrintJobMaintenanceTask:  HYPERLINK "https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/b0fc75f7b05cc043cca4ed675d3e1c4f98926760/Enterprise/Product/Core/ServiceManager/ServiceManager.Tasks/PrintJobProcessor/PrintJobMaintenanceTask.cs#L39" CargoWise/Enterprise/Product/Core/ServiceManager/ServiceManager.Tasks/PrintJobProcessor/PrintJobMaintenanceTask.cs at b0fc75f7b05cc043cca4ed675d3e1c4f98926760 · WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise    To do:  - Add a support-only registry item to Document group "Scan Printers on Process Controller Servers".  - Default value should be:      - for hosted in WiseCloud = false;      - for other = true;      (ther are many other registry items with different defaults for systems hosted in WiseCloud and not hosted in WiseCloud).  - In PJM service task, check this registry item, and if it is disabled - do not update print queues. (But do all other logic.)    BEE 25-Aug-25 09:47 GMT+10:00: The defect 'cause' is hosting things on WiseCloud but no specific Work Item.
product_candidate: Don't scan printers by PJM in WiseCloud
feature_description: hosted systems

WKI_Summary: AC Ph2 St2 - Consolidate packlines with same weight and dimensions for eBooking
details: SNF 30-Sep-24 16:27 GMT+10:00:     Done statement:     • Packlines with same weight and dimensions are consolidated prior rate/booking request is send to airline.   • i.e packlines of:  ? 1@2kg ea 10x10x10 ea 0.001m3  ? 2@2kg ea 10x10x10 ea 0.002m3  ? 5@2kg ea 10x10x10 ea 0.005m3        • results in:  ? 8@2kg 10x10x10 ea 0.008m3      BZS 22-Oct-24 15:59 GMT+11:00:   This is an AirlineConnect only change. We need to:   - Apply the logic above on loaded packlines from CW1 consol   - Create the RateQuery based on updated packlines, which goes to UI to be displayed, and ultimately sent to ABE for booking.   - We can add a flag for packlines being consolidated in order to notify user on the UI (How? Decision/Design to be decided)
feature_description: Consolidate packlines with same weight and dimensions for eBooking

WKI_Summary: IOM [UPS MVP] - From a CLP record I can create a container manifest Document
details: QJ 22-Sep-25 13:17 GMT+08:00:   This one reuses docstrips/wrappers defined in HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/ba9a6f9e-388b-4730-aa83-28b8e438efc2" WI00917525 - IOM [UPS MVP] - From a CLL record I can create a container manifest Document  It should be checked in after the CLL one and conflicts should be resolved.    Using the doc builder functionality the required system design element and basic form are available from the CLP (Container Load Plan) record to create a manifest of the final loading done by the CFS. Essentially a container manifest of what what packed.    (no sample given by UPS we could request or design as flexible doc strips)    CLP - Container Load List BCN    ASL 27-Aug-25 08:11 GMT+10:00: Questions:   1. Without a sample from UPS, can we just re-use an existing Manifest document we have? Yes   2. What AOM fields need to be on this document? Corinne has provided  3. Where will this document be printed from? From the CLP record  4. Is it one per Container, or can it be printed for all Containers? Will need to be for each container. Corinne has specified i believe.      MM7 15-Sep-25 09:45 GMT+10:00:   AI Generated:  ## 1. Overview and Purpose    ### 1.1 Reason for Change  Allow users to create a Container Manifest document from a Container Load Plan (CLP) record after the final loading has been completed by the CFS (Container Freight Station). This document provides a manifest of what was actually packed into each container.    ### 1.2 Done Statement  A User is now able to print a Container Manifest from a CLP record showing the actual contents loaded into each container, providing visibility into the final loading results performed by the CFS.    ### 1.3 Scope  - Create a new "Container Load Plan Manifest" document accessible from CW1 > Container Load Plan > Documents records as per https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Wiki.Archive/blob/master/CargoWise-Wiki/Documents-%26-Reports/Adding-new-System-defined-Document-Menu.md    This menu is visible only if you enable "Advanced Order Managber" feature. To enable it, look at this: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=daa09a72-5939-4091-a3bf-47ec5c7033af&StorageDocPK=0bd41fb6-c3b9-426e-a898-260ed5fc4bdc&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bid9dPV4TgCgKIT69rKnRGUPGyfrKF6Z5" MM7 15-Sep-25 10:29:  File EnableFeature.jpg (Internal Correspondence)    - Implement necessary DocStrips to display container loading information  - Ensure the document shows one manifest per container  - Provide detailed cargo information including load sequence when available    ---    ## 2. Business Requirements    ### 2.1 Functional Requirements  1. **Document Access**: Users must be able to access the Container Manifest from CW1 > Container Load Plan > Documents  2. **Container-Specific**: The document must be generated per container (one document per container)  3. **Load Information**: Display actual loaded cargo with load sequence information  4. **CFS Integration**: Show information relevant to CFS operations and final loading  5. **Professional Format**: Provide a well-formatted, branded document suitable for external use    ### 2.2 Data Requirements  Based on the Order Manager table relationships and CLP structure:  - **Container Information**: Container number, type, size  - **Consol Information**: Consolidation details linked to the container  - **Cargo Details**: Items actually loaded, quantities, descriptions  - **Load Sequence**: When CLP status is PLC (Placed), SHP (Shipped), or CNV (Converted)  - **Company Information**: CFS details, controlling customer information  - **Booking References**: Related supplier booking information    ---    ## 3. Technical Design    ### 3.1 Document Menu Location  Navigate to **CW1 > Container Load Plan > Documents** and click **Customise menu** to create a new document called **"Container Load Plan Manifest"**.    ### 3.2 Document Structure  Following the pattern established in WI00917525 (CLL Manifest) and WI00917528 (Cargo Receipt), the document will contain the following DocStrips (To know how to create DocStrips look at: https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise.Wiki.Archive/blob/master/CargoWise-Wiki/Documents-%26-Reports/Adding-new-DocStrips-in-DocBuilder-System-Document-Element.md):    #### Line 2: Document Header  - **DocStrip**: "Company Logo"  - **Purpose**: Display company branding  - **Source**: Existing system DocStrip    #### Line 3: Document Title  - **DocStrip**: "Document Title with Page Numbers"  - **Content**: "Container Load Plan Manifest"  - **Source**: Existing system DocStrip    #### Line 4: Document Information  - **DocStrip**: "Recipient with Job Number and Date"  - **DocWrappers**:    1. CLP Number (CLP identifier)    2. Document creation date  - **Source**: Reuse DocStrip from WI00914361 or create new  AFE 15-Sep-25 14:07 GMT+08:00: Existing system DocStrip    #### Line 5: Company Details  - **DocStrip**: "CFS Company Information" AFE 15-Sep-25 14:09 GMT+08:00: "Order Manager Controlling Customer + CFS Address"  - **DocWrappers**:    1. CFS Company Name & Address    2. CFS Phone & Fax    3. Controlling Customer (from CLP > Addresses - Controlling Customer)  - **Source**: Adapt from WI00917528 Line 6 DocStrip    #### Line 6: Container Information  - **DocStrip**: "Container Details" AFE 15-Sep-25 14:11 GMT+08:00: "Shipment Routes (Mode/Transport Info/Load/Disch/ETD/ETA)"  - **DocWrappers**:    1. Container Number (from CLP > Container)    2. Container Type & Size    3. Consol Number (from Container.Consol relationship)    4. Container Status    AFE 15-Sep-25 14:12 GMT+08:00: Routing/consol info is on CLP > Allocate Containers > Allocated Containers  - **Source**: New DocStrip based on container relationships    #### Line 7: Transport Information  - **DocStrip**: "Transport and Load Information" AFE 15-Sep-25 14:16 GMT+08:00: "Load Plan"  - **DocWrappers**:    1. Transport Mode    2. Load Mode (CFS/LSE)    3. Origin Location    4. Destination Location  - **Source**: Adapt from existing transport DocStrips    #### Line 8-10: Cargo Details Table  - **DocStrip**: "Container Load Plan Cargo Details" AFE 15-Sep-25 14:18 GMT+08:00: Make sure there's a manifest for each containers  - **DocWrappers**:    1. Load Sequence Number (when available for PLC/SHP/CNV status)    2. Order Number (CLP > CLP Line > Supplier Booking Line > Order Line > Order > Order No.)    3. Part Number (CLP > CLP Line > Part No.)    4. Description (CLP > CLP Line > Description)    5. Marks and Numbers (CLP > CLP Line > Marks and Numbers)    6. Planned Quantity + Unit (CLP > CLP Line > Planned Quantity + Unit)    7. Actual Loaded Quantity + Unit (CLP > CLP Line > Loaded Quantity + Unit)    8. Loaded Packages + Unit (CLP > CLP Line > Loaded Packages + Unit)    9. Loaded Weight + Unit (CLP > CLP Line > Loaded Weight + Unit)    10. Loaded Volume + Unit (CLP > CLP Line > Loaded Volume + Unit)  - **Source**: New DocStrip based on CLP line data structure    #### Line 9: Summary Information  - **DocStrip**: "Container Load Summary"  - **DocWrappers**:    1. Total Pieces Loaded    2. Total Weight Loaded    3. Total Volume Loaded    4. Container Utilization Percentage  - **Source**: New DocStrip with calculated totals    #### Line 12: Signoff  - **DocStrip**: "Signoff"  - **Purpose**: Signature area for CFS confirmation  - **Source**: Existing system DocStrip    #### Line 13: Document Footer  - **DocStrip**: "Separator - End of Document"  - **Source**: Existing system DocStrip    ### 3.3 Data Source Mapping    #### Primary Entity: Container Load Plan (CLP)  - **Access Path**: CW1 > Container Load Plan  - **Key Relationships**:    - CLP ? CLP Line (one-to-many)    - CLP Line ? Container (many-to-one)    - Container ? Consol (one-to-one)    - CLP Line ? Supplier Booking Line (many-to-one)    - Supplier Booking Line ? Order Line (many-to-one)    To understand their relations look at this picture: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=daa09a72-5939-4091-a3bf-47ec5c7033af&StorageDocPK=922989da-1d62-48d9-be7b-e66d4ea756d8&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bYqyqVfvygen02wwl2pWWOhOeHltAEECi" MM7 15-Sep-25 09:51:  File Overall Picture of Order manager Tables.png (Internal Correspondence)    #### Data Hierarchy:  ```  Container Load Plan (CLP)  ??? CLP Lines  ?   ??? Container Information  ?   ??? Load Sequence (if status = PLC/SHP/CNV)  ?   ??? Cargo Details (quantities, descriptions)  ?   ??? Related Supplier Booking Line  ?       ??? Related Order Line  ?           ??? Related Order  ??? Container      ??? Consol Information  ```    ### 3.4 Document Availability Conditions  - **Status Requirement**: Available for CLP records in any status  - **Load Mode Requirement**: Available when Load Mode is CFS or LSE  - **Container Requirement**: Only available when CLP is associated with a container  - **Per Container**: Generate one document per container (if CLP covers multiple containers)    ---    ## 4. Implementation Guidelines    ### 4.1 DocStrip Creation Process  1. **Reuse Existing DocStrips** where possible from WI00914361, WI00917525, and WI00917528  2. **Create New DocStrips** for CLP-specific data requirements  3. **Test DocWrappers** to ensure they work correctly in the Container Load Plan module context  4. **Copy System DocStrips** from other modules if required for base functionality    ### 4.2 DocWrapper Implementation  Following CargoWise DocWrapper patterns:  - Use proper schema field references (e.g., CLP_FieldName)  - Implement null-safe value retrieval  - Provide fallback values where appropriate  - Format data appropriately for display (quantities, dates, etc.)    ### 4.3 Module Integration  - **Order Manager Context**: Ensure all DocWrappers work within the Order Manager module  - **Container Relationships**: Properly navigate CLP ? Container ? Consol relationships  - **Load Sequence Access**: Implement logic to show load sequence when CLP status allows  - **Multi-Container Handling**: Design for scenarios where CLP involves multiple containers    ### 4.4 Reference Implementation  Use **WI00914361 - IOM [UPS MVP] - SBK create Booking Confirmation** as the primary reference for:  - DocStrip creation patterns  - DocWrapper implementation  - Module-specific considerations  - Document menu integration    ---    ## 5. Testing Requirements    ### 5.1 Functional Testing  1. **Document Access**: Verify document appears in CLP Documents menu  2. **Data Display**: Confirm all DocWrappers display correct data  3. **Container Filtering**: Test document generation per container  4. **Load Sequence**: Verify load sequence appears for appropriate CLP statuses  5. **Multi-Container**: Test behavior with CLP covering multiple containers    ### 5.2 Integration Testing  1. **Module Compatibility**: Test DocWrappers work correctly in Order Manager context  2. **Relationship Navigation**: Verify data retrieval through CLP ? Container ? Consol paths  3. **Performance**: Ensure document generation performs acceptably with large datasets  4. **Format Validation**: Confirm document formatting matches requirements    ### 5.3 User Acceptance Testing  1. **Business Workflow**: Test document fits into CFS operational workflow  2. **Information Completeness**: Verify document contains all required cargo information  3. **Professional Appearance**: Confirm document is suitable for external use  4. **Usability**: Ensure document access and generation is intuitive    ---    ## 6. Dependencies and Risks    ### 6.1 Dependencies  - **WI00914361**: Completion required for reusable DocStrips  - **Order Manager Module**: Must be enabled with Feature Control Management  - **DocBuilder Framework**: Requires functional DocBuilder system  - **Container Load Plan Data**: Depends on proper CLP data structure and relationships    ### 6.2 Technical Risks  - **DocWrapper Compatibility**: Risk that existing DocWrappers may not work in CLP context  - **Performance**: Large container loads may impact document generation performance  - **Data Relationships**: Complex CLP ? Container ? Consol relationships may cause data access issues  - **Module Dependencies**: Order Manager module dependencies may affect availability    ### 6.3 Mitigation Strategies  - **Incremental Testing**: Test DocWrappers individually before full integration  - **Performance Monitoring**: Monitor document generation times during development  - **Relationship Validation**: Thoroughly test all data relationship paths  - **Fallback Logic**: Implement fallback mechanisms for missing or incomplete data    ---    ## 7. Future Considerations    ### 7.1 Enhancement Opportunities  - **Multiple Container Support**: Potential future requirement for single document covering multiple containers  - **Digital Signatures**: Integration with digital signature capabilities  - **Mobile Access**: Consideration for mobile device document generation  - **EDI Integration**: Potential electronic manifest transmission capabilities    ### 7.2 Maintenance Considerations  - **DocStrip Updates**: Ensure DocStrips remain maintainable as business requirements evolve  - **Performance Optimization**: Monitor and optimize as data volumes grow  - **Integration Points**: Maintain compatibility with related UPS MVP features    ---    ## 8. Conclusion    This detailed design provides a comprehensive framework for implementing the Container Load Plan Manifest document in CargoWise. By leveraging existing DocStrip patterns from related work items and following established CargoWise development practices, this implementation will provide UPS MVP users with essential container manifest capabilities while maintaining system consistency and performance.    The design emphasizes reusability, maintainability, and alignment with existing Order Manager functionality, ensuring successful integration into the CargoWise document framework.
feature_description: From a CLP record I can create a container manifest Document

WKI_Summary: Stop import of non constant values such as ‘BBB’ to the Job_Direction
details: PA1 15-Jul-25 09:34 GMT-07:00:     When a TB UXML is imported with <SubShipment>/<TransportBookingDirection> filled in , no validation is performed against the incoming value.  Instead the import process accepts upto first 3 chars of any string present in the field.    This behaviour is inconsistent with how TB data is populated whne created manually via Action menu.     The TB UXML import process should validate the <SubShipment>/<TransportBookingDirection> value and only allow options - PIC, DLV or blank value
product_candidate: Stop import of non constant values such as ‘BBB’ to the Job_Direction

WKI_Summary: L&A: Dangerous Goods Transit Manifest to Australian Ports
details: RYS 12-Feb-25 08:58 GMT+08:00:   Updated refer the new changes on SPE:    Add a new flag enum PortDirections like  [Flags]  public enum PortDirections  {   Load = 1, // 0x001   Transit = 2, // 0x010   LoadOrTransit = 3, // 0x011   Discharge = 4, // 0x100   DischargeOrTransit = 6, // 0x110   All = Load | Transit | Discharge // 0x111  }    Then you could use PortDirections.HasFlag() to check the related flag    C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Agency\Agency.Business\Messaging\PortMessage\PortMessageTargetPort.cs  Add a new property PortDirection and calcualte it as below:  1) Load:   If the selected port = is the first Load Port in the Sailing Schedule  2) LoadOrTransit  If the selected port = is a Load Port, and not the first Load Port in the Sailing Schedule, then Direction = unspecified, Drop Down of this field contains following values: LOAD and TRANSIT. Use ETD and ETA dates to determine order of port calls  3) Discharge   If the selected port = last Discharge Port in the Sailing Schedule, then Direction = DISCHARGE. Use ETD and ETA to determine order of port calls.    4) DischargeOrTransit  If the selected port = a Discharge Port followed by other Discharge Ports in the Sailing Schedule, then Direction = unspecified, Drop Down of this field contains following values: TRANSIT and DISCHARGE. Use ETD and ETA to determine order of port calls.   5) All     If the selected port = a Load port and a Discharge port, then Direction = unspecified, Drop down of this field contains following values: LOAD, TRANSIT and DISCHARGE. Use ETD and ETA to determine order of port calls    C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Agency\Agency.Business\Messaging\DangerousGoodsManifest\DangerousGoodsManifestMessageTargetPortList.cs  Calculate the flags above and fill in them.    C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Agency\Agency.Business\Messaging\DangerousGoodsManifest\DangerousGoodsManifestMessageLookups.cs  Update the Direction lookups if it contains Transit port flags    C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Agency\Agency.Business\Messaging\DangerousGoodsManifest\DangerousGoodsManifestMessage.cs  In the setter of the Port, update the Direction based on if the port is the first load or laste discharge    C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Agency\Agency.Business\Messaging\Helper\RelatedJobsHelper.cs  Update the filter to support Transit direction    C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Agency\Agency.GUI\Messaging\DangerousGoodsManifestMessageDialog.cs, GetDangerousGoodMessageType  Update the MST = 'Dangerous Goods Transit Manifest' if the Direction is Transit    C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Agency\Agency.DataTransfer\Messaging\DangerousGoodsManifestDataObjectWriter.cs  Please double check if the Transit direction is included in t he AddInfoCollection, it seems we have already passed it in.      RYS 23-Jan-25 10:33 GMT+08:00:   Proposed Changes:  C:\git\wtg\CargoWise\Dev\Enterprise\Product\Operations\Freight\Agency\Agency.Business\Messaging\PortMessage\PortMessageTargetPort.cs  Change the furrent flags and add more:    1) IsLoadPortOnly:  If the selected port = is the last or only Australian Load Port in the Sailing Schedule and there are no Australian Discharge Ports  2) IsLoadOrTransitPort  If the selected port = Load Port followed by other Australian Load or Discharge Ports in the Sailing Schedule, then Direction = unspecified, Drop Down of this field contains following values: LOAD and TRANSIT. Use ETD and ETA dates to determine order of port calls.  3) IsDischargePortOnly  If the selected port = last Australian Discharge Port in the Sailing Schedule and there are no following Australian Load Ports, then Direction = DISCHARGE.
