WKI_Summary: [EAD] Add <DataProvider> as Fallback for Proxy User Resolution
details: Background:    See original WI  HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/2aa97751-97f9-41d0-9e11-3052daa77089?lang=en-gb" WI00226015 - Create a system user for Automated XML updates that introduced Interchange Proxy User  Where DataProvider was checked first when setting Proxy User, then Interchange Sender   Although the function was only intended to work for EDI messages from EDI interchange which are processed by UMI service task, customers have been able to use it in eAdaptor Sync messages (unintended side effect)    We removed DataProvider requested in HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/6e005ff1-f774-4ba9-9274-2b53504380e6?lang=en-gb" WI00885758 - [EADI] Interchange Sender Proxy Users change to use EDI message sender to mitigate spoofing risk  That makes customers' workflow authomation not work because user is no longer set based on DataProvider in eAdaptor Sync messages  To solve the customer's problem quickly and officially support this side effect as a feature, we need to do the following and the changes need to be patched back    Requirement:    Adding <DataProvider> back into the resolution logic as the final fallback, after checking for an EDI Client (available in eAdaptor Next) and Interchange Sender, to  officially supporting proxy user resolution not only for EDI Interchange-based messages but also for standalone EDI messages, such as those received via eAdaptor Sync  Update the Registry name to say "EDI Message Sender Proxy Users"  Update the Registry description to say "This setting maps an EDI message Sender or DataProvider to a corresponding StaffProxy user. When processing an inbound EDI message, the system follows this order: If the sender matches, the associated Staff Code is used as the processing user. If no sender match, the system checks the DataProvider and uses its associated Staff Code. If neither match is found, the default system user is applied.    New Logic:    Check EDI Message EDI Client Staff Proxy, if there is, use that as User   If not found, check EDI Message sender (which is only populated when the EDI message is from an EDI interchange and the sender is EI_FROM for the EDI interchange) look for matching Sender Code in registry and use the user ID configured)  if not found, check <DataProvider> provided in UXML, then look for matching Sender Code in registry and use the user ID configured  if not found, use system user
product_candidate: [EAD] Add <DataProvider> as Fallback for Proxy User Resolution

WKI_Summary: GLWOM: Bulk Action Requests - Mass Accept/Decline of Requests
details: Process records in bulk. Driven by DHL for their June 11 DPR.    DONE:    ·       From the request search grid (both OSX and NEO), multiple requests can be selected using their associated checkboxes      ·       When at least one request has been selected, two option buttons are presented above the grid, on the filter row: Accept, Decline      ·       Pressing the “Accept” button or the “Decline” button will process all of the selected records      ·       The "Accept" button will set the REQ_Response to true and set REQ_RequesteeCompleted to true for all selected records.      ·       The "Decline" button will set the REQ_Response to false and set REQ_RequesteeCompleted to true for all selected records.      ·       After the requests have been processed in bulk, the row selections are reset. WKI_Summary: Block Native XML imports when SCIM is enabled
details: CST 10-Dec-24 15:46 GMT+11:00:  From the attached incident (which was raised by the I&S team) and I believe the "meat and potatoes" of the request are highlighted bold:      We've built a way for customers to synch Staff users and Groups data from their IdP (Azure Entra ID, Okta, OneLogin, bespoke...) into CW1 using System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM). When SCIM is enabled, we need to block imports into CW1 using other data importing  methods because the customer's IdP is the source of truth, and SCIM should be the only bulk update process. Allowing other importing options will cause data inconsistencies between their IdP and CW1 if it isn't done via SCIM. Our investigations show us that Universal XML, Data Wizard, Legacy XML, and ADAW do not support importing of Staff users or Groups leaving only Native XML, which does support importing and updating, and will overwrite everything in it's path, unless some specific rules are put in place. This CR6 is for these rules to be created.    After a short discussion with Sudipta, we agreed that a CR6 is required and that when SCIM is enabled (there's a registry setting in CW1 under System > SCIM > Enable Scim Service), a check can be added in the staff Native hander to discard any updates or inserts using Native XML. This works for our purposes but we'd prefer to take it one step further and block the updates or inserts when the database record has an ExternalId (a new column in these two tables, where GlbStaff is GS_ExternalId, and GlbGroup is GG_ExternalId). This way, the Native XML imports can still be used by customers to import or update other users and groups that are not already managed by the SCIM interface (i.e. via their IdP). When the Staff or Group are managed by SCIM they are assigned an external Id.    Since Native XML can be processed directly in the staff module or via eAdaptor/eHub or via EDI Message Module, all of these scenarios should be catered for.    I'll add the draft technical guide to eDocs for more information about SCIM.        At the time of this WI creation, the System > SCIM > Enable Scim Service Registry item is not yet in the code (Checked in UAT Alpha 24.11.28.88) so a verification with I&S if that Registry is still valid might be required if the setting is not found when doing the HLD/DBD.
product_candidate: Block Native XML imports when SCIM is enabled

WKI_Summary: Registry Notes has a Default Note & supports Custom Notes
details: BL3 03-Jul-25 09:04 GMT+10:00:       HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=a459557b-9a26-4817-9252-3feb7d7e23fe&StorageDocPK=a8854f9b-9243-49d4-9984-5d7050dfea3f&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bjlK8vUOudnjn3JfJrCO6jOez8pWRIAgd" BL3 03-Jul-25 09:04:  File Quick Questions.pdf (DBD) added to eDocs tab.    BL3 01-Jul-25 15:12 GMT+10:00:   HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=a459557b-9a26-4817-9252-3feb7d7e23fe&StorageDocPK=ad9a46ef-598b-4e87-b30d-18bf02c1b31c&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b6wbGrOZgMDX9sNaBFDo%2b1CiYbXzzBKt6" BL3 01-Jul-25 15:13:  File Detailed Build Design.docx (Detailed Build Design) added to eDocs tab.    BL3 03-Jul-25 09:50 GMT+10:00:   1. RegistryController returns a null ModuleID because the controller doesn't have a top-level bizo and a form only opens if its controller has both a valid ModuleID and persistent bizo. Adding a bizo like RegistryBusinessObject will cause BusinessObjectFactory to search for a non-existent table since it is non-persistent. Therefore ModuleID has to remain null.  2. IRegistry already has a bizo called RegistryBusinessObject, but due to the reasons above it can't really be used. A way to work around is to avoid parsing Registry's table name in BusinessObjectFactory.GetTableNameFromTypeCore but it would require continuously parsing special cases for Registry in 100+ files which is not feasable.    Therefore, my original spike in https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/pull/1546/files is more feasable since it only affects custom note types + default note type for registry + minimal changes. Possible repercussions/edge cases would be normal non-registry custom note types being affected (i.e. registry default note type as an option in WhsPick default note type).
product_candidate: Registry Notes has a Default Note & supports Custom Notes

WKI_Summary: IOM [UPS MVP] - User is able to link to Orgnisation in CW from AOM
details: UPS Incident CS01775488    UPS requires a User to be able to update supplier contact details etc when operating in the AOM screens.  Proposed functionality to add a link (like F3 functionality in winforms so the user can link to Orgnisation record in winforms    STZ 20-Aug-25 16:09 GMT+10:00:   Figma design:  https://www.figma.com/design/tk2sbAh8m0qHJQau2GgFb6/FR--Job-address-2.0--WI00880278-?node-id=4363-1510&t=rdF2RxatY8NvvCLY-0  I would go for "Edit Organisation Only" solution for OrgAddress Control      DMC 29-Aug-25 15:39 GMT+10:00:   Reason for change  UPS want to be able to edit an organisation (e.g, add/change an address, add/change a contact, etc) quickly from the portal.     We're looking to implement an "Edit Organization" button on the address controls in the portals which will launch a CW session.   See figma: https://www.figma.com/design/tk2sbAh8m0qHJQau2GgFb6/FR--Job-address-2.0--WI00880278-?node-id=4363-1510&t=rdF2RxatY8NvvCLY-0    Originally, we wanted to use client link so that CW could notify GLOW when a change has been made to auto-refresh. This has been descoped.   We only need the ability to launch CW and then enable the users to manually refresh the lookups.     The following addresses need this feature:  • Order header record (Buyer and Supplier)  • Order header record Affiliated addresses (Buyer and Supplier)  • Supplier Booking screen header record (Supplier Only)    Done statement  - Users are able to jump edit organizations from the staff portal and manually refresh the lookup to pickup new changes    Proposed changes  We need to support both JDA - JobDocAddress and ADD - Address Field components since the required addresses are shown across both of those controls.  There are a few repos that this change will span, so I've highlighted in bold.    WTG.WebUI   WtgAddressField  HYPERLINK "https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/WTG.WebUI/blob/master/src/wtg-ui-vue/packages/wtg-material-ui/src/supply/components/WtgAddressField/WtgAddressField.vue" WTG.WebUI/src/wtg-ui-vue/packages/wtg-material-ui/src/supply/components/WtgAddressField/WtgAddressField.vue at master · WiseTechGlobal/WTG.WebUI    - Add a prop `showEditInCargoWise` which will be used to show the edit button. Make it false by default.   - Inside the wtg-panel which shows the selected address, we need to add a "Edit organization" wtg-btn in the top right corner, as per figma.   - Should only show the button if an address is selected and the showEditInCargoWise prop is true. If address is overridden/there is no address then it should probably be readonly.    - When the edit in CW button is clicked, it should emit a relevant event (edit-in-cw? try think of something better) so it can be picked up by above controls. WKI_Summary: GLWM: Converting LSE SBK does not create a new shipment if SPT was used
details: EMF 06-Aug-25 12:28 GMT+08:00:   Reason for changes:  Converting LSE SBK to shipment packlines always create new shipment and packlines with dispatched Qty/Pkg/Vol/Wgt now.  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/master/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Forwarding.ServiceTasks/Orders/Services/OrderManagerConvertService.cs#L260  If user use SPT to generate and allocate packlines, packlines are linked to their respective supplier booking lines. we should update packlines with dispatched Qty/Pkg/Vol/Wgt instead of creating new shipment.    Done:  A booking line is not split into multiple shipments by SPT. Pack line Qty, Packs, Vol, and Wgt are updated with dispatched Packs, Vol, and Wgt when a LSE SBK is converted.  If a line was not dispatched by LSE SBK (i.e. the dispatched Qty == 0), converting the LSE SBK deletes the linked pack line/s.   A booking line is split into multiple shipments by SPT. Upon conversion, the dispatched quantity is proportionally allocated to multiple shipment pack lines.      Suggested changes:  https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/master/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Forwarding.ServiceTasks/Orders/Services/OrderManagerConvertService.cs  Change ConvertLooseCargoSupplierBooking:  Find packlines attached to bookinglines by JL_JSL_BookingLine.  Founded bookinglines - packlines:   Update packlines proportionally which related JSL dispatched Qty > 0    Calculate propotion by related packProduct.D2_ProductQuantity/totalQty and final dispatch Qty/Pkg/Vol/Wgt value.    Add a new function i.e. UpdatePackLineQty(Qty, Pkg, Vol, Wgt) to update dispatched Qty/Pkg/Vol/Wgt. should extract from ConvertDispatchedLooseCargoBookingLineToPackLine in   HYPERLINK "https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/master/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Forwarding.ServiceTasks/Orders/Converters/JobSupplierBookingLineConverter.cs#L9C15-L9C63"    https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/master/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Forwarding.ServiceTasks/Orders/Converters/JobSupplierBookingLineConverter.cs#L9C15-L9C63   Delete packlines which related JSL dispatched Qty == 0   Update changed packlines related shipments   e.g. shipments.Foreach(()=> {     shipment.UpdateShipmentFromOuterPackLines();    });  Other bookinglines:   Similar to existing logic https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/blob/master/Enterprise/Product/Operations/Freight/Forwarding/Forwarding.ServiceTasks/Orders/Services/OrderManagerConvertService.cs#L260-L262   e.g. SupplierBookingConverter.ConvertToShipmentForBooking(booking, shipment);    OtherBookingLines.ForEach(bookingLine => SupplierBookingLineConverter.ConvertDispatchedLooseCargoBookingLineToPackLine(shipment, bookingLine));  Draft PR: https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/CargoWise/pull/8060    EMF 04-Aug-25 10:37 GMT+08:00:   Put update packline logic question in HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=f284b2eb-45ec-4cb3-9b0f-fd673af902d5&StorageDocPK=8b78be29-2b0d-4353-9a3a-e05e3d5c0da0&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bEXtToZGZylHhDRMSuHScyP2WtnpEemMd" EMF 04-Aug-25 10:34:  File WI00940403_HLDv1_EMF_Comments.docx (High Level Design)    SGF 24-Jul-25 09:22 GMT+10:00:   I could not replicate CR6. Below is the current actual result:  Actual Result: A new shipment is created. It has 700 qty, 70 pkg, 7 vol, 7 wgt in both packline grid and basic registration tab.  Expected Result: No new shipment is created. Existing shipment's qty, packs, vol, and wgt should update in both packline grid and basic registration tab.  Done: When LSE SBK line is already linked to a shipment pack line through SPT or manual linking, converting LSE SBK does not create a new shipment. Converting updates the qty, pkg, vol, and wgt of the linked shipment packline.      SGF 22-Jul-25 10:29 GMT+10:00:   Refer to Kelvin's escalation document for screenshots.  Steps to Replicate:  1. Order 1k qty, 100 pkg, 10 vol, 10 wgt  2. Book 900 qty, 90 pkg, 9 vol, 9 wgt  3. Generate shipment1 from SPT 900 qty, 90 pkg, 9 vol, 9 wgt  Actual Result: Shipment1 basic registration tab shows 900 qty, 90 pkg, 9 vol, 9 wgt. Pack line shows 900 qty, 90 pkg, 9 vol, 9 wgt.  4. Dispatch 700 qty, 70 pkg, 7 vol, 7 wgt  5. Convert  Actual Result: Shipment1 basic registration tab did not update. Pack line is updated to 700 qty, 70 pkg, 7 vol, 7 wgt.  Expected Result: Shipment1 basic registration tab is updated too.    Done:   1. The qty, pkg, vol, wgt in shipment basic registration is updated with the LSE SBK dispatch qty, pkg, vol, wgt on conversion.   2. Regression test is performed after converting LSE SBK that did not generate shipment from SPT.
Explanation: Significant new regulatory or system capability
product_candidate: Converting LSE SBK does not create a new shipment if SPT was used

WKI_Summary: Honour CW1 security rights for running reports via Glow
details: See attached incident for more details.  This is to introduce security in Staff web portals for running reports, just as we have in CargoWise.    DL4 06-Mar-25 00:58 GMT+08:00:   Sub-Work Item of HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/5f8eee90-2f8b-4268-a381-f3c40fe04b80?lang=en-gb" WI00681995 - Staff security rights for Glow report APIs    ----    DL4 24-Feb-25 15:45 GMT+08:00:   Only authorized users in CW1 can execute reports via these APIs, effectively preventing unauthorized access.  Done Statement: Implemented CW1 security right integration for Glow Report APIs, ensuring that report access is restricted according to staff user permissions defined in Glow Security Roles & CW1 security right     ETG 25-Feb-25 11:04 GMT+08:00:   Done Statement: Implemented CW1 security right integration for Glow Report APIs, ensuring that report access is restricted according to staff user permissions defined in Glow Security Roles & CW1 security right   This can not be controlled by Glow Security Roles as they are all CW1 APIs.    DL4 26-Feb-25 10:10 GMT+08:00:   This WI is linked to 2 incidents (a CR3 and a CR6) by Alex, and the tasks to be done include:  (CR3) Backend: The ‘report/deliver’ and ‘report/schedule’ need to have CW staff security applied.  (CR6) Backend: The ‘report/running/data/{id}’ also requires CW staff security.  (CR6) Frontend: After selecting a report, if the user lacks permission, the system should not load the report data like filters. Instead, it should display an error message.  ----
product_candidate: Honour CW1 security rights for running reports via Glow

WKI_Summary: Search by Name in Registry Tree
details: ODN 27-Jun-25 13:18 GMT+10:00:   Currently, registry tree view (LazyTreeViewSearcher) only does a search by node text, which is the display text shown to users.  There is a use case, at least for WTG internal staff, to be able to search by node name as well, which corresponds to the registry class names as they appear in our code base.    The scenario is mostly around setting up for development and/or UAT. A developer needs to go locate the registry definition itself and extract the caption from there, even though the registry name itself is more readily available in the code.  Also, sharing the registry captions around in messages and documentation is relatively error prone since the captions contain spaces and various text editors have a tendency to mangle/wrap and make it harder to select regular English text.    Sharing the registry name as a search term would make it more immediately apparent that it is a "key" and make it more easy to preserve, find, and copy in technical documentation.    Mykola: "please add Core team code review for DAR capability, and Core team usability review for PAR capability"    See also: HYPERLINK "https://svc-ediprod.wtg.zone/Services/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/ab154d64-0bee-4b31-9588-4de25001574e?lang=en-gb" WI00644657 - Registry Find Box Results
product_candidate: Search by Name in Registry Tree

WKI_Summary: ACAS - Item 13-14 - IP Address of Account Creation and Bill Creation [NEW LOGIC]
details: QJ 10-Jun-25 11:03 GMT+08:00:   Cancel the workflow: Coding - Win32 API IP Fetching  RDS team said that the session client ip interface is already available on server side,  so we don't need to create another one on their RDS solution    Done: CW supports the following ACAS reporting requirements via OCI segment in FWB and FHL messages:    13. IP Address used during creation of Customer Account       - This is the IP Address captured at the time of Organisation creation    14. IP Address used during bill creation       - This is the IP Address captured at the time of MAWB and HAWB printing    CTS 08-May-25 14:28 GMT+10:00:     # Done Statement    - Captured the user's private IP address when a new organization is created and stored it in a read-only IPA (IP Address of Organization Creation) record with the user's country. Refer to "IP Address used during Customer Account Creation" in the HLD for details.  - Supported a new "IPA" type in organization registration numbers to store the IP address of organization creation.  - For non-direct consolidations, used the Sending Agent's IPA record IP address for the FWB message's organization creation IP. Refer to "IP Address used during Customer Account Creation" in the HLD for logic details.  - For direct consolidations, determined the organization creation IP address for the FWB message based on Controlling Customer, AWB WT/VAL, or incoterm, defaulting to the Shipper if unclear. Refer to "IP Address used during Customer Account Creation" in the HLD for the decision tree.  - For FHL messages, determined the organization creation IP address based on Controlling Customer, AWB WT/VAL, or incoterm, defaulting to the Shipper if unclear. Refer to "IP Address used during Customer Account Creation" in the HLD for the decision tree.  - Used the user's private IP address when sending FWB/FHL messages (from "Print Final Master") as the AWB creation IP address. Refer to "IP Address used during AWB Creation" in the HLD for details.  - If no organization creation IP address is found, used the AWB creation IP address as a fallback for both FWB and FHL messages.  - Added the organization creation IP address to the OCI segment of FWB and FHL messages with code "IA" (if available). Refer to "Data Element Mapping in OCI Segment" in the HLD for examples.  - Added the AWB creation IP address to the OCI segment of FWB and FHL messages with code "IR" (if available). Refer to "Data Element Mapping in OCI Segment" in the HLD for examples.  - Displayed warnings in "Consol > Documents > AWB > Print Final Master" when the organization creation IP address cannot be determined for FWB or FHL messages. Refer to "Warnings and Validations" in the HLD for exact messages.  - Displayed warnings in "Consol > Documents > AWB > Print Final Master" when the AWB creation IP address cannot be determined for FWB or FHL messages. Refer to "Warnings and Validations" in the HLD for exact messages.  - Applied the above logic only for ACAS, i.e. shipments destined or transiting the USA (including US territories).    # Architecture and Implementation Approach    This design leverages the existing messaging architecture to add IP address information to FWB/FHL messages. Key components:    1. **IP Address Storage**: Store organization creation IP address in organization registration numbers with type "IPA".  2. **IP Address Retrieval**: Implement existing `IACASCountryHandler` methods `GetCustomerAccountCreationIPAddress()` and `GetAWBCreationIPAddress()` in `UsaACASCountryHandler` class.  3. **OCI Segment Generation**: Use the existing `AddIPAddressesToOCI()` method in `FBase.cs` to add IP addresses to OCI segments.  4. **Message Flow**: Follow the established message generation path where `ConstructMessage()` calls `AddOtherCustomsInformation()` which calls `AddVATAndContactNumbersToOCI()` which conditionally calls `AddIPAddressesToOCI()` when ACAS requirements apply.    # Implementation    When creating a new organization:  1. Get the user's private IP address.  2. If an IP address is found, store it in a new record with type "IPA" (IP Address of Organization Creation), the user's country, and mark it as read-only.    For `GetCustomerAccountCreationIPAddress()` implementation in `UsaACASCountryHandler`:  1. Check if the AWB header is a ConsolExportAWBHeader (FWB):     - If it is a direct consolidation:       - Look for a Controlling Customer organization in the shipment.       - If found, use its IPA record's IP address.       - If not found:         - Check the consolidation's AWB WT/VAL field.         - If WT/VAL is "P" (prepaid), use the Shipper's organization IPA record's IP address.         - If WT/VAL is "C" (collect), use the Consignee's organization IPA record's IP address.         - If WT/VAL is "B" (both) or blank:           - Check the shipment's AWB WT/VAL field.           - If shipment WT/VAL is "P", use the Shipper's organization IPA record's IP address.           - If shipment WT/VAL is "C", use the Consignee's organization IPA record's IP address.           - If shipment WT/VAL is "B" or blank:             - Check the shipment's incoterm.             - If incoterm indicates prepaid, use the Shipper's organization IPA record's IP address.             - If incoterm indicates collect, use the Consignee's organization IPA record's IP address.             - If incoterm is unclear, use the Shipper's organization IPA record's IP address.     - If it is not a direct consolidation:       - Use the Sending Agent's organization IPA record's IP address as the organization creation IP address.    2. Check if the AWB header is a ShipmentExportAWBHeader (FHL):     - Look for a Controlling Customer organization in the shipment.     - If found, use its IPA record's IP address.     - If not found:       - Check the shipment's AWB WT/VAL field.       - If WT/VAL is "P" (prepaid), use the Shipper's organization IPA record's IP address.       - If WT/VAL is "C" (collect), use the Consignee's organization IPA record's IP address.       - If WT/VAL is "B" (both) or blank:         - Check the shipment's incoterm.         - If incoterm indicates prepaid, use the Shipper's organization IPA record's IP address.         - If incoterm indicates collect, use the Consignee's organization IPA record's IP address.         - If incoterm is unclear, use the Shipper's organization IPA record's IP address.    For `GetAWBCreationIPAddress()` implementation in `UsaACASCountryHandler`:  1. Return the current user's private IP address.    OCI Segment Generation (handled automatically by existing `AddIPAddressesToOCI` method in FBase.cs):  1. When the `AddVATAndContactNumbersToOCI` method is called during message construction and ACAS requirements apply:     - The `AddIPAddressesToOCI` method is called.     - If an organization creation IP address exists, add "/US/CUS/IA/" followed by the IP address.     - If an AWB creation IP address exists, add "/US/CUS/IR/" followed by the IP address.       Validation (added to `HasWarningForFWB` and `HasWarningsForFHL` methods in `UsaACASCountryHandler`):  1. If no organization creation IP address is found, show a warning: "The IP Address for Organization Creation could not be determined for ACAS reporting requirements and will not be sent to the airline."  2. If no AWB creation IP address is found, show a warning: "The IP Address for AWB Creation could not be determined for ACAS reporting requirements and will not be sent to the airline."    Refer to detailed implementation guide: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=b5317208-f3ec-4f0c-9129-ef824064e62e&StorageDocPK=cf8f2acf-3c5d-43cc-ab05-ddabaa7fd38e&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bGAhTVJH4S%2bdEs3IHyGVpyltOiew1S8xa" File WI00877073_implementation_guide.md (Attachment).
feature_description: Item 13-14 - IP Address of Account Creation and Bill Creation [NEW LOGIC]

WKI_Summary: EBL: ease TRI restriction - allow same TRI on multiple Orgs
details: JR 04-Aug-25 11:16 GMT+10:00:   Melinda found some orgs with duplicated TRI in Test A, like HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=200a18cd-ead5-4a48-9b61-8fb0befd1a2e&StorageDocPK=c804c86a-66ae-4bb3-b018-c5e9e6cbf9b5&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b1gaNjJ3JEE9IXPZNUhPkP9plG8y18wkV" JR 04-Aug-25 11:16:  File image.png (TRI ReadOnly) and HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=200a18cd-ead5-4a48-9b61-8fb0befd1a2e&StorageDocPK=f3d2e011-6911-4bd1-a1cf-23e9b130bb78&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bSrY4u4FASqoZtv2AuQKLSvQuo2bukZS1" JR 04-Aug-25 11:27:  File Duplicated TRI in three orgs.png (Duplicated TRI in three orgs) .  The reason is when MAA event is received with MST=Enrollment Request/DEP=Bolero, the OrgCusCode with RFN (TRI code) will become readonly, like HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=200a18cd-ead5-4a48-9b61-8fb0befd1a2e&StorageDocPK=4ffde11e-5adb-46cb-8ea9-37fb2e87d814&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2b9lS62NKLc%2fUb7Xwdr9uvgTdmWdikph0c" JR 04-Aug-25 11:21:  File MAA Event with RFN.png (MAA Event with RFN).  It's added from HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/WorkItem/d65e6a52-82a7-4222-9aaf-e5a8c3d1f852?lang=en-gb" WI00889656 - BOb: Receiving UXML (Event) by MDM team.  So this issue should be fixed by MDM team.    JR 31-Jul-25 09:38 GMT+10:00:   Reason for Change: ease TRI restriction for multiple Orgs and adjust the rule within the same Org.  Proposed Changes:      C:\git\GitHub\WiseTechGlobal\CargoWise\Enterprise\Product\Operations\MasterFiles\Business\MasterFiles.Business\Organisation\Other\OrgCusCode\OrgCusCodeValidation.cs   ValidateRegistrationForBoleroTitleRegisterIDIsUnique    Change the validation error to warning and update the message as per the HLD.     ValidateCusCodeIsUnique    When CodeType is OrgCusCode.CodeTypes.BoleroTitleRegisterID,    remove x.OK_OA_PremisesAddress != premisesAddress condition and update the message as per the HLD.    NDT 29-May-25 09:43 GMT+10:00:     Background:  With the work that is currenlty being to done to onboard our customer's customers onto Bolero (the customers of CW users), we found we need to ease the TRI restrictions we have on Organizations.  Reason being, it is possible CW users maintain multiple Organizations instead of maintaining multiple premises addresses on single 'HQ' organization and we can't control that.  So we need to allow users to have same TRI against multiple organizations.    Done:  - A unique TRI can be recorded across multiple Organizations  - A unique TRI can be only recorded once on a single organization (existing logic)  - Multiple different TRI can be recorded against one organization as long as differentiated by premises address (existing logic)
feature_description: allow same TRI on multiple Orgs

WKI_Summary: OM: Order Line Address line identifier enabled GLWOM
details: The company name override can be used to make the address names (eg DC's) identifiable in the AOM platform.  Currently this shows as Delivery name. The option should be available as required and able to be filtered and sorted on.  Order / order Lines / Booking /CLL and CLP.    EMF 27-May-25 11:39 GMT+08:00:   Reason for the change:  Each address in an organisation set up can have a Company name override added which can be used to identify the address in the Advanced Order Manager system. It can be used to identify an organisation delivery address (eg DC number/name) etc and then to group cargo going to specific sites. An order could contain order lines for multiple DC locations on a single organisation.   the company name will be reflected in the user interface to make delivery addresses easier to identify.    Done:  Delivery Code and Delivery Name have been added in AOM grids mentioned in HLD.    Suggested changes:  1. Order lines search list:  Add index in Configuration\Index\IJobOrderLine.yaml  - name: DELIVERYCODE    propertyPath: Addresses.Address.OrgHeader.OH_Code    keyField: true    where: Addresses.E2_AddressType == "GDT" && Addresses.Address.OrgHeader.OH_Code != ""  - name: DELIVERYCODE    propertyPath: JobOrderHeader.Addresses.Address.OrgHeader.OH_Code    keyField: true    where: JobOrderHeader.Addresses.E2_AddressType == "GDT" && JobOrderHeader.Addresses.Address.OrgHeader.OH_Code != ""  - name: DELIVERYNAME    propertyPath: Addresses.Address.OA_CompanyNameOverride    keyField: true    where: Addresses.E2_AddressType == "GDT" && Addresses.Address.OA_CompanyNameOverride != ""  - name: DELIVERYNAME    propertyPath: Addresses.Address.OrgHeader.OH_FullName    keyField: true    where: Addresses.E2_AddressType == "GDT" && Addresses.Address.OA_CompanyNameOverride == ""  - name: DELIVERYNAME    propertyPath: JobOrderHeader.Addresses.Address.OA_CompanyNameOverride    keyField: true    where: JobOrderHeader.Addresses.E2_AddressType == "GDT" && JobOrderHeader.Addresses.Address.OA_CompanyNameOverride != ""  - WKI_Summary: IOM [UPS MVP] - Add events when manual requests are created
details: Done statement : A corresponding event is created and correctly linked whenever a request is manually added, processed and status changed to closed    Actions may be required to be triggered from Requests so a corresponding event is required. This occurs on requests created from validaitons so we need to now add this behaviour to manually created events.    PGN note - Not sure where we'll put the event though, since we can end up with hundreds of REQ events on the job if we store this at the job level, so will need to consider carefully, if we can put this as the line level (which has other issues).    TZ1 15-Oct-25 15:40 GMT+08:00:   Reason for the change  Actions may be required to be triggered from Requests so a corresponding event is required. This occurs on requests created from validaitons so we need to now add this behaviour to manually created events.    Done  A corresponding event is created and correctly linked whenever a request is manually added    Proposal Solution  RQC event need to be added when creating request for Order/OrderLine/SBK/CLL/CLP  Create a helper ts function in OrderManagerUtilities.ts to invoke rules.AddLog() (https://github.com/WiseTechGlobal/Glow/blob/d7f9356310e599aea803ca7d4f14ec5007946c7c/DotNet/Business/Logging/Business.Logging/CommonCommands.js#L7)  Change OSX Create External Request For Order/OrderLine/SBK/CLL/CLP yaml form flows to coded form flows, put them in Business.Forwarding\OrderManager\FormFlows\ExternalRequest,  and make them invoke the helper function with (entity, "RQC", "|RID=XXXXX") or (entity.Order, "RQC", "|RID=XXXXX|RFN=XXXXX")    We have 3 ways to create request, manual, validation, workflow.   validation in GLOW and workflow already have RQC event.  validation in CW still don't have RQC event. not sure if we should add this.    PGN 27-Oct-25 13:53 GMT+11:00: As discussed with Lani, format is 'RID=XXX|TYP=XXX|DES=XXX', when object is Order Line is ‘RID=XXX|RFN=XXX|TYP=XXX|DES=XXX’.

WKI_Summary: IOM -Duplicate shipments being created in portal
details: Challenge - When a shipment is create with the shipment planning tool the system does not see this unless connected to the consol when the 'convert shipment pack lines' functionality is used.    Work item to stop the duplication of shipment without the need for Manual process intervention.    PGN 29-Apr-25 10:34 GMT+10:00: Note there is no way around requiring the shipment to be attached to the consol because we're packing into containers that only exist on the consol, so this needs to be a check and warning message for the shipment against the correct consol when converting to pack lines.  We shouldn't auto-attach the shipment to the consol unless we provide a big warning, since this breaks the security model for customers like DHL who have a separate team that controls the shipment attachment to consols. Attaching shipment to consol is also a much bigger job.    Proposed solutions: When selecting 'Convert to packlines' the system checks for existing related shipments (not linked to a consol) then there is a pop up to the user stating there are shipments that is a related record to the booking. Would the user like to attach this shipment to the consol before converting the pack lines ***Warning if no a new shipment will be created***    05/05 Learning material suggests that we offer a warning when the duplication will occur but this is not happening. Sarah advised 'Yes we used to have that check. But that feature was replaced by another WI. Shen wrote that feature. He might be able to help us find what work item overrides it.'    13/05*** Meeting notes and path forward**   Two actions:  1) Restore the original message that checks planned shipment is linked to the consol IF the SPT has been used for any of the line (fixes UPS problem)  2) Remove the convert to shipment pack lines on the CLL to simplify the logic of conversion (optional, if it makes the pack line matching easier)         S37 06-Jun-25 11:19 GMT+10:00:   Reason for change  Revert to hard block on SPT pack wrong instead of giving the option to create an additional shipment    Done  For SPT packed wrong, hard stop message from WI00749579 is reinstated    SPT packed wrong when running service task results in EXR event and revert of status as per WI00749579   - Any CLL line packed wrong in a load list, load plan or SBK result in blocking, even mixed with non-SPT  For Non-SPT conversion, new shipment created, an EXR event is raised as per WI0076908  Regression test: when SPT pack lines used up, new pack lines are created  DONE: The ‘Convert to Shipment Pack lines’ button is removed from CLL. (We're not doing this in this WI due to out of scope.)    Proposed changes  On CW, we're putting back the changes done by https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev/pullrequest/248748 but a few changes to be made   1. JLG table is not used anymore. We'll instead use JL_JSL_BookingLine to determine if a booking line is under SPT, which means    SELECT    COUNT(1)  FROM   dbo.ContainerLoadListLine   INNER JOIN dbo.JobContainer ON CLL_JC_Container = JC_PK   INNER JOIN dbo.JobSupplierBookingLine ON CLL_JSL_BookingLine = JSL_PK   INNER JOIN dbo.JobPackLines ON JSL_PK = JL_JSL_BookingLine  WHERE   NOT EXISTS (    SELECT 1    FROM      dbo.JobConShipLink    WHERE JN_JS = JL_JS and JN_JK = JC_JK   )     2. For unplanned load list lines, there's no packed wrong scenario anymore. Remove related logic, and always add an EXR for new shipment creation.   https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/CargoWise/_git/Dev?path=%2FEnterprise%2FProduct%2FOperations%2FFreight%2FForwarding%2FForwarding.ServiceTasks%2FOrders%2FServices%2FOrderManagerConvertService.cs&version=GC679ddcfb334f2d68bad8eeffb850ace01d2eef28&line=152&lineEnd=152&lineStartColumn=9&lineEndColumn=22&lineStyle=plain&_a=contents    On GLOW, we're putting back https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/Glow/_git/Glow/pullrequest/245167   1. Similar changes being made to determine SPT (not use JLG)   2. Remove related change in https://devops.wisetechglobal.com/wtg/Glow/_git/Glow/pullrequest/285933
feature_description: Duplicate shipments being created in portal

WKI_Summary: ACAS - Item 13-14 - IP Address of Account Creation and Bill Creation [NEW LOGIC]
details: QJ 10-Jun-25 11:03 GMT+08:00:   Cancel the workflow: Coding - Win32 API IP Fetching  RDS team said that the session client ip interface is already available on server side,  so we don't need to create another one on their RDS solution    Done: CW supports the following ACAS reporting requirements via OCI segment in FWB and FHL messages:    13. IP Address used during creation of Customer Account       - This is the IP Address captured at the time of Organisation creation    14. IP Address used during bill creation       - This is the IP Address captured at the time of MAWB and HAWB printing    CTS 08-May-25 14:28 GMT+10:00:     # Done Statement    - Captured the user's private IP address when a new organization is created and stored it in a read-only IPA (IP Address of Organization Creation) record with the user's country. Refer to "IP Address used during Customer Account Creation" in the HLD for details.  - Supported a new "IPA" type in organization registration numbers to store the IP address of organization creation.  - For non-direct consolidations, used the Sending Agent's IPA record IP address for the FWB message's organization creation IP. Refer to "IP Address used during Customer Account Creation" in the HLD for logic details.  - For direct consolidations, determined the organization creation IP address for the FWB message based on Controlling Customer, AWB WT/VAL, or incoterm, defaulting to the Shipper if unclear. Refer to "IP Address used during Customer Account Creation" in the HLD for the decision tree.  - For FHL messages, determined the organization creation IP address based on Controlling Customer, AWB WT/VAL, or incoterm, defaulting to the Shipper if unclear. Refer to "IP Address used during Customer Account Creation" in the HLD for the decision tree.  - Used the user's private IP address when sending FWB/FHL messages (from "Print Final Master") as the AWB creation IP address. Refer to "IP Address used during AWB Creation" in the HLD for details.  - If no organization creation IP address is found, used the AWB creation IP address as a fallback for both FWB and FHL messages.  - Added the organization creation IP address to the OCI segment of FWB and FHL messages with code "IA" (if available). Refer to "Data Element Mapping in OCI Segment" in the HLD for examples.  - Added the AWB creation IP address to the OCI segment of FWB and FHL messages with code "IR" (if available). Refer to "Data Element Mapping in OCI Segment" in the HLD for examples.  - Displayed warnings in "Consol > Documents > AWB > Print Final Master" when the organization creation IP address cannot be determined for FWB or FHL messages. Refer to "Warnings and Validations" in the HLD for exact messages.  - Displayed warnings in "Consol > Documents > AWB > Print Final Master" when the AWB creation IP address cannot be determined for FWB or FHL messages. Refer to "Warnings and Validations" in the HLD for exact messages.  - Applied the above logic only for ACAS, i.e. shipments destined or transiting the USA (including US territories).    # Architecture and Implementation Approach    This design leverages the existing messaging architecture to add IP address information to FWB/FHL messages. Key components:    1. **IP Address Storage**: Store organization creation IP address in organization registration numbers with type "IPA".  2. **IP Address Retrieval**: Implement existing `IACASCountryHandler` methods `GetCustomerAccountCreationIPAddress()` and `GetAWBCreationIPAddress()` in `UsaACASCountryHandler` class.  3. **OCI Segment Generation**: Use the existing `AddIPAddressesToOCI()` method in `FBase.cs` to add IP addresses to OCI segments.  4. **Message Flow**: Follow the established message generation path where `ConstructMessage()` calls `AddOtherCustomsInformation()` which calls `AddVATAndContactNumbersToOCI()` which conditionally calls `AddIPAddressesToOCI()` when ACAS requirements apply.    # Implementation    When creating a new organization:  1. Get the user's private IP address.  2. If an IP address is found, store it in a new record with type "IPA" (IP Address of Organization Creation), the user's country, and mark it as read-only.    For `GetCustomerAccountCreationIPAddress()` implementation in `UsaACASCountryHandler`:  1. Check if the AWB header is a ConsolExportAWBHeader (FWB):     - If it is a direct consolidation:       - Look for a Controlling Customer organization in the shipment.       - If found, use its IPA record's IP address.       - If not found:         - Check the consolidation's AWB WT/VAL field.         - If WT/VAL is "P" (prepaid), use the Shipper's organization IPA record's IP address.         - If WT/VAL is "C" (collect), use the Consignee's organization IPA record's IP address.         - If WT/VAL is "B" (both) or blank:           - Check the shipment's AWB WT/VAL field.           - If shipment WT/VAL is "P", use the Shipper's organization IPA record's IP address.           - If shipment WT/VAL is "C", use the Consignee's organization IPA record's IP address.           - If shipment WT/VAL is "B" or blank:             - Check the shipment's incoterm.             - If incoterm indicates prepaid, use the Shipper's organization IPA record's IP address.             - If incoterm indicates collect, use the Consignee's organization IPA record's IP address.             - If incoterm is unclear, use the Shipper's organization IPA record's IP address.     - If it is not a direct consolidation:       - Use the Sending Agent's organization IPA record's IP address as the organization creation IP address.    2. Check if the AWB header is a ShipmentExportAWBHeader (FHL):     - Look for a Controlling Customer organization in the shipment.     - If found, use its IPA record's IP address.     - If not found:       - Check the shipment's AWB WT/VAL field.       - If WT/VAL is "P" (prepaid), use the Shipper's organization IPA record's IP address.       - If WT/VAL is "C" (collect), use the Consignee's organization IPA record's IP address.       - If WT/VAL is "B" (both) or blank:         - Check the shipment's incoterm.         - If incoterm indicates prepaid, use the Shipper's organization IPA record's IP address.         - If incoterm indicates collect, use the Consignee's organization IPA record's IP address.         - If incoterm is unclear, use the Shipper's organization IPA record's IP address.    For `GetAWBCreationIPAddress()` implementation in `UsaACASCountryHandler`:  1. Return the current user's private IP address.    OCI Segment Generation (handled automatically by existing `AddIPAddressesToOCI` method in FBase.cs):  1. When the `AddVATAndContactNumbersToOCI` method is called during message construction and ACAS requirements apply:     - The `AddIPAddressesToOCI` method is called.     - If an organization creation IP address exists, add "/US/CUS/IA/" followed by the IP address.     - If an AWB creation IP address exists, add "/US/CUS/IR/" followed by the IP address.       Validation (added to `HasWarningForFWB` and `HasWarningsForFHL` methods in `UsaACASCountryHandler`):  1. If no organization creation IP address is found, show a warning: "The IP Address for Organization Creation could not be determined for ACAS reporting requirements and will not be sent to the airline."  2. If no AWB creation IP address is found, show a warning: "The IP Address for AWB Creation could not be determined for ACAS reporting requirements and will not be sent to the airline."    Refer to detailed implementation guide: HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=b5317208-f3ec-4f0c-9129-ef824064e62e&StorageDocPK=cf8f2acf-3c5d-43cc-ab05-ddabaa7fd38e&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bGAhTVJH4S%2bdEs3IHyGVpyltOiew1S8xa" File WI00877073_implementation_guide.md (Attachment).
feature_description: Item 13-14 - IP Address of Account Creation and Bill Creation [NEW LOGIC]

WKI_Summary: Hide System > UI > Open Module In A New Window setting for CW Next
details: Problem Statement  The System > UI > /setting in the Registry manages if modules open in a new window or not and it defaults to No.  It works in CargoWise One, when accessing modules they will not open in new Windows.  However in CargoWise Next, this setting is ignored and modules are opened in new windows.  This appears to be the expected behaviour for CargoWise Next, it is mentioned in this FAQ on the WiseTech Academy site, HYPERLINK "https://wisetechacademy.com/search?quickstart=69175e6f-17bf-483f-ab78-8b2b47e6ee41" Navigating the CargoWise Next Home screen, "Clicking on any record will open it in a new window."  However the FAQ does not mention anything about this Registry setting.  As more users are upgraded to CargoWise Next, this will result in CR3/CR4 incidents raised to us about this Registry setting not working.    Done Statement  The System > UI > Open Module In A New Window Registry setting is hidden from view if the system is CargoWise Next.    HYPERLINK "edient:Command=ShowStorageDoc&BusinessEntityPK=c5195dce-2349-49eb-ab17-f81e92629e3a&StorageDocPK=646a9307-e873-4ee7-bbf8-f176b7b05760&Domain=wtg.zone&Instance=ediProd&Hash=%2bzVRzbClgWBH1d1AyncWa7Og5CrLS62E6" BL3 01-Aug-25 23:50:  File Detailed Build Design.docx (Detailed Build Design) added to eDocs tab.    BL3 12-Aug-25 14:48 GMT+10:00:   From discussion with WGN:  One of the major visible differences from 1 and Next is the color scheme  Color theme is defined in DefinedColorThemes in Registry.Business and so is ColorThemeRegItem  It would be easier to move OpenModuleInANewWindow from RawDataRegistry to Registry.Business into SystemRegistry  This makes sense since they are both in the System > UI  Rewriting the tests would just be copy and paste  Reference to CWNextFeatureHelper.IsCWNextEnabled() is available in Registry.Business -> no dependency loop
product_candidate: Hide System > UI > Open Module In A New Window setting for CW Next

WKI_Summary: Decommission XNDT TAN
details: Publish TAN for decommissioning of XNDT  TAN in eDoc    For      WiseCloud-hosted customers, we already sent out a broadcast in March 2025. After that, we removed all services not in use—only T89 and A26 remained. They are given until End of March 2026 to migrate off it. HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/539236ec-9f05-46d0-858d-148673467e85?lang=en-gb" CS01906910 - WISGLOSYD - Broadcast about decommissioning XNDT service    DSV is      the self-hosted customer that we know of who’s still actively using XNDT. We’ll be sending a broadcast to all self-hosted customers letting them know that XNDT will be removed from CW versions released after 1 April 2026. HYPERLINK "https://ediprod.cw.wisetechglobal.com/link/ShowEditForm/SupportIncident/cfb4781d-26f5-4d8b-aac9-873099d5b374?lang=en-gb" CS02094816 - WISGLOSYD - Broadcast about decommissioning XNDT service to Self Hosted Customers    A TAN will be published advising the same.
